jobTitle: Sales Representative I, Spine- Charlotte, NC
description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  Business Description:  Cranial and Spinal Technologies (CST) is redefining cranial and spinal procedures to reduce variability and improve outcomes with the goal of restoring long-term quality of life for more patients. We are the first company to offer an integrated solution that includes artificial intelligence-driven surgical planning, personalized spinal implants, and robotic-assisted surgical delivery to make patient care more customized.  CST is the market leader in spinal implants, robotics, and navigation. Our integrated operating unit is comprised 3 global businesses, Spine and Biologics, Enabling Technologies and China Cranial, Spinal Orthopedic Technologies.  This role will support our Spine and Biologics business.  Click here to learn more about our full procedural solutions for spine surgery and  Click here to learn more about our bone grafting solutions for spinal fusion.  A Day in the Life:  At Medtronic, the Sales Representative I, Spine is responsible for soliciting orders, selling Medtronic Spinal products assigned and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the area assigned; for maintaining an awareness of local competitive conditions. This position will work in tandem with Spine Sales Representatives II and will have territory coverage responsibility and limited sales responsibility. Allocation guideline for core responsibilities include: Inventory Management, Case Coverage, and Selling (outside the operating room).  This is a field based role.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: Maintain, manage and track Consignments and Loaner inventory. Keep non usage and flight usage to a minimum level. Territory case coverage. Manage accounts in assigned territory. Prepare and submit call reports as required by the District Sales Manager. Maintain up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with District Sales Manager’s instructions. Aggressively solicit orders from present and prospective customers for the products assigned. Aggressively seek new customers and formulate and follow plans for such action as directed by the District Sales Manager. Resolve customer complaints in accordance with Medtronic Spinal policies and advise District Sales Manager and Medtronic Spinal promptly of any situation beyond scope of authority. Recommend the additions of new products and the modification or deletion of present products to the line as appropriate. Successful completion of all required product and sales related training curriculum. Meet or exceed sales quota and total company market share in assigned territory. Attend and participate in sales meetings, training programs and conventions as directed. Identify selling opportunities and work closely with the sales representative to increase sales in their respective accounts. Comply with all Medtronic Spinal policies. Work weekends, evenings, and Holidays as required on an emergency basis. We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader —that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients.  To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic Click Here  Must Have: Minimum Requirements  To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume . High School Diploma or GED AND a minimum of 4 years of sales experience including 2 years of medical sales; or High School Diploma or GED AND 2 years of Medtronic RTG Clinical Specialist experience plus 2 years of prior clinical/ medical sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND a minimum of 2 years of sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND 1 year of Medtronic RTG Clinical Specialist experience; or Bachelor’s degree Nice to Have Ability to interact effectively with a wide range of people and personalities Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in an operating room setting Ability to accommodate a flexible work schedule Ortho, Spine or O.R. experience strongly preferred About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile Required to interact with a computer for extended periods of time, and communicate with peers and co-workers Regularly required to talk or hear Occasionally required to sit and reach with hands and arms Regularly required to stand; walk and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools , or controls Must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds Specific vision abilities required by this job involve normal vision Ability to travel Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.  The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 7, 2021 Travel: No

description: LG Electronics has an opening for an experienced Inside Sales Rep ( ISR) in the medical products team. We’re building our sales force and are looking for an individual to support our consultative style selling. You will assist in developing business value propositions around LG Electronics Medical display products and solutions. You will help the Team drive sales with your technical knowledge, technical account management skills, sales ability, and a strong customer-first focus.  This role can be a remote home office based position with occasional on site work in our Los Angeles Office Position Description The ISR - will work collaborate with the North American Products Medical Channel organization in helping to achieve revenue goals. The ISR will work as the liaison between Sales and external Business Partner that support Sales staff in daily activities and provide insight into sales activities. This position will report to the Sr. Director of Medical Channel  Key Responsibilities; Works collaboratively with sales organization to prospect new customers in regional territories; cold call potential customers to generate demand for LG products and solutions Maintain an awareness of all product knowledge information, promotions, and Partner training. Generate new and repeat sales providing product and technical information in a timely manner; determine customer requirements and expectations in order to recommend specific products and solutions, accurately process requests for special pricing quotes for accounts in the assigned region Demonstrate use and operation of the product and recommend products to customers and answer questions. Ability to work in a Team environment with different areas of the business including Marketing, Operations, Logistic, Product Management and Planning Experience in event planning, set up and execution a plus Act as the Super user and capture relevant data in Salesforce Manage and Coordinate all demo equipment Manage RMA Conduct Client walkthroughs in our LA Innovation Center   Job Qualifications Bachelors degree or equivalent experience A minimum of 3-years’ hands-on experience within the Salesforce Platform Experience with Microsoft Tools Demonstrated ability to drive results at all levels, regardless of reporting structures. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Excellent presentation skills, including the ability to engage with leadership at all levels of an organization. Experienced with change management and problem-solving experience. Comfort in working up and across the organization – working with front-line Sales employees. Demonstrated competency in strategic thinking that results in new ideas that drive the business forward. Travel 10-20%  LG Electronics, USA Inc.; LG Mobilecomm USA, Inc., LG Mobile Research USA LLC, and Zenith Electronics LLC provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Further, the Company takes affirmative action to ensure that applicants are employed and employees are treated during employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

description: Job Location: Charlotte, NC  This position can also be based in Asheville, NC; Abingdon, VA; Tri-Cities, TN  Summary  The Customer Sales Executive (CSE) is responsible for profitably growing Hershey’s Food City and Ingles Markets business to achieve objectives and plans, including net sales, market share, trade spend, and sales activity margin. Responsibilities include business planning & analysis, creating valued business partnerships with customers by becoming a business advisor, and achieving mutually beneficial agreements through skilled negotiation and understanding of the customers business. The CSE will also leverage insights to build a 1-to-3-year business plan and deploy supporting tactics to achieve financial objectives.  Responsibilities Achieve net sales, market share, trade spend, and sales activity margin targets for assigned customer(s) by simulating and planning incremental volume and pre and post analysis as well as displaying core competencies and behaviors. This includes judiciously managing and allocating trade funds (maintaining compliance with all Sarbanes Oxley policies) to achieve profitable sales growth. Effectively utilize Hershey’s analytical tools (e.g. PlanEx, Unify, Trade Point, etc.) and processes to drive profitable and predictable sales results. Build and maintain appropriate sales plans in PlanEx. Manage trade fund budget to include clearing deductions. Monitor and control customer expenses to include WASTE and supply chain costs. Provide category analysis and consumer insights to customers as well as other category tools/consultation with Category Management partnership. Develop and provide resources and tools to the retail team. Achieve appropriate levels of account penetration. Alignment with retail team through participation in retail meetings as well as field visits with appropriate Retail management. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree strongly preferred. Experience: At least 3-5 years relevant sales experience. The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. description: HemoSonics, LLC is seeking a Clinical Sales Specialist based in the TN/AL/GA territory who will be responsible for implementing the Quantra in clinical areas of new accounts and departments, and expanding the utilization of the Quantra in existing accounts and departments.  Key Attributes of the Successful Candidate: Knowledge of perioperative bleeding management. Excellent communication, effective time-management and relationship-building skills. Strong technical/clinical aptitude to understand and train customers and users on products (including running the Quantra solution and understanding application of results). Team player with strong desire to see the group succeed.  Key Responsibilities: In collaboration with other HemoSonics personnel, ensure the successful implementation of Quantra into initial and expanded clinical settings. Identify expansion opportunities and increase product usage within new and existing accounts to enable HemoSonics to become the standard of care for bleeding management. Ensure customers can independently, safely and efficiently operate HemoSonics equipment and related disposables through clinical education and training. Identify and develop key accounts/key opinion leaders/product champions to serve as “reference sites” for potential new customers and/or conferences. Collaborate with Sales and Clinical Affairs for development activities. Provide customer feedback to Sales and Marketing regarding product enhancements, service and policies. Increase professional and clinical knowledge/competency by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks & participating in professional societies. Support clinical demonstrations/evaluations and tradeshows/conferences as needed. Perform all assigned administrative responsibilities (monthly reports, conference summaries, expense reports, etc.). Achieve revenue and expense goals. Work collaboratively with HemoSonics personnel as requested on special projects.  Education and Experience Required: Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline (Life Sciences, Nursing, Perfusion) 2 - 5 years of industry experience, preferably in critical care, diagnostics or surgery Experience in execution of clinical education and training programs Clinical experience in critical care areas of the hospital/OR, with emphasis on coagulation and hemostasis preferred Professional credentialing (RN, CCP, PA, etc.) preferred  This position will be home-based in TN/AL/GA and will require 60-75% domestic travel. HemoSonics requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or meet the requirements for a medical or religious exemption.  HemoSonics, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

jobTitle: National Account Manager, Retail Sales (Remote Role)
description: Olaplex is revolutionizing the haircare industry through a patented, proprietary technology that protects and repairs hair from damage. We've paved the way for a completely new category of hair care and, due to an overwhelming support from the brand's loyal stylist and advocate base, the company has emerged as one of the largest independent hair care brands in the world.  Olaplex has been able to achieve phenomenal growth and we continuously seek exceptionally talented individuals who can support our innovation and creativity. We currently operate in a fully remote environment; because of this, collaboration and flexibility are at the core of our commitment to each other and to the success of Olaplex.  The Account Manager, Retail is responsible for leading day-to-day execution of key Retailers business needs while driving brand awareness and growth. Reporting into the Director of Sales, this role will involve strategic planning of new launches, partnering on marketing initiatives and education levers with cross-functional teams and closely collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to optimize results. The ideal candidate will be up-to-date on latest market trends in Beauty with extensive experience analyzing data and using it to make key business decisions.  Responsibilities: Independently manage high-volume Retailers and lead Account Management while being the direct brand contact for day-to-day business needs. Oversee all aspects of the business, including managing Retail calendars, assisting with new product launches, managing forecast planning and deadlines. Maintain strong relationships and work closely with Merchants/Category Managers to drive growth while supporting new initiatives and oversee business deliverables. Partner with Marketing and Education teams to develop/implement sampling plans, training levers and Retailer targeted needs to grow business. Develop strategies to drive sales while achieving company goals with continuous negotiation of digital, marketing initiatives and in store exposures. Update weekly, monthly and quarterly Reports by pulling data from various sources and managing Retail Sales Templates. Track and manage Budget, Sell thru and Sell in Reports received from Retailers on a weekly and monthly basis. Manage execution of Retail Sales projects, Market Decks, 360 strategies and go to market plans.  Qualifications: 5+ years of relevant Account Management experience in Beauty Retail industry. Numbers driven with high comfort level in Excel. Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills. Proven track record of meeting deadlines while managing multiple projects. Strong problem-solving and organizational skills. BA/BS Degree preferred.  Benefits: Work/Life Balance: Remote work environment, unlimited time off, 11 paid holidays, and flexible work schedules. Wellness: Medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees in addition to short- and long-term disability coverage and life insurance. Financial Well-being: Roth and 401k plans; Bonus eligibility for all Full-Time employees. Products: Fourteen (14) free products per year, plus a friends and family discount. Culture: Our team has an "attitude of gratitude" and a shared passion for our brand. We are a fast-paced, high-growth company where career opportunities can be endless.  Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:  At Olaplex, we support and stand up for our community with our talent, content, messages, and product offering. We strive to build and nurture a culture where a focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion is instinctive. Our deep sense of passion and pride in what we do, both as individuals and as a company, unifies our shared commitment to 'do well and do good'. We recognize and celebrate different ideas, perspectives, and backgrounds and know they create a stronger and more creative work environment.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Territory Sales Manager opening.   We promptly review all applications. Highly qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews.    About the job  This is your opportunity to join the expanding CELSIUS Field Sales Team! CELSIUS is one of the fastest growing Energy Drink Brands nationally! At CELSIUS we pride ourselves in providing our employees a culture and atmosphere of inclusiveness that challenges individuals to be thought leaders, innovators and game changers as every employee is an owner of the CELSIUS Brand upon joining the Organization.   Who are we looking for specifically? Someone to seek out, sell and cultivate new business in all retail Channels to include Grocery, Mass, Convenience and Specialty for CELSIUS while amplifying existing businesses and Partnerships. Effectively and efficiently expand assigned business in coordination with CELSIUS Distributor and Retailer Partners. The position will be expected to participate in local level field sales strategy development, planning and execution of key initiatives at 10 – 15 stores per day while providing real time feedback, opportunities, results and direction utilizing CELSUIS’ Field Sales selling platform. The candidate must show an ability to be a self-starter, competitive by nature and have a drive to succeed individually and WIN BIG as a member of a Team.  Essential Functions and Responsibilities Within assigned market, execute the Celsius Inc. sales plan through the attainment of shelf distribution, cold box placement, promotional execution, displays and the placement of brand collateral at retail. Secure new outlet availability by influencing distributors through route rides, crew drives and local key account calls as required. Provide ongoing communication on sales, marketing and executional opportunities with assigned Distributor Partners. Assist District and/or Regional Sales Manager with bill backs and other duties as assigned. Participate in weekly recap and planning calls outlining objectives, results, barriers and opportunities.  Special Requirements Ability to travel within the assigned territory including potential overnight travel. Must be able (with or without accommodation) of bending and lifting to set up displays, adjust shelves during resets, move product, etc.  Knowledge and Skills Required Strong business acumen with an entrepreneurial spirit. Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills (verbal/written) with the ability to interact effectively internally as well as with external contacts. Deep rooted understanding of the assigned territory and the surrounding area. Creative and strategic thinker. Experience negotiating. Strong team player. Problem solver. PowerPoint, Excel and Word proficient.  The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.   Celsius Holdings, Inc. celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment.

Description  Life at Elvie - Meaningful work. Exceptional people  At Elvie, we don’t believe women's bodies are the problem. Instead, we believe the problem is that the needs of women’s bodies – and therefore, lives – have been ignored, misunderstood, and underestimated.  Founded by Tania Bolder in 2013, Elvie has been improving women's lives through better – and smarter – technology ever since. We develop innovations that meet the unique needs and complexities of the female body so that women can take charge of their health across every life stage.  Our first product, Elvie Trainer, is a multi-award-winning device bringing hospital-grade pelvic floor care to the hands of women everywhere— it was even a gift in the Oscar Nominee Goody Bags! And now, we're proud to say that we're part of the NHS Supply Chain in the UK.  Our second innovation was Elvie Pump. Launched in 2019, it's the world's first silent, wearable breast pump, enabling women to pump wherever they please— even the catwalk at London Fashion Week. It’s since won numerous awards, including the Times 100 Best Inventions of 2019 and ‘Wearable Design of the Year’ at the Dezeen Awards. The initial success of our wellness tools gave us the means to expand our breastfeeding range to include Elvie Curve and Elvie Catch, both designed to give mothers total comfort and confidence.  As a business, Elvie has received more than 30 awards (including the prestigious Red Dot Design award). We’re ranked as one of the 15 startups ‘To Watch’ by The Sunday Times and Business Insider and ranked as the 13th fastest growing business in the UK by Syndicate Room. Our founder and CEO, Tania Boler, is regularly profiled in top-tier media titles, and, in 2021, Tania was named GLAMOUR’s Women of the Year: Technology Gamechanger.  In July 2021, Elvie announced an $80 million Series C funding, the number one position and biggest raise in an initial fundraising round in the femtech category.  What does it mean to work at Elvie?  You will be surrounded by people who want to improve everything and everyone around them. People who are passionate about our mission. People who are driven to solve tough problems and constantly consider the best ways to improve the health and wellbeing of women.  We Take Them Seriously Because We Want Our Culture To Thrive  We're deeply proud of our values, which are intrinsic to the way we behave every day. We make an impact - we are mission driven and not afraid to break boundaries. We relentlessly focus on going the extra mile to solve problems We are fearless innovators - we are passionate, curious and data-driven. We continuously embrace change and innovation We are in it together - we fail and learn fast, always as one team, and have fun along the way. We stay authentic and embrace our differences What you’ll be doing in this role  In the U.S., we have been successfully selling Elvie products omni-channel, via elvie.com, retail and e-commerce partners, as well as insurance / DME channel. We are looking for an experienced Key Account Manager who can help us build strong relationships with our both existing and new customers.  Responsibilities Account management of an existing group of Durable Medical Equipment and Specialty Women's Health providers. Prospecting new accounts as directed by management Establish and maintain strong relationships with assigned accounts Manage purchase orders through the system and ensure issues are resolved Routinely update demand forecasts and develop account growth plans Work closely with Marketing to identify promotional opportunities with key customers Product training for customer CSR teams and trade show attendance Tracking, analyzing, and reporting on performance while identifying risk mitigating actions in case of performance challenges. Requirements Must be a curious learner! 3+ years of B2B sales experience, preferably in the healthcare market Experience working in the Breastpump category is a plus Excellent written and verbal communication skills required Strong computer skills and ability work in both Microsoft and Google suites Experience navigating complex sales process and multi-stakeholder product launches High degree of commercial and business acumen, strong selling skills Strong influencing skills to effectively manage interdependencies and projects with other teams Outstanding critical thinking and problem-solving skills Ability to travel up to 25% of the time University degree or equivalent Location: US - Preferably the East Coast  Benefits  We're on an exceptional journey, and can offer you a truly purpose led career, with a culture built on trust, autonomy and flexibility. In addition, we'll give you: The chance to make a real impact in improving women's health and lives Working with an experienced, dedicated and passionate team that share the same values and love what they do Career progression and regular performance reviews Competitive base salary, bonus linked with performance and share options in a rapidly growing business Flexible working environment - our culture is built on trust and autonomy 20 days vacation + 5 days sick leave (front loaded from start date) + bank holidays Medical, dental and vision plan Life Insurance / EAP / Travel Assistance Short & Long term disability insurance Commuter programs Travel assistance with Guardian Globe LiveHealth online & One Medical Gym membership reimbursement (subject to eligibility) Perks and various discounts Belonging at Elvie  At Elvie, we believe having diverse teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and we don't discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, marital status, disability or age. If you need any support with your application, please get in contact with us: elvie@jobs.workablemail.com or +44 (0)203 884 7223.

jobTitle: Trauma Sales Representative - El Paso, Texas
description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who do what is necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do  As a Trauma Sales Representative, you work with a high degree of intensity and commitment to sell Stryker Trauma products that meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident trauma expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons and healthcare professionals. You live your work, feeding off the extreme demands of trauma, not counting hours but rather lives impacted. A person who is energized by chaos, you organize your materials and sort possible solutions quickly during operating/emergency room consultations. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with surgeons. They trust you to provide advice and training on products and tools used to save lives. As a Trauma Sales Representative who does what is necessary and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need Bachelor’s Degree or 4+ years experience in a clinical healthcare or sales role (or a combination of the two) 3+ years of sales experience preferred Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services, including marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems Excellent organizational skills and knowledge in the use of current office technologies (MSOffice suite, databases, etc.) Experience in building and maintaining relationships (with surgeons & hospitals in respective areas would be beneficial) Must be comfortable in emergency/operating room environments Ability to participate in and attend sales meetings and professional association meetings outside regular business hours, as required Must adhere to compliance and the principles of responsibility (AdvaMed) by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information, protecting the assets of the organization, acting with ethics and integrity, reporting non-compliance, and adhering to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, accreditation and licenser requirements, and Company’s policies and procedures What We Offer A winning team motivated to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges.  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology.  Manage all aspects of engagements with existing and new customers for our Smart Energy organization (Gas and Utilities). You will build relationships and understand customer business to provide appropriate products or solutions. You will define sales and growth strategy toward key customers while aligning with critical sales business objectives. You will identify opportunities and build credibility with customers. Utilize your product knowledge to deliver the value proposition to the customers.  This opportunity will cover US Southeast and travel of up to 50% will be required with occasional overnight stay.  Key Responsibilities  PMT102021 Identify Opportunities Manage and Plan Accounts Negotiate and Close Articulate and Deliver Value Proposition Manage Momentum Through the Sales Cycle Manage book of business with Honeywell CRM tool (Salesforce) Establish Rapport with Customers MUST HAVE: 5-10 years of utilities (gas market) or industrial industry. 5+ years of sales and account management experience Valid Drivers License WE VALUE Bachelor's Degree Demonstrated ability to evaluate complex situations or concepts to translate strategies into actions. Recognizes business goals and drives activities for sustainable results. Act as a Business partner across all functions to ensure objectives are met. Results-driven with accountability to challenge the status quo. Strong influencing and persuading skills. Develops strong working relationships. Motivated to deliver to multiple customers within the technical field of expertise. Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills. Effective communicator both internally and externally. Ability to work independently in a fast-paced matrix setting. Experience in developing marketing and sales strategies. Experience working in an Engineering / Manufacturing organization would be a candidate advantage. The attitude and will to want to make a difference. A methodical approach and an eye for detail. Effective presentation skills. description: Position Title: Director of Global Sales  Location: Remote With Operating During The Preferred Pacific Time Zone In The U.S.A.  Reports to: President  Who We Are  BequestTech is working to bring advanced technologies to the world as it relates to sustainability in agriculture, energy, waste management, disease detection/prevention, supply chain management and so much more…  Our Mission  Bring innovative technologies to market and develop life-changing solutions for the world.  Our Vision  Create a legacy of global innovation to cure world hunger, eliminate disease and improve the overall quality of life on our planet.  Job Description Part 1  Develop new sales quickly that align with the market segments that are a must area of focus early in the market.  Demonstrate the ability to work with marketing closely in a roll out of a technology that is highly disruptive. This opportunity requires sales and marketing to act as one.  Experience in working with scientists to achieve successful outcomes is vital. Having success in this position will require being able to understand those roadblocks that pop up and can roll with things. Having the ability to use Jedi mind tricks would be helpful.  The ability to solve complex challenges at a global level with a high business and emotional acumen is key to this role being filled with the right candidate.  We have a company culture of honor. being able to effectively communicate to someone that doesn’t understand what seems obvious to others will be a challenge at first.  Build strong customer relationships and strategic partnerships to assess customer needs and recommend appropriate products.  Achieve and Exceed Budget Sales and Gross Margin targets.  Ensure all reports, plans, forecasts and administrative requirements are completed accurately and in a timely manner.  Job Description Part 2  This is a job summary which includes essential job duties of this position. More specific information regarding this new position will be provided during the interview process.  The Director of Global Sales is responsible for implementing and managing the global sales and distribution network. objectives across all current and future brands. The primary role of the Director of Global Sales is to build out a global sales network that at first will be laser focused on one new roll out of a technology that is vital to our world that we get launched with sales quickly going. This position requires an experienced professional with a solid track record in successful sales, strong core competencies in finance, and an ability to embrace and grow BeQuest Tech’s company culture.  The Director of Global Sales leads the sales team and understands what it takes to develop sales professionals. The Director of Global Sales is comfortable working with numbers in an analytical realm as the incumbent will extract and distribute useful information from those numbers throughout the organization.  The Director of Global Sales infuses additional strategic direction to create sales plans and product development that drives brand value.  The incumbent instills “instant credibility” in the eyes of the sales group, from senior management to the sales representative level.  Specific objectives include:  Establish prime relationships with strategic accounts  Leads the global sales organization, overseeing budget, planning and resource development  Responsibilities:  Leads the global sales organization, overseeing budget, planning and resource development  Defines and executes the strategic direction for global sales that drives growth  Plans the time needed with all territory accounts to cover business issues, account goals, support programs, ASAP sales and promotional product sales  Coordinates the build out of regional representatives to support the specialty dealer base  Directs and implements the presentation strategy for each country or region, including sales materials, technical training tools, white papers, and ready to embrace the integration of system that streamline our sales process and automate all that we can possibly automate  Identifies key market opportunities technologies. Facilitates the development of these products and technologies world wide  Delivers monthly reports to communicate dealer issues, sales, competitive information, and product information to the company  Communicates regularly to provide information on specific issues, sales, product information, and general economic and business issues  Key Qualifications:  University or four-year college degree in Business with an emphasis in Sales and Marketing, or equivalent experience  A minimum of 15 years of experience in sales at the global level, preferably in the medical device for diagnostics  Practical knowledge of related functions including production, inventory planning and distribution  Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills  Leadership experience required, experience managing/leading managers preferred  Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work successfully with a variety of people  Ability to manage and lead change  Highly driven, self-motivated and capable of working without significant supervision  Flexible nature with the ability to react quickly and sometimes creatively to business needs  Team player  Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects  Proven ability to work in a fast paced and evolving environment  Willing to work long hours and weekends during preseason selling periods  Proficiency in all Microsoft programs  Knowledge of database software preferred  Proficient with use of company’s Intranet to analyze account business and territory sales  Successful performance requires well developed skills in negotiating and interpersonal relationships, project planning, organization and management  Offer  Competitive base salary $150,000- $175,000, bonus, benefits, 401K, vacation, holidays. Being a part of a growing and innovative company doing our part to bring the change the world needs.  Contact Scott Krauger ScottK@BequestTech.com  www.BeQuestTech.com

Key Account Manager  Modern Sprout LLC (MS) is a Chicago-based design shop and manufacturer that launched in 2013 and has become a leader in the grow-your-own movement with its innovative indoor and outdoor garden-focused lifestyle goods. The genius behind the brand is translating the logic and utility of hydroponic growing systems into simple, stylish and sustainable products that thrive inside the average home. MS’s collection of thoughtfully packaged products has introduced a new and highly sought-after category to home and gift retailers across the continent – gifts that grow. Its products resonate with a diverse audience, from city dwelling millennials to suburban families to rural residents. Media has taken notice too; MS’s products have been selected as one of Oprah’s Favorite Things twice, featured on the Today Show, and covered by numerous other print and online publications including Food & Wine, Real Simple, Clean Eating and more.   Currently, Modern Sprout can be found on the shelves of national retailers such as Target, Crate & Barrel, Nordstrom, Anthropologie, and at over 2,000 independent retailers across the country.   Modern Sprout is seeking a bright, energetic and highly motivated individual to oversee key account sales initiatives, from managing and growing existing customer relationships to procuring new accounts and identifying new sales channels. The ideal candidate is someone who thrives in a hands-on, fast-paced entrepreneurial environment and has proven experience in the consumer products space, preferably in the home/gift/lifestyle sector.    PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES  ● Manage, develop, and maintain strong relationships with key customer accounts to achieve sales goals ● Manage relationships with prospective small-to-mid sized business customers via email, phone, and through in-person meetings/tradeshows ● Track daily activity in CRM system for successful account and communication maintenance ● Prepare and deliver account onboarding paperwork in an organized, and efficient manner ● Review and update sales forecast for key accounts weekly ● Report customer needs and issues, product feedback, and trends to management to support Modern Sprout in best serving its partners ● Review opportunities and project workload with VP of Sales weekly to ensure effective progress toward monthly, quarterly, and yearly department goals ● Collaborate with internal design, operations, and logistics team to satisfy the needs of our partners ● Identify products to expand assortment and develop programs to increase sales with existing key accounts. ● Attend seasonal tradeshows representing the Modern Sprout brand and product OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE:  ● A bachelor’s degree with 3+ year’s applicable experience with sales and account management within lifestyle, home, fashion and/or gifting ● Thrives in an entrepreneurial and fast-paced environment ● Personable and able to build and maintain relationships with leads/potential clients    ● Driven and self-assured; someone who takes ownership of achieving their goals   ● Confident, with strong written and oral communication skills ● Proven track record of sales success in a similar role ● Tech savvy; someone who is able to easily adopt our existing systems and work with leadership to develop and execute new systems to manage growth they are driving ● Progressively minded – interested in learning about and utilizing new tools and apps to achieve different identified objectives ● Green thumb is a plus  BENEFITS:  • Full-time, salaried + commission. Competitive compensation based off experience • Modern Sprout offers a unique benefits package including medical and vision insurance plus flexible hours and unlimited paid vacation time to managers  TO APPLY: Submit a resume and cover letter to careers@modsprout.com. Applications without cover letters will not be accepted.  To learn more about Modern Sprout and its collection of products, please visit modsprout.com or follow the company on Facebook and Instagram.   Modern Sprout is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. In short, we value our employees for being talented and good people. How you identify as a person, what your family’s background is, how you celebrate and express your moral and/or religious beliefs, what physical or health limitations you have (that will not stop your spirit and your talent!)—none of that matters in the Modern Sprout workplace, so long as you respect your fellow workers and live up to your potential as an employee and team member here at Modern Sprout. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment by and advancement within Modern Sprout without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: We are looking for a Sales Assistant for the CNN Worldwide Commercial Sales Team (Based in New York)  The CNN Story  CNN made its official debut in 1980. To help reflect on CNN’s mission then and now, our fearless leader and founder, Ted Turner, recited a poem by Ed Kessler that said: “To act upon one’s convictions while others wait, to create a positive force in a world where cynics abound, to provide information to people when it wasn’t available before”. We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are Pioneers. We are CNN.  What does our department do? The CNN Worldwide Commercial Sales Team is responsible for broadening CNN’s revenue streams through the global portfolio of cross-platform assets and increasing the value CNN provides globally to global advertisers in North America and abroad. This team works closely with global brands and agencies to create media partnerships that drive incremental growth domestically and internationally.   What will you be doing?  The Sales Assistant will be responsible for supporting and coordinating sales efforts across the department. You will help with the development and execution of integrated cross-platform campaigns by working cross-functionally with diverse teams and business units in multiple locations and countries. This includes, but not limited to CNN and Warner Media US and International sales teams, CNN’s In-house creative studios (‘Courageous’ in the US / ‘Create’ in international markets), Marketing & Network Partnerships, Research, Audience & Data, Ad Operations, Programmatic, Commercial Clearance, Trafficking, etc. We’re looking for a dynamic person who’s passionate about media, sales/business development, and marketing with strong execution skills to help support the growth of our global business.  Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Provide general day-to-day support to the team members of our CNN Worldwide Commercial North America Sales Team – including pre-sales, campaign management and post sales. Work cross-functionally with different internal business units to help develop successful marketing and media partnerships Attend internal creative brainstorm sessions to support the creation of global media campaigns Help with the development of PowerPoint presentations for internal and external purposes. Assist in all aspects of the order process (account setup and new orders, revisions, billing) Foster relationships with internal, external, and advertising agency contacts and serve as a liaison in monitoring accounts Develop a working relationship with Sales Operations team on the Digital and TV side of the business to ensure timely, precise order process and campaign success. Responsible for booking all new and revised Television orders through our TV operations systems (Admiral system) Monitor TV pre-emptions, makegoods, and overall delivery Maintain the central filing system / shared drive, including all correspondence, contracts and revisions associated with the orders Resolve problems with copy, billing/invoices, order discrepancies and inventory issues and help oversee billing records on each account Manage client outreach for special events  The tasks listed above will equip you with the media sales skills and global experience needed to advance in the everchanging diverse media landscape.  What do we need from you? Possess a passion for media & advertising, intellectually curious, and interested in a media sales career. Familiar working with Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word). Preferably strong skills with PowerPoint and/or Excel. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills. Excellent organizational, multi-tasking, time and people management skills. Enjoy working in a group and independently to complete daily and weekly tasks.  Desire to learn, work in a fast-paced environment and be proactive.  Why consider this position with us? ·        The chance to work with a global team and collaborate with colleagues from around the world. ·        Gain advanced experience and skills working at the largest and most trusted news organization in the world. ·        Opportunity to grow your career with one of the most innovative and largest media organizations in the world.     Start date: ASAP    Full time position Requirements: ·        Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship ·        All international applicants will be required to provide documentation of proper visa paperwork prior to starting the position

description: Rated Top Place to Work by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution, RWC is a market leader and manufacturer of water solutions for residential, commercial, and industrial applications. RWC’s portfolio of brands includes industry-leading brands: SharkBite® Push-to-Connect plumbing solutions; HoldRite® engineered plumbing and mechanical solutions; Cash Acme® control valves; andJohn Guest® fittings and fluid dispense products.   POSITION SUMMARY: The Business Development Manager is responsible for achieving sales revenues and margin requirements to support the company’s financial objectives in the assigned territory. The individual must sell RWC® products in various new construction markets that include, but are not limited to, hotel, healthcare, single family, multi-family, commercial, and institutional. Essential to success will be the ability to present and sell to plumbing contractors, general contractors and engineers. The candidate must excel in closing sales on jobsites, deliver office presentations and be willing to meet key decision makers throughout the territory.  PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES  Thoroughly understands and can effectively demonstrate installation methods, features, benefits and applications of all RWC branded products. Coordination and planning with RSM and territory sales agencies to ensure market and customer coverage. Successfully sells to and influences the following key audiences as assigned; installing contractors, inspectors, engineers, architects, builders, distributors and owner/developers. Adoption of Salesforce best practices to sell and track opportunities through territory pipeline. Responsible for quarterly forecasting of products and product mix through Salesforce pipeline. Ensures Salesforce contacts, accounts and other database information is maintained accurately and timely. Daily updates on opportunities, next steps, next step dates, probability, dollars and other pertinent information regarding the opportunity. High Impact Activities logged upon completion of site or office visit. Develop and implement a territory sales plan to achieve sales and margin objectives, while remaining within budget. Ensures Company is current on market conditions and trends by providing input and assistance with market research and development. Competent in all aspects of RWC product portfolio to provide training for sales agencies, installing contractors and other parties. Use of RWC sales tools to effectively convert customers to RWC products. Understanding of sales reporting for assigned reps, wholesalers and/or territory. Other duties as assigned.  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:   Education:   Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience  Experience:   The ideal candidate will have construction experience and installer/foreman or similar equivalent experience. This individual must possess the ability to make successful cold calls, qualify prospects, and generate leads. This position requires a minimum of 3 years of outside sales experience within an assigned territory. Working knowledge of MS Office and a CRM program is preferred. Candidate must demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to establish customer relationships. A valid driver’s license is required.   Competencies:   Excellent negotiation and relationship building skills Initiative and self-motivation to stay ahead of the competition Proficient with Microsoft Office products Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills Excellent time management and organizational skills Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.  WORKING CONDITIONS: This position will require the majority of your time in the field with contractors, on jobsites and in a contractor’s office. Extensive travel - 50%  PHYSICAL DEMANDS:  Job requires both sitting and standing and agile flexibility to move and connect equipment in various set-ups. Excellent vision, hearing, speech and motor skills are required to perform essential functions of the job. This position travels by car and plane on a frequent basis.

Key Account Manager – Acute Care Chicagoland and Wisconsin territory  Who you are/What you’re looking for- Are you seeking a career with a world-class organization where your medical device knowledge and sales experience in the acute care space will be fully utilized? Do you have medical device sales experience in acute care OR the surgical space? Do you have experience selling in the acute care space without being on a GPO contract? Do you wish to work with a tremendous team of individuals, all pulling for the same goals and objectives? If you’re saying YES… then we are very interested in hearing from you  Medela is seeking a Key Account Manager – Acute Care to join our team. Please continue reading for additional information about us and the position.  Founded in 1961 by Olle Larsson in Zug, Switzerland, Medela continues to grow under the ownership of the Larsson family. Medela exists to advance human health and wellbeing through knowledge-based and innovative human milk and medical vacuum solutions. In Medela we have two business segments, Human Milk and Healthcare. The common denominator for the two segments is the medical vacuum. We have developed and progressed our core competencies over the past 50 years and turned them into high quality and innovative products, in both segments. Medela's US-based manufacturing and development facility is headquartered in McHenry, Illinois with an additional facility in Elgin, Illinois. www.medela.com  This position covers Chicagoland and Wisconsin  What We Offer our Key Account Manager – Acute Care Candidate: Excellent salary and bonus potential Comprehensive benefits plan, which is affordable to our employees 401K with match Pension Plan Generous PTO package, including paid holidays  Education and Critical Skills/Experience – Key Account Manager – Acute Care Bachelor's degree (B.S./B. A.) from four-year college or university; minimum five years related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Surgical sales experience is required. Strong computer and internet skills; software experience with Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Experience with SAP and Salesforce.com will be considered an additional asset Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to manage multiple conflicting priorities Experience working in an environment with global objectives preferred Travel up to 50% of the time, including occasional international travel  Main Responsibilities – Key Account Manager – Acute Care Responsible for selling Negative Wound Therapy Vacuum Systems product line to a variety of clinical and medical customers across numerous call points with primary being in (Hospitals) Acute Care Centers, establishing relationships with physicians and working with national thought leaders in this therapeutic area, collaborating with Post-Acute Key Account Manager at the discharge planner, and liaising with partners in market including DME’s (Durable Medical Equipment), distributors and independent sales representatives Utilize professional selling skills to solicit sales of company products Seek new customers, either known target accounts or new business found by prospecting Make contacts at all levels and with all groups, which might influence current and future buying decisions Maintain the highest degree of product knowledge through continuing study, including characteristics, quality, engineering, competitive advantages, customer applications, features, benefits, and proof sources Expand skills in selling, adapting to selling situations, negotiating complex deals, and broadening team dynamics Quarterly, define customers to be visited and maintain call frequency standards Preplan sales calls; review background information, set call objectives and define selling strategies Submit regular objectives, action plans and sales projections Utilize CRM/Salesforce tools, maintain integrity of information  Servicing and follow-up: Provide field sales service and training to all accounts in assigned territory Service includes solving problems, assisting customers, and ensuring their satisfaction with our products, including technical advice on the use of products, delivery considerations, quality control, invoicing, etc. Provide these services personally where feasible or initiate and coordinate action through appropriate company support personnel Follow up to make sure customer requests/problems are satisfactorily resolved Promptly report any product or service complaint through quality system  Communications and reporting: Submit required reports promptly and legibly Update sales opportunities and forecasts through company CRM software (SalesForce.com) Keep timely records and manage all customer activities including call reports and follow-up through company CRM software Complete and submit expense reports monthly Communicate with Manager or Sales Director as needed Develop customer communications such as presentations, bids, quotes, as necessary and approved by corporate  Field surveillance: Serve as the eyes and ears of the company within assigned territory by observing, appraising, and reporting on competitive activities, price developments, customer plans, product trends, new product potentials, market trends and related matters Provide relevant information in CRM/Salesforce when applicable  Employee must meet vendor credentialing/compliance demands of accounts within given territory.This includes but not limited to: RepTrax, VendorMate, Status Blue, VCS, etc.For patient/customer safety purposes as part of the vendor credentialing process, Employee must satisfy account’s drug screening requirements, including but not limited to screening for marijuana use, regardless if use of marijuana is legal under applicable state law. For more information, please refer to the Drug and Alcohol Workplace Policy.     MEDELA Core Behaviors Put the customer first. Be solution oriented. Take ownership. Strive for excellence. Work as a team. Create engagement  As an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, protected veteran status, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, HIV/AIDs status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity (transgender status), weight, height or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law or ordinance. https://mandatoryview.com/?LicenceId=e7c44cfe-6946-4b77-9939 493d186ba760&ProductType=OnlineApplicant&SubType=PG

description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  A Day in the Life  At Medtronic, the Sales Representative I, Spine is responsible for soliciting orders, selling Medtronic Spinal products assigned and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the area assigned; for maintaining an awareness of local competitive conditions. This position will work in tandem with Spine Sales Representatives II and will have territory coverage responsibility and limited sales responsibility. Allocation guideline for core responsibilities include: Inventory Management, Case Coverage, and Selling (outside the operating room).  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Maintain, manage and track Consignments and Loaner inventory. Keep non usage and flight usage to a minimum level. Territory case coverage. Manage accounts in assigned territory. Prepare and submit call reports as required by the District Sales Manager. Maintain up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with District Sales Manager’s instructions. Aggressively solicit orders from present and prospective customers for the products assigned. Aggressively seek new customers and formulate and follow plans for such action as directed by the District Sales Manager. Resolve customer complaints in accordance with Medtronic Spinal policies and advise District Sales Manager and Medtronic Spinal promptly of any situation beyond scope of authority. Recommend the additions of new products and the modification or deletion of present products to the line as appropriate. Successful completion of all required product and sales related training curriculum. Meet or exceed sales quota and total company market share in assigned territory. Attend and participate in sales meetings, training programs and conventions as directed. Identify selling opportunities and work closely with the sales representative to increase sales in their respective accounts. Comply with all Medtronic Spinal policies. Work weekends, evenings, and Holidays as required on an emergency basis. Must Have: Minimum Requirements High School Diploma or GED AND a minimum of 4 years of sales experience with 2 of those 4 years in medical sales; or High School Diploma or GED AND 2 years of Medtronic RTG (Pain, Brain or Spine) Clinical Specialist or Sales Rep I experience plus 2 years of prior clinical or medical sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND a minimum of 2 years of sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND 1 year of Medtronic RTG (Pain, Brain or Spine) Clinical Specialist or Sales Rep I experience plus 1 year of prior clinical or medical sales experience; or Bachelor’s degree. Nice to Have Ability to interact effectively with a wide range of people and personalities Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in an operating room setting Ability to accommodate a flexible work schedule Ortho, Spine or O.R. experience strongly preferred Physical Job Requirements While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile Required to interact with a computer for extended periods of time, and communicate with peers and co-workers Regularly required to talk or hear Occasionally required to sit and reach with hands and arms Regularly required to stand; walk and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools , or controls Must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds Specific vision abilities required by this job involve normal vision Ability to travel Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.  The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  ABOUT MEDTRONIC:  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  EEO STATEMENT:  It is the policy of Medtronic to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Medtronic will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  DISCLAIMER:  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position.  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 6, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: B V L G A R I is looking for a Sales Administrator for our 5th Avenue, Flagship boutique!  The Sales Administrator is responsible for overseeing all back office functions as a support to the sales activity. This position’s responsibilities will include, but are not limited to F&A Reporting, Inventory Management, Supply Fulfillment, Vendors’ Management, After Sales Service Coordination and assistance to the Sales team.  This role will take action under the direct Management of the Operations Manager, and will work collaboratively with other members of the Sales team to coordinate with the Corporate Office and all store-related activities.  Essential Duties:  Perform all inventory control activities in a precise and accurate manner  Perform daily sales reconciliation Assist and support After Sales Service activities in the Store Assist the Sales team during the Sales process, upon request Order supplies on a regular basis and in a financially responsible manner  Facilitate and follow-up on IT and Store maintenance requests Support Visual Merchandising functions  Assist on special and UNIQUE projects   Key Competencies:  2+ years experience in operations, inventory, or relevant working experience Experience in luxury retail environment preferred Precious attention to detail, good organizational skills, priority setting and personal accountability Proactive, self-starter and flexible mindset Client centric approach and result orientation Ability to multi-task and work independently EXQUISITE communication skills, both verbal and written Integrity and Trust Must work retail hours – Weekdays and Weekends, Evenings & Holidays
industries: Luxury Goods & Jewelry, Retail, and Apparel & Fashion

description: A startup advertising company is seeking to hire a driven Southern CA Sales Executive to join their growing nationwide team. This is a fully remote position but candidate must be local to the Southern CA region.  We are looking for an experienced account executive who is passionate about both out-of-home advertising and digital media. Our ideal candidate will be motivated and excited about making a change within the advertising industry! Apply today for consideration  Responsibilities Include Initiate and develop relationships with media agencies, entertainment companies, and brands to drive advertising sales. Develop and maintain a sales prospect database. Generate weekly reports and maintain relationships with new clients. Contribute to the company’s marketing strategies, sales collateral, and product development. Requirements 3-5 years of experience working in sales and/or media. A solid understanding of account planning in an advertising agency or group. Ability to travel to clients when needed. #ZR #hotjobs

description: Job Description:  What makes Gartner Sales a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll set your career on track for outstanding achievement with a company that knows no limits. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company, steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our sales associates earn a competitive base salary, uncapped commissions and exceptional benefits — along with top training and support, and recognition for high performers. If you’re coachable, persistent, smart, executive-savvy, and looking for your next great adventure, Gartner is the place for you. Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here!  What we do: Gartner partners with C-suite executives across all industries to provide market research and best practices and advisory services, enabling them to address their business-critical decisions through data-driven research. Gartner has experienced almost a decade worth of double-digit growth, which demonstrates how Gartner has succeeded in helping businesses navigate their mission-critical priorities.  About the role: The Business Development Manager is an office-based sales role responsible for developing and acquiring new clients to Gartner. The territory for this role includes specific mid-sized client accounts with revenue targets between $50 million - $750 million per annum.  What you’ll do: Identify and develop new business opportunities with new-to-Gartner organizations Own the full sales cycle from prospecting through close Convert viable prospects to active Gartner clients (members), leading the full sales conversation and negotiation, through to the transition of new clients to the account management team  What you need: Bachelor’s degree highly preferred 2 – 6 years of consultative and solution-based selling experience with a demonstrated track record of quota-carrying success Experience selling IT, staffing/recruiting or professional services solutions highly preferred Competitive nature. You’re driven to be the best. You challenge yourself by setting goals, crushing them, and helping your teammates do the same.
industries: Information Services

description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Associate  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Committed, loyal and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. Honest people who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do You will get exposure to the proven winning Stryker Trauma culture that delivers Industry leading results in all market segments You will receive best-in-class formal Trauma training on product portfolio and selling skills which includes on-the-job training in the operating room. You’ll become an expert on surgical procedures by observing well-over 300 cases in your first year You will develop well-rounded field exposure to prepare you in all aspects of the selling/ servicing process when a territory opportunity arises You will develop a high level of competency in Orthopaedic surgical needs and procedures becoming a valuable member of the surgical team and positively impacting surgical outcomes You will build a strong brand in account management and client service – key drivers in our business! You will work in a highly competitive and challenging work environment that will put your best talents to work every single day What You Need To be successful in this role bring your strong multitasking ability, ability to read and sell to any audience, drive to achieve and succeed, aptitude to learn medical and technical information quickly, ability to build strong, lasting relationships, a strong work-ethic and a competitive nature Bachelor’s Degree required 1+ years of sales experience preferred Come ready to make a difference…fast! What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges.  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology.  Manage all aspects of engagements with existing and new customers for our Smart Energy organization (Gas and Utilities). You will build relationships and understand customer business to provide appropriate products or solutions. You will define sales and growth strategy toward key customers while aligning with critical sales business objectives. You will identify opportunities and build credibility with customers. Utilize your product knowledge to deliver the value proposition to the customers.  This opportunity will cover US Southeast and travel of up to 50% will be required with occasional overnight stay.  Key Responsibilities  PMT102021 Identify Opportunities Manage and Plan Accounts Negotiate and Close Articulate and Deliver Value Proposition Manage Momentum Through the Sales Cycle Manage book of business with Honeywell CRM tool (Salesforce) Establish Rapport with Customers MUST HAVE: 5-10 years of utilities (gas market) or industrial industry. 5+ years of sales and account management experience Valid Drivers License WE VALUE Bachelor's Degree Demonstrated ability to evaluate complex situations or concepts to translate strategies into actions. Recognizes business goals and drives activities for sustainable results. Act as a Business partner across all functions to ensure objectives are met. Results-driven with accountability to challenge the status quo. Strong influencing and persuading skills. Develops strong working relationships. Motivated to deliver to multiple customers within the technical field of expertise. Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills. Effective communicator both internally and externally. Ability to work independently in a fast-paced matrix setting. Experience in developing marketing and sales strategies. Experience working in an Engineering / Manufacturing organization would be a candidate advantage. The attitude and will to want to make a difference. A methodical approach and an eye for detail. Effective presentation skills. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD137527 Category: Sales Location: 10045 International Blvd,West Chester,Ohio,45246,United States Exempt Sales (LATAM)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.
