description: Wine Sales Executive / Brand Manager Job Description: Opportunities:  Be responsible for building a growing regional brand in retail. Capitalize on an established, recreational destination winery’s growing popularity. Grow existing primarily off sale accounts while  opening and growing new ones by marketing the brand’s identity with the popular recreational area. Work on a commission compensation plan that provides a base plus expenses and rewards for case growth over the previous year. Responsibilities:  Compliant assistance to retailers to help move the products by providing current and relevant point-of-sale materials, obtaining eye-catching displays, cold box placements, promoting the brand with local worthy causes to bring in new customers, and other initiatives that result in demand around each retailer. As the brand increases in sales and can justify more sales staff,  help select and train additional representatives to service existing accounts and expand into new ones. Inform, introduce, and support new products, labels, and line extensions with signage, displays, tastings, and local worthy cause promotions. Help develop and implement sales, marketing, and merchandising strategies. Help establish and achieve sales targets, case goals, customer service levels, and profitability. Identify market trends and opportunities to keep the brand relevant. Work closely with the Wine Marketing Manager to develop an effective promotional calendar, advertising campaign, and special events.. Requirements:  Demonstrated experience promoting and growing wine brands in retail (independents as well as chain outlets) A knowledge of the territory (Philly to Northwestern PA). Ideally has existing positive relationships with retail buyers. Helped grow another wine brand or worked for a distribution company. Personality and performance that builds trust on the part of retail buyers. Regular regional travel – fully licensed with a dependable vehicle capable of carrying samples and marketing materials. Experience soliciting, securing, providing logistics, performing and following up on tastings at retail (and other events) Dependable, organized, disciplined, and empathetic toward buyers, customer and all other in the distribution system.

This is an incredible opportunity to break into medical sales with defined promotional growth.  Requirements & Skills: - 1-2 years of medical diagnostic experience OR strong B2B Sales - Clinical Background/Industry Knowledge Preferred - Bachelor's degree  Compensation: - Uncapped Commissions - $75k+ Year 1 (base + commission) and $300k+ by Year 2/3 - Full Benefits + iPhone/iPad - Car allowance

description: Vision  Spero Foods is a venture-backed, female and disability -founded, and plant-forward startup using clean technology to transform seeds (not nuts) into plant-based dairy products, creating the world's first delicious and sustainable plant-based dairy that will soon be priced the same as animal dairy! Spero is innovating in every single dairy alternatives category. Spero’s backers include: YC, Valor, BVP. Check out our Insta!  About Our Founder  Phaedra, our founder and CEO, created Spero to democratize dairy, giving everyone access to delicious dairy alternatives that are better for us and the planet. She invented Spero’s technology and designed its brand. Before Spero, she graduated from Cornell in engineering and biosciences, was an award-winning artist, and an All-American athlete. She’s been a top software engineer at Facebook and acquired startups, founded and led organizations at Cornell, Facebook, and Harvard, and has grown Spero to now be in a state-of-the-art manufacturing plant in CA and top retailers across the country, and it’s just the beginning of the journey to change the world for the better!  Spero Has Been Named Fast Company's World Changing Ideas Honoree Hermes Creatives - 2x Gold IAB 2020: Most Disruptive Consumer Brands in the U.S. TED Women Food Trend Lab Forbes 30 Under 30 Food & Drink Responsibilities Managing Retail Accounts: relationships with stores and buyers, inventory, marketing Managing In-Store Demos: logistics, scheduling, people, shipments Managing Merchandising and inventory: forecasting, restocks, etc. Paperwork: impeccable attention to detail and timeliness to ensure everything is completed on-time The ideal candidate will be responsible for leading effective sales account management in their territory, developing strong relationships with key stakeholders. You will work cross-functionally to understand sales needs, act as a company brand ambassador to external sources, driving revenue growth through successful sales initiatives and management.  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in sales or marketing preferred but not required 10-15 years of retail food sales experience You've built a network of retail food buyers Outstanding history of leadership and communication Insanely detail-oriented Impeccable execution and relentlessness! Every no can become a yes! Personable and excellent at relationships building You Are Someone Who Takes pride in your work! Is obsessed with creating a strong community among our users! Is results-oriented and an incredible executor. Is adaptable. Detail-oriented. Is scrappy. Has grit. Is obsessed with quality and innovation. Is positive and awesome! Job Perks Include Health & dental insurance!! 401K hosting ClassPass Membership Free meditation app access Team Bonding Outings Sponsored Team Lunches Free late-night dinners if you stay after hours* Autonomy, growth, impact! Opportunities to make a positive impact on the world-- the environment, people’s health, and animals’ lives --  Spero Foods, Inc. does not and shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities or operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers and vendors, and provision of services. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, clients, volunteers, subcontractors, vendors, and clients.  Spero Foods, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate and will take affirmative action measures to ensure against discrimination in employment, recruitment, advertisements for employment, compensation, termination, upgrading, promotions, and other conditions of employment against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, veteran's status, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. Spero is innovating in every single dairy alternatives category.

description: Fort Lauderdale, FL, USA  Req #4623  Tuesday, January 12, 2021  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees.  As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida.  The Sales Account Manager (** SAM) is responsible for business development and customer relationships for the Central Tampa Bay area. The SAM increases business by selling additional brands and packages within his or her sales territory's existing customer base. The Sales Account Manager at CCBF works across all sales channels. This position's territory will be dedicated to the Ft. Lauderdale area. **Role Responsibilities**  â€¢Make sales and obtain orders from customers  â€¢Customarily and regularly perform primary duties in the field visiting customer accounts away from a company facility or office  â€¢Build and maintain profitable customer relationships  â€¢Execute and close all sales calls  â€¢Sell in incremental displays and equipment placements; sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance  â€¢Review business results with customers  **â€¢**  Ensure company assets meet performance requirements and develop a plan of action for those assets generating zero or low volume  â€¢ Ensure outlets comply with CCBF standards  â€¢ Communicate account activities to appropriate parties  â€¢ Merchandising and rotation inspection  â€¢ Resolve customer inquiries, including researching and closing customer service tickets  â€¢ Transport, replace and maintain Point of Sale advertising as appropriate for account  â€¢ Maintain regular and punctual attendance  â€¢ Work overtime as assigned  â€¢ Comply with all company policies, procedures and applicable laws  â€¢ Identifying and reporting any unsafe working conditions  â€¢ Comply with dress code or appearance/grooming standards  â€¢ Work shifts and work schedules as assigned  **Role Requirements**  â€¢ High School Diploma or equivalent, bachelor's degree preferred  â€¢ Must be 18 years of age or older  â€¢ 5+ years of general work experience  â€¢ 5+ years previous sales experience preferred  Â€¢ Food/beverage Industry Experience Preferred  â€¢ Ability to create and conduct sales presentations  â€¢ Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills  â€¢ Excellent planning and organization skills  â€¢ Proficient in computer application skills  â€¢ Ability to use and understand mobile applications  â€¢ Ability to work variable schedule, weekends and holidays  â€¢ Must have and maintain a valid driver's license  â€¢ Must have and maintain current vehicle liability insurance, as specified by company  â€¢ Must have a driving record with no major moving violations in the last three (3) years*  â€¢ Must provide and maintain a personal vehicle for use during employee working hours  â€¢ Frequent lifting of 25+ pounds. Occasional lifting of 50+ pounds, bending, reaching, kneeling, and light merchandising  â€¢ Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print  â€¢ Ability to stand a minimum of 6 hours during the workday  â€¢ Ability to walk a minimum of 4 miles during the workday Major moving violations include, but are not limited to, leaving the scene of an accident, driving under the influence, and reckless driving. Minor moving violations include, but are not limited to, speeding, driving too close, failure to stop, and improper lane changes. Driving records, including minor moving violations, will be evaluated according to CCBF guidelines to determine eligibility for the Sales Account Manager position. Physical Abilities  â€¢ Ability to repetitively lift, carry, and position objects weighing up to 50 pounds without assistance  â€¢ Ability to repetitively push and pull objects weighing up to 50 pounds without assistance while kneeling; squatting; reaching above the head; reaching at the waist; reaching below the knees; and bending at the knees  â€¢ Ability to repetitively push and pull manual transport equipment (for example, pallet jack, handtruck) containing product loads a minimum of 100 yards without assistance  â€¢ Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination  â€¢ Ability to exert oneself physically over sustained periods of time to complete job activities  â€¢ Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print  â€¢ Ability to stand a minimum of 6 hours during the workday  â€¢ Ability to walk a minimum of 4 miles during the workday  â€¢ Frequently work in a hot/humid outdoor environment  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  **Other details** Job Family Sales Job Function Sales Pay Type Salary Apply Now Fort Lauderdale, FL, USA

jobTitle: Inside Sales Advisor (Call Center) - Fremont, CA
description: The role of the Inside Sales Advisor is to educate, inspire and skillfully guide Tesla’s potential customers through the vehicle purchase and configuration process. Inside Sales Advisors have the incredible opportunity to advise potential Tesla customers from all over North America, while honing their abilities in lead qualification.  We expect members of this team to become experts in our products and the direct-from-manufacturer sales model that has made Tesla an innovator in the automotive industry.  The ideal candidate will possess exceptional interpersonal communication skills, unshakeable moral fortitude, and a strong awareness of professional behavior when supporting customers.  Responsibilities Communicate with current and prospective customers via chat, email and SMS to nurture and prepare them for a vehicle purchase. Receive inbound leads to assess the prospect's needs, qualify the opportunity, and schedule the test drive experience. Use a consultative approach to influence customer purchase while also aiding buy in to the mission, business model, and Tesla brand. Develop and maintain a sales pipeline achieving both personal and group monthly metrics in conjunction with the field Sales teams. Provide feedback and recommendations based on direct experiences with potential customers. Maintain customer relationships from the initial interaction up until delivery day. Qualifications 1-3 years’ of Inside Sales experience or Bachelor’s degree preferred Evidence of exceptional ability Strong relationship management skills and the ability to explain complex technical concepts Proven track record to meet or exceed targets and goals Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills, grammatical genius Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office, internet navigation, CRM applications) Valid US Driver’s License and/or State ID and ability to obtain DMV Salesperson’s License Employee Benefits As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents. Kaiser and UnitedHealthcare PPO and HSA plans (including infertility coverage) 3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage) Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits Employee Assistance Program, Paid Time Off, and Paid Holidays Back-up childcare and employee discounts

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced matrix setting. Experience in developing marketing and sales strategies. Experience working in an Engineering / Manufacturing organization would be a candidate advantage. The attitude and will to want to make a difference. A methodical approach and an eye for detail. Effective presentation skills. description: Jarvis Elliott is partnered with an award-winning AI tech company that strives to make hiring more fair and more efficient for the largest companies in the world.  This team already has some impressive F100 clients already on board and are looking for someone to help develop a world-class Enterprise Sales Development program. This person would own all top-of-the-funnel activity and set the stage for the sales experience. If you are motivated by career acceleration and growth, take a look at the requirements below to see if this could be you!  What you'd be doing: Collaborating with AEs to develop account outreach strategies and with the Marketing Team to ensure messages are on brand. Building scalable prospecting campaigns based on data. Writing compelling messages that lead to booked meetings for AEs. Identifying inefficiencies and implementing improvements to their process  What you'll ideally have: 1+ year(s) of experience working with enterprise-level clients 1+ year(s) of experience working for a data or HR focused SaaS company. Experience writing personalized cold emails/messages; strong verbal & written communication skills.  What's offered: Competitive compensation with uncapped commission. description: Samsung Ads Sales Planner  Samsung Ads, the advertising monetization arm of Samsung Electronics, leverages proprietary real-time TV viewing behavior and insights to promote relevant brands and content experiences to consumers. We partner with brands, agencies and content owners to deliver unique advertising opportunities on native placements within our Smart TV platform and programmatically with a cross device solution.  Samsung’s unique first party data help brands connect to their audience as they explore content across desktop, mobile, tablets and our Smart TVs. The Samsung Ad platform delivers high-quality audience targeting powered by three key components: first-party audience data at scale, world-class data science, and brand-safe cross-device ad inventory.  The Opportunity Samsung Ads is looking for energetic individuals to help support our growing organization. This person should be a strong communicator with the ability to multitask. If you are attention detailed and thrive in a results-based, sales environment then this could be the opportunity for you!   S/he will be responsible to build supporting materials for our advertisers and manage an internal process of the campaign life cycle. Candidates should have familiarity with digital advertising and its relationship with traditional advertising. Experience with Excel, PowerPoint are a must.  The Sales Planner position will be based in Playa Vista, CA and will closely align with our sales vertical strategy. This is a one year contracted role with the possibility of extension or perm hire.  2+ years experience; media planning or buying experience   Responsibilities Support Client Solutions Management team in executing advertiser’s campaign goals Manage the internal RFP process while ensuring timelines and goals are met Work cross functionally with varying departments (Ad Operations, Inventory, Marketing, Finance, etc.) to facilitate campaign execution. Develop a deep understanding of Samsung Ads products and sales offerings. Work with dedicated Client Solutions Manager to track proposals, analyze post campaign delivery and billing. Create processes as needed to streamline efficiencies while working with the CSM leadership team.  The Sales Planner should also possess most of the following characteristics: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to manage the needs of multiple stakeholders and adhere to timelines. Direct and frequent communicator. Process-oriented with excellent organizational skills. Independent and driven to succeed. True team player: takes full accountability for assigned tasks and believes in the importance of adhering to and communicating deadlines. Possesses an eye for details and takes pride in the materials he/she creates, mindful that the quality of that work has real impact on the business.

Full Benefits + Expensed Travel +Car Allowance Very strong territory  Requirements & Skills: 2-3+ Years of Experience Selling into Hospitals True Hunter with Track Record of Success Hospital-based sales experience is a HUGE plus (IR, Vascular, Cardiac Cath Lab call points)   If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, send your updated Resume to ewalters@pursuitsalessolutions.com!

jobTitle: Trauma Sales Representative - Mountain Home, AR
description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who do what is necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do  As a Trauma Sales Representative, you work with a high degree of intensity and commitment to sell Stryker Trauma products that meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident trauma expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons and healthcare professionals. You live your work, feeding off the extreme demands of trauma, not counting hours but rather lives impacted. A person who is energized by chaos, you organize your materials and sort possible solutions quickly during operating/emergency room consultations. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with surgeons. They trust you to provide advice and training on products and tools used to save lives. As a Trauma Sales Representative who does what is necessary and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need Bachelor’s Degree or 4+ years experience in a clinical healthcare or sales role (or a combination of the two) 3+ years of sales experience preferred Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services, including marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems Excellent organizational skills and knowledge in the use of current office technologies (MSOffice suite, databases, etc.) Experience in building and maintaining relationships (with surgeons & hospitals in respective areas would be beneficial) Must be comfortable in emergency/operating room environments Ability to participate in and attend sales meetings and professional association meetings outside regular business hours, as required Must adhere to compliance and the principles of responsibility (AdvaMed) by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information, protecting the assets of the organization, acting with ethics and integrity, reporting non-compliance, and adhering to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, accreditation and licenser requirements, and Company’s policies and procedures What We Offer A winning team motivated to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

description: The Company At SchoolPass, we're changing the way schools think about campus movement and wellness. Parents love using SchoolPass to communicate wellness, attendance, and dismissal changes to everyone at the school with the tap of a button, and schools love using SchoolPass to streamline their dismissal process and make sure every kid goes where they're supposed to at the end of the day.  We're headquartered in the Greater DC Area, and we have customers in 36 states from California to New York. Our work is dynamic, responsive, and stimulating.  This is a great opportunity for the right person to join a fast-growing EdTech software startup.  The Role The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is the entry point into a complex and lucrative software sales role at SchoolPass. The SDR is responsible for proactive business development through research, prospecting, and outbound lead generation. The goal is to qualify sales prospects then coordinate with the Sales Executive Team to progress them through the sales funnel starting with a product demonstration. The key to the SDR’s short term and long term success will be the tenacity to sift through prospect lists of targeted accounts to develop new sales opportunities from new, cold, or inactive accounts.  What you will do: Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM (Salesforce) Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities Utilize effective prospecting, networking, research, and opportunity development Execute high volume outbound email and phone call campaigns to prospective clients Qualify new sales opportunities by understanding the budget, decision maker, specific business need, timing, and fit Develop and maintaining a highly professional online presence using our website and other tools Respond to hits to the SchoolPass web site and inbound calls; qualify them, and assign them to the appropriate sales representative Schedule meetings between prospects and SchoolPass sales staff Support marketing efforts by assisting in online, direct mail, other marketing campaigns and trade shows  Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry and competition Attend SchoolPass webinars and events as a company representative as needed Other relevant projects, as needed  The skills & experiences you’ll need: Sales or marketing experience or education equivalent preferred Energy and desire to fulfill prospecting behaviours daily (both triage and “cold calling”) Motivated and goal oriented (AKA hungry!) Ability to identify and establish communication with key decision makers Ability to form relationships, be influential, & maintain personal credibility Superb written, oral and presentation skills Thrives in fast-paced, consultative sales environment Proficiency with Microsoft Office and internet tools and research Proficiency with social media (LinkedIn, Facebook, etc)  The values that are important to us: Respect. Mutual respect is REQUIRED, and non-negotiable. Basically, treat people the way you want to be treated. Customer Centricity. We obsess over solving problems for our customers – without them we don’t have a business. Collaboration. We encourage teamwork and communication up, down, and across an open organization to achieve best outcomes. Results. We are a fully remote organization, giving you the power to manage your time, while having full transparency of set objectives by which we manage and will gauge your performance. Action. To stay ahead of our competitors, we act with speed to add value to our market and each other.

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges.  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology.  Be the front line seller who drives sales, identifying and generating opportunities for different kinds of customers. You will foster client satisfaction by maintaining regular customer contact and managing customer expectations. You will develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminar, and similar events. You will provide education of Honeywell product through technical presentations. You will maintain and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will provide competitive intelligence and market trends. You will provide forecast/demand input to Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP).  Key Responsibilities Attend (trade shows, seminars, events) Visit Customers Search for New Customers Campaign Management Customer Reporting Learn the Products Customer Account Management YOU MUST HAVE A High School Diploma / GED A minimum of 3 years of experience working in a selling role. A minimum of 1 year experience working with Salesforce.com WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Compensation & Benefits  Incentive Eligible  Salary Range: $92,900 - $139,200  For benefits information please visit https://careers.honeywell.com/us/en/honeywell-benefits. Current employees may visit HR Direct.  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD139024 Category: Sales Location: 534 Fellowship Road,Mount Laurel,New Jersey,08054,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Rated Top Place to Work by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution, RWC is a market leader and manufacturer of water solutions for residential, commercial, and industrial applications. RWC’s portfolio of brands includes industry-leading brands: SharkBite® Push-to-Connect plumbing solutions; HoldRite® engineered plumbing and mechanical solutions; Cash Acme® control valves; and John Guest® fittings and fluid dispense products.   POSITION SUMMARY: The Business Development Manager is responsible for achieving sales revenues and margin requirements to support the company’s financial objectives in the assigned territory. The individual must sell RWC® products in various new construction markets that include, but are not limited to, hotel, healthcare, single family, multi-family, commercial, and institutional. Essential to success will be the ability to present and sell to plumbing contractors, general contractors and engineers. The candidate must excel in closing sales on jobsites, deliver office presentations and be willing to meet key decision makers throughout the territory.  PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES  Thoroughly understands and can effectively demonstrate installation methods, features, benefits and applications of all RWC branded products. Coordination and planning with RSM and territory sales agencies to ensure market and customer coverage. Successfully sells to and influences the following key audiences as assigned; installing contractors, inspectors, engineers, architects, builders, distributors and owner/developers. Adoption of Salesforce best practices to sell and track opportunities through territory pipeline. Responsible for quarterly forecasting of products and product mix through Salesforce pipeline. Ensures Salesforce contacts, accounts and other database information is maintained accurately and timely. Daily updates on opportunities, next steps, next step dates, probability, dollars and other pertinent information regarding the opportunity. High Impact Activities logged upon completion of site or office visit. Develop and implement a territory sales plan to achieve sales and margin objectives, while remaining within budget. Ensures Company is current on market conditions and trends by providing input and assistance with market research and development. Competent in all aspects of RWC product portfolio to provide training for sales agencies, installing contractors and other parties. Use of RWC sales tools to effectively convert customers to RWC products. Understanding of sales reporting for assigned reps, wholesalers and/or territory. Other duties as assigned.  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:   Education:   Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience  Experience:    The ideal candidate will have construction experience and installer/foreman or similar equivalent experience. This individual must possess the ability to make successful cold calls, qualify prospects, and generate leads. This position requires a minimum of 3 years of outside sales experience within an assigned territory. Working knowledge of MS Office and a CRM program is preferred. Candidate must demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to establish customer relationships. A valid driver’s license is required.   Competencies:  Excellent negotiation and relationship building skills Initiative and self-motivation to stay ahead of the competition Proficient with Microsoft Office products Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills Excellent time management and organizational skills Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.  WORKING CONDITIONS: This position will require the majority of your time in the field with contractors, on jobsites and in a contractor’s office. Extensive travel - 50%  PHYSICAL DEMANDS:  Job requires both sitting and standing and agile flexibility to move and connect equipment in various set-ups. Excellent vision, hearing, speech and motor skills are required to perform essential functions of the job. This position travels by car and plane on a frequent basis.

A bit about us… Pegasus Laboratories is a full-service Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization, or CDMO, with a very special niche: improving the lives of animals. Through our leading veterinary brand PRN Pharmacal, we create trusted veterinary products that promote animal wellness, including behavior modification, urinary incontinence, and seizure management. And Pegasus offers the complete package, from idea through development and regulatory approval to production and marketing. Our team is a mosaic of professionals, including manufacturing specialists, quality assurance professionals, business development geniuses, chemists, regulatory experts, and veterinarians. And Pegasus is part of a 100% employee-owned organization, PBI-Gordon Companies, Inc. With more than 500 employee-owners, we’re bonded together in the pursuit of mutual success. We’ve got a great and growing team – come join us!  It’s a fun place to work with a great mission supporting animal health. And we’re located in beautiful Pensacola, Florida, with great beaches just minutes away!  About the Role:    This position requires a motivated self-starter with solution-driven orientation and the ability to develop strong customer/partner relationships utilizing their business knowledge to create win-win situations. This position will be directly responsible for calling on assigned key accounts in the veterinary and eCommerce markets of animal health.  This role, as a member of the Sales group, requires high proficiency in developing sound business plans, and requires building internal, as well as, external cross-functional team relationships for value creation ahead of pace of the market.   Specific Responsibilities: Develop annual strategic sales plans for eCommerce and key accounts to achieve established budget targets and growth in focused areas. Build, implement and carry out customer business plans with select accounts that roll up to a larger overall plan for long-term cooperation with sustained industry partners. Present, gain consensus and execute customized and innovative programs that support annual growth aligning to corporate goals and forecasts.  Expected that full programs will include sales, marketing and financial analysis dimensions. Create specific key account activities beyond status quo within eCommerce, including product awareness, education and minimum advertised price policies.  Utilize inventive and cross-functional thinking in emerging markets for annual proposals that will drive business in new broader formats. Initiate standard customer communications of program dates, terms and total PRN Pharmacal/Pegasus Laboratories support to all accounts, as well as, ad hoc in-person updates when required. Introduce new products and assist in the promotion of those products through marketing and pricing programs as necessary with selected accounts. ·     Provide business intelligence, which supports company growth initiatives including customer and internal product forecasting. Develop existing accounts by initiating behaviors that allow them growth with product portfolio. ·     Resolve customer concerns by investigating issues, developing solutions and providing sound resolutions to executive leadership. Manage budget expenditures and accruals within given budget parameters. ·     All other duties as may be assigned. Experience/Skills Required: Education: Bachelor’s degree. Advanced degree or certifications in business-related fields a plus. Experience: 6-8 years of progressively responsible experience in Key Account Management & Sales roles related to animal health, specifically related to areas of product distribution, eCommerce, Group Purchasing Organizations and corporate veterinary medicine with proven ability to meet sales goals and objectives with reporting capabilities. Specialized Knowledge: Clear understanding of B2B, B2C and DTC marketing required with experience with emerging media a plus.  Other Skills: High proficiency in MS Office Suite, strong analytical, presentation and communications skills, with ability to thrive in transparent, teamwork-focused environment essential. Travel Required: Although this position is home-based, extensive travel within the territory is required (50-65%)
industries: Pharmaceuticals

jobTitle: Sales Representative - Houston Medical Center - Surgical Technologies
description: Sales Rep  Who we want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As a Surgical Technologies Sales Representative, you strategically promote and sell Stryker ST products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As an ST Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need  5+ years in an outside sales position (medical related fields or b2b sales preferred) or Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University  What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In February 2019, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that for the ninth consecutive year has been named as one of the 2018 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For ranking 11 out of 100. Some of our other awards from 2018 include Great Places to Work for Inclusion, Women, Millennials, and Diversity.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn More About The Surgical Technologies Products https://www.stryker.com/us/en/surgical-technologies.html Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better

description: Inform Diagnostics is a leading national pathology laboratory, headquartered in Irving, Texas, with additional state-of-the-art laboratories in Boston, New York City, and Phoenix. With unparalleled quality and experience, Inform Diagnostics provides reliable, high-quality diagnostic services in various subspecialties. The company is profoundly impacting patient care, one diagnosis at a time.  Sales Directors are responsible for the sales function of Dermatology (DERM), Gastroenterology (GI) and Urology (GU) services. Our Sales Directors are individual contributors who identify new business opportunities as the bulk of their day-to-day while also managing existing customer relationships within a given territory. They understand customer industry and business needs and strategically sell pathology products/services. Focus on driving revenue and client retention by building consultative relationships. Work with clients to establish a strategic account value. Successful Sales Directors follow a results-driven process while finding a balance between customer orientation and territory growth. Executes sales cycle with high level of service. Overnight travel approximately 60% (up to 90%).  Responsibilities:  Sales Directors will spend 70% of time prospecting high-volume targets, 20% off time focusing on client retention while trying to penetrate additional case volume and 10% of time completing administrative duties. Act as single point of contact for assigned customers. Create strategic business plans and consistently achieve sales quota while complying with company standards, polices, and procedures. Grow revenue in designated territory through effectively prospecting target customers, delivering compelling value proposition, and converting business routinely. Negotiate agreements. Maintain Anatomic Pathology product knowledge/expertise in Derm, GI and GU. Communicate effectively and professionally with internal and external customers to exceed performance objectives and customer expectations.  Required:  Bachelor's degree from an accredited University required. 5+ years of successful healthcare sales experience (both product and service) with experience calling on and selling to physicians and ambulatory surgery centers. 2+ years of lab experience preferred. Ability to travel 60% (and the ability to travel up to 90%) and work flexible hours when required. Positive attitude paired with strong work ethic and drive to win business. Ability to find opportunities and turn them into long-term, profitable relationships. Possess high degree of understanding the client relationship with Physicians, their needs, and how we can provide service and technology solutions for their pathology needs. Demonstrated decision making ability towards solving problems, while working under pressure and effectively communicating these solutions to coworkers and customers. Ability to quickly learn and apply knowledge of proprietary software programs. Customer Service Focus – Demonstrate a focus on listening to and understanding client/customer needs and then delighting the client/customer by exceeding service and quality expectations.  Territory: AZ, CO, UT, WY, MT, ND, SD, NE  Perks: Base + uncapped commissions, mileage reimbursement, 401(k) + match, full benefits and more! This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Biotechnology, and Medical Practice

description: The Muse is a values-based job search platform used by over 70 million people annually to connect with companies and find a career that matches their values. Founded in 2011, we were named one of Fast Company’s 50 Most Innovative Companies in the World. We have a highly diverse userbase of Millennial & Gen Z jobseekers who we help connect with companies as wide-ranging as Apple, Nike and the FBI, on the strength of those companies’ values, cultures, and employee experiences. Our users come to TheMuse.com for original career advice from prominent experts, access to the best coaches, and a behind-the-scenes look at job opportunities. Smart companies work with us to attract today’s top talent, giving candidates the information they need to find the company that is right for them. Why? Because life’s too short to hate your career.  We're hiring Sales Development Representatives to support our new business Sales team. As an SDR, you’ll have the opportunity to significantly impact the growth of our business and help redefine the way companies hire. Our SDRs are often the first point of contact for our potential customers, so you’ll be responsible for representing The Muse brand and making a positive impression that sets the tone for the entire customer lifecycle. You’ll also become an expert in our business and products as you prepare yourself for the next step in your sales career.  This position is based in NYC and candidates need to be able to work in NY.  How you'll make an impact You’ll manage and qualify inbound leads You’ll research companies and approach potential customers through a targeted selling strategy encompassing calling, email, social engagement, and events You’ll articulate and evangelize The Muse’s value proposition to decision-makers across multiple industry verticals You’ll drive revenue by setting sales meetings for Account Executives You’ll collaborate with our Marketing team on lead gen for events You’ll leverage a robust sales tech stack including Salesforce, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Apollo.io, Chorus, and ZoomInfo  Why we’ll love you You have 1-3 years of professional experience with time spent in a sales, recruiting, or lead gen role. If you are a recent grad, please make your 1+ years of sales experience clear in your resume or cover letter to be considered You’re passionate about a career in sales  You’re extremely competitive and have an insatiable hunger to win You’re naturally curious and have a strong desire to learn about the sales process, the people and companies you’re prospecting, The Muse business and products, and the employer branding and recruitment technology space You embrace aggressive goals and work hard to achieve them You’re not easily discouraged and always maintain a positive attitude You’re passionate about testing, measuring, and improving outreach effectiveness You enjoy being part of a team and doing whatever it takes to help that team succeed  Why you’ll love us You’ll work at a tech company founded by two badass women—Our founders believe transparency is important so they really try to share as much as they can about changes to The Muse strategy, board meetings, and when they are wrestling with big company-wide decisions The Muse actually has—and sticks to—a “no assholes” policy, so you can come to work everyday knowing you will always be surrounded by good people who genuinely care about you We invest in growing our people—personally and professionally We offer unlimited vacation—and we mean it!
industries: Internet

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges!  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology!  The Sr Sales Executive is responsible for driving Honeywell solutions with both new and existing customers in the healthcare vertical.  Maintaining an active and full sales funnel, the Sr Sales Executive calls on all levels of a customer's organization to position solutions and services that solve customer business needs.  The Sr Sales Executive will be responsible for developing and maintaining a robust funnel of opportunities to provide Honeywell services to align with customer’s business needs and outcomes. Primary focus will be to sell service solutions that help maintain, optimize, and improve building performance.  This role will need to sit in Houston metro; however, will work remotely.  Responsibilities Include Business Relationships: Develop new customer relationships; Calling at all levels, including senior levels, of target customer organizations; engaging early in the customer buying process to discover customer needs HBS can fulfill and/or influence customer specification prior to bid. Sales Process: Continuously identifies new sales opportunities and focuses on providing consultative support by building value propositions for the customer; Manage and build customer contacts, serving as HBS’ ambassador in the market place; Focal point for relationship strategies, sales plans, proposal strategies, and contract negotiations, for pursuits in play. Customers: Engage technical buyers, economic buyers, and relationship buyers; engage customers at all levels in any organization including executive level decision makers; could potentially pursue $1-$10M opportunities; could include competitively advantaged opportunities. Results: Profitable growth and focus on expanding existing customers and securing new customers and new opportunities; Orders and margin above set quota in support of Annual Operating Plan. As an ideal candidate for the Sr Sales Executive role, you’ve successfully demonstrated the following:  Strong Sales Management Operating System (MOS) Developed and implemented strategic Territory Management Plans and individual Account / Opportunity Plans Active and proficient use of CRM System (SFDC) to show pipeline growth and accuracy in forecasting information Proficiency in applying a consultative selling framework to improve customer conversion rate Strong Customer MOS (Management Operating System) with a Bias Toward Customer Satisfaction: Demonstrated ability to manage a portfolio of assigned customer accounts ranging from $2-5M Demonstrated ability to win new customers in assigned region or vertical Ability to establish a cadence of regular meetings with customer’s key stakeholders Capability to uncover qualified opportunities to support customer challenges through Honeywell offerings – sourcing opportunities to grow share of wallet Demonstrated ability to foresee and anticipate challenges and act accordingly to minimize impact through regular customer meetings or proactively sourcing feedback through Medallia customer surveys Quota-Achievement: successful track-record of consistently exceeding quota-carrying goals Capable of identifying and targeting new migration and share of wallet opportunities with existing customers by actively co-developing Technology Roadmaps, understanding the customer buying process, co-developing RFPs/RFQs with solution development engineers and proposal team members, managing customer proposals (Budget, and Final Proposals), and negotiating deals to close new business Ability to demonstrate strategic approach to new & existing customers and opportunities through opportunity planning Team Player Acts as a “quarterback” to enhance the Honeywell-to-customer rapport through facilitating deep and wide personal/professional relationships throughout the customer sales cycle and cross-functionally within both organizations Leads customer through their technological journey by understanding customer requirements and developing the appropriate Honeywell support team to address customer needs Be a customer advocate within Honeywell and a Honeywell advocate with your customer YOU MUST HAVE Minimum of 3 years direct selling in the building technology industry (Building automation, fire/life safety, or security etc.) experience Valid Driver’s License WE VALUE Bachelor’s degree Strong background in the Healthcare market with experience selling at the Executive Level Ability to influence across a broader organization Ability to work in a fast-paced, highly matrixed environment Good interpersonal and presentation skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction Additional Information JOB ID: req309261 Category: Sales Location: 13805 West Rd Ste 500,Houston,Texas,77041,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Foot and Ankle Sales Representative-Charlotte, NC
description: Who We Want Hard-working winners. Loyal, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do As a Foot & Ankle Sales Rep, you work with a high degree of intensity and commitment to sell Stryker Foot & Ankle products that meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident Foot & Ankle expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons and healthcare professionals. You live your work, feeding off the extreme demands of Foot & Ankle, not counting hours but rather lives impacted. A person who is energized by chaos, you organize your materials and sort possible solutions quickly during operating room consultations. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with surgeons. They trust you to provide advice and training on products and tools used to save lives. As a Foot & Ankle Sales Rep you love driving in the fast lane and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. What You Need Bachelor's Degree or 4+ years experience in a clinical healthcare or sales role (or a combination of the two) 3+ years of Sales Experience Preferred Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services, including marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems Excellent organizational skills and knowledge in the use of current office technologies (MSOffice suite, databases, etc.) Experience in building and maintaining relationships (with surgeons & hospitals in respective areas would be beneficial) Must be comfortable in emergency/operating room environments Ability to participate in and attend sales meetings and professional association meetings outside regular business hours, as required Must adhere to compliance and the principles of responsibility (AdvaMed) by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information, protecting the assets of the organization, acting with ethics and integrity, reporting non-compliance, and adhering to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, accreditation and licenser requirements, and Company’s policies and procedures What We Offer A winning team motivated to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

description: Our Natural and Insurgent (N&I) Category is one of the largest of its kind in the industry, with brands that have a shared mission to promote health, wellness and nutrition. We create real foods from great ingredients made by incredible people. If you believe that food should do more, that it has the power to create positive change in ourselves and the world around us, and if you possess an entrepreneurial spirit, servant mindset and like to win…we want to hear from you!  As an Account Executive, you will use your stellar sales and planning experience to manage the relationship and uncover unique opportunities to deliver incremental volume nationally. We are looking for top talent in Chicago, IL but will consider individuals in other remote US locations near a major airport location. Customer accounts include natural independents to include PCC, MOM’s Organic Market, Vitamin Cottage, Mothers, Lassens as well as other key accounts. On our team, we focus on great relationships – both with each other and our customers. With an owner's mindset, you will work with the broker team to deliver market-leading customer plans and growth strategies, while managing trade dollars within assigned budgets, to execute customer specific trade plans. We are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial mindset.  Here's a Taste Of What You'll Be Doing Make A Whole Lotta Strategic Decisions - You'll consider immediate and long-term implications, benefits, costs and risks associated with alternatives to create, implement and monitor the success of a business plan. Lead Sales Efforts - You'll promote a customer-centered culture that strives to exceed customer needs, requirements and expectations. We're hoping you can take a new angle on what otherwise might be ordinary. Ensure Accuracy - Help us bring the best to families. You'll reinforce our passion for the future, with the practical steps to get there. You will play a key role in maintaining integrity, and timeliness of operating budgets. Broker Management – Win with our broker partners by providing strategic direction around promotional strategy, retail priorities, assortment and execution to Natural Specialty Sales / Acosta Business Managers. Budget Management – You will be responsible for m anaging deductions as well as trade dollars within your assigned budgets to drive profitability and deliver customer specific trade plans. YOUR RECIPE FOR SUCCESS  Required Significant related experience Ability to develop, present, and execute customer plans Ability to understand market dynamics, forecast results, and analyze and interpret syndicated data (i.e. SPINS, IRI, etc). Strong understanding of trade strategy, retail operation, and negotiation skills Effective written and oral communication, and a track record of Sales success Proficiency in Microsoft office applications (i.e. Excel, Power Point, Word, Outlook). Belief in the power of food to make a positive change in people and the world around us Entrepreneurial spirit, humility, a servant mindset and a passion for winning Motor vehicle history with 2 or less moving violations within the last 36 months Bonus Points BA/BS Degree Experience calling on buyers and category managers at the headquarters level Broker management experience Experience managing trade dollars within assigned budgets Intrinsic enthusiasm for natural foods, natural/organic lifestyle and nutrition What’s Next  The ideal candidate will reside in the Chicago, IL area but there is flexibility for individuals in other US locations near a major airport. A flexible work schedule and the ability to overnight travel up to 25%-35% of the time but may vary depending on location of residence. It’s best to apply today, because job postings can be taken down and we wouldn’t want you to miss this opportunity. Kellogg K-Values New Hire Benefits Guide THE FINER PRINT  The ability to work a full shift, come to work on time, work overtime as needed and the ability to work according to the necessary schedule to meet job requirements with or without reasonable accommodation is an essential function of this position.  We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Where required by state law and/or city ordinance; this employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For additional information, please follow this Link for English or this Link for Spanish.  Kellogg’s Natural and Insurgent Category is a collection of delicious, and wholesome brands, and our belief is that business can be a positive force for good. We incubate and scale wellness trends and our dream is to make it possible for people everywhere to embrace natural healthy living Our dynamic portfolio of brands includes Kashi, Bear Naked, Pure Organic, RXBAR, joybol, and Leaf Jerky . Behind these brands, we have products in ten grocery categories. We love ingredients, taste and the undeniable fact that good food makes you feel, well, good. And that fuels our relentless desire to make a difference in everything we do.  If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, please reach out to ApplicationAssistance@kellogg.com .  LET’S CREATE THE FUTURE OF FOOD  Kellogg Recruitment

description: About The Job  As a Business Development Representative (BDR) Manager at Opal, you’ll join a smart, gritty, and passionate team of value-and customer-focused players. The BDR Manager will build, scale, manage, and coach our BDR team while simultaneously building out the outbound BDR system and strategy.  The BDR Manager is responsible for ensuring that the team hits its monthly goals, training them to be effective sales people, while also launching experiments to further optimize the team's processes and efforts.  The BDR Manager dives into the data to form their own perspectives on what Opal needs to test and scale in order to hit our sales numbers. They then own, launch, and analyze those tests to achieve success.  About You  Your background and experience include a combination of sales, and operations. You have experience building high velocity sales teams and managing them to achieve amazing results.  You also take pride in being a player-coach, in that you can also help the team on the ground while mentoring the team.  About Opal  Opal is the planning platform that connects strategy to execution. Marketing and communications teams working together in Opal get the visibility they need to stay aligned and collaborate efficiently. Visit workwithopal.com to learn why Opal is used by teams everywhere including Starbucks, Target, Minted, General Motors, T-Mobile and Zillow.  Requirements  Responsibilities Ensure the team BDRs achieve monthly/quarterly quotas on first meetings, pipeline growth and revenue attainment. Hire, train and mentor new BDRs. Work jointly with sales leadership to strategize, build their pipelines, and achieve goals. Ensure that BDR processes are executed consistently and improve continuously. Track team metrics with periodical reviews, keep records and generate reports on all phases of activities. Motivate your team to meet and exceed quotas and objectives. Coach, develop, and train your team members. Manage the growing BDR team with a metrics-based approach, relying heavily on data to inspire, iterate, and educate inside and outside the team. Constantly innovative our outbound approaches  Performance Metrics:  As a performance driven organization, we look to root all things in data. It helps us understand where we are succeeding, and where we need to improve. Some of the metrics we’ll focus on: Opportunities Created Opportunities Qualified Pipeline Created BDR attributed Closed Won Pipeline Requirements  Skills, Experience, Knowledge: A proven track record of exceeding targets in sales, with 1-2 years experience leading a team. Drive to progress personal career goals and is excited for the opportunity to make a significant impact. Passion for creating a positive culture. A high EQ and the ability to connect with team members. Data driven decision making The ability to motivate and lead. A high level of creativity and proficiency in tailored outreach. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Natural alignment with Opal’s Values: Professional, Intentional, Steadfast, Helpful, Creative, Passionate, and Empathetic.  Preferred Experience: Experience in working with/on marketing teams. Deep understanding of marketing functions. Education Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience preferred; advanced degree in a related field a plus.  Education: Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience preferred; advanced degree in a related field a plus.  Benefits  Some benefits our team members enjoy include: Competitive, market-leading compensation package, including stock options 100% company-paid Medical/Rx, Dental, and Vision Insurance for individuals (plus company-subsidized dependent coverage) Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) for Health, Dependent Care, Commuter, Parking Company-paid Life/AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance Pet Insurance for your furry friend Flexible Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Paid Parental Leave & Back-to-Work Program 401(k) and Roth Retirement Plans Company-sponsored outreach & activity programs  Opal is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment. We believe a diverse workplace promotes innovation and enhances decision making. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will consider all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age, or veteran status.

description: Callaway Golf Company is a leader in total performance, premium golf equipment and active lifestyle products while also being a great place to work! We are passionate and push the limits of innovation. We dare to be great while acting with integrity and respect. We stay hungry, yet humble. All while having fun and making golf enjoyable for everyone!  Our company is a blend of experience and diverse backgrounds, and our leaders have a strong history of building and selling successful initiatives. We are working to build a truly groundbreaking company, and we want top-notch people to join us in that mission.  JOB OVERVIEW In support of the business operations this position is responsible for coordinating the setup and maintenance of various sales initiatives throughout a product’s life cycle, including pricing, new product launches, consumer promotions and compensation. Acts as project manager for each sales initiative, ensuring all execution steps are completed on time, accurately and within scope.  ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Works with Sr. Pricing Analyst, Master Data and Sales Operations teams to setup and update pricing in the system Maintains net pricing master for all customers, including SMU offerings Updates the Wholesale Price List & Policy and coordinates email to customer database Resolves discrepancies between pricing in our system versus our customers Continuously monitors orders to ensure customers are receiving the correct benefits (pricing, discounts, terms, free freight, etc.) according to the customer agreements/programs Routes and maintains online Price Exception Form for required approvals Participates in and prepares for pricing strategy meetings Works with various departments to compile information that our customers need to setup new products in their systems Maintains portal site that hosts setup information for sales reps and customers to access Completes customer specific setup sheets Works with Sales Operations team to ensure Order Tool is updated with latest product offerings and order types Fields sales rep’s questions and/or issues regarding Order Tool. Works with IT team to troubleshoot and resolve Order Tool issues Maintains Master Calendar with all current and upcoming product launches, pricing changes, consumer promotions, sales programs and end-of life Tracks all National Account/Regional Strategic COOP budgets, accruals and compensation Communicates and executes all netdown and promotional compensation Maintains and enhances databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality Refreshes and distributes reoccurring reporting Inputs and indexes data for revenue forecast and Business Objects queries Develop ad-hoc reporting/analyses as needed  TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities) Advanced to expert Microsoft Excel experience which includes building spreadsheets and working with formulas. Ability to use systems and tools to pull, organize and interpret data Ability to function in a continuously changing environment and adept at functioning effectively under high volumes of work and deadlines Strong project management, organizational and multi-tasking skills Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to interface with all levels of the organization Highly skilled at solving problems and thinking creatively or “out of the box”. Critical attention to detail Self-starter that is proactive and takes the initiative to start and complete assignments without direct supervision Able to maintain confidentiality and work with sensitive information Previous experience working with Business Objects and SAP preferred Ability to learn new concepts quickly and put them into action  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree from four-year College or university Minimum 2 years related work experience Project management experience required Systems and reporting experience required  Callaway Golf is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers. Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new clients within your assigned sales territory through virtual/on-site client meetings, presentations, site visits, and client engagement events. Haines City, FL, USA  Req #4517  Monday, December 21, 2020  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees.  As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida.  **Sales Account Manager**  The Sales Account Manager (** SAM) is responsible for business development and customer relationships. The SAM increases business by selling additional brands and packages within his or her sales territory's existing customer base. The Sales Account Manager at CCBF works across all sales channels. sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance  â€¢Review business results with customers  **â€¢**  Ensure company assets meet performance requirements and develop a plan of action for those assets generating zero or low volume  â€¢ Ensure outlets comply with CCBF standards  â€¢ Communicate account activities to appropriate parties  â€¢ Merchandising and rotation inspection  â€¢ Resolve customer inquiries, including researching and closing customer service tickets  â€¢ Transport, replace and maintain Point of Sale advertising as appropriate for account  â€¢ Maintain regular and punctual attendance  â€¢ Work overtime as assigned  â€¢ Comply with all company policies, procedures and applicable laws  â€¢ Identifying and reporting any unsafe working conditions  â€¢ Comply with dress code or appearance/grooming standards  â€¢ Work shifts and work schedules as assigned  **Role Requirements**  â€¢ High School Diploma or equivalent, Bachelor degree preferred  â€¢ Must be 18 years of age or older  â€¢ 1+ years of general work experience  â€¢ 1+ years previous sales experience preferred  Â€¢ Food/beverage Industry Experience Preferred  â€¢ Ability to create and conduct sales presentations  â€¢ Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills  â€¢ Excellent planning and organization skills  â€¢ Proficient in computer application skills  â€¢ Ability to use and understand mobile applications  â€¢ Ability to work variable schedule, weekends and holidays  â€¢ Must have and maintain a valid driver's license  â€¢ Must have and maintain current vehicle liability insurance, as specified by company  â€¢ Must have a driving record with no major moving violations in the last three (3) years*  â€¢ Must provide and maintain a personal vehicle for use during employee working hours  â€¢ Frequent lifting of 25+ pounds.
