description: Construction is a $13 Trillion global industry and yet, it’s one of the least digitized. Our mission puts us at the forefront of a movement driven by former construction professionals looking to modernize how the world builds, fueled by rapidly increasing venture investment.   StructionSite is bringing the same computer vision and mapping technologies found in self-driving cars to the construction technology space. Our software allows project teams to communicate in the context of the jobsite anytime, from anywhere. As the only founding team in our space with actual construction experience, we understand our customers on a deep personal level. Builders want to build, not spend time tracking their work, so our software gives them superpowers to automatically capture and track their progress. The data we provide on the back end allows our customers to perform at a higher level and gives them a competitive edge to win their next project.  We’re a team of engineers, salespeople, product managers, marketers, designers, operators, and evangelists. We value learning, humility, and ownership of our domains above all else and we’re looking for teammates who have the same appetite for growth, grit, and determination. If this sounds like you, we’d love for you to come build with us!   StructionSite is looking for a curious, positive, high-energy, goal-oriented Sales Development Representative to source prospective accounts through extensive research, and outbound strategies in companies ranging from $100 million to $1 billion+ in annual revenue. Tenacity and grit are some of your stronger qualities. This is your chance to make a significant impact at a fast-growing construction technology startup full of fun and driven teammates!  This means that every day, you will: Engage with Construction professionals in target accounts through cold calling, emails, and social outreach to identify challenges solved by our products Prospect, research, and create plan for outreach to target personas Use LinkedIn, Salesforce, Outreach, Zoominfo, and Gong to drive sales success Have a primary focus on outbound effort to schedule meetings for our Account Executives with key individual(s) on accounts Leverage information you learn to build on Enterprise clients that start at and exceed $100MM in annual revenue Be hungry to learn and become expert in SaaS sales, construction, our products, and internal technology/systems  Our experience shows that to be successful in this position, you’ll need to hit these daily and weekly targets: 200 calls a week, in addition to prospecting efforts including but not limited to: emails, research, and contact prospecting to hit quota objectives Maintain a 99% no-defect rate on emails, grammar, and Outreach campaigns Adhere to all “no-spam” requirements as required by state, national and international law  What you have:  Construction experience and/or SaaS experience You absolutely LOVE the problem we’re solving for our customers and feel you're ready to contribute to achieving our mission and vision as a key member of our team You have a positive attitude and love to learn An ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines in a dynamic, ever-changing environment An urge to reach out and make new friends with strong social and interpersonal skills A preference for asking questions and listening to answers before you speak and a desire to tackle problems 6 months sales experience preferred   Life @ Structionsite StructionSite is a remote-first company and we respect your whole life. Here are some of the ways we support our team: Generous equity package and competitive salary Remote workspace setup allowance Unlimited PTO 401k Match Medical, Dental, and Vision for full-time employees in the US   StructionSite is a proud equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome everyone regardless of their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or genetics, and we are dedicated to providing an inclusive, open, and dimensional work environment.
industries: Construction and Computer Software

jobTitle: Sales Representative - North Colorado - Patient Resuscitation and Treatment
description: Patient Resuscitation and Treatment Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives with an unparalleled work ethic to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do As an Patient Resuscitation and Treatment (PRT) Sales Representative, you work strategically to promote and sell Stryker PRT products to meet our customers’ needs. You will achieve your assigned quota by taking a consultative approach to Hospital sales, marketing, and clinical demonstrations of all related products and programs. You are responsible for becoming the resident PRT expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of nurses, medical directors, and administrators. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with your customers. You focus on customer satisfaction by demonstrating teamwork and empowerment, solving problems, operating with honesty and integrity and providing a highly responsive and unsurpassed level of customer service. You contribute to leading in product innovation by listening and working with others and contributing new ideas. You strive for operational excellence by promoting a team based, product-focused organization, contributing to continuous improvement, participating in preventative maintenance and safety programs. You are committed to operational excellence, reporting customer complaints, participating in preventative maintenance and safety programs and committing to on time and error free shipments. As a PRT Sales Representative, you live out your mission to save and change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. What You Need Bachelor’s degree required. 2+ years of sales or relevant experience. Strong inter-personal communication skills specifically relating to stress management, people management and conflict management. Excellent time management, project management, and customer service skills. Knowledge of marketing, market research, new product development, new product introduction, P/L management, and field testing. Must possess valid driver license in the state of residence and a good driving record. What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results. Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients. Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career. About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - San Diego - ENT
description: Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As an ENT Associate Sales Representative, you assist in strategically promoting and selling Stryker ENT products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and Sales Representative(s) you are supporting to push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As an ENT Associate Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. As an Associate Sales Representative you may be asked to cover open territories, which will give you the opportunity to grow in your responsibilities.  What You Need Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University 1-2 years in medical device or B2B sales preferred What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In February 2019, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that for the ninth consecutive year has been named as one of the 2018 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For ranking 11 out of 100. Some of our other awards from 2018 include Great Places to Work for Inclusion, Women, Millennials, and Diversity.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn more about the ENT Products: https://ent.stryker.com/  Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better

jobTitle: Diabetes Sales Specialist - North Atlanta, GA
description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  At Abbott, we believe people with Diabetes should have the freedom to enjoy active lives. That’s why we’re focused on helping people with diabetes manage their health more effectively and comfortably, with life-changing products that provide accurate data to drive better-informed decisions. We’re revolutionizing the way people monitor their glucose levels with our new sensing technology.  What You'll Do  Diabetes Sales Specialist: A Unique Opportunity  The Diabetes Sales Specialist is responsible for growing sales with HCPs assigned to the territory by developing customer relationships, being an ambassador for Abbott’s Freestyle products, and strengthening overall market presence. This role is instrumental in delivery of sales and profitability objectives, as well as expanding brand reputation. This is a field-sales opportunity.  Primary Function Meeting or exceeding sales quotas/objectives for ADC Products. Collaborating with various channels, Managed Care, Retail, and Point of Care representatives. Establishing strong relationships with a broad base of internal and external health care constituents (e.g., physicians, nurses, pharmacists, CDEs, etc.). Acting in a friendly, respectful, adaptive manner while focusing on the needs and interests of others. Keeping current on internal and competitive products and positioning by utilizing a variety of resources. Understanding and conveying information professionally and accurately. Effectively planning for and following through with short and long term results based on business trends by developing plans that include goals, action plans, time frames and the appropriate resources. Keeping current in market trends and competitor’s strategy. Engage in sales-focused activities including: Conveying information and ideas clearly and concisely, answering s questions, responding to others, and listening s carefully to understand the needs of providers and patients. Positions products and services using appropriate resources and confident, convincing logic; tailor sales approach to meet customer needs. Utilize and distribute appropriate resources. Handle disagreements and objections by exploring perspectives and tactfully addressing them. Develops and implements plans (e.g., territory, account and call) that include goals, action items, time frames and resources. Regularly tracks and reports progress against plan, redirecting efforts as necessary. Completes all administrative tasks accurately and in a timely fashion. Document daily activity in call reporting / tracking system. Maintain accountability for all samples in accordance with Division guidelines. Work within quality guidelines established for compliance. Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system. Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management Required  Experience You'll Bring Bachelors Degree, or equivalent experience, required. Minimum of 3-5 years previous experience with commendable sales track record from previous positions preferable in health care industry. Excellent communication skills, high energy, integrity and ambition to succeed. Preferred A strong preference given to candidates with 4+ years of relevant experience. Diabetes clinical knowledge This position may be hired at different levels depending on the experience of the candidate.  What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully:  www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

description: Title of role: Associate Regional Sales Manager, UNFI Conventional  Remote: US, Southern CA region  Background & Purpose of the Job  The Associate Regional Sales Manager (RSM) will work to execute Unilever Strategies and Merchandising objectives at UNFI Headquarters and Key Southern California Retailers through 3rd Party Sales Agents (Advantage Sales & Marketing; ASM”). This person will work in concert with ASM’s Business Development Managers and sales force to accomplish Unilever’s business objectives.  The Regional Sales Manager will develop sustained business relationships with both accounts and brokers in order to drive profitable sales volumes by developing a plan using key performance measures. The RSM will initiate the development and growth of the Unilever brands across UNFI Conventional retailers as well has serve as a ‘brand ambassador’.  The RSM actively reviews the competitive environment and works internally, with the UNFI, and with ASM to adjust promotional plans where appropriate and prepare recommendations as needed for Unilever.  Who You Are & What You’ll Do Manage and coordinate ASM resources to maximize effectiveness of assigned market objectives through Account Executives, Marketing, Retail Group, Administrators, and Broker senior management. Delegate work to ASMs, BDMs, CDMs, and Administrators where appropriate Identify opportunities and risks within the market in support of channel and corporate business objectives. Drive trade investment efficiencies while ensuring corporate goals are delivered, broker investment is maximized, and customer strategies are met.  Communicate opportunities, risks, and recommendations to management and internally. Manage and coordinate Unilever resources to maximize effectiveness on assigned market performance to include Trade Marketing, Category Management, Consumer Insight, Supply Chain and Shopper Marketing Achieve assigned targets, including volume, spend, profitability, and appropriate KPI’s as applicable.  Engage in joint business planning with the BDMs to develop a winning customer engagement Craft and deliver winning sales stories to our retailers in support of achieving KPI’s. Strong understanding of our story, mission, products, and our point of difference.  Educate broker partners and retailers to drive sales and create advocates for our brands.  Guide ASM Partners on delivering spending efficiencies (ROI), strategies to managing spend within a Region, and AMPS Plan reconciliation as well as ensure all resources are available to the ASM Partners Develop Strategic Relationships with key accounts and broker partners to accelerate growth, while operating within approved Trade Marketing parameters, and driving trade investment effectiveness and efficiency Routinely interface and work effectively with multiple internal departments/personnel, plus senior level, and customer personnel. What You’ll Need To Succeed Bachelor's degree is required 3-5 years Customer Management/Broker Management experience. Experience managing 3rd parties, Retail Store operations, HQ. Sales Experience, and Team Leadership Skills Understanding of the Wholesale Network and experience with UNFI Excellent communication and follow up skills Must be able to manage through 3rd parties and delegate responsibly Business Planning and Implementation Strong interpersonal skills.  Be able to communicate throughout Unilever and ASM organization. Contribution to Company Strategy & Innovation Consumer /Shopper Understanding What We Can Offer You  Culture for Growth | Top Notch Employee Health & Well Being Benefits | Every Voice Matters | Global Reach | Life at Unilever | Careers with Purpose | World Class Career Development Programs | Check Out Our Space | Focus On Sustainability  Unilever is an organization committed to diversity and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future every day for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics by federal, state, or local law. For more information, please see Equal Employment Opportunity Posters  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Persons with Disabilities  Employment is subject to verification of pre-screening tests, which may include drug screening, background check, credit check and DMV check.  If you are an individual with a disability in need of assistance at any time during our recruitment process, please contact us at NA.Accommodations@unilever.com. jobTitle: Inside Sales Advisor - (Call Center) - Las Vegas (8p-5am shift)
description: This role is 8p-5a with availability needed 7 days a week.  The role of the Inside Sales Advisor is to educate, inspire and skillfully guide Tesla’s potential customers through the vehicle purchase and configuration process. Inside Sales Advisors have the incredible opportunity to advise potential Tesla customers from all over North America, while honing their abilities in lead qualification.  We expect members of this team to become experts in our products and the direct-from-manufacturer sales model that has made Tesla an innovator in the automotive industry.  The ideal candidate will possess exceptional interpersonal communication skills, unshakeable moral fortitude, and a strong awareness of professional behavior when supporting customers.  Responsibilities Communicate with current and prospective customers via chat, email and SMS to nurture and prepare them for a vehicle purchase. Receive inbound leads to assess the prospect's needs, qualify the opportunity, and schedule the test drive experience. Use a consultative approach to influence customer purchase while also aiding buy in to the mission, business model, and Tesla brand. Develop and maintain a sales pipeline achieving both personal and group monthly metrics in conjunction with the field Sales teams. Provide feedback and recommendations based on direct experiences with potential customers. Maintain customer relationships from the initial interaction up until delivery day. Qualifications 1-3 years’ of Inside Sales experience or Bachelor’s degree preferred Evidence of exceptional ability Strong relationship management skills and the ability to explain complex technical concepts Proven track record to meet or exceed targets and goals Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills, grammatical genius Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office, internet navigation, CRM applications) Valid US Driver’s License and/or State ID and ability to obtain DMV Salesperson’s License Employee Benefits As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents. Kaiser and UnitedHealthcare PPO and HSA plans (including infertility coverage) 3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage) Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits Employee Assistance Program, Paid Time Off, and Paid Holidays Back-up childcare and employee discounts

description: Cocoa Beach, FL 32931, USA ? Merritt Island, FL, USA ? Port Canaveral, FL 32920, USA  Req #4906  Tuesday, January 26, 2021  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees.  As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida.  **Sales Account Manager**  The Sales Account Manager (** SAM) is responsible for business development and customer relationships. The SAM increases business by selling additional brands and packages within his or her sales territory's existing customer base. description: Job Location: Boston, MA  This position can also be based in eastern New England  Summary  The Customer Sales Executive (CSE) is responsible for profitably growing Hershey’s Demoulas and Roche Bros. business to achieve objectives and plans, including net sales, market share, trade spend, and sales activity margin. Responsibilities include business planning & analysis, creating valued business partnerships with customers by becoming a business advisor, and achieving mutually beneficial agreements through skilled negotiation and understanding of the customers business. The CSE will also leverage insights to build a 1-to-3-year business plan and deploy supporting tactics to achieve financial objectives.  Responsibilities Achieve net sales, market share, trade spend, and sales activity margin targets for assigned customer(s) by simulating and planning incremental volume and pre and post analysis as well as displaying core competencies and behaviors. This includes judiciously managing and allocating trade funds (maintaining compliance with all Sarbanes Oxley policies) to achieve profitable sales growth. Effectively utilize Hershey’s analytical tools (e.g. PlanEx, Unify, Trade Point, etc.) and processes to drive profitable and predictable sales results. Build and maintain appropriate sales plans in PlanEx. Manage trade fund budget to include clearing deductions. Monitor and control customer expenses to include WASTE and supply chain costs. Provide category analysis and consumer insights to customers as well as other category tools/consultation with Category Management partnership. Develop and provide resources and tools to the retail team. Achieve appropriate levels of account penetration. Alignment with retail team through participation in retail meetings as well as field visits with appropriate Retail management. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree strongly preferred. Experience: At least 3-5 years relevant sales experience. The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veterans  If you require a reasonable accommodation as part of the application process, please contact the HR Service Center (askhr@hersheys.com).
industries: Food & Beverages, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: At Dooly, we create human experiences for work  Revenue teams at top Cloud 100 companies like Asana and Intercom use Dooly to capture and amplify the outcomes of their meetings. Because we build Dooly with the end-user in mind, users tell us they couldn’t live without it. With our recently announced Series B funding, we're investing in our team and building the next generation of our product.  We’re looking for a remote North American based Account Executive to join our rapidly expanding sales organization. We are in the early stages of building our sales team so we are looking for people who have a track record of closing in a fast paced growing startup. You will have the opportunity to build and shape the sales team during this exciting phase of growth.  You Will Manage the full sales cycle Deliver engaged demos of Dooly to prospects based on their needs and priorities Research to understand customer goals, plans, challenges, timeline, budget, and authority Have a focus on new logo acquisition through inbound and outbound efforts Strategically map and break into named accounts  You Are Open, honest and take a consultative approach to sales A sales rep that has carried a new business quota for a minimum of 2 years Someone that strives to continuously improve your sales process and demonstrate a willingness to learn and implement best practices A rep that has experience selling both short and long sales cycles A sales rep that has a proven track record of managing complex deals from start to finish If all this sounds like you, please apply with a resume and a short note telling us why you'd be great for this role.  We encourage you to apply  At Dooly, we value you, your well-being, and having fun.  We value the differences of our team members, and we encourage everyone to apply - especially those whose identities are underrepresented in tech. We know that the more diverse the perspectives, experiences, and talent of our Dooligans, the better we’ll be. We respect and celebrate how you identify, who you do or don’t worship, your pronouns, the color of your skin, your age (on paper and at heart), your sexual orientation, your culture and background, and if you have a disability or are a veteran. If you require accommodations in the hiring process please reach out to talent@dooly.ai.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Associate  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Committed, loyal and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. Honest people who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do You will get exposure to the proven winning Stryker Trauma culture that delivers Industry leading results in all market segments You will receive best-in-class formal Trauma training on product portfolio and selling skills which includes on-the-job training in the operating room. You’ll become an expert on surgical procedures by observing well-over 300 cases in your first year You will develop well-rounded field exposure to prepare you in all aspects of the selling/ servicing process when a territory opportunity arises You will develop a high level of competency in Orthopaedic surgical needs and procedures becoming a valuable member of the surgical team and positively impacting surgical outcomes You will build a strong brand in account management and client service – key drivers in our business! You will work in a highly competitive and challenging work environment that will put your best talents to work every single day What You Need To be successful in this role bring your strong multitasking ability, ability to read and sell to any audience, drive to achieve and succeed, aptitude to learn medical and technical information quickly, ability to build strong, lasting relationships, a strong work-ethic and a competitive nature Bachelor’s Degree required 1+ years of sales experience preferred Come ready to make a difference…fast! What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Medical Devices

description: DESCRIPTION  At quip, we design and deliver delightful products and services that keep your mouth healthy.  We are seeking a Strategic Account Manager to drive efforts to grow our dental provider-facing sales channel. You will prospect and close inbound and outbound leads in order to grow the brand in the dental professional channel. In a start-up environment , being comfortable with a fast rate of change and growth is vital. In this role, you will have a direct impact on growing the business by improving processes and tools, overall elevating the dental partner experience.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Proactively seek new business opportunities within assigned territory Responsible for calling on midsize & enterprise accounts Build strong client relationships with existing provider accounts to drive recurring orders and mitigate attrition Provide exemplary service to maintain our growing book of providers Accountable for select sales activity to convert prospective dental practices and DSO organizations to quip products and services Identify revenue opportunities and close new business in order to grow our book of providers Engage in continuous follow up and outreach to our provider base; build outreach cadences to automate communication flow with both existing accounts and new business Maintain knowledge of industry trends, market opportunities & current events pertaining to the dental space Contribute to the ongoing development of all of quip’s provider facing / focused initiatives, including cross-functional work with internal teams  REQUIREMENTS  Bachelor's degree 5+ years of B2B sales experience. Dental, medical, or healthcare sales a plus 3+ years working with a CRM, preferably Salesforce A desire to make a direct and tangible impact on a rapidly growing company Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  BENEFITS  You'll be working in a high energy, fast-paced environment helping us make oral care simple and effective! An office located in the heart of DUMBO with breathtaking views of Manhattan Bridge Competitive health and dental benefits Commuter benefits for parking & transit Offer competitive paid parental leave policy for qualifying employees Flexible work from home options Open vacation policy Dog-friendly office space 401k Contribution Extended Education Assistance Employee Referral Program Competitive compensation package with stock options at a high-growth startup Fully stocked kitchen with snacks (make sure to use your quip after snacking!) Your very own quip with an unlimited subscription plan The opportunity to help us make oral care more simple, effective and accessible!  ABOUT quip  Most of us aren’t brushing our teeth correctly, either because we don’t know how to do it right, or because we just don’t feel like it. At quip, we design delightful products and experiences to help you care for your mouth better. Our initial product is a beautifully simple electric toothbrush and toothpaste that was featured by Time Magazine as one of the 25 Best Inventions of 2016. With refill brush heads and toothpaste arriving on a 3-monthly schedule. We pride ourselves on great design and our brand values of simplicity, honesty, and accessibility, which are applied throughout our community. We are excited to apply these principles to the acceleration of our digital patient-professional advice and services platform.  quip is committed to promoting equality, inclusion, and diversity beyond your brushing routine. We believe our company is better equipped to care for every mouth when we listen to fresh perspectives from every voice, and in doing so, we build an equal-opportunity team of the brightest minds (and mouths)—regardless of race, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, identity, or any other trait that makes you you. By celebrating and supporting our differences, we will thrive in our mission to improve oral health for all.
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness

description: Mission for Compliance SaaS Account Executive As a SaaS Compliance Account Executive, the ideal candidate will utilize the sales methodologies outlined in the Challenger Sales model to teach, tailor, and take control of all opportunities. Through our 10 Elements of Compliance, you will teach new customers in the Healthcare space (Health Systems, Hospitals, facilities) the importance of having Healthicity’ s Compliance and Audit Manager software (SaaS) in order to help them manage their compliance and auditing programs, then help tailor our solutions to solve clients’ unique challenges, then take control of all opportunities and see them through to the close by helping them understand the consequences of inaction.  Principal Responsibilities, Essential Duties and Outcomes:   Close New Client Deals Successfully sell healthcare compliance, auditing, and training SaaS - software and services to new opportunities (Long Term Care, Skilled Nursing Facilities, Hospice etc.) Consistently deliver on performance quotas associated with developing, nurturing, and closing leads Effectively deliver sales presentations (including software demos) to senior leadership of mid- and enterprise-level Long Term Care, Skilled Nursing Facilities, Hospice organizations etc. Continually stay informed of new product and technical upgrades, innovations, and industry trends Deliver quality and tailored demonstrations of Healthicity Software to prospects based on the prospects needs and priorities Continuously improve your sales process and demonstrate a willingness to learn and best practices  Source 50% of your own pipeline Supplement your pipeline by completing lead generating activities including cold calls, emails, and social touches Strategically initiate account-based outreach plans to targeted accounts for additional opportunities Tactically conduct account research to assist in Account-based Marketing (ABM) strategies We expect that 50% of your pipeline will come from our inbound marketing and SDR efforts  Embrace the subject matter of Healthcare Compliance Research the market to understand the ever-changing world of Healthcare Compliance Attend Healthicity webinars to better understand your customer and the industry Be an active learner in all areas of Healthcare Compliance to become a pseudo Subject Matter Expert (SME) Stay current with new government regulations and guidance around Healthcare Compliance  Qualified Candidates Possess Bachelor’s degree in related field (Equivalent practical experience will be considered in lieu of degree) 5+ years working in the healthcare compliance industry, or related field 5+ years of consultative sales experience and account management, including SaaS sales Willingness to travel 10-20% Significant business relationships/contacts with executives in areas of healthcare organizations, health systems and hospitla such as compliance, revenue cycle, auditing, coding, billing, etc. A self-driven, highly motivated, results-oriented work ethic The ability to think creatively and solve problems quickly Proven prospecting and sales cycle management skills Minimum of 3+ plus years working in Salesforce.com or other CRM application Practical working experience with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Sales Engagement (Outreach, Salesforce.com etc.) software Excellent oral and written communication skills Strong planning, organization, time management and analytical skills

Regional Sales Manager  Street Smart is a medium sized business headquartered in Lino Lakes, MN. For over 20 years Street Smart has played an important part in keeping the roadways of North America safe! We specialize in renting and selling innovative highway safety equipment across the country. Due to our continued growth, we are seeking a highly-motivated individual to join our team as the Regional Sales Manager. The ideal candidate must have: A minimum of 3 years B2B sales experience (resumes will not be considered without this)  In addition to the above, the ideal candidate should have: Experience within transportation, road construction, traffic safety, or intelligent transportation is strongly desired but not required Ability to develop and deliver product presentations to large groups Strong interpersonal and communication skills Computer skills and proficiency, especially with Microsoft Office products Visibility requires maintaining a professional appearance and providing a positive company image to the public Requires the possession of a valid state driver’s license Ability to deadlift at least 50lbs; capable of climbing ladders to repair equipment as well as maneuvering in and around heavy equipment without issue Bachelor’s degree is preferred; relevant work experience may be a substitute  In addition to working with an industry-leading team, a few of the benefits to working at Street Smart include:  Career advancement opportunities Individual and company incentive plan Company-matched 401(k) retirement savings Health, dental, life insurance Generous PTO Informal dress code Laptop, cell phone, company truck  What we Value: At Street Smart we are passionate about exceeding expectations (while having fun). We value Positivity (people that enjoy working and having fun), Innovation (people that are continuously improving), Reputation (integrity in everything we do), Teamwork (people that are committed and reliable) and Winning (people driven by hard work, and the hunger to do and be great).  Key Responsibilities:  Position is full time with flexible hours. Overnight and out-state travel is required (Expected to be 5-10 days per month). Position is exempt for outside sales. Position reports directly to the Regional Sales Director.  Responsible for all sales and marketing activities within territory. Business is B2B sales to: general contractors, traffic safety contractors, public works departments, cities, counties, state DOT, etc. Develop annual business plan detailing activities to follow during the fiscal year focused on sales and marketing efforts to meet or exceed quota Use company CRM (Salesforce), to develop and manage database of qualified leads Responsible for sourcing and developing customer relationships by using referrals, telephone canvassing, face to face, cold calling, direct mail, email, social media and networking to find new business opportunities Complete daily/weekly sales call activity report Effectively manage on-going customer relations Attend industry trade shows (possibly out of state), and display/ demonstrate products to potential customers Assist in the design and implementation of company marketing and advertising materials On-site and remote group presentations, discussing and demonstrating the products to potential customers Oversees the negotiation of client contracts and work agreements Other duties as assigned  Street Smart Rental, LLC is an equal employment opportunity employer. Street Smart Rental, LLC’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age (40 and over), past or present military service, disability, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Street Smart Rental, LLC also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories.

description: We heard you might be looking for a new opportunity! sunday might be the perfect stop for you. Just in case you haven't heard, sunday is an exciting and thriving FinTech (or FunTech) startup that's changing the way payments are made in restaurants across the world. We are saving millions of people minutes at the end of their meal with the simple scan of a tiny 4x4cm QR code. The coolest thing is we are growing quickly and possibly have the perfect position for you. Account Executive, Restaurants The Account Executive role is a great opportunity to leverage sales skills and abilities in order to expand the number of restaurants that work with Sunday. We are looking for someone who is natural at selling and knows where the best restaurants in all major US markets, has a passion for food and restaurants and enjoys negotiating and building partnerships. Your primary focus will be bringing on new SMB restaurants that fit our partnership criteria and leverage your skills in pitching, negotiating and driving internal processes to set up our partnerships for success. What You’ll Do Leverage prospecting skills and relationships to build partnerships with SMB restaurants interested in Sunday. Rely upon existing relationships and prospecting skills to get meetings with decision makers at target restaurants; conduct meetings over the phone, video or in person, when necessary Manage negotiations and relationships aimed at establishing the foundation of a strong working, mutually beneficial relationship with our restaurant partners. Clearly communicate the value of Sunday and its newest products and projects. Help craft and redesign processes to ensure Sunday can move quickly and succeed at scale. Who We Look For Minimum 3 years of inside and/or field sales experience in high growth company A restaurant centric, consultative approach to sales Excellent written and verbal communication skills Able to work in a fast-paced environment and a team player Up-to-date on the latest restaurant industry trends; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently Possesses excellent interpersonal and customer service skills Able to multitask while efficiently managing priorities Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; knowledge of Salesforce or other programs a plus Experience selling products or services into SMB restaurants a plus What We Offer Competitive salary and stock options Position with full flexibility: full remote, partial or in office 100% health coverage for you and equal parental leave policy A lot of responsibilities and opportunities to grow (also internationally) Steps In Our Recruiting Process Share your story: Application with resume and questions Present your motivation through video recordings Amaze your future colleagues with a case study Meet with people from other departments and understand our culture Let's get to know each other through an in-depth interview with hiring manager Offer: we want you Thank you for taking the time to apply, and looking forward to get to know you!

description: SIGMAXIM is a global company providing productivity solutions and services that enable companies to increase efficiency in their product development process, including engineering configurators for complex products, and add-ons to standardize the usage of CAD. We are looking for a professional with a Sales or Business Development profile. You must be tenacious from identifying a lead to closing the sale. You will work as part of a team and individually with little supervision. The ideal candidate is proactive, self-driven, a proven problem solver and is willing to expand job knowledge and skill set to remain current with product positioning through ongoing training. A strong candidate will not be intimidated by technology or making cold calls, self-motivated and have a positive attitude.  Responsibilities: Contact businesses which meet our technical profile while using our existing database. Own the sales process; while learning our proven sales method by which to prospect a customer, we will train you how to strategize all the way to closure. Build strong relationships and customer loyalty by bringing our solutions to a rapidly changing marketplace Understand complex customer requirements from both a business and technical perspective. Interface with customers for software demonstrations and troubleshooting of client problems. Work with internal staff and technical engineers to define required solutions, provide technical product information and/or schedule demos. Enter key sales activities in the CRM & maintain an accurate sales pipeline in the CRM. Meet established call and sales goals while maintaining a quarterly forecast.  Both full time or part time are possible. We are willing to consider different levels of experience.  Remote Position

** PLEASE ATTACH RESUME ** Syneos Health® is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization. The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration.  Are you passionate about discovering, developing and bringing more innovative medicines to help patients? Idorsia’s purpose is to discover, develop and bring more innovative medicines to help patients. Idorsia is an independent biopharmaceutical company specializing in the development of small molecules to meet significant unmet medical needs. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus.  Job Description: Reporting to the Syneos Health District Manager (DM), the Specialty Sales Representative (SSR) role is responsible for building relationships with recognized experts, HCPs, and prioritized stakeholders in the therapeutic area and integrated health care systems.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required • Minimum 2+ years life science sales experience • Experience in psych / PCP / Sleep Disorders preferred • Experience in retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales • Identify and develop business relationships with targeted Health Care providers • Achieve quarterly and annual sales goals • Identify key influencers and achieve designated customer interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • Understand and address both business and scientific-oriented needs of healthcare professionals by engaging in meaningful dialog to determine underlying patient needs and determine how products could address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • Implement and execute in a compliant manner marketing and sales direction to achieve territory promotional objectives • Communicate effectively with peers and management • Effective in front of the customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain expense and promotional budgets for the territory within guidelines • Must operate within Compliance Guidelines at all times • Adherence to Policies, Process and Procedures  At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality of life balance.  Why Syneos Health? Our employees voted Syneos Health as the overall winner in MedReps’ Best Places To Work In Medical Sales Awards. Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)

description: Job Description  This candidate must drive new business sales and exceed sales targets sold through producer channels and direct opportunities in assigned territory. The territory will include the Mid-Atlantic and Southeast Regions in the United States. The role provides an opportunity to a professional who is eager to join a large healthcare company and exceed goals by finding and developing new business opportunities, cultivating winning relationships, and driving strong results in the global expatriate market.  Fundamental Components & Physical Requirements include but are not limited to: Develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling and market research Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives. Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment(s) being supported. Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna International's full product portfolio. Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities. Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations. May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations. Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends. Required Qualifications 3-5 years of health insurance experience Strong presentation skills Organizational skills managing producer activity and quote volume Preferred Qualifications Licensure as required by state (must obtain within 90 days) Education  Bachelor's Degree or higher is preferred  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

description: Reports To: VP of North American Sales Location: Denver, CO or Phoenix, AZ or California Position Type: Full-time  Who We Are  Founded in 2007, Geoforce is a rapidly growing technology firm (#43 on the 2020 Dallas 100 list for fastest growing DFW tech companies) that provides GPS-based tracking and monitoring of field equipment, vehicles and other assets to over 1,300 companies in 90 countries. Our turnkey solution is delivered via a combination of our award-winning web-based software platform, rugged GPS tracking devices and a global satellite and cellular network. Prominent customers include American Airlines, DHL, and Schlumberger. For more information, please see www.geoforce.com. As a rapidly growing company committed to technology innovation and delivering high value services to its clients, Geoforce is constantly looking for high integrity, well-rounded professionals who thrive on challenges, are fascinated by technology, exhibit passion and pride, and don't mind rolling up their sleeves to get a job done.   What We Need  Geoforce is seeking an experienced Regional Sales Manager to join our US sales organization where you will have the opportunity to work with the leader in the dynamic GPS-based field asset tracking space. This role will demand interaction with medium and large-scale enterprises at senior levels, as well as selling to multiple C-level decision makers. You have a proven ability to establish strong business relationships at the executive level and regional level, conduct compelling sales presentations, set account sales strategies, coordinate multiple resources within an account, and successfully close business. The successful candidate will possess a strong business acumen, ability to build a strong business pipeline, accurately forecast and close business.  Job Duties  Achieve assigned revenue targets by growing, maintaining, and closing a sales pipeline. This role is 75% hunting new business and 25% account management.  Identify new business opportunities proactively and develop account plans to close this business. Supplement incoming leads with proactive prospecting activity to ideal customer profile. Clearly articulate Geoforce’s value proposition and engage the customer in jointly addressing business priorities. Drive and manage the entire sales cycle – from identifying the right business initiatives and building a competitive value proposition to negotiating through close. Comfortably talk to a wide range of decision influencers. Align commercial insights to key customer priorities and tie those insights back to Geoforce’s unique differentiators. Investigate and understand the internal business processes of potential clients. Advocate for the client needs internally by working with a variety of organizations including support, product management, professional services and software/hardware engineering. Grow the account/footprint by becoming a part of the customers’ planning processes and having the customer leverage Geoforce for key technology and solution definition needs.  Knowledge and Skills  You are an innovative seasoned sales professional with a hunter mentality.  Results oriented personality with a sales focus; willingness to have a significant portion of your compensation based on quota incentives (including substantial upside). Eagerness to join a growing technology company and a high aptitude for learning how tracking technology can make field operations more efficient. Ability to prioritize, work with others, and be a team player. Relentless attention to detail and ability to follow a proven system. Consistent top performer. Strong interpersonal and presentational skills (oral and written). Existing competency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Suite of applications (Drive, Docs, Sheets).  Education and Work Experience 5+ years of referenceable experience in Regional Sales  Experience with asset tracking, GIS systems, GPS systems, telematics, or Internet of Things applications a major plus Experience within or serving the following industries is a plus: Oil/Gas, Construction, Heavy Equipment Rental, Transportation/Logistics, Agriculture, Mining Experience with Salesforce.com  Bachelor’s Degree preferred

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges!  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology!  The Sr Sales Executive is responsible for driving Honeywell solutions with both new and existing customers in the healthcare vertical.  Maintaining an active and full sales funnel, the Sr Sales Executive calls on all levels of a customer's organization to position solutions and services that solve customer business needs.  The Sr Sales Executive will be responsible for developing and maintaining a robust funnel of opportunities to provide Honeywell services to align with customer’s business needs and outcomes. Primary focus will be to sell service solutions that help maintain, optimize, and improve building performance.  This role will need to sit in Northern California; however, will work remotely.  Responsibilities Include Business Relationships: Develop new customer relationships; Calling at all levels, including senior levels, of target customer organizations; engaging early in the customer buying process to discover customer needs HBS can fulfill and/or influence customer specification prior to bid. Sales Process: Continuously identifies new sales opportunities and focuses on providing consultative support by building value propositions for the customer; Manage and build customer contacts, serving as HBS’ ambassador in the market place; Focal point for relationship strategies, sales plans, proposal strategies, and contract negotiations, for pursuits in play. Customers: Engage technical buyers, economic buyers, and relationship buyers; engage customers at all levels in any organization including executive level decision makers; could potentially pursue $1-$10M opportunities; could include competitively advantaged opportunities. Results: Profitable growth and focus on expanding existing customers and securing new customers and new opportunities; Orders and margin above set quota in support of Annual Operating Plan. As an ideal candidate for the Sr Sales Executive role, you’ve successfully demonstrated the following:  Strong Sales Management Operating System (MOS) Developed and implemented strategic Territory Management Plans and individual Account / Opportunity Plans Active and proficient use of CRM System (SFDC) to show pipeline growth and accuracy in forecasting information Proficiency in applying a consultative selling framework to improve customer conversion rate Strong Customer MOS (Management Operating System) with a Bias Toward Customer Satisfaction: Demonstrated ability to manage a portfolio of assigned customer accounts ranging from $2-5M Demonstrated ability to win new customers in assigned region or vertical Ability to establish a cadence of regular meetings with customer’s key stakeholders Capability to uncover qualified opportunities to support customer challenges through Honeywell offerings – sourcing opportunities to grow share of wallet Demonstrated ability to foresee and anticipate challenges and act accordingly to minimize impact through regular customer meetings or proactively sourcing feedback through Medallia customer surveys Quota-Achievement: successful track-record of consistently exceeding quota-carrying goals Capable of identifying and targeting new migration and share of wallet opportunities with existing customers by actively co-developing Technology Roadmaps, understanding the customer buying process, co-developing RFPs/RFQs with solution development engineers and proposal team members, managing customer proposals (Budget, and Final Proposals), and negotiating deals to close new business Ability to demonstrate strategic approach to new & existing customers and opportunities through opportunity planning Team Player Acts as a “quarterback” to enhance the Honeywell-to-customer rapport through facilitating deep and wide personal/professional relationships throughout the customer sales cycle and cross-functionally within both organizations Leads customer through their technological journey by understanding customer requirements and developing the appropriate Honeywell support team to address customer needs Be a customer advocate within Honeywell and a Honeywell advocate with your customer YOU MUST HAVE Minimum of 3 years direct selling in the building technology industry (Building automation, fire/life safety, or security etc.) experience Valid Driver’s License WE VALUE Bachelor’s degree Strong background in the Healthcare market with experience selling at the Executive Level Ability to influence across a broader organization Ability to work in a fast-paced, highly matrixed environment Good interpersonal and presentation skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction Additional Information JOB ID: req309268 Category: Sales Location: 1740 Creekside Oaks Drive,Suite 150,Sacramento,California,95833,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.
