jobTitle: Sales Representative - Central New Jersey - Sustainability Solutions
description: About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services that help improve patient and hospital outcomes.  Our mission  Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better.  The division  Below Are Additional Ways That We Are Providing Sustainable Solutions To Our Customers  Stryker’s Sustainability Solutions (SSS) is the leading provider of reprocessing and remanufacturing services for single-use medical devices. Reprocessing of single-use medical devices (SUDs) is the practice of inspecting, cleaning, function testing, sterilizing and packaging so that they can be clinically and safely used again. Watch this short video to learn about how, with our customers, we’re better together. Diverted 13.4M pounds of waste from landfills in 2019. Providing an “end of life” solution for devices that can no longer be reprocessed; converting them into syngas, biochar or recyclable metals. Launched Pulse Ox for the Planet in 2017 where we donate trees to the National Forest Foundation based on increasing pulse oximeter collections. This year, we are on track to plant over 90,000 trees. Invested $33M in capital expenses to improve operations since 2009. Helped our customers save over $375M in 2019. Who We Want  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and service mindset to bring value to their customers.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who look beyond conventional methods to transform their industry and make healthcare better.  Dedicated competitors. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and work fiercely to win.  What You Will Do  As a Sales Representative, you’ll be selling and promoting the products and services of the world leader in the healthcare reprocessing market, Stryker Sustainability Solutions. Your ability to create and develop influential relationships with your customers will serve them well and develop your business to meet territory performance and growth objectives. You’ll create a strategic and defined game plan that will allow you to influence all levels of hospital personnel including but not limited to Surgeons, Specialty Surgeons, administrative staff, patient support staff, operations, supply chain, nursing, in-patient staff, out-patient staff and c-suite level personnel. Stryker Sustainability’s portfolio of life saving, quality driven devices will align well with your ability to understand and effectively leverage many different products, relationships and challenging situations within hospitals. With your focus, SSS can be the caveat that brings many different divisions together, becoming more valuable to our customers. You’ll operate with a high level of purpose, passion and integrity. As a member of our sales team, you’ll thrive off the fast pace environment and find purpose in your work to help make healthcare better.  Responsibilities And Duties Develop and implement sales strategies that meet or exceed territory sales objectives for each SSS franchises (EP, OR & Patient Care) Establish, maintain and develop strong business relationships with prospective and existing customers to maintain and grow revenue Provide product use and collection “in-servicing” trainings and other customer education support programs associated with environment and financial benefits Identify and cultivate productive business relationships with cross- divisional Stryker counterparts and strategic partners that can assist in achieving business results Understand and continually educate yourself on your customer facilities and the reprocessing competitive landscape Conducts business reviews, in-services on new programs, changes to existing programs, updates, and timely addresses any customer concerns and influence customer participation levels Partner with your service team to drive customer engagement in collections program ensuring we maintain a consistent flow of product to our production facilities Work from home: Yes (field-based role, 90% of time spent visiting customer accounts in assigned territory) Required travel percentage: Up to 30% Experience / Skills Required Bachelor's Degree (Preferably in Business or related degree) Experience in B2B sales Experience in the medical device industry preferred High level of self-motivation and ability to work independently with minimal supervision Demonstrated sales success (quota attainment YOY, awards, etc.) Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program.

Monitor customer and competitor activity and industry trends. Protect, grow and diversify the relationship with targeted customers. Support business growth by disseminating favorable information about the organization and its products and services. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Position Information  The business will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.  Qualifications  Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Customer Relationship Management software Locations: Arizona, Louisiana, New Mexico, Mississippi and Texas.  Preferred location: Texas.  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

description: The Business Development Manager is responsible for driving sales through collaboration with spa management, general managers, and providers to increase sales in hotel and day spas.   Maintains and develops strategic relationships through an individualized approach, strong interpersonal skills, and motivation.   Will work closely with Director of Education Center of Excellence in regards to planning and execution of trainings and events.  Partners closely with the Spa leadership to create strategic partnerships across Spa and Hotel teams to grow Natura Bissé, delivering exceptional experiences and brand building moments.  Accountabilities  Understands and exemplifies the Natura Bissé philosophy and brand culture Manages to and achieves sales and targets per account  Services and grows both existing and new accounts, Managing and achieving sales and targets per account while acting as liaison to resolve client issues and opportunities.   Compile data on prospective customers for use as sales leads, based on information from business directories, industry ads, trade shows, internet websites, and other sources.  Build and maintain a sales pipeline of prospective new business opportunities within the assigned territory. Ability to research and qualify prospects and show them how Natura Bissé can partner to help them grow their service and retail profits  Attain new business growth by successfully opening new accounts  Establishes monthly call cycle to achieve sales, profit goals and identify account needs.  Maintains communication with accounts to ensure proper stock levels, retail sales, and services, and identify areas of opportunity.  Maintain accurate, current data on each customer including practice/office demographics, staff, call and sales history  Work closely with the Manager of Hotel and Spas to customize strategy, marketing plans, and activities to each account to achieve sales goals and targets  Review and analyze orders for each account.  Work closely with Customer Service and Accounts Receivable to manage order processing and coordinate the accounting /invoicing of accounts  Partner with Manager of Spas and Marketing teams to ensure marketing requests and requirements are met and executed for each account using correct Marketing Request forms and tools  Plan and execute comprehensive training programs and events that incorporate product knowledge, retail selling skills, hands-on aesthetic skills, and business operations for use in account opening and ongoing development.   Executes Natura Bissé protocols for all spa / retail treatments  Delivers webinars, videos, social media, and communications to inspire and enhance ongoing education, reinforce brand equity, customer service, sales, and profitability. These programs include but are not limited to Hands-On Trainings, Spa Plan Training, and Masterclasses (MOB)  Collaborates with Education Center of Excellence in the ideation, creation, and execution of education projects  Works in partnership with spa to grow their social media platforms, with a focus on Natura Bissé partnership  Establish weekly calls cycle and bi-annual visits (more where required and necessary)  Maintains communication with accounts to ensure proper stock levels and retail sales and services  Creates feedback loops to the brand; shares feedback with in-house teams  Maintains in-depth knowledge of market trends, competitor’s products, service offerings, demographics and customer needs, behaviors, and reactions. Shares insights with the management team  Preferred Skills Exceptional interpersonal skills and ability to build positive/effective business partnerships. Ambitious self-starter with the ability to anticipate problems and think proactively. Strong analytical and organizational skills including budgeting and time management. Proven ability to set and achieve sales goals required. Ability to work collaboratively in a highly competitive, fast-paced, changing environment, Excellent communication skills – verbal, non-verbal, and written including strong presentation abilities. Proficient in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge and experience in managing a large, multi-state territory.  Qualifications and Education Requirements Minimum 2-3 years’ experience leading/managing spa/retail/POS stores/counters/regions in the luxury beauty business; preferably in the beauty industry. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.

Bardy Diagnostics, Inc. (“BardyDx”) is an innovator in digital health and remote patient monitoring, with a focus on providing the most diagnostically accurate and patient-friendly cardiac and vital signs patch monitors in the industry. Currently, BardyDx has FDA 510(k) clearance and CE Mark approval to market the Carnation Ambulatory Monitor (CAM) Patch and is presently launched in the U.S. and multiple international countries with over 60,000 patients helped already. Position Overview & Purpose Bardy Diagnostics is building a team of passionate people who share an entrepreneurial spirit and are dedicated to making a difference in advancing patient care. It is our desire to create a “family – like” culture among the commercial team and across the company as we continue to build the team and grow.  Currently, we are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales Team who are passionate about digital health and helping cardiac patients through our innovative remote patient monitoring body sensor technologies. The right individuals will join a dynamic and fast-paced start-up environment and work with cross-functional teams to raise awareness about BardyDx and our innovative CAM Patch, and to drive market adoption of the CAM Patch as the new standard of care in cardiac monitoring.  Ideal candidates will have a combination of medical sales and/or B2B sales experience, with some start-up or small company experience preferred. The ability to deal with adversity, and to quickly adapt new sales strategies as market conditions change, are ideal traits for this position. Core Job Functions & Responsibilities • Develop and implement a territory business plan and sales strategy • Increase revenue in assigned territory by promoting BardyDx’s Core products and services • Develop relationships with Electrophysiologists, Cardiologists, Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Neurologists and Emergency Medicine Physicians to drive increased adoption of products & services • Develop and maintain relationships with physicians, office staff, and practice/ hospital administration • Spend majority of your time in the assigned territory promoting the company’s products and services • Gain a deep understanding of customer needs, determine ways to improve the overall customer experience, and generate new sales and marketing tactics that grow market share, and drive growth • Train staff, physicians and administration on the proper usage and billing codes for our products & services • Perform other duties as assigned or required  Required Experience & Skills • Bachelor’s degree with a combination of successful sales or B2B sales experience is the ideal target background experience • Previous Medical Device or Diagnostic Services Sales experience preferred • May consider strong proven performers doing business to business selling • Experience selling to hospitals, including Emergency Departments, is strongly preferred, but not required • Some start-up or small company experience preferred (ability to deal with adversity, to execute with limited resources, and to quickly adapt new sales strategies as market conditions change)
industries: Medical Devices

description: Acquia empowers the world’s most ambitious brands to create digital customer experiences that matter. With open source Drupal at its core, the Acquia Digital Experience Platform (DXP) enables marketers, developers, and IT operations teams at thousands of global organizations to rapidly compose and deploy digital products and services that engage customers, enhance conversions, and help businesses stand out.  Headquartered in the U.S., Acquia has been named a top software company by The Software Report, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named a top place to work by the Boston Globe and the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it!  We are seeking a results-oriented Key Account Manager responsible for developing & maintaining existing customer relationships. This role will proactively engage in the day-to-day management of the account including issue resolution. They will become the customer’s advocate within Acquia crafting a positive customer experience that ultimately results in the renewal of the subscription. This role will work directly with Sales, Technical Support and Finance.  This position is designed for an experienced account manager who has a high attention to detail and strives for customer satisfaction. This is a great opportunity to hit a hot market with best-of-breed open source technology and be the front lines of our Account Management program.  Summary Maintain account retention while providing outstanding customer service and developing client relationships Identify and close new opportunities within existing customer base Create and execute on a territory plan to drive customer retention and upsell opportunities Exceed monthly/quarterly growth and renewal goals Coordinate with business users and procurement to ensure timely renewals Update and maintain Sales database as appropriate Proactively drive accounts with minimal over sight Ability to balance multiple systems and administration at once Job Requirements Minimum of 5 years working in an account management role providing tech solutions to large enterprises Strong leadership, teamwork, communication & cross-group collaboration skills Ability to proactively drive accounts with minimal over sight from sales or senior management Consistent track record of sustaining & growing complex relationships including closing the renewal, up sell / cross sell opportunities Has owned & exceeded a Quota Incredibly detail oriented, ability to prioritize. Ability to perform in a fast paced environment MS Office knowledge including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Experience with Salesforce.com and other CRM tools Acquia is proud to provide best-in-class benefits offerings to our employees and their families in maintaining both a healthy body and a healthy mind. Core Benefits include: competitive healthcare coverage, wellness programs, take it when you need it time off, parental leave, recognition programs, and much more!  Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.  Interested residents of Colorado may contact NA-recruiting@acquia.com as it relates to regulation C.R.S. 8-5-201. Information regarding benefits are linked here.

description: Kickstart your career in software sales with this entry-level sales role!   Are you looking to explore the dynamic world of software sales? Do you want to work for a rapidly growing software as a service (SaaS) company where you can make an impact and be rewarded for your ingenuity and engagement? If so, you’re in the right place! Our product, LMS365, is a learning application that fully integrates with Microsoft 365 and Teams. With our rapidly digitalized, virtual workspaces, what better place to be than helping customers transform organizational learning within the widely utilized Microsoft cloud ecosystem.    This could be your perfect launch into SaaS sales!  In this position, you will jump into the world of SaaS sales, reporting directly to one of our US business managers who will be one of your closest colleagues. Through regular remote collaboration, you will work to solve customers' challenges and navigate a complex sales process to grow the LMS365 business while building your career in this industry.   Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:  Initially, this role will focus on inbound requests from small and mid-size companies. With proper training and guidance, you will: Reply to inbound requests using the phone and video meetings Actively listen to understand the customer's challenges and goal Ask questions to dig deeper and determine how we can deliver the most value to the customer Clearly present to potential customers how LMS365 can help solve their challenge Guide the customer through the process, ensuring all stakeholders are involved at an early stage Close the deal by tying the project to the customer's goals   Once fully onboarded your role will expand to include:  Starting conversations and generating demand with focus target companies via LinkedIn, email, and phone Contributing to local marketing activities such as webinars and virtual or physical events Assisting in larger opportunities in the Corporate and Enterprise segment  Our Ideal Candidate: We hire great people who thrive in a diverse environment, have a passion for sales innovation, and seek a company where their talents & effort can drive industry change. We need a person who is:  Curious with an internal drive to learn new skills and competencies Competitive in nature, with an urge to succeed on the individual and team level Resilient with the ability to get back up after failing Detailed in their communication and collaboration with others, especially when working remotely. Adaptable to change and enjoys learning in a fast-paced environment Mindful about their work-life balance and can contribute to the fun side of our company culture as much as the productive side  Preferred Experience: A recent graduate from an accredited college/university Previous internship experience in sales, consulting, or a related field, or at a technology company 1-2 years in a sales development role with experience building initial touchpoints with potential customers  About Us  LMS365 is the parent company behind the award-winning Learning Management Platform LMS365. As a Microsoft Gold and Co-sell Partner, we build our products on the Office 365 platform and are the only Learning Management System completely integrated into Teams. We are a privately held software company established in Denmark in 2003, with offices in Europe, Australia, and the USA.  More than 4 million users rely on our world-class SaaS-based LMS platform. For any organization using Office 365, SharePoint, and Microsoft Teams, LMS365 offers a seamlessly integrated learning solution, that allows employees to receive training in context, anywhere and anytime in a familiar environment. LMS365 helps learners find the training they need, identifies training they might need and ensures participation in the training they’re required to complete.  At LMS365, we are leading the charge in modern, hybrid workplaces, allowing our employees to work when, where, and how they want so they can perform at their unique best. With customers in over 50 countries around the world, we are making our mark on the world of SaaS software and our talented and diverse employees are the ones that make it all possible. LMS365 is an equal opportunity employer.   We do not discriminate based on race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome all backgrounds. Join us as we transform the world of working and learning, together.   Compensation and Benefits for this position Base salary of $35,000-$50,000 plus commissions. We are a flat, growth-driven organization so a great opportunity for rapid advancement once you get in the door and make things happen. We have excellent benefits- medical, dental, and vision + HSA which we contribute to both. Plus a 401K with a company match and company-paid life/disability insurance.   For further information about the position, you can contact: Joe Schweitzer VP of Operations Mail: js@lms365.com

Cabinet is looking for our first ever Account Executive to join our team! You are a true “hunter” and have an innate talent for closing B2B sales. You are also passionate about making a difference in the lives of what we think of as the backbone of any successful organization - Executive Assistants.  Cabinet is the all-in-one tool that’s built for efficiency & productivity — and built just for Executive Assistants. Cabinet’s co-founders went through Techstars in 2020 in NYC, and today are located in NYC and Denver.  What you’ll do: Building and cultivating prospective customers by initiating conversations, sending emails, and nurturing these leads through the sales funnel Presenting products to prospective clients through demos Closing deals and handing them over to customer success for onboarding Working cross functionally to align revenue with company goals, processes and initiatives Working with Cabinet’s design team to develop sales collateral Recording and managing data on prospective clients Finding comfort in working in a fast-paced startup environment Leading by example through perseverance, humility, and initiative Believing no task is too small, and no task is too tall You Have: 3+ years of sales experience, preferably in SaaS and/or start-up industries An uncanny ability to talk to people! Consistent over achievement in quota and revenue goals, with a strong work ethic Self-motivated and self-driven to achieve results Excellent communication, relationship, presentation and time management skills   What you’ll get: Autonomy, autonomy, autonomy! Selling a product that actually improves the lives of hardworking women & men in the workforce in a meaningful way. Working with an awesome team of smart, motivated, happy people who like to have fun Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Unlimited vacation days with a minimum requirement of two weeks off per year 16 weeks of Paid Maternity Leave and 8 weeks of Paid Paternity Leave  In accordance with Colorado State Law (https://leg.colorado.gov/bills/sb19-085) the base salary range for Colorado for this role is $61K- $73K per year.  Cabinet is committed to providing equal employment opportunities available to all. We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion are critical to our success as a company and seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most qualified people without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, military status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

A leading provider of home improvement products sold through multiple channels including retail and online through Home Centers (Home Depot, Lowe’s, and Menard's), co-ops, mass merchants, two-step distributors, and internet channels needs a National Accounts Manager.   The National Accounts Manager will manage, develop, and lead the implementation of strategies and programs to grow profitability and customer satisfaction at select accounts. Strong negotiation skills Experience with price changes Microsoft skills including PowerPoint and Teams meetings ERP Proficiency E-commerce experience is a plus Ability to travel up to 40% once the travel starts again Must be able to drive a motor vehicle with a clean driving record  Responsibilities Lead all account activities, including product line reviews, business reviews, product launches, and store program execution. Establish and maintain influential relationships at all levels of the organization Meet or exceed financial objectives, operational metrics, and customer service levels. Analyze sales data to identify trends and prepare periodic reports and business plans.  Deliver accurate forecasts and other metrics with a focus on early identification of opportunities and challenges. Conduct ongoing market and competitive research and use that information to support short and long-term account plans and initiatives.  Provide input to the business team on products, pricing, packaging, and merchandising. Negotiate prices Manage a network of independent sales reps and business analysts

description: Your mission in sales at AMAX is to enable the world's software and hardware companies to deliver their IT products to market faster and with greater assurance! AMAX is seeking individuals with a passion for technology and is fueled by solving commercial challenges.   If you enjoy building relationships and advanced technology, please read on!   Primary job responsibilities include:  ·       Research, analyze and understand the clients’ problems and pain points ·       Presenting to executives on the value and power of our platform and services ·       Overcome technical and business objections of prospective customers, as necessary ·       Contribute and maintain a thorough understanding of the processes, technology, products and services offered ·       Prepare and respond to formal proposals, bids, credit terms, quotations ·       Coordinate, collaborate and strategize across marketing, technical and sales engineering, and supply chain teams ·       Prospecting, managing opportunities and growing new accounts ·       Manage sales cycles from lead qualification to opportunity conversion ·       Develop and execute effective account and sales plans ·       Create and maintain pipeline and account reports ·       Work with management on contract negotiations ·       Enter contact data, log calls and other sales information for prospects and customers into the SO and contact management system ·       Provide feedback (customer/prospect needs, industry trends, market perceptions, competitive intelligence, etc.) to marketing management teams ·       Keep up with product, market and industry knowledge     Essential Job Requirements:  Researching new verticals or potential customers Prospecting, cold calls, conducting face to face and web meetings Presenting AMAX Solutions and Services to targeted accounts Work with engineering and marketing teams to create proposals for solutions based on customer needs Be responsible for managing the entire sales process from prospecting to close Establish, maintain and grow the client relationship through active account management Strong passion and self-discipline for continuously reaching and surpassing goals Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation); jobTitle: Sales Representative I, Interventional Therapies - Fresno / Bakersfield, CA
description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  Business Description:  Our vision is to become the undisputed world leader in Neuromodulation, improving patient lives through innovative solutions. Our therapies span the care continuum; from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies that relieve pain, restore function and improve lives for our patients.  We're committed to applying clinical and economic evidence and integrated technologies to our unmatched portfolio of therapies to develop healthcare solutions that increase patient access, improve the efficiency of procedures and deliver successful patient outcomes.  The Neuromodulation Operating Unit offers solutions — from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies — that treat chronic pain as well as pain from spinal fractures, cancer, and severe spasticity.  Our key Interventional Pain therapies include: Balloon Kyphoplasty, Vertebroplasty, and Radiofrequency Ablation  Click here to learn more about our Balloon Kyphoplasty products.  Click here to learn more about our Vertebroplasty products.  Click here to learn more about our Radiofrequency Ablation products.  A Day in the Life:  At Medtronic, the Sales Representative I, Interventional Therapies solicits orders, selling Medtronic Interventional products assigned and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the area assigned; for maintaining awareness of local competitive conditions and for reporting back promptly to the district manager. This position will work in tandem with an Interventional Therapy Consultant II and will have territory coverage responsibility and sales responsibility.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promote and sell Medtronic's Interventional products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including physicians. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's Interventional products and/or services. Organize meetings with physicians and other key opinion leaders in order to increase awareness of Medtronic's Interventional solutions. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts and/or evaluates market research including customers and competitors activities. Develops and/or implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Assesses customer needs and feedback regarding new products and/or modifications to existing products and communicates to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader —that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients.  To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic Click Here  Must Have: Minimum Requirements  To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume. Bachelor's Degree plus 3 years of sales experience with 1 of those 3 years in medical sales; or Bachelor's Degree plus 1 year of Medtronic Neuroscience (Pain, Brain or Spine) Clinical Specialist experience Nice to Have Ortho, spine or O.R. experience Ability to sell in an environment where partnering with a surgeon is critical and ability to sell a new device or procedure Proven leadership abilities and experience in selling value-added programs Fully knowledgeable about the anatomy and capable of effectively explaining after the completion of sales training. After two weeks in the territory, should be able to describe the anatomy of the spine and anatomical landmarks necessary to instruct a surgeon on the use  of Kyphon’s products. Thrives in an environment of variety and rapid growth & change Excellent communication and presentation skills Accustomed to working independently with a high degree of accountability About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision Must be able to travel Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 6, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Suzy puts the voice of the consumer at your fingertips. Whether you’re a novice or an expert researcher, our platform brings advanced tools together with the highest quality audience to deliver insights in minutes. Some of the biggest brands in the world use Suzy to deliver breakthrough products and experiences backed by data-driven decisions. Learn more at www.suzy.com.  Suzy is not where you figure out if a career in sales is for you. As a Sales Development Representative, you know what you’re getting into. You love the ups and downs of seeking out the right contact. Writing emails every day that tell the right story. You bounce back with a new strategy when you don’t get a yes the first time.   That’s how you’ll thrive as a Sales Development Representative (SDR) at Suzy.   At Suzy, you’ll be setting meetings for account executives to show customers our research platform so they can make better, more informed decisions with data. It’s a unique product that delivers insights across every vertical, and we’re growing this team. You can be a part of our next step, working with a group that will coach you and cheer in to your wins.   Oh, and did we mention the unlimited PTO, virtual lunch hangouts, an internal channel dedicated completely to showing off your dog, and a flexible work schedule?   Go ahead, apply already.   Suzy is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.   Suzy is committed to protecting its customers, employees, partners, and the company as a whole, from damaging acts that are intentional or unintentional. Effective security is a team effort involving the participation and support of every user who interacts with company information/data and systems. It is the responsibility of each individual to help protect company information assets.
industries: Market Research, Internet, and Computer Software

description: At Anvyl we are on a mission to make bringing products to life easier. We believe everyone should be able to make the physical products they want to see in the world and no one should be left out because finding suppliers, scaling up production or paying for goods is too hard. So we’re building software where brands manage suppliers, oversee production, and track in-depth product data from procurement to delivery of inbound goods. It saves hours a day of manual work, reduces supply chain costs, and provides actionable data on supplier activity throughout sourcing, production, and the product lifecycle. These tools to fuel and empower the most important relationships you have - the ones with your suppliers.  As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) at Anvyl, you will have the opportunity to impact the bottom line and drive revenue through generating sales opportunities in a team-focused environment. Success in this role means reaching and exceeding monthly sales goals, staying ahead of daily metrics, and handling rejection in stride, all with the support of experienced leaders. You will be a member of Anvyl's SDR program, a two-year track to the Account Executive position upon successful completion of program requirements.  Our SDRs are our product evangelists, believing in our product and authentically selling the Anvyl story. You understand that every single day is a new opportunity to be on top and are driven to compete against yourself while also being a collaborative teammate. We believe in collaborating with the greater Revenue organization (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success) to strategically generate new business for the company. Qualify leads by learning about the prospect's approach to supply chain, providing complete and appropriate solutions for every customer Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships Reach out to customer leads through cold calling Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments Analyze possible industries/market’s potential, track sales and status reports Continuously improve through feedback  Requirements Excellent written and verbal communication skills A strong work ethic, paired with effective prioritization and organizational skills An appetite for learning, with the ability to receive and implement feedback Experience in an SDR/BDR role a plus Experience cold-calling and cold-emailing a plus Experience working with Salesforce or any other CRM, a plus Knowledge of B2B SaaS  Benefits  We are a team that believes in cooperation, learning, quality, and putting our people and customers up front. We are a small company offering large company benefits - health, dental, and vision offerings, 401k availability, and many more perks. We are a remote company and want to make sure our employees have the flexibility to do their work where they feel best, and know that they can step away to recharge with our unlimited paid time away.  We are a diverse team spanning all professions, cultures, races, gender, and orientations. Our teammates are located across the country as well as in China, giving us a truly global footprint. We enjoy spending time together in person when - especially if there is Korean BBQ - or having a group brain-storming session on the next product innovation.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The AE role is critical to the success of Iridium Technology, with a primary responsibility of identifying and developing new opportunities with prospective customers in the assigned territory. The AE is a domain expert in legal industry finance and Iridium Technology products. This individual will partner, collaborate and plan with the Iridium sales, marketing, and management teams to develop leads and manage the sales cycle from demand generation through opportunity close. Negotiation and closing skills are a must. Prospects will view this individual as someone who can help them solve critical business problems. This is a work-from-home position and requires the candidate to be a self-starter with a strong discipline to achieve outcomes.  Reports To: CRO - Sales  Accountabilities Achieve defined 12-month new sales objective through a combination of telephone, web, e-mail based, and some live activity to new prospects.[TJ1] [RW2] [RW3] Identify potential new customers utilizing effective prospective selling techniques to expand customer base. Fully apprise the management team of monthly sales trends, making recommendations for adjustments to tactical plans. Develop an in-depth understanding of the Iridium portfolio offerings as well as competitive products/services to articulate the benefits and advantages of Iridium’s solutions, and handle customer concerns or objections. Forecast and manage account/opportunity detail using internal sales tools. Opportunity data is expected to be maintained on a daily basis. Collaborate with management, product owners, and Marketing to develop and create necessary Sales materials and maintain online repository of sales content Network with industry leadership, C-level executives, and other key influencers to understand, analyze and share unique client information and industry insights. Establish relationships with multiple contacts across the firm. Create ongoing messaging to the target population. This includes newsletter, webinar, and other materials to support product value and adoption. Accurately and efficiently document information gathered from clients, and, document interactions in the sales process in CRM systems and other formats as required. Daily updating is the expected cadence. Accurately and consistently report progress of territory plan toward meeting revenue quota goals via forecast/pipeline reports to and meetings with Sales management. Utilize and drive adoption on all required processes, tools, systems, sales metrics, and reporting tools. Approximately 30% overnight travel to client meetings, sales meetings, training programs, trade shows, company internal management meetings, etc. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications Relevant Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience (Information Technology, Accounting/Finance, etc.). * Ideal candidates will have a minimum of 7 years of new business sales success in legal industry finance technology or finance software solutions. * Demonstrated drive and experience to sell and win business successfully. * Must have the ability to travel overnight for work related events* Ability to build strong relationships with others to establish a network of relationships with individuals who can provide information, help or access to others. Politically savvy to understand and manage the matrix relationships in the legal industry. Includes the ability to identify the real decision-makers and key influencers and predict how new events or situations will affect individuals and groups within the organization. Excellent interpersonal and communication (oral & written) skills required. Executive presence, communication and presentation skills to convince customers to purchase Iridium Technology products and services. Strong collaboration and team skills required. Strong time management skills. Ability to work independently with and assist others in a team environment. Ability to perform research quickly and expertly, including utilizing appropriate search techniques to uncover valuable industry events and insights. Proven investigation or probing skills to uncover sales opportunities. Be curious. Experience working in a fast-paced competitive environment is preferred Strong business acumen. Proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Internet Explorer. Experience with Hubspot CRM is a plus. Critical qualifications for role, no exceptions Please visit to find out more information about the organization.  https://www.iridium-technology.com/
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Management Consulting

description: EasySend is a no-code platform for building and optimizing digital customer journeys. EasySend transforms paperwork-based processes in insurance, banking, and financial services into customer engagement and revenue growth opportunities.  We are looking for a Sales Development Representative to join our SDR team. As an SDR you will qualify inbound leads, create outbound leads, work with sales and marketing, move leads into and through the sales funnel, and set up sales-qualified appointments. This is a great opportunity to start in a prospecting role to learn the product, use cases, etc and then move into a close role. With $16M in funding, we're growing very quickly and there is lots of opportunity for growth.  Responsibilities Prospecting for new clients/ lead generation. Contact customers via email and telephone to promote the company and its solution. Follow up and qualify contacts from web registrations, promotions, events, and other marketing and sales activities. Prepare and present results from campaigns, webinars, and trade shows. Record of all lead activities in SalesForce according to company requirements. Conduct Market research, provide feedback, and share knowledge.  Requirements Preference of 1-2 years of sales development experience (selling over the phone, cold calling). B2B sales experience (bonus if it's in the insurance and financial service space). Proven over achievement record with an aggressive hunter mentality. Excellent phone & email communication skills. Methodological and organized. Strong Knowledge of the SalesForce, LeadIQ, and SalesLoft systems.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Must be in US Eastern time zone.

description: Job Description  We have two remote National Accounts Senior Sales Executive roles available and are seeking someone based in NYC as well as someone based in Boston  Sells to producers, prospective clients, and existing clients in Northeast National Accounts.  Cultivates strong, productive and influential relationships with brokers/consultants, customers, and peers focusing on the larger or more complex accounts/prospects. Implements strategies necessary to attain  sales objectives in assigned areas. Manages complex negotiations.  Positions products, rate levels, and expanded product portfolios to increase sales and maximize revenue. Manages the integration of client's and  Aetna's internal organizations to meet client's installation needs and close the deal. Provides expertise in difficult renewals. Collaborates with account  management and underwriting for renewals on assigned book of business.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line. Gains understanding of client's multifaceted needs and recommends appropriate benefits of Aetna's full product array (e.g.,  fully vs. self-insured, combination of products and/or covers a range of industries). Provides effective presentations to Aetna constituents. Exhibits  the following Senior Sales Executive Behaviors.  Required Qualifications  10 years + industry experience.  Applicable state licenses to sell products.  Preferred Qualifications  15+ years industry experience.  Education  Bachelor's degree.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Soothe also offers workplace and event massage through its corporate wellness program. This is done through providing customer support and working with our providers to ensure that appointments are filled.  Job Duties Serve as primary customer service contact for corporate wellness, hospitality partnerships, group events, and VIPs, delivering high quality customer experience Operational fulfillment for specialty client requests, including provider staffing, customer and vendor coordination/communications, livestream events, etc. to maximize client satisfaction and retention Support account management and operational fulfillment activities for all Soothe specialty clients Collaborate with and help train Client team to ensure customer service excellence for Soothe specialty clients Help Operations & Sales team with customer support  Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills And Abilities) Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal and customer service skills Strong relationship building skills Exceptional detail orientation and organization skills Strong time management skills Ability to grasp and retain processes Ability to adapt and effectively function in a constantly changing environment Professional attitude, enthusiastic, and reliable Please note the schedule for this position is from 11am - 8pm PST.

description: Base Salary plus commission fast track position to Account Executive within 6 months. Overall first year earnings 75-85K and six figures by 2nd year.   Cyber security is one of the fastest growing industries on the planet. Everyday you hear about another company who was hacked and who’s data has been compromised costing millions of dollars. The sector is now doubling in size from $165 Billion to over $365 Billion. CORL Technologies is pre-eminent solutions provider of cyber security risk assessments for the healthcare industry.   This makes CORL THE place to get your foot in the door to learn how to be an enterprise sales executive selling to Chief Information Security Officers and those on their team. Their budget is growing rapidly per year and the need they have for solutions like CORL has never been greater. Many companies make selling into cyber security so intimidating. Our focus to to train you alongside the very best and brightest minds in the business and allow you to flourish without having the industry experience.   Wonderful salary with strong commission pkgs.    • Lead generation through emails, cold calling, marketing campaign follow-up calls, CRM activity follow-up, and incoming leads follow-up • Prospect call prep including company background research, website, contacts, and other pertinent lead information • Enter, update, and maintain CRM information on leads, prospects, and opportunities. • Update and manage target lists Basic Qualifications   • HS diploma, Bachelor’s preferred. In lieu of Bachelor’s degree, 1+ years of relevant work experience   • 1-3 years of experience in a cold calling or lead generation position.   • Excellent communication skills (presentation and listening) and ability to uncover pain points / identify opportunities   • Entrepreneurial, persistent, and competitive spirit with a desire to succeed   • Proven experience managing multiple, competing priorities while working towards an established goal

Enterprise Sales Executive RedLegg is an innovative, global security firm that delivers managed cybersecurity solutions and peace of mind. Our agile team of engineers has been serving and defending clients’ information since 2008. Chicago-based and veteran-owned, we are trusted, personable guides in this complex, ever-changing, high-stakes field. We lead with confidence and take pride in instilling the same confidence in our clients and partners. We are trusted allies. Here to guide, defend and protect. The Enterprise Sales Executive will design, present, and demonstrate security services solutions. The ability to gather requirements, architect solutions, develop proposals, and present to the client is essential. During the sales cycle, the Enterprise Sales Executive will work with the security engineering team to architect solutions, identify vendor solutions that meet the client’s requirements, and position competitive solutions. The Enterprise Sales Executive will also be responsible for identifying needs and selling managed security services. Writing and presentation skills are a must.   Responsibilities  ·      Effectively translate customer requirements into security services solutions.  ·      Maintain strong relationships with existing contacts while onboarding and building new relationships. ·      Understand and apply vendor solutions that address technical requirements.  ·      Provide trusted advisory services to customers by maintaining knowledge of the latest security technologies and industry trends.  ·      Maintain certifications with top partners.  Requirements  ·      5-7 years of services sales experience   ·      5-7 years information security experience ·      Excellent customer service skills  ·      Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving skills  ·      Strong communication skills (phone and email)  ·      Self-managed and team oriented  ·      Consultative selling approach, problem resolution, judgment, and decision-making skills  ·      Deadline and detailed oriented  ·      Ability to travel within the territory 35-50% Compensation & Benefits  ·      Competitive Base Salary and Commission Plan  ·      Gym Membership Reimbursement  ·      Competitive Benefits Package Health, Dental, Vision ·      401K

jobTitle: Inside Sales Representative - Therapeutic Nutrition - Columbus, OH
description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  About Abbott  Our nutrition business develops science-based nutrition products for people of all ages, from helping babies and children grow, to keeping adult bodies strong and active. Millions of people around the world count on our leading brands – including Similac®, PediaSure®, Pedialyte®, Ensure®, Glucerna® and ZonePerfect® – to help get the nutrients they need to live their healthiest life.  Our location in Columbus, Ohio, currently has an opportunity for a Inside Sales Representative -Therapeutic Nutrition. An assignment as an inside sales representative is intended to be 12 to 24 months in duration, and is designed to accelerate and promote high-performing internal sales representatives into the Abbott Nutrition Field Sales organization. The assignment is designed to train and develop future field sales representatives and provide the experience and knowledge necessary to be successful in their future Field Sales role. Abbott’s Inside Sales position is dedicated to providing quality service and products to Abbott Nutrition customers. Inside sales sells to and/or provides services to institutional customers, including, physicians, registered dietitians, nurses and various healthcare professionals. Inside sales representatives work as a collaborative partner with field sales force to drive AN business. Strong relationships among healthcare professionals are built by providing service, support and education in alignment with sales and marketing strategies and direction.  What You’ll Do Responsible for selling Abbott Nutrition’s portfolio of products to various market segments.. The inside sales representative exhibits expertise in analyzing the facility's needs, educating healthcare professionals about the products and services that Abbott offers to result in optimal patient care and improved outcomes. Demonstrate the ability to address each customer's unique needs, while providing them with the proper information and appropriate solution based on the customer's specific needs and interests. Sells products ethically and in accordance with the company’s sales process and agreed marketing strategy. Makes compelling and persuasive sales calls to designated customers resulting in sales of products. Maximizes revenue and market share of products in territory and achieves/exceeds sales targets Build, maintain and leverage relationships with existing Abbott customers during short and long term field territory vacancies. May assist in the training and development of sales representatives. The inside sales representative will develop effective selling skills by way of prospecting, responding to inbound, or placing outbound calls to field customer account locations. Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the internal systems. Accountability / Scope/Budget: The inside sales representative is accountable for a targeted number of healthcare facilities, in accordance with sales direction. The main focus of accountability lies in the area of ensuring that the representative positively influences the product decisions of the healthcare professional. It is mandatory that the representative is personally aware of and in compliance with the Medicare/Medicaid reimbursement and federal regulations concerning Abbott products. The representative must appropriately manage health care professionals (HCP) concerns regarding products, patient education services, reimbursement issues, contract requirements and continuing education. Sales presentations and sample distribution both play a major role in Abbott customer satisfaction. Representatives are responsible for managing a territory budget and are expected to, based on sales direction, utilize the appropriate budgetary guidelines that bring maximum benefit to the customer and Abbott. Required  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING Bachelor’s Degree required, preferred in fields of Nutrition, Business, or Communication A strong business acumen Nutritional or science background is preferred Ideal candidates would have a proven track record of success in product or relationship based sales. Demonstrated leadership and the drive to achieve beyond what is expected. Excellent customer relationship building skills. Strong communication, presentation, persuasiveness and active listening skills. Must be able to work in a team environment and open to coaching and mentoring from others. Initiative and strong planning and time management skills. A strong interest in sales and the ability to meet or exceed sales and activity quotas. Proficiency in computer skills and use of sales databases. Ability to manage monthly budget responsibilities for product gratis and literature distribution. Demonstrated Abbott Leadership Core Competencies as required. Proactive self-starter, able to multitask in a fast paces environment, and sales focused to expand the client relationship. Enthusiasm and passion is a must! Percent Travel Required: 10% - 30% Knowledge of applicable regulatory standards and requirements for infant formula and adult nutritional products. The representative must be willing to relocate to cities throughout the country to obtain a Field Sales force position. Relocation is required for most positions and relocation assistance is provided.  What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: A fast-paced work environment where your safety is our priority (Include for Manufacturing roles only) Production areas that are clean, well-lit and temperature-controlled (Include for Manufacturing roles only) Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: Bring your sales talents to a leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions. Rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation, our medical technologies open doors. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  CAREERS THAT CHANGE LIVES: POSITION DESCRIPTION: Maximize profit by achieving sales revenue targets and grow market share for a specified territory, by promoting, selling and servicing Medtronic Coronary and/or Peripheral vascular products Practice good, ethical territory management in terms of organization, planning, administration and expense planning and control Increase sales and revenue by aggressively targeting and developing new accounts Train appropriate medical staff on products and procedures Meet expectations as defined by Sales Management A DAY IN THE LIFE: POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Planning/Results Orientation Ability to develop, implement and deliver on plans to achieve/exceed sales targets. Plans, actions, and results should include: Consistent achievement/overachievement of sales objectives Ability to handle multiple and competing priorities Specific targeted accounts/customers in which to maintain and grow business Identified competitive accounts in which to establish and promote new business Consistent follow through on all objectives and assignments Metrics and timelines to evaluate results Territory Management/Account Development Develop and maintain accurate account and territory records Effectively manage time to ensure maximum coverage of all accounts within territory in order to achieve optimum level of exposure and results Develop and act on plans which identify growth opportunities within current and competitive customer accounts Develop and implement strategies to counter competitors In collaboration with other departments, manage inventory to optimally balance availability of product with inventory costs Control and manage expenses in the most handle objections, and gain commitment by customers on actions to drive revenue growth and maximize profitability Maximize revenue potential by targeting specific customers to gain sales leads and understood and used effectively Maintain high standard of personal presentation and promote a professional image Communication Develop and maintain productive, collaborative working relationships within company to ensure maximum sales support and a high level of customer service Actively contribute to the development of a strong team effort Communicate market intelligence/competitor activity promptly, including potential sales leads, and provide information regarding product price or account activity to Regional Manager and other appropriate company personnel; e.g., The Legal Dept. Maintain a professional standard of written and verbal communication Proactively respond to all requests in a professional, timely manner; e.g., Voicemail, email, etc. Self-Development and Product Knowledge Proactively develop knowledge, skills and abilities in all relevant areas; e.g., clinical, technical, product and sales skills Recognize, understand, and be able to communicate features, strengths, and drawbacks of competitive products in relation to the company’s products Participate in product and skill development programs and activities such as classroom education, on-the-job training, and other relevant activities that assist in the development of the team and yourself Compliance Adherence with all company policies and procedures; e.g., Code of Conduct, AdvaMed, etc. Compliance with all relevant clinical and regulatory body guidelines Adherence to customer account policies and procedures where applicable Compliance with all safety standards, policies and regulations Compliance with all other standards, policies and legal requirements related to this position Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 7 years of relevant experience and expert level knowledge of company products and services DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Strong preference toward local candidates with cath lab sales experience Prefer sales experience in capital equipment sales, surgical sales, and in-hospital pharmaceutical. Medical device sales is especially preferred but not required Completion of a strong sales training program Demonstrated high level of sales performance in a highly technical, competitive, and volatile environment Demonstrated skills in account, inventory, expense, and budget management Demonstrated skills in sales planning, organization and execution Consistent success working in a variety of business conditions Ability to teach and educate medical personnel, peers, and technical support personnel Demonstrated success working in a collaborative environment Continual self-development Computer (PC) literacy Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Frequent required travel to customer clinics, hospitals and offsite meetings. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers. Lifting/carrying 20 pounds Sit/stand walk 6-8 hours day Operate moving vehicle About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. description: The Territory Sales Manager will be responsible for leading and driving all sales initiatives within the Dallas/Fort Worth, TX territory, for Libbey’s foodservice channel. This includes maintaining and growing existing accounts, and actively managing the sales pipeline process, to identify and convert new business opportunities. The Territory Sales Manager will be responsible for maintaining strong customer relationships, offering outstanding customer service and successfully selling Libbey’s marketing programs, products and promotions at the distributor and end user level.  Libbey is looking for highly motivated sales professionals, with effective virtual office skills and experience. The Territory Sales Manager role is an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic, savvy and results-oriented individual to positively impact growth with one of the largest tableware suppliers worldwide. If you have a passion for winning, we want you on our team!  Responsibilities: Technical and functional subject matter expert responsible for planning, coordination, requirements gathering, business analysis, project monitoring, project status reporting, and development and implementation of small to medium business solutions Independently develop an annual territory sales plan, to achieve and exceed planned sales targets Drive successful development of new business opportunities Successfully maintain and grow territory business with existing customers, primarily at the end user level Collaborate with customers and the sales leadership team to develop business plans and targets for foodservice growth Successfully utilize technology to manage customers and prospects, and provide feedback for continuous improvements (CRM database and other sales pipeline planning and review tools) Coordinate and execute sales efforts to integrate with Libbey marketing activities, such as product launches, promotions, advertising, merchandising, etc. Work cohesively with internal teams to communicate customer requirements and opportunities (product and service opportunities, special developments, competitive information, or feedback gathered through field activity) Partner with other sales team members, engineering, new product development, and other departments, to achieve company goals and meet customer needs Collaborate with Libbey Customer Service to proactively resolve any issues immediately Train customers on Libbey products and range of value-added services Submit credible, accurate forecasts of monthly sales volume, based on customer business plans, inventory builds, product mix and growth objectives Participate in customer trade shows and sales meetings, assist with payment collections, address service and shipping related concerns, etc.  Requirements & Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree preferred, or equivalent work experience 3-5 years of direct selling experience in the food service and/or hospitality industry, preferred Forecasting and business planning experience Strong negotiations skills and ability to persuade and influence others Ability to develop and deliver compelling business presentations Strong communication and organization skills Work requires travel to current/prospective customers, trade shows, and Libbey events or training. This requires a valid driver’s license and clean driving record Ability to travel 50+% of the time   Libbey provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description: Career Opportunity – Sales Coordinator with Galerie in Hebron, KY  Do you want to be a part of an organization that provides creative and breakthrough solutions? Do you excel at supporting sales teams? Do you have the dedication to follow through on customer and company commitments? If yes, we want to speak to you!  As the Sales Coordinator for Galerie, you will be responsible for the daily transactional support of customer accounts and assisting the Sales Team Managers and Directors. You will provide exceptional internal and external customer service and assume an “expert” role with system data to effectively assist Sales and Marketing Managers in creating proposals and leading projects through to completion. You will also communicate directly with customers and retail buyers to respond to inquiries, provide solutions, request extensions and to make product sales recommendations for future seasons.  To be considered, you will meet the following requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in business related field or equivalent experience is preferred. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint a must. Experience with Access and ERP Systems is a plus. Self-starter that can positively influence others. A positive, upbeat, and interactive style is very important. Very organized and deadline driven. Can work effectively with little supervision. Strong communication skills, both in verbal and written formats, with all levels of business professionals. Understanding of basic retail math. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple projects at one time.  GALERIE® provides outstanding customer service while delivering fresh, innovative confectionery gifts of the highest quality and value. We are a design-driven enterprise, bringing more than 1,200 items to retailers every year. In addition to the Galerie brand, our licensed product lines include Disney, Star Wars, Hershey, Kellogg's, Minions, Trolls, Peppa Pig, Marvel and Warner Brothers. Our extensive seasonal and everyday offerings are perfect to give and receive!  We offer a very competitive base salary and a full benefits package including health insurance, life, dental and a 401(k) plan with a company match.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website and LinkedIn page: https://www.galeriecandy.com/ https://www.linkedin.com/company/galerie/  This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing and innovative team! Please apply online today at https://grnh.se/3a4d00bf3us!  Employer is EOE/M/F/D/V. No third-party candidates please.
