description: Who We Are Hubilo is a leading virtual event solution company focused on fostering greater human connection through the reimagination of events. Our platform, built with the largest set of engagement features in the industry, makes events more inclusive, accessible, and meaningful. Whether in-person or virtual, event organizers turn to Hubilo for our powerful yet intuitive event technologies, offering our clients an end-to-end event solution with dedicated customer support and proven market leadership.   Fostering greater human connection isn’t just what we do-it’s who we are. As a pioneer in virtual experiences, we believe accessibility, diversity and work-life balance sparks innovation and competitive advantages in a competitive industry.  Hubilo is looking to hire an Account Manager to join its Sales organization in the US/EMEA. This is a remote position.  What We Are Looking For The Account Manager role is the specialization area of our sales organization that focuses on growing customer wallet share within the Hubilo customer base by identifying, qualifying, and closing expansion and renewal opportunities. Reporting to the Director of Account Management, you will conduct regular business reviews to customers that utilize Hubilo to hold hybrid events, probing for new business, building deep customer relationships and long-term strategic account plans to insure retention and growth.  You will work closely with cross-functional teams such as Customer Success and Solutions Consultants to ensure customers are experiencing excellent hybrid and virtual event outcomes. The ideal candidate will possess both an account management and sales background, to drive engagement with decision-makers and influencers within Sales, Marketing, Event Management, and HR Teams.  Additional Responsibilities Will Include Expansion sales into existing accounts with strong forecast and funnel management process Deliver regular outbound campaigns on new product updates, partnering with Customer Success and Solutions Consulting resources Conduct data driven conversations to cultivate new product pipeline and upsell opportunities Deliver commercial outcomes by running a consistent sales process and setting next step expectations and contract negotiations with customers Understand customer use-cases and how they pair with Hubilo’s solution in order to identify new cross-sale opportunities Evaluate core usage trends and articulate value to show Hubilo impact and provide strategic recommendations during business reviews Network across different business units with each of your accounts, and multi-thread to identify and engage new divisional buyers Operate internally as a liaison with cross-functional teams to share key customer feedback and insights to improve customer experience and further investments with Hubilo Own and execute win/win negotiation strategies for a high quantity of renewals that maximize contract value while protecting and enhancing customer trust Identify and communicate any renewal risk to internal resources in order to develop retention strategies Collaborate with internal resources such as account executives, customer success, pricing, legal, revenue operations and product management to develop strategies for upcoming renewals Follow and adhere to best practices for all internal processes including, opportunity management, data quality and accuracy, Salesforce CRM hygiene, quotes and forecasting Achieve financial and strategic revenue, bookings and billings targets Leverage customer data and behavior to assess the health of each Account  Examples Of Desirable Skills, Knowledge And Experience Bachelor's degree required 3-4 years+ managing and growing a portfolio of relationships with mid-market and enterprise buyers Prior pipeline generation and closing sales experience in strategic selling to mid-market and enterprise Managing a full sales process from demand to close for install base of customers Building strong, trusting relationships with customers and internal stakeholders Proven track record of performance in past sales positions Self-motivated, Analytical, and Entrepreneurial spirit with hunter sales capabilities Comfortable working in a fast paced dynamic environment

jobTitle: Sales Representative - Charleston, WV - Sports Medicine
description: Job Description  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Promote and sell Stryker Endoscopy products within approved indications for use. Understand and comply with applicable laws, regulations and rules set forth by Federal, State and Local governmental authorities including, but not limited to: reporting of device complaints, accurate recording and reporting of financial transactions and other reports determined by Stryker policy, and the Federal Anti-Kickback Statute. Understand and comply with the Code of Ethics and company policies. Understand and comply with applicable customer policies, HIPAA, and vendor requirements. Educate and inform doctors, nurses, and appropriate staff personnel about the proper use and maintenance of Stryker Products. Direct product evaluations in OR and office settings while adhering to OSHA, Hospital, and other pertinent guidelines May assist in the preparation and operation of trade shows, conventions, and/or clinical meetings. Keep regional manager informed of territory progress on a regular basis. Solve product problems for customers in an expeditious fashion. May assist in the training and development of sales personnel. Manage, maintain and complete reports about product inventory. Exhibit a base understanding or ability to learn and operate software programs such as Microsoft Office and Oracle Sales Information System. Qualifications 2-5 years in an outside sales position (medical related fields is preferable). B.A. or B.S. degree required. Medium work: Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently to move objects. Must be able to communicate with large groups of people. Must be able to communicate telephonically and with electronic means (i.e., email texts, etc.). Must be able to use common office equipment (e.g. fax, modem, calculator, PC, etc.). Up to 20% overnight travel annually. Must be able to drive an automobile. Must be able to routinely negotiate price and terms of transactions between Stryker and its customers. Must be able to readily solve customer complaints. Must have fundamental understanding of all products and be able to disseminate this knowledge to the customer. Able to analyze and prioritize market potential-based call patterns. Excellent interpersonal, analytical and organizational skills. Work From Home: Yes  Travel Percentage: Up to 50%  Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.  Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Medical Devices

description: LeadIQ is building a world-class, remote-first, team that is reinventing how companies find their best customers with sales intelligence, productivity, insights, and resources for success. We take pride in building a company and product that materially improves people’s lives, whether they’re an employee or a customer.  As a LeadIQ Sales Development Representative, you'll play a key role in prospecting new business for the company and be on the ground floor of a growing start-up!   The Role  Embody the LeadIQ brand of taking research first, personalized approach to selling Reach out to leads (sales leaders) via cold calling, social engagement, and email prospecting to convey LeadIQ’s value proposition Convert qualified leads into scheduled product demos with your Account Executives Collaborate with team members to share and learn from best practices You’ll be using Outreach, Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and LeadIQ, of course :) along with various internal data systems daily This is an individual contributor role that reports to the SDR manager, who values daily team coaching, weekly one-on-ones as well as autonomy to allow you to own your success Achieve specific daily, monthly, and quarterly metrics   The Person  BS/BA strongly preferred or unique life experiences History of achievement and strong work ethic  Desire to learn and grow Collaborative mentality by prioritizing ‘we’ and not focusing on ‘me’ Superb writing, communication, and listening skills Creative, outside-the-cube thinker High level of empathy - it’s important for our SDR’s to be a good person to peers and prospects Desire to move up the ranks and become an Account Executive in the future   Perks & Benefits  This is a 100% remote full-time job! Medical and dental coverage for full-time employees and dependents Matching 401K program to help you invest in your future Flexible vacation time to promote a healthy work-life balance Paid parental leave to support you and your family (structure of paid leave is governed by your state of residency) Additional Sales Incentive Bonuses    About Us  LeadIQ is a Series B-funded startup headquartered in the Bay Area and Singapore. We are reshaping the future of Sales with our mission to enable the day-to-day sales prospecting workflow for every sales rep.  We are passionate about empowering our customers with Data and Insights to generate more revenue faster. We do this with the help of cutting-edge technologies and innovation.  A diverse and talented workforce powers our exponential growth across 24 countries that breathe our core values of #EmpathyFirst, #BeBetterEveryday, #DataDriven, and #MakeItHappen, and the trust of our investors- Cathay Innovation, Fresco Capital, Strong Ventures, Eight Roads, Draper Associates, and Jason Calacanis. We are a remote-first company with a culture of trust, independence, collaboration striving to transform Sales. Join us!   LeadIQ is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.
industries: Computer Software and Internet

description: Mercatus is seeking a passionate Sales Executive to source and close new opportunities. There are four key areas of focus to this role: Evaluate and prepare business plans for each assigned account, which involves evaluating the customer profile, creating value messaging, targeting key steps needed to execute, etc. Build top of funnel and pipeline through events, networking, cold outreach, etc. Move opportunities through the pipeline to close which includes managing the process end to end and pulling in the necessary resources to support along the way. Drive timely and accurate sales forecasting through effective and consistent use of Mercatus’ customer relationship and insight collection tools.  This job is assigned a set of target accounts and a sales quota and performance is measured by meeting or exceeding annual targets. This position reports to VP of Sales and Account Management and will work closely with our Marketing and Solution Engineer team members.  Responsibilities Target Private Market fund and asset managers. Identify prospects and evaluate their position in the industry; research and analyze customers that can act quickly and decisively. Identify and maintain key executive decision makers, convert them to sponsors and coach through the buying cycle. Obtain deep understanding of prospective customer’s business teaching them something new and provocative about how to grow and compete. Develop and maintain a pipeline of qualified prospects. Navigate through complex negotiations, determine pricing and contractual agreements to close the sale. Continually network to strengthen relationships with new potential partners. Ensure that information relating to sales activities, and business issues are available to senior management in a timely fashion for input/guidance. Promote the use of sales teaming and executive calling in support of your sales efforts. Curiosity and willingness to learn, understand, and solution client business problems. Sell complex service engagements and creatively seek alternative solutions where necessary. Drive business results and move the team from vendor to trusted advisor. Outside sales position, physically at customer location when needed for business development, prospecting, contract negotiations, etc. Partner with channel partners to understand their business, creatively adopt programs to drive new revenue, and expand business partner relationships.  Job Requirements Proven track record of consistent quota attainment ideally with on premise, SaaS, or a hybrid model experience 6+ years of enterprise sales experience, preferably within the private markets sector and/or technology sector. Strong team, selling and leadership skills. Experience with direct and indirect selling channels. Highly driven, determined & business oriented. Highly polished executive presence and sophistication to gain credibility with the firm's most senior professionals and provide leadership, guidance, and direction to a team. Demonstrated ability to deliver on assigned responsibilities through commitment to quality and attention to detail. Ability to travel as required for customer engagements (~30%-50%), including internationally.  About Mercatus, A State Street Company Mercatus is a fast-growing SaaS data management platform that was recently acquired by State Street. Mercatus and State Street are now offering the market a public to private and front to back offering.  Mercatus is migrating the multi-trillion-dollar private market into the cloud just like has been done for other industries in the global economy. As the leading platform for managing the complexity of today's private market investment data, we offer a single solution for fund managers’ data, from deal to divestment, asset to fund, and equity to debt. Mercatus is headquartered in Silicon Valley with team members across the globe including Boston, London, Rome, Austin, and India. Visit www.gomercatus.com to learn more!  We are building a global team of inspired, smart, and driven individuals from all backgrounds. With many opportunities for growth and leadership, we strive to help each employee carve out the path that is right for them. Our team is a smart, hardworking group of people who enjoy working together and come from diverse backgrounds and different walks of life which gives us a true melting pot of shared ideas and experiences.

Dade City, FL, USA ? Wesley Chapel, FL, USA ? Zephyrhills, FL, USA  Req #4975  Thursday, January 28, 2021  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees.  As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida.  **Sales Account Manager**  The Sales Account Manager (** SAM) is responsible for business development and customer relationships. The SAM increases business by selling additional brands and packages within his or her sales territory's existing customer base. The Sales Account Manager at CCBF works across all sales channels. This role will focus on the Wesley Chapel, San Antonio, Dade City and Zypherhills areas. **Role Responsibilities**  â€¢Make sales and obtain orders from customers  â€¢Customarily and regularly perform primary duties in the field visiting customer accounts away from a company facility or office  â€¢Build and maintain profitable customer relationships  â€¢Execute and close all sales calls  â€¢Sell in incremental displays and equipment placements; sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance  â€¢Review business results with customers  **â€¢**  Ensure company assets meet performance requirements and develop a plan of action for those assets generating zero or low volume  â€¢ Ensure outlets comply with CCBF standards  â€¢ Communicate account activities to appropriate parties  â€¢ Merchandising and rotation inspection  â€¢ Resolve customer inquiries, including researching and closing customer service tickets  â€¢ Transport, replace and maintain Point of Sale advertising as appropriate for account  â€¢ Maintain regular and punctual attendance  â€¢ Work overtime as assigned  â€¢ Comply with all company policies, procedures and applicable laws  â€¢ Identifying and reporting any unsafe working conditions  â€¢ Comply with dress code or appearance/grooming standards  â€¢ Work shifts and work schedules as assigned  **Role Requirements**  â€¢ High School Diploma or equivalent, Bachelor degree preferred  â€¢ Must be 18 years of age or older  â€¢ 1+ years of general work experience  â€¢ 1+ years previous sales experience preferred  Â€¢ Food/beverage Industry Experience Preferred  â€¢ Ability to create and conduct sales presentations  â€¢ Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills  â€¢ Excellent planning and organization skills  â€¢ Proficient in computer application skills  â€¢ Ability to use and understand mobile applications  â€¢ Ability to work variable schedule, weekends and holidays  â€¢ Must have and maintain a valid driver's license  â€¢ Must have and maintain current vehicle liability insurance, as specified by company  â€¢ Must have a driving record with no major moving violations in the last three (3) years*  â€¢ Must provide and maintain a personal vehicle for use during employee working hours  â€¢ Frequent lifting of 25+ pounds. Occasional lifting of 50+ pounds, bending, reaching, kneeling, and light merchandising  â€¢ Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print  â€¢ Ability to stand a minimum of 6 hours during the workday  â€¢ Ability to walk a minimum of 4 miles during the workday Major moving violations include, but are not limited to, leaving the scene of an accident, driving under the influence, and reckless driving. Minor moving violations include, but are not limited to, speeding, driving too close, failure to stop, and improper lane changes. Driving records, including minor moving violations, will be evaluated according to CCBF guidelines to determine eligibility for the Sales Account Manager position. Physical Abilities  â€¢ Ability to repetitively lift, carry, and position objects weighing up to 50 pounds without assistance  â€¢ Ability to repetitively push and pull objects weighing up to 50 pounds without assistance while kneeling; squatting; reaching above the head; reaching at the waist; reaching below the knees; and bending at the knees  â€¢ Ability to repetitively push and pull manual transport equipment (for example, pallet jack, handtruck) containing product loads a minimum of 100 yards without assistance  â€¢ Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination  â€¢ Ability to exert oneself physically over sustained periods of time to complete job activities  â€¢ Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print  â€¢ Ability to stand a minimum of 6 hours during the workday  â€¢ Ability to walk a minimum of 4 miles during the workday  â€¢ Frequently work in a hot/humid outdoor environment  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  **Other details** Job Family Sales Job Function Sales Pay Type Salary Apply Now Dade City, FL, USA Wesley Chapel, FL, USA Zephyrhills, FL, USA

description: The AE role is critical to the success of Iridium Technology, with a primary responsibility of identifying and developing new opportunities with prospective customers in the assigned territory. The AE is a domain expert in legal industry finance and Iridium Technology products. This individual will partner, collaborate and plan with the Iridium sales, marketing, and management teams to develop leads and manage the sales cycle from demand generation through opportunity close. Negotiation and closing skills are a must. Prospects will view this individual as someone who can help them solve critical business problems. This is a work-from-home position and requires the candidate to be a self-starter with a strong discipline to achieve outcomes.  Reports To: CRO - Sales  Accountabilities Achieve defined 12-month new sales objective through a combination of telephone, web, e-mail based, and some live activity to new prospects.[TJ1] [RW2] [RW3] Identify potential new customers utilizing effective prospective selling techniques to expand customer base. Fully apprise the management team of monthly sales trends, making recommendations for adjustments to tactical plans. Develop an in-depth understanding of the Iridium portfolio offerings as well as competitive products/services to articulate the benefits and advantages of Iridium’s solutions, and handle customer concerns or objections. Forecast and manage account/opportunity detail using internal sales tools. Opportunity data is expected to be maintained on a daily basis. Collaborate with management, product owners, and Marketing to develop and create necessary Sales materials and maintain online repository of sales content Network with industry leadership, C-level executives, and other key influencers to understand, analyze and share unique client information and industry insights. Establish relationships with multiple contacts across the firm. Create ongoing messaging to the target population. This includes newsletter, webinar, and other materials to support product value and adoption. Accurately and efficiently document information gathered from clients, and, document interactions in the sales process in CRM systems and other formats as required. Daily updating is the expected cadence. Accurately and consistently report progress of territory plan toward meeting revenue quota goals via forecast/pipeline reports to and meetings with Sales management. Utilize and drive adoption on all required processes, tools, systems, sales metrics, and reporting tools. Approximately 30% overnight travel to client meetings, sales meetings, training programs, trade shows, company internal management meetings, etc. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications Relevant Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience (Information Technology, Accounting/Finance, etc.). * Ideal candidates will have a minimum of 7 years of new business sales success in legal industry finance technology or finance software solutions. * Demonstrated drive and experience to sell and win business successfully. * Must have the ability to travel overnight for work related events* Ability to build strong relationships with others to establish a network of relationships with individuals who can provide information, help or access to others. Politically savvy to understand and manage the matrix relationships in the legal industry. Includes the ability to identify the real decision-makers and key influencers and predict how new events or situations will affect individuals and groups within the organization. Excellent interpersonal and communication (oral & written) skills required. Executive presence, communication and presentation skills to convince customers to purchase Iridium Technology products and services. Strong collaboration and team skills required. Strong time management skills. Ability to work independently with and assist others in a team environment. Ability to perform research quickly and expertly, including utilizing appropriate search techniques to uncover valuable industry events and insights. Proven investigation or probing skills to uncover sales opportunities. Be curious. Experience working in a fast-paced competitive environment is preferred Strong business acumen. Proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Internet Explorer. Experience with Hubspot CRM is a plus. Critical qualifications for role, no exceptions Please visit to find out more information about the organization.  https://www.iridium-technology.com/

The selected candidate will be based in the Greater Milwaukee area because of its central location relative to most of our customers. description: Account Executive -Third Ear  Are you looking for an agency that values every team member and their ideas? Third Ear speaks human and truly connects with people on our team, our customers, and our vendors. Our mission is to listen first. Our full-service creative agency offers competitive compensation and benefits as well as a culture of support and encouragement. If you are eager to share their talents with exceptional teammates and aspire to grow and flourish by serving our customers with care and creativity then we want you to apply.  The Job  The Account Executive is responsible for the day-to-day management of their assigned accounts. The AE is expected to effectively execute strategies, problem-solve, and develop strong working relationships at all levels within the agency and with the day-to-day client. Additionally, the AE supports their supervisors in their role of identifying and developing marketing and business opportunities for the agency and our client-partners. If you thrive on establishing and cultivating strong working relationships across all disciplines within the agency as well as with our clients this is the place for you.  Your Duties (Grow, Collaborate, Support) Establishes core relationships with Clients and key partner agency counterparts; attends and participates in Client meetings Partners and collaborates with counterparts within the Agency to deliver on projects and deliverables Collaborates with strategic planning team to develop creative briefs Works with Business Team to obtain legal and other required network clearances Leads select Productions at discretion of Manager Comprehends Agency and Client operations and provides solutions for optimization Understands beyond the business fundamentals of assigned brands Recognizes trends that could positively or negatively impact the business Leads development of Client-facing conference reports, presentations and other written communication Leads projects from beginning to end (Creative, Production and Selling of work) Oversees and approves project timelines and schedules to ensure that deliverables are on-schedule and on-budget Oversees monthly financials and output Responsible for pulling hours and ensuring full team compliance of timesheets Has understanding of scopes and scope tracking and can begin to identify out-of-scope opportunities You Bring A. in Advertising, Public Relations, Promotions, Marketing or other related area of Mass Communications 2-4 years of experience in an agency environment preferred Detail-oriented and take-ownership attitude Strong project management skills; highly skilled in time management to facilitate involvement in high volume of projects Ability to work independently and manage communications to all organizational levels Comprehension of Production: TV, Social, Digital, Radio and/or Print (including POS/Retail and OOH) Solid understanding of the principles of integrated marketing and Client’s business Personnel management (instruction/motivation/mentorship) Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment Advanced presentation skills English/Spanish (Bilingual) a plus

Overview Of The Company  Fox TV Stations  Fox Television Stations is one of the nation’s largest owned-and-operated network broadcast groups, comprising 29 stations in 18 markets and covering over 37% of U.S. television homes. This includes seven duopolies in the top 10 markets: New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas, San Francisco, Washington, D.C. and Houston; as well as duopolies in Minneapolis, Phoenix, Orlando and Seattle.  Job Description  The FOX O&O duopoly in the #1 market seeks a highly motivated, team-oriented Account Executive to implement strategies to achieve quarterly budgeted goals developed by management team in order to impact station revenue objectives; develop and maintain strong client relationships.  The ideal candidate will have strong negotiation and communication skills, thorough knowledge of Nielsen ratings, digital and multi-platform initiatives, as well as experience in major market television sales; must be able to identify share and revenue growth opportunities with both transactional and new business clients; contribute to a positive culture that is focused on maintaining and building strong client relationships. Candidate must possess strong time management and organizational skills; must be able to work in a fast paced, high-pressured, evolving environment; solid problem-solving, communication and strategic skills required; minimum 3 years of sales experience in a major market preferred; proficient with Excel, Word, One Domain, Wide Orbit Traffic, Rentrak and Power Point. Candidate must also have solid knowledge of new business development and digital sales.  We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

description: Summary Responsible for creating and developing relationships with large companies, associations, fraternal organizations, etc. in efforts to produce group ticket sales.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned. Maintain contact with all group accounts to provide superior service with focus on retaining current business and growing ticket revenue Proactively prospect and qualify new group clients Network at team and community events Follow-up on all sales leads to sell group tickets and assign seat locations to group accounts Secure and process payments of group ticket accounts Assist in game-day staffing needs for group customers Identify and convert opportunities to drive incremental season and partial ticket plans Act as contact on game days for American Family Field vendors related to group sales, including caterers and Arena Americas Create and maintain customer information for both existing accounts and prospects through Customer Relations Management Software, including logging of phone conversations, future action to be taken, and logging customer complaints Attend weekly sales meetings coming prepared to provide input on creative sales ideas and provide feedback on successes and challenges of previous week Handle additional projects as assigned by the Director - Group Sales or by the Senior Director - Ticket Sales Additionally, the individual may be responsible for any of the following group of responsibilities Provide full year service to online and other non-traditional group contacts and affiliated organizations Create and develop SuperGroups and other non-traditional Group Sales Work with other AE’s, American Family Field Vendors, and caterers to ensure the best possible customer service to group leaders Manage the booking of game day tailgate parties including Party Pavilions, Tailgate Haus, and Parking Lot Tailgates. Also, ensure that these areas are properly staffed and serviced on game days Work with Group Sales interns to organize and manage the group pre-sales Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. A.) from four-year college or university or two or more years of ticket sales and/or service experience in the sports industry; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Computer Skills  To perform the job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft office software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook, and Internet Explorer.  Language Skills  Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.  Mathematical Skills  Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.  Reasoning Ability  Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Work Environment  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  Our business purpose is to restore health and improve quality of life through the design and provision of device and management solutions for the treatment of Structural Heart disease. We aim to lead the markets we serve by requiring the solutions we offer customers provide an improved benefit/risk profile as compared to existing standards of care; a performance threshold that by definition, guides and ensures the productive output of our engineering, business development, and clinical research efforts result in outcomes that advance the standard of care.  The Clinical Sales Specialist provides clinical and sales support through education of current and potential customers, and procedure coverage with a defined region. In this role, the CSS will train interventional cardiologists, catheter lab staff and ancillary personnel on the use of Structural Heart products and provide technical support to physicians during procedures. The role is responsible for communicating product, clinical and market data to appropriate personnel and will support the company’s efforts to develop and implement product marketing strategies.  This position may be hired at different level, depending on the experience of the candidate. This position may travel in excess of 50%.  What You’ll Do Collaborate with Regional Account Managers to provide good case coverage and clinical outcomes for patients Serve as primary resource for clinical support in the areas of surgical coverage, troubleshooting and in-service education for company products Educate customer on the merits and proper clinical usage of company products. Inform customers of the latest product, therapy and technology developments in the industry. Actively engage in clinical, procedural and technical discussions and link data outcome to key messaging. Meet with existing and potential clients (health care providers) to identify their clinical needs, goals and constraints related to patient care and provide creative and feasible solutions. This role requires a strong clinical orientation with the ability to influence a variety of clinician personality types. Required  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING BS/BA or equivalent experience. 0-2+ years of related work experience within cardiovascular space. Preferred Degree in life sciences or medical training (RN, EMT, Perfusion, etc.) preferred. Strong clinical orientation, experience with products for use in interventional cardiology and cardiac surgery, familiarity with echo cardiology and other indirect imaging, also strongly preferred. Strong consideration will be given to candidates with EP (Electrophysiology) and SH (Structural Heart) sales experience. What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully:  www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.
industries: Hospital & Health Care

description: What We Do Matters Our mission is critical, and “good enough” simply isn’t good enough for us.  Everbridge is seeking an experienced Inside Sales Representative (ISR) for our scaling team of ISRs.  The Everbridge ISR team thrives on providing communities throughout the country with news and information that is both proximate and personally relevant. Our technology is critical in creating new communication paths that have never existed before. The Everbridge ISR Team mission is to sell the full suite of Everbridge critical communications products into commercial accounts up to 1000 employees or Healthcare accounts, with up to 200 beds.  The ideal candidate will be an experienced hunter/closer with a demonstrated track record of achievement selling into small to medium size businesses (SMB) in a full cycle, high volume closing role.  This position will be selling into one of our North American territories, from any geographical region within the US, and is therefore 100% remote-based, work-from-home opportunity.  What you’ll do: This is a full selling role that will include prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing new sales. The individual will focus on developing domain knowledge of products, competitors and target buyers in the finance industry. Candidates will primarily be responsible for selling on the phone and web.  What you’ll bring: Minimum of 2 years of new logo sales experience Excellent internet research and networking skills Experience conducting product demos and/or presentations using video conferencing technology Strong hunting, prospecting, and cold calling skills. Excellent verbal and written interpersonal, presentation and communication skills including PowerPoint. Must have a verifiable history of meeting or exceeding sales quotas. Fluency in English required.  Bonus if: You have 3+ years closing experience in above industries Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Business, Communications, Computer Science, Organizational Behavior, Security, Facilities Management or HR.   Accurate forecasting ability Salesforce.com power user skills Knowledge of LinkedIn, Salesloft, Rainking, Data.com, Inside View. Knowledge of IT Operations, QA and Application Development workflow. Closing experience in SaaS, Software, IT Ops, SW Development, Communications, Compliance, Security, IT Recruiting, Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery, HR, Facilities Management, Hardware or IT Services industries  Bridger Culture:   At Everbridge, we have a mission that matters – to keep people safe and businesses running during critical events. Our “Bridgers” join Everbridge to make a positive impact on the world through their work. The core of our company culture is built around making a difference. Our people are dedicated to solving problems during difficult times and challenging situations as our software was built to save lives.  We are a rapidly growing organization transforming the field of critical event management and need passionate, committed and determined individuals to help us carry out our mission. Our environment is dynamic, and our culture is constantly evolving and expanding in order to provide the best employee experience.

description: Born in 2014 by Creative Director, Max Svärdh and CEO, Albin Johansson, Axel Arigato is a Sweden based contemporary brand that started from an Instagram page and an idea to break into the footwear market. With deep roots in music, art, architecture and what is contemporary, Axel Arigato has defined itself by offering more than a product. It has been created to leave an experience at the front of mind, whether it’s via stores, online or through events. Axel Arigato currently has 7 stores, including London, Copenhagen, Stockholm, Gothenburg & Paris with more pending. Expanding from 2 people to now hiring over 100 members of staff in 7 years, Axel Arigato also operates a subsidiary office in London. Join us!  Axel Arigato is offering a full-time position for an experienced Wholesale Account Executive to help launch our coming expansion in the US. Based in New York you will be primarily responsible for effectively overseeing the wholesale accounts, maximizing growth on a global scale, exceeding targets, and identifying new business opportunities. You will have the opportunity to be amongst the first in place and make a significant contribution to the company's growth on the US market and lead the direction of a fast-growing young company.  This is a fantastic opportunity for a person passionate about fashion and our brand aesthetic to join the Axel Arigato team.     Responsibilities    Secure and facilitate the growth of the Axel Arigato brand through seasonal and in-season sales  Work closely with partners to ensure a high sell-through and brand knowledge  Customer relations maintenance: consolidation, reinforcement, development of the existing customer portfolio  Work to accelerate the increase of new wholesale accounts in line with the company strategy and targets and to maximize the full potential of existing accounts and research new business in assigned territories  Work by embracing our brand values  Train Department stores and independent retailers floor staff about Axel Arigato brand, products, materials, fabrics, and newest styles  Visit clients and prospects to maintain brand awareness and give market feedback (50%)  Represent Axel Arigato as the main contact for the accounts you manage  Work together with the marketing team to maximize exposure across different platforms  Partner with Production and Operations Department on commercial terms, discrepancies, reorders, returns, and samples requests.  Track sales and growth of all accounts; review weekly and YTD sales figures  Reporting: KPI’s and sales analysis, Products feedback  Participate in all markets/showrooms/trade shows 4, 6 times a year  Forecast sales, replenishment, new launches, collaborations  Achieving and exceeding Sales Goals  Explore new business opportunities and strategically partner while respecting existing retailer partnerships  Be an ambassador for the Axel Arigato brand with the ability to understand how to best communicate the brand identity.   Qualifications   Minimum Bachelor’s degree  Minimum 3 years experience in fashion/footwear - Sneakers  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Possess an outgoing personality with a desire to positively represent the Axel Arigato brand  Commitment to customer excellence  Planning and Organization  Strong reporting and analytical skills  Excel/system proficient  Achievement-oriented  Problem-solving skill  Multifunctional with strong organizational skills and attention to detail     Please apply by providing a brief motivation letter and CV as soon as possible. We will hire as soon as we find the right person.       Salary: According to agreement    Start date: According to agreement    Location: New York

description: People Source Consulting have an exciting role to work with a Sustainable Finance company based in Boston.  This is a huge opportunity to work with one of the best Sales Directors to progress in your career, you'll have an opportunity to learn new skills and will also be allowed a lot of autonomy.  I have an exciting position working for a Sustainability FinTech based in Boston, looking for someone who can work alongside Partners and Directors with direct exposure to clients and prospects. As part of your day-to-day tasks, you will collaborate closely with the Research and Product teams and the wider Arabesque group to deliver for our clients and strategic partners.  About the company:  This company is one of a partnership between leaders in finance, science, and sustainability to accelerate the transition to a more sustainable future. description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  A Day in the Life  At Medtronic, the Sales Representative II, Spine is responsible for making field sales calls, soliciting orders, selling assigned Medtronic Spinal and Biologics products and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the assigned territory; for maintaining an awareness of local competitive conditions and for reporting back promptly to the district manager.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: Selling implantable devices for specific therapies to physicians, institutions, payors, and other appropriate medical staff Maintaining Consignments and Loaner inventory, moving loaner sets between accounts as needed Keeping non usage and flight usage for products to a minimum level Providing field service and case coverage to customers per their individual needs Preparing and submitting field visit reports as required by District Sales Manager Maintaining up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with District Sales Manager instructions Aggressively visiting hospitals and solicit orders from present and prospective customers for the assigned products Aggressively seeking new customers and formulate and follow plans for such action as directed by the District Sales Manager. Handling customer complaints in accordance with Medtronic Spinal and Biologics policy and advise District Sales Manager and Medtronic Spinal and Biologics promptly of any situation beyond scope of authority Recommending the addition of new products and the modification or deletion of present products to the line as appropriate Meeting or exceeding sales quota and total company market share in assigned territory Staying attentive to competitor’s product and merchandizing practices and keep the District Sales Manager informed Attending and participating in sales meetings, training programs, conventions, and trade shows as directed Assisting in the field training of any sales person as requested by the District Sales Manager Cooperating with all personnel on the execution of Company programs Creating and implementing an annual business plan with quarterly updates Submitting reports and provide information as directed Adhering to company policies and conduct all business in an ethical manner Managing business with Medtronic Spinal and Biologics profitability in mind Traveling significantly within assigned territory to cover hospital cases, make account calls, move loaner sets to needed locations and attend meetings, training programs, conventions and trade shows Other duties as assigned Must Have: Minimum Requirements High School Diploma or GED AND a minimum of 7 years of sales experience with 5 of those 7 years in medical sales; or High School Diploma or GED AND 5 years of Medtronic RTG (Pain, Brain or Spine) Clinical Specialist or Sales Rep I experience plus 2 years of prior clinical or medical sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND a minimum of 5 years of sales experience with 3 of those 5 years in medical sales; or Associate’s Degree AND a minimum of 3 years of Medtronic RTG (Pain, Brain or Spine) Clinical Specialist or Sales Rep I experience plus 2 years of prior clinical or medical sales experience; or Bachelor’s Degree AND a minimum of 3 years of sales experience, with 1 of those 3 years in medical sales; or Bachelor’s Degree AND a minimum of 1 year of Medtronic RTG (Pain, Brain or Spine) Clinical Specialist or Sales Rep I experience plus 2 years of prior clinical or medical sales experience. Nice to Have Ability to interact effectively with a wide range of people and personalities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ortho, Spine or O.R. experience Physical Job Requirements While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile Required to interact with a computer for extended periods of time, and communicate with peers and co-workers Regularly required to talk or hear Occasionally required to sit and reach with hands and arms Regularly required to stand; walk and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools , or controls Must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds Specific vision abilities required by this job involve normal vision Ability to travel Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.  The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  ABOUT MEDTRONIC:  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  DISCLAIMER :  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position.  EEO STATEMENT:  It is the policy of Medtronic to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Medtronic will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  This employer participates in the federal E-Verify program to confirm the identity and employment authorization of all newly hired employees. For further information about the E-Verify program, please click here: http :// www.uscis.gov/e-verify/employees .  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 6, 2021 Travel: No

jobTitle: Account Executive, Group Ticket Sales - Denver Nuggets
description: Job Title: Account Executive, Group Sales – Denver Nuggets  Department: Ticket Sales & Service  Business Unit: Denver Nuggets  Location: Denver, CO  Reports To: Manager, Group Sales, Denver Nuggets  Employment Type: Full-Time, Non-Exempt  Supervisor Position: No  ______________________________________________________________________________  Kroenke Sports & Entertainment (KSE) is an American Sports and Entertainment holding company based in Denver, Colorado. KSE is committed to providing world class sports and entertainment for both live and broadcast audiences. We are the employer of choice as the owner and operator of Ball Arena, DICK’S Sporting Goods Park, the Paramount Theatre, 1STBANK Center, Denver Nuggets (NBA), the Colorado Avalanche (NHL), Colorado Mammoth (NLL), Colorado Rapids (MLS), Altitude Sports & Entertainment, Major League Fishing/Fishing League Worldwide (MLFLW), Winnercomm, Outdoor Sportsman Group and SkyCam.  Nature of Work  The Denver Nuggets are seeking highly motivated, coachable individuals who are passionate about generating ticket revenue on the business side of the sports industry. The Account Executive, Group Sales position focuses on selling group tickets, full season ticket memberships, partial season ticket plans, mini plans and premium seating through outbound touchpoints and face to face appointments for the Denver Nuggets. This position has a heavy focus on outbound prospecting with emphasis on driving new revenue through referrals, prospecting and networking while also maintaining relationships to renew group clientele annually and grow the overall book of business.  Examples of Work Performed Responsible for new ticket sales for the Denver Nuggets including group tickets, full season ticket memberships, partial season ticket plans, mini plans and premium seating. Potential to sell a full menu of ticket packages for the Colorado Avalanche, Colorado Rapids, and Colorado Mammoth. Prospects, networks, sets appointments, and aggressively sells a full menu of ticket packages. Responsible for maintaining/growing a base of group ticket accounts and executing any Fan Experiences that may be tied to them. Acquire knowledge and understanding of Denver Nuggets fans, their changing preferences, needs, wants and demographics Handles a high level of sales activity, including 250 touchpoints per week. Touchpoint activities include phone calls, meetings, emails/proposals, social media, networking events, etc. Maintains detailed records of clients and prospects in the CRM system Meets or exceeds defined sales and sales development goals. Represents, actively promotes, and sells teams at events (minimum of 43 events per year including Denver Nuggets home games, outside ticket events, ticket on-sales, chamber events, etc.). Perform various other duties as assigned by the Manager, Group Sales, Denver Nuggets This description is a summary only and is describing the general level of work being performed, it is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties of this position may change from time to time and/or based on business needs. We reserve the right to add or delete duties and responsibilities at the discretion of the supervisor and/or hiring authority.  Competencies/Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Completion of an Inside Sales program with a professional sports team is preferred. Works well in a team environment Always demonstrates a positive and professional attitude Strong people management skills Knowledge of organizational policies and procedures Strong written and verbal communication skills Excellent customer service skills Superior organizational skills Time Management Skills Ability to problem solve and resolve conflict quickly and effectively Knowledge of organizational policies and procedures Knowledge of computer systems and applications Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously with a high degree of detail against short deadlines Ability to quickly build rapport with customers and assess customer needs Advanced sales and service training Considerable knowledge of sales and service processes and procedures including Ticketmaster and Microsoft CRM Firm understanding of Kroenke Sports group ticket products, services, procedures Ability to acquire or produce and maintain a valid Colorado driver’s license and meet company vehicle driving standards Ability to work a varied schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Minimum of 1 Year Sales Experience in Sports, Entertainment, Hospitality, or related industry (Inside Sales preferred) Compensation  Based on qualifications and experience. Base Salary Range $24.04 per hour Eligible for commission plan Benefits Include 12 Paid Company Holidays Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision) Paid Time Off (PTO) Life Insurance Short and Long-term Disability Health Savings Account (HSA) Flexible Spending plans (FSAs) 401K plan All applicants for employment at KSE may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to commencing employment. Applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment may be required to produce proof of vaccination status prior to their first day of employment. Applicants with qualifying disabilities or bona fide religious objections, or who are pregnant, may be exempted from this requirement or otherwise accommodated if they are unable to be vaccinated.  Working Conditions & Physical Demands  Normal office environment. Requires prolonged sitting, some bending, stooping and stretching. Working Denver Nuggets games and events may require long periods of standing and walking. Occasionally lifting equipment for sales tables and events weighing up to 30 pounds. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity enough to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and eyesight to communicate clearly and effectively with prospects and clients.  Equal Employment Opportunity  Kroenke Sports & Entertainment (KSE) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Nonprofit Organization Management, and Entertainment

description: ** PLEASE ATTACH RESUME ** Syneos Health® is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization. The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration.  Are you passionate about discovering, developing and bringing more innovative medicines to help patients? Idorsia’s purpose is to discover, develop and bring more innovative medicines to help patients. Idorsia is an independent biopharmaceutical company specializing in the development of small molecules to meet significant unmet medical needs. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus.  Job Description: Reporting to the Syneos Health District Manager (DM), the Specialty Sales Representative (SSR) role is responsible for building relationships with recognized experts, HCPs, and prioritized stakeholders in the therapeutic area and integrated health care systems.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required • Minimum 2+ years life science sales experience • Experience in psych / PCP / Sleep Disorders preferred • Experience in retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales • Identify and develop business relationships with targeted Health Care providers • Achieve quarterly and annual sales goals • Identify key influencers and achieve designated customer interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • Understand and address both business and scientific-oriented needs of healthcare professionals by engaging in meaningful dialog to determine underlying patient needs and determine how products could address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • Implement and execute in a compliant manner marketing and sales direction to achieve territory promotional objectives • Communicate effectively with peers and management • Effective in front of the customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain expense and promotional budgets for the territory within guidelines • Must operate within Compliance Guidelines at all times • Adherence to Policies, Process and Procedures  At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality of life balance.  Why Syneos Health? Our employees voted Syneos Health as the overall winner in MedReps’ Best Places To Work In Medical Sales Awards. Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: Unlock Your Career Potential: Sales at ADP. It takes a relentless team to lead an industry. ADP's world-class sales team is driving our global growth as a worldwide leader of workforce solutions. If you believe in the power of relationships, we'll give you the tools, training and support you need to connect with new and current customers, ranging from Fortune 100 corporations to small start-ups. And as you achieve success, you'll enjoy the rewards, support and recognition you deserve.  ADP is hiring a National Accounts Sales Representative. In this position, you'll identify and cultivate new prospects with 1,000 or more employees in your territory, cross-sell solutions to existing clients, and effectively close sales, with the support of exceptional sales training and the rewards of advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits and awards.  At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.  We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.  Responsibilities Reach or exceed assigned sales goals Implement sales strategies Develop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospects Mine existing and prospective clients for referral business Establish and maintain good customer relations, with both internal and external customers Connect customers' business needs with ADP products and services Cross-sell other ADP solutions to existing clients Build network in person and via phone with key decision makers in a designated territory Qualifications Required 3 or more years of Enterprise level sales experience Preference will be given to candidates who have the following: Human Capital Management Sales, HCM, HR Outsourcing Sales Experience Hunter Mentality Enterprise resource planning ERP Workforce Management Explore our COVID-19 page https://jobs.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.  Minimum  Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents  Maximum  Compensation Type: Salary

description: Medical Device Sales - Urology  My medical device client is an innovative company that is growing a portfolio of surgical devices within a specialized field. They are seeking to hire a Medical Sales rep to cover and do new business development within an established territory. Responsibilities will include penetrating new business opportunities and managing clients. This position involves presentations to surgeons, being in the OR/surgical and follow-up, educational support.  Profile:  Medical Device Sales selling surgical instruments and/or disruptive medical innovations Seeking reps with longevity in positions, with most recent role 2-4 years+  Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree Min. 5+ years’ experience in Medical Device Sales and/or Surgical Sales Experience selling within an office setting required Knowledge / Understanding of urology and products, existing relationships preferred OR/surgical experience required Knowledge/Understanding of Healthcare reimbursement Experience with new innovative product launches Documented Sales Success of meeting and achieving sales goals Ability to develop and manage relationships amongst key decision makers Strong communication and presentation skills Ability to multi-task and prioritize Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Ability to travel as needed, possible overnights  Offering:  Base Salary $90,000 Year 1 @ plan $250,000 Uncapped earnings Expenses Advancement opportunities Full Benefits Package   Direct Sales Recruiting, LLC, (DSR) and DirectHR are National Recruitment organizations partnering with National, Regional and Local Clients to bring qualified candidates a career and a future. DSR offers over 50 years combined Recruitment, Sales and Management experience. description: Seeking a highly professional and results oriented Sales Representative with an excellent track record of success for our client, a vertically integrated Cannabis Cultivator, Processor and Bulk Cannabis extract company, looking to is expand their footprint within Washington State. The ideal Sales Representative candidate will possess exceptional management skills and be responsible for developing and maintaining effective key customer relationships by promoting the company’s product lines.  The Sales Representative will ensure that the company's brands are well knows with their distribution and retail partners, requiring a passionate, entrepreneurial mentality and a history of meeting and exceeding sales objectives.  Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute key sales objectives and initiatives to identify new business opportunities, and drive the Territory Sales Representatives to do the same Sell company Cannabis products within their territory and establish new accounts Develop and enhance effective customer relationships through leadership and support in managing the company’s various distribution channels to ensure effective market penetration and mutually respectful relationships with our customer partners Use of company car, computer and cell phone to travel and communicate with customers and prospects, up to 40-50%. Build and maintain a network of sources, to identify new sales leads and follow up with direct communications Vigilant presence in the community and with customers to strengthen brand and reputation Setting and achieving performance goals that are challenging and tied to overall company strategies  Required Skills and Education: Minimum 2-3 years Sales experience with a strong track record of success. High School Degree or Bachelor’s degree preferred Wholesale or direct retail sales experience preferred Expertise in CRM system use Relationship building and relationship management skills Microsoft Office skills should be intermediate level Knowledge of wholesale sales techniques to grow revenue and profits Experience in cannabis/consumer packaged goods/alcohol and beer/food or beverage industry  Compensation: $35K Base Salary, Plus Generous Commission Structure and Benefits  Location: Washington State  If this sounds like the position you have been waiting for, please apply using the online application or the link below - all inquiries are strictly confidential. Our focus is to assist you to make your best next career move, and we will not use your information for any other purpose. CannabizTeam is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. www.cannabizteam.com

description: You are a technology sales person with at least 5 years of sales experience supporting Enterprise level accounts. You love HUNTING for new business, and thrive on the challenge of hunting & identifying new business opportunities within named accounts. You are up for the challenge of becoming an expert on Citrix solutions, and are comfortable driving business within the Enterprise space with customers. You are ready to reap the rewards of turning Greenfield accounts into valued Citrix customers that you will manage. You are experienced managing and exceeding million dollar quotas. This is a remote based position with travel to customer locations or corporate meetings, as needed. This position covers named accounts in the Southwest US region. Position Overview: As a Greenfield Sales Rep, you will establish relationships and engage with business and IT management to identify opportunities and sell Citrix products and services. In this role, you will be responsible for Greenfield account development working off of a named account list. You will develop Enterprise level accounts with high potential into accounts with regular revenue generation; & create partnership-based relationships with customers. You will be the face of Citrix for our customers, and you will help propel Citrix by driving the company’s revenue and growth. This is a great opportunity for someone interested in continued career growth in sales within Citrix, a global organization that is continuously recognized for its world-class products! Role Responsibilities:  Carrying a revenue quota to meet or exceed sales targets within assigned accounts Prospecting into named customer accounts, building relationships, presenting Citrix solutions and closing deals Interacting strongly with customers at the Senior Management level with support on forming a relationship with C level contacts Developing and maintaining account strategies to drive adoption of Citrix products and services Establishing and leading teams of internal and external resources to identify, pursue, and close specific opportunities Establishing and maintaining close relationships with sales teams as well as with external partners Understanding and documenting customers’ business IT strategies, priorities, and goals, and driving prompt resolution of customer issues to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction Understanding and navigating account procurement practices to negotiate licensing contracts Serving as the primary client contact for non-technical or support issues requiring escalation Ensuring accurate and timely forecasts in SalesForce.com and providing updates to management Preferred Skills/Requirements:  3+ years selling SaaS to enterprise accounts Experience working with greenfield accounts- desire to hunt for new business Consistent track record working with customers, up-selling of products, contract renewals and QBRs Track record of developing new sales through prospecting accounts Experience working with external partners to develop and close business within enterprise accounts Strong record of meeting or exceeding enterprise sales quotas in excess of $1 million a year Experience in a minimum of 1 to 2 of the following areas of expertise: application and core technology (database, operating systems, application platforms, hardware, networking), internet solution selling (service, hardware, software), and/or networking, security and/or WAN optimization Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant experience required 5+ years of technology sales experience Must have the ability to travel to customer accounts and corporate meetings as needed
