description: Sales Operations Specialist Who you are: My client; the global leader in training, technology, and consulting is looking for a Sales Operations Specialist to join their award-winning organization!  You are a results-oriented person who loves problem-solving and is creative in your approach to solutions. You are eager to contribute to this role via your excellent communication skills, your analytical thinking, and your process orientation. You are an independent thinker who is self-motivated and enjoys a fast-paced work environment. You pride yourself on your negotiation and influencing skills. What you’ll do: As our Sales Operations Specialist, you will support our growing Sales team with day-to-day activities and provide cross-functional support. To be successful in this position, you must be able to enable team success through process improvement by utilizing quality data and insights. You will manage logistics, create Sales team presentations and content, organize team events, and be responsible for scheduling and managing calendars. Other responsibilities are listed below, and this position will report to the Director, Sales Operations. Assist with team-related operations, including team meetings, external meetings, and other miscellaneous tasks Create and maintain presentation decks Ensure our internal Sales processes are executed with efficiency and quality; monitor compliance and proactively identify opportunities for improvement Support the Sales team at all stages of the sales cycle; act as the main point of contact for Sales Operations queries Partner with the Director, Sales Operations to manage Salesforce system data & maintenance Implement and assist in developing sales strategies and forecasts to drive high-level planning and goal setting Help manage the adoption and customization of the Salesforce CRM and other sales tools; this includes lead gen funneling/routing  Aid in the development, monitoring, and managing of data analytics tools and dashboard Deliver reports on performance metrics (high level of accuracy, quality, and consistency). Develop new reports/tools as needed Train new hires on Sales team processes & systems, creating training resources as needed  What you bring: You have at least 2 years of professional experience in Sales Operations (ideally in business reporting and data analysis). You are proficient in Salesforce and are working toward becoming an expert. Finally, you possess excellent computer skills including, Microsoft Office Suite - Outlook, Excel, Word & PowerPoint. What we can offer you: Competitive compensation packages based on experience and relevant skillset. Full benefits package including medical, dental, vision, retirement plan, unlimited PTO plan, and more. Opportunity to join a high-growth business launching into its next phase of transformation. A collaborative culture of smart, hard-working people that support one another to get the job done!
industries: Management Consulting

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Sales/Account Manager will, with guidance, sell directly to the consumer or business purchaser or indirectly through various sales channels. We seek a results-oriented professional who is comfortable conducting face-to-face and remote sales with new and existing customers. In this role, you will assist in evaluating customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and solutions.  Key Accountabilities Help identify potential customers and handle existing customer relationships. With guidance conduct market research and pricing, sales and merchandising activities. Monitor customer and competitor activity and industry trends. Protect, grow and diversify the relationship with targeted customers. Support business growth by disseminating favorable information about the organization and its products and services. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Position Information  The business will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.  Qualifications  Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Customer Relationship Management software Locations: Arizona, Louisiana, New Mexico, Mississippi and Texas.  Preferred location: Texas.  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

jobTitle: Sales Representative - Kansas City East - Surgical Technologies
description: Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As a Surgical Technologies Sales Representative, you strategically promote and sell Stryker Surgical Technologies products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As a Surgical Technologies Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need 5+ years in an outside sales position (medical related fields or b2b sales preferred) or Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In February 2019, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that for the ninth consecutive year has been named as one of the 2018 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For ranking 11 out of 100. Some of our other awards from 2018 include Great Places to Work for Inclusion, Women, Millennials, and Diversity.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn More About The Surgical Technologies Products  Stryker’s Hidden Scar Program Advanced approach to removing breast cancer  Invuity Transforming minimal access surgeries through advanced visualization  Neptune Moving surgical suction forward  SafeAir See through the smoke, know the truth  SurgiCount Helping you in your fight against retained surgical sponges  Cactus A better, greener waste solution to help reduce diversion of controlled substances  Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Medical Devices

description: EnGoPlanet is a well funded Award Winning Clean Energy Start-Up. The company was founded on a vision of delivering clean, managed “wireless energy” to meet the global need for reliable, low-cost solar power for street lighting, telecom, security, and IoT devices, as well as other mission-critical systems.  The company has recently completed a Series A investment led by Sallyport Holdings, who have  billions of dollars worth of exits under their belt, and are actively involved, young, and ready to support high-growth technology companies like EngoPlanet. You’ll be standing shoulder to shoulder with industry makers and company builders.   Position We are looking for someone that believes in our vision to provide environmentally-friendly and sustainable products. The Sales Executive will be an integral part of our business & sales team and will play a key role in building out our sales operation. This is an ideal position for a person that thrives in working within a young and nimble work environment that’s invested in the long-term growth and success of its business.    What You Will Do  Identify potential clients within target segments and geography. Participate in seminars and conferences in the capacity of speaker, panelist and exhibitor, thereby consistently adding new opportunities to EnGoPlanet’s sales pipeline. Qualify prospects, analyze their needs and develop a sales strategy for each opportunity. Negotiate all commercial aspects of contracts related to new sales. Close contracts related to new sales. Manage all phases of the sales process, including all relations to the customer.    What You Will Need to Succeed 1 – 3 years of applicable sales experience. Possess the ability to effectively prioritize and quickly solve challenges & roadblocks. Highly motivated self-starter who is organized, reliable, and sales-driven. Must have a growth mindset and be entrepreneurial! Experience working within the renewable energy space is a plus. Experience working within a complex subscription based sales model environment is a plus.     What’s in it For You You will have the unique opportunity to help develop EnGoPlanet’s North American sales operations.       As one of the first hires you will have a tremendous amount of opportunities for professional development and upward mobility.  EnGoPlanet is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to promoting the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it is through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances.
industries: Renewables & Environment

description: Company Brand Overview  Pulmuone is a LOHAS, Lifestyle of Health &Sustainability, company that seeks to promote beautiful harmony between people and the earth. Pulmuone Foods USA brands include Nasoya, Wildwood, Emerald Valley Kitchen, Monterey Gourmet Foods, and Cibo Naturals. Pulmuone’s family of brands provides our consumers a wide variety of delicious products that are inspired by contemporary flavor palates and encourage a healthy and sustainable lifestyle. Visit www.pulmuonefoodsusa.com to learn more about the company and brands.  The Regional Account Manager is responsible for the management and continued growth of targeted key regional accounts as outlined. This position will work closely with these designated accounts at the category level and above to drive sales growth and profitability through the execution of the “Pulmuone Way” process, through effective communication providing a “Plan Of Action” for each key account, to our Regional Territory Teams.  Job Responsibilities Include But Not Limited To Develop strategies for annual business plan within authorized trade spending parameters, utilizing the OGSM tools to achieve alignment internally and externally Accurately manage volume forecasts and maximizes trade efficiency by understanding the demand and key business drivers for the customer and/or channels Develop Smart goals and objectives with the team in a timely manner ensures the team makes the link between development plan, coaching plan, and performance management Proactively identify potential problems and develop plans to overcome them Effectively communicates and collaborates with others to maximize POA effectiveness Leverage a deep understanding of customer and channel strategies to influence growth and drive mutually beneficial results Engenders trust and confidence while developing strong relationships across all levels both internally and externally Possesses significant knowledge of the different brands and products under the Plant-forward and Asian Inspired categories Manages and analyzes the health of the portfolio by using a data-driven approach to evaluate and prioritize new product launches Effectively communicate in a variety of presentation settings one on one, small/large groups, with peers, direct reports, and supervisors. Gains support and commitment of others to drive business results externally and or internally Committed to creating challenging goals and demonstrates resilience achieving them Leads the team in pursuing market-leading solutions; that the customer request, over-delivering on their request and presents opportunities they were not expecting Domestic travel: up to 40% Other duties as assigned Skills / Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field preferred Min. 8+ years’ experience in Sales (food experience preferred), with at least 5 years servicing major/national retail accounts In-depth understanding of the key accounts. description: JOB DESCRIPTION TITLE: Regional Account Manager SUPERVISED BY: National Sales Manager SUPERVISES: N/A FEDERAL LABOR STATUS: Non-Exempt (Hourly) SUMMARY Standex is a diversified global manufacturing company operating in five segments which consist of Engraving, Engineering Technologies, Electronics, Scientific Solutions, and Specialty Solutions. Our market-leading manufacturing brands are recognized for quality and innovation. The position is based outside of Charleston in Summerville, South Carolina, at the Scientific Solutions division location, Horizon Scientific. Standex International Corporation is based out of Salem, NH (NYSE: SXI). Horizon Scientific is a fast-growing manufacturer and distributor of medical and laboratory equipment with specific focus on Research and Clinical Life Science Labs within the Pharmaceutical, Biotech, Hospital and University Markets. Horizon Scientific’s 100,000 sq. Ft. facility includes sheet metal fabrication, an automated powder coat paint booth, environmental temperature testing rooms, temperature testing, mapping and data logging stations. The position offers a variety of benefits, including: · Competitive Salary and Benefit plans · Healthcare Plan including health/dental/vision insurance · 401K Plan with Company Match · Life Insurance · Other Insurance Options: HSA, FSA, AD+D · Paid Time Off · Paid Holidays Summary: Due to an ever-increasing number of new products and markets, Horizon is expanding its sales team and seeks a dynamic individual to play a vital role in its sales and marketing efforts. Responsibilities will include account management, training, and support of distributors and regional customers. Interacting with customers, distributor product & sales managers as well as sales representatives to promote products and implement product training will require excellent organizational, presentation, and communication skills. This position requires a 4-year degree and a minimum of three years of sales experience. Majority of time will be spent at Summerville offices, but some travel (20% - 25%) throughout the US will be required. This position will report directly to the National Sales Manager. DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES · Build and maintain strong relationships with regional customers to maximize market share with Horizon’s product portfolio · Develop sales and marketing action plans for assigned accounts · Complete quarterly key account business reviews, constantly identifying new opportunities for growth. · Develop presentation materials and perform training to sales representatives · Consistently identify new sales opportunities and effectively manage sales funnel with existing and prospective accounts. · Follow up on inbound sales leads · Identify new product and market opportunities, and present recommendations to leadership. · Conduct market research to identify industry trends and monitor competitive landscape. · Jointly coordinate customer visits with sales representatives · Represent company and products at exhibitions and customer national sales meetings. · Prepare competitive product comparisons. · Assist customers with technical product questions. · Work closely with customer service, technical service, engineering, marketing, production, shipping, and accounting to effectively meet customer needs and to promptly solve any problems that arise. · Assist with special projects as needed · Submit timely reports with account updates, sales opportunities, and project status. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES · Bachelor’s degree from a 4-year university · Minimum 3 years’ experience with proven track record in a related role · Experience with account management, sales support, or a related customer-facing role required. · Knowledge of working with distributors and independent sales representatives preferred. · Knowledge of healthcare and/or laboratory research industries preferred · Must have strong presentation and demonstration skills, and represent the company in a profession manner · Ability to communicate with executives, sales managers, and field sales personnel confidently and effectively. · Must have strong direct sales and negotiation skills. · Excellent time management and organization skills · Ability to work under minimal supervision and effectively manage priorities in a fast-paced environment. · Must have strong technical skills, with ability to learn and communicate features of complex products to customers · Prepared to travel anytime. · Excellent interpersonal and project management skills. · Must be proficient in MS Office and virtual presentation applications. · Must pass drug and background check. DISCLAIMER The above job description is not an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position and in no way, is to be construed as a contract. As with all positions, employment is “at will” or voluntary on both the part of the Company and the employee. Employment is not for a set period of time and may be discontinued by either party for any reason with or without notice. Horizon Scientific is committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace, and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers, and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at 843-821-8010 to request accommodation.

description: Principle Responsibilities: Drive sales of all Crane Instrumentation & Sampling (I&S) products within defined geographic territory to achieve profitable growth. Identify key influencers at Target Key Accounts and End Users to develop and implement sales strategies aligning our value propositions for their applications. Become champion of Crane Business System (CBS) and use the tools as part of standard work to achieve results. Work closely with Key Account Team within Crane to develop strategies for Target End Users in Refining and Chemical Industries. Drive execution of MRO business and develop conversion accounts. Identify and Manage projects in territory through IIR (Industrial Info Resources) and the Global Project Tracker tool from the Crane Business System. Maintain a detailed and comprehensive knowledge of the product line and the value proposition within specific applications. Work closely with the Crane CP&E Sales team to develop common strategy. Assist Business Line Managers in New Product Development and sales integration with Target End Users and Channel. Develop sales forecast for each product line to assist Business Line Managers with production. Monitor and report competitive landscape within territory for all I&S products. Conduct lunch and learns for distribution channels, end users, and EPC’s as required. Manage Midwest territory within the guidelines of budgets, reporting, and distribution management. Create and distribute weekly reports with information from sales calls and market conditions.  Qualifications / Experience / Personal characteristics: Bachelor’s degree in technical field. Five years of experience in Outside Sales managing similar product with Channel and End Users preferred. Applied experience working with mechanical valves, pneumatic and hydraulic systems, instrument hookups and process analytical samplers. Domestic travel is required. Proven track record of valve or instrument sales in Industrial or Oil & Gas markets (at least 3-5 years desirable) Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with ability to quickly build relationships with Channels and End Users. Knowledge of how to create a product differentiation, value proposed, product advantage to win MRO and project orders versus competition. Strong listening skills with the ability to assimilate information and translate it into customer solutions. High energy team player and competitor. High proficiency with MS products (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint).

description: Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership  The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.  Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs.  Responsible for driving sales for specific customer accounts or region. You will achieve increased sales targets from existing accounts/customers aligned with business initiatives. You will increase sales by recommending new product offerings to existing customers. You will be responsible for increasing the customer base and influence cross-functional teams to eliminate barriers to sales success. You will drive new customer leads to outside sales. You will liaise with multiple factions to help prevent and resolve customer problems. You will analyze sales statistics and business needs to provide recommendations to customers and stakeholders.  Key Responsibilities Identify Opportunities Plan Accounts Negotiate and Close Support Administrate Sales Cycle Deliver Value Proposition to Customers Manage Sales Cycle Momentum Deliver Communications to Customers YOU MUST HAVE Associates degree, or equivalent. 3 years of experience in the field. WE VALUE SalesForce.com experience Advanced degree Knowledge of key sales concepts, practices, and procedures Excellent communication skills Demonstrated ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Demonstrated ability to operate independently Ability to use experience to appropriately apply the established standards Demonstrated ability to attain sales quotas/targets Prior industry experience Additional Information JOB ID: req308638 Category: Sales Location: 2100 Apollo Drive,Brook Park,Ohio,44142,United States Nonexempt Global (ALL)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Job overview Yumpingo is seeking a goal-crushing experienced Enterprise Sales Executive with a passion for food and feedback. You will have the opportunity to sell industry leading Software-as-a-Service solutions to some of the most respected mid-market/enterprise restaurants, bars, and entertainment establishments in your assigned territory. An ideal candidate will have an established network and experience selling software solutions into the restaurant and hospitality industry.   This is an ideal opportunity for someone who wants to leverage existing connections and forge new relationships with high-value prospects using Yumpingo’s sales playbook and process to increase Yumpingo’s footprint in the US hospitality market.   If you are motivated by advancing early-stage companies, have a history of achieving quota, and are experienced in a consultative sales approach we would love to hear from you!  About Yumpingo Launched in the UK in 2017, Yumpingo is a Guest Experience Management SaaS, bringing big data analytics to restaurant operations by tapping into the silent majority of guests’ in-moment restaurant experiences through technology touchpoints. Our award-winning platform enables restaurant leaders to make informed decisions, faster, and with greater confidence - turning data into insights and actions at unprecedented levels. Yumpingo gives restaurants complete certainty of how to optimize customer satisfaction across brands at location, shift, server and dish level. The ultimate effect is a transformation of the business as proven through numerous case studies which boast increased sales and improved customer satisfaction, and we’re just getting started.  “This is a game-changing way of looking at guest feedback.  It's a magical breakthrough. And I don’t say that lightly – I have a very high bar.” Jim Hyatt,  CEO at California Pizza Kitchen  Key Roles & Responsibilities  Actively engage with key restaurant decision-makers in the Mid-Market/Enterprise segments Ability to manage strategic accounts and opportunities, balancing prospecting and closing initiatives High degree of organization and discipline that allows you to manage time for prospecting, deal management, research, order processing and reporting Drive the entire sales cycle from initial customer engagement to closed sales (and in some cases through delivery) Prospect for potential customers using various methods such as calling, email, LinkedIn, and networking Qualify prospects against company criteria for ICP and identify needs through proper discovery Consult with prospects about business challenges and requirements, find the right solution fit, and effectively demonstrate the value proposition to meet the customer’s needs Maintain a high level of relevant industry and product knowledge Present to prospects, and internal teams (demos, proposals, QBRs, etc.) Work with internal teams and product specialists where required to address customer requirements Develop and maintain territory plans which outline how sales targets will be met on an ongoing basis and identifies trends in your territory Keep detailed notes on prospect and customer interactions in Salesforce, Groove, and other provided sales tools  Provide forecasts on best case and most likely sales volumes over relevant time periods Cultivate strong relationships and manage commercial activities with partner companies that may be required to deliver full solutions to customers Provide feedback to sales management on ways to decrease the sales cycle, enhance bookings, and improve internal processes, and customer experience Provide internal feedback on market trends, competitive landscape, and opportunities to deliver greater value to customers Be a positive representative of the company and its brand in the marketplace Conduct all sales activities with the highest degree of professionalism and integrity  Requirements  Be an outstanding teammate Be a self starter Be curious - strive for more, seek to understand  Highly organized and motivated Open to growth and feedback Skilled in use of sales tools (Salesforce, Groove, LinkedIn, Sales Navigator) Must prioritize outbound calling and take pride in cultivating net new business Experienced in using sales methodologies Experience working in or with restaurants is a must Successful sales track record required - selling SaaS into the hospitality sector preferred  Travel may be required (20% or more)  Additional Requirements  5-7 years of relevant work experience required Outstanding references required Right to work in the US Location: Austin, TX or remote for the right candidate  What we’re offering Working with a passionate and hungry team Being part of our progressive ‘Global & Remote First’ culture Salary and commission plan to attract the best  Company laptop & home working allowance 401K and benefits plan Generous holiday allowance Some amazing food!  Notes We don’t work with third-party recruiters. Due to the volume of applications, we might not be able to respond to everyone. You must have the right to work in the US and submit information about any potential restrictions with your application.

Sales Development Representative As a Sales Development Representative at Prezzee, you'll be responsible for prospecting and qualifying new business leads and for assisting the AEs in the sales cycle. This is a high impact role in our team that is perfectly suited for an experienced SDR who is relentlessly optimistic, genuinely curious, and who deeply believes in delivering awesome customer experiences. We move at lightning speed and have loads of growth opportunities for people who thrive working in a fast-paced startup environment!  Hi! We’re Prezzee - Nice to Formally Meet You Have you ever sat and thought about how you can make gift-giving a more enjoyable experience? Ok so maybe it’s not an everyday thought, but it really would come in handy on your mom’s birthday, am I right? Maybe the thought has never crossed your mind, but don’t worry...Prezzee has it all figured out. We bring the fun, magic, and personalization back into sending digital gift cards.  Founded in Australia in 2014, we have experienced record-breaking year over year growth at over 500% (if you’re keeping track, that’s a lot of gift cards). Not only do we have the perfect gift for your mom (and your dad, and your best friend, and your Uncle Tom), but we also partner with businesses to help them reward their employees at scale! With over 200 retail partners and 21 million customers, Prezzee has swooped in and dominated the digital gift card industry in Australia, and we’re looking to do the same in the US, UK and New Zealand.  Outside of our external growth, our internal team is what sets us apart. Our team may be spread out across multiple time zones, but our core values remain the same no matter where you are in the world. As a future employee of Prezzee, you’re signing up to give openness, give greatness, give magic, and most importantly, always give a damn. Oh, and if you’re wondering about our culture? The people are the #1 reason employees say they stay with Prezzee. We’re a collaborative, tight-knit crew that cares about our customers and each other. Our leaders encourage thoughtfulness, compassion, being humble, and we have a bit (read: a lot) of fun along the way.  The Role You’ll Play as a Sales Development Representative Partner closely with senior Account Executives to build territory strategy, business plan to ensure effective pipeline generation and revenue results Generate new pipeline by contacting potential clients through cold calls and emails to assess fit for company’s solutions Create an amazing first impression, effectively presenting company to prospective customers pipeline creation  Certain Skills are Important, Like…  BS / BA and 1+ years of sales experience, experience with gift cards, loyalty, rewards, and incentives is a plus. Demonstrated success in meeting monthly targets Quantitative track record of exceptional performance and a strong professional trajectory Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques - including cold calls Experience with CRM software -Hubspot preferred Understanding of sales performance metrics Excellent communication skills both written and verbal and diplomacy in all interactions Outstanding time management skills Goal oriented and team player Experience with meeting challenges with solutions and track record of learning and engaging new ideas through that process Strategic thinking with a bias towards action A desire to grow into a Senior Sales role Outgoing and friendly - you are easy to talk to  This is a San Francisco based position. Only on-site employment will be considered- we work a hybrid schedule.  More than a Job Where you work isn’t just a career decision -- it’s a life decision. We get it. That’s why we want our Planet Prezzee Team to feel a sense of belonging that comes from feeling supported in all areas of their lives. Everyone has family, friends and interests outside of their careers, so we offer perks and benefits to make work work better for you.  · Competitive compensation, including a solid bonus structure for every role. We all have individual goals, but we also stick to team goals, because at the end of the day - we’re all in this together. · 4 weeks PTO, plus 5 sick days, and 9 holidays. Whether it's hiking to a waterfall in Costa Rica or bonding with your couch, we all need downtime. All employees get four weeks paid time off, 5 sick days, and enough holidays to make a banker blush. · We’ve got you covered. We offer health insurance plans that include medical, dental, and vision that include employee and family plans. · Get paid to work with your friends. We offer a generous bonus for any employee that we hire based on your referral.  Interview Process: What to Expect Applying for a job can feel intimidating and like a full-time job of its own. You shouldn’t have to burn through a week of sick time or use all your best out-of-office excuses just to put feelers out for a new career opportunity. We want to be as transparent about the process as possible to help ease your mind. It’s our goal to provide you a fair, efficient interviewing experience that respects you and your time — and to do it all with a sidecar of delight.  Once you submit an application, we’ll review it. If you’re a good fit, you’ll have an initial chat with a recruiter over the phone. A video interview with a manager typically follows. Then we’ll set up your final video interview, answer any questions you have, and give you a feel for what it’s really like to work at Prezzee. You’ll round out the process by getting some face to face time (via video!) with our CEO, Tony Karp. If you're on the fence, just give it a try. We’re hoping it’s just the beginning of the best move you’ll ever make. Just remember, Michael Scott reminded us that Wayne Gretzky said you’ll miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.

description: ALULA is the leading professional security, IoT and smart home company.  ALULA’s flexible solutions enable our partners to efficiently adapt to the needs of today’s modern home and business owners. We provide our customers with fully integrated solutions that encompass everything from hardware and embedded firmware to cloud software and mobile apps.  The Regional Sales Manager-Midwest Region position requires an experienced, reliable and results-oriented person who is dedicated to the growth of the region, covering multiple states. In this position, the main focus will be to execute the business plan, with emphasis on new partner acquisitions while maintaining strong business relationships at the “C” level with key customers, under the direction of the Director of Sales. This role requires strong attention to detail, exceptional written and oral communication skills and complete confidentiality.   Essential Functions including but not limited to:  Develop and implement plans to create strategic account wins with tier 1 & 2 security dealers and integrators New business development through strong prospecting and closing sales with our new Security and Home Automation platform.  Ensure the region successfully meets and exceeds all revenue, profitability, and market share targets across all solutions. Promote and market Alula’s solution offerings, ensuring that the company achieves positive brand equity and captures market/mind share Develop customer proposals to secure new business and achieve regional objectives Develop and grow strong sales pipeline, month-over-month, managed through SalesForce.com Responsible for achieving forecasts on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis Responsible for achieving revenue targets on monthly, quarterly & annual basis Responsible for complete and accurate on-going maintenance of accounts, forecasts, proposals, and account activity in the company customer relationship management (CRM) tool Salesforce.com Perform special projects as directed by management Travel long distance or air as needed; 75% travel.  Other duties as assigned  Work Experience and Skill Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree Business Administration, Marketing or related area Preferably the candidate resides Midwest area.  Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in technology sales.  Proven track record in sales, managing a large geographic territory, with a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in technology sales.  Excellent organization and time management skills with an ability to think proactively and prioritize work A strong background in selling SAAS is a plus Consistent successful track record of accomplishment in sales with go-getter mentality Exceptional planning, time management, communication, decision-making, presentation, and organization skills.  Excellent communication, persuasion, and negotiation skills. Experience with using and maintaining CRM, Salesforce.com. Ability to manage larger geographic territory and achieve revenue targets Ability to travel. Extensive long-distance, overnight, air travel required 75%  Come join a market leading company that is fun, humble and committed to their employees and partners. We have a collaborative team culture and we help make lives safer every day. You will have access to products to keep your home protected. We offer competitive compensation, great benefits, Flex Time Off instead of PTO and so much more.    We are an Equal Opportunity Employer  Ready to join an innovative company? Apply now… For more information please visit: www.ALULA.com

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - Southwest Michigan - Orthopaedic Instruments
description: Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As an Orthopaedic Instruments Associate Sales Representative, you assist in strategically promoting and selling Stryker Orthopaedic Instruments products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and Sales Representative(s) you are supporting to push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As an Orthopaedic Instruments Associate Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. As an Associate Sales Representative you may be asked to cover open territories, which will give you the opportunity to grow in your responsibilities.  What You Need Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University 1-2 years in medical device or B2B sales preferred Travel Requirement Approximately 20% travel. Must have a valid driver’s license and be able to drive an automobile. Physical Requirements Medium work: exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects Coordination of the eye, hand and foot movement with an ability to grasp by hand and meet cognitive demands to include visual and auditory discrimination / memory, reading ability and memory retention Mental Requirements Exercise discretion and independence when applying professional expertise Must be able to manage time, projects, stress and conflict Must possess strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication Must be able to bring tasks through to completion with minimal supervision Must have the ability to prioritize work and keep detailed and confidential records Must be able to communicate / present to large groups of people Must possess unwavering ethics & integrity in a competitive and demanding work environment What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn more about Orthopaedic Instrument Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/orthopaedic-instruments.html  #LIInstruments  Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better

description: The AE role is critical to the success of Iridium Technology, with a primary responsibility of identifying and developing new opportunities with prospective customers in the assigned territory. The AE is a domain expert in legal industry finance and Iridium Technology products. This individual will partner, collaborate and plan with the Iridium sales, marketing, and management teams to develop leads and manage the sales cycle from demand generation through opportunity close. Negotiation and closing skills are a must. Prospects will view this individual as someone who can help them solve critical business problems. This is a work-from-home position and requires the candidate to be a self-starter with a strong discipline to achieve outcomes.  Reports To: CRO - Sales  Accountabilities Achieve defined 12-month new sales objective through a combination of telephone, web, e-mail based, and some live activity to new prospects.[TJ1] [RW2] [RW3] Identify potential new customers utilizing effective prospective selling techniques to expand customer base. Fully apprise the management team of monthly sales trends, making recommendations for adjustments to tactical plans. Develop an in-depth understanding of the Iridium portfolio offerings as well as competitive products/services to articulate the benefits and advantages of Iridium’s solutions, and handle customer concerns or objections. Forecast and manage account/opportunity detail using internal sales tools. Opportunity data is expected to be maintained on a daily basis. Collaborate with management, product owners, and Marketing to develop and create necessary Sales materials and maintain online repository of sales content Network with industry leadership, C-level executives, and other key influencers to understand, analyze and share unique client information and industry insights. Establish relationships with multiple contacts across the firm. Create ongoing messaging to the target population. This includes newsletter, webinar, and other materials to support product value and adoption. Accurately and efficiently document information gathered from clients, and, document interactions in the sales process in CRM systems and other formats as required. Daily updating is the expected cadence. Accurately and consistently report progress of territory plan toward meeting revenue quota goals via forecast/pipeline reports to and meetings with Sales management. Utilize and drive adoption on all required processes, tools, systems, sales metrics, and reporting tools. Approximately 30% overnight travel to client meetings, sales meetings, training programs, trade shows, company internal management meetings, etc. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications Relevant Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience (Information Technology, Accounting/Finance, etc.). * Ideal candidates will have a minimum of 7 years of new business sales success in legal industry finance technology or finance software solutions. * Demonstrated drive and experience to sell and win business successfully. * Must have the ability to travel overnight for work related events* Ability to build strong relationships with others to establish a network of relationships with individuals who can provide information, help or access to others. Politically savvy to understand and manage the matrix relationships in the legal industry. Includes the ability to identify the real decision-makers and key influencers and predict how new events or situations will affect individuals and groups within the organization. Excellent interpersonal and communication (oral & written) skills required. Executive presence, communication and presentation skills to convince customers to purchase Iridium Technology products and services. Strong collaboration and team skills required. Strong time management skills. Ability to work independently with and assist others in a team environment. Ability to perform research quickly and expertly, including utilizing appropriate search techniques to uncover valuable industry events and insights. Proven investigation or probing skills to uncover sales opportunities. Be curious. Experience working in a fast-paced competitive environment is preferred Strong business acumen. Proficiency in MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel and Internet Explorer. Experience with Hubspot CRM is a plus. Critical qualifications for role, no exceptions Please visit to find out more information about the organization.  https://www.iridium-technology.com/

description: SALES EXECUTIVE - Digital Marketing  Let's talk about the role.   Attane is seeking a self-motivated, results-driven Sales Executive to join our rapidly growing organization. As a Sales Executive you are a hunter with demonstrated over achievement. You enjoy a challenge, and have a love for the fast paced, variety that working with multiple clients provide. You're a master at owning the sales cycle from beginning to end, identifying key stakeholders, and driving solutions to complex business problems. You will drive the sales process in a performance-based environment, be responsible for engaging with new customers, accelerating the sales process, and closing new business. We have an amazing team that works to deliver in a collaborative and innovative manner. This is an exciting opportunity within an environment where you understand the value of sales to an organization and incredibly sales growth opportunity for you.   The Sales Executive will be responsible to cultivate and secure new business relationships, selling Attane products and services, in their defined territory. Success in this position is based on the achievement of defined new business sales and revenue production goals.   Some challenges you’ll tackle:    Achieve defined new sales targets and in year revenue production goals. Develop and present a comprehensive, annual territory plan designed to articulate the best options to achieve assigned sales targets. Develop and present Target Account plans, as requested, designed to surface large scale new business opportunities. Proactively drive new pipeline development through appropriate sales engagement tactics which may include but are not limited to cold calling, email communications, social media, and trade show participation. Engage and educate prospects regarding Attane’s solution offering and value proposition with the intention of driving quick qualification decisions. Facilitate prospect meetings whether in person, via conference call or leveraging digital collaboration tools and achieve volume and quality-related goals for sales engagements. Responsibly engage internal subject matter experts in support of sales cycle progression when required. Leverage the sales methodology employed by Attane to qualify, progress, engage and close new business opportunities. Manage detailed pipeline and opportunity information updates in Attane’s Salesforce system. Communicate market and competitor related feedback to appropriate Attane resources (i.e. Product Management) in support of solution evolution. Travel is required   What you bring to the team.  5 years’ successfully selling digital marketing services and/or SaaS sales experience  Bachelor's degree in sales, business administration, marketing, or related field. Significant market expertise and connections within the target segment(s). Strong communication capabilities that include tailoring communication style to the audience. Proficient with online collaboration technology such as WebEx, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc. and sales engagement platforms such as Outreach.  Strong discovery and closing skills are critical  Preferable but not essential – Experience in the Senior Living industry.   What makes you stand out?  Ability to navigate a prospect organization and uncover their buying process. An understanding of best practices related to SEO, marketing automation, paid media is highly preferred.  Experience in providing realistic and achievable forecasts. Proficient in objective & decisive deal qualification. Familiarity in selling digital solutions. The ability to assess and critique existing website and digital marketing tactics Ability to effectively prioritize work efforts and operate independently with a strong sense of accountability. Must be energized by a fast-paced environment and able to work as part of a team. An appreciation for the relationships that exist between potential clients and the company currently, as well as historically. Knowledgeable of marketing services trends and best practices. “Hands-on" personality; a willingness to be involved in day-to-day activities associated with B2B sales; strong sense of ownership and ability to work independently. Curiosity/desire for continuous learning. This position provides a competitive salary based on experience, a commission structure and comprehensive benefits package.   Get to Know Us  Attane, formerly GlynnDevins, is the leading marketing solutions provider trusted by the senior living and healthcare industries to drive sales and business success. Our data-driven understanding of the customer journey and more than 30 years of experience delivering results provide unparalleled value to clients — empowering them to engage with success.  Attane is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Position Mission: As an Account Executive, you will be directly responsible for selling Homebase to prospects in your territory. Success in this role is measured by hitting and exceeding monthly sales goals by staying ahead of weekly, monthly, and quarterly metrics.   Responsibilities:  Coordinate with the marketing department and sales lead to qualify and identify additional leads Establish and maintain long-term relationships to maximize future revenue opportunities Manage pipeline activity for assigned markets; participate in sales forecasting for upper management Meet (in-person or virtually) with and present to key clients and senior-level executives to negotiate and close deals Aggressively work the pipeline to consistently meet or exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue quotas Manage account and contact information through the entire sales lifecycle process using Salesforce Interact with cross-functional business leadership teams including Finance, Marketing, Sales, and Development. Skills & Qualifications:  Proven inside sales experience Track record of over-achieving quota Strong phone presence and experience dialing >40 calls per day Proficient with corporate productivity and web presentation tools 4+ proven experience as an Account Executive, or in other sales/customer service role Knowledge of market research, sales, and negotiating principles Outstanding knowledge of G Suite; knowledge of Salesforce is a plus Excellent communication/presentation skills and ability to build relationships Organizational and time-management skills A business acumen Enthusiastic and passionate

We, Ripple Logics, are a software consulting and application development group based in Addison, Texas. Our software consulting practice serves customers with best in class data and cloud services. Ripple’s consulting practice specializes in filling company's contract, contract-to-hire, direct hire, contingency, and executive positions with professional candidates.   Ripple Logics is currently seeking a Business Development Manager for our software consulting practice in Addison, TX . The role will sell recruiting and consulting solutions using industry knowledge to service solutions specifically for the client's needs. The role assumes responsibility and accountability for establishing new contacts, and generating staffing leads and closing opportunities.   The ideal candidate will lead initiatives to generate and engage with business partners to build new business for the company. This candidate will be focused and have strong communication skills. They should be able to think critically when making plans and have a demonstrated ability to execute a particular strategy.   Responsibilities: Responsible for proactively developing client relationships to introduce our services within the fields of IT, Engineering, Accounting/Finance, Healthcare, Mortgage, and Professional Services industries Develops sales contacts researches customer needs and develops the application of services in an effective manner Establishes and builds client relationships with all levels of management Determines market strategies and goals for each service, based on industry research and development of a pipeline of potential customers Creates sales and marketing proposals responds to RFP's and negotiates contract terms with new clients Communicates with the main office for quality recruitment and placement to clients Clearly understands and utilizes sourcing techniques and tools including Indeed, ZipRecruiter, Monster, CareerBuilder, ATS, LinkedIn, college resources, as well as other social networking sites Frequently attends networking events and user groups specific to industries to make contacts and drive sales efforts  Qualifications: Must have a minimum of 5+ years selling experience in a consultative sale environment, preferably in the staffing industry Bachelor's Degree in any field, preferably Business Focused and goal-oriented Ability to sell in a highly competitive market and meet deadlines Exceptional communication, presentation, follow up, negotiation, and closing skills Must have proven track record in meeting/exceeding sales quotas Proven knowledge and execution of successful development strategies Proficiency with Microsoft Office products and internet Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Must have strong leadership and problem-solving skills Must be able to drive activity to produce results Must have experience with budgeting processes

Purpose: Bucha Bio, Inc. is hiring a Fashion Sales Account Manager to create a sales plan, manage all active client relationships of notable fashion brands both in the United States and Internationally, build and manage lists of contacts, connect with, and pitch fashion brands both in the United States and Internationally to secure commercial contracts for our animal & plastic-free biomaterial, MIRAI™ made from bacterial nanocellulose.  We are seeking a Fashion Sales Account Manager to join us in building Bucha Bio and making MIRAI™ the fashion industry's #1 choice for luxury biotextile applications.  What we offer: Base compensation to actively manage current client relationships Commission on commercial contracts secured for Bucha Bio commensurate with the size of the contract. Opportunity to work with a diverse team of scientists, business people, designers, and marketers. Opportunity to come in on the ground level on a company that is growing the future.  Major Duties / Responsibilities Perform detailed market & competitor research in the alternative leather and biomaterial space Create lists of appropriate companies to reach out to and contact information for key decision-makers in said companies Create Email templates to cold call or connect with fashion brands Pitch and secure contracts with fashion brands Actively manage all sales accounts and client relationships with brands, keeping active pressure on them to move to the next step in collaboration, Letter of Intent, or contract. Present results both informally (e.g., in internal meetings) and formally to investors. Participate in project planning and execution. Maintain detailed and accurate records.  Preferred Qualifications: Interest in sustainability, sustainable materials, and fashion. Experience or academic qualification in business, sales, fashion, design, marketing, or strategic relationship management. Effective writing, communication, and presentation skills Desire to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a multidisciplinary team Basic scientific knowledge to describe our textile creation process to interested clients.  We realize that candidates may not meet all of these qualifications, and we will always prioritize enthusiastic and entrepreneurial candidates with a clear vision.

Trace is a ground-breaking technology that automatically films and edits video into highlights for every player on the field. Our mission is to help players and families to be able to review their athletic performance, moments and memories that are important to them. We create a customized experience that is tailored to each athlete. Our apps have become integral to the lives of hundreds of thousands of passionate athletes all over the world, from National teams to kids just starting out their athletic journey. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for you to be an early, integral member of the team that will triple in size over the next 18 months.   At Trace we look for individuals who are passionate about sports, have played sports and understand how to work hard to achieve goals. We’re a collaborative team of top performers that thrive on healthy competition, we push each other individually so we can succeed collectively. We will challenge you to develop personally and professionally if you’re willing to learn, commit to our mission and be coachable. All of this while focusing on the sports market!  As a Sales Development Rep (SDR), you will be responsible for building our pipeline and qualifying leads. This is a great place to start for someone looking to enter the tech world and learn sales. We’re looking for drive and a fun demeanor as we work towards removing friction from youth sports video.   How you will contribute: Find new opportunities to target for outreach Set meetings and demos for our AE team Organize and build the sale pipeline Regular reporting (weekly) on key performance metrics Facilitate introductions to clubs, teams, and tournaments  Skills that will help you be successful in this role: 1+ year of prior professional experience (sales or online marketing is ideal) Background in sports (coaching or playing) or a former athlete in club sports Strong ability to take initiative and confidentially direct customer interactions Excellent organizational and time management skills Demonstrated ability to work in a self-directed way in a fast moving environment Strong communication skills on technical topics and/or a willingness to learn  About you: You’re passionate about being part of a successful high growth tech company You want to make an impact and aren’t looking for a cookie cutter 9-5pm You're a builder, problem solver and have a growth mindset You seek a company that allows you to drive your own success and development You’re hungry to learn, crave opportunity and ownership  Trace is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.
industries: Computer Software and Sports

description: About Teleflex Incorporated Teleflex is a global provider of clinically effective medical technologies designed to improve the health and quality of people’s lives. We apply purpose driven innovation – a relentless pursuit of identifying unmet clinical needs – to benefit patients and healthcare providers. Our portfolio is diverse, with solutions in the fields of vascular and interventional access, interventional cardiology, surgical, anesthesia, cardiac care, interventional urology, urology, emergency medicine and respiratory care. Teleflex employees worldwide are united in the understanding that what we do every day makes a difference. For more information, please visit teleflex.com.  Surgical - Whatever the latest surgical breakthrough looks like, Teleflex is working to make it happen. From our MiniLap® Percutaneous Surgical System to Weck® Hem-o-lok® Polymer Locking Ligation System, and Weck EFx® Shield™ Fascial Closure System, our portfolio of products adds up to a powerful offering of solutions that helps improve patient outcomes. These innovative, minimally invasive surgery products are offered alongside time-tested and trusted Pilling® Surgical Instrument and Lightsource solutions to provide a comprehensive set of solutions to meet the challenges of an evolving healthcare environment. Join a dynamic, growing team that offers healthcare providers an array of medical technology solutions that make a difference in patients’ lives.  Position Summary The surgical sales representative position is an OR based sales role with uncapped earnings and career potential. In this role representatives interact with Surgeons, OR Coordinators and Economic buyers to deliver the value proposition of our products and services.  PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Description of major duties and responsibilities of the role. Attain quota through aligning with corporate objectives and required sales processes. Complete understanding of surgical procedures and OR protocols relative to our product portfolio. Participate in a specific amount of surgical procedures as assigned by the regional sales manager on a weekly basis. Evaluate territory performance against established objectives/guidelines (sales forecast, budget, number of new accounts, etc.) and take appropriate action to improve performance. Communicate customer requirements and request support from other departments as necessary to assist in achieving established objectives. Cooperate with finance to assure the collection of accounts receivable due in obtaining of appropriate documents to minimize risk. Provide accurate forecast of sales by customer and product on a timely basis. Assure the sales activities in the territory comply with company’s policies and procedures. Recommend to the company areas of future growth potential such as acquisitions, new market strategies, etc. Assist in establishing sales objectives for territory in cooperation with Regional Sales Manager. Provide timely reporting of activities in the field and special reporting to assist in business and product planning to the regional sales manager.  This position requires direct contact with an implantable device.     ☒ Yes           ☐ No  Education / Experience Requirements • Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field. • 5+ years successful B2B or Medical Device sales, with a proven successful track record. • Candidate will be required to carry a detail bag weighing up to 20 pounds. • Candidate will be required to lift equipment weighing up to 30 pounds. • Position will require 20 to 40% travel.    TRAVEL REQUIRED: 20%-40%  Specialized Skills / Other Requirements Teleflex surgical is creating a world class culture for surgical device representatives. We stand for excellence in everything we do through personal accountability, high performance, integrity and continuously challenging the status quo.
industries: Medical Devices

description: Slalom Los Angeles is actively seeking a talented Sales Executive to drive results by producing a well-managed, profitable, and growing book of technology delivery opportunities. The individual in this role will serve Slalom’s clients as a trusted partner, building and executing customized business plans and predictable sales engagement processes. Successful candidates must thrive in a people-based corporate culture and be passionate about identifying new client opportunities and growing the Slalom brand.  Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 5,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2017 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 25 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada.  Job Title: Sales Executive - Mid/Emerging Markets  Responsibilities Build an extensive portfolio of technology based delivery work in the mid-market ($1-5 billion in revenue) sector Develop deep partnerships with the Slalom Delivery Centers and the LA leadership team Build confidence and understanding of the remote technology delivery model Drive activity in partnership with the account and practice leaders Work with new and existing clients to build a pipeline and secure new MSAs Activity and relationship-focused Sell to multiple accounts Develop and share sales collateral Manage negotiations of the opportunities in the pipeline Define win themes based on our competition Partner with clients to understand their technology needs and recommend solutions that add value to their business Qualifications 8+ years of previous sales and account management experience Passionate about sales and technology delivery Experience selling Agile based, remote technology delivery Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong customer service and interpersonal skills Excellent collaboration and team-building skills Organized and methodical; strong prioritization and negotiation skills Ability to work with virtual teams Budget and project management experience Experienced in building relationships with CXOs and business decision-makers Skilled at leading teams through complex technology solution sales Experienced and adept at aligning teams to work toward a common goal; consistently demonstrates strong people management skills Creative and innovative; seen as a visionary in his/her approach Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Job Title:            Sales Executive Location:            Collierville, TN  Overview of Position This is an opportunity for a bright, energetic sales professional to work with a leading, full-service marketing communications company. The successful candidate will provide exceptional account management support for a wide range of clients while preparing to move into a full outside Sales role. They will consistently deliver a high level of customer service, striving to exceed client expectations while maintaining company standards, goals and philosophy.   The Account Manager to Sales Executive path includes an advanced course on digital marketing strategies as well as on-the-job training performing account management duties. This opportunity ultimately leads to an outside Sales role that will require outstanding business development (hunting) and account management skills.  Responsibilities – Account Management ·        Support sales efforts through all phases of the sales cycle ·        Handle all aspects of account management including client engagement, sourcing, and order management ·        Research products, prepare quotations and presentations ·        Develop and maintain productive internal & external client relationships ·        Oversee fulfillment programs including monitoring/addressing inventory levels, restock quantities, and reorder points ·        Maintain comprehensive knowledge of industry trends, products/services, vendor partners, etc. ·        Serve as a brand Ambassador to support Shamrock’s Corporate Mission   Responsibilities – Sales Executive ·        Plan for your success by setting goals and identifying the strategies and activities required to achieve success. ·        Consistently grow your business o  Prospecting / Business Development – Find new clients using various sales tactics and tools such as Hubspot, networking, cold calling, etc. o  Develop Accounts – Provide Raving Fan Service, and cross sell / up-sell to maximize account penetration ·        Collaborate with peers, suppliers, and Shamrock management to ensure success  Requirements Associate or Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or related field preferred 1 + years’ direct sales experience Promotional products and commercial print industry knowledge a plus Strong customer service orientation Ability to work with people in varied organizational relationships Demonstrated ability to multi-task, prioritize, and work with a sense of urgency to meet deadlines Strong written and oral communication skills Strong computer skills and the ability to learn new software; comfortable with modern technology Experience working with databases and associated file types a plus Strong attention to details, organizational system, time management and documentation skills High level of flexibility, reliability, and dependability Exceptional “can-do” attitude  About us The Shamrock Companies, Inc, is a full-service integrated marketing company with over 38 years of experience in strategic marketing, creative design, premium and promotions, fulfillment and data management services to meet the growing needs of our customers in markets nationwide. Quality-conscious. Driven. Everything that we do at Shamrock helps define, build and strengthen brands.

You must apply through our internal portal: click here  Sr Chain Sales Executive  Date: Sep 23, 2021  Location:  Chicago, IL, US  Requisition ID: 18152  A Career in Beer and Beyond:    Our purpose at Molson Coors Beverage Company is to brew beverages that unite people to celebrate all life’s moments.  We’ve been brewing iconic brands for over 350 years and are now proud to be offering a modern portfolio that expands beyond the beer aisle.    We are Talent Brewers with our culture rooted in our core values. We believe in our brands and our people, and that diversity WITH inclusion is the key to a winning team culture.  We want you to join our team of brand ambassadors who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.    The Headlines    In the role of Sr. Chain Sales Executive working in Chicago, IL or the state of Virginia, you will be part of the National Accounts Sales Team. You will drive performance at designated key accounts through strategic planning and selling.    This position reports to the Sales Team Lead.  The Responsibilities Owning designated retailer or channel volume, profit, and share performance through superior communication, coordination, and execution of customer plan Regular in-market work to both evaluate the effectiveness of our plans and to identify opportunities that enable us to be first choice for our customers and consumers Brewing strong customer relationships with retailers and providing thought leadership on industry/category dynamics and execution Developing and selling-in customer plan that exceeds volume and profit objectives Diving into the customer data to analyze and build compelling selling stories for designated retailer accounts   The Other Qualifications:   You have a Bachelor’s degree OR equivalent experience (4+ years) in the field of Chain Sales preferably within Consumer Packaged Goods You love a challenge. You complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities You build relationships and collaborate to get to the desired outcome You take accountability for results – acting with integrity and honoring commitments You have a thirst for learning – you are always looking for ways to learn and help one another grow You exhibit our core values   Work Perks That You Need To Know About Flexible work programs that support work life balance We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental, vision, 401k option with incredible employer match, generous paid time off plans, an engaging Wellness Program, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) with amazing resources Access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages! Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That’s why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  Job Posting Grade: 11  At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.  Nearest Major Market: Chicago
