description: HAYDEN LOS ANGELES, based in Los Angeles, California, is a fast-growing Women’s and Tweens’ fashion company. We are a family-run inclusive brand for those who enjoy fun, feminine, and casual to boho style. Hayden LA is for every Woman and Tween who likes individual style that will make her feel her most authentic self.  We are looking for a passionate Sales Representative to join our team. The ideal candidate loves interacting with new people, is detail oriented, and a self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment. Competitive pay and benefits offered: Dental, Life, Medical, and Vision.  Duties and Responsibilities: Cultivate existing and new relationships with buyers across multiple platforms Maintain high level of customer service and sales Timely response and resolution to customer inquires via phone, email, and in person Collaborate with colleagues in different departments Create line sheets for clients by understanding market needs and trend forecasting Work strategically and proactively to achieve and exceed seasonal and annual sales targets PO processing from order entry to shipment Sample merchandising and organization for tradeshows Attend tradeshow markets as necessary (Dallas, Atlanta, Las Vegas, New York, etc.) Perform other duties as assigned  Desired Skills & Experience: Knowledge and love of fashion, with a presentable and professional image 1+ year of Sales Experience (fashion wholesale preferred) Excellent and confident communication skills -- written and verbal Resourceful, hands-on and able to sense urgency Ability to multitask and work well under pressure Analytical, problem solving, and critical thinking is a must Proficient in Outlook & Microsoft Office (specifically Excel) Minimum of a High School diploma or equivalent required  All of our team members are expected to have the following intangibles:  Team-Oriented: Teamwork is one of our core values. We strongly believe that we both succeed and fail as a team. We are joined up and encourage each other to share their ideas.  Self-Starter: On days on which you don’t have much to do, what are you going to do?  Strong Communication Skills: Being direct, yet polite, is important to us, regardless of job title or experience. We strive to make sure we’re responsive, because no one likes being ignored.  Ability to Thrive in a Multitude of Environments: Our team takes pride in our multi-ethnic and multi-generational workplace and thrives in completing multiple and completing tasks on time.  *This is an on-site LA based role.

We are looking for an established robust Salesperson with a passion for client partnership and strategic selling. As Global Account Manager, you will be a critical team member responsible for generating sales opportunities and product adoption within our current client base. You will also establish yourself as a specialist by providing strategic guidance and industry standard methodologies.  Responsibilities Grow revenue within existing accounts by identifying new sales opportunities and successfully seeing them through contracting Gain command of the Bluecore message, demonstrate data in the Bluecore platform and identify strategic growth opportunities to help clients understand and grow their business Outstanding Salesforce hygiene to provide up to date and accurate ongoing forecasts Conduct well-informed and consultative meetings with senior level executives to demonstrate the business value of the Bluecore platform that clearly articulates our innovative products Negotiate renewals and expansions that profit Bluecore while driving client performance. Collaborate with Customer Success team to help improve client use, value, and happiness of the Bluecore platform High degree of planning, prioritizing and coordinating skills to drive client success cross multi internal and external partners  Requirements 5 plus years demonstrated track record of growing existing business or bringing in new business in high tech/SaaS space is a must History of running global accounts with $4B+ in annual revenue and driving over $1M of ACV (Annual Contract Value). Relationships with executives and over 10+ contacts within one account Consistent and shown delivery of attaining quota targets and experienced pipeline management Proficient in value based solution selling Passionate about forecast accuracy and dedicated follow-up skills that allow nothing to fall through the cracks Well-versed in retailer-specific marketing challenges and solutions landscape and/or experience with an email service provider or marketing cloud is a plus Phenomenal presentation skills along with high confidence in engaging with decision makers Powerful communication and social skills. Highly eloquent via phone, email, video conferencing and in person is a differentiator, along with a positive engaged approach to working collaboratively with internal colleagues and external partners Passionate about working in a changing and evolving work environment where growth is non-stop Experienced with Salesforce, Gmail, Google Sheets/Excel, MS PowerPoint/Slides  #BI-Remote  Bluecore is a marketing technology company that’s reimagining how the world’s fastest growing retail brands transform casual shoppers into lifetime customers. Through our patented retail data model and the recent release of Bluecore Communicate™ and Bluecore Site™, we replace manual processes with an intelligent, AI-driven workflow. We are credited with doubling email revenue, and increasing customer retention for more than 400 brands, including Express, Tommy Hilfiger, The North Face, Teleflora, and Bass Pro Shops. We have been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Glassdoor and ranked No. 241 on the Inc. 500 List, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies.  We are proud of the culture of flexibility, inclusivity and trust that we have built around our workforce. We are a remote first organization with the option to potentially work in our New York headquarters on occasion moving forward. We love the opportunity to come together – but employees will always have the option on where they work best.  At Bluecore we believe in encouraging an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, demonstrate their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences. Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to building a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Who You Are: Versace is looking for a solution-seeking Planner to join their team. You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, are financially savvy and are an Excel whiz.  What You'll Do:  Support Director of Planning in developing seasonal OTB by store by category for full-price stores and E-commerce; liaising with Director of Merchandising and Buyers as necessary.  Ensure OTB ties to financial target and trends Follow-through to ensure that OTB budgets once approved by President are updated and respected by Buying Team.  Update President and Director of Planning on a timely basis on any requests made by Buying Team or HQ that could affect the OTB which has been approved locally Manage all Carry Over orders within market as well as off-market periods Develop non-seasonal OTB (licensed product) quarterly; to ensure inventory supports the annual financial plan; liaising with Director of Merchandising and Buyers as necessary Monitor seasonal and non-seasonal opportunities at SKU level. Review bestsellers with buyers weekly (including WOS report), and project reorder quantity at the size level in a timely manner Make recommendations for allocations/transfers at SKU level for stores At the end of each of season, identify categories with excess inventory to lead mark-down and movement to outlet analysis and decision Provide in-depth analysis and reporting: Weekly & Monthly sales reports, sales by class, sell-through, Bestsellers, WOS, etc. Prepare and issue daily/weekly reporting on Business Performance, including Sales Penetration, Best Sellers, Slow Sellers, Sales vs Plan, etc., with qualitative comments on key drivers, risks, and opportunities. Lead weekly business review meetings with the Director of Planning For Full Price stores and E-commerce, monitor receipts flow and pro-actively recommend strategies to maintain adequate inventory levels and achieve sales targets Analyze current trends and historical data to identify risks and opportunities at the SKU level. Identify business opportunities through analysis, market research, analyzing sales performance, competition, and trends Responsible for developing the Retail, Outlet and E-Commerce channel annual sales plans and ensuring alignment with the OTB plans Responsible for creating daily sales goals for each channel, based on monthly and annual goals  You'll Need to Have: 5+ years of retail planning and analysis Minimum Bachelor’s Degree High level of understanding of retail math and excel Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills Must possess a detail-oriented nature (ability to prioritize/multitask) Strong communication skills and ability to interact confidently with senior executives Self Motivator and proven ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment  At Capri, we are all responsible for creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We try to inspire change and growth within each other and believe success is a result that comes from our differences. Capri is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusivity regardless of age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic characteristics, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law. description: At AURA Devices, we're building products that help amateur and professional athletes to push their limits and go beyond. We're a team of professionals that make new instruments to track, analyze, and improve your fitness performance. Our state-of-the-art core technology of bioimpedance analysis provides information about hydration levels and body composition changes.  We're looking for an experienced leader who’ll drive our Sales department to a new level. An ideal candidate has experience in building a sales team, working in various channels and ability to achieve extraordinary results.   Key Responsibilities: Responsible for Sales Department; Grow AURA's sales program with a focus on empowering AURA Devices' brand at the retail partners; Identify potential Retail partners that will support our sales growth; Set-up and manage sales strategy along with Marketing and Sales teams; Create and implement an efficient bonus program for the entire Sales team; Close communication with Manufacturing team to utilize sales strategy and optimize stock levels;  Align the sales organization's objectives with business strategy through strategic planning, sales strategy development, forecasting, sales resource planning, and budgeting; Partner with the Support team to assist in chargeback investigations; Oversee trade show operations as needed; Occasional travel required.  Requirements: You have more than 5 years of significant experience in Retail, DTC, or Digital sales. Experience in young consumer electronics brands would be an advantage;  Experience in working with Big-box (BestBuy, Target, etc.) and Speciality (Apple Store, APR, etc.) retailers; Strong business management skills; Knowledge of current trends in high-tech fitness; Brilliant communication skills; Exceptional executive leadership, coaching, and motivational skills;   Benefits: Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity; Health insurance; Flexible working hours; Work from home option; Mac or PC for doing your job; All AURA products of your own.

Description  We’re the largest competitive gaming organization serving high school and education facilities in North America focused on making esports available to every student as a legitimate varsity level sport in high schools throughout the U.S. We achieve this by working with faculty to easily offer students the chance to engage in healthy esports competition, surrounded by peers while supervised by teachers. Through organized esports competitions, students are learning to align their commitment to gaming with their success in academics and potential future careers.  We are taking High School Esports to the next level with a curriculum to guide students through the Esports Ecosystem, leading to college and career opportunities.  The Curriculum Sales Executive will be selling our Gaming Concepts Curriculum to schools and school districts in the Rocky Mountain and Midwest region. Gaming Concepts, a video game curriculum for schools, is an educator's guide to teaching college and career-ready skills, social-emotional learning, and digital citizenship through the lens of video games. The STEM.org approved curriculum includes 81 lessons complete with lesson overviews, content standards addressed, materials needed, and directions.  We are looking for an experienced K12 sales executive with experience selling curriculum (preferably CTE/STEAM), who will be hands-on with CTE Departments, school and district administrators, as well as regional and state organizations to develop their Esports curriculum offerings. Deals can range from $1,000 a year to over $500,000/year, depending on the size of the implementation. Highly skilled educators with Esports and curriculum knowledge will also be considered. An education background is a must (either through sales or in a school/district).  Who you are: You are a self-motivated, hard-working individual with a solid work ethic, who is passionate about Esports and opening up future opportunities for students. While you are a sales hunter, you are also mission-driven to reach all students, especially those who have traditionally been underserved. You recognize the value that esports brings to middle and high school students in terms of leadership skills, development of perseverance, increase in student engagement and sense of belonging, and opening up college and career opportunities.  What you will do: Take ownership and be the "CEO" of your territory. Develop and execute a strategic plan, working with our Education Team, Success Team, Partnership Team, and Marketing Team, as well as the National Sales Director. Leverage existing K12 contacts to introduce esports curriculum solutions. Prospect new leads in middle schools, high schools, and districts. Build close relationships with school administrators. Manage and maintain customer buying journey progress in our CRM (Hubspot) database for proper data tracking. Schedule meetings and follow-ups with engaged prospects and existing customers. Create new sales, upsell and cross-sell opportunities. Conduct regional market research to identify selling opportunities and evaluate customer needs. Conduct needs analysis, perform platform demonstrations of the content on our LMS, write proposals, and process POs. Achieve Quarterly and Annual Revenue Quota Targets.  Requirements Tech-savvy 4+ years of hands-on sales experience in the K12/education/edtech space for software and/or 4+ years of education experience at the school or district level. CRM experience is a plus  Bonus Points Live in the Midwest or Rocky Mountain regions, preferably near a Major Airport You are a big gamer or esports lover Bachelor Degree+  Benefits Base salary High earning commission potential Healthcare, Vision and Dental 401k Work from Home Limited travel Training and development Short and Long term disability Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary and AD&D) Fun, enthusiastic work environment with fellow gamers

description: The Account Sales Manager will be in charge of managing and developing an existing portfolio of large mass-market retailers such as Ross, TJ Max, Burlington, Winners, and more. To ensure the implementation of sales & business development strategies, you will also need to create the short-term, mid-term and long-term sales strategies and be responsible for the execution of the same.  Our corporate office in Dania, FL, is currently hiring a full-time Account Sales Manager.  Our Ideal Profile  We are looking for an Account Manager to create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The Account Manager’s role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients, and actively seek new sales opportunities. Account management responsibilities include developing strong relationships with customers, connecting with key business executives and stakeholders, and preparing sales reports. Account Managers answer client queries and identify new business opportunities among existing customers. In this role, you will liaise with cross-functional internal teams (including Customer Service and Product Development departments) to improve the entire customer experience. This position may require occasional travel. If you are familiar with account management software (CRM), have a flair for client communication, and understand consumer behavior, we’d like to meet you. Ideally, candidates for this role will know how to meet ambitious individual and team-wide sales quotas. Ultimately, a successful Account Manager should collaborate with our sales team to achieve quotas while keeping our clients satisfied and engaged with our products and services in the long run.  We are looking for a well-rounded sales development executive coming from the beauty industry. Preferably the US, Canada market knowledge.  We need someone analytical and creative enough to create sales programs, events, and strategies to boost sales. We are also looking for someone capable of reaching out to new prospects.  Job Description New business development and key account management in the Beauty care, Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts Prepare reports on account status Marketing research for developing new sources and identifying new product categories to grow volume and increase the profitability of the company. Skills Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager, or relevant role Demonstrable ability to communicate, present, and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level Solid experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, Zoho CRM, or HubSpot) and MS Office (particularly MS Excel) Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needs Proven ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation abilities Strong verbal and written communication skills Aggressive business development and market coverage abilities Excellent analysis and synthesis abilities Strong sales experience for 4 to 8 years preferable in beauty products/hair care industry working with wholesale channels, including new account development Fluency in English & Spanish languages - a huge plus. BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Sales, or relevant field Fashion Foundry is one of the fastest-growing brand incubators and manufacturers of beauty products with multiple locations throughout Florida. Fashion Foundry also carries a full line of professional salon products, beauty electronics, and accessories. It is an exciting place to work.

description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  A healthy heart is essential to good health. That's why we're committed to advancing treatments for people with cardiovascular disease. As a global leader in Cardiac Rhythm Technologies, our breakthrough medical technologies help restore people's health so they can get back to living their best lives, faster. We focus on innovative technologies that can improve the way doctors treat people with heart arrhythmias, or irregular heartbeats.  What You’ll Do  C Calls on physicians, medical laboratories, distributors, and hospitals to sell ABT medical devices in an assigned territory. May conduct marketing surveys, effectiveness reviews of calls/sales activities, and territory analysis. Develops and services new and established accounts, suggests and presents new products. As appropriate, assists marketing personnel on advertising and promotional sales strategies.  Job Duties Contacts, visits and educates clients and potential clients on the Company’s products and addresses any client questions and concerns. Builds and executes on business plans in partnership with management to identify, target and develop new accounts. Provides medical professionals with information and training on the use of Company products and with staff education, in-services and technical troubleshooting. Insures that all pertinent patient information is completed and forwarded to patient tracing when required. Responsible for the management of physical inventory located within assigned territory. Collects and studies information about new and existing products and monitors competitor sales, prices and products. Analyses sales statistics; prepares reports; and performs required administrative sales duties, e.g., filing expense account reports, scheduling appointments, and making travel plans. May attend trade shows where new products and technologies are showcased and conferences to meet other sales representatives and clients and discuss new product developments. Prepares special analyses as required. Remains current on developments in field(s) of expertise. Resolves and/or facilitates resolution of problems including identifying causes to prevent re-occurrence. Performs related duties, on occasion, as assigned or required. Required: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent and typically two plus years of sales or clinical support experience with proven experience influencing customers in a healthcare-related setting. An aptitude to analyze and evaluate technologically complex devices; ability to work with and direct others effectively; ability to prepare and present strong written and verbal communications; familiarity with medical device industry policies, operations and procedures. Documented record and/or aptitude of delivering sales/marketing information to influence customer decision-making Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with customers, physicians, hospital administrators, government agencies, medical groups, and other sales representatives. Strong verbal and written communication, negotiation, sales, interpersonal and presentation skills. Demonstrated working knowledge of frequently used personal computer programs and relevant applications. Preferred General understanding of cardiac rhythm management technology. What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

description: Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.  Foursquare’s platform includes Attribution, Audience, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry’s first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions — those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone’s-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.  About the Role: As the Demand Account Executive you will be responsible for a defined set of independent agencies and brands. The position requires a strategic thinker who will be deeply involved in creating location-based advertising solutions for advertisers that lead to strategic and long term partnerships.  Responsibilities: You will spend time meeting with agencies and brand direct clients, evangelizing Foursquare and location-powered advertising. You will be responsible for building positive relationships with client/agency counterparts, maintaining ongoing communications and ensuring that client needs are met. Along with the Business Development, Product, and Data teams you will craft custom opportunities to address marketer’s goals. You will take complex, and at times technical, sets of capabilities and translate that into a compelling story for the marketplace. You will maintain a high level of internal and external client service orientation while providing excellent customer service. Tracks all activity in Salesforce and manages/closes opportunities in a timely fashion.  Qualifications: 4+ years of experience with digital advertising across sales , account management, or at an agency Has a network of contacts throughout the industry An entrepreneurial approach to business Demonstrated success in a goal oriented, highly accountable sales environment. Strong work ethic with excellent organizational, project/time management, and analytical skills Experience structuring, negotiating and closing large partnership deals with top holding companies Experience using Excel, Powerpoint, Salesforce, Google Docs Ability to think and plan strategically BS/BA degree  Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.  Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus. retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)

description: *This territory covers the entire Midwest and would require 50% travel.*  CONMED is seeking an Associate Territory Manager to join our Advanced Endoscopic Technologies team. This is an exceptional entry-level opportunity in the medical device industry, with rapid promotion potential. Our Associates learn from and grow with the best! Join our team, and you will be mentored by proven sales professionals. We offer an excellent training program, where you'll learn about anatomy, medical terminology, hospital protocol and the latest products and techniques in minimally invasive Gastroenterology and Pulmonary procedures. It will take a lot of hard work and determination on your part to be successful, but there are few opportunities that can match ours for long-term career growth.  If you're interested, here's what it's all about:  Travel of 60%+, typically 1-2 nights out per week. You will be supporting multiple Territory Managers (TM's). More TM's = more learning opportunity. You'll have a dedicated mentor to learn from and achieve common sales goals. CONMED is committed to your success. Top notch training program starts day 1. Rapid and long-term promotion path is the plan! If you are successful, there is opportunity to advance. Compensation is a combination of salary and bonus opportunity. You'll receive both a car allowance and mileage reimbursement. You will need to bring your work ethic, proven track record of achievement, and energy every day. If you have prior success selling products in a highly competitive market, we consider such experience a definite plus. If you are driven to succeed, seeking uncapped income potential and tremendous job satisfaction, this is the opportunity for you.  Qualifications: Bachelor's degree required. Degrees in Marketing, Management, Health Sciences or related life-science degrees preferred. Prior sales experience preferred. Strong combination of internships and experiences throughout college welcomed. Track record of overachievement and leadership roles will be highly considered. Competitive sports and military backgrounds welcomed. Strong organizational and time management skills are essential. Highly competitive and self-motivated, great people skills, positive attitude, entrepreneurial, and a burning desire to win are all a must.  Requirements: Must be fully vaccinated and proof of a COVID-19 vaccine before your start date. Ability to meet with customers at hospitals and to be a member of a credentialing agency.  Sponsorship: This position is not eligible for employer-visa sponsorship.
industries: Medical Devices

description: SiriusXM and Pandora have joined together to create the leading audio entertainment company in the U.S. Together, we are uniquely positioned to lead a new era of audio entertainment by delivering the most compelling subscription and ad-supported audio experiences to millions of listeners -- in the car, at home and on the go. Our talent, content, technology and innovation continue to be at the forefront, and we want you to be a part of it! Check out our current openings below and at http://www.siriusxm.com/careers .  Position Summary  SXM Media is seeking an Sales Executive to develop our sales efforts within the Atlanta region. This seller will play a critical role in executing new national business development strategies. We are searching for a proven sales leader who is goal-oriented, entrepreneurial and thrives on building something new in a fast-paced, high-energy environment.  Duties And Responsibilities  Sales Executive’s priority will be to develop and manage successful advertising programs for key national advertisers. This individual contributor will be responsible for closing new business with advertisers and ad agencies based on a territory and/or account list.  Advertisers that partner with SXM Media come in various shapes and sizes and no one advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how existing and new business grow. Using your relationship-building skills, enablement support, you will provide excellent research, analytical analysis and media solutions for your clients.  Supervisory Responsibilities None Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience 8 years of digital media sales experience in technology sales, digital marketing or consulting Ensure that our clients receive the highest level of sales and operational customer service Proactively prospect, qualify, grow, and maintain a regional territory account list and manage activity Create innovative sales presentations, incorporating industry research and campaign performance data. Execute and deliver high quality responses to all RFPs Negotiate pricing and contractual agreements Prospect and develop key senior level ad agency and client relationships in order to effectively build and maintain territory ad revenue vs. budget Requirements And General Skills Experience building effective relationships externally and influencing cross-functionally internally Proven sales experience within the technology landscape, as well as a proven track record of exceeding sales goals and ability to develop and manage a consistent sales pipeline Experience managing and influencing executive or C-level clients and stakeholders Ability to be sales growth oriented and operationally sound Excellent communication and presentation skills Contacts and relationships with key client accounts and agencies in the Bay Area Must be creative, smart, and passionate, as well as a problem solver and a team player Entrepreneurial spirit driven to achieve sales goals and help build a new channel for a rapidly growing company Willingness to travel when needed Willingness to take initiative and to follow through on projects. Creative writing ability. Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Must have legal right to work in the U.S. Technical Skills Thorough knowledge of MS-Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access). More details about our company benefits can be found https://jobs.jobvite.com/siriusxm/p/cultureanddiversity !  Our goal at SiriusXM+Pandora is to provide and maintain a work environment that fosters mutual respect, professionalism and cooperation. SiriusXM+Pandora is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, gender identity, marital status, familial status, veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  The requirements and duties described above may be modified or waived by the Company in its sole discretion without notice.

jobTitle: Sales Representative - San Francisco - Patient Handling
description: Patient Handling Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do As a Patient Handling Sales Representative, you work strategically to promote and sell Stryker Patient Handing products to meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident Patient Handling expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons, nurses, and hospital administrators. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with your customers. You focus on customer satisfaction by demonstrating teamwork and empowerment, solving problems through a consultative approach, operating with honesty and integrity and providing a highly responsive and unsurpassed level of customer service. You contribute to leading in product innovation by listening and working with others and contributing new ideas. You strive for operational excellence by promoting a team based, product-focused organization, contributing to continuous improvement, participating in preventative maintenance and safety programs. You take great pride in cost reduction, and commit to on time, complete, and error free shipments. As a Patient Handling Sales Representative, you love driving in the fast lane and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. What You Need Bachelor’s degree required. 2+ years demonstrated successful sales experience (medical device or capital equipment sales preferred). Strong inter-personal communication skills specifically relating to stress management, people management and conflict management. Excellent time management, project management, experience with reports and budget, and customer service skills. Knowledge of marketing, market research, new product development, new product introduction, P/L management, and field testing. What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results. Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients. Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career. About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.  Learn More About The Patient Handling Products Stretchers & transport chairs– https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/medical-surgical-equipment/stretchers.html Stretcher support surfaces– https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/medical-surgical-equipment/support-surfaces/stretcher-support-surfaces.html Mistral-Air- https://www.stryker.com/us/en/acute-care/products/mistral-air.html

description: You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Welcome to one of the toughest and most fulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools, most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitless opportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work.SM  This position is full-time (40 hours/week) Monday - Friday. Employees are required to work our normal business hours of 8:00am – 5:00pm. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime or weekends. Training will be conducted virtually from your home. All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Primary Responsibilities Process 51 - 100 quote requests as assigned in the inventory tracking system Review documents and market reference tools to create a 51 - 100 Fully Insured and / or Self - funded quotes Work with internal and external contacts to gather missing information and clarify data that was submitted Use appropriate quoting system to process quotes for 51 - 100 Non - Community rated business and All Savers quotes, as required by markets Work with Underwriting and Underwriting tools to provide underwritten rates Manage Specialty Rate Bank, as required Process 51 - 100 Sold Case Submissions, as assigned in inventory system using outlined policies and procedures on OneNote, to follow market nuances Work closely with AE, Broker, and Case Installation team to get a case through contract issuance Manage data, including a personal email box and shared folders Work in multiple applications including Microsoft Excel, Solaris, VRT, Word, WITT and pricing tools Work within required timelines and expectations Adherence to productivity metrics Flexibility to work other operational roles during certain times of the year Multi-task many responsibilities, that may or may not be related, through thoughtful prioritization and documentation You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications High School Diploma / GED (or higher) or equivalent work experience Intermediate level of experience with Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Outlook (ability to filter and sort through documents, spreadsheets, compose and respond to email) Preferred Qualifications Experience using all Microsoft applications including Microsoft Visio, Microsoft SharePoint (ability to create a document and basic navigation through application) Experience working with Sales Operations teams in small businesses (1 - 100 employees) 1+ years of experience with healthcare Insurance experience or medical experience. Telecommuting Requirements Required to have a dedicated work area established that is separated from other living areas and provides information privacy Ability to keep all company sensitive documents secure (if applicable) Must live in a location that can receive a UnitedHealth Group approved high-speed internet connection or leverage an existing high-speed internet service Soft Skills Effective interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal Energetic, self - motivated, and high commitment to drive to results in a challenging, fast - paced environment Diplomatic with strong negotiation and resolution skills Demonstrated ability to meet commitments, build consensus, negotiate resolutions, and garner respect from other teams and individuals Demonstrated ability to assist with focusing activities toward a strategic direction and achieve targets / goals Military & Veterans find your next mission: We know your background and experience is different and we like that. UnitedHealth Group values the skills, experience and dedication that serving in the military demands. In fact, many of the values defined in the service mirror what the UnitedHealth Group culture holds true: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance. Whether you are looking to transition from active duty to a civilian career, or are an experienced veteran or spouse, we want to help guide your career journey. Learn more at https://uhg.hr/transitioning-military  Learn how Teresa, a Senior Quality Analyst, works with military veterans and ensures they receive the best benefits and experience possible. https://uhg.hr/vet  Careers with UnitedHealthcare. Let's talk about opportunity. Start with a Fortune 5 organization that's serving more than 85 million people already and building the industry's singular reputation for bold ideas and impeccable execution. Now, add your energy, your passion for excellence, your near - obsession with driving change for the better. Get the picture? UnitedHealthcare is serving employers and individuals, states and communities, Military families and Veterans wherever they're found across the globe. We bring them the resources of an industry leader and a commitment to improve their lives that's second to none. This is no small opportunity. It's where you can do your life’s best work.SM  Colorado Residents Only: The hourly range for Colorado residents is $17.12 to $30.34. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. As of the date of this posting, In addition to your salary, UHG offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Health, dental, and vision plans; wellness program; flexible spending accounts; paid parking or public transportation costs; 401(k) retirement plan; employee stock purchase plan; life insurance, short-term disability insurance, and long-term disability insurance; business travel accident insurance; Employee Assistance Program; PTO; and employee-paid critical illness and accident insurance.  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Keywords: UnitedHealth Group, UnitedHealthcare, Optum, health care, office, phone support, customer service, billing, training class, now hiring, jobs, careers, work at home, work from home, WAH, WFH, remote, telecommute, hiring immediately, #RPO
industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Coffey Medical, a manufacturer’s rep firm for Philips Healthcare, is hiring a Territory Sales Representative to be based in Texas.  OPPORTUNITY: As our Territory Sales Rep, you will cover the Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Louisiana and Mississippi markets. Develop new business for Philips Healthcare's cardiograph and stress test product line by using your professional sales talents to call on leads provided and an extensive database of prospects and established customers.  Based in the Texas territory, you will use traditional inside and outside sales strategies to close new business with viable prospects (Department Managers in hospitals and Business Managers in hospital owned physician practices.) Using advanced technology sales tools, build a robust sales pipeline through your disciplined sales activity.  Reporting to the President/Sales Manager, you will receive coaching, mentoring, and product training along with world-class sales skill training. This is an existing territory with established customers and a funnel of opportunities already established achieving $2 million in sales this year. Two thirds of the sales in this territory are derived from servicing existing accounts. This is a highly technical position requiring the ability to understand medical terminology as well as how our equipment interacts with hospital software solutions.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Meet and exceed all sales goals. Develop new business by regularly calling on hospitals in your multi-state territory. Develop leads from other Philips reps and Philips marketing efforts. Deliver sales presentations to key prospects and convert prospects to customers by moving opportunities to closure. Maintain CRM database of existing, new, and potential customers using SalesForce and recording sales activity daily. Participate in weekly sales meetings.  SUCCESS FACTORS: 3 years of outside sales experience with at least 2 years selling to hospitals practices. Ability to work well in a team environment. Ability to work well with a Fortune 500 size company and its reporting requirements Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in sales, business, or similar field. Prefer experience selling medical devices software or diagnostic devices. Experience working and traveling a multi-state territory. 20-30% travel. Proven track record of success in generating your own leads, negotiating, and closing sales. Ability to work in a fast-paced, self-directed entrepreneurial environment. Highly proficient computer skills including Excel, Word, and Outlook. Avid user of CRM software solutions; experience with Salesforce is a plus! Excellent communication, organizational, time management, and follow up skills. Highly energetic, driven self-starter. Burning desire to earn $100k+ and willing to do what it takes to make it happen!  COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: Coffey Medical will reward your talents with an attractive base salary of $40-60k, plus a lucrative quarterly and annual incentive commission/bonus plan. First year total compensation expected to be $100K+. Second year income expected to be $120K -150K+. There is no limit to compensation for star performers.   APPLY NOW: If you are a proven healthcare sales professional, we encourage you to apply online now.   COMPANY: Coffey Medical is a 30-year-old manufacturer representative and distributor of specialty medical device and software technology.  We market and sell to US hospitals and the out-of-hospital market. We handle sales for Philips Healthcare to all hospitals in 16 states for cardiograph and stress testing systems.   To learn more about Coffey Medical, please visit www.coffeymedical.com  Tammy Prehoda, HR Consultant Safari Solutions Search3@safarisolutions.com   Territory Sales / Sales Manager / Outside Sales / Inside Sales / Sales Professional / diagnostic / medical devices / business development / territory manager / sales representative / account executive / account manager / channel sales / EKG / cardiograph / medical device distributor / district manager / VP of sales / Director of Sales / healthcare / regional sales
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Machinery

description: Sales Representative  Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As a ENT Sales Representative, you strategically promote and sell Stryker ENT products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As a ENT Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need 5+ years in an outside sales position (medical related fields or b2b sales preferred) or Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In February 2019, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that for the ninth consecutive year has been named as one of the 2018 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For ranking 11 out of 100. Some of our other awards from 2018 include Great Places to Work for Inclusion, Women, Millennials, and Diversity.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn more about the ENT Products: https://ent.stryker.com/  Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better  #LIInstruments

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make of it  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges. Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology.  UOP is hiring an experienced Account Manager with Full Cycle Sales accountability in the Refining, Petrochemical, and Adsorbent industry. This position will preferably be based in Des Plaines, IL, US Gulf Coast will be considered.  UOP LLC, headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, USA, is a leading international supplier and licensor of process technology, catalysts, adsorbents, process plants, and consulting services to the petroleum refining, petrochemical, and gas processing industries. UOP is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Honeywell International, Inc. and is part of Honeywell's Performance Materials and Technologies strategic business group.  Honeywell Performance Materials and Technologies is a global leader in providing customers with high-performance specialty materials, including fluorine products; specialty films and additives; advanced fibers and composites; intermediates; specialty chemicals; electronic materials and chemicals; and technologies and materials for petroleum refining.  Position Responsibilities  Forecast product demand and revenue (for refining, petrochemical, catalysts, adsorbents, and services) for assigned accounts 18 months into the future and deliver on resulting annual targets.  Forecast project opportunities and revenue (for technology sales, engineering work, gas processing, etc.) for assigned accounts 18 months into the future and deliver on resulting annual targets.  Manage customer relationships and coverage by sharing information and developing account plans throughout UOP.  Lead opportunities through the entire sales cycle: Identify opportunity, clarify bid, develop sales strategy, enroll and aligning sales support, submit proposal, close the deal, work with order management, production planning and service to make, deliver and service the product.  Support Business and Technology functions by providing market and competitor intelligence.  Report and work with internal resources to resolve customer issues including legal agreements.  Maintain all internal work and sales processes, e.g. SFDC.  20-30% domestic travel annually.  Must Have  BS degree in Engineering  Minimum of 5 years’ experience within either the refining, petrochemical, midstream, or gas processing industries.  1+ years’ of experience with the operations in either the refining, petrochemical, midstream, or gas processing industries (i.e. knowledge of catalysts and absorbents application in respective industry)  We Value  Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering  6 or more years of direct sales and/or sales support (high level of customer focused engagements) experience  Demonstrated ability to sell into a competitive market place and achieve premium prices by communicating the value achieved by the customer using UOP technologies, products and services  Knowledge of the application of catalysts, adsorbents, or technologies in refinery, petrochemical, and gas processes in either the refining, petrochemical, gas, and midstream industries in the Americas  Experience with adsorption/treating, reforming, isomerization, hydroprocessing, gas processing, or petrochemicals (i.e. OLEFINS or Aromatics)  Experience using CRM (i.e SFDC)  Good listening and communication skills  The ability to work effectively with other sales colleagues and sales support functions is key  A strong customer and business focus  Fluency in English  PMT102021  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD139526 Category: Sales Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Sales (LATAM)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Austin – Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential. description: Our mission at Leviosa is to elevate wellness for everyone.  Our upcoming product provides one of the most robust and well-rounded offerings to improve wellness. Employers seeking to offer innovative benefits see value in providing (or subsidizing) this offering for their employee base. This role will be responsible for identifying and solidifying clients and business partnerships.  This is a chance to get in at the ground level as we scale up. A passion for wellness is highly desirable. Prior experience working with HR departments and/or the healthcare market (insurance, medical groups, etc.) is a plus. Given that we are an early stage startup, the candidate should be open to being compensated with commissions and possibly equity for a few months before switching to traditional cash and incentive compensation. We are flexible with schedule and open to part-time, remote work from anywhere in the U.S.  The ideal candidate will be an experienced sales person who is comfortable generating sales lead with new clients and maintaining relationships with existing ones. This candidate will be able to understand a prospective client's needs and offer an ideal solution. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills and have a positive track record of exceeding outlined goals.   Responsibilities Identify and target sales lead Use digital, social, and other channels to identify prospects Prospect clients and understand their needs Present our offering via online video meetings Build and maintain relationships with clients  Qualifications Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and customer relationship management software Demonstrated ability to set goals and achieve them Strong communication skills and understanding of sales process Experience in managing a book of business

Territory Business Development Manager  Based in Atlanta/Norcross, GA, or NC  https://equipmentcontrols.com  SUMMARY:  As a Territory Business Development Manager at Equipment Controls Company, you will implement company strategies and policies to meet planned sales objectives in GA, AL, SC, and NC.  The Business Development Manager develops and executes sales strategies and tactics to support our current customer base within the Municipal Natural Gas market. These include the municipalities and LDC field offices in the defined area, engineering firms, sub-distributors, and supply house accounts on select projects that overlap within the municipal gas market segment.  Achieve sales plans and account goals for all assigned product lines including, but not limited to gas, gas meters, meter set assemblies, gas regulators, safety devices, valves, instrumentation, AMR/AMI remote read systems. Work closely with the overall sales team to execute team and corporate strategies and programs.  Active involvement in Industry Associations.  Use CRM for timely and accurate updates on lead status and sales pipeline. Review sales pipeline with the focus on accurately projecting close dates. Provide quarterly business summary reports for key accounts. Work effectively as a team with internal Equipment Controls Company personnel in customer service, quality assurance, field service, applications, marketing, pricing, and other operations as required.   Qualifications:  3 -7 years of field sales experience in municipal natural gas markets or similar field. Optional Knowledge of combustion, gas control, and measurement environment are a plus. Introductory level ability to use Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint). Ability to analyze and interpret customer needs as well as formulate and recommend solutions in a consultative manner. Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills required. Ability to lift 50lbs.      Since 1965, Equipment Controls Company has been focused on delivering innovative solutions driven by everyday challenges. ECCO’s growth can be attributed to providing complete customer satisfaction with professionalism, ethical standards, and exceptional product knowledge.   ECCO represents and distributes quality products from established manufacturers such as Sensus, Pietro Fiorentini, AY McDonald, Sensit, Romet, Eagle Research, and 3M. Headquartered in Norcross, GA, ECCO is one of the largest North American distributors of natural gas measurement control and data acquisition products and services. ECCO, has you covered with additional office locations in Houston, TX, Indianapolis, IN, Sparta, Mi and Salt Lake City, UT; as well as sales offices in Cumming, GA, Charleston, WV, Ft. Pierce, Fl. and Walker, LA.   WHAT WE OFFER:  Competitive salary, quarterly bonus, company car, and 100% company paid health, dental and vision benefits (starting immediately). Also includes, paid time off, life insurance and 401k.                                                                                                                                                                   WHO WE ARE:  A Privately owned National, Specialty Master Distributor of natural gas measurement products and solutions.  We are seeking a hardworking team player to join our team.

description: Description  Philips-Medisize is seeking a dynamic and proactive Global Account Manager with the primary objective of growing profitable Molex revenue. This position will be the primary interface between assigned accounts and Molex. Responsibilities include expanding Molex presence within assigned customer(s) by increasing the value Molex brings to their company. This position will be responsible for managing the relationships and full breadth of sales activity for the entire Molex portfolio of products to a high priority customer and market.  Our Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Attributes Excellent ability to strategize, develop, implement, communicate and evaluate processes and tools Leadership skills that demonstrate the ability to take charge, initiate actions, make sound decisions and direct others toward the accomplishment of goals Sales skills that demonstrate the ability to successfully negotiate and close a sales call Strong organization skills to anticipate, plan, organize and monitor workload Well-developed written, oral and interpersonal skills that demonstrate the ability to build rapport with both internal and external contacts Authoritative knowledge of the connector industry’s products, markets and sales channels This position is open to remote candidates  What You Will Do In Your Role  Global Growth Strategy Develop, define and execute a global engagement strategy, driving the implementation of growth opportunities at all global locations of a high-profile account; positioning Molex in a successful way that results in increased profitable revenues Provide direction and support to sales team members including both direct reports and indirect Sales Engineers, located at design sites and manufacturing locations, to effectively execute the strategic plan Establish Global Strategic Direction for Product and Application Development Understand and communicate industry and customer technology and business trends Maintain an open, two-way communication across Sales, BU, and MPS division in all geographic regions as to maximize the effectiveness of new product/technology introductions Coordinate and resolve account issues. Involve BU and divisional leadership as required if they are to impact the successful implementation of the account strategy Develops and implements strategic sales plans to meet established objectives. Works with internal Sales and Division partners to identify and penetrate target accounts/markets Global Communication & Relationships Build and maintain strong relationships with key individuals in all levels of the organization globally Understand and communicate key strategic sub-contractors, to GSM team members and Product Divisions to assure seamless applications of our strategy throughout the supply chain Promote the Advancement of the Corporate Culture Utilize sound economic models to determine projects selection Meet or exceed corporate profit objectives Ensure full compliance to all regulatory and policy guidelines within the team High degree of Customer Focus. Strive to create the highest value possible for our customer and society The Experience You Will Bring  Requirements Bachelor’s degree A minimum of 5 years successful sales experience Ability to travel up to 50%, both domestically and globally This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship What Will Put You Ahead Bachelor’s Degree in technical field (BSME, BSEE, BSIE, Industrial Technology, etc.) Medical market knowledge Previous supervisory experience Familiarity with Molex and Philips-Medisize manufacturing facilities and capabilities worldwide Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.  At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.  For this role, we anticipate paying $110k - $130k per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.  Equal Opportunity Employer.  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

description: The Sales Advocate Specialist role support sales managers in daily sales-related interactions with strategic customers to consolidate and process detailed information required to generate quotes and process orders in company tools.   The Sales Advocate Specialist role requires a basic understanding of company products and services to properly communicate with customers and obtain the necessary information to document products/solutions in company tools. In addition, should develop a deep understanding of company tools and processes and constant interaction with other company areas to facilitate and speed quote to ordering for customers. Activities include gathering and processing information with the customer, using company tools, process quotes or service changes, consolidating complex large project data requirements, interacting with different customers, sales managers, and other areas.  The Sales Advocate Specialist role requires excellent communication skills, essential product and process analytic skills, MS excel (high level), good organization skills, ability to effectible manage time and workload. The Sales Advocate Specialist should develop collaborative work with sales managers and customers. Become the customer advocate and represents the customer interests inside CES, interacting with all the critical areas, including Pre-Sales, Sales Operations, Customer Care, Finance, etc.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following (additional duties may be assigned:  Works in tandem with the Account Executive (AE) assigned to the account with an emphasis in the pre-sales L2Q (Lead-to-Quote) Serves as backup to cover all the functions of the AE whenever the AE is not available (e.g., PTO, sickness, etc.) Establishes professional relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts.  Owns the MACDs (Move/Add/Change/Disconnect) process for existing services, interacting directly with the client Executes all the processes and subprocesses needed to process MACDs that are defined as a direct responsibility of the Commercial Area Coordinates the timely compliance with all the customer requirements and procedures to complete a closed deal, including registering CES as a provider for the customer, obtaining a Purchase Order (PO) to associate with service billing, etc. Directly interacts with the customer to help with all the external paperwork and administrative tasks needed to close a deal, including follow-ups on NDA, contracts, addendums, etc. Coordinates with Sales Operations to ensure that a closed deal becomes a processed order in the shortest possible time. Interacts and keeps updated the Company's systems, including Salesforce. Escalates any situation as needed to the appropriate levels to resolve any outstanding customer issues as expeditiously as possible. Supervisory Responsibilities: The Sales Advocate Specialist position will not include any supervisory responsibilities. Qualifications:  Demonstrated commercial acumen; previous experience in sales positions is a must Knowledge of SalesForce and Tableau is a plus Negotiation skills Proactiveness Ability to follow and learn new procedures Excellent interpersonal skills Crisis management skills Advanced Excel skills Education and Experience:  3+ years in a junior sales position.  Previous experience in Customer care is a plus. Language Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including writing and proofreading.  Ability to communicate information effectively and persuasively. Ability to read and interpret documents.  Bilingual (English-Spanish).
