description: The Partner Sales team is growing and we are excited to hire the next members of the Partner Sales Team in Denver and Remotely. We’re seeking sales professionals with a track record of success in achieving new-business and growing a current book of business. The ideal candidate will be driven, organized, and display a natural ability to build rapport and trust. We’re looking for that perfect blend of sales drive coupled with a customer-service mentality that will help us create loyal, happy partners.  Gusto partners with Accountants whose customers are small business owners. You will work with accounting firms to onboard their entire book of business. It’s your job to understand an accountant partner's needs and the needs of their clients in order to properly convey Gusto’s value proposition delivered through the partnership. You’ll manage the ongoing relationship with each new accountant you bring onboard while continuing to work to add new accountants to your growing book of business.  Here’s What You’ll Do Engage and ramp relationships with existing partners through a consultative sales process Win in competitive sales against the industry’s incumbent players Construct, forecast, and manage your sales pipeline to meet company goals Leverage People Advisory and Certification to deepen strategic partnerships Advocate for accountant needs to inform Gusto’s product roadmap Build strong, long-lasting relationships with resellers to grow a firm’s client base on Gusto Listen carefully to understand customer needs and communicate Gusto’s value proposition Manage partners after the first 90 days of their onboarding to Gusto, helping them ramp additional clients, keeping them up to date on new product developments, & best practices to get the most out of the Gusto platform Penetrate the partner’s firm by convincing additional accountants to join, influencing additional client adds, and even getting the firm to adopt Gusto internally Deliver comprehensive product demos and answer technical inquiries Contribute accurate records and notes to a team-wide CR Here’s What We’re Looking For 3-5 years of sales experience (industry related experience selling directly to accountants is a bonus!) Technically proficient and experienced with web technologies (able to present pros/cons, use cases/examples, trends, and all that good stuff) Proficient with Salesforce Ambitious, enthusiastic, tenacious, and a top-performer with a track record of consistently exceeding quota A consummate team player who enjoys wearing multiple hats and inspiring everyone around you to do great work A builder who is excited to help shape the foundation for Partner Sales team in Denver office Bachelor's degree At Gusto, we strive to provide rewards that empower employees to achieve their financial and personal goals. We offer competitive compensation packages with a strong emphasis on equity based compensation (ownership in Gusto). To learn more about Gusto’s compensation philosophy and benefits offerings please view our Total Rewards Approach page.  Our cash compensation range for this role is targeted at $115,000 OTE per year in Denver and most remote locations and $126,000 - $140,000 OTE in San Francisco & New York. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed above.  Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto.  Gusto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Gusto considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Gusto is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@gusto.com.

jobTitle: Trauma Sales Representative - Des Moines, IA
description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who do what is necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do  As a Trauma Sales Representative, you work with a high degree of intensity and commitment to sell Stryker Trauma products that meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident trauma expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons and healthcare professionals. You live your work, feeding off the extreme demands of trauma, not counting hours but rather lives impacted. A person who is energized by chaos, you organize your materials and sort possible solutions quickly during operating/emergency room consultations. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with surgeons. They trust you to provide advice and training on products and tools used to save lives. As a Trauma Sales Representative who does what is necessary and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need Bachelor’s Degree or 4+ years experience in a clinical healthcare or sales role (or a combination of the two) 3+ years of sales experience preferred Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services, including marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems Excellent organizational skills and knowledge in the use of current office technologies (MSOffice suite, databases, etc.) Experience in building and maintaining relationships (with surgeons & hospitals in respective areas would be beneficial) Must be comfortable in emergency/operating room environments Ability to participate in and attend sales meetings and professional association meetings outside regular business hours, as required Must adhere to compliance and the principles of responsibility (AdvaMed) by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information, protecting the assets of the organization, acting with ethics and integrity, reporting non-compliance, and adhering to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, accreditation and licenser requirements, and Company’s policies and procedures What We Offer A winning team motivated to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Medical Devices

jobTitle: Sales Representative - Palm Springs, CA - Orthopaedic Instruments
description: Sales Representative  Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As a Orthopaedic Instruments Sales Representative, you strategically promote and sell Stryker Orthopaedic Instruments products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As a Orthopaedic Instruments Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need 5+ years in an outside sales position (medical related fields or b2b sales preferred) or Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn more about the Orthopaedic Instruments Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/orthopaedic-instruments.html  Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better  #LIInstruments

description: *Job Summary*  *FCP Live-In*  We Provide Live-In Elder Care Services.  We are FCP Live-In a large and fast growing Live-in Elder Care Agency specializing in Post-Acute Care and Transitional Care to Reduce Hospital Readmissions and to keep Mom and Dad at Home.  We are seeking experienced Health Care Business Development Leaders. This position is perfect for experienced Health Care Business Development people. If you sell Health Care and have existing relationships, We want to talk to you.  We are seeking assistance in developing partnerships with ACOs, LTC Insurers, Physician Groups, Geriatric Care Managers, discharge planners, case managers, Skilled Nursing Facilities, Hospitals, VNAs, Eldercare Attorneys and others.  You will be responsible for building relationships with ACOs, Long Term Care Insurance, Skilled Nursing Facilities, Nursing Homes, discharge planners, case managers, social workers, elder care attorneys, hospitals, Physician Groups and others.  MUST have Business Development experience, working in healthcare sales This is a high profile position with a respected healthcare company.  FCP Live-In is celebrating our 25th year of Providing Outstanding Service.  REQUIREMENTS: \* Sales experience is required. \* Self-starter who can work with little supervision. \* Must be highly motivated. \* Experience selling to Skilled Nursing, ACO’s, Hospitals, VNA's, Physician groups, nursing homes, hospitals, eldercare and others. \* Responsible for achieving sales goals in a short sales cycle environment by building relationships with professionals that are in a position to initiate referrals for Live-In Care Services. \* Consult with Social Workers in positions to Refer Live-In Care Post-Acute and Readmission Reduction options. \* Perform daily selling activity required by FCP Live-In in order to achieve quota requirements. \* Timely completion and submission of required reporting paperwork and projects as determined by sales management. \*  At FCP Live-In, we are leading the way in Providing an Assisted Living Alternative.

We are looking for a sales executive that has mastered the process of taking cool leads and converting them into a raving customer. The sales executive who joins our team will have a demonstrated ability to quickly build relationships, understand the pain points of the prospect, and clearly map the value and benefits of the Vimocity solution.  Selling the Vimocity solution is the ultimate relationship-based sales process. Our customers highly value how Vimocity dramatically reduces workplace injuries and improves employee satisfaction. They are respected as leaders in safety amongst their industry peers and are happy to share their success.  Responsibilities  The Enterprise Account Executive will lead all sales efforts at Vimocity, including prospect identification, lead generation, sales calls, and managing the full sales cycle, from contract negotiation through deal closure. They are expected to meet sales goals and deliver value to all customers through relationship-based sales.  What You'll Achieve Build strong, value-based relationships with sales prospects Generate new opportunities through prospecting Nurture leads and progress prospective customers through the sales pipeline Develop and execute Account-Based Sales (ABS) plans for target customers Collect vital information from customers that allow you to develop a proposal that meets potential customers’ business needs and budget Craft and deliver sales presentations that speak to the needs and business objectives of the company and executive suite Maintain account and opportunity forecasting within HubSpot Develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of Vimocity’s' solution offerings. Address product uses, benefits and competitive advantages that facilitate deal closure Maintain a real-time understanding of the competitive landscape to assist in developing proposals and pricing Represent Vimocity at industry conferences and association meetings Manage the handoff of new customers to the Onboarding and Customer Success teams. Meet or exceed quota expectations Your Core Attributes 5+ years of experience in B2B enterprise sales Experience selling to the executive suite Consistent achievement of year over year quota Demonstrated ability to research companies and align the solution to the prospect’s corporate strategic initiatives Background or education in roles that require a mix of analytical and strategic thinking Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Experience with platforms such as HubSpot, MailChimp, Slack, Google Suite, Canva, and Microsoft Office This opportunity is for someone who loves the challenge of implementing new and innovative processes for building and nurturing key relationships, pitching proposals, negotiating contracts, closing deals, and successfully transitioning new customers to the Onboarding and Customer Success teams. Our mantra is that we bring value, deliver an ROI, and surprise and delight our customers and their employees at every stage of the customer journey.  At Vimocity, we believe that every individual deserves to be out of pain and moving their best. We're dynamic change-makers with a passion for developing the most effective injury-prevention solutions on the market. Our mobile and web apps, backed by our expertise in movement and ergonomics, puts engaging solutions directly in the hands of our utility and clean energy customers and their employees.  We strive to provide a hiring experience and work environment in which all people know they are equally respected and valued. We value what makes you unique, and we’d love to see what you might add to our team.

Selling the Vimocity solution is the ultimate relationship-based sales process. Our customers highly value how Vimocity dramatically reduces workplace injuries and improves employee satisfaction. Responsibilities  The Enterprise Account Executive will lead all sales efforts at Vimocity, including prospect identification, lead generation, sales calls, and managing the full sales cycle, from contract negotiation through deal closure. They are expected to meet sales goals and deliver value to all customers through relationship-based sales.  What You'll Achieve Build strong, value-based relationships with sales prospects Generate new opportunities through prospecting Nurture leads and progress prospective customers through the sales pipeline Develop and execute Account-Based Sales (ABS) plans for target customers Collect vital information from customers that allow you to develop a proposal that meets potential customers’ business needs and budget Craft and deliver sales presentations that speak to the needs and business objectives of the company and executive suite Maintain account and opportunity forecasting within HubSpot Develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of Vimocity’s' solution offerings. Address product uses, benefits and competitive advantages that facilitate deal closure Maintain a real-time understanding of the competitive landscape to assist in developing proposals and pricing Represent Vimocity at industry conferences and association meetings Manage the handoff of new customers to the Onboarding and Customer Success teams. Meet or exceed quota expectations Your Core Attributes 5+ years of experience in B2B enterprise sales Experience selling to the executive suite Consistent achievement of year over year quota Demonstrated ability to research companies and align the solution to the prospect’s corporate strategic initiatives Background or education in roles that require a mix of analytical and strategic thinking Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Experience with platforms such as HubSpot, MailChimp, Slack, Google Suite, Canva, and Microsoft Office This opportunity is for someone who loves the challenge of implementing new and innovative processes for building and nurturing key relationships, pitching proposals, negotiating contracts, closing deals, and successfully transitioning new customers to the Onboarding and Customer Success teams. Our mantra is that we bring value, deliver an ROI, and surprise and delight our customers and their employees at every stage of the customer journey.  At Vimocity, we believe that every individual deserves to be out of pain and moving their best. We're dynamic change-makers with a passion for developing the most effective injury-prevention solutions on the market. Our mobile and web apps, backed by our expertise in movement and ergonomics, puts engaging solutions directly in the hands of our utility and clean energy customers and their employees.  We strive to provide a hiring experience and work environment in which all people know they are equally respected and valued. We value what makes you unique, and we’d love to see what you might add to our team.

It is headquartered in Kansas City, MO, with main offices in Orange County, CA, and Milan, Italy. MW Company employs more than 200 people worldwide. Record and monitor customer contacts initiate minimum of semi-annual contact with every lead and dealer in assigned territory. Continue to learn and stay abreast of technical details of brands, market trends and customer preferences. The territory area is Spokane WA and Idaho area.  Under the supervision of Regional Sales Director, you will: Assume responsibility for the effective and professional completion of sales function Creates great business relations customers Handles problems and complaints in a prompt and professional manner Accomplishes all weekly reporting as it relates to Sales Assist with inventory accuracy, warehouse, shipping and receiving functions as needed Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills Assists in verifying accounts, checking product availability, and mailing correspondence Keeps management informed of area activities and significant problems Works with and ensure functions are effectively and accurately performed in accordance with established policies, standards, and security procedures  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS -      High school diploma or equivalent.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 5 years of experience in sales, marketing or customer service Experience with ERP systems preferred, experience with PLEX a plus Understanding of automotive, performance and motorsports preferred

description: Touchstone Medical Imaging is seeking an experienced, dynamic Sales professional to join our team as a Sales Specialist covering the Denver area. The Touchstone Medical Imaging Sales Specialist position is responsible for meeting and exceeding territory sales goals by using strategic sales tactics while performing face to face sales calls. This position will primarily focus on growing referral volume to Touchstone Medical Imaging Outpatient Imaging Centers within a specific sales territory. Selling skills and business planning ability is critical. Successful incumbent should be a flexible thinker who is able to produce results in an ever changing fast paced environment. jobTitle: Sales Account Manager - Telecommute in NC
description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm)  The Sales and Account Manager (SAM) is a field based position charged with enrolling Medicare beneficiaries, residing in a skilled nursing or assisted living facility, into the UnitedHealthcare Institutional Special Needs Plan (ISNP) or the UnitedHealthcare Assisted Living Plan.  If you are located in the Charlotte, NC area, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities Utilize the national sales model to generate leads and enroll beneficiaries into the UnitedHealthcare Nursing Home or Assisted Living Medicare Advantage plan Develop and manage account specific strategies to educate and engage facility personnel, resulting in the generation of interested residents and/or families (responsible parties) Utilize traditional sales strategies to uncover needs and introduce features and benefits of the plan Generate enrollments consistent with targets established for the territory Document all activity to ensure compliance with Medicare Marketing Guidelines Participate on daily/weekly standup calls to report activity and month to day results Develop and maintain relationship with facility champion(s) through ongoing communication, education and demonstration of the value proposition Implement role specific processes designed to educate beneficiaries and generate interest in each assigned facility Enroll beneficiaries through appropriate use of face to face, telephonic or other enrollment strategies Demonstrate the value of the product to interested parties through the use of CMS approved enrollment materials, knowledge of the plan, and introduction of proof sources Update CRM on a daily basis to record interactions with beneficiaries and families Comply with all CMS, organization and departmental regulations and policies Provide market leadership with facility feedback relative to service and product acceptance You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.  Required Qualifications 2+ years of sales experience 2+ years of account management/territory management skills (including planning, documentation and measurement) MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) proficiency Have, or be able to obtain, appropriate state licensure within 90 days of hire date Maintain licensure and product certification based on policies and procedures Ability to work a variety of hours, early morning, evenings and weekends, as required by various sales activities Preferred Qualifications B2B and B2C experience Use of a CRM (salesforce, etc.) Demonstrated experience meeting or exceeding sales goals Maintain a state driver’s license or arrange for transportation in the field Ability to travel 90% throughout the designated local territory UnitedHealth Group requires all new hires and employees to report their COVID-19 vaccination status.  Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm) All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drugfree workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Sales Account Manager, Sales, Medicare, Long Term Care, Nursing Home, Medical Sales, Laboratory, DME, Home Health, Laboratory Sales, Durable Medical Equipment, Telecommute, Telecommuter, Telecommuting, Travel, Charlotte, NC, North Carolina

description: Job Description  We have two remote National Accounts Senior Sales Executive roles available and are seeking someone based in NYC as well as someone based in Boston  Sells to producers, prospective clients, and existing clients in Northeast National Accounts.  Cultivates strong, productive and influential relationships with brokers/consultants, customers, and peers focusing on the larger or more complex accounts/prospects. Implements strategies necessary to attain  sales objectives in assigned areas. Manages complex negotiations.  Positions products, rate levels, and expanded product portfolios to increase sales and maximize revenue. Manages the integration of client's and  Aetna's internal organizations to meet client's installation needs and close the deal. Provides expertise in difficult renewals. Collaborates with account  management and underwriting for renewals on assigned book of business.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line. Provides effective presentations to Aetna constituents. Exhibits  the following Senior Sales Executive Behaviors.  Required Qualifications  10 years + industry experience.  Applicable state licenses to sell products.  Preferred Qualifications  15+ years industry experience.  Education  Bachelor's degree.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

description: Recognized as one of Forbe's 2020 World's Best Employers and named to Fast Company magazine's list of 2021 Most Innovative Companies, is seeking to hire a Specialty Development Executive to help identify and shape opportunities for our continued growth across our Specialty Medicine segment.  This is a unique opportunity to join the Esoteric Business team of a leading global life sciences company that advances patient health and powers clear, confident decisions through its diagnostics and drug development offerings. We developed 100 new tests in 2020 with the same output of first in class, best in class diagnostics planned for 2021.  As a Specialty Development Executive, you will function as an outside sales representative primarily focused on growing and retaining business in the defined, assigned territory, within the specialty segments namely Ambulatory Surgery Centers, Dermatology, Endocrinology, Gastroenterology, Infectious Disease, Medical Drug Monitoring, Neurology, Rheumatology, and Urology.  We are seeking a competitive and collaborative individual with a high degree of communication and business acumen skills who enjoys growing and working with a seasoned, high performing team across a wide variety of high growth therapeutic areas including cancer, Alzheimer's disease, autoimmune disorders, kidney and liver diseases, diabetes, and other conditions.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities Maintain and organize an annual book of business, while meeting and exceeding sales growth goals in the assigned territory. Achieve long and short-term sales objectives by providing specialty solutions Serve as a subject matter expert and champion of our expansive list of testing solutions for customers and prospective clients. Create effective customer relationships. Make in person visits to clients on a regular basis to provide ongoing customer support, education on focus products and market updates for current customer base using sales analytics and insights Act as a liaison between the client and us. Collaborate, communicate and actively contribute to new business opportunities with our Clinical Sales counterparts Keep current with the competition's products, service offerings and activity Stay updated of new products, clinical guidelines, new developments in the industry & research trends Use market data, sales analytics and insights to make sales decisions and spot new business opportunities. Provide updates to senior leadership on key strategic initiatives and new business opportunities Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all company support departments internally. Effectively manage travel logistics to maximize sales productivity Attend local and national professional trade shows and events as requested Update all relevant customer account information into CRM Data Management Systems Requirements Bachelor's degree is preferred Previous sales experience or account management is required; preferably 3 years A strong degree of comfort in both inpatient and outpatient settings Experience with a wide range of hospitals and hospital systems- DOD, academic, urban, rural, VA, etc. (preferably within the given market) highly preferred Successful experience in the AP or clinical specialties space preferred Strong technical competency and business acumen capabilities

description: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity  The future is what you make of it  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges. Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology.  UOP is hiring an experienced Account Manager with Full Cycle Sales accountability in the Refining, Petrochemical, and Adsorbent industry. This position will preferably be based in Des Plaines, IL, US Gulf Coast will be considered.  UOP LLC, headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, USA, is a leading international supplier and licensor of process technology, catalysts, adsorbents, process plants, and consulting services to the petroleum refining, petrochemical, and gas processing industries. UOP is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Honeywell International, Inc. and is part of Honeywell's Performance Materials and Technologies strategic business group.  Honeywell Performance Materials and Technologies is a global leader in providing customers with high-performance specialty materials, including fluorine products; specialty films and additives; advanced fibers and composites; intermediates; specialty chemicals; electronic materials and chemicals; and technologies and materials for petroleum refining.  Position Responsibilities  Forecast product demand and revenue (for refining, petrochemical, catalysts, adsorbents, and services) for assigned accounts 18 months into the future and deliver on resulting annual targets.  Forecast project opportunities and revenue (for technology sales, engineering work, gas processing, etc.) for assigned accounts 18 months into the future and deliver on resulting annual targets.  Manage customer relationships and coverage by sharing information and developing account plans throughout UOP.  Lead opportunities through the entire sales cycle: Identify opportunity, clarify bid, develop sales strategy, enroll and aligning sales support, submit proposal, close the deal, work with order management, production planning and service to make, deliver and service the product.  Support Business and Technology functions by providing market and competitor intelligence.  Report and work with internal resources to resolve customer issues including legal agreements.  Maintain all internal work and sales processes, e.g. SFDC.  20-30% domestic travel annually.  Must Have  BS degree in Engineering  Minimum of 5 years’ experience within either the refining, petrochemical, midstream, or gas processing industries.  1+ years’ of experience with the operations in either the refining, petrochemical, midstream, or gas processing industries (i.e. knowledge of catalysts and absorbents application in respective industry)  We Value  Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering  6 or more years of direct sales and/or sales support (high level of customer focused engagements) experience  Demonstrated ability to sell into a competitive market place and achieve premium prices by communicating the value achieved by the customer using UOP technologies, products and services  Knowledge of the application of catalysts, adsorbents, or technologies in refinery, petrochemical, and gas processes in either the refining, petrochemical, gas, and midstream industries in the Americas  Experience with adsorption/treating, reforming, isomerization, hydroprocessing, gas processing, or petrochemicals (i.e. OLEFINS or Aromatics)  Experience using CRM (i.e SFDC)  Good listening and communication skills  The ability to work effectively with other sales colleagues and sales support functions is key  A strong customer and business focus  Fluency in English  PMT102021  Additional Information JOB ID: HRD139526 Category: Sales Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Sales (LATAM)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Come Tell Your Story With Us!  The Vomela Companies has an exciting opportunity for a high-energy and goal-oriented Account Executive. Vomela is an industry-leading, print conglomerate, with some of the most advanced capabilities around. We specialize in graphics of all kinds; from traditional commercial print to visual merchandising, store decor, fleet graphics and more. Our Account Executives combine direct sales, marketing and account management to provide comprehensive graphic solutions to Fortune 500 companies.  For printing companies, there’s a fine line between being too big and too small. One is impersonal, where employees can feel like just a number. The other simply can’t handle much and is always waiting for the next big job. Vomela is the best of both worlds. We offer the support and diversity of a national organization with the family feel of a smaller company. Vomela operates sales and manufacturing facilities in more than 20 locations across the Unites States and Canada and no matter which of our successful divisions you choose to work at, you can make a difference.  To learn more about Vomela and our opportunities, visit our website at www.vomela.com.  Currently, we have openings for remote Account Executives in Arizona, Florida and San Diego areas. We offer the candidates an opportunity to grow and evolve their careers while working in a fun, fast paced and dynamic environment. Our international network of companies allows members of our sales team to build relationships with and provide marketing and printing solutions to some of the largest and most recognized brands in the world.  Responsibilities Build and establish new business relationships Actively strengthen one-on-one relationships with buyers (This is a repeat sale once you establish the relationship you can keep the customer for years) Marketing acumen and passion Collaborate and consult with your clients to bring new ideas and solutions Provide extraordinary customer service throughout the sales process Managing the sale using KPI objectives and CRM process Requirements BS/BA degree 6 months to 2 years of successful business to business sales experience Graphics/Printing industry experience The ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast paced, high energy environment Great communication skills Competitive, persistent and eager to achieve results Confidence, enthusiasm and an ability to persuade and influence others Coachable with a collaborative team approach Benefits The most attractive salary/commission plan in the industry Uncapped growth potential Comprehensive benefit package including a 401k A financially stable, employee focused environment that serves as the foundation for a successful, long term career Location  Openings in Arizona/Florida/San Diego (Remote Position)  Years Of Experience  Minimum of 1-2 years selling experience  We are and Equal Opportunity Employer.  Vomela is one of the largest and fastest growing marketing specialty companies in North America. With 24 locations and more than 1,300 employees, Vomela utilizes the latest in technology to manage, produce, and distribute corporate marketing programs and collateral, retail in-store signage (POS/POP), tradeshow and event programs, transportation and fleet graphics.

description: The Role  The Revenue Analytics team at Peloton uses data and analytics to accelerate and optimize connected fitness membership growth across all sales channels. The team consists of 2 functional areas: Revenue Planning and Sales Channel Analytics.  Peloton is looking for a thoughtful, curious and ambitious professional to join the Sales Channel Analytics team, with a focus on improving efficiency of our sales teams. The sales analyst will utilize data to drive actionable insights that enhance the productivity of Peloton’s sales teams, including visibility into quota setting and attainment, ramp time, and incrementality of sales touchpoints. This role involves collaboration across the Inside Sales, Retail, Finance, and Revenue Operations teams. The successful candidate would be just as comfortable spending hours analyzing data as they would be having an impactful conversation about the business implications of that analysis with senior stakeholders.  Responsibilities Partner with the revenue planning team to build and maintain robust sales forecasts along with KPI measurement and tracking Analyze actual monthly, weekly performance and identify key drivers behind variances in sales and budgets Develop and maintain operational KPI dashboards in Looker Serve as key owner of insights and disseminate reports, findings, and dashboards across the organization Strategize on methodologies to address and answer complex decisions through analytics Partner with LOB managers to help them better understand their businesses and identify opportunities for improvement Qualifications BA/BS degree in an analytical discipline 3-5 years of experience working in an analytics function in direct-to-consumer business with both ecommerce and retail sales channels High aptitude and enthusiasm for complex problem solving utilizing business modeling and analysis, including advanced Excel, Powerpoint. Advanced experience working with reporting and data visualization capabilities in Looker and Salesforce. Serious plus: Highly proficient in SQL, with the ability to write complex and nuanced queries against new or unfamiliar data sets. Proactive, thoughtful, & highly organized self-starter; able to work independently and under tight deadlines while maintaining impeccable attention to detail; thrives in ambiguity and develops novel approaches to open-ended problems without a clear right answer Excellent communication and collaboration skills required; role involves building strong relationships across the organization. Also needs to be able to distill technical or complex matters into clear and concise explanations to senior leaders and business stakeholders About Peloton  Peloton uses technology + design to connect the world through fitness, empowering people to be the best version of themselves anywhere, anytime. We have reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform. Seamlessly combining hardware, software, and streaming technology, we create digital fitness and wellness content and products that Members love. In 2020 Peloton committed to becoming an antiracist organization with the launch of the Peloton Pledge. Learn more, here.  “Together We Go Far” means that we are greater than the sum of our parts, stronger collectively when each one of us is at our best. In order to be the best version of Peloton, we are deeply committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive culture where all of our team members can be the best version of themselves. This work has no endpoint; it is the constant work of running an organization that strives to reach its full potential. As a first step in our commitment, we announced the Peloton Pledge to invest $100 million over the next four years to fight racial injustice and inequity in our world, and to promote health and wellbeing for all, from the inside out.  Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our applicants. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from application through to interview, please email: applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com  Please be aware that fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers may be circulated on the Internet in an attempt to obtain privileged information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Peloton does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted here on our careers page and all communications from the Peloton recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @onepeloton.com email address.  If you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Peloton, please email applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.  Peloton does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Agencies should not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Peloton employees or any other organization location. Peloton is not responsible for any agency fees related to unsolicited resumes.
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness

description: We're looking for a Business Development Representative to join our team in the US as part of our Sales function.   Key Responsibilities  Effectively managing inbound lead queue; following up on marketing-driven leads Researching and identifying prospect companies who will benefit from our service and data products; developing and executing strategies for outbound prospecting via email, cold calling, LinkedIn Sales Navigator and any other means relevant Speaking with provided and self-sourced prospects to discuss potential needs and how WGSN would be beneficial to them Utilizing good discovery tactics and questions in a consultative sales style Qualify leads for the sales team so that they can demonstrate WGSN to its full potential and identify how this will be an essential tool for the customer’s business Ensuring that once meetings are booked, relevant research and information is translated to the sales people so that they are set up for success in their meetings Meet weekly and monthly qualified call, meeting and opportunity goals to ensure company revenue objectives are met Learn and maintain extensive knowledge of market/industry trends, developments, WGSN customers, competitors, and products; building expertise towards being able to tell the WGSN story while pitching WGSN value Working closely with the marketing team on lead generation and new business activities, including but not limited to events, email campaigns, social media Attending WGSN hosted events for marketing and other relevant networking events   Your Experience This opportunity is ideal for an individual who is towards the beginning of their sales career, with 1-2 years of experience. We offer extensive training and clear career progression for successful individuals. You will be focused on a variety of industries from across fashion apparel and accessories, home furnishings, CPG, travel and tourism, food and drink, durable goods, and entertainment. You will be interacting with SME to enterprise size companies. A motivated dynamic and self-driven individual who is confident and professional in approach with a positive ‘can-do’ attitude Someone who is passionate about the prospect of delivering creative intelligence to new clients and helping them transform their business A flair for strong relationship building on the telephone at all levels Possess strong interpersonal, organization and time management skills Excellent computer skills across general computer programs like Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint Previous B2B sales experience, preferably telephone sales, preferred An understanding of Salesforce or a similar CRM system would be a plus Knowledge of our core industries such as fashion, food and drink, beauty, interiors is a plus Very strong knowledge of how the web works and how to make it efficient (HTTP, caching, page rendering, etc) Experience working in a continuous integration environment Experience working in an environment with Agile practices Experience working with product managers, designers, marketers, stakeholders Good understanding of how to work effectively with microservices and a service-oriented architecture In-depth knowledge of agile process and principles. You live agile, and know how to lead in agile, cross-functional teams Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)  What We Offer  Our benefits package incorporates what we’re passionate about – unlocking your future, overall well-being and sustainability – whilst giving you control over your benefits. ·      15 days of holiday per year and an extra day for each year of service up to 20 days ·      401K – Saving Incentive plan ·      Medical and Dental Insurance plans ·      Flexible Spending Accounts ·      Vision benefits ·      Great learning and development opportunities ·      Life Assurance and Disability insurance ·      Option to opt into the Ascential Shares Scheme   Inclusive Workforce  At Ascential, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Ascential people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals.  Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.  If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the application and interview process, please let us know so that we can support you.  For more information on our culture, visit Ascential.com.   About WGSN  We offer insights and inspiration from around the globe. We help our customers stay ahead and informed through trend forecasting and data science. We believe inspiration comes from the monumental and the mundane.  If you’re passionate about fashion and lifestyle this is a great place to be, giving you the opportunity to work with the world's most creative trend experts, designers, editors, account managers, marketers, product developers, customer service experts and much more in a meritocratic, high performance company.    Want More Info?  Find out more on what our people say: Ascential YouTube Channel  If we inspire
industries: Information Services

Contribute to the company’s marketing strategies, sales collateral, and product development. Requirements 3-5 years of experience working in sales and/or media. A solid understanding of account planning in an advertising agency or group. Ability to travel to clients when needed. #ZR #hotjobs

description: Position Responsibilities: ·     Actively target large institutions, banks, and large fund managers ·     Accountability for the overall business results ·     Coordinate and participate in industry events, conferences, and round tables to further develop relationships with prospects, existing clients, and strategically relevant 3rd parties ·     Demonstrate fluency across our extensive product line ·     Organize and drive sales campaigns ·     Manage timely follow up on all external actions post prospect calls and meetings ·     Ensure respective CRM systems are up to date ·     Other duties as assigned  Job Requirements: 10+ years of experience in a sales role dealing with large institutions, banks, and large fund managers with a proven track record of revenue generation 2 + years of formal training with a bulge bracket Investment Bank Undergraduate degree from a competitive top tier University Ability to demo a diverse range of products An extensive network of decision makers in the financial industry and a willingness to leverage them Knowledge of financial markets with an advanced degree in economics, business, finance, computer engineering, or CFA preferred Charisma, shrewdness, and fortitude to influence decision makers within and without Ability to manage complex transactions Adaptive and versatile analytical skills

description: Are you good at building strong relationships and are excited about working for a growing leader in the Oncology space? Then it is time to consider a career at Biotheranostics, a Hologic company.  Due to our success and continued growth, we are looking to add to our Commercial Team and bring in exceptional talent with big ideas, strong personalities, and a lot of potential to be part of this amazing journey.  Think this role is for you?  As a Key Account Manager at Biotheranostics, you will thrive at managing and enhancing relationships with strategic key accounts, these include Academic Centers, Integrated Delivery Networks, Medical Groups, Integrated Delivery Systems, etc.  From the day-to-day smooth management of the account relationship to the strategic partnership development, you will be in the driving seat. You will be responsible for the development and implementation of Customer Development Plans for your designated accounts.  Playing to your interpersonal and influencing skills and commercial acumen you will help to develop our key academic and thought leader relationships, as well as working with our state, regional and district business leaders to ensure appropriate levels of support are given to these accounts.  Key Outcomes:  Your reputation within the Oncology space, and deep relationships with Key Opinion Leaders will support us in reaching more patients by equipping us with the ability to get our products in front of the right teams, maximizing our patient outcomes and commercial returns.  Always thinking strategically, you will understand and execute upon the opportunities to maximize revenue streams within your accounts as well as helping us to be proactive and mitigate account risk from our competitors.  And with strong knowledge of healthcare reform, you will be a local expert, the eyes and ears of the ever-evolving landscape of oncology diagnostics. Whether you prefer working in an office, or from the comfort of your home, we offer flexible working to all of our employees.  Do you have what it takes?  Outside of your account relationships and ability to deliver you will love the opportunity to be part of a successful and team-driven culture.  You will work across the breadth of our business but can expect to be chatting with teams such as sales management, local reps, Field Science and Medical Science Liaisons, regularly, so having a conversational attitude is important.  You will also be able to soak up information quickly, and share it in a concise and informative manner, and given your background in pharmaceutical or biotech sales/marketing, we know this will come easily to you.  Join us as a Key Account Manager and grab the opportunity to improve lives across the whole world as part of the Hologic Family. It all starts here. What are you waiting for?  Additional Qualifications And Other Information BA/BS Degree Required 5+ years of Oncology Diagnostics, Pharmaceutical or Biotech Sales/Marketing experience 3+ years as an Oncology Key Account Manager in a similar capacity 75% travel within the region  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.  Agency And Third Party Recruiter Notice  Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition, Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.
industries: Medical Devices

description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Associate  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Committed, loyal and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. Honest people who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do You will get exposure to the proven winning Stryker Trauma culture that delivers Industry leading results in all market segments You will receive best-in-class formal Trauma training on product portfolio and selling skills which includes on-the-job training in the operating room. You’ll become an expert on surgical procedures by observing well-over 300 cases in your first year You will develop well-rounded field exposure to prepare you in all aspects of the selling/ servicing process when a territory opportunity arises You will develop a high level of competency in Orthopaedic surgical needs and procedures becoming a valuable member of the surgical team and positively impacting surgical outcomes You will build a strong brand in account management and client service – key drivers in our business! You will work in a highly competitive and challenging work environment that will put your best talents to work every single day What You Need To be successful in this role bring your strong multitasking ability, ability to read and sell to any audience, drive to achieve and succeed, aptitude to learn medical and technical information quickly, ability to build strong, lasting relationships, a strong work-ethic and a competitive nature Bachelor’s Degree required 1+ years of sales experience preferred Come ready to make a difference…fast! What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Medical Devices

description: If you are looking for an opportunity that provides satisfaction and personal growth, we encourage you to apply for our Territory Sales Manager opening.   We promptly review all applications. Highly qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews.    About the job  This is your opportunity to join the expanding CELSIUS Field Sales Team! CELSIUS is one of the fastest growing Energy Drink Brands nationally! At CELSIUS we pride ourselves in providing our employees a culture and atmosphere of inclusiveness that challenges individuals to be thought leaders, innovators and game changers as every employee is an owner of the CELSIUS Brand upon joining the Organization.   Who are we looking for specifically? Someone to seek out, sell and cultivate new business in all retail Channels to include Grocery, Mass, Convenience and Specialty for CELSIUS while amplifying existing businesses and Partnerships. Effectively and efficiently expand assigned business in coordination with CELSIUS Distributor and Retailer Partners. The position will be expected to participate in local level field sales strategy development, planning and execution of key initiatives at 10 – 15 stores per day while providing real time feedback, opportunities, results and direction utilizing CELSUIS’ Field Sales selling platform. The candidate must show an ability to be a self-starter, competitive by nature and have a drive to succeed individually and WIN BIG as a member of a Team.  Essential Functions and Responsibilities Within assigned market, execute the Celsius Inc. sales plan through the attainment of shelf distribution, cold box placement, promotional execution, displays and the placement of brand collateral at retail. Secure new outlet availability by influencing distributors through route rides, crew drives and local key account calls as required. Provide ongoing communication on sales, marketing and executional opportunities with assigned Distributor Partners. Assist District and/or Regional Sales Manager with bill backs and other duties as assigned. Participate in weekly recap and planning calls outlining objectives, results, barriers and opportunities.  Special Requirements Ability to travel within the assigned territory including potential overnight travel. Must be able (with or without accommodation) of bending and lifting to set up displays, adjust shelves during resets, move product, etc.  Knowledge and Skills Required Strong business acumen with an entrepreneurial spirit. Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills (verbal/written) with the ability to interact effectively internally as well as with external contacts. Deep rooted understanding of the assigned territory and the surrounding area. Creative and strategic thinker. Experience negotiating. Strong team player. Problem solver. PowerPoint, Excel and Word proficient.  The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.   Celsius Holdings, Inc. celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. We believe strongly in fostering a safe, fair and respectful work environment.

About Us  Every small business journey is different, filled with its own twists and turns. Mineral is with them every step of the way, taking the guesswork out of HR and compliance so that they’re always ready for whatever lies ahead.  Mineral brings together the best of two HR and compliance powerhouses: ThinkHR and Mammoth.  By combining certified HR experts with tech-enabled tools, Mineral takes the guesswork out of HR. Our innovative platform is a one-stop resource for small businesses, filled with everything they need to tackle even the trickiest workplace issues with confidence.  Humble brag alert: Mineral has been consistently recognized for our award-winning culture, and we’re especially proud of our 2020 Great places to Work certification. Simply put, Mineral is a place where people want to be, which could explain why we’ve also been ranked among the nation’s fastest-growing private companies.  As a company, Mineral is also made up of incredibly diverse, vibrant individuals, working together for the greater good. We’re here to help our clients build healthy, thriving organizations, and we’re looking for some like-minded people to help us do it.  Do you enjoy working in fast-paced and frequently changing work environment.? Are you collaborative? If you said yes, then we have the team for you! Join us in developing game-changing HR solutions used by hundreds of thousands of businesses nationwide. Our high-performance culture empowers individuals to have a direct impact on our success (and the opportunity to grow their careers).  The Key Account Manager will be responsible for creating long-term, trusting and mutually beneficial relationships with our re seller partners. This role will oversee a portfolio of assigned accounts and with a focus on expanding new business, increasing end-client adoption, product utilization and ultimately monthly recurring revenue. The ideal candidate will join our company poised for explosive growth while remaining committed to the end goal of developing a plan to increase revenue from their accounts, serve as primary point of contact for the partner and offer guidance on a proactive and consistent basis.  Essential Functions Of The Role Build positive working relationships with assigned channel partners to maximize product sales within their customer base. Understand partners’ current business, challenges and goals to develop trusted advisor status and build loyalty. Coordinate with partners to identify key sales opportunities to generate revenue and increase adoption of products to our different levels of service. Act as a single point of contact for assigned accounts to triage and resolve partner related issues and sales conflicts in a timely fashion. Develop partner specific sales and marketing plans to increase selling efforts through collaboration with our marketing team and the partners’ marketing team. Experience, Skills, Abilities, Education, and Certifications Minimum 3+ years of Sales or Account Management experience Superior customer service skills with the ability to focus on solutions Strong organizational skills and the ability to create clear business processes Self-motivated sales professional with strong work ethic, integrity, and values Ability to identify sales opportunities and strategically grow partnerships Payroll/HCM/PEO/insurance broker experience a plus Benefits and Perks  Generous medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage  401k + company match  Flexible PTO + Company Holidays  Corporate Bonus Program  Paid Family Leave  Other Market Competitive Perks And Benefits  Equal opportunities, accessibility for all  Mineral values diversity and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All individuals seeking employment at Mineral are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected characteristic.  We’re also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants with disabilities in our job application and recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, don’t hesitate to reach out to us at careers@trustmineral.com

You will discover qualified opportunities by responding to inbound interests and targeted outbound prospects to build rapport and establish long-term relationships.   Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1 - 2 years' of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

description: Sales Trainer Sales training is essential to an organization’s success, and it’s a powerful tool for developing the full potential of every sales rep. The success of a program is due in large part to the individual delivering it—and the approach they take.  All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Location: Remote Storable is a distributed-first company, but is only registered for employment in a certain number of states. In order to be considered, you must permanently reside in the following states to be eligible for employment: Texas, Colorado, North Carolina, Tennessee, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Missouri, Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona, Alabama, Mississippi Louisiana, South Carolina, Oklahoma, Wyoming, Nebraska, Wisconsin, Virginia  About Us: At Storable, we believe storage operators should have one partner they can trust to help you get the results they need for their business. That’s why we’ve built the industry’s first fully integrated platform that offers facility management software, facility websites, marketing programs and services, payments, and deeply integrated tenant insurance capabilities all in one solution.  We leverage our platform in combination with our over 25 years of storage industry expertise to help our thousands of storage customers achieve their tenant experience and operational efficiency objectives every  single day.   What you will do everyday: Coach and develop our sales and CS reps Own all new hire Sales and CS training Review and improve our current sales process / training methodology - make strategic recommendations that help us drive to world class sales process and results  Leverage current call monitoring system that quantifies and calibrates call skill performance and identifies opportunities for improvement  Create, update, maintain, and report on rep coaching logs Work with Sales Leadership, Revenue Operations & Learning & Development to identify areas of opportunity, metrics, and behaviors to coach and monitor Assist sales management with driving adoption of processes and key metrics  Operational Activities & Responsibilities  Directly engage front-line sales team members to teach, mentor, coach and drive the sales process Engage and assist sales reps on active opportunities as needed Work with Learning & Development to prepare and organise digital and or physical job aids or other materials required to facilitate the learning process Facilitate the collection, sharing, and archiving of sales best practices Post training follow up and reinforcement Conduct regular recurring coaching sessions with their assigned reps Coach and assist reps with the activities and action items in their assigned coaching plans Monitor and evaluate sales calls with sales team members regularly  What you need to bring to the table: Strong background in sales and sales process training (at least 2-4 years of professional training experience) Sales Leadership experience is preferable Must be humble - the focus must remain on the participants and their development. Intellectually curious and facilitates authentic discussions Altruistic - motivated by having a positive impact on team members career Always looking for ways to improve their craft World class communicator - ability to communicate complex ideas that are easily absorbed by participants A great balance of strategic mindset with incredible hands on presence  A difference maker who loves helping a team to win  Benefits and Perks: Generous health coverage for you and your family, including short- and long-term disability coverage, 401(k) and HSA matching, company-provided life insurance, and more. Engage remotely! Since March of 2020, we transitioned to a fully remote environment and we run regular contests, trivia games and remote happy hours. Instant-Access & Flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a ‘take what you need’ vacation policy. No waiting to use it or need for accruals. Do More, Be More – Company rewards and recognition that add up and can be redeemed for once-in-a-lifetime Bucketlist experiences! Get active in the community by joining one of our many quarterly offsite volunteer and community service events. Fun company events, including Halloween costume contests, ugly sweater competitions, baseball game outings, ice cream socials, food trucks, and more.  Storable is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Storable will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.
