description: Job Description:    The commercial roofing industry is growing, & Siplast is growing with it! If you’re ready to take your roofing knowledge or sales experience to the next level, this could be the job for you!  Join our dynamic Sales Team!    This Field Sales Representative role is a pathway to progression and increasing responsibility while receiving training from your Senior Territory Manager and Regional Sales Director.  Build your sales skills, Siplast roofing knowledge, and understanding of your market in this salaried position. While you learn and develop, you’ll receive a monthly guaranteed commission in addition to your salary!   GENERAL DUTIES:   The Field Sales Representative will be trained in, and responsible for, assisting the Senior Territory Manager and Regional Sales Director with:   Product sales, accomplished primarily through specification selling to major owners, architects, roofing consultants, and roofing contractors. Includes identification of prospective jobs and decision-making individuals, timely contact, and effective follow-up.  Also includes proper use of sales and promotional tools provided by the company and the development of additional tools, such as local job photos, testimonials, references, etc. Assisting with management of the contractor base, including regular business review meetings, training of contractor crews, and monitoring of Siplast applications. Working closely with area Field Technical Representative to prioritize and manage technical needs, including development and/or review of roofing specifications for prospective jobs, participation in pre-job meetings, periodic job/rooftop inspections, and basic troubleshooting. Providing essential support to customers for their on-site needs.  This includes site meetings, documenting site conditions, evaluating product claims, and coordinating with Technical Services to ensure timely issuance of guarantees. Assisting with sales and administrative tasks as needed to support the Senior Territory Manager or Regional Sales Director. As experience increases, these responsibilities may shift to the FSR, with the Senior Territory Manager’s input and approval.   QUALIFICATIONS: Siplast product knowledge or 1+ years equivalent roofing product knowledge Face-to-face sales call experience; proven ability to establish business relationships Some college/ college degree preferred, but not required. Sales ability and persuasiveness Computer skills/keyboarding skills GSuite &/or Salesforce familiarity a plus Self-disciplined and motivated (initiative) Confidence, assertiveness, tenacity, and resiliency Excellent interpersonal skills and solid communication skills (both verbal & written) Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an insurable driving record Ability to travel as necessary (depending on area, could average 3–4 overnights/month) Ability to have and maintain a Company credit card for business-related expenses Flexible schedule, ability to alter work as needed.    PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Ability to drive car and travel without assistance Ability to climb ladders, work with heights, and demonstrate roof applications Ability to work in outdoor conditions (including high/low temperatures, wind, dust, humidity, etc.) Visual acuity to perform inspections, read computer screens, documents, etc. Manual dexterity to perform data entry, filing, and site inspections Ability to hear and speak on the phone Ability to bend, pull, and reach to perform filing and site inspection functions Ability to lift up to 50 lbs (booth, sample boxes, products, etc.)   BENEFITS: Competitive Salary Great healthcare, dental, & vision coverage - effective day one! 401k with up to a 7% company contribution 3 weeks vacation + 13 company holidays Employee Assistance Program, Discount Programs, and more!   We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best – Protect what matters most.  As part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccines are required for all candidates and employees in this position. Proof of vaccination is required. Should you require accommodation for medical or religious needs, GAF will engage in an interactive process with you to determine if a reasonable accommodation can be provided in accordance with applicable state and federal law.        At Siplast, we believe our employees are our greatest resource.  We offer competitive salary, benefits, and vacation package for all full-time permanent positions.  Siplast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.    We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without need for employer-sponsored visa (work permit).    If you are an internal employee, please do not apply here. Please click on the Careers bubble in Workday, which can be accessed via the HR Portal.
jobFunction: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service

description: Role Description Elemental Machines is seeking a Highly Motivated SaaS Enterprise Account Executive, to help source and create qualified opportunities as part of the rapidly expanding Commercial Team. To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience with developing robust pipelines through cold outbound activity. You will use your strong communication skills to cultivate and maintain relationships with our clients, from initial contact until closing.   Responsibilities Consistently research, identify and generate multiple new opportunities each week Convert 75% of intros to qualified opportunities Generate a significant pipeline per quarter with mid to large pharma/biotech and agtech companies. Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects to move through defined sales process In CRM, track activities, customers communications, forecast, and onsite events with prospective customers to enable accurate forecasting Meet and exceed outbound cold call, email, & social selling activities Demonstrate and present the value of Elemental Solutions to C-Suite Executives Methodically qualify, build, and manage prospect lists Engage directly with Commercial VP and Executive Team regarding newly generated opportunities and potential product development Experiment and iterate to create personalized customer communications Diligently follow up on leads generated through trade shows, online campaigns, and other marketing initiatives  Requirements Proven track record for meeting and exceeding lead generation and quarterly/annual sales objectives 5+ years of B2B/Enterprise/SaaS/PaaS experience Experience cold calling middle/senior management at pharma/biotech and life science companies Highly motivated professional with excellent written/verbal communication skills Experience with CRM tools Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth sales environment Travel: Approximately 25%

Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As an ENT Sales Representative, you strategically promote and sell Stryker ENT products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As an ENT Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need 5+ years in an outside sales position (medical related fields or b2b sales preferred) or Bachelor’s Degree from an Accredited University (plus 2+ years of outside sales experience preferred) Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program Learn more about Stryker’s ENT Products: https://ent.stryker.com/medical-devices

description: Sales Representative  Smith is currently looking for experienced sales professional to join their Sales Team. As one of the world’s leading independent electronics distributors, the successful applicants will play a significant role in Smith’s market leading expertise on global electronics sourcing, logistics and distribution.  At Smith, we encourage our sales team to take an entrepreneurial approach to their work, believing that every impact can make a difference. We are looking for talented individuals who are driven, self-motivated and hungry for success. If you are not afraid of a challenge and looking for a rewarding environment, we would like to speak with you.  More senior candidates with more than 4 to 8 years of experience may be considered for a Senior Sales Representative or Sales Manager position.  Key Responsibilities • Develop and maintain a portfolio of prospective OEM customers within the region and internationally • Become an expert in the customers’ industry and act as the main point of contact for any client related inquiries • Identify potential customers and develop sales strategies • Provide effective cost-saving solutions (PPV) to customers based on accurate marketplace insight • Assist customers to remove excess stock proactively  Requirements • Bachelor degree in any discipline • At least 2 years of sales experience in electronics or any relevant industries is highly preferred • Passionate, proactive, self-motivated, and result-driven • Ability to handle work independently, systematically in a fast-paced environment • Excellent communication skills and passionate in cold calling • Good command of both written and oral English and Chinese, Japanese is a plus  About Smith Founded in 1984, Smith is a global distributor of semiconductors and electronic components and a trusted provider of efficiency-enhancing supply chain services to electronics and high-tech manufacturers. Smith’s investment in advanced in-house labs, a highly trained professional team, and strategically located global support centers offers our partners complete sourcing, inventory management solutions, cost-saving program, and more.  A privately held company, Smith employs more than 600 people worldwide, with over $1.39 billion in sales annually. Smith's regional hubs in Houston, Hong Kong, and Amsterdam are ISO-certified. In addition, sales and purchasing offices are located in Austin, Beijing, Silicon Valley, Guadalajara, New York, Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Seoul, Taipei, Penang, Cluj-Napoca, Munich, and Bangalore

description: Job Title: National Account Manager - NS  General Summary: This position is responsible for promoting the company's complete line of diversified services to national account clients in order to achieve profitable revenue growth at an acceptable expense level.  Duties and Responsibilities (functions considered essential are marked by an *):  • *Establishes and maintains effective communication and working relationships with customer executives/managers  • *Responsible for sales growth and diversification of services sold to assigned accounts  • *Develops/plans revenue growth, customer service requirements, profitability and expense control within assigned accounts  • Identify customer service needs, changes, modifications required to meet market demands  • *Provides customers information as requested, problem solves and coordinates customer solutions  • *Utilizes resources to identify market trends within railroad industry and identify/qualify competition  • *Responsible for keeping current on industry trends and industry knowledge in order to fulfill sales targets and objectives  • *Identifies and maintains potential clients within the railroad industry using advertising campaigns, mailing lists and personal contacts  • *Effectively communicates and coordinates Account Plans for the company.  • * Must pass background checks to be allowed on railroad property.  • Assists in the training of Business Development Managers, National Account or other key management position on an as needed basis  JOB QUALIFICATIONS (refers to job, not incumbent):  Educational Requirements: Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university  Experience Requirements: Five years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Knowledge/ Skills: Strong ability to effectively communicate technical information to all types of people, both verbally and in writing; ability to multitask; strong communication, decision-making, analytical, problem solving and interpersonal skills  Strong knowledge of conceptual/strategic selling methodology  Ability to influence people and negotiate  Ability to think on a strategic “big picture” level  Ability to close business sales and demonstrate results  Ability to coach and team build  Travel: Subject to long, irregular hours and 24-hour on-call availability. Must be able to travel 60% of the time. Driving for extended periods.  Working Conditions: Indoor and external working environments. The employee is exposed to outside weather conditions, extreme cold, extreme heat, including wet and/or humid conditions. The employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; risk of electrical shock; vibration; fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, explosives, and risk of radiation. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet (with exception of work done on-site).

description: Background  About Rollick, Inc.  Rollick connects manufacturers, dealers, and finance and insurance providers with in-market consumers in the Powersports, RV, and Marine industries to deliver a seamless customer journey. Rollick’s solutions include new customer acquisition, enterprise lead management, customer experience/loyalty, and marketing automation. In addition, the company has rapidly built its GoRollick.com outdoor recreational vehicle buying marketplace to include a nationwide network of dealers, over 100 manufacturers, and an affinity partner network with access to over 250 million high-quality customers including policyholders of major insurance providers, employees at more than 2,000 top U.S. companies, members of the military, veterans and first responders. For more information, visit Rollick.  Position Summary  The Marketplace Team is responsible for the growth of the GoRollick.com Recreational Vehicle Marketplace and the corresponding revenue partnerships. The Senior Manager of Strategic Partnerships reports directly to the Senior Vice President of Marketplace.  Your job will be to manage and grow our most important partnerships, such as partnerships with lenders, insurance providers, OEMs, accessory providers, and other strategic partners that can grow Rollick’s revenue. You will project manage these initiatives cross-functionally and will be responsible for hitting revenue targets. You will be instrumental in shaping the partnership strategy for Rollick and will be on the ground floor as we build the most dynamic company in the recreational vehicle space. The ideal candidate enjoys working in an entrepreneurial environment, is curious-minded and willing to wear many hats, is highly analytical, has strong sales and relationship skills, and is excited about the opportunity to have revenue responsibility.  Rollick is the fastest growing B2C marketplace in the recreational vehicle space, plus has dozens of partnerships which large affinity organizations including AAA, Sam’s Club, Progressive, Allstate, top employee benefit platforms and more.  Responsibilities Proactively grow Rollick’s strategic partnerships Own day-to-day relationship management of Rollick’s strategic partnerships Own project management of the various growth initiatives and develop new growth strategies to drive revenue Communicate project requirements to product, technology, dealer, finance, accounting and legal teams Create mechanisms/dashboards/metrics to forecast revenue, costs, overall performance of partnership and related marketing initiatives Develop and communicate internal and external reporting, forecasts, analysis, and presentations. Onboard and launch new strategic partnerships  Qualifications Strong background in the following: Business Development, Strategy, and Project Management Self-starter with ability to multi-task, remain organized, adapt to shifting priorities, and complete work consistently by or before agreed upon deadlines This candidate must be strong analytically and have experience using data to make informed decisions, with a proven ability to present analysis and results to senior management Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, economics, finance, or any other analytical discipline 5 - 7 years’ work experience in a similar business development or strategic partnership role. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to present analysis and results to senior management Experience in building strong relationships with key Internal and Partner stakeholders across organizational and departmental boundaries Strong proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint  Nice to Have Ability to analyze and dissect data through google analytics (or similar tool) and develop accompanying strategies Technical aptitude: you speak the language and can interface with our product and engineering teams Experience in automotive, powersports, RV, marine or technology is a plus.

EARN UNLIMITED INCOME   Seeking a Client Relationship Manager, with a minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a competitive sales environment. Candidates must have exceptional interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills to thrive in this position. The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of previous sales experience in B2B sales and selling to C-suite executives. The successful candidate will be self-motivated and goal-oriented to meet the necessary expectations of this firm.   Essential Duties: -Diligent prospecting to locate new business opportunities through cold-calling, emailing, and networking events - Assist senior management in preparation of new prospects and existing client meetings - Maintain rapport with all sales leads and existing clients - Communicate with existing clients and prospects to ensure they receive high-level support  Key Skills: - Organized - Goal Oriented - Self-Motivated - Determined - Competitive - Entrepreneurial spirited - Superb verbal and written communication - Team oriented

description: Come for the mission. Stay for the experience.  Let's keep things simple: we are an unbelievably talented, hard-working, and compassionate team driving towards a mission that impacts every single one of us - even you! Healthcare benefits are complex, underutilized, and a mystery for most users. We're removing that complexity.  Our industry-leading technology solution puts a simplified benefits experience in the hands of users, saving them time and money. Since the start of the pandemic, we've created a COVID-19 resource center, helped members find testing and care, and made it even simpler to get telemedicine and mental health support to employees.  HealthJoy experienced explosive growth in 2020: we raised $30M in Series C funding, earned awards for Talent Culture's Best HR Technology Leaders and Forbes America's Best Startup Employers, added 55+ key team members despite going totally remote, and so much more. This year, we continue down that path of high growth and high impact.  Your impact. Partner with brokers across your region to incorporate HealthJoy into their employee benefits offering Use a consultative sales approach to identify client needs and use detailed knowledge of the HealthJoy solutions to challenge prospective brokers & customers to consider a new and innovative offering Ability to articulate HealthJoy's value proposition to prospective and existing clients and successfully secure new business Develop and deliver sales presentations to clients onsite Collaborate with all levels and departments in a positive and successful manner  Your experience. Aggressive self-starter with strong relationship management and negotiation skills Proven track record of achieving sales and revenue goals Commitment to sell, win and grow Strong interpersonal communication skills; excellent poise and presentation skills 5+ years of experience in a sales position Ability to travel 50% of time  Our rewards.  Work should be meaningful and rewarding.  HealthJoy offers a robust package of employee perks and benefits, including healthcare benefits (medical, dental and vision, EAP, and telemedicine), flexible PTO plan, 401k+match, parental leave, and HSA contribution match. We also provide our employees with a remote work stipend - to ensure you can work comfortably from home, host virtual-lunch-and-learns, 'friendship time' pairings, virtual coffee chats/happy hours, and quarterly team activities.  The best benefit of all? We use our own product. As an employee, you can rely on HealthJoy to feel confident about your own healthcare decisions and get the most out of your unique benefits plan.  HealthJoy is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: We’re looking for passionate, high-energy individual to join our growing organization.  This role reports to the President at Harddiskdirect.com  About You  Our ideal candidate is a self-starter who has extensive experience in account management or customer-facing roles (e.g. sales, customer services and business development etc.). This role requires interaction and engagement with senior professionals.  You should possess a “get-things-done” approach, a data-driven mindset, creativity, and be able to independently manage your portfolio (“book of business”).  Job Summary  The Key Account Manager shall be responsible for handling the most important client accounts of harddiskdirect.com. The incumbent must build and maintain strong relationship with the clients. This position shall act as lead point of contact for all key client matters, anticipate the client’s needs, work within the company to ensure deadlines for the client are met, and help the client succeed. The key account manager will also bring in new business from existing clients or contacts and will develop new relationships with potential clients.  You Will ·         Create meaningful relationships, launch & manage different growth initiatives from scratch, and use data to drive better results. ·         Build strong client relationships to help grow existing business. ·         Act as the main point-of-contact for our clients’ day-to-day communication; own overall client satisfaction by proactively identifying opportunities and by working closely with the team to optimize and retain the client’s business. ·         Develop and own marketing initiatives aimed at improving the client experience. ·         Oversee and participate in events to help grow our user base with existing customers. ·         Resolve complaints and keep track of all processes that pertain to the client's goals. ·         Ensure that client’s demands are met with a focus on improving the customer experience. ·         Collect and analyze data concerning consumer behavior to understand changing needs. ·         As the company grows, be a part of building a world-class growth organization.    Requirements  What we’re looking for:  ·         5+ years in an account management role preferably in Hardware E-commerce industry, with a proven track record of driving growth and meeting KPIs. ·         Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in marketing, business administration, sales, or relevant field. ·         Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong attention to detail. ·         Skilled at working with cross-functional teams to successfully execute new program initiatives and develop partnerships. ·         Intellectually curious, creative, and inquisitive. Someone with an interest in understanding how things work. ·         Strong customer service and interpersonal skills for dealing with different types of customers and clients. ·         Time management and multitasking skills in order to handle multiple tasks and clients at once.  A collaborative, team-player who thrives in a dynamic growing environment and rapidly adjusts to new opportunities.

Position Overview  The New Jersey Devils seek a self-starter who will be responsible for generating new ticket sales revenue and managing existing ticket sales accounts. With a primary focus on driving revenue for the New Jersey Devils of the National Hockey League (NHL), it will be the Account Executive’s responsibility to develop strong relationships with leaders of the business community in the Greater New York and New Jersey areas while providing excellent customer service through customized communication and tailored benefits to match the needs of the customer.  Responsibilities Include, But Aren't Limited To The Following Generating new ticket sales through cold calling, networking, video and face-to-face appointments Sell a full-menu of HBSE product offerings with a focus on New Jersey Devils full season memberships, partial plans, group events, and single-event suite rentals Work New Jersey Devils home games at Prudential Center to host new business prospects and established clients Develop and maintain good-working relationships with both internal and external clients Prospect and cultivate new sales leads through creative lead generation approaches Meet and exceed established monthly and annual sales objectives and revenue goals Identify business opportunities by establishing professional and personal networks, proactively soliciting and following-up on any sales leads and representing the New Jersey Devils and Philadelphia 76ers at assigned functions Ensure customer data and profile requirements are accurately and completely detailed for defined accounts in CRM system Work assigned sales, promotional and team events during games and outside normal business hours Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned Qualifications A minimum of 8 months experience as a top sales producer, preferably in the sports & entertainment industry A degree or diploma in business, communications, marketing, sports management or related field Strong knowledge and passion for a long-term career in the revenue-generating segment of the sports business Team player with the ability to handle multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment High comfort level making cold calls and consistent outbound sales efforts Strong time management and organizational skills Excellent written communication skills Demonstrated ability to work independently and to self-motivate Flexible and creative problem-solving skills Preferably possesses a database of qualified corporate prospects Flexibility in working extended hours including nights, weekends, and holidays as required Working Conditions COVID-19 Vaccine Required: As of the first day of employment, you must be able to demonstrate proof that you are fully vaccinated (as defined by the CDC) against COVID-19, unless you are granted a medical or religious exemption in accordance with Company policy.

description: Stryker  Position Title: Trauma Sales Associate  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Committed, loyal and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. Honest people who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do You will get exposure to the proven winning Stryker Trauma culture that delivers Industry leading results in all market segments You will receive best-in-class formal Trauma training on product portfolio and selling skills which includes on-the-job training in the operating room. You’ll become an expert on surgical procedures by observing well-over 300 cases in your first year You will develop well-rounded field exposure to prepare you in all aspects of the selling/ servicing process when a territory opportunity arises You will develop a high level of competency in Orthopaedic surgical needs and procedures becoming a valuable member of the surgical team and positively impacting surgical outcomes You will build a strong brand in account management and client service – key drivers in our business! You will work in a highly competitive and challenging work environment that will put your best talents to work every single day What You Need To be successful in this role bring your strong multitasking ability, ability to read and sell to any audience, drive to achieve and succeed, aptitude to learn medical and technical information quickly, ability to build strong, lasting relationships, a strong work-ethic and a competitive nature Bachelor’s Degree required 1+ years of sales experience preferred Come ready to make a difference…fast! What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

description: The Role  As Akili's Sales Executive, you will lead customer facing efforts with target healthcare providers, leading to a successful commercial launch of EndeavorRx. If you are an intellectually curious, highly adaptable and motivated salesperson, this is a great opportunity to use your talents to challenge the status quo of medicine and make a meaningful impact on the lives of people around the world.  Responsibilities Establish and retain relationships with assigned target HCPs leading to awareness, trial, and advocacy for the brand experience Contribute to re Aid in developing and executing an innovative sales model, and continue to drive optimization in customer outreach Closely manage assigned territory, ensuring alignment with leadership on sales calls, and maximize allocated budget for customer facing expenses Collaborate closely with marketing team to ensure education and resources are available to address HCP customer needs  Qualifications Track record of success 5+ years in therapeutics sales, preferably with launch experience in a nascent market Demonstrated history of operating as a self-starter, strongly motivated by progress against business goals Ability to successfully navigate change, operate with level of ambiguity, and think outside the box to solve business challenges Strong cross-functional collaboration skills Experience operating under and strong understanding of regulatory and compliance requirements related to sale of therapeutic products Working knowledge of sales enablement platforms (e.g. salesforce.com, Veeva, etc.) Experience in virtual meeting interactions and platforms Management of budget and resources for customer facing activities Highly accountable mindset; ability to operate independently Persistency in the face of adversity Ability to successfully navigate change, operate with level of ambiguity, and think outside the box to solve business challenges Intellectual curiosity; ability to confidently challenge the status quo Strong persuasive communication skills and ability to influence without authority Transparent and strong level of integrity Strong organizational skills Aptitude for cross-functional collaboration  About Akili  At Akili Interactive, our mission is to ignite new hope for those living with cognitive impairment. We're bringing together world-class neuroscience with the latest technology and video game entertainment to create a new class of digital medicines, delivered through captivating video game experiences. We are out to prove that effective medicine for serious illnesses can also be fun and engaging.  Our flagship product, EndeavorRx, is the first ever FDA-cleared prescription treatment delivered through a video game to treat children living with ADHD. This is only the beginning, as we continue to boldly challenge the status quo of today's medicine.  Diversity and Inclusion  Diversity and inclusion are incredibly important to all of us. We are committed to hearing all voices. Akili Interactive provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

description: Daytona Beach, Florida Phoenix Raceway Kansas Speedway Charlotte, North Carolina Watkins Glen International Talladega Superspeedway  At NASCAR, you will find a community of passionate individuals who care about our sport and are united in seeing it grow.  NASCAR is currently seeking a highly motivated, coachable, and passionate individual to join the best team in Motorsports as a Group Sales Account Executive.  Duties: Generate new sales revenue through prospecting, cold calling and in-person appointments Maintain a 60-80 call per day volume as well as an aggressive meetings schedule Responsible for the growth of existing relationships in order for the client to maximize spend and generate repeat business Assist with the creation, development and implementation of new concepts designed to generate new sales revenue streams Renew and up-sell existing group sales customers year-over-year Meet and exceed weekly, monthly, and yearly sales goals Set appointments with key decision makers in the community to assess the opportunity to develop and grow opportunities Proactively seek new leads through referrals, networking, and prospecting businesses and organizations Maintain accurate and detailed records of all current clients and prospects within our CRM system Provide superior customer service to clients and prospects both in-person and over the phone Execute group sales assets on race day Requires some nights/weekends and limited amounts of travel for conferences or trade shows Assist with additional duties and tasks as assigned Qualifications: Four year college degree – Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science preferably in Sports Management, Business and/or Marketing and Communications Minimum one (1) year of sales experience, preferably in a sports sales environment Strong verbal, written and presentation skills Strong organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills Comfortable making cold calls on the phone Ability to function in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple projects simultaneously and adhere to deadlines Comfortable making face to face sales presentations Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office Experience with Ticket.com ProVenue and Microsoft Dynamics 365 a plus Valid drivers license Additional Requirements:  The desired candidate must have a strong work ethic and be highly motivated to achieve sales goals. A successful candidate should also showcase excellent communications skills with the ability to have effective and frequent dialogue with prospects, clients, account managers and colleagues.  Apply Now!  Learn more about this role and our team by applying at www.careers.nascar.com for consideration.  We are a company unlike any other. We want you to bring your experience, skills and passion to our close-knit, high-energy environment in which our employees thrive and where you can prosper. We know the key to our success is our employees and we offer highly competitive salaries, a solid benefits package focused on wellness, and opportunities for you to grow and develop both personally and professionally. It won’t take you long to find out that you are on the right track here at NASCAR!  NASCAR is committed to fostering a diverse work environment where all employees feel valued and empowered. NASCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). We seek to attract and retain the best qualified people available. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status or any basis that is protected by applicable law except where a bona fide occupational qualification exists.  Follow us on Twitter @NASCARJobs to stay current on all of our openings.  Posted 30+ Days Ago Full time JR10617  The National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing (NASCAR) is the sanctioning body for the No. 1 form of motorsports in the United States and owner of 16 of the nation’s major motorsports entertainment facilities. NASCAR consists of three national series (NASCAR Cup Series™, NASCAR Xfinity Series™, and NASCAR Gander RV & Outdoors Truck Series™), four regional series (ARCA Menards Series, ARCA Menards Series East & West and the NASCAR Whelen Modified Tour), one local grassroots series and three international series. The International Motor Sports Association™ (IMSA®) governs the IMSA WeatherTech SportsCar Championship™, the premier U.S. sports car series. NASCAR also owns Motor Racing Network, Racing Electronics, Americrown Service and ONE DAYTONA. Based in Daytona Beach, Florida, with offices in eight cities across North America, NASCAR sanctions more than 1,200 races in more than 30 U.S. states, Canada, Mexico and Europe.  For more information visit www.NASCAR.com and www.IMSA.com , and follow NASCAR on Facebook , Twitter , Instagram , and Snapchat (‘NASCAR’).

description: ADP is hiring a Sales Representative, Enterprise Accounts. Are you ready to control your financial future with unlimited upside earnings potential? Do you want a lasting career with a company that offers autonomy to run a book of business, flexibility to make your own schedule, and gives you work-life balance? Are you looking for continuous learning and the opportunity to invest in yourself? If so, then this may be just the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and decide for yourself.  The world's largest companies -- including 80% of the Fortune 500 -- count on our Human Capital Management solutions. As a Sales Representative, Enterprise Accounts, you'll grow new market share for ADP's cloud-based Human Resources solutions to large market prospects (1,000 or more employees) within a defined territory. You will bring proven expertise and responsiveness to the table every day on a team dedicated to unparalleled partnership and unwavering relationships with our clients and prospects. We are passionate and committed to our current and future clients' success in the ever-changing world of work.  Sales Representatives for Enterprise Accounts are collaborative. Rarely will a deal be sold without internal partnering. If you are a self-professed "lone wolf" salesperson, this will not be the role for you. If you thrive being part of a team, however, then this career opportunity not only offers significant earnings potential but maximum exposure for career advancement. We will support your personal training and development in an informal, diverse, non-bureaucratic environment that is sensitive to work-family and flexible-schedules.  A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos.  Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now!  To learn more about Sales at ADP, watch here: http://adp.careers/Sales_Videos  WHAT YOU'LL DO: Responsibilities Grow Our Business While Growing Yours. You will work independently and collaboratively as part of various teams within your assigned geography to attain or exceed 100% of assigned revenue and product goals within assigned accounts. Plan and Report to Achieve Success. You will develop an annual business plan, determining sales and activity goals required for attainment of assigned revenue and product goals. You'll compile "Account Plan" documents for prospective clients, describing existing products and services used, potential product sales, and related selling strategy to create a robust pipeline. You'll maintain a current prospective business report identifying potential business and activities necessary to close client accounts. Market & Conduct Market Research. You'll develop prospective client sources utilizing various communication mediums, including personal contact mailings and planning client seminars. You will utilize sales automation tools to define market penetration strategies, and you will identify and target competitive prospects and plan strategy to increase market share. You will broaden your knowledge of company products and their capabilities versus the strengths/weaknesses of competitive products. Collaborate Daily. You will serve as a trusted advisor, partner, and ADP ambassador to your clients, internal partners, and overall network while demonstrating grace under pressure and the highest ethical standards. You will work closely with U.S. and Global Enterprise Accounts sales teams on joint and global client opportunities and relationships. TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications You have 5 or more years of enterprise-level sales experience. Bonus points for these: Preferred Qualifications Industry knowledge and/or knowledge of ADP's competitors is an asset. You'll Love Working Here Because You Can Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights. Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences. Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress. Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner. Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones. Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another. Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impactupon the communities in which we work and live. Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about. What are you waiting for? Apply today!  Explore our COVID-19 page https://jobs.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.  Minimum  Compensation range for this role for U.S. Colorado Residents  Maximum  Compensation Type: Salary

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - New York City - Orthopaedic Instruments
description: Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As an Orthopedic Instruments Associate Sales Representative, you assist in strategically promoting and selling Stryker Orthopedic Instruments products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in Operating Room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with your Regional Manager and Sales Representative(s) you are supporting to push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your sample inventory of products and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As an Orthopedic Instruments Associate Sales Representative you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. As an Associate Sales Representative you may be asked to cover open territories, which will give you the opportunity to grow in your responsibilities.  What You Need Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University 1-2 years in medical device or B2B sales preferred What Stryker Will Provide Field sales training In-house product training program The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In February 2019, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that for the ninth consecutive year has been named as one of the 2018 FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For ranking 11 out of 100. Some of our other awards from 2018 include Great Places to Work for Inclusion, Women, Millennials, and Diversity.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn More About The Orthopedic Instruments Products Flyte – Personal Protection System (surgical helmet and toga) - https://www.stryker.com/us/en/search.html?q=flyte Cement Mixers - https://www.stryker.com/us/en/search.html?q=cement+mixer Interpulse - https://www.stryker.com/us/en/search.html?q=interpulse Saws & Drills - https://www.stryker.com/us/en/search.html?q=saws+and+drills Our mission: Together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better

description: Senior Sales Lead Join our team! This is a year of growth at Allovance and we're looking for a Closer to lead our sales team. We are scaling rapidly, and it is important for us to find a candidate who embraces challenge, is eager to learn, and is passionate about succeeding. This leadership role requires high social intelligence and a natural inclination for selling to grow the company from a founder-led sales stage to a serious sales powerhouse selling into government, education, healthcare, and utility sectors. Primary users of the product are Facilities Managers, Capital Planning Directors, City Engineers, Economic Development Officers, and Portfolio Management professionals. Target customer organizations range from small cities to mid-size businesses and large enterprises.  The Sales Lead will be the first dedicated sales hire at Allovance and will be responsible for following up on leads, developing relationships, and closing sales opportunities. The Sales Lead will act as the final point of contact while making business connections and landing new clients and contracts. This role will supervise a Lead Generation Associate whose job will be to work the top end of the funnel.  Who we are: Allovance is an independent company that spun off of the founder’s well-established management consulting firm, Pyramid Consulting International. Pyramid Consulting has been in business for 15+ years and has 50+ employees. Clients include Fortune 500 companies across different industries.  Allovance is built around the idea that there is a better way to make decisions.  Our company is built on research in decision sciences, psychology, business, change management, and learning behaviors.  This research led to the development of two unique product offerings: 1.      A cloud-based capital allocation and strategic prioritization software designed to add transparency and reliability to any organizational prioritization practices. 2.      Decision Coach certification in partnership with The University of Michigan.  As a self-contained decision hub, Allovance allows you to create priorities, input projects, score projects against priorities, and plan your projects all from one platform. Critical business decisions shouldn't happen in isolation. Instead, they should be viewed in light of the bigger picture and aligned to your priorities.   We certainly dream big at Allovance; however, we believe that good decision-making starts with small changes, and it starts…with people. People are at the center of everything we do. Our 5-step process understands the human elements of decision-making, like biases and subjectivity, and accounts for them in decision-making using our patented software platform.    You’ll Love This Role If You: Want to build the initial sales operations of a start-up and have a passion for sharing Allovance’s story with prospective clients Are High-Energy and Persuasive - you love building relationships and influencing people Are Fearless and Confident – you have the drive to succeed and you’re not afraid to fail Are Self-Motivated – you’re results-driven and can work with minimal supervision Are Curious - you enjoy uncovering new info you can use to make connections Embrace Change and Initiate Opportunity - you stay positive through change Have a Passion for Growth - you love feedback and focus on continuous improvement Believe in Spirited Teamwork - you believe in sharing knowledge with team members. Believe in the need for more inclusive and equitable decision making that recognizes and balances diverse perspectives  You demonstrate trust in your colleagues and share a responsibility to succeed.   Here’s What We Are Looking For: Someone with experience in go-to-market strategy (ex. suggest new target markets, define the prospect space/profile, etc.) You have a solid network of peers and lasting relationships across different industries. (i.e. facilities, government, public sector, education…) 5 years of B2B sales experience Comfort and experience in B2B sales High interest in building a career in sales Ability to clearly communicate complicated topics. You can speak in simple terms people can understand and expand when required. Innovative and creative team members that can connect dots others don’t see An overachiever and natural problem solver. You believe barriers present an opportunity Excellent written and verbal communication skills You never quit and ultimately succeed in everything you do!  Responsibilities: Build Allovance Sales strategy and go-to-market strategy with collaboration from team Conversion - Turn leads into sales Identify and build relationships with key decision-makers and influencers Leverage relevant business information and market intelligence Educate potential customers about Allovance and its services Handle objections and align our solutions to customer’s needs Collaborate and innovate with team on how best to connect with potential customers Engage with potential clients and customers and promote brand on social media  Compensation:  Competitive base salary plus uncapped commission.  Quality health care options and benefits Location: Ann Arbor, MI. (May work in Hybrid or Remotely as situations/needs dictate)

Who we are:  SilverIP is fast-growth, Chicago-based Internet Service Provider (ISP), consistently ranked as one of the top independent networks in the region. We provide Gigabit Internet to multi-family buildings, businesses and to large events such as Lollapalooza.   Our unique service offering enables us to offer carrier-grade, high bandwidth Internet access service at highly competitive prices. We back our service with superior customer support and reliability through end-to-end control of our service delivery and proactive 24/7 network monitoring.    The Position:  As a Business Development Manager for SilverIP, you will play an important role in helping us build our commercial Internet and Events business in the greater Chicago region. This will involve building relationships with existing and prospective commercial clients within our on-net building network as well as further developing opportunities to provide Internet service to large indoor and outdoor events. Hands-on sales and technical training, a generous base salary, and a commission plan offers you significant earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment.    This involves:  Create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients and actively seek new sales opportunities. Develop a strategic plan to market Internet access services to prospective business customers located in our on-net commercial buildings. Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walkthroughs, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings. Develop our event portfolio business, which involves providing Internet access to indoor and outdoor event venues. Current customers include – Second City, Lollapalooza, Summerfest, among many others. Understand and effectively communicate SilverIP’s value proposition and our technology Oversee customer account management including negotiating contracts. Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters. Will report directly to the VP of Business Development  What you will need to bring:  Strong work ethic, self-motivation, and sales drive Effective communication Confident decision-making skills Strong ability to negotiate 3-5 years of business development, marketing or sales experience A college degree is preferred Hybrid work schedule – office and remote

Position overview Honor My Decisions (HMD) is seeking a Sales Executive (Healthcare Market-Remote) – Contract to sell a software-as-a-service advance care planning solution to hospitals, health systems, academic medical centers, and large independent physician practices in the United States.  There is no cap on commissions for this position.  What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job? Meets and/or exceeds all assigned sales quotas and performance goals; effectively manages assigned market independently, develops a pipeline of qualified prospects, engages in a consultative sales process, and closes them. Develops full understanding of product value proposition, features, and differentiating traits vs. competitive landscape; speaks comfortably and confidently about HMD’s offering and accurately identifies how solution will meet and surpass client needs and performance goals. Provides timely and complete reporting on the status of the sales plan, pipeline growth, and sales progress using tools determined by executive management. Maintains industry and product knowledge, adapting to changes in the market/competition, participating in regional/national meetings/forums, and driving brand/deliverable awareness within the target healthcare market.  What are the requirements for this position? 5+ years of new account consultative sales experience for healthcare technology products or services.  What critical skills are needed in this position? Capable of executing the full sales cycle, understanding the competition, effectively collaborate with HMD colleagues, and be a trusted advisor to clients. Excellent cold-calling and prospecting skills – must have a “hunter” drive and be self-reliant to identify opportunities. Ability to sell value over price by providing deep insight about how the service will impact the client’s business. Very strong internal and external communication skills, with the ability to listen comprehensively and deliver clear recommendations and guidance. Excellent selling and sales strategy skills, including the ability to close opportunities. Strong sales technology capabilities including proficiency and comfort using Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel and PowerPoint), Zoom, and Pipedrive sales CRM. Demonstrated consultative sales experience where sales are dependent on persuading multiple stakeholders and influencers within complex healthcare organizations. Knowledge of healthcare operations and how to overcome perceived constraints in getting doctors and clinical staff to successfully adopt new processes in the office environment.  How much should I expect to travel? Up to 40% of the time (sometimes on short notice) for meetings with prospects and clients (when we are not in the midst of a public health emergency).  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Statement Honor My Decisions is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Blue Wheel is one of Inc. Magazines 2020 fastest-growing private companies in the US. We can attribute much of that growth to our digital marketing and advertising capabilities, and our amazing track record of success for our clients.   Your Role:  As an Account Executive at Blue Wheel, you will lead targeted sales efforts with high-value prospects to attract, acquire, and grow ideal client segments. This is a pure new business development role that will require creative prospecting and well-coordinated, eloquent, and intuitive sales efforts. Each sales cycle will require you to execute with urgency by establishing strong relationships and client trust, and consist of complex, technical variables and multiple stakeholder involvement that can range in high dollar value. While we prefer to have this role stationed in Detroit, NYC or San Diego, we will consider remote candidates.  In the 1st month, you will… · Immerse yourself in BW’s culture, team and product.  · Open to Change - Learn different customer acquisition techniques as well as how companies leverage advertising+content into their digital strategies. · Participate in sales and product training to understand the leverage points we use on our clients and differentiators we have over our competitors.  Sharpen your skills in Month 2 by… · Becoming an expert at the digital solutions Blue Wheel provides, how we provide them, and who we are best suited to work with. · Organize and Conquer - owning the sales funnel and work with leadership in order to establish, meet and/or exceed monthly sales goals. · Having built your own pipeline and managed multiple opportunities through a complete sales cycle.  Execute in Month 3 by... · Start winning new clients and contributing revenue for the company. · Becoming an expert in a variety of use cases. · Gaining self-reliance when closing deals without substantial oversight from management.  Desired Skills & Experience · Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field. · 5+ years of relevant agency or marketplace (SaaS) sales experience. · Excellent communicator and relationship builder. You thrive on the phone. Proficient in Google & Microsoft Office Suite. · Self-driven with the ability to work independently. · Must be able to understand complex environments and projects, pay attention to details and maintain an organized workflow. · Excellent planning, time management, and decision-making skills with the ability to self-manage numerous projects simultaneously. · Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on teamwork and the ability to foster/maintain relationships across multiple businesses and organizations. · Exceptional writing, copy, editing and proofreading skills preferred. · You work hard and smart. You know when to ask questions and admit to weaknesses. · Worked in a startup or fast-growing organization.  Blue Wheel Perks and Benefits: · PTO, Exclusive company holidays, Summer Fridays & Mental Health Days · 401K Matching · Parental Leave · Healthcare · Dental · Vision · Voluntary Life Insurance

description: ** PLEASE ATTACH RESUME ** Syneos Health® is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization. The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration.  Are you passionate about discovering, developing and bringing more innovative medicines to help patients? Idorsia’s purpose is to discover, develop and bring more innovative medicines to help patients. Idorsia is an independent biopharmaceutical company specializing in the development of small molecules to meet significant unmet medical needs. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus.  Job Description: Reporting to the Syneos Health District Manager (DM), the Specialty Sales Representative (SSR) role is responsible for building relationships with recognized experts, HCPs, and prioritized stakeholders in the therapeutic area and integrated health care systems.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required • Minimum 2+ years life science sales experience • Experience in psych / PCP / Sleep Disorders preferred • Experience in retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales • Identify and develop business relationships with targeted Health Care providers • Achieve quarterly and annual sales goals • Identify key influencers and achieve designated customer interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • Understand and address both business and scientific-oriented needs of healthcare professionals by engaging in meaningful dialog to determine underlying patient needs and determine how products could address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • Implement and execute in a compliant manner marketing and sales direction to achieve territory promotional objectives • Communicate effectively with peers and management • Effective in front of the customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain expense and promotional budgets for the territory within guidelines • Must operate within Compliance Guidelines at all times • Adherence to Policies, Process and Procedures  At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality of life balance.  Why Syneos Health? Our employees voted Syneos Health as the overall winner in MedReps’ Best Places To Work In Medical Sales Awards. Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)

description: The role of the Stormwater Inside Sales is to perform civil/site material take-offs, quantity calculations, prepare pricing, and submittals as part of the project quotation. This includes updating CRM, performing manual and excel based calculations, occasional preparation of AutoCAD drawings, etc. Individual would also be responsible for processing customer orders and coordinating deliveries with the shipping department. The individual will work closely with the Project Manager to ensure objectives are completed in a timely manner. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.  Essential Responsibilities: ·           Perform material take-offs of civil/site drawings as provided by the sales team, as part of the quoting process. ·           Perform calculations for sizing, material quantity, and pricing, utilizing hand calculations, excel and quoting software. ·           Prepare quotations, utilizing required software. ·           Generate project submittals, as required, to secure purchase orders. ·           Utilize Infor ERP (Syteline) to process customer purchase orders in a timely manner ·           Coordinate deliveries of material with the internal shipping dept and customer ·           Create and update files in CRM (Microsoft Dynamics) ·           Utilize AutoCAD software to prepare layout drawings, as required. ·           Follow up on all projects in a timely manner and support the sales team in securing projects. ·           Provide timely feedback on all projects and activities to management. ·           Occasional travel to local distributors  Essential Skills:   ·           2-3 years’ experience in construction take-off, estimating or civil/site product sales required. ·           Knowledge of computerized drafting and experience with AutoCAD, preferred ·           Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, CRM, etc. ·           Experience with Infor ERP systems, preferred ·           Work from conceptual layouts, able to follow guidelines ·           Attention to detail, well organized, able to meet deadlines, can handle simultaneous assignments ·           Work independently and without close supervision  Brentwood offers professional growth potential, pleasant work environment, and an excellent wage and benefits package including 401K w/employer match. Brentwood Industries, Inc., provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.

jobTitle: Oncology Associate Key Account Manager - Dallas
description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description  Oncology Associate Key Account Mgr (OAKAM) is to represent Teva Oncology products, as part of the brand strategy within Oncology clinics and hospitals while collaborating with Teva’s IDN Key Account Management team in shared hospital accounts. OAKAM is accountable for the implementation of product access strategies/tactics, pulling through GPO contract wins, gaining formulary access and driving volume through the Letter of Commitment (LOC) program in their geography. The ability to successfully network and penetrate key account targets while developing and cultivating long-term working relationships is critical.  Essential Areas Of Responsibility In concert with Regional Sales Manager and the IDN KAM team, identify, develop, and maintain relationships with strategically important decision makers in your geography. Demonstrate business acumen through analysis to identify, create, and quantify business opportunities, attend all relevant Society Meetings where key decision makers will be in attendance. Have a working knowledge of generic and brand pharmaceutical industry, contracting, distribution channels, pricing, chargebacks and institutional sales. Facilitate purchase of targeted Oncology products individually and in collaboration with Sales and Marketing teams and negotiate contracts. Monitor account contract performance to ensure compliance with the goal of driving incremental sales. Gain formulary access for targeted Teva Oncology Brands Identify opportunities to drive business through the Letter of Commitment (LOC) program. This Position Will Include The Following Territory  North: Oklahoma border  South: Temple Texas  East: Longview Texas  West: Amarillo Texas  It is Texas only. It is to Oklahoma, Arkansas and Louisiana border. Includes Texarkana, Longview, Paris, Lufkin, Nacogdoches, Midland, Odessa, Wichita Falls, Amarillo, Lubbock, San Angelo, Waco, Dallas Fort Worth Metroplex  Requirements  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree Minimum 4 years of pharmaceutical, Healthcare or pharmaceutical sales experience Demonstrated career success in sales or related industries Preferred Master’s degree preferred Experience in Oncology, Market Access or Marketing within the pharmaceutical industry Experience in reimbursement, contracting and pharmaceutical pricing strategies a plus Hospital / Account Mgmt experience Biologic experience preferred Understanding of healthcare delivery systems, including “Buy and Bill”, reimbursement, contracting and pharmaceutical pricing strategies and specific to Oncology including clinics, GPOs and IDNs Ability to rapidly develop and maintain relationships with key accounts and their decision makers including (C-Suite selling) Ability to work in a heavily matrixed environment across various functional teams Function  Sales  Sub Function  Account Management  Reports To  In process of validation  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.  Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to support you throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, military status or status as a disabled or protected veteran, or any legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Need to have strong customer service skills and the ability to create and maintain long-term relationships with clients Extremely well organized and detailed oriented with excellent time management in a fast paced work environment Ability to develop in-depth knowledge about products and markets Proficient in Microsoft Office Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in both English and Spanish is a plus Only candidates outside of Southern California will be considered. description: Job Description  Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is a global lifestyle apparel company with a portfolio of some of the world’s most iconic denim brands: Wrangler®, Lee® and Rock & Republic®. We design, manufacture and distribute superior high-quality products that look good , fit right, and are crafted with sensitivity to our planet to give people around the world the freedom and confidence to express themselves.  Our global community of more than 15,000 employees fosters a culture of integrity, collaboration, performance and entrepreneurial spirit. We are looking for inclusive, humble, creative and forward-looking employees with a passion for creating innovative apparel products, accessories, and solutions that are both meaningful and purposeful for consumers and employees. Assist Sales Operations function in creation and maintenance of key reporting needs. Manage multiple data sources to implement sales reports and ad hoc requests. Aid in creating materials for accounting presentations. Support Account Executives in coordination and execution of special events and promotions. Skills for Success: Strong computer skills. Proficiency in verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in a team environment. Analytical, math, and organizational skills. Ability to think strategically and anticipate needs.
