jobTitle: Manager Key Accounts - Global Corporate Sales
description: About The Role  We are hiring a talented individual with skills to establish, own, manage, grow and retain a portfolio of key B2B customers, focusing on driving revenue and best practice adoption through deep understanding of customers’ needs, challenges and opportunities within their business. Developing a strategic tailored account plan and to drive customer success & achieve revenue targets. Responsible for the identification, acquisition, implementation, development, and retention of a line of business that that Qatar Airways manages and develops globally.  Other Key Strategic & Operational Duties Would Include Develop strong customer relationships that deliver impactful results on ambitious annual targets. Responsible for account management across the full sales cycle (identification, acquisition, implementation, development, and retention) for the identified line of business using data as a key reference point. For all accounts in the portfolio, account management applies for all points-of-sale and points-of-origin. Based on the knowledge gained from managing the line of business, provide recommendations to management on: Development of the commercial strategy; Introduction of new product/routes and service offerings; and Business opportunities and risks for Qatar Airways. Achieve and exceed the assigned revenue target and personal revenue target for each financial year. Initiate and drive negotiations by conducting regular reviews with clients, to understand their requirements and provide them with competitive options to derive maximum revenue Be part of an extraordinary story  Your skills. Your imagination. Your ambition. Here, there are no boundaries to your potential and the impact you can make. You’ll find infinite opportunities to grow and work on the biggest, most rewarding challenges that will build your skills and experience. You have the chance to be a part of our future, and build the life you want while being part of an international community.  Our best is here and still to come. To us, impossible is only a challenge. Join us as we dare to achieve what’s never been done before.  Together, everything is possible.  Qualifications  About You  We are looking for a passionate and experienced professional to join the Global Sales team. Minimum Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is essential 8+ years of experience managing B2B portfolio of clients. Possess skills in analysis and interpreting analysis for business decisions. Exceptional communication & presentation skills Possess the ability to work under pressure & independently. Manage & develop internal & external stakeholder relationships. You MUST also have the right to live and work in the US to be considered for this role.  About Qatar Airways Group  Our story started with four aircraft. Today, we deliver excellence across 12 different businesses coming together as one. We’ve grown fast, broken records and set trends that others follow. We don’t slow down by the fear of failure. Instead, we dare to achieve what’s never been done before.  So whether you’re creating a unique experience for our customers or innovating behind the scenes, every person contributes to our proud story. A story of spectacular growth and determination. Now is the time to bring your best ideas and passion to a place where your ambition will know no boundaries, and be part of a truly global community.  How To Apply  If you are interested to submit your application and feel you are a good fit for this role, please complete our application form and upload your CV for our review and consideration

description: Now, more than ever, the Toast team is committed to our customers. We’re taking steps to help restaurants navigate these unprecedented times with technology, resources, and community. Our focus is on building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love. And because our technology is purpose-built for restaurants, by restaurant people, restaurants can trust that we’ll deliver on their needs for today while investing in experiences that will power their restaurant of the future.  Bready* to make a change?  As an Account Executive, you will be part of a team that is transforming the way restaurants operate. You will target restaurants with 1-15 locations within an assigned geographical territory and own the entire process from prospecting to close. By understanding their unique needs, you will develop a customized solution that helps their business thrive. We need your passion and sales expertise to help us build the Toast brand!  This is a 100% remote opportunity with 25% travel required.  About this roll*: Generate list of prospective restaurants and manage the entire sales cycle from initial call to close Conduct demos and develop a solution that best meets the prospect’s needs Partner with teams across the business to ensure that expectations set during the sales process are met in delivery Leverage Salesforce (our CRM) to manage all sales activities Understand the competitive landscape and determine how to best position Toast in the market Minimum 1 week/month travel to assigned territory required Do you have the right ingredients*? Strong communication, organizational and presentation skills with the ability to sell and negotiate at all decision-making levels Ability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Self-motivated, creative, and flexible with the ability to perform well under pressure Special Sauce* (Nonessential Skills/Nice to Haves) Experience canvassing and/or cold-calling into various types of local businesses, with evidence of success preferred Knowledge of restaurant operations is a plus Sales experience preferred Bread puns encouraged but not required As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our employees and their families, all individuals entering our US workspaces are required to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 unless they have an approved medical or religious accommodation.

description: Who We Are:  Leafbuyer Technologies is a rapidly growing cannabis tech startup offering white-label mobile apps and loyalty / communication solutions. Cannabis dispensaries leverage our Software as a Service (SaaS) platform to boost revenue through customized loyalty apps and a robust SMS/MMS text marketing software. On top of our app and texting service, Leafbuyer reaches hundreds of thousands of cannabis consumers and we enable sales through online pre-ordering.  We foster an open-minded and collaborative work environment with a focus on results. We expect the best from our team and let them schedule their day to accomplish their goals. Training and development are key to our firm’s rapid growth and we will work as hard as you do to ensure your success.  Role Overview:  We’re looking for a driven, money-driven Sales Executive to sell our suite of software products to the cannabis industry. Earn your true potential through recurring monthly payouts and the chance to work in one of the fastest growing markets in the world.  We’re looking for a true-hunter—an outbound cold calling expert and is able to hit weekly call and appointment goals. We want a Sales Rockstar who consistently blows out quotas and is used to operating in a startup. The ideal candidate loves to build relationships, can prioritize, and has a drive to succeed. There is room for advancement for candidates who perform.  Our headquarters is based in one of the most developed cannabis markets in the world: Denver, Colorado. Candidates from CO, OK, WA, OR CA, MI, and MD are strongly encouraged to apply, though anyone in the US is welcome.  Primary Responsibilities: Drive revenue through new client acquisition Identify dispensary leads, prospect, conduct demos, and close new business Manage a large pipeline of deals while consistently hunting for new opportunities Maintain outbound activity to hit minimum KPIs and log all data in our CRM Engage, present, and influence key stakeholders in a small to enterprise dispensary, from store managers C-level executives Suggest recommendations based on clients’ needs at every stage of the sales process Collaborate with account management and tech teams to ensure client success post-sale

description: Company Summary  Join a team that puts its People First! As member of First American's family of companies, Mortgage Solutions provides lenders with solutions to originate, close and service quality loans. Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for six consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.  Job Summary  The Sales Analyst will work closely with the Sales Operations Manager and Salesforce Admins to provide on-going support of Salesforce.com including maintenance of sales representative reporting, data clean-up, and data auditing with a focus on data integrity and quality. Additionally, the Sales Analyst will provide assistance with sales support, project coordination, creating and maintaining documentation, and accommodating ad-hoc user requests. The Sales Analyst role includes departmental coordination between Sales Operations, Product Management, Project Management and general activities to assist the Sales and Operations management teams.  Essential Functions Act as primary support person for the Sales Operations Manager and Salesforce Admins Maintain the documentation around processes and activities performed by Sales Operations Act as a liaison with other departments to ensure the integrity of master data information through the SalesForce.com and reporting structures Review and analyze solutions by working with Management and Operations/Sales members Assist, coordinate, and lead in the development of responses and solutions to company-wide Salesforce.com requests, this includes but is not limited to informational, content, and analytical requests Complete special projects and other duties as assigned Communicate and work effectively with organizational departments on data management  Knowledge And Skills/Technology Used Advanced Microsoft Office skills with a high degree of proficiency in Excel Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal Sound decision making and problem solving skills Strong business acumen Ability to build relationships and ensure cooperation across First American Ability to work independent of direct instruction or supervision to achieve goals and objectives Must be comfortable working with all levels of employees and management throughout First American enterprise.  Typical Education Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience  Typical Range Of Experience 3-5 years experience in business operations or similar roles 2+ years of analyst experience  First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.  Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

Account Representative for set assigned client book. jobTitle: Healthcare Sales - Base plus Uncapped Commisisions
description: Healthcare Sales - working with Physicians. There is a significant physician shortage in the USA. When a doctor quits, retires or goes on maternity leave, Mint Physician Staffing gets the call from hospitals across the USA for a temporary replacement or "Locum Tenens" doctor. Locum Tenens is a $4 billion industry and Mint is one of the fastest growing companies in the industry.  Mint is also listed as one of the “Great Places to Work" according to Best Company Group.   Business is booming, and Mint is seeking great communicators and relationship builders to join our team in this Physician Consultant role. Your job is to utilize our 25 year old database to call, text and email physicians asking for their availability to help another hospital or clinic that is short staffed. For every hour your physician works at one of our client’s hospital or clinic locations, you will earn uncapped commission based upon the revenue generated by the physician placement. The more doctors you have working, the more commission you earn. We offer an inside sales environment with flexible hours in a professional office building on the west side of Houston. Once you are trained and ramped up you can work from home. No travel, nights or weekends required.  Your territory is not restricted, you can call anywhere our clients have open positions so it's truly a national territory, not local. Our industry is not regulated, unlike pharmaceutical sales and medical device sales so there are no restrictions on how we sell, although ethics is a core value at Mint. We encourage recent college graduates to apply, as we provide all training.    Take a look at some of the benefits we offer:   Unlimited earning potential, including a base salary, healthcare benefits, 401K match and up to 20% commission on your revenue within an uncapped commission structure Comprehensive training on all facets of the job and the physician staffing industry, no prior knowledge or experience required, sales experience a plus. Flexible hours, company outings, paid time off, and paid holidays Employee recognition and rewards programs Business casual office environment WORK FROM HOME once you are full trained and ramped up.  Our Success Comes from our Extraordinary Employees and our Amazing Culture! Our company is 25 years old and our senior leadership team has 40 years of combined healthcare staffing experience that has contributed to the solid infrastructure which is an integral part of our amazing culture.  We provide all the training from day one, and all the tools you require to be successful, even if you are right out of college. Working for Mint is a lucrative professional opportunity in the Healthcare Industry and is also a fun and exciting place to build your career. Mint recognizes that extraordinary employees are the core of the organization's success and that is why an employee-centric culture has been adopted.  Mint Physician Staffing takes great pride in promoting from within and equips employees with the tools needed to succeed from entry-level positions to key managerial roles. There are three distinct and achievable career pathways for employees to grow within the organization!  Are You the Right Fit? Bachelor's Degree (recent college graduates are encouraged to apply) Tenacious spirit and focus with a desire to build a career in sales Motivated self-starter with a great attitude, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work well independently Outstanding communication skills and the enthusiasm for developing great relationships with Physicians and clients over the phone Excellent closing skills that drive the ability to meet and exceed goals and deadlines in a competitive selling environment Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office & G Suite  Are You Ready for the Most Rewarding Challenge Yet? If you are interested in a career with Mint Physician Staffing, please apply now or send your current resume to jobs@mintphysicians.com. This opportunity is based in our Houston TX office. We look forward to meeting you!
industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Hospital & Health Care, and Medical Devices

description: About Alto: Alto is on a mission to improve rideshare by offering a cleaner, safer experience to passengers and a sustainable living wage to drivers. Alto drivers are W-2 employees who receive background checks and training, and its fleet of luxury vehicles is company-owned. Because of this, Alto is able to offer a consistent, premium experience to all members and riders.  Summary: Alto is seeking a passionate, self-starting sales person to support our expansion and company growth through B2B volume in new markets.  Our Launch Sales Rep will be the first set of “boots on the ground” in upcoming launch cities to sell into our first set of B2B partners.  This hire will be responsible for generating new business through direct client contact, cold visits to prospective accounts, cold calling, selling our services, developing accounts, and driving results.  Between launches, the LSR will sell in our DFW service area.  This position will be key in the early development of our Sales organization, informing structure and strategy through suggestions and feedback. We are seeking candidates who want to grow with Alto while aggressively growing Alto.  Responsibilities: Work closely with the head of business development to inform sales strategy with the objective of driving business volume in rides and deliveries, including surfacing up areas of opportunity based on business needs, identifying new business use cases, making informed suggestions for sales collateral and tools, and areas of improvement for our business products  Identify key business prospects and generate a targeted lead list  Build strong relationships with prospective business customers  Maintain relationships with existing customers with the goals of retention and identifying additional business opportunities  Educate prospects and customers on Alto business solutions  Develop well-qualified opportunities to fill the biz dev sales funnel  Develop detailed summaries of qualified leads for head of biz dev to understand their business pain, stakeholders, decision process, and motivation Work with head of business development to close accounts  Be proactive about solving problems and be ready to take on additional initiatives and responsibilities as they emerge Act as the “eyes and ears” of Alto in the business arena, maintaining awareness of and communicating updates related to local market context; competitive activity; and other updates with potential or actualized impacts to Alto’s business.  Background & Experience:  Ability to generate and close new business leads 2-3 years of marketing or sales experience preferred Startup experience a plus! Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral. Fast learner, takes initiative and willing to take risk, learning quickly from mistakes  Organized and able to work on multiple projects/tasks simultaneously. Detail oriented, strong problem solving skills and a team player.
industries: Leisure, Travel & Tourism

Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments Analyze the territory and the market’s potential, track sales and status reports Supply Business Development Director with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends Continuously improve through feedback Assume other responsibilities to ensure success in this role  Job Requirements  Proven work experience as a Sales Representative, preferably in a technological, SEO and/or software ecosystem. Willingness to succeed Proven ability to take responsibility for own work, be able to work without supervision and able to contribute productively in a remote-first team sales environment Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office 365, particularly Excel Familiarity with BRM and/or CRM practices, such as HubSpot along with ability to build productive business professional relationships Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales Excellent selling, negotiation, and communication skills Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs Relationship management skills and openness to feedback and learning. Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field an advantage, but not a requirement.  Compensation is 100% commission uncapped with an attractive OTE commission structure ($108,300) including a monthly bonus of $250+ for achieving monthly sales targets with no qualifying period. Option to move to employment contract after 90 days.  If your interested in this role and are a motivated sales professional please consider applying.

Sales Operations Analyst  Overview  Weedmaps’ mission is to power a transparent and inclusive global cannabis economy. Through our industry-leading marketplace, we connect the cannabis market’s highest value and intent consumers with the best dispensaries and brands in the world and provide cannabis retailers with the suite of operational tools they need to efficiently run their businesses.  The Sales Operations team is a force multiplier for Weedmaps’ Revenue Organization. The Sales Operations team drives operational excellence, influences sales and customer success strategy, partners inside and outside the revenue function, and executes initiatives to maximum impact.  As a Sales Ops Analyst at Weedmaps, you'll be a go to expert on Salesforce reporting for the team. Helping build and maintain advanced dashboards (that join and link across objects and databases) and supporting others in navigating Salesforce reporting. Your skills at problem solving will help us create scalable solutions for management and frontline employees. Over time you'll evolve from analysis, to insight to solutions.  Sales Operations Function Role Be a force multiplier within the Revenue Organization (including Sales, Customer Success and related support functions) by driving operational excellence. This will be achieved through spreading best practices and driving consistency manifested in a cohesive system with: Clearly defined sales roles Useful playbooks for reps and managers Strong pitches & collateral Robust training programs Effective Salesforce dashboards and analysis Partner with Revenue leadership (Territory Directors & Managers) to decide strategic and tactical priorities for Territories. Sales Ops will support through rigorous analysis and structuring the decision making process. Examples of strategic decisions may include: Allocating resources to new vs existing business and across markets Defining monetization timelines and structure for new markets Selecting key initiatives to improve rep effectiveness Spearhead execution of sales strategy through: Supporting Revenue Org Design Owning process improvement initiatives Designing dashboards Building business cases for initiatives and resource requests Managing external vendors Analyzing Salesforce data and improving the functioning of Salesforce and related tools Build relationships with cross-functional partners (including but not limited to Product, Marketing, Finance, Government Relations) to ensure short term and long term alignment. Examples of successful collaborations include: Providing cohesive actionable feedback on Sales Product Roadmap Supporting change management of new product feature rollouts Translating Supply Quality priorities from Marketing into areas of focus for teams Acting as voice of frontline reps Prioritizing areas for investment and focus The Impact You'll Make Building and maintaining Salesforce dashboards that drive insight to add value for the business Modeling data to lead to insights for sales tactics, strategy, and improvement opportunities Automating data flows to increase efficiency for self and others on the team Effectively communicating with team members Providing responsive customer service to sales managers and representatives; beginning to evolve from pure responsive to more proactive and strategic Supporting effective adoption of Salesforce through trainings, documentation and responsive customer service Leading process improvement efforts (both within Salesforce and broader to include sales operations) with support of leadership Proactively managing workflow with clear transparency Maintaining strong data hygiene within Salesforce through ensuring field accuracy, building custom fields and drop-downs, and auditing data to ensure quality Effectively administering Salesforce through user provisioning, developing custom reports, and managing dashboards As needed, managing connections and ensuring data linkages work in Salesforce Beginning to learn project management What You've Accomplished BS / BA Degree or equivalent experience 2-4 years of experience in sales enablement, sales operations, business operations, business development Comfort with, and ability to operate at an aggressive, accelerated, iterative pace in a dynamic environment Extensive experience with Salesforce, data modeling and data analysis Excellent communication, project and time management, writing and presentation skills with the ability to confidently interact with senior management Pluses 3+ years of experience working in the advertising industry or in sales organizations Experience with financial modeling Experience with SQL/relational databases, and reporting tools like Tableau Expert knowledge of MS Office (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel) and Google Office Suite (Sheets, Slides) Extreme attention to detail (minimizing defects) Ability to see the insights beyond the numbers to drive sound decision making Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize tasks and work within deadlines with little supervision Ability to flex between day-to-day operations and broader strategic initiatives Enjoy building out structure and process while adapting it to an ever changing dynamic environment Our Benefits 100% paid employee monthly Medical, Dental and Vision premiums AND 80% paid dependent monthly premiums HMO (California residents only) and PPO option offered through United Healthcare Company-paid $50,000 in Basic Life/AD&D (Accidental Death and Dismemberment) coverage 401(k) Retirement Plan: 100% match on the first 1%. 50% match from 2-6% of employee contributions 3 weeks PTO (accrued) and 5 sick days (immediate) Supplemental, voluntary benefits Kindbody (family planning/fertility) including up to $10,000 towards cash-pay services Goodly (Student Loan Repayment/529 Education Savings) including a company contribution of up to $1,000/year Flexible Spending Accounts (Medical, Dependent, Transit and Parking) Voluntary Life Insurance Critical Illness Accident Insurance Short- and long-term disability Pet Insurance Paid parental leave During current work-from-home: Reimbursements for home office setup and monthly WiFi Our Culture 11 company-paid holidays Catered lunch and snacks provided when working in the office Snack boxes sent straight to your door when you work-from-home Casual work environment, read no fancy clothes required, but you are free to dress to the nines! Monthly virtual happy hours Quarterly all-hands meetings Weedmaps is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. We are looking for the smartest and most passionate people who want to join our team and develop the services, systems, and marketplaces that will serve the marijuana industry in the decades to come. Our company uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit www.dhs.gov/E-Verify.  Applicants may be entitled to reasonable accommodations under the terms of the ADA and state/local laws. Please inform us if you need assistance participating in the interview process.  About Weedmaps  Founded in 2008, WM Technology is a leading technology and software infrastructure provider to the cannabis industry, comprising a B2C platform, Weedmaps, and B2B software, WM Business. The cloud-based SaaS solutions from WM Business provide an end-to-end operating system for cannabis retailers. WM Business’ tools support compliance with the complex, disparate, and constantly evolving regulations applicable to the cannabis industry. Through its website and mobile apps, WM Technology provides consumers with the latest information about cannabis retailers, brands, and products, facilitating product discovery and driving engagement with our retail and brand customers.  WM Technology holds a strong belief in the power of cannabis and the importance of enabling safe, legal access to consumers worldwide. Since inception, WM Technology has worked tirelessly, not only to become the most comprehensive platform for consumers, but to build the software solutions that power businesses compliantly in the space, to advocate for legalization, social equity, and licensing in many jurisdictions, and to facilitate further learning through partnering with subject matter experts on providing detailed, accurate information about the plant.  Headquartered in Irvine, California, WM Technology supports remote work for all eligible employees. Visit us at www.weedmaps.com.  #WMFromAnywhere
industries: Internet, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: Sales Executive Kaseya Miami, FL Join a 3.5 Billion dollar hyper-growth, global technology leader! Embracing our customer-centric philosophy, you will sell award-winning solutions integrated within the industry's first and only purpose-built platform, IT Complete. You will report to a Director of Account Management. You Will: •            Upsell and cross-sell industry-leading solutions to over 60 assigned clients within your book of business •            Expand business by increasing product adoption and long-term customer satisfaction •            Exceed weekly, monthly, and quarterly revenue/sales targets •            Build relationships with clients over the phone You Have: •            1 or more years inside or outside sales experience in a metrics-driven environment •            Experience exceeding sales goals •            A motivated and competitive personality •            Exposure to CRM applications to manage leads, opportunities, and accounts •            Bachelor's degree or similar experience Our Benefits: Earn exceptional compensation based on your own effort and merits – your earning potential is uncapped and is driven by your hard work, resilience, and success as a salesperson Explore career opportunities - you can learn new skills and be promoted along an exciting career path Network - meet company and industry mentors and leaders, allowing you to form relationships you can build on in the future Excellent health benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, company-paid life, commuter benefits, 401 (K), onsite parking, and free access to building gym We ensure a quick, virtual interview process and onboarding About Kaseya: Kaseya is the leading provider of complete IT and security management solutions for Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and small to medium businesses (SMBs) worldwide. Kaseya's best-in-breed technologies allow organizations to efficiently manage, secure, and backup IT to achieve sustained business success. Kaseya has sustained, strong double-digit growth over the past several years and is backed by Insight Venture Partners and TPG, two of the leading global private equity firms investing in high-growth technology and software companies. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
industries: Computer Software

description: Description  Sales Development Representative, Avo  Avo In The News - Check It Out  https://www.insightpartners.com/about-us/news-press/avo-announces-over-80m-in-funding-to-accelerate-ambitious-growth-plans-in-the-delivery-amenity-business/  https://finance.yahoo.com/news/avo-announces-over-80m-funding-110000846.htm  About Us  Hi, we’re Avo (www.avonow.com), your building’s newest, custom amenity. We are a series B start-up that is building the future of e-commerce through our custom, white-labeled online stores for residential and commercial management companies and property owners. Residents and employees order same-day delivery of anything from fresh groceries & personal care items to electronics and more. We are vertically integrated, with our own warehouses and team of exceptional delivery persons. We have no delivery fee (what you see online is what you pay!), order minimum (order one Avocado if you feel like it!), or membership (yet!).  We are humbled to be backed by some of the most reputable investors such as Kleiner Perkins, Y Combinator, & Insight Partners amongst others.  The Role  As our Sales Development Representative, you will be responsible for helping us prospect new accounts by reaching out to potential corporate customers via LinkedIn, email, phone and in person, to help set up meetings for our Partnership leads.  In this role, you will collaborate closely with your partnership lead, to help identify and engage with potential leads, helping secure meetings, and ultimately, drive sales for the business!  The position involves helping build the foundation of our sales and marketing efforts, so you’ll play an integral role in helping grow the business!  What You'll Do Prospect new business and help set up meetings and calls for our partnership leads Manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales Work closely with your partnership lead to help identify which leads convert the best, and which tactics are most effective You’ll manage all of your prospecting efforts in our CRM tool (hubspot) to ensure we can track all sales and prospecting activity Partner with the marketing team by sharing your learnings to help better inform their messaging and approach Requirements  What You'll Need 1-2 years experience in sales, prospecting, and lead generation for B2B businesses Willingness to get scrappy, we’re a start-up! Intelligent, authentic, ethical and articulate with the ability to deliver a solution-based sales approach. Skilled in using Linkedin to prospect B2B leads Comfortable cold calling and talking/meeting with new people Very organized and disciplined! Persistent; doesn’t take “no” for an answer :) Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Attention to detail balanced with swift execution Resilience in fast-paced, high profile and ever-changing situatIons Bachelor's degree Preferred Qualifications Commercial real estate experience is a plus!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Job Description  Position can be based anywhere in the U.S.  bswift is currently seeking an experienced Account Manager to join our direct Client Services Team.  The Account Manager (AM) is directly responsible for helping bswift meet and exceed client expectations by supporting consumers on our best-in-class HR software and services.  Located in downtown Chicago, bswift offers software and services that streamline benefits, HR and payroll administration for employers and public and private exchanges nationwide. bswift’s state-of-the-art cloud-based technology and outsourcing solutions significantly reduce administrative costs and time-consuming paperwork, making life easier for administrators and millions of consumers who enroll in benefits with bswift.  Responsibilities  The Account Manager (AM) will serve as the primary point of contact to our direct clients, internal team members and partners by helping implement and maintain client web sites. This individual will:  Help manage and provide technical guidance through the implementation of new client Web sites  Continually update sites as requirements change each year or as often as needed (this includes benefit class matrix, requirements document, rates, permissions, field options, site text and any open items on questions log)  Test client sites for quality assurance; track and monitor the resolution of issues  Prepare and conduct technical/product presentations, demonstrations and trainings (such as an open enrollment demo for new/changing plans, site text, and release functionality changes, etc.)  Provide resolution of client issues by responding to questions and concerns about the use of bswift products; ability to leverage research to find resolution  Maintain thorough understanding of all internal systems to respond to general and specialized client requests  Triage client tickets and/or questions (email and voicemail) within 24 hours; maintaining ownership from initial customer contact to call resolution which includes supporting escalations if appropriate and providing customer updates  Look for and help drive continuous process improvements/efficiencies by maintaining a thorough understanding of all internal systems  Develop and implement fulfillment procedures  Lead and create agendas for client meetings (when CRM is not available)  Coach and mentor other team members; share new ideas and customer needs with bswift teams throughout all phases of product life cycle  Manage workflow in the setup and maintenance of carrier and payroll feeds  Assist in sales and marketing activities as needed  Provide open communication to bswift customers in a pleasant, professional manner with a can-do attitude  Responsible for special projects as assigned  (NOTE: NIGHT AND WEEKEND WORK MAY BE NECESSARY)  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree from a four-Year College or university; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  3+ Years of direct client and/or analyst experience preferred  Solid Technical background  Must be proficient in Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Basic Functionality)  Good written/verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical personnel; ability to listen, clarify and respond well to questions  Ability to operate and make timely decisions in an ambiguous, fast-paced atmosphere  Must be able to quickly sort through complex subject material  Strong analytical skill set and ability to effectively use data for strategy  High level of productivity, reliability, responsibility, attendance, dependability, organization and accuracy/thoroughness  Ability to take initiative to meet challenges with resourcefulness and new innovative approaches while maintaining a high level of quality  Must possess a passion for teamwork, client service and reaching business results through problem solving  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Experience with benefits administration / open enrollment process  Education  A Bachelor’s Degree from a four-Year College or university; or equivalent combination of education and experience  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Bongene Search is biotech, pharmaceutical, and medical staffing agency that believes talent lies at the heart of all great companies. As such, the team at Bongene Search is dedicated to helping our clients around the globe create the most talented team of biopharma professionals. Whether it is a large publicly traded company or a biotech start-up, our medical, pharmaceutical, and biotech recruiting agency will create a tailor-made search process that delivers the perfect fit for the role. We represent the following opportunity from our client.  CNS Field Sales Representative would be covering Oklahoma, OK territory.  This role will responsible for the development and management of a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales while improving patient lives. Patients are central to all our strategies and the Representative will be responsible for a physician and patient-centric focus. The role is responsible for developing business relationships with targeted neurologists, epileptologists, seizure specialists, and other identified healthcare practitioners and members of the health care community. The time allocation for this role is 70% field-based selling and 30% utilization of virtual technology and an inside approach to remote customer contact, however, this may vary as business needs arise.  REQUIREMENTS: · Bachelor’s degree is required in business, communications, marketing or related discipline · Minimum of 1-3+ years of B2B sales experience is required · Previous experience using Customer Relationship Management software required (Salesforce.com preferred) · Demonstrated proficiency with tele meeting (i.e. video conferencing, Skype, etc) technology and the use of tablets for the customer detailing strongly preferred
industries: Pharmaceuticals, Medical Devices, and Biotechnology

description: Position Title: Market Manager, Southern CA, On-Premise Location: Remote - within the market Position Summary At Pernod Ricard USA, we have accelerated and transformed our organization around experiences of conviviality, placing the consumer at the heart of our business model.  The Market Manager plays an important role in our mission to drive the success of our complete portfolio across our entire customer base. In summary, the Market Manager plays an important role in driving and motivating our Distributor partners to execute our plans to grow the holistic PR USA Spirits, Wine, and Champagne portfolio and beat the market in a designated channel or geography.  Acting as the specific channel/geography’s main day-to-day point of contact for our local Distributor partners, this role leads the local market-level planning and execution, as well as the tracking of our Distributor’s performance, with data-driven rigor.  The Market Manager ensures the local level plan, including PR strategic imperatives and local KPIs, remain in line with broader region priorities at the local level. This position reports directly to the State Director or State Manager. Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities Work with Distributor partners to sell and execute against the full PR USA brand and portfolio plans – inclusive of Wines, Spirits, & Champagnes – in assigned market (specific channel or geography)  Lead local market-level planning and execution with Distributors and track performance. Ensure data-driven decision making in assigned market through the utilization of data dashboards. Effectively utilize the data meet market goals, as well as to regularly track and inform Distributors of progress against goals. Execute local level plan, including PR strategic imperatives and local KPIs, in line with region priorities at the local level. Manage day-to-day channel planning and performance tracking for appropriate channel / geography. Support State Manager / State Director in reviewing account lists and segmentation; recommend high potential accounts for inclusion. Execute localized national programs and initiatives with cross-functional teams (Distributor, Customer Success, eCommerce), and work with Customer Success team to meet program goals (as applicable). Identify and oversee targeted sell-through activities – using local marketing funds (LMF) / A&P – within budget and policy guardrails. Collect market and channel insights and disseminate them via Field Marketing to support broader planning processes (i.e. channel plans, field marketing, etc.). Ensure balance between Chains and non-Chains resourcing, allocations, and growth plans. Provide sales enablement support through quarter turn of selling stories and localizing selling materials within Guardrails. Ensure performance operates within full legal compliance with state and local regulations. Influence and oversee distributor partners in selling and executing against the holistic PRUSA brand and portfolio plans and programs in designated market (channel or geography)  Apply designated performance management guardrails against Distributors and monitor / drive performance as programs are executed using data dashboards and tracking tools. Oversee dedicated Distributor resources (when applicable) within market and work closely with split-book and full-book Distributor teams to ensure optimization and prioritization of PR USA brands and portfolio.  Ensure allocation of local resources against market priorities and key accounts. Align local Distributors to PR USA’s strategies and goals; ensure the tracking of Distributor / Customer compliance. Act as the local Distributor’s first point of contact for specific channel / geography; attend local Distributor calls / meetings. Coordinate and leverage educational materials and Brand Ambassadors to support Distributors and Customers with a better understanding of the PRUSA portfolio. Own resolution and decision making of execution-related issues in designated market with minimal support from State leadership. Work with Distributors and Customer Success Team (when applicable) to ensure timely and accurate POS ordering, logistics and distribution from HQ to Distributors and to key accounts. Conduct “work withs” with Distributor to ensure compliance and keep abreast of distributor practices and customer trends. Coordinate with eCommerce to provide digital marketing assets and eCommerce support to Distributors. Support market-level pricing and forecasting activities  Identify potential pricing and promo programs; partner with State leadership and Division Finance to evaluate ROI. Ensure execution and compliance of pricing, within guardrails defined by RGM. Track / review / evaluate forecasting for geography / channel, assisting State leadership as needed. Job Requirements The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated self-starter with strong leadership, analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to collaborate effectively across functions with passion and enthusiasm. Strong entrepreneurial ability to work around obstacles, results driven, and a bias for action with a pilot/learn/scale approach. Education:  Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) highly preferred. Experience / Background:   Minimum 5 years of work experience in relevant sales management role, preferably within the wine and spirit or consumer goods industry. Travel: This position may travel up to 40% of the time.       Required Competencies Functional Competencies  Strong relationship-building skills with internal and external partners; effectively serve as the lead for local market-level Distributor contacts. Strong cross-organization consensus-building skills with the ability to gain buy-in, trust, and universal alignment. Strong financial and business acumen; understanding of market’s customer and distributor requirements, including legal statutes. Proven experience driving strategies to execution, as well as delivering results through others. Management-level communication and reporting; can communicate effectively in customer / distributor meeting. Demonstrated ability to utilize digital tools, platforms, and channels, as well as analyze data and dashboards to drive strategy, decision-making, and business opportunities; uncover themes to make effective recommendations; and monitor compliance/track progress against goals. Strong proficiency in problem solving, prioritization, and the ability to multitask in a rapid-changing environment. Entrepreneurial and able to thrive in ambiguity. Effective budget management capabilities. Leadership Competencies  Growth Mindset: Strategic mindset - Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies. Consumer Centricity: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions. Drive Results: Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances. Deliver through collaboration:  Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. Bold and Agile:  Actively learning through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder; courageous; strong decision-making ability that keeps the organization moving forward. Grow Diverse Teams: Leverages and values diversity of profiles to build empowered teams and develops talents creating a sense of belonging to help them meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals. Who are we? Pernod Ricard USA is the premium spirits and wine company in the U.S. The company's leading spirits and wines include such prestigious brands as ABSOLUT® Vodka, Chivas Regal® Scotch Whisky, The Glenlivet® Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Jameson® Irish Whiskey, Malibu®, Kahlúa® Liqueur, Beefeater® Gin, and Avión™ Tequila such superior wines as Jacob's Creek® and Brancott Estate®; and such exquisite champagnes and sparkling wines as Perrier-Jouët® Champagne, G.H. Mumm™ Champagne and Mumm Napa® sparkling wines. Learn more about our history, values, strategies and organization by visiting us at http://www.pernod-ricard-usa.com/
industries: Wine and Spirits

description: Company Profile Southstar JCB is a highly successful, fast growing business We pride ourselves on customer service. We invest on our workforce and offer a highly competitive compensation and benefit program.  Position Summary  Southstar JCB currently has an opening for a Territory Sales Representative to support our sales coverage. This position is responsible for providing exemplary customer satisfaction to assigned accounts through the sale or rental of products and services offered by Southstar JCB. The Territory Sales Representative will serve as the primary liaison between Southstar JCB and the customer.  Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities  Develop sales opportunities by researching and identifying potential accounts, soliciting new accounts; building rapport, providing technical information and explanations preparing quotes. Build relationships with customers quickly and in a mutually beneficial manner. Listen to and engage every customer to obtain sufficient information to correctly determine or confirm his/her requests. Answer customer questions regarding products, prices, availability, product uses and rental policies. Fulfill requests promptly and accurately, in line with company procedures. Obtain customer information such as name, address and payment method. Enter orders into Point Of Rental database. Create quotations and maintain records of contacts, accounts and orders. Consult with clients after contract signings to resolve issues and provide ongoing support. Knowledge of products to troubleshoot machine issues over the phone. Ensure showroom, equipment, displays, counters, and signs clean, well-stocked, orderly and attractive. Ensure price tags are in place, updated and accurate. Schedule and dispatch deliveries. Work with team members to ensure high quality work and the best possible customer experience Maintain CRM database, knowledge of Sales Force a plus  Requirements Specific industry experienced desired or an equivalent college degree. Qualified candidate MUST have prior service, parts or sales experience in a dealership or renal company environment to include heavy customer contact and negotiation.  Prior territory management experience preferred. High energy, excellent communication skills, and a strong work ethic required. Leadership Skills a strong plus for future growth opportunities Self-Improvement skills and set high standards for personal performance Excellent customer service skills Ability to perform at a high capacity in fast paced environment Must pass any drug screens and background checks   JCB is an equal employment opportunities (EEO) employer in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. JCB complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.
industries: Construction and Machinery

description: For over 70 years, MOSAIC has provided strategic marketing, creative, promotional products and print services to a wide range of industries and companies across the country. To support our continued growth and success, we are seeking to hire some fun, dynamic, and strategic Sales Account Executives to our sales team.  At MOSAIC, we love to solve meaningful business challenges collaboratively with our clients. Our ideal candidate is a curious problem-solver – one who is willing to understand the client’s challenges, do what’s in their best interest, and create real results. We find our best success comes from individuals that have creative and marketing talents with strong sales acumen.  SUMMARY:  The Sales Account Executive will develop new business for MOSAIC by offering a variety of services and solutions to our prospects and customers, including strategic marketing, creative services, promotional products, print services, and fulfillment. As you foster and grow relationships with C Level Executives across a variety of markets, our team of subject matter experts will support you along the way.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Build relationships with assigned and organic prospects to discover their needs and identify opportunities for MOSAIC to help Ability to gain appointments with C suite to identify, quantify and develop new business to achieve goals Hold meetings with high level people to discuss a variety of needs ranging from complex through tactical. Capable of narrowing in on specific information to determine how MOSAIC can support needs of customers and prospects and then closing business. Open to learning new ways of working with clients utilizing the many solutions we offer including: Promotional products, Marketing strategy and Creative solutions, Print and digital support, Fulfillment and Mailing, Learning systems and App technology  KEY SKILL SETS & EDUCATION DESIRED:  Proven record of selling Promotional Products, Print and/or Marketing/Creative Services Professional demeanor and excellent communication skills, including oral and written Organizational skills to track and record each step within a sales pipeline Proactive, positive, personable and self-motivated with a strong work ethic

description: For over 70 years, MOSAIC has provided strategic marketing, creative, promotional products and print services to a wide range of industries and companies across the country. To support our continued growth and success, we are seeking to hire some fun, dynamic, and strategic Sales Account Executives to our sales team.  At MOSAIC, we love to solve meaningful business challenges collaboratively with our clients. Our ideal candidate is a curious problem-solver – one who is willing to understand the client’s challenges, do what’s in their best interest, and create real results. We find our best success comes from individuals that have creative and marketing talents with strong sales acumen.  SUMMARY:  The Sales Account Executive will develop new business for MOSAIC by offering a variety of services and solutions to our prospects and customers, including strategic marketing, creative services, promotional products, print services, and fulfillment. As you foster and grow relationships with C Level Executives across a variety of markets, our team of subject matter experts will support you along the way.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Build relationships with assigned and organic prospects to discover their needs and identify opportunities for MOSAIC to help Ability to gain appointments with C suite to identify, quantify and develop new business to achieve goals Hold meetings with high level people to discuss a variety of needs ranging from complex through tactical. Capable of narrowing in on specific information to determine how MOSAIC can support needs of customers and prospects and then closing business. Open to learning new ways of working with clients utilizing the many solutions we offer including: Promotional products, Marketing strategy and Creative solutions, Print and digital support, Fulfillment and Mailing, Learning systems and App technology  KEY SKILL SETS & EDUCATION DESIRED:  Proven record of selling Promotional Products, Print and/or Marketing/Creative Services Professional demeanor and excellent communication skills, including oral and written Organizational skills to track and record each step within a sales pipeline Proactive, positive, personable and self-motivated with a strong work ethic

We’re transforming the software industry. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team.  Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester, and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace.   Flexera delivers Technology Value Optimization solutions that enable some of the largest companies in the world to inform their IT so they can transform their IT. From on-prem to the cloud, companies can get the IT asset data needed to rightsize, reallocate spend, reduce risk and maximize ROI.  The Role As a Territory Account Manager, you will meet/exceed assigned revenue goals working with a virtual team of Systems Engineers, Business Development, Channels, Marketing, and other members of your Flexera ecosystem, including Solution and Channel Partners. You will follow up on leads, perform deep discovery, use product demos for qualified customers and lead the technical validation process. You know how to work "smarter" not harder and drive standard methodologies to ensure success to win as a team. In addition, you will also successfully:  Responsibilities: Be responsible for the business by building and developing account relationships through personalized contact, understanding of account’s needs, and ability to effectively communicate the value of Flexera’s solutions Lead sales campaigns and motions that build customer value and enable multi-year, multi-solution transactions Accurately forecast opportunities based upon realistic assessments and consistently deliver against that forecast Support Channel Partners to create net new customer opportunities and upgrade/expansion opportunities in customer accounts  Requirements: 2+ years of experience in selling enterprise IT software solutions (asset management, cloud management, data analytics, security software, enterprise applications, business processing outsourcing, risk management software or networking performance) or 3-5 years in outside B2B sales or technology/business consulting Utilize a defined Sales Methodology (re: MEDDPICC, MEDDIC, Sandler, SPIN) for business needs/business pain understanding Successful experience running the entire sales cycle - direct responsibility for your own quota or have created new revenue streams with accounts Strong reputation of exceeding sales quota (top 20% in your sales organization) You have successfully owned and led the end-to-end sales process (this is not an overlay or team quota) Consultative sales experience targeting relevant companies/businesses to drive cost savings and efficiencies throughout their IT organization Successful in finding and uncovering opportunities with net new and existing accounts, via creative prospecting tactics and hunting activities Consistent track record of using a repeatable sales process for successful deal Finding, Engaging, Running & Closing Highly motivated and professional, with excellent verbal communication, presentation, and social skills A rational, logical, and analytical thinker You have shown strong technical aptitude and are passionate about technology sales CRM system (Salesforce.com); experience working with Word, Excel, Powerpoint Excellent listening skills with the attested ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks to meet deadlines Self-starter able to work independently but also a giving member of a team Willingness and desire to learn new things and ways to be more efficient and effective Excellent conflict resolution skills Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Computer & Network Security

description: Honey’s Place Inc., a leader in the distribution of pleasure products, is looking for a career oriented, talented Remote Sales Representative that is outside of Southern California. The ideal candidate will be well organized with excellent communication skills and able to complete tasks in a proficient manner. We are looking for an enthusiastic self-starter to work in a fast pace environment. They also must have a customer-focused attitude and have a proven track record of success interactions within a dynamic team environment.  Only candidates outside of Southern California will be considered. If you are in Southern California please use the Inside Sales job posting to be considered.  Responsibilities Cold calling to proactively pursue new prospects to grow customer base Meet and exceed monthly sales performance goals by servicing existing accounts, obtaining orders, upselling and establishing new accounts Focus sales efforts by using reports to analyzing existing and potential sale opportunities Meet all sales objectives and handle all aspects of completing a sale including paperwork Continually manage daily, weekly, and monthly sales forecasts and prospects using company software, and produce weekly reports. Resolve customers’ complaints by investigating problems, developing solutions, and making recommendations Understand each customer’s needs to build strong long-term relationships Develop and maintain positive relationships with support departments (warehouse, customer service and accounting) Coordinating in-store sales training with vendors and customers Attend vendor trainings and trade shows to increase product knowledge Deliver exceptional customer service Skill Summary Ability to communicate and hold a conversation with decision makers Minimum 2- 3 years of sales, account management, or customer service experience from a distribution or manufacturing background with a minimum of 1,000 skus Experience with Business-to-Business sales; Retail sales experience is plus Capacity to sell physical products. Proven track record of cold calling to acquire new business. Need to have strong customer service skills and the ability to create and maintain long-term relationships with clients Extremely well organized and detailed oriented with excellent time management in a fast paced work environment Ability to develop in-depth knowledge about products and markets Proficient in Microsoft Office Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in both English and Spanish is a plus Only candidates outside of Southern California will be considered. If you are in Southern California please use the Inside Sales job posting to be considered.  Honey’s Place Inc., a leader in the distribution of pleasure products is located in San Fernando, CA.
industries: Wholesale, Consumer Goods, and Retail

description: The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. As a leader in a corporation with 83,000 employees and agency force members, you’ll have a hand in transforming not only Allstate but a dynamic industry. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.  Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.  Compensation Data  Starting salary will be between $48,000 to $52,000 based on candidate experience + bonus opportunity   Job Description  If you are looking for a sales career without having to work in an office, the Allstate Outside Sales Associate is a position built for you. This is an Entry to Mid-Level remote position where you use your knowledge and skills to attract and generate new customers. As an Allstate employee, you help us bring our products and services to the customer – whether virtually or in-person meeting them where they are most comfortable to capitalize on the in-person sales experience. As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning! Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. This full-time position offers unlimited earnings potential!  Job Responsibilities Partner with Allstate Sales Leaders in developing your plan to sell new policies Establish a target customer base by using best practices in sales and customer relationship-building Utilize your community connections to generate sales and develop a network of referrals – must be comfortable being actively involved in your community and reaching out to your natural market as well as bringing in new customers Regularly meet with potential and current customers in your community  Plan, implement and manage processes to achieve customer satisfaction, sales growth goals, and targets Proactively communicate with customers to confirm their insurance needs are being met  Job Qualifications  Education and Experience You have a “hunter” mentality, very friendly and conversational and have experience working with customers face-to-face You are actively involved in your community and comfortable reaching out to your natural market You have outside sales experience You enjoy and thrive in a salary + bonus selling environment Certificates, Licenses, Registrations Applicable Insurance Licensing in state of residence and areas serviced is required to perform the duties of this job – must be willing to obtain P&C Producer Licenses – Company Paid  Functional Skills Strong ability to close sales Self-motivated to drive production and achieve results in a virtual space Advanced problem-solving skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Strong grammar skills Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a high volume, fast-paced environment
jobFunction: Business Development, Customer Service, and Sales
industries: Insurance

description: Snap-on Tools Factory Sales Representative - Selling Direct to Industrial Corporations  Snap-on Inc. is more than the premiere global tool and equipment manufacturer; we are a leading global innovator, manufacturer and marketer of complex equipment and systems solutions. We operate in critical industries like; Aerospace, Energy and Natural Resources, Defense, Transportation, and Manufacturing.  At Snap-on Industrial, our team of sales Solutioneers prides themselves on our ability to offer our customer “Business Partners”, unique solutions. We actively listen to their requirements and develop specific solutions tailored to meet their needs. As a solutioneer you will use your superior sales and problem solving skills to help our business partners become more productive. In return, you will receive a generous benefits package and a future of career opportunities.  As a Snap-on Sales Solutioneer You Will Work intently with our business partners to thoroughly understand their business needs, and leverage the broad range of Snap-on product offerings to develop solutions unique to the situation. Build and enhance relationships with key business partner decision-makers. Present at all levels of the organization; from C suite sales presentations, to lunch and learns on the shop floor or in the field. Develop and maintain a Customer Contact and Activity Database for assigned accounts. Monitor Sales Activity Reports, projecting annual sales goals, preparing territorial sales forecasts and verifying that sales activity supports the forecast and projected sales. Reviewing customer activities at least quarterly with Team Leader or Sales Manager and strategizing ways to maximize sales volumes or grow territory. 3-5 years of outside sales experience is required Proven track record of prior goal achievement showing increase in sales and customer growth Bachelor or Associate degree preferred Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Strong organizational and communication skills are required and comfort working with and presenting to all levels within an organization Must hold and maintain a valid driver license with an impeccable driving record Join the industry leader!  We Offer a Substantial Compensation And Benefits Package That Includes  As part of the Snap-on team, you'll be joining an extraordinary company that has been the industry standard for over 100 years. As part of our team, you will not only provide superb service and innovative solutions to our business partners, but enjoy the benefits of working for an extraordinary company. Competitive compensation with incentive opportunities Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) Health, Dental, and Vision coverage Defined Retirement Savings Plan 401K And more! You and Snap-on - let’s get started, NOW!  Snap-on is a drug free work environment and welcomes all qualified candidates to apply. Local candidates are strongly encouraged to apply since we are not offering relocation assistance at this time.  Snap-on is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Job Type Full-time
industries: Construction, Automotive, and Financial Services
