description: Job Description  This role will focus on developing and cultivating strong relationships with key constituents (producers, plan sponsors and/or consumers depending on business) to maximize sales opportunities and achieve profitable growth.  Required Qualifications  Oversees a block of business or may develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling, issue resolution and superior service.  Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives. Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment  being supported.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna's full product array.  Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities.  Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations.  May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations.  Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends.  Licensure as required by state.  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  5-10+ years in the medical insurance industry and sales experience working directly with brokers, producers and plan sponsors.  Education  College degree or equivalent work experience.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

GuardHill is one of the nation’s leading, privately-held mortgage specialists headquartered in NYC with over 29 years of experience. Our sales team originates over $1 Billion annually in residential and commercial mortgages and excels in structuring standard to complex mortgage transactions with competitive rates for our customers. jobTitle: Group Sales Account Manager, Shared Services
description: Job Description Summary  Reporting to the Corporate Regional Director of Sales, the Group Sales Account Manager is responsible for managing of group accounts for two or more assigned hotels along with a defined cluster of hotels within a region. The Group Sales Account Manager will serve as a trusted advisor for internal and external clients to optimize fair share delivery to Sonesta Hotels in addition to the following key responsibilities: Handle Group Sales responsibilities for primary hotel, hotels in an assigned region and point of contact for select Group Accounts. Duties would include, lead management, business review, all system work, sales follow up, site coordination, business development, payment and other related duties prior to turnover. Will represent hotel(s) for identified key trade shows, market solicitation activities.  We are looking for motivated, independent, sales -professionals with a successful track record within a hotel sales organization and demonstrated ability to build mutually beneficial complex customer relationships. Successful candidates will be extremely self-driven, possess excellent communication and customer-relations skills and have solid business acumen.  Focus  As key enablement tools, the candidate will successfully embed group sales initiatives and strategies that will increase Sonesta’s visibility and improve year over year share of group business to Sonesta Hotels. The position requires a proactive approach and carefully crafted account plans to achieve desired results. The Group Sales Account Manager will also be measured on successful collaboration with varying stakeholders to include property leaders, Sonesta corporate leadership team including Global Sales, and key third party intermediators.  Environment  The job environment is fast paced and results oriented. The successful candidate will employ proactive measures to achieve the desired account and revenue objectives.  Job Description Operational/Functional: Effectively promote the Sonesta brand to group and meeting decision makers Be fully capable of utilizing primary online tools for RFP solicitation and negotiations including C-vent, Meeting Broker, Delphi.fdc Manage a limited number of GSO accounts for Sonesta’s full service domestic portfolio. Assigned Accounts, seller will be responsible for achieving account growth targets, solicitation, maintenance and all sales related activities . Be able to analyze market conditions and account specific data to determine current account status and alter individual account strategies, as needed. Meet or exceed weekly, quarterly and annual sales goals, KPI’s, solicitation goals and initiatives. Develop, actively solicit, and map group business accounts per defined territory. Participate in daily business review meeting, pre-convention meetings, training and other sales-related meetings as required. Adhere to all mandatory standards of operations, policies and procedures, manuals, memos, oral instructions, etc., all of which go to make up the essential functions of the job. Maintain a complete database of accounts in defined territories. Identify and qualify potential prospects through participating in telemarketing, tradeshows, sales blitzes and other sales initiatives. Prepare correspondence to customers, internal booking reports and file maintenance. Maximize outcome of all sales initiatives by following up on leads, following up with clients in-house to identify additional business opportunities and aggressively managing accounts. Leads on-site inspections by customers, performs outside sale calls to develop leads. Manages and negotiates account details and contracts so that all pertinent aspects of solicitation and closing are complete and documented. Manages and update Delphi.fdc daily. Formulates and submits formal and informal sales proposals to prospective customers in the field, at the hotel, and over the phone. Follow company direction, process, and expectations of assigned hotels. Partner with operations departments to ensure full participation in servicing accounts. Ensure all due dates/deadlines are met and other duties as assigned. Attend trade shows, community events and industry meetings as directed. Strategy and Planning: Analyze sales statistics with Leadership, to determine sales potential, inventory requirements, and sales goals. Awareness of competition, top accounts, rates and sales strategies on an ongoing basis. Stays abreast of trends in the market. Ability to coordinate and participate in Sales Blitzes and completes follow up in a timely manner with potential corporate clients. Develop a sales plan that addresses new business development, product management from a sales and marketing perspective, strategic sales alliances, and partnerships with companies. Development of quarterly SMART plans. Ability to set up and lead customer business reviews on a quarterly basis; collaborating with other Sales and Operations teams as appropriate. Having a deep knowledge of group and meetings industry, decision making and booking processes. Develop strong working relationships with Sonesta International Hotel DOSMs and regional team to ensure collaborative management approach and seamless interactions with customers. Financial Management: Manage and optimize annual revenue goal and to achieve YOY key account revenue growth (room nights, ADR and revenue). Ability to work with Revenue Management and provide detailed business analysis of group opportunities. Interact with outside contacts: Oversee designated portfolio of managed accounts, strategic relationships in the B2B space and represent Sonesta in key industry associations Acquire new accounts that fit the hotel portfolio and drive incremental impact Promote and reposition the Sonesta brand to decision makers by analyzing needs, mapping business opportunities, creating strategies and measuring growth realized at Sonesta. Promoting and repositioning the Sonesta brand to group and meeting decision makers by analyzing needs, mapping business opportunities, creating strategies and measuring growth realized at Sonesta International relative to account level results. Customize and effectively socialize Sonesta’s value proposition to meet the needs of meeting planners. Ensuring client and hotel satisfaction by facilitating positive, long-term relationships with both customers and Sonesta Hotels International. Network at key industry events and trade shows. Accountability: Responsible for individual performance and incremental contribution to Sonesta hotels. Responsibly collaborate with hotel teams to activate shared account events and activities. Responsible for effectively managing time commitments. Responsible for meeting and/or exceeding revenue and room night targets. Candidate is expected to learn and understand roles, responsibilities and business of the clients with whom we partner with. Responsible for using the appropriate account management tools to effectively track activities, opportunities and follow up. Responsible for achieving the desired ROI on tradeshow and industry events. Leading with Passion Function as the Voice of the Customer to represent customer insights to key corporate personnel and Sonesta senior leadership. Utilize and collaborate with resources across different departments within the corporate office as appropriate. Lead by example and operate with integrity and respect. Work to achieve goals while overcoming competitive obstacles and planning alternate ways to win. Show strong passion and commitment about reaching targets. Celebrate individual and team success. Maintain a positive, “can do” attitude and a versatile approach to change. Appreciates the diversity of our team members, guests, vendors and surrounding community. Is always committed to ensuring a positive and safe work environment.  Additional Job Description  A candidate for this position must possess the following applicable knowledge, skills and abilities and be able to demonstrate and provide applicable examples to support their competencies therein. Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) 2-4 years of property level sales experience. A successful track record of sales success and team development. Multi-brand hotel experience is advantageous. Must possess the ability and willingness to travel 20%-30% of the time. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Excellent organization skills. Possess selling skills that are transferable to multiple segments within the hotel industry Appropriate professional appearance and demeanor. Ability to deliver presentations in a concise, well-organized manner. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Demonstrates good working knowledge of job-related processes and systems (i.e. IT systems specific to sales, like Delphi.fdc, Social Tables, Knowland, Opera, etc.) Valid driver license, passport, serviceable automobile, proof of insurance and approved to work in USA  Benefits  Sonesta recognizes that benefits play a vital role in helping ensure the health and financial security of employees and their families. We offer a variety of benefits to our employees including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Health Savings Account with Company Match 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match Paid Vacation and Sick Days Sonesta Hotel Discounts Educational Assistance Paid Parental Leave Company Paid Life Insurance Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance Various Employee Perks and Discounts Upon submitting your application, please ensure you complete a full application in addition to attaching a resume. Incomplete applications received will not be considered.

description: Vista Equity Partners seeks a Business Development Associate for our outbound proprietary deal sourcing strategy. Using a data and metrics driven approach, this person will proactively identify and engage executives at leading software companies that may be investment opportunities for the fund. Working closely under the Director of Business Development, with peer Associates and the investment team, the Business Development Associate will play an integral role in the sourcing success of the fund. The right candidate will have a passion for building relationships while working at the intersection of technology and finance; be self-motivated and organized, with a high degree of initiative; and enjoy leveraging a systematic approach to results.  This role is based in Austin, TX and is for an immediate start.  Primary Responsibilities ·      Maintain coverage of hundreds of companies, broken down by geography and verticals ·      Create thematic driven investment theses to identify and vet new potential investments within enterprise software ·      Partner with investment professionals to identify companies of interest ·      Map organizations to identify key influencers and decision makers ·      Build relationship networks to gain access to decision makers and key industry contacts ·      Leverage research to prepare for meetings to thoughtfully engage with senior executives and business owners qualify for meetings for senior investment professionals  Qualifications ·      BS/BA required; prefer related field such as finance or business ·      Minimum 3+ years of relevant professional experience such as software sales, PE / VC, consulting, or investment banking ·      Commercially facing and/or direct sales experience ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·      Demonstrated track record of success and accountability ·      High degree of personal and professional maturity ·      Competitive with a strong desire to achieve goals in a team environment ·      Motivated to use data and a programmatic approach to continuously improve processes and results ·      Expertise or willingness to acquire knowledge of B2B enterprise software ·      Intellectually curious with high intellectual horsepower ·      Coachable, resilient, personable, and self-aware ·      Experience with Salesforce or another CRM ·      Candidate must be willing to travel ·      As a condition of employment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to starting work. For purposes of this policy, “fully vaccinated” means two weeks after either (a) the single dose of a one-dose vaccine regimen, or (b) the second dose of a two-dose vaccine regimen. We will require that you provide proof of full vaccination prior to beginning your employment. We are an equal opportunity employer, and will consider a request for exemption from this policy for medical reasons or sincerely-held religious beliefs where reasonable accommodations are possible without imposing undue hardship, to the extent required by law.  About Vista Equity Partners Vista is a leading global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled organizations across private equity, credit, public equity and permanent capital strategies. The firm brings an approach that prioritizes creating enduring market value for the benefit of its global ecosystem of investors, companies, customers and employees. Vista’s investments are anchored by a sizable long-term capital base, experience in structuring technology-oriented transactions and proven, flexible management techniques that drive sustainable growth. Vista believes the transformative power of technology is the key to an even better future – a healthier planet, a smarter economy, a diverse and inclusive community and a broader path to prosperity. Further information is available at vistaequitypartners.com. Follow Vista on LinkedIn @Vista Equity Partners or Twitter @Vista_Equity.

description: ** PLEASE ATTACH RESUME ** Syneos Health® is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization. The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration.  Are you passionate about discovering, developing and bringing more innovative medicines to help patients? Idorsia’s purpose is to discover, develop and bring more innovative medicines to help patients. Idorsia is an independent biopharmaceutical company specializing in the development of small molecules to meet significant unmet medical needs. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus.  Job Description: Reporting to the Syneos Health District Manager (DM), the Specialty Sales Representative (SSR) role is responsible for building relationships with recognized experts, HCPs, and prioritized stakeholders in the therapeutic area and integrated health care systems.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required • Minimum 2+ years life science sales experience • Experience in psych / PCP / Sleep Disorders preferred • Experience in retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales • Identify and develop business relationships with targeted Health Care providers • Achieve quarterly and annual sales goals • Identify key influencers and achieve designated customer interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • Understand and address both business and scientific-oriented needs of healthcare professionals by engaging in meaningful dialog to determine underlying patient needs and determine how products could address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • Implement and execute in a compliant manner marketing and sales direction to achieve territory promotional objectives • Communicate effectively with peers and management • Effective in front of the customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain expense and promotional budgets for the territory within guidelines • Must operate within Compliance Guidelines at all times • Adherence to Policies, Process and Procedures  At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality of life balance.  Why Syneos Health? Our employees voted Syneos Health as the overall winner in MedReps’ Best Places To Work In Medical Sales Awards. Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)

Not to exclude future retailer, brands in the future.  Serves as a key liaison between Biossance and the retail accounts to positively impact sales through educating, demonstration and special events.  This position is based in Miami, FL.  Responsibilities Daily, Weekly and Monthly store visits, report on inventory levels, and track sales performance by door Conduct in person trainings in both small and large capacities Plan and execute minor and major special events in stores monthly Build strong business relationships with stores sales teams and management Administratively responsible for timely and accurate reporting and expense control  Required Qualifications Must have outstanding interpersonal and communication skills (i.e.: verbal, written, group presentation and through facilitation) Proficient in Word, Excel, and able to create and update PPT presentations Ability to travel as needed or up to 25% of time based on market Position requires a flexible work schedule to include weekends, evenings and some holidays. Make Good, No Compromise .  Amyris, a leader in industrial synthetic biology, uses its innovative bioscience solutions to achieve renewable products by converting plant sugars into hydrocarbon molecules. Amyris’ molecules are used in wide range of specialty & performance chemicals, flavors & fragrances and in applications ranging from cosmetics to biofuels. Learn more at www.amyris.com . jobTitle: Sales Development Representative (SDR) - Buildup- East Coast
description: Job Description  Sales Development Representative (SDR) - Buildup, East Coast  Joining the Stanley Black & Decker (SBD) team means joining one of the world's largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. SBD, a Fortune 200 company is a world-leading provider of tools and storage, commercial electronic security and engineered fastening systems, with unique growth platforms and a track record of sustained profitable growth. We have been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable, and rewarding companies in the world.  Stanley X is Stanley Black & Decker’s Innovation business dedicated to launching and growing exponentially scalable businesses to address customers’ needs within our strategic markets. We are building a capability within Stanley Black & Decker to identify and seize on new sources of growth. We are a group of innovation & business-building professionals located in Silicon Valley and in Atlanta, GA. Stanley X is building a Construction Technology platform to bring new digital services, workflow tools, and data transparency to the construction industry. Buildup is a newly acquired application within the Construction Technology platform. We have an exciting opportunity for an eager Sales Development Representative to join our Buildup team to drive our sales pipeline.  Buildup was designed with construction and development professionals in mind, providing an easy to use collaboration tool for task management, punch list and inspections. The mobile-first application allows users to document conditions, request action and communicate in the built environment. Used by owners, developers, GCs, subcontractors, architects/3rd party consultants and property managers, Buildup ensures that everyone is “on the same page” and projects are completed on-time.  Summary  We are looking for a motivated Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing sales team targeting our construction/renovation and property management prospects. This position will work closely with an Account Executive in their territory, collaborating to help increase sales activity and help to continue to grow our company.  Duties & Responsibilities Cold and warm calling (80+ phone calls/day) and sending emails out to the largest construction companies, real estate development companies, and their associated project personnel. Titles that you will be calling are the likes of: Heads of Construction; Heads of Property Operations; Directors of Construction; Directors of Operations; Project Managers, Superintendents and other similar titles Coordinating with inbound leads to set up demos and reaching out to customers to up-sell on free trials. Prospecting and conducting market research to help sales team strategize for future growth Being an integral part of an entrepreneurial corporate team and a collaborative regional team that is dynamically hunting and farming new prospects and new projects Qualifications 0-2 years in proactive, outbound sales role in Apps/SaaS software or Construction, Property Management, or Real Estate Development industry Graduated from BA/BS degree from a top-tier university Must have very strong communication skills, demonstrated high volume work ethic, and a “scoreboard mentality” of wanting to have visible measured success metrics Ideally overachieving lead generation and/or closing business over the phone on a monthly and quarterly basis Demonstrated aptitude with apps and software Experience or strong knowledge of the AEC space, Construction, Property Management, or Real Estate Development industry a plus Experience working with a high volume of clients and transactions Track record of being self-motivated and hard working No fear of imperfect information or failure. Willing to constantly reach out to over the phone as well as email and LinkedIn to potential customers without hesitation of talking with strangers Ability to think “outside the box” in terms of sales strategy, ways to further increase sales pipelines Why work with us  Solve massive problems for customers  We approach problems with a lean startup methodology, focused on in-depth user research and addressing the most critical problems first. We are a technology and innovation team that leads with voice of customer, value-based pricing and strong secondary research and competitive analysis.  Visibility to senior leadership  Our team reports directly into the CEO and operates autonomously within the company. This role will report to the head of the group and work closely across other teams.  Work with great companies  We work with some of the most innovative companies in construction technology, additive manufacturing and supply chain. Our partners range from Y Combinator startups to multi-billion-dollar unicorns. You’ll have unparalleled access to their technologies and freedom to explore new and innovative ways of solving customer problems.  All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran’s status or any other protected characteristic. description: Who We Want  Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders, senior management, and their teams.  Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure a project is complete and meets regulations and expectations.  Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.  What You Will Do Performs a variety of finance/accounting functions, focused on accurate commission payments and reporting, in support of our salesforce. All work must be in accordance with standard procedures in general accounting and other financial areas. Act as business partner to salesforce to provide support including ad hoc requests, trainings, & commission-related inquiries. Collaborates on regular basis with leadership including VP, Directors, and Finance leads. Subject matter expert of commissions system & sales reporting tool, including data warehouse & system’s logic. Actively participates in review of salesforce compensation plans, including SPIFs and bonus objectives, acting as liaison between finance & sales leadership. Will work cross-functionally with counterparts to support salesforce/business needs, identifying areas of improvement. Compiles test scripts and participates in UAT, user experience testing, and all projects. Responsible for calculating, researching, and processing monthly sales commissions for business unit. Assists in the completion of journal entries & month end reporting in a timely manner while compliant with GAAP. Assesses commission programs, using data to provide feedback to sales leadership on effectiveness. Influences the formulation of policy, programs, and incentives, providing feedback and focus in specific areas. What You Need 0+ years of work experience required Bachelor's degree required Advance Excel experience preferred This job may be performed remotely from anywhere in the United States, except that this job may not be filled or performed in Colorado.

description: Twingate is building a modern remote access solution that simplifies and improves the way businesses secure access to their cloud, SaaS, and on-prem resources. Twingate is backed by leading investors such as WndrCo, 8VC, Green Bay Ventures, SignalFire, and Dropbox founders Drew Houston and Arash Ferdowsi. Our investors share our belief that in a world where workforces are becoming increasingly distributed, it is critical to be able to effectively secure access to apps, data, and environments.  As part of our company culture, our belief in putting the customer first permeates our thinking in everything from our customer communications to the design process behind the product itself. If you take pride in creating experiences with the customer firmly at the center of the picture, we'd love to work with you.  The Role  Our team is looking to make the first Account Executive hires to help us build meaningful customer relationships. You'd be working closely with our Head of Enterprise to prospect and close companies looking to leave their legacy VPN environment and adopt a modern alternative.  We're still a growing company, so in addition to closing deals, you'll also be shaping the Twingate go-to-market strategy in collaboration with marketing, product, and engineering.  Responsibilities Run full sales cycles from prospecting to qualifying all the way through to closing Be able to interface with CTOs, CIOs, CISOs, DevOps, and engineering leaders Lead Twingate pitches and demo sessions for potential customers Collaborate with Product to funnel customer feedback directly into the product development process Work closely with marketing to develop messaging around Twingate's unique opportunity as an easy to deploy zero trust solution Qualifications 3-5+ years of experience working in sales 2+ years of experience in a closing role Experience in B2B tech SaaS is a plus Customer-first approach: you do whatever it takes to get the right answers for our customers & partners Strong communication and coordination skills to collaborate across time zones Solutions-oriented problem-solving. You look for a path forward and are able to find creative ways to seed relevant use cases of Twingate at innovative companies. Equal Opportunity  Twingate is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to Twingate’s success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

description: SquarePeg is helping a leading digital research company hire an Account Executive to join our corporate new business sales team. This Companies' research empowers our clients with the data, insights, and analysis to make grounded decisions in a digital world. You will be joining a team that prides itself on learning, having fun, winning, teamwork, continuous improvement and achieving results.  Account Executives are responsible for strategically working an assigned territory to identify, engage and win new clients in order to position and sell our syndicated, subscription-based research offering. Your territory will be composed of the world’s largest consumer brands, technology companies and media organizations. Account Executives engage with mid to senior-level executives to diagnose needs and connect the dots between those needs and the research, data, and forecasts we produce. The ultimate goal is to bring on as many new clients as possible and to achieve your annual bookings target. You will report to a Director of New Business and work closely with your peers and SDRs to achieve your goals.  Responsibilities Successfully achieve your quarterly and annual bookings quota Research potential accounts and ideal buyers in your territory and actively engage them with multi-channel prospecting activity in order to ensure consistent pipeline quality, quantity, and velocity Leverage our sales process and consultative selling methodology to continually qualify opportunities, progress them through your pipeline and ultimately win them Anticipate and address customer objections, seeking to resolve concerns and drive win/win outcomes Track all activity in Salesforce; consistently keep contact and opportunity records up to date to deliver predictable forecasting to the sales leadership team Requirements The ideal candidate will have a track record of successful quota achievement in a new business sales position Experience selling subscription-based research or SaaS solutions is highly desirable given the nature of our products and services B2B full-cycle sales experience, selling to business leaders in the marketing, advertising, financial services, CPG, and technology landscapes is highly desirable Proven success achieving/overachieving pipeline and bookings goals and metrics equivalent to ours #ZR  SquarePeg is dedicated to finding you the right fit. We match applicants with curated opportunities based on workplace and personal preferences, as well as skills. You control which roles we put you forward for -- we are directly in touch with hiring managers, and only hiring managers responsible for roles you're interested in can see your profile. Employers turn to our assessments for insight into important soft skills that can't be found on a resume. Take our assessments in approximately 10 mins, and you will receive a personalized report relevant to your career. There are no wrong answers, and no preparation is necessary! Join us at www.SquarePegHires.com.  We love to hear from you! Get in touch with SquarePeg: info@squarepeghires.com

jobTitle: Medical Device Sales – Surgical Sales – Tissue
description: Medical Device Sales – Surgical Sales Specialist – Tissue Reconstruction  Seeking Top Ranked, Well Documented Medical Sales Reps Background in Medical Device: Biologics, Regenerative Medicine, Plastic Surgery.  My client assists patients with biologically active regenerative therapies for wound and tissue repair. As the current leader in the science and clinical application of regenerative medicine, their products are some of the only advanced wound care therapy of its type indicated for tissue reconstruction, trauma wounds and burns. This position involves presentations to surgeons as well as being in the OR/surgical settings for abdominal reconstruction and hernia tissue repair.  Profile:  Medical Device Sales / Sales Reps selling Biologics, Regenerative Medicine or Plastic Surgery OR experience required Seeking reps with longevity in positions, with most recent role 2-4 years+  Requirements:  College Degree (Required) Minimum 3+ years of medical device or medical sales in an OR setting required Selling surgical products in hernia / abdominal, plastic surgery experience required Experience selling to surgeons (plastic, wound, trauma and/or colorectal) Documented sales success (stats, rankings, quota achievements) Consistent years of over 100% to plan with Awards, Trips, etc.  Offering:  Year 1 earnings based on performance $125,000- $150,000+ Base Salary $75,000 Growth oriented accounts Expense Account / Car Allowance Laptop, Mobile, Home Office Full Benefit Package Recognition   Direct Sales Recruiting, LLC, (DSR) and DirectHR are National Recruitment organizations partnering with National, Regional and Local Clients to bring qualified candidates a career and a future. DSR offers over 50 years combined Recruitment, Sales and Management experience. We are, along with our clients, an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to hiring and supporting a diverse workforce. A M/F/D/V

description: Intuition is a global leader in the provision of knowledge solutions. Our extensive portfolio of clients includes top tier organizations from multiple sectors such as financial services, life sciences, public sector and health, telecoms, and energy. Intuition solutions are used by more than 1.5 million professionals around the world annually, and our success is founded on the passion and skills of our dedicated global team. We deliver a range of solutions including learning and cybersecurity awareness platforms, mobile apps, bespoke training portals, technology services, and business process outsourcing.  We have an immediate opportunity for a Junior Account Manager within our New York office. This role involves assisting and supporting the operations of the Sales and Account Management teams and ensuring the smooth running of our daily office operations. This is an ideal opportunity for candidates looking to kick-start their career in a fast-paced sales and business development environment.  What You’ll Be Doing  Client support duties will include: Providing proactive customer support to clients by working closely across teams to ensure that client issues and needs are communicated clearly and resolved effectively. Examining client accounts, handling first-line client queries, and assisting the sales team with the timely resolution of issues. Reviewing and distributing sales reports. Providing site administration and support on client accounts. Building relationships with key customers as well as managing and delivering to their expectations. Creating, executing, and revising support processes as necessary to meet changing needs and requirements. Supporting the sales team with queries, tenders, proposals, client requests, and presentations. Assisting in the organization of client meetings, conferences, and events. Providing support for program activities and assisting with content development. Office Administrative Duties Will Include Providing administrative support to the Chief Executive Officer, North America. Answering incoming calls and escalating queries to the appropriate person. Greeting clients, visiting employees and guests, and managing office workspace to accommodate same. Managing relationships with third party providers (stationery suppliers, cleaners, etc.) Acting as a “culture ambassador” for the office, planning and organizing team building exercises and outings. Ordering and stock-taking of all supplies for the office. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. Exceptional attention to detail. Proficiency in MS Office. A competent and professional manner, especially in client-facing situations. A positive “can-do” attitude and a friendly, personable manner. Ability to multi-task and proactively take ownership of responsibilities. Inventiveness and resilience with a focus on achieving set goals and objectives. A team player who’s enthusiastic and dependable. Previous experience in a similar role would be a distinct advantage. If you are interested in working in an enjoyable, highly innovative environment, Intuition would like to hear from you!  Intuition is an Equal Opportunities Employer  Intuition is a leading global knowledge solutions company. We help clients to optimize their knowledge capital through the provision of online courses, knowledge services, blended learning solutions and knowledge management technology.  For over 30 years, we have been a trusted knowledge advisor and partner to the world’s leading companies and public sector organizations.  As knowledge is the backbone of any organization’s success, our expertise is in helping our clients to optimally manage and distribute knowledge effectively.  Combining a deep understanding of clients and their industries, along with our comprehensive capabilities, we deliver solutions that enable clients to trade more effectively. This unrivaled combination sets us apart in the marketplace.

description: Come for the mission. Stay for the experience.  Let's keep things simple: we are an unbelievably talented, hard-working, and compassionate team driving towards a mission that impacts every single one of us - even you! Healthcare benefits are complex, underutilized, and a mystery for most users. We're removing that complexity.  Our industry-leading technology solution puts a simplified benefits experience in the hands of users, saving them time and money. Since the start of the pandemic, we've created a COVID-19 resource center, helped members find testing and care, and made it even simpler to get telemedicine and mental health support to employees.  HealthJoy experienced explosive growth in 2020: we raised $30M in Series C funding, earned awards for Talent Culture's Best HR Technology Leaders and Forbes America's Best Startup Employers, added 55+ key team members despite going totally remote, and so much more. This year, we continue down that path of high growth and high impact.  Your impact. Partner with brokers across your region to incorporate HealthJoy into their employee benefits offering Use a consultative sales approach to identify client needs and use detailed knowledge of the HealthJoy solutions to challenge prospective brokers & customers to consider a new and innovative offering Ability to articulate HealthJoy's value proposition to prospective and existing clients and successfully secure new business Develop and deliver sales presentations to clients onsite Collaborate with all levels and departments in a positive and successful manner  Your experience. Aggressive self-starter with strong relationship management and negotiation skills Proven track record of achieving sales and revenue goals Commitment to sell, win and grow Strong interpersonal communication skills; excellent poise and presentation skills 5+ years of experience in a sales position Ability to travel 50% of time  Our rewards.  Work should be meaningful and rewarding.  HealthJoy offers a robust package of employee perks and benefits, including healthcare benefits (medical, dental and vision, EAP, and telemedicine), flexible PTO plan, 401k+match, parental leave, and HSA contribution match. We also provide our employees with a remote work stipend - to ensure you can work comfortably from home, host virtual-lunch-and-learns, 'friendship time' pairings, virtual coffee chats/happy hours, and quarterly team activities.  The best benefit of all? We use our own product. As an employee, you can rely on HealthJoy to feel confident about your own healthcare decisions and get the most out of your unique benefits plan.  HealthJoy is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.

description: We are a B2B Niche organization, rapidly growing and expanding into local, regional, and national markets. We are a team-centric environment, with an adaptive model, and a strong work culture. Apart from adding to this team dynamic, we are looking for someone that can grow with us, and help us tell our story.  Key Responsibilities Prospecting for potential customers and selling the company’s services and value proposition. Researching the target market and finding companies to target (although we have a constant pipeline of leads and a massive database in our CRM). Attending meetings with potential customers and closing sales. Attend Networking Events to develop and cultivate new and existing relationships and  leads (Lunches, Golf Tournaments, Seminars, Gala's, and other networking events... provided current Covid conditions allow) Building a sales pipeline to ensure a constant stream of sales. Working to monthly sales and revenue targets as set by the sales manager. Progressing towards activity targets and KPI’s set by the sales manager. Entering and onboarding all required data for sales onto the company system. Utilization of Hubspot CRM and Sales Processes for Lead and Deal Tracking Following up on leads generated by other departments.  We need someone with the foundation, the desire, and the willingness to be a rock star. We believe in helping our Team members achieve their goals. We will foster the rest. We provide continuing Education/Sales Training through Sandler Training. Competitive compensation base + commission (Base is dependent on Candidate, which we know sounds like a cop-out, but we would rather find the right person for our team rather than a person that fits a certain range), cell phone allowance, health care benefits, paid time off, performance-based raises and or/bonuses. We also offer a work culture that does not have a case of the “Mondays”, and a team environment that fosters growth and hard work, with the underlying desire to enjoy what you do. Some travel (depending on current COVID Protocols) and hybrid work from home/office possible.

description: Description  Philips-Medisize is seeking a dynamic and proactive Global Account Manager with the primary objective of growing profitable Molex revenue. This position will be the primary interface between assigned accounts and Molex. Responsibilities include expanding Molex presence within assigned customer(s) by increasing the value Molex brings to their company. This position will be responsible for managing the relationships and full breadth of sales activity for the entire Molex portfolio of products to a high priority customer and market.  Our Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Attributes Excellent ability to strategize, develop, implement, communicate and evaluate processes and tools Leadership skills that demonstrate the ability to take charge, initiate actions, make sound decisions and direct others toward the accomplishment of goals Sales skills that demonstrate the ability to successfully negotiate and close a sales call Strong organization skills to anticipate, plan, organize and monitor workload Well-developed written, oral and interpersonal skills that demonstrate the ability to build rapport with both internal and external contacts Authoritative knowledge of the connector industry’s products, markets and sales channels This position is open to remote candidates  What You Will Do In Your Role  Global Growth Strategy Develop, define and execute a global engagement strategy, driving the implementation of growth opportunities at all global locations of a high-profile account; positioning Molex in a successful way that results in increased profitable revenues Provide direction and support to sales team members including both direct reports and indirect Sales Engineers, located at design sites and manufacturing locations, to effectively execute the strategic plan Establish Global Strategic Direction for Product and Application Development Understand and communicate industry and customer technology and business trends Maintain an open, two-way communication across Sales, BU, and MPS division in all geographic regions as to maximize the effectiveness of new product/technology introductions Coordinate and resolve account issues. Involve BU and divisional leadership as required if they are to impact the successful implementation of the account strategy Develops and implements strategic sales plans to meet established objectives. Works with internal Sales and Division partners to identify and penetrate target accounts/markets Global Communication & Relationships Build and maintain strong relationships with key individuals in all levels of the organization globally Understand and communicate key strategic sub-contractors, to GSM team members and Product Divisions to assure seamless applications of our strategy throughout the supply chain Promote the Advancement of the Corporate Culture Utilize sound economic models to determine projects selection Meet or exceed corporate profit objectives Ensure full compliance to all regulatory and policy guidelines within the team High degree of Customer Focus. Strive to create the highest value possible for our customer and society The Experience You Will Bring  Requirements Bachelor’s degree A minimum of 5 years successful sales experience Ability to travel up to 50%, both domestically and globally This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship What Will Put You Ahead Bachelor’s Degree in technical field (BSME, BSEE, BSIE, Industrial Technology, etc.) Medical market knowledge Previous supervisory experience Familiarity with Molex and Philips-Medisize manufacturing facilities and capabilities worldwide Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. description: Do you wish there were more innovative options in real estate investing?  At HomeRoom, we have pioneered one of the most innovative real estate investment vehicles in real estate which enable private investors to achieve returns that were previous unreachable for out of state investors.  It’s an exciting product that so far has sold itself through word of mouth and consistent referrals.   We’re now ready to bring in some incredible sales talent to accelerate our businesses growth.   The right person for this role will be an excellent prospector and lead qualifier. You’re mentally curious and who feels equally comfortable selling real estate investment products to sharp and high network individuals and real estate investment neophytes.   The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   Role  As a Sales Executive, you are a tenacious, hard-working problem solver with an optimistic attitude that can compellingly present HomeRoom's investor offering and rapidly qualify new business.  As a member of our Sales team, you will be responsible for reaching out to taking the initial call with validated sales leads (property investors) and deliver a tailored value pitch on how the HomeRoom model and technology consistently drives superior rental income compared to traditional single-family rentals.   Responsibilities  Qualify inbound leads, and present initial HomeRoom pitch deck  Score leads in our CRM and communicate hot and high-quality leads to our Sr Sales Executive  Follow up with qualified leads regarding their pre-approval letters  Set up 2nd meeting with Sr. Sales Executive once lead is fully qualified and their pre-approval letter has been received  In addition to excellent work with inbound leads – this role will actively prospect with a mixture of cold calling, emailing, and social selling to supplement the lead flow provided by the Marketing team  Achieve and exceed quarterly assigned sales quota within your targeted prospect accounts and sales territory.  Synthesize customer feedback for input into product development  Share and leverage your talents, and provide information and feedback to improve strategies, solutions and execution of the sales process  Maintain timely and detailed pipeline management, keeping sales pipeline up to date and accurate in our CRM  Minimum Qualifications  1+ years of experience in a consultative, B2B inside sales role  Polished presenter who can simply and collaboratively help a lead overcome objections  Demonstrated experience consistently exceeding target goals, hunting for deals, navigating organizational hierarchies and building long-term relationships  Comfortable making "the ask" and hearing "no"  Unsatisfied with successes, undaunted by failures  Eager to learn, get better all the time (you are coachable)  Desire to be a part of fast-paced, high energy, start-up experience  Interested in real estate and real estate investing   Preferred Qualifications  Real Estate investment experience  Early-stage startup sales experience

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - Detroit, MI - Craniomaxillofacial
description: Who We Want To Work With  You’re a sales professional at heart. You love engaging with customers and colleagues – wherever that might take you. Being responsible for other’s perception of a company’s brand and reputation excites you, as does the challenge of initiating and creatively prospecting new customer relationships – especially in healthcare environments. You enjoy building relationships and understand that collaboration is key to growing any business, especially in a complex and competitive industry. You’re an influencer that is driven to succeed and accountability is important to you. You seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions. You’re resilient and persistent and will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  At Stryker’s Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) Division You’ll work closely with experienced Sales Representatives and Managers to build your knowledge, skill and comfort with clinical and product knowledge as well as selling styles and techniques. They will serve as your coaches and mentors to share lessons learned for how to build and grow a successful business. You’ll receive training and be expected study and prepare independently to perform at the highest levels in the operating room, working amongst surgeons and healthcare professionals. The expectations are challenging, yet rewarding. You’ll represent Stryker as a leader in our industry and the marketplace. You’ll have the opportunity to identify and promote solutions and sell products that change our patient’s lives. You’ll collaborate with our team to build your own business one customer and account at a time. You’ll identify and prospect new customers as well as continually take care of existing customers. You’ll assist Sales Representatives in determining the necessary resources needed for our customers to achieve sales objectives and then execute the plan. These resources may include educational programs, product development initiatives, and sales strategies. You’ll foster a culture and environment that makes CMF destination for top performers and a place where people’s careers thrive. What You Need Highly organized and demonstrate ability to organize a busy schedule. Capacity to deal with competing priorities and potential to be adaptable as days change quickly. Demonstrated ability in building and maintaining relationships in the sales capacity. Must be comfortable in emergency and operating room environments. Prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals (including some weekends, and some overnight travel). Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services This would include marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques and sales control systems Comfortability with adapting to new technology and business advancements. Bachelor’s degree required Would need personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers. Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. “Smart, hardworking, and gets along well with others.” John Brown Our Values  Integrity  We do what’s right  Accountability  We do what we say  People  We grow talent  Performance  We deliver  Core Themes And Phrases About Our Workplace Our Culture - Win together as a team We are a team. We constantly challenge ourselves. We challenge each other. We want to achieve more. We win the right way. We care about each other. Growth - Own your career Our company is growing. You can grow with us. We help you discover your strengths. You can discover and follow your passion here. We are a career destination. The Work - Customers and patients are at the heart of everything we do We strive for the best. We improve lives. We go above and beyond. We are proud of our quality products. We are accountable for our work. e Our People - Passionately driven, remarkable results We are passionate. We are driven. We are focused. We deliver remarkable results. We expect to win. We act with purpose. We act with integrity. We do what we say.  Who we are  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  CMF Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/orthopaedics/craniomaxillofacial.html  #LIInstruments

description: ** PLEASE ATTACH RESUME ** Syneos Health® is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization. The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration.  Are you passionate about discovering, developing and bringing more innovative medicines to help patients? Idorsia’s purpose is to discover, develop and bring more innovative medicines to help patients. Idorsia is an independent biopharmaceutical company specializing in the development of small molecules to meet significant unmet medical needs. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus.  Job Description: Reporting to the Syneos Health District Manager (DM), the Specialty Sales Representative (SSR) role is responsible for building relationships with recognized experts, HCPs, and prioritized stakeholders in the therapeutic area and integrated health care systems.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required • Minimum 2+ years life science sales experience • Experience in psych / PCP / Sleep Disorders preferred • Experience in retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales • Identify and develop business relationships with targeted Health Care providers • Achieve quarterly and annual sales goals • Identify key influencers and achieve designated customer interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • Understand and address both business and scientific-oriented needs of healthcare professionals by engaging in meaningful dialog to determine underlying patient needs and determine how products could address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • Implement and execute in a compliant manner marketing and sales direction to achieve territory promotional objectives • Communicate effectively with peers and management • Effective in front of the customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain expense and promotional budgets for the territory within guidelines • Must operate within Compliance Guidelines at all times • Adherence to Policies, Process and Procedures  At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality of life balance.  Why Syneos Health? Our employees voted Syneos Health as the overall winner in MedReps’ Best Places To Work In Medical Sales Awards. Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)
industries: Pharmaceuticals
