description: Avery Products Corporation, the world’s leader in the label industry is hiring for an Inside Sales Representative for our fast growing Avery WePrint custom printing business. This Inside Sales representative will have the opportunity to help Avery drive strong revenue growth in the fast growing, Direct-to-Consumer label space.  The Inside Sales Representative will be responsible for identifying and qualifying new leads, meeting with prospects to better understand their business needs, and tailoring solutions for each customer. Ultimately, this role is responsible for bringing in new customers to Avery and creating successful long term customer relationships.  This role will focus in the Food & Beverage industry, so the ideal candidate will either have work experience in the industry and/or a passion for fresh and prepared foods, packaged foods, snacks, beverages and CPG brands. This role will be part of a smaller dynamic team within our larger organization. We are seeking someone who is self-driven with positive energy, a great team player, and a willingness to work in a fast paced environment. If you enjoy the “start up like feel” and being part of a great team, than Avery’s D2C business is right up your alley!  Primary Responsibilities Fuel the prospect lead pipeline for the Avery business and drive sales growth in the Food & Beverage industry. Lead the entire sales process from prospecting new leads, nurturing prospects to become new customers, and building successful long-term customer relationships Develop effective and creative ways to build prospect lists and develop qualified leads in the F&B Industry Nurture qualified leads and ask the right questions to better understand the prospects business needs and propose relevant product solutions. Help prospects achieve their desired result by sending out product samples, answering technical questions, providing pricing and cost quotes, and helping customers place orders. Follow up with new customers post-order to ensure a great customer experience and to discuss future needs. Grow revenue from existing customer accounts and nurture larger corporate accounts to win more business or spread thru their organization. Process Sales Orders: Take telephone sales, manage repeat business lists, and develop accounts Manage Production Timelines with Customers: Confirm lead times where necessary and inform customers throughout the production process to ensure orders are on time. Quality Control: Ensure orders are checked against our Ecommerce platform and check order and shipping status Meet monthly, quarterly, and annual “contact” targets (e.g. outbound emails, calls, samples sent, close rates) Meet monthly, quarterly and annual sales and revenue targets. Manage all customers within our CRM system including key account info, customer communication, tracking pipeline activity Provide regular and timeline tracking of sales and prospecting activity Participate in trade shows and industry events as needed. Identify key trends and insights that can help us better understand key vertical markets and grow our business Research and keep educated about current market trends, opportunities, and competition  Requirements/Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 2+ years' sales experience (lead generation, cold calling, inside sales etc.) Represent Avery in a professional manner Must be comfortable making outbound emails, outbound phone calls, securing in-person meetings, and delivering presentations Should be comfortable communicating through digital funnels (e.g. social media, email, text, FB group pages etc.) Should be good at researching, writing, and be persuasive in closing a deal. Able to work independently to manage and expand the customer base Experience working with CRM Proficient use of Microsoft Office products (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint) and comfortability with moderate data analysis. Entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment Consumer-first mindset Team player and extremely collaborative Self-starter and action oriented. Highly organized and can manage multiple ongoing projects and a cross-functional team. Positive energy and supportive of team members  Avery Products Corporation, is a wholly owned subsidiary of CCL Industries, is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of self-adhesive labels, labeling software, binders, dividers and other products. Founded in 1935, Avery has built a solid reputation as the trusted brand and leading resource for organization and identification solutions. Combining dynamic capabilities in technology with groundbreaking ideas, Avery offers innovative products to make life easier—at work, home, school, and small business. Avery also offers free software, design templates and mobile apps. The consumer can now access the Avery experience anywhere, anytime and create customized projects that are uniquely their own.  What we offer: Competitive Base Pay + Monthly Commission Program for great earning potential. Dynamic, energetic work environment with an exceptional talented workforce. Great comprehensive benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term & Long Term Disability, Company provided & paid life insurance Excellent 401K Retirement Plan with generous company match. Work Life Balance; 12 Company Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation and Paid Sick Time  All offers of employment are based on the successful completion of a pre-employment background check. Avery Products Corporation is an at-will employer. Employment is at will and, as such, are free to resign at any time without any reason. The company retains the right to terminate an employee’s employment at any time with or without reason or notice.   Thank you for your time and consideration of this opportunity. Please include resume when responding

description: Description  Philips-Medisize is seeking a dynamic and proactive Global Account Manager with the primary objective of growing profitable Molex revenue. This position will be the primary interface between assigned accounts and Molex. Responsibilities include expanding Molex presence within assigned customer(s) by increasing the value Molex brings to their company. This position will be responsible for managing the relationships and full breadth of sales activity for the entire Molex portfolio of products to a high priority customer and market.  Our Ideal Candidate Will Have The Following Attributes Excellent ability to strategize, develop, implement, communicate and evaluate processes and tools Leadership skills that demonstrate the ability to take charge, initiate actions, make sound decisions and direct others toward the accomplishment of goals Sales skills that demonstrate the ability to successfully negotiate and close a sales call Strong organization skills to anticipate, plan, organize and monitor workload Well-developed written, oral and interpersonal skills that demonstrate the ability to build rapport with both internal and external contacts Authoritative knowledge of the connector industry’s products, markets and sales channels This position is open to remote candidates  What You Will Do In Your Role  Global Growth Strategy Develop, define and execute a global engagement strategy, driving the implementation of growth opportunities at all global locations of a high-profile account; positioning Molex in a successful way that results in increased profitable revenues Provide direction and support to sales team members including both direct reports and indirect Sales Engineers, located at design sites and manufacturing locations, to effectively execute the strategic plan Establish Global Strategic Direction for Product and Application Development Understand and communicate industry and customer technology and business trends Maintain an open, two-way communication across Sales, BU, and MPS division in all geographic regions as to maximize the effectiveness of new product/technology introductions Coordinate and resolve account issues. Involve BU and divisional leadership as required if they are to impact the successful implementation of the account strategy Develops and implements strategic sales plans to meet established objectives. Works with internal Sales and Division partners to identify and penetrate target accounts/markets Global Communication & Relationships Build and maintain strong relationships with key individuals in all levels of the organization globally Understand and communicate key strategic sub-contractors, to GSM team members and Product Divisions to assure seamless applications of our strategy throughout the supply chain Promote the Advancement of the Corporate Culture Utilize sound economic models to determine projects selection Meet or exceed corporate profit objectives Ensure full compliance to all regulatory and policy guidelines within the team High degree of Customer Focus. Strive to create the highest value possible for our customer and society The Experience You Will Bring  Requirements Bachelor’s degree A minimum of 5 years successful sales experience Ability to travel up to 50%, both domestically and globally This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship What Will Put You Ahead Bachelor’s Degree in technical field (BSME, BSEE, BSIE, Industrial Technology, etc.) Medical market knowledge Previous supervisory experience Familiarity with Molex and Philips-Medisize manufacturing facilities and capabilities worldwide Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.  At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.  For this role, we anticipate paying $110k - $130k per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.  Equal Opportunity Employer.  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

description: Tricentis is looking for an enthusiastic and strategic Business Development Representative (BDR), to join our growing Marketing team. As a BDR at Tricentis, you get the opportunity to lead the initial outreach to targeted (Commercial or Enterprise) accounts working in conjunction with the Field and Digital Marketing teams. In this role you will leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas and roles to introduce Tricentis’ value. You will be responsible for generating qualified meetings and opportunities for the Tricentis’ Sales organization.  Key Responsibilities:  Effectively manage inbound lead flow as well as executing outbound prospecting initiatives Conduct high-level discovery conversations in target accounts Meet or exceed BDR sourced Opportunity volume targets Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts Work to have a variety of touches (call, email, social, etc.) on all leads in your assigned territory Manage, track, and report on all activities and results using Salesforce Work in collaboration with Field and Corporate Marketing to drive attendance at regional marketing events Act as a mentor for new BDR hires in helping them navigate their key accounts Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts  Qualifications  Bachelors Degree is required or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 2+ years work experience in a professional environment Excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally with sales and different marketing departments. You'll have exposure to different departments like Sales, Marketing, Finance, Recruiting, Enablement, Engineering, etc. which will help you determine your career path at Tricentis. Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills A self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievements Knowledge of business process, roles, and organizational structure Determined personality with a desire to grow and win Passionate about being a part of Tricentis’ journey Proficient in using Salesforce and Salesloft (or similar products) Previous tech industry experience or experience in sales development, marketing and/or sales is a plus Outbound prospecting experience is a plus Globally we require excellent written and spoken English which is our company language  Additional Information  We offer:  Paid Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance  Paid Disability & Life Insurance  Paid Vacation & Holidays  Paid volunteer days  401K  Diversity programs  Maternity leave  If you are interested in the opportunity to become a member of Tricentis where your ideas count, apply now for immediate consideration.  Tricentis is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran.

jobTitle: Executive Professional Sales Representative, Respiratory – Huntsville, AL
description: 1343 Mylan Specialty L.P.  At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.  Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.  We Do So Via Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance; Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services. Key Responsibilities For This Role Include  Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Executive Professional Sales Representative, Respiratory – Huntsville, AL role will make an impact: Develops business plan for assigned territory that is consistent with Viatris’s sales plans, strategies and objectives. Conducts quality sales presentations to all targeted customers. Achieve quarterly sales goals within territory while adhering to all ethical sales practices and required regulations. Understands and demonstrates targeting principles. Develops pre-call planning strategy for key targets. Develops positive and interactive relationships with peers, customers, and Company managers. Responsible for ensuring high levels of call and field productivity. Gathers and utilizes information from offices, pharmacists and others to develop and implement specific strategies for territory prescribers. Leverages sample program, literature and other items to ensure physician awareness of Viatris Products. Differentiates products from all competitors and responds to customer issues confidentially and appropriately. Actively pursue continuous learning and professional development on efficient sales, communication & product knowledge training. The Minimum Qualifications For This Role Are Bachelor's degree required. A minimum of 11 years of pharmaceutical sales experience. Documented history of successful performance. Demonstrated success in influence and negotiation skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Strong verbal, interpersonal and listening skills. Demonstrated leadership. Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a team member to deliver results. Demonstrated self-starter and highly motivated. Ability to learn, apply and communicate products and disease states over time. Proficiency in Excel, Word and Outlook. Ability to travel. Must live within geography of responsibility or within reasonable driving distance; no relocation offered. Valid Driver’s License and acceptable driving record. Proficiency in speaking, comprehending, reading and writing English is required. At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.  Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations.

description: Are you looking to break into Medical Sales and have a strong business to business sales background? We are currently working with a world renown Medical Device Manufacturer who is hiring multiple Associate Reps in the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic  APPLY TODAY. Opportunities available in the below territories -  OPPORTUNITIES IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS/STATES  Baltimore, MD Pennsylvania PA, DE North New Jersey Richmond, VA   Associate Medical Sales Rep Responsible for supporting the accomplishment of company, region, and district goals within a territory, including gross sales, quota goals, profits, inventory, expenses, and overall company mission. Work within one or more territories to develop sales relationships and provide monthly summaries of customer activity and goals progress to the District Manager. Consult with the customers to provide answers to all questions regarding use of products. Be able to in-service, maintain, restock, and sell all products in the current product portfolio  MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES & ACTIVITIES Medical Sales Rep  Use professional verbal and written communication skills to explain technical product information to customers, salespeople, and employees. Provide in-services, sales presentations, and answers to all questions on all products Educate customers in the function, use, and maintenance/restock of all products, including software and online collaboration with individual patient solutions Deliver sales presentations to update customers on all products and services Organize and run professional educational events including hands-on workshops with all products Plan and run online and on-site meetings with customers and sales teams using internet based online meeting software or digital projection hardware Provide pricing to customers within the policy of the company and provide local knowledge for negotiation of price contracts with the Contract Team and Sales Management Stay current on, and cross reference competitive product offering and pricing Ensure the efficiency of territory inventory through organization and communication with field inventory support teams in customer service and the warehouse Be able to generate and process a Quote, Bill Only, Consignment, and field inventory or customer returns Package, ship and handle products between the office or other field locations, including hazardous materials Retrieval and interpretation of documents, knowledge of the Quality Policy & Safety Program, report product complaints and adverse events, understand and follow off indication regulations Understand government regulations and company policy on customer expense related activities Complete Hospital Credentialing where necessary to perform essential duties Performs other related duties as assigned  Travel is 35-50% (approximately 8-10 nights per month). Occasional Nights and Weekends due to covering Trauma cases   Sales Function: Meet or exceed annual revenue target expectation Actively maintain and proactively manage an assigned top account list Build a high yielding business base to top accounts by offering technical training, high product knowledge, and service. Sell all products sold, including functional foot orthotics, Custom AFOs, Diabetic and Orthopedic Footwear, Custom Diabetic Inserts, Prefab orthotics, socks, compression hosiery and other items as well as Technology relevant to the growth of business (2D/3D Scanners). Sales Presence at relevant Seminars/Webinars/Tradeshows and internal sales meetings Communicate to Regional Sales Director all critical information relevant in real time in SalesForce CRM Update manager weekly on call schedule and Sales funnel status using SalesForce CRM Participate in Weekly Conference Calls.    MINIMUM POSITION REQUIREMENTS: University Degree 2-5+ years of demonstrated success in a sales position Experience with consultative selling within medical accounts Superior oral and written business communication skills Strong time-management and organization skills Creative problem solver Strong self-motivator and Team player Intermediate Microsoft Office, Sale force and computer skills Reliability and honesty Access to reliable internet Ability to travel and Reliable transportation Must have Covid-19 vaccinate to access hospitals per credentialing requirements

description: We are currently seeking Sales and Marketing Professionals, to assist with current business needs and help secure new business. It's a huge plus if you're enthusiastic about technology, hard-working, and very entrepreneurial-minded. Your primary responsibilities are identifying qualified prospects, demonstrating the capabilities, and bringing deals to closure. You must be able to establish strong relationships with clients through emails, phone calls, and meetings. You must also: - Skilled in executing sales campaigns by qualifying leads and moving them towards opportunity, facilitating client needs discussions, providing product demonstrations, and closing sales, using a consultative selling approach.  - Generate and qualify leads to supplement those supplied by the business - Manage a "nurture funnel" using company-provided tools - Understand and implement our structured prospecting strategy and process - Demonstrate our product for qualified prospects - Develop new leads through email, cold calling, and networking with key decision-makers in the organization. - Dynamically demonstrates SaaS software to customers and prospects - Meet Consistently achieve monthly sales quota and key performance metrics. - Maintain and build personal, fruitful relationships with our clients. - Participate in trade shows and conferences as required. - Work with our CRM to manage all contacts and leads.  This position requires strong communication skills, a person who is highly motivated and a self-starter with a high sense of urgency, and a strong desire to be the best. Excellent organization skills, with an emphasis on maintaining detailed documentation.  We have a fun team and we're energized by the consulting industry across the country, and attracting the very best candidates in the marketplace. If this position sounds like something you'd enjoy, apply! The SM/ BDM, IT, Cold Calling, business development, sales, account management, cold calling, qualifying)

description: Want to help the world’s biggest companies solve their biggest technology challenges? At CDM Media, that’s what we do, by bringing the brightest minds in technology together to discuss, create, and problem-solve the next wave of innovations and incredible technologies that will change the way companies do business.  Technology is rapidly changing not only the tech sector but every industry globally. Light bulbs are now “smart”. Banking is done on phones and watches. Your laundry detergent can reorder itself. Seem like magic? It’s not. It’s technology, and the world’s biggest companies are all reimaging themselves as technology companies to keep pace. CDM Media sits at the intersection of the technology executives and the technology solution providers who work together to make “magic” into reality.  Our live events/summits, virtual gatherings, digital marketing services, VIP dinners, and other custom marketing services let C-Level executives cut through the noise and get down to business. If you want to be a part of the fastest-growing sector of the global economy, on the cutting edge of the next wave of game-changing technologies, and spend your days speaking to the most successful and brilliant executives in their fields, you've come to the right place.  The Role  You will be working directly with our Sales Director and SVP Sales to drive the direction and growth of your portfolio of clients. You’ll spend your time creating sponsorship opportunities and growing relationships with the movers and shakers of some of the biggest companies in the world such as IBM, Oracle, Salesforce, Google, Amazon.  We need people that are fired-up about creating high-end qualified sales opportunities, and constantly on the hunt for ways to improve themselves and the team around them. If you’re ready to get after it, we want to talk to you ASAP.  Responsibilities  Drive sales growth by finding and engaging qualified prospects via LinkedIn, phone, email and an array of technology tools  Connect with and quickly develop relationships with key Senior Management contacts and prospects within the technology vendor space  Collaborate with marketing and sales on lead quality and conversion  Perfect and articulate CDM’s Value Proposition  Build a pipeline and execute on early stages of the sales process  Create and prioritize strategic target account lists  Use various sales tools and methods to identify decision makers within the target account lists  Achieve and dominate your quotas  Outbound ZOOM demo calls along with running targeted email campaigns  Requirements  You have business development, account management, professional sales development experience  You have real determination and grit to make opportunities a reality  You have or want experience with prospecting and cold calling  You have clear written/verbal communication skills  You have strong presentation skills and are confident, both on the phone and in person  You are motivated and goal oriented with a self-starting attitude  You can work in a fast paced, team environment  You have good time management with strong organizational skills  You want to build a successful sales career  You know and understand that failure is a part of every success  SalesForce experience is a plus  CDM Media Offers You  Competitive salary + Commission  Health/dental insurance  Up to 25 days paid personal vacation each year  401(k) plan  Summer holiday hours  Life and disability insurance for all staff  We welcome you to learn more about CDM Media at the following links:  About: http://www.cdmmedia.com/about.php  CDM Media in three words: https://youtu.be/z5Bs5iLo_ig  Summits & client testimonials: http://www.youtube.com/user/ciosummits  Travel with CDM Media: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hLjPvfgK2TE  CDM Media culture: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wtsEAkp_noQ&feature=youtu.be  CDM Media is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. CDM Media is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

description: Our client is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. They are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine.  Position: Trauma Device Sales Associate (Pasadena, CA & Thousand Oaks, CA)  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Committed, loyal and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. Honest people who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Organized self-starters. Salespeople who create and maintain precise inventory control to ensure they can initiate the implementation of a solution with the proper product or tool. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do You will get exposure to the proven winning Trauma culture that delivers Industry leading results in all market segments You will receive best-in-class formal Trauma training on product portfolio and selling skills which includes on-the-job training in the operating room. You’ll become an expert on surgical procedures by observing well-over 300 cases in your first year You will develop well-rounded field exposure to prepare you in all aspects of the selling/ servicing process when a territory opportunity arises You will develop a high level of competency in Orthopedic surgical needs and procedures becoming a valuable member of the surgical team and positively impacting surgical outcomes You will build a strong brand in account management and client service - key drivers in our business! You will work in a highly competitive and challenging work environment that will put your best talents to work every single day What You Need To be successful in this role bring your strong multitasking ability, ability to read and sell to any audience, drive to achieve and succeed, aptitude to learn medical and technical information quickly, ability to build strong, lasting relationships, a strong work-ethic and a competitive nature Bachelor’s Degree required 1+ years of sales experience preferred Come ready to make a difference…fast! What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Coworkers committed to achieving more and winning the right way Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

description: Sales Development Representative (SDR) Progression to Account Executive 6-9 months Salary: $55,000 (Y1 OTE $90,000)  GDS Group is a global project intelligence organization, with 420+ employees across Europe and the US dedicated to helping the world’s largest enterprises meet the challenges posed by a fast-moving, digitally disruptive business environment.  Over the past 5 years, we’ve partnered with 95% of the Fortune 2000 and our solution provider clients include; Google, Microsoft, Oracle, IBM, AWS, Dell EMC, HPE and SAP to name a few.  COMPANY HIGHTLIGHTS  Extensive sales training - member of The Association of Professional Sales We are on track to exceed 100%+ growth in 2021 Exceptional career progression - we’re a true meritocracy, fast growing and ever evolving Uncapped earning potential across all sales roles We've increased headcount from 350 to 420 globally in the past 9 months Winner of Best Digital Event Production Company in 2021 Winner of three Business Brilliance Awards in 2020  With market-leading platforms, new products in production, a superb sales training (ValueSelling) program, and a rewarding commission scheme, we are perfectly positioned to offer swift career path progression and exciting earning potential to sales/ business development representatives who show a commitment to obtaining and evolving the right skill sets.  Sales Development Representative - Role As part of our global business function, you will work side by side a senior AE, generating their sale pipeline by actively seeking out new business opportunities within your vertical through extensive research and high-level conversations. You will be able to quickly research a company, see opportunities, and strategize an approach to build interest, securing meetings with senior decision makers. You will conduct extensive market research daily, using enterprise project overviews combined with a variety of lead generating techniques to identify prospect organizations within your specialist technology vertical. You will set up high-quality meetings for our senior AEs by means of proactive, personalized, optimized outbound telephone, LinkedIn messaging and email-based prospecting Securing meetings with C-Suite and SVP level executives only, all the while mastering and utilizing the Value Selling methodology in order to advance to Account Executive   Sales Development Representative - Requirements Stellar written and verbal communication skills Exceptional organizational and time management skills Inquisitive nature and strong research skills  Proven track record of achievement - either educational or professional A self-starter with a desire to grow a career in corporate sales  It’s well known that firms with greater gender diversity among senior leadership perform better. GDS Group is proud to be in that category!  Research shows that while men apply for sales jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other underrepresented individuals tend to only apply when they check every box. So, if you think you have what it takes but don't necessarily meet every single point listed below, please apply - you could be exactly whom we are looking for!  To help promote and ensure the safety of all of our employees, customers, and business partners we require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination, which will be kept confidential. If you are not vaccinated, or partially vaccinated currently, but willing to become fully vaccinated, we invite you to still apply.  GDS Inc. is committed to providing a safe and inclusive work environment for all and we recognize that some individuals may have a sincerely held religious belief as it pertains to the practice of immunization or a medical  condition which may prevent them from becoming vaccinated. Individuals who cannot be fully vaccinated due to a sincerely held religious belief or medical  condition may request an accommodation in accordance with the Company’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccine Policy. We request that you refrain from discussing religious beliefs or medical conditions during the interview process. If you believe you need an accommodation, please submit your request to accomodations@gdsgroup.com. All requests for accommodation will remain confidential and reviewed by selected GDS senior leaders. We cannot guarantee that all requests for accommodation will be granted.

description: Who Are We?  Here at Arrow we have built an all-in-one platform that makes it easier and smoother for the salesperson to get their job done and allows them to have the option to close deals over their phone.  There is a shift in the mindset of the heavy equipment industry (an  acceptance and intrigue) around technology and how it should be helping them to close deals more efficiently, whilst also being an enjoyable process and we are confident that Arrow is the new way to close deals!  Arrow is seeking an ELITE  Business Development Professional to join our fast growing team!  This is an opportunity to join a fast growing tech business who puts Brand + Product first.  Together, we will grow with our innovative software that provides a fun and better way to sell BIG products for our customers, globally.  Responsibilities:  Contact potential customers currently in Arrow’s database to present demos of the platform. Manage and set up the onboarding process for new customers.  Manage and develop existing customer/partner relationships within Arrow’s database to create a positive experience and drive opportunities for increased business. Source prospective sales leads and clients through referrals, networking, social media, internet research, and direct contact. Continuously expand client base through new business development. Updating and maintaining customer/partner information within Arrow’s platform. Develop and maintain strategic relationships (alliance management) with customers through in-person meetings, site visits and virtual meetings.  Highlights:  Work from anywhere in the world (not exaggerating). Great benefits. Competitive Base Salary On Day 1 (we are investing in you). Year 1 On Target Earnings of ~$100k (including a 3 month ramp).   Year 2 On Target Earnings of ~150k. Top performers will earn $300k+. No caps. Targeted leads provided.  The "Best Fit" Person Will:  Be in their second sales job (or 3+ years of experience selling). Have a growth oriented mindset focused on achieving and growing. Be curious about the operational side of the business (to ensure a smooth setup process for their customers). Have an entrepreneurial and competitive mindset with a focus on ROI. You think about the resources available and the way to maximize them. Enjoy Social Media.  We care a lot about “Who” our employees really are.  We want to find people who want to Create value for themselves and our customers, Grow personally, and Enjoy playfully building along the way.   Arrow is a game changer.  Purpose & People of Arrow  Core Purpose To build an essential and sustainable living, breathing organization. We build tools to help people live more impactfully by unlocking their potential. We thrive on challenges that start with: “I’m not sure if this is possible, but I wish I could…” We are uniquely positioned to design and build user-focused products, we seek direct feedback from clients, and we deliver data-driven improvements to solve complex problems in a repeatable and scalable way. We believe that getting more done with less effort allows you to invest more time doing more of what you enjoy in life.  The People of Arrow... Want our products to have a meaningful impact. Believe all activities should deliver an optimal return on our collective efforts. Are ruthlessly efficient and constantly reprioritized. Assume good intentions. We will be kind and painfully honest. Write out ideas, strategies and plans to be read by and debated on their merit. Always reverse engineer the clearly defined definition of success. Identify the “right long-term path” but ride momentum. Expect best in the world outcomes. Only play where we have a comparative advantage to win. Have autonomy and control over your calendar. Believe that design and an intuitive customer experience are a competitive advantage. Are ok making mistakes, just not the same mistake twice. Work smart...then hard. Understand that the workload will be uneven. Question leadership until you understand and clarify priorities. Understand small groups are better at solving hard problems than large groups. Understand this business will change, the goal of value creation will not. Don’t borrow from tomorrow, as it will always leave you broke today. Understand what you do is your brand, if your name is on it, be proud of the work you have done or the work isn’t done yet. Don't pre-solve future problems (focus on first-order problems). Understand inputs drive outputs…focus on the small steps to create value. Are comfortable being uncomfortable, stretch yourself in the goal of value creation.  Arrow provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

jobTitle: Healthcare Recruitment/Sales - Top 50 Best Places to Work in the U.S.
description: At Host Healthcare, our focus is on building an incredible place to work both for our internal team members and our healthcare professionals. With a culture focused on individual growth and teamwork combined with leading pay and benefits, Host Healthcare is one of the top organizations in San Diego for motivated sales professionals.  Our recruiters are an integral part of our sales team and essential in delivering top talent to our clients. Successful recruiters are high-energy sales professionals with an internal drive for success and growth. Our company recruits registered nurses and therapy professionals (physical therapists, occupational therapists, speech therapists) for contract assignments ("travel assignments") at healthcare facilities nationwide. Our healthcare recruiters sell the travel healthcare field, close deals with healthcare professionals, and guide healthcare professionals through every step of the hiring process.  This position is ideal for a motivated recent college graduate with a desire to start a sales career, or an experienced sales professional looking for an exciting new career opportunity. With our uncapped bonus structure, successful healthcare recruiters earn $120k+ per year going forward after their first year of ramp up.  Please visit our website for more information and send your resume to us directly to ensure that your resume receives a careful review (https://www.hosthealthcare.com/careers/).  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Develop and maintain relationships with healthcare professionals over the phone and internet. Pre-screen and evaluate potential candidates to determine if they are qualified for our positions and serious about working with us. Submit healthcare professionals to positions at our client’s sites. Negotiate compensation packages with healthcare professionals to maximize profit and margin. Provide a high level of customer service to your current healthcare travelers on assignment.  Qualifications: Highly energetic, self-motivated, and goal oriented. Dedication and enthusiasm for sales. Fearless and competitive sales attitude. Excellent communication skills with strong phone presence. Willingness to make many phone calls. Ability to articulate and sell an intangible concept/experience. Proven interpersonal, negotiation, and organizational abilities. Willingness to hold oneself accountable for achieving high levels of individual and organizational performance.  Personal and Professional Competencies: The successful candidate is intelligent, self-confident, influential, and effective when interacting with others. "Roll up their sleeves" type of individual who does whatever it takes to get the job done in an entrepreneurial environment. Strong written and verbal skill. Equally strong listening skills. Proficiencies in all Microsoft Office products. Exhibits assertiveness, inspiration, strong perception, and insight. Willingness to hold oneself accountable for achieving high levels of individual and organizational performance. Unquestionable business and personal integrity, discretion, and judgment. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships across the organization.   Education: 4 Year degree strongly preferred.  Compensation and Benefits: Compensation includes a base salary and a bonus structure based on performance. During their first year, healthcare recruiters typically earn approximately $70k. Successful healthcare recruiters earn $120k+ per year going forward after their first year of ramp up. Two weeks PTO for first year, three weeks PTO after first year. Seven Company-paid holidays. Option to enroll in company health insurance. 401k plan with Company matching.  Other Host Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Host Healthcare may require applicants to undergo a drug screen and/or background check as a condition of employment. References will be required. Please note that this is a sales position, not a human resources position. Please apply only if you currently live in San Diego or are planning on relocating in the near future.

description: We're looking for an entrepreneurial Account Executive to drive early customer adoption.  This is a rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a well-funded AI startup. We’re making our first hires to build our sales function. Offers come with substantial equity grants and our culture is built around shared wins, so success drives large career, financial, and personal growth.  As an Account Executive at Akkio, you’ll be leading the charge on making AI accessible to everyone, not just data scientists. You’ll meet and build empathy with both technical and business-focused executives to identify problems that can be solved by machine learning and demonstrate how life with Akkio means more insight, automation, and capacity for their teams.  This role reports to the VP of Growth and will play a strategic role in developing our customer community.  Responsibilities  Manage and grow a pipeline of both net-new opportunities based on assigned territory - from strategic planning and CRM execution Quarterback the sales process both internally and externally. Orchestrate technical and business stakeholders through proofs-of-concepts, and secure deals. Deeply understand our customers’ journeys, key objections and articulate the business impact of life with Akkio through presentations, demos, and offline engagements. Tailor engagements, messaging, and assets to fit customer pain points and needs. Collaborate with Marketing & Product to provide market insights Work with Customer Success to ensure customer fit including use case value and feasibility assessment.  Requirements  3-7 years in B2B software sales with previous startup experience Experience selling emerging technologies, winning new logos, and building territories Experience selling or expertise in data, analytics, data science, BI, AI/ML Adaptive communicator - ability to demonstrate credibility to technical buyers (foundational knowledge of data, integrations, and analytics) and articulate value to business stakeholders Athleticism to understand business applications across multiple verticals Trained in solution/value selling methodologies Comfortable testing, learning, and evangelizing ideas and messaging across GTM teams ‍ Our Mission  The promise of the AI Revolution is to tackle numerous, intractable problems across business, healthcare, science, education, government, transportation, and logistics to name just a few. But so far, the benefits have been seen only by the few organizations with the resources to support data-science and machine learning teams. Akkio makes it so that everyone has access to the same state-of-the-art AI capabilities, formerly only available to the largest corporations and most well funded research groups. We do this because we believe that AI is the future, and the future belongs to everyone.  ‍Apply now at: https://www.akkio.com/jobs  To all recruitment agencies: Akkio does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias or Akkio employees. Akkio is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.  All team members have the option to work remotely. The Cambridge office is open for collaborative sessions but team members are required to wear masks indoors.

We are looking for teammates who are engaging, whose smile comes through loud and clear over the phone or via email, who understands the workplace is your second home and wants to contribute to the positivity and collaboration and who deep down in their bones really feels the customer is always right… Are we describing you?  ARRI INC, world renowned distributor of Premier Professional Motion Picture Camera and Lighting equipment is looking for Account Sales Representatives (ASR’S) (CUSTOMER RELATIONS). We have 1 permanent, hybrid, non-management, role open right now in our Burbank, CA location. We have 100 plus years of skill, expertise, and drive behind our name and pride in our standing within the entertainment industry, we need a stellar ASR’s to support us.  Your mission (should you choose to accept it) is to create an insanely great customer experience by helping people complete a sale and doing everything possible to keep them as happy customers! You’re literally the voice of the brand, and a strong relationship between our clients and their customers starts with you and the rest of the ASR team. So only the awesome need apply!  These critical roles within our group will do the following: Connect with existing and potential customers and aim to turn every call into a sales opportunity Handles various incoming and outgoing sales-focused phone calls and emails Process quotes/sales orders & responding to customer technical questions and inquiries in a timely manner Resolve customer questions, complaints, and billing inquiries in a professional, helpful manner Promotes and sells customer products and services by emphasizing product features based on customer’s needs Utilizes computer system to verify and document customer requests  We prefer an Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree. A minimum of 3 years relevant work experience in a Customer Service environment preferably in a technical field, optimally in the world of Camera and Lighting equipment, proficiency in Microsoft 360 especially: Word, Outlook, Excel, and Teams. Experience working in SAP or a similar ERP platform strongly preferred. The ability to communicate in a manner which exudes confidence, friendliness, and competence is necessary in this role.   If you are someone who possesses these skills, if you thrive in high demand environments, and satisfying the needs of others rules your soul, please seek us out. We offer a comprehensive benefit plan including vacation, personal and sick leave, 401k and profit-sharing plan, wellness program, medical, dental, vision, employee assistance, and flexible spending. Salary is dependent upon experience and skill set.  ARRI requires all new employees working in its facilities or interacting with other employees or others persons to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and new employees must provide proof they are fully vaccinated prior to the first day of employment. Individuals may seek a medical or a religious exemption to the vaccination requirement.  Are we describing you? We sure hope so… In order to be considered you must include your salary requirement. ARRI Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Our products are Innovative, our customer service Legendary and our staff Dedicated.  EMPOWERING CONTENT CREATORS WITH SUPERIOR SERVICE AND TOOLS!

description: About the Company:  At Ledge Lounger, we believe outdoor living inspires life’s most meaningful moments. When you join the team at Ledge, you’ll be an integral part of bringing those special moments to our valued customers and clients. Even though we’re growing fast – we’ve been honored for the 5th consecutive year on the Inc 5000 list of fastest growing companies in America – we keep our company culture and core values at the center of everything we do. We’re looking for loyal, ethical, graceful, and driven team members who constantly evolve to join our team at our brand new 80,000 sq foot headquarters in Houston, Texas.   Why Work at Ledge?!  It is with great honor that we share our newly acquired award: Best Places to Work in Houston, 2021.  This award is delivered based on employee feedback collected by Houston Business Journal, covering the topics of: goals and leadership, communication and support, advancement opportunity and skill development, recognition and compensation, tolerance and flexibility, and embracing innovation and ideas.  Ledge’s biggest benefit to our employees is being part of a low-ego, high-performing team that’s transforming the outdoor design industry.  We are constantly on the lookout for people who want to be a part of a contemporary startup culture; and, what gets us out of bed is working with talented people on a mission that matters!  Your Story: You listen; You seek feedback;  You utilize social media to gauge interest; You are quick to respond; You know how to add value; You have conversations, not sales pitches; You are genuine; You make your teams jobs easier; You are patient; You maintain your relationships.  Requirements:  College degree from an accredited school required 2+ years of furniture industry experience Bilingual in Spanish/English a plus Extenuate high energy Comfortable working on a team Proven ability to drive for results Relentless in the pursuit of exceeding goals and setting higher standards Proven experience in cold calling, property visits, executing and presenting online Experience facilitating presentations in person and virtually Accepting of feedback and quick to make changes necessary for success Exceptional communication and collaboration skills Breadth of knowledge on sales best practices Understand goals and recommend new approaches and/or process for continuous improvement Enthusiastically embrace a high-volume workload, managing multiple tasks and priorities in a “roll up your sleeves” environment Ability to work effectively in a rapidly evolving environment Ability to develop relationships as a trusted advisor and coach High degree of business acumen; must understand the fundamentals of business sales Enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills Will be required to lift 10 lbs with ease Some standing, moving, climbing, bending, kneeling, and handling is required  Responsibilities:  Cultivate long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients/customers Cold call in the field and over the phone to acquire new business Ensure you are meeting monthly and yearly sales objectives Conduct sales presentations, and facilitate conference calls Attend trade shows to promote furniture lines and acquire new business Participates in staff meetings and attends other meetings and seminars as needed Performs other work-related tasks as assigned.  Benefits:  This full-time role offers a competitive compensation package, ten (10) + days of personal time off, ten (10) paid Company holidays, and eligibility for medical, dental, and/or vision coverage; which also includes access to a healthcare concierge service and free virtual visits.  TO BE CONSIDERED:  Complete the mandatory Cultural Index Survey to be considered for these positions (copy/paste link in separate browser): https://go.apply.ci/p/67aKM7ubRkbkkXn5L84N  Commitment to Diversity and Equal Employment Opportunity:  Ledge Lounger is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating a work environment where all employees can find their drive. To do that, we champion a workplace where every person is treated with dignity and respect and is valued for their unique perspective and contributions. Our values of LEDGE: Loyalty, Ethics, Drive, Grace, and Evolve, are only possible in an environment where every individual has the ability to bring their whole selves to work and contribute fully.  Ledge Lounger’s policy is to maintain a working environment that encourages mutual respect, promotes harmonious and congenial relationships between employees and is free from all forms of discrimination and harassment of any employee (or applicant for employment or service provider) by anyone, including supervisors, co-workers, vendors, or clients. Harassment and discrimination in any manner or form is expressly prohibited. There is no tolerance for discrimination or unequal treatment of any kind on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, sexual and reproductive health decisions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or civil partnership/union status, familial status, military or veteran status, predisposition or carrier status, domestic violence victim status, alienage or citizenship status, unemployment status, sexual violence or stalking victim status, caregiver status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  This practice applies to all terms, conditions and privileges of employment including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, promotion, demotion, transfer, layoff, rehire, termination of employment, development and training, compensation, benefits and retirement.

ARC Group Worldwide, Inc. is Hiring! Our Longmont CO facility is looking for a Business Development Manager with deep experience in Aerospace. Thorough knowledge of Metal and Plastic injection molding processes, technical applications and relevant industries are required. The position will target leading global customers. Industry focus is in the Aerospace. Experience in Aerospace Industry is required.  BDM JOB SPEC:   ARC Group Worldwide is a leading global advanced manufacturer. The company provides customers a compelling portfolio of advanced manufacturing technologies and cutting edge engineering capabilities that dramatically improve the efficiency of traditional manufacturing processes, reduce costs and accelerate time to market.   As a Business Development Manager (BDM) you will be responsible for identifying and developing prospective customers and for their maintenance and support. This includes support and growth of existing ARC accounts. As a BDM at ARC Group you will work collaboratively across the ARC sales, engineering, production, new product development and customer support groups. This position primarily supports our Firestone, CO facility but also includes our FL and Hungarian facilities. The position is located in Firestone, CO.  The BDM is responsible for: - Creating and executing a sales plan that drives against corporate sales objectives. - Developing, building and maintaining relationships with potential and existing Aerospace customers, key decision makers and critical customer teams (engineering, purchasing, product management, finance, etc.) - Managing a portfolio of existing clients to maintain and grow relationships and expand business opportunities - Targeting new customer opportunities and expanding key vertical industry categories - Securing new project opportunities and receiving confirmed sales orders - Work closely with new product development managers and facilitate communication between customers and ARC teams (program managers, engineers and material experts) to help ensure smooth relationships and program progress. - Attend and participate in regularly scheduled sales meetings and prepare regular sales status reports of ongoing business activities - Works to develop competitive quotes with production, finance and engineering teams - Collaborate with Customer Support Team to fully support customer programs, purchase orders and unique customer needs/requests - Assists in the development of short and long range sales forecasts  Candidate should be: - Highly energetic  - Exceptionally organized - Personally and professionally motivated without need for regular, direct oversight - Honest and have a positive "can do" attitude with proven independent problem solving capabilities - A team player, with high level of dedication to "get the job done" - Strong sales narrative with excellent verbal and written communications and presentation skills - Ability to obtain information, build relationships, qualify and close a customer sale - A leadership mentality mixed with a fun, collaborative work style - Ability and willingness to travel to customer sites by air and auto - Hold proven experience as a sales/business development professional in injection molding manufacturing & technology or other related/relevant field. - Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, liberal arts, engineering or technical background highly preferred Aerospace Industry sales experience is required. Only qualified candidates will be considered.   Compensation based on competitive salary.  Position to be based in Firestone, Colorado.  Please submit resume to Shannon McKinney, HR Manager at smckinney@arcw.com

By Salons.” Aura believes in providing top-notch customer service and the most innovative salon software in the industry. POSITION SUMMARY  The Tanteo Spirits Company is looking for an ambitious New Jersey based Mid-Atlantic Market Manager to grow the Tanteo Tequila brand in the Mid-Atlantic (DC, DE, MD, and NJ). The Market Manager’s primary responsibility will be to directly open and develop on and off-premise accounts, with a primary focus on New Jersey and the major metro areas in the territory. Daily account management activities include but are not limited to distributor collaboration, distributor work-withs, securing menu placements, conducting brand training sessions, planning and hosting promotional events, and consumer samplings. This position will report to our New York Based VP of Sales East.  REQUIREMENTS FOR CONSIDERATION  At least 2-3 years of on- and off-premise beverage sales, marketing, or promotional experience 4-year bachelor’s degree Valid driver’s license and clean driving record Willingness to work full-time, non-traditional, late-night hours as required Ability to manage and track budgets Demonstrated computer, communication, and presentation skills Strong relationships in the local restaurant scene A magnetic personality that complements the Tanteo Team  CORE COMPETENCIES  Ability to work independently, set priorities, and manage time effectively Passionate about the beverage industry and the Tanteo brand Ability to translate strategy into action and make things happen Team player who leads by example The mental fortitude to survive the startup environment Solid relationships with beverage decision-makers at major local on-and off-premise accounts    COMPENSATION:  Commensurate with experience: T&E, Car allowance, Cell Phone, and a generous health care package.   About Tanteo Tequila: Tanteo® Tequila is the original 100% agave spicy tequila, crafted to make the perfect Spicy and classic Margaritas. With a higher proof blanco, spicy Jalapeño, smoky Chipotle, and extra spicy Habanero expressions, Tanteo is distilled, infused, and bottled by the cooperative of agave growers of Juanacatlan. The result is an award-winning artisanal product that is anything but ordinary. Tanteo was launched in January 2009 by Tanteo Spirits Company in New York City and is available in bars, restaurants, and spirits shops across the United States.

Business Development Representative Location: US-All Locations-Remote  Who We Are ComplySci is a SaaS company forging the future of RegTech (regulatory technologies). Our global governance, risk management and compliance (GRC) solutions helps more than 1,100 financial services and professional services institutions proactively identify risks and manage complex regulatory and compliance challenges. We have been selected by some of the largest hedge funds, private equity firms and brokers to be their partner and are looking for amazing people to join our growing team!  ComplySci is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our US team!  The Role ComplySci is growing at warp speed, and we are increasing the size of our Business Development team to help us maintain momentum. As a Business Development Representative, you will be joining a fast growing, fast paced, and supportive team. We are passionate about the financial industry and dedicated to empowering organizations and compliance teams towards improving their processes and becoming ever more efficient.    You will target mid- and upper-level executive prospects, communicate our value proposition to key decision-makers and influencers, and qualify new opportunities for our Sales org to pursue.  During your first 18 months, you will receive training, coaching, and mentoring with the goal of career growth and advancement.   What You Will Do Connect with prospects using phone and email. Respond to all inbound leads. Procure and qualify leads for Account Executives. Utilize Salesforce and other tools to record activity and manage your progress. Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to build strong opportunity pipelines with new prospects. Collaborate with the team to improve processes for more targeted opportunity generation efforts and improved selling techniques. Represent ComplySci with integrity and teamwork in all internal and external communications.   Qualifications BA/BS degree or equivalent. Consistent record of achieving measurable goals in previous roles. Strong business insight and curiosity about the prospect's business needs. Competitive by nature and self-motivated to exceed expectations. Previous experience in a sales-focused or SaaS software company preferred.   Excellent verbal and written communications skills.  Experience using Salesforce or other CRM and tools such as Outreach or SalesLoft.  Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.  Must be organized and attentive to detail.  Highly motivated with a strong desire to succeed.  Talk about company perks! Phenomenal Benefits: ComplySci offers a comprehensive benefits package including full medical, dental and vision coverage at little to no cost, unlimited PTO, gym reimbursements, discounts on pet insurance and more! 100% Remote Flexibility: We offer a virtual onboarding experience with a stipend to help get your work from home office set up. Employee Centric Culture: We host virtual happy hours and team bonding events to keep our fun ComplySci culture alive. High Growth Startup: There is plenty of room for you to make a positive impact on the organization and advance your career!  Complysci is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. Nothing in this job posting should be construed as an offer or guarantee of employment.

description: Want to join one of the fastest-growing charter airline companies in the industry? We specialize in ACMI and wet-lease charters for VIP, professional sports, entertainment passengers, and more. GlobalX also is expected to begin cargo operations in early 2022. Our Fleet currently has two (2) stunning AIRBUS A320/1 aircraft and is expected to have six (6) planes by December of 2021. Joining the GlobalX team means you get to work with some of the most experienced professionals in the airline industry, providing the opportunity to learn and grow in your career.  Why join the GlobalX Team?  Competitive Pay, Health Insurance paid entirely by the company, vision, dental, Health Savings Account, vacation, sick time, and supplemental benefits.  Overview  The Charter Sales Executive will be the driver of revenue generation for our narrowbody aircraft charter program. The candidate will come to the position with a deep understanding of the narrowbody charter market, proven individual sales performance and leadership, and deeply established sales contacts in the industry. The candidate will be responsible for direct sourcing of charter contracts. The ideal candidate will possess an entrepreneurial mindset and previous experience in charter sales is a requirement.  Essential Duties Directly source charter clients and contract revenue through existing relationships, developing and managing new customer relationships, cultivating client relationships, and developing new to charter clients Understand and maintain market intelligence and pricing strategies of the competitive set Generate leads and grow network of potential charter customers Meet or exceed set annual sales, customer prospecting, and conversion targets that align with company goals and performance targets Negotiate contracts with clients effectively manage the sales P&L within established rates of return based on business channel Work with operations teams for the resolution of client issues Take on additional projects and tasks as needed to support business growth and change Other duties as assigned Required Qualifications And Skills 5-10 years of demonstrated experience in high volume Part 121 Charter and Part 380 sales with proven and documented year over year sales growth history Entrepreneurial self-starter with the ability to operate independently, drive results, and creatively contribute to the development of the company’s short and long-term strategy Strong presentation skills to small and large groups Strong written and verbal communication skills with excellent ability to understand and translate customer requirements Effective decision maker and problem solver. Ability to analyze information and evaluate results to choose a solution that benefits both the company and the client. Strong computer literacy and quantitative skills to manage data, process and distill information and communicate effectively. MUST have aviation sales experience.

description: We are searching for Account Executives!  First off, what is CyberGRX?  CyberGRX provides enterprises and their third-party vendors with the most cost-effective and scalable approach to cyber risk management. Built on the market's first third-party cyber risk Exchange, CyberGRX combines both third-party vendors and enterprise organizations in one easy-to-navigate platform to streamline the risk assessment process. 63% of data breaches are linked to a third party and CyberGRX arms organizations with the data and advanced analytics so they can efficiently manage, monitor and mitigate risk in their partner ecosystems.  What does an Account Executive do at CyberGRX?  As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for growing the CyberGRX customer base by establishing new relationships, educating prospects, and ultimately selling the initial contract for accounts in your territory. This is a unique opportunity to be part of building a new team and channel. As a founding member of the Account Executive team, you will have an outsized ability to impact and influence the broader sales team.  What a day in the life looks like: You will become an expert in the product, market and customer. Build and operate from a comprehensive territory plan. Collaborate with Marketing and Business Development teams to build a strong process and pipeline. Prospecting into focus accounts with a high-touch approach that educates prospects and compels them to engage. You will manage the full-cycle sales process from sourcing to opportunity closure. Build trust with prospects and initiate strong, long-term relationships. Provide feedback to Product and Marketing to help improve our solution and messaging. You will participate in broader sales initiatives to build market awareness, improve processes, and help the team win and grow. Add to the CyberGRX culture as an early hire and key member of the broader organization.  What you bring to the table: You have at least 5 years of full sales-cycle, quota carrying experience (bonus points if you have a background in SaaS). Proven record of overachieving quota and results in a high-growth company. You are experienced in sourcing, managing, and closing high-level business-to-business sales. Great at assessing customer challenges, aligning solutions, and reading prospective buyers. You can predictably forecast and execute on business goals. You enjoy using insights and data-driven decisions in the sales process. Ability to effectively build trust-based relationships with senior-level executives. You have built consensus at speed among multiple, cross-functional decision makers and influencers. Experience managing a high volume of multiple opportunities.  Why you want to work for CyberGRX: We offer a competitive base salary (commensurate with experience) plus incentive compensation. We have an incredible benefits package including: 100% Company paid medical/dental/vision for employees & generous company contribution for dependent health benefits 401(k) program, including employer match up to 3% of your base salary $100/month stipend to use for wellness and WFH expenses Open Time Off policy - Take the time you need! Recharging the batteries is encouraged. Equity – Acting like an owner is one of our Core Values Remote Friendly Work Environment We are doing new and exciting things and have big plans for growth!  Annual Base Salary Range: $90,000 - $120,000  Annual Variable Potential: $90,000 - $120,000  We encourage you to apply if this role excites you - even if you think you may not have the exact skillset. We believe in cultivating an environment where there is a diversity of perspectives, in hopes that we can all thrive in an inclusive environment.  CyberGRX does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Resident is an industry-leader in the Direct-to-Consumer mattress and home furnishings category. Since our founding of the award-winning Nectar Sleep in 2016 (with over 1 million happy sleepers and counting), we have also launched the Dreamcloud, Awara and Level Sleep brands to cater to a variety of sleep preferences. Our mission is simple, we strive to make inspiring products people love coming home to (and to help everyone afford a great night's sleep)!  Our company is built around continuously improving our ability to introduce new customers to our products, and wow them with exceptional experiences through the shopping and post purchase journey. We love to use data and metrics to drive our decisions, while keeping in mind that customers don’t speak in numbers, and that each one should be treated as a member of our family.  Oh, and by the way - we’ve been doing the “remote work thing” since the day we started. So you can expect a hard working team of people that understands how to create meaningful connections and get great work done virtually - it’s in our nature!  The Channel lead works directly with the sales manager to lead the Resident direct-to-consumer Sales team to help our customers in their pre-purchase journey via inbound phone, email and chat channels. This is an outstanding sales opportunity for an experienced sales lead who is excited to help ensure our customers get their best night of sleep! This is a Full- Time, Remote, Work from Home opportunity in the United States. Must be available to work any FT scheduled shift given between the hours: 9:45 AM - 10:15 PM PST/ 12:45 PM EST - 1:15 AM EST SUN-SAT (with 2 days off weekly). We are open 365 days a year. Must be willing to work weekends & key holidays as well.. Additionally, you must have a dedicated quiet work space to be considered for this role.** Responsibilities Live and breathe a Customer First mindset Be a subject matter expert for sales agents in real time in order to help address product features, policy, and operational processes to help agents facilitate and close sales Deliver real-time hands-on coaching for sales agents Collaborate with sales leadership to ensure execution of ongoing sales development and training to the team of sleep experts. Ensure sleep experts provide the best customer experience while becoming top earners Collaborate with WFM to ensure that SLAs, AHTs and productivity metrics are being met Collaborate with cross functional teams to develop and execute strategies and initiatives to help agents resolve real-time customer questions and concerns Share best practices when it comes to inside sales and closing effectively Drive results by engaging, motivating, and providing constructive feedback to team members Be a ‘mattress and sleep expert’ Monitor and post leaderboard and sales activity daily to help drive agents to their monthly sales goals Communicate effectively with leadership on trends, feedback, product issues, coaching opportunities, customers needs & any product requests Help drive and cultivate a strong and healthy sales culture for the team, that keeps sales agents engaged and motivated to reach target business goals Multi-task on a variety of web based tools simultaneously to efficiently and effectively get it done Willingness to participate by video chat on all internal and external team meetings Get excited to come to work every day - bring your best self, be a great team member and get to know fellow employees located around the world! Requirements 1-2 years of people management experience + 1-2 years of B2B or DTC sales experience in a call center or remote environment Comfortable with key sales and service metrics and can speak to the importance of things like SLA, AHT, CSAT, ACW, AOV, conversion rates, up-sell rates, etc Great team building and interpersonal skills with the ability to bring an upbeat, professional and respectful approach to internal and external customers Well-organized, with a high attention to detail and ability to prioritize and time manage for successful execution A demonstrated ability to listen to customer needs, leverage Feature/Benefit and emotion based selling techniques to identify the best products for each individual Excellent written and spoken English Comfortable and familiar with working from home and being a self-starter. Experience in a startup, DTC, or e-commerce environment a plus Strong computer literacy with the ability to quickly learn and adapt to new platforms Tech savvy with the ability to type at approximately 50+ WPM (ideally) Experience/proficiency in programs such as Kustomer, Chat Tools, Zendesk, Google Suite, Slack Blazing fast internet connection in your zen work sanctuary We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, sex, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, citizenship, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or other characteristics.

Swedish Match North America LLC, a rapidly growing consumer packaged goods (CPG) producer and market leader of well-known tobacco products, non-tobacco ZYN pouch products, as well as complementary products is currently seeking a Territory Sales Manager for Sioux Falls, SD and the surrounding area.﻿ The successful candidate will manage all sales and operational functions within the respective assigned geography.  Major Responsibilities Include: Selling and servicing Swedish Match's products in retail stores in assigned geography. Gaining new item distribution, promotion execution and merchandising products, as well as, insuring freshness on all products in all assigned stores. Being able to utilize our data to develop fact based presentations for our customers and follow our call process. Also, handling all administrative aspects of the job, including expenses and point of sale materials.
