description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  The Mid-Market Sales Executive is a dynamic role that is responsible for leading the end to end sales cycle for clients in the Southeast Region. This individual is responsible for identifying, qualifying and nurturing prospects; building trust, uncovering compelling events and presenting Kyriba’s unique business value with the goal of securing new subscription business in our Software-as-a-Service business model.  Prospects are identified through marketing campaigns as well as direct prospecting efforts from the Sales Executive. Interaction with the prospect involves comprehensive discussions surrounding their current Treasury operations to identify their current situation, problems and pain all while positioning Kyriba’s unique business value and solution for the mid-market sector.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Educate contacts through comprehensive discussions surrounding their current Treasury operations and Kyriba’s product offerings applicable to the mid-market space Become fluent with value proposition messaging and be able to articulate our unique business value in a consultative sale Understand where the prospect is in the buying process and qualify accordingly Nurture non-qualified prospects by offering resources and educational materials Follow-up on inquiries from marketing campaigns, online ads, events and webinars Perform high volume outbound calling activities combined with e-mail marketing Gather key information to update SalesForce.com in order to effectively prospect specified territory Enhance product knowledge through regularly scheduled training sessions and self-education Become part of a very collaborative team in terms of training and sharing education, and best practices Manage and deliver quarterly revenues with accurate forecasting of the pipeline and full transparency through the status of opportunities Curate and build your own book of business based off of defined territory, with the goal of exceeding quarterly targets and owning the sales process Recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential    Education, Experience and Skills:           Bachelors Degree required 5 years of Software Sales or Business Development experience preferred Experience selling into back office finance preferred Highly successful track record in prospecting Ability to handle high outbound call volume with corresponding high talk time Must be articulate, organized, detail-oriented, and have the ability to multitask in a dynamic, fast-changing entrepreneurial environment Ability to learn complex Treasury concepts and incorporate into daily interactions and conversations Ability to build rapport with prospects and transition inquiries over time to the sales force Strong phone, customer service, and interpersonal skills Understand the customer’s environment and introduces new concepts to solve the customer’s problems Effective listener to understand prospect needs Ability to effectively communicate and advocate with internal stakeholders Ability to travel 20% of the time  Kyriba Culture and Values: At Kyriba, we value a strong work culture and sense of community and ownership among our global team. We live by our “iCare” value system to demonstrate our care and commitment to our clients and to each other. In hiring, we look for candidates that are a strong fit with our culture and values, as well as bring the talent and experience required by the position.  Innovation: We foster innovation and entrepreneurial thinking across our team by rewarding employees for their achievements and encouraging efficiency and continual process improvement. Client Success: Our passion is to enable our clients’ success. We do this by understanding their needs, and developing and managing solutions that provide them the insight to effectively drive decision making within their organizations. Accountability: We each take personal responsibility for our actions. We are committed to our own continuous improvement and we go the extra mile to meet our clients' needs. Respect: We respect each other’s ideas, efforts and commitments, and embrace our diverse cultures and points of view. We achieve our goals through teamwork, responsiveness, open communication and a positive attitude. Excellence: We strive for excellence in all that we do and bring the passion and commitment to deliver on our promises. We achieve excellence through leadership, teamwork, transparency and integrity, and we are committed to recognizing employee achievements.  Kyriba believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
industries: Computer Software and Financial Services

description: Operations Lead - Seller Growth and Success Location: Remote in the US.  Who You Are  As the SGS Operations Lead, you’ll be the central nervous system for the Seller Growth and Success department. You will lead the creation and growth of the knowledge bases and workflow that support our teams.   If you love solving problems, working collaboratively with coworkers throughout an organization and are driven to constantly improve, we need you here!  The Impact You Will Make Here  You will work with your customer-facing teammates to document all of the knowledge inside of their heads and make sure that we all are working from the same playbook. Now, training new agents is a breeze and every seller is getting the highest level of service. You’ll also work with the other departments throughout our organization to keep everything running smoothly. Our agents need some new sales reports from our data team? You’ll be helping translate between the teams and keeping everything on track until it’s complete. Our fulfillment center team isn’t getting enough information from us about our sellers? You’ll create a system to make sure our agents are delivering what is needed. You’ll own and run the mission critical software and tasks that keep our teams running. You’ll make sure our dashboards are up to date, so managers can keep their teams operating. You’ll work with our copywriters and inbound sales team to publish blog posts and send email campaigns. You’re the dungeon master shaping the world that our agents work in.  Our products are great, but they could be even better with our sellers’ advice. We need you to make sure we have a strong system for taking ideas from our sellers, passing them back to our product and UX teams, and then letting our sellers know once the job is done. We have a lot of cool projects and programs that our sellers sometimes get an early participation in, so you’ll need to track and store any special contracts, non-disclosure agreements, releases for testimonials, and other documents.   This is an important job that’s only going to get bigger, so you’ll need to help us figure out who else you’ll need in the future to keep this going, and then bring them onboard  What You Bring To The Team  Formal education, or equivalent work experience in process optimization, document management or equivalent area. Relevant experience in management of both direct reports and cross functional teams.  What We Provide  Our benefits program is one of the most flexible and progressive in the country. Plus, benefits start on day one, so you have everything you need to make a stress-free transition to life here.  Comprehensive medical insurance with a variety of plan options to suit your needs Dental and vision insurance Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO) 100% company paid Family Leave 401k plan with 4% match  Stock options for all employees Free coaching, counseling and mental health services 100% company paid life insurance  Paid trips to work with remote teammates
industries: Information Technology and Services

jobTitle: Sales Development Representative, ACH and Online Banking
description: The world of payment processing has changed. Technology alone can no longer meet the needs of businesses who are looking for strategic partners to help them grow globally.  We are Nuvei. The payment technology partner that merchants can count on to make their business a local marketplace. We deliver unified commerce solutions and expertise to help our partners capture every opportunity that comes their way.  As the most valuable tech IPO ever on the Canadian TSX, we are continuing to expand and are seeking individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.  As a Sales Development Rep, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei’s products with specific focus on the Northern America market by uncovering new opportunities and working with a business development manager to mature those opportunities.  Key Responsibilities Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Develop sales leads by using sales tools with outbound sales prospecting efforts. Preferred Qualifications Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends. Minimum Qualifications Minimum two years’ of sales high growth experience. Pipeline management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits  Nuvei offers a wide variety of benefits which include Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Paid Vacation, Paid Sick Time, 401(k) and many other great benefits.  Nuvei perks also include: Training, development and career advancement opportunities. Free Virtual yoga, meditation and fitness classes, community involvement, and many social activities. Employee recognition. Flexibility for Hybrid work A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Nuvei does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: The San Antonio Express-News, part of Hearst Communications, is excited to announce our continued growth in the San Antonio market and we are seeking a Trainer just like you! As the voice of South Texas since 1865 providing news and information to over 1 million people, the San Antonio Express-News is able to offer our advertisers a robust suite of digital and print products to help them achieve their business objectives. The ideal candidate will have experience in media and an understanding of the SAEN and Hearst competitive advantage.  Primary Responsibilities:  Working with sales representatives in the field utilizing technology to hone sales skills and product knowledge  Construction of the timing and deployment of training programs Create presentations and construct proposals An expert in all processes and products of the San Antonio Express-News sales team Ability to teach others and develop their skill set Improve the number of individuals within the local team that achieve total, digital and new business goals regularly   Experience, Qualifications, Technical Requirements, Education:  Google Analytics certified preferred 2 to 3 years Sales experience required 1 to 2 years Managerial experience preferred 1 to 2 years Sales Trainer experience preferred Challenger Sales experience preferred Proficient with Sales Force required  Must have a strong business and digital acumen Excellent communication skills required   As part of its continued efforts to maintain a safe workplace for employees, Hearst Newspapers requires that all employees who receive a written offer of employment be fully vaccinated (as defined by the CDC) against the coronavirus by the first day of employment as a condition of employment, to the extent permitted by applicable law. Hearst Newspapers will consider requests for reasonable accommodations due to medical, including pregnancy or a pregnancy-related condition, and/or religious reasons on an individual basis in accordance with applicable legal requirements.

description: Job Summary  The Sales Coordinator executes all order processing-related duties and independently perform all the steps necessary to ensure that every order is processed in a timely, effective manner and delivered on time.  Job Responsibilities: Manage the day-to-day order operations and actively communicate with the customer and overseas offices to ensure flawless execution of the order fulfillment cycle Maintain clear and accurate records of purchase orders and production schedules Liaise with cross-functional team on production and delivery issues; resolve issues as they arise Organize and timely execute all aspects of the artwork process from the design phase to the commercial packaging; effectively communicate and manage artwork timelines, milestones and status of projects to overseas offices and customer Collaboratively contribute in tender processing-related duties to ensure that all inquiries are processed in a timely manner; complete the customer’s portal (product specifications, production facility, packaging requirements, and etc.), Product Pricing and Product Information Forms at the tendering and Order Confirmation’s stages Coordinate and timely distribute incoming/outgoing samples to/from factories and customer Qualifications: 3- 5-year experience as a Sales Coordinator or Analyst Must possess superior organizational, time management, financial, and analytic skills. Ability to multitask and proactively execute to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and time-critical environment Excellent organizational and communication skills with attention to details Must work proactively and independently in solving problems Must have positive attitude, work well independently and as a team Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience Highly proficient in Microsoft Office  About The Company  Our client is a global supply chain creating customized, end-to-end supply chain and logistics solutions for brands and retailers

jobTitle: Field Sales Representative III - Channel Seed - Western Nebraska
description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Field Sales Representative III - Channel Seed - Western Nebraska  Your Tasks And Responsibilities  As a Field Sales Representative for Channel Seed you will be responsible for leveraging independent Channel Seedsman dealers to grow the market share of Bayer's Seed & Trait business in Western Nebraska including the following counties; Sioux, Dawes, Sheridan, Cherry, Box Butte, Scottsbluff, Morrill, Garden, Banner, Kimball, Cheyenne and Duel. In this position, you will create demand for Bayer Seed & Trait products by supporting our exclusive Channel Dealers (Seedsmen). This role will report to the local Area Business Manager.  The primary responsibilities of this role, Field Sales Representative III, are to: Achieve assigned targets with Bayer products in coordination with pod mates; Develop and implement dealer business plans, manage forecasting proactively, inventory management and product line demand issues, set the business direction, and coordinate follow-ups with dealers that drive business results; Serve as the key business consultant to retailers and dealer and effectively sell the value of Bayer Crop Science products; Demonstrate proof of product performance against the competition by being the champion of Bayer brands and product/technical/agronomic knowledge; Collaborate with pod-mate FSRs, CBAs and Bayer Agronomists and Technology Development Representatives (TDR) to maximize services, information, and sales to preferred growers and key customer accounts; Actively manage inventory concerns as appropriate to ensure success of meeting business objectives while anticipating demand and potential bottlenecks; Gather, assimilate and analyze market and competitive information; Utilize data to make key decisions to drive the business; Develop and recommend strategies for achieving long and short business plans for key accounts and assigned area; Effectively manage expenses, discretionary dollars and program payments per Bayer Crop Science policy; Work independently to continuously expand selling skills and product/portfolio knowledge, while mentoring peers and teammates in these skills as well; Ensure achievement of program execution and program fulfillment, including national/regional marketing initiatives; Take a leadership role in partnering with pod-mate FSRs/CBAs and manage the relationship with top growers and retailers; Act as the business expert for top growers and retailers, while planning for customer business needs; Proactively mentor and coach earlier-in-career FSRs; Manage area claims per Bayer Crop Science policy and process through effective problem solving, execution, administration and resource management; Travel approximately 60%; Grow market share of Crop Protection/Seed and Trait business and create demand for seed growth, seed and trait, and chemistry within territory. Position requires driving for the company that may fall under DOT/FMCSA jurisdiction. This may entail the hauling of trailers, product, supplies or equipment in a safe manner. Who You Are  Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:  Required Qualifications: At least six years of experience in Sales, marketing, account management or agriculture; Excellent communication skills (interpersonal, oral and written); Demonstrated initiative, assertiveness, and ability to drive results; Excellent business acumen, account planning, influencing and critical thinking skills; Financial, time, and territory management expertise; Proven ability to multi-task in a rapid-paced and matrixed environment; Strong computer and presentation skills (proficiencies in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook); Demonstrated digital acumen and ability to analyze data to influence decisions; Willingness to travel and live/work in a rural environment; Proven interest in supporting collaboration and teamwork within a pod structure; Ability to pass driving record background check (i.e. moving violations, accidents, License suspension, etc. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree; Demonstrated product, portfolio and agronomic knowledge. Domestic relocation assistance may be offered for this role.  YOUR APPLICATION  Bayer offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and want to impact our mission Science for a better life, we encourage you to apply now. Be part of something bigger. Be you. Be Bayer.  To all recruitment agencies: Bayer does not accept unsolicited third party resumes.  Bayer is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans  Bayer is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodations in its application process for individuals with disabilities and encourages applicants with disabilities to request any needed accommodation(s) using the contact information below.  Location: United States : Nebraska : Residence Based  Division: Crop Science  Reference Code: 496403  Contact Us  Email: hrop_usa@bayer.com
industries: Chemicals, Pharmaceuticals, and Biotechnology

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - Detroit, MI - Craniomaxillofacial
description: Who We Want To Work With  You’re a sales professional at heart. You love engaging with customers and colleagues – wherever that might take you. Being responsible for other’s perception of a company’s brand and reputation excites you, as does the challenge of initiating and creatively prospecting new customer relationships – especially in healthcare environments. You enjoy building relationships and understand that collaboration is key to growing any business, especially in a complex and competitive industry. You’re an influencer that is driven to succeed and accountability is important to you. You seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions. You’re resilient and persistent and will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  At Stryker’s Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) Division You’ll work closely with experienced Sales Representatives and Managers to build your knowledge, skill and comfort with clinical and product knowledge as well as selling styles and techniques. They will serve as your coaches and mentors to share lessons learned for how to build and grow a successful business. You’ll receive training and be expected study and prepare independently to perform at the highest levels in the operating room, working amongst surgeons and healthcare professionals. The expectations are challenging, yet rewarding. You’ll represent Stryker as a leader in our industry and the marketplace. You’ll have the opportunity to identify and promote solutions and sell products that change our patient’s lives. You’ll collaborate with our team to build your own business one customer and account at a time. You’ll identify and prospect new customers as well as continually take care of existing customers. You’ll assist Sales Representatives in determining the necessary resources needed for our customers to achieve sales objectives and then execute the plan. These resources may include educational programs, product development initiatives, and sales strategies. You’ll foster a culture and environment that makes CMF destination for top performers and a place where people’s careers thrive. What You Need Highly organized and demonstrate ability to organize a busy schedule. Capacity to deal with competing priorities and potential to be adaptable as days change quickly. Demonstrated ability in building and maintaining relationships in the sales capacity. Must be comfortable in emergency and operating room environments. Prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals (including some weekends, and some overnight travel). Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services This would include marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques and sales control systems Comfortability with adapting to new technology and business advancements. Bachelor’s degree required Would need personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers. Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. “Smart, hardworking, and gets along well with others.” John Brown Our Values  Integrity  We do what’s right  Accountability  We do what we say  People  We grow talent  Performance  We deliver  Core Themes And Phrases About Our Workplace Our Culture - Win together as a team We are a team. We constantly challenge ourselves. We challenge each other. We want to achieve more. We win the right way. We care about each other. Growth - Own your career Our company is growing. You can grow with us. We help you discover your strengths. You can discover and follow your passion here. We are a career destination. The Work - Customers and patients are at the heart of everything we do We strive for the best. We improve lives. We go above and beyond. We are proud of our quality products. We are accountable for our work. e Our People - Passionately driven, remarkable results We are passionate. We are driven. We are focused. We deliver remarkable results. We expect to win. We act with purpose. We act with integrity. We do what we say.  Who we are  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  CMF Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/orthopaedics/craniomaxillofacial.html  #LIInstruments

description: Who Are We?  Here at Arrow we have built an all-in-one platform that makes it easier and smoother for the salesperson to get their job done and allows them to have the option to close deals over their phone.  There is a shift in the mindset of the heavy equipment industry (an  acceptance and intrigue) around technology and how it should be helping them to close deals more efficiently, whilst also being an enjoyable process and we are confident that Arrow is the new way to close deals!  Arrow is seeking an ambitious Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team!  As an SDR at Arrow, you will build your sales experience through B2B prospecting and continuous hands-on training with our management team!   Responsibilities:  Research customers, identify decision makers, and educate prospects. Create clear communication through prospecting via phone, networking, e-mail. Create a high quantity of qualified sales opportunities. Qualify leads through research and analysis, and schedule partnership opportunities for our Business Development Managers. Contribute directly to the rapid growth of Arrow and our sales team  Highlights:  Work from anywhere in the world (not exaggerating). Great medical benefits. Unlimited PTO. Competitive Base Salary On Day 1 (we are investing in you).  The "Best Fit" Person Will:  Embrace the opportunity to work for a startup.  Look forward to taking direct responsibility for your work and having an impact in a fast-growth organization. Be flexible and dedicated to get the job done. Have high energy, passionate and competitive. Be inquisitive, innovative and coachable.   Purpose & People of Arrow  Core Purpose To build an essential and sustainable living, breathing organization. We build tools to help people live more impactfully by unlocking their potential. We thrive on challenges that start with: “I’m not sure if this is possible, but I wish I could…” We are uniquely positioned to design and build user-focused products, we seek direct feedback from clients, and we deliver data-driven improvements to solve complex problems in a repeatable and scalable way. We believe that getting more done with less effort allows you to invest more time doing more of what you enjoy in life.  The People of Arrow... Want our products to have a meaningful impact. Believe all activities should deliver an optimal return on our collective efforts. Are ruthlessly efficient and constantly reprioritized. Assume good intentions. We will be kind and painfully honest. Write out ideas, strategies and plans to be read by and debated on their merit. Always reverse engineer the clearly defined definition of success. Identify the “right long-term path” but ride momentum. Expect best in the world outcomes. Only play where we have a comparative advantage to win. Have autonomy and control over your calendar. Believe that design and an intuitive customer experience are a competitive advantage. Are ok making mistakes, just not the same mistake twice. Work smart...then hard. Understand that the workload will be uneven. Question leadership until you understand and clarify priorities. Understand small groups are better at solving hard problems than large groups. Understand this business will change, the goal of value creation will not. Don’t borrow from tomorrow, as it will always leave you broke today. Understand what you do is your brand, if your name is on it, be proud of the work you have done or the work isn’t done yet. Don't pre-solve future problems (focus on first-order problems). Understand inputs drive outputs…focus on the small steps to create value. Are comfortable being uncomfortable, stretch yourself in the goal of value creation.  We care a lot about “Who” our employees really are.  We want to find people who want to Create value for themselves and our customers, Grow personally, and Enjoy playfully building along the way.   Arrow provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

description: Globalization Partners’ automated, AI-driven global employment platform, designed by our technical teams and powered by our worldwide HR experts, enables our customers to hire, onboard, and manage the best talent they can find, anywhere in the world.  As the leader in the Employer of Record industry, we simplify global business by allowing companies to grow to new countries and test new markets compliantly, without the hassle of setting up branch offices or subsidiaries.  With diverse teams all around the world, our people are the heartbeat of the company and the reason why Globalization Partners is a fun and inclusive place to work. We encourage and support personal growth and career development, trust our team members with the autonomy to do their best work, and believe in recognition for a job well done.  Did we mention you can experience all of this while working remotely? As a remote-first employer, we value your experience and skills more than where you are located. Join our collaborative work environment where you can make a real impact and love the work you’re doing!  About the position: As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for nurturing our existing Client base, from outreach and follow-up to generating add-on business with our Clients who use our Global Expansion Platform. Although we close sales on the phone, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy and a laser-like attention to detail, who is focused on outstanding client satisfaction from the prospect’s first introduction to our operations team with Globalization Partners onward.  What You'll Do Close sales for add-on products, including expansion countries and other product lines Nurture existing company Client base by proactively calling and building relationships with key members of the Client’s team Identify and expand contacts within the company Client base to assess the Client’s departmental needs Draft and follow up on proposals/addendums, overcome objections and close sales Attend initial onboardings meetings to understand the needs and growth cycle of the Client Formulate key outreach approaches in conjunction with the designated Client Service Manager to better understand the Client’s global expansion needs Work with Client Services Managers to provide a best in class service experience for our Clients Build and maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics Identify contacts who have left a client company and assess their potential as a new client Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive Maintain high quality data in SalesForce What We're Looking For Professional in all listening, speaking and written communication Meticulous attention to client satisfaction Collaborative Ability to identify solutions to problems Driven to Succeed Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business or finance discipline 2-4years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred About Globalization Partners  Hire anyone, anywhere, quickly and easily.  Globalization Partners AI- driven, automated, fully compliant global Employer of Record platform technology is transforming how companies hire talent around the globe. Our industry-leading proprietary technology simplifies onboarding and managing employees anywhere in the world.  With easy-to-use dashboards and a mobile-ready payroll authorization system, our customers can safely and securely access crucial HR documents and authorize and approve global payroll faster than ever.  Globalization Partners: Breaking Down Barriers for Everyone, Everywhere  #Remote

description: About MIEC: We are MIEC, an insurance company that provides medical professional liability insurance to physicians and acupuncturists in Alaska, California, Hawaii and Idaho. We are owned and operated for the benefit of our policyholders, which number almost 7,400.  We were founded in 1975 by physicians during a time when commercial carriers withdrew from the market. Now, some 40 years later, we remain determined to provide our policyholders with low, responsible and stable premiums.  POSITION SUMMARY: Direct Account Manager (Acupuncture) In collaboration with the Director of Sales & Marketing, the Direct Account Manager will be responsible for business development, relationship management, and marketing for various channels within our medical professional liability insurance portfolio, with a focus on supporting acupuncture practitioners. The Direct Account Manager will be responsible for developing and deploying marketing and business development strategies to cultivate relationships with prospective members, partners, and existing members to meet strategic growth initiatives.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Understand, advocate, and market MIEC Insurance products with a focus on acupuncture practitioners, to grow the book of business and meet assigned strategic initiatives. Nurture relationships with key industry stakeholders. Manage relationships with endorsed society partners. Proactively manage new business prospects, both inbound and outbound. Conduct regular follow up activities (phone, email, social media). Conduct needs assessment, to understand the insurance requirements. Explain various aspects of available coverage. Provide coverage recommendations based on member needs. Secure applications for insurance products. Explain coverage, and/or answer questions regarding MIEC policy language. Provide the highest level of customer service to both new & existing MIEC members. Follow up and collaborate with underwriting as a member liaison to ensure coverage is appropriately secured. Collaborate and Support Member Services to ensure member service needs are met where applicable. Serve as the subject matter expert for the acupuncture service line. Attend marketing events, tradeshows, etc., where applicable to advertise, and/or advocate MIEC products and services. Collaborate with Marketing to develop and deploy various marketing and sales campaigns. Continued awareness of competitive marketing/branding activities, positioning and pricing in the MPL market segment. Strong spirit of collaboration, and the ability to effectively partner with those at all levels within the organization and see projects through to completion. Perform other projects and/or duties as assigned. This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; and nothing in this herein restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.    QUALIFICATIONS: Enthusiastic, creative, goal-oriented individual with the ability to work autonomously and achieve production goals. Strong critical thinking and networking sales skills. Excellent planning and organizational skills: ability to perform tasks methodically with structure; ability to create a good framework before execution; and, executes to a timeline with a sense of urgency. Excellent research and analytical capabilities. Ability to act autonomously and take initiative to solve problems: proactively identifies and solves complex problems; anticipates challenges. Excellent writing and communication skills (verbal, written, and public presentation) across all levels. Bilingual (Chinese/Mandarin/Thai/Korean) preferred. Strong sense of customer service and passionate about taking care of MIEC members. Must possess vision and creativity to proactively drive brand positioning in alignment with both short and long-term strategic initiatives.  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or related field preferred. 2 – 3 years’ experience in marketing, sales, or business development in insurance or related industry preferred. Prior experience working directly with the practice of medicine, and/or healthcare industry, including the acupuncture profession preferred. LA-C, or other acupuncture designation desirable. Property/Casualty Insurance Producers License Required, or willingness/ability to obtain within the first three (3) months of employment. Experience in networking, brand marketing, and cultivating relationships. Experience managing sales pipeline, and meeting production metrics (KPI’s), preferred. Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Powerpoint, Visio, and Word. Working knowledge of digital marketing techniques and tools, including Google analytics, Google Adwords, etc. Understanding or, and/or experience with both traditional and digital marketing techniques. Experience with social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.  WORK ENVIRONMENT:     Combination of in-office and remote work anticipated. Occasional weekend and/or evening work expected. Periodic daily and/or overnight travel required. Position requires regular interaction with MIEC members, stakeholders, and prospective members.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Ability to lift 25 pounds for conference material and distribution.  Typing repetitive motion and light bending and kneeling to access file cabinets.  The ability to talk and express or exchange ideas by means of the spoken word to provide instructions.  BENEFITS 401(K)/Pension Plan Health Insurance Vision and Dental Insurance Paid Time Off  COMPENSATION: Salary based on experience. MIEC offers competitive compensation commensurate with experience and a comprehensive benefits package.  MIEC is an EEO employer, we enjoy diversity in our staff, insured and business partners.

description: Valdosta, GA - Cardiorenal Sales Consultant  Bayer’s Cardiorenal Division is undergoing an impressive growth trajectory and significant investment. Bayer is committed to improving cardiorenal health both in the US and globally with currently available products and products which are in development, including investigational treatments for Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), heart failure with reduced and preserved ejection fraction, and renal anemia. Given the profound burden of CKD in Type 2 Diabetes (T2D), Bayer is continuing to make significant investments in further developing and currently launching treatment options for the disease. Specifically, as a member of the Cardiorenal Sales organization, you will have an opportunity to make an immediate impact by connecting our products with patients and continuing to advance a world class Cardiorenal Sales organization.  Your Tasks And Responsibilities  The primary responsibilities of this residence-based role, Cardiorenal Sales Consultant - Valdosta, GA, are to: Build and develop professional relationships with (but not limited to) cardiology, nephrology, endocrinology, primary care and pharmacy staff, within assigned customers; Drive appropriate utilization of approved cardiovascular (CV) products; Work closely with other Bayer commercial associates to generate pull-through within local payers and community health care professionals (HCP’s); Leverage expertise and knowledge of diabetes, nephrology and cardiovascular disease (CVD), the marketplace, applicable competitors, industry and cross-functional activities/plans in order to anticipate and effectively manage business opportunities and challenges; Provide relevant, thoughtful input to other commercial colleagues (e.g. sales leadership, regional account managers) in regard to strategic and tactical planning for territory, area, and region; Develop and implement effective customer specific territory plans; Communicate insights to internal stakeholders; Prioritize time and effort to ensure optimal coverage of appropriate physician specialists based on opportunity and potential; Understand fully the assigned customers product and business needs and work to meet those needs while adhering to all of Bayer company ethics and compliance standards; Anticipate potential barriers to achievement of goals and propose responsible solutions for success; Have long standing relationships with key customers and an in-depth knowledge of the disease state, key drivers, influencers and prescribing patterns in their territory; Effectively handle customer objections and exceed customer expectations with the value they bring to physicians; Occasionally be called on to share their exemplary skills with others in the region in a training capacity. Who You Are  Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:  Required Qualifications: Bachelors’ degree and at least 5 years of experience in pharmaceutical sales; A valid driver’s license and safe driving record; Proven track record of consistent high performance; Demonstrated leadership and foster an environment that promotes ethical behavior and compliance with company policies and applicable laws. Preferred Qualifications: Advanced degree; Experience in the promotion of cardiovascular and/or diabetes and/or nephrology pharmaceuticals; Product launch experience; Outstanding written and oral communication skills; Strong analytical and computer capabilities; Virtual sales experience; Strong local relationships with HCP’s and understanding of local market. Application Period: Please define Reference Code: 451482  Division: Pharmaceuticals Location: United States : Georgia : Residence Based  Functional Area: Commercial & Sales Position Grade: VS 1.2  Employment Type: Regular Work Time: Please define  Contact Us  Address Telephone E-Mail  Please define  Please define  Please define

description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  The Regional Sales Director will lead a regional field sales and clinical organization to achieve sales and market penetration goals as assigned for Abbott’s Acute MCS Division. This position will lead a team of field sales and/or sales support employees and will be responsible for developing and implementing annual sales plans to meet revenue goals for the business. This position is responsible for hiring, coaching and developing sales and clinical personnel, supporting these field personnel in the efficient and effective leadership of their teams. This position is responsible for the overall employment, development, and retention strategies for field personnel for the assigned area.  Job Duties Develop regional strategic plans to meet revenue, profitability, and market penetration goals, ensuring alignment with sales team. Drive regional performance by ensuring alignment and executing on critical sales and service strategies and tactics. Collaborate with the field team to identify strategies to increase referrals of appropriate patients to overcome barriers that are restricting the national growth and adoption of the Acute therapy. Provide ongoing coaching and feedback to field sales and support staff through field visits, observation and measurement of results. Oversee training strategies and market development plans for the region to ensure the sales and service teams have the skills and tools to drive therapy adoption and revenue targets. Lead effective talent management strategies within the region, including implementation of high quality talent acquisition and talent development skills. Develops and maintains relationships with new and existing customers, KOLs and industry leaders. Maintains understanding of heart failure technology in a competitive environment. Effectively manage and own P&L for region with finance alignment. Build and maintain effective relationships with ABT and competitive customers. Ensure the quality policy/system is planned, understood, implemented and maintained by ensuring compliance within the department. Contacts, visits and interests clients and potential clients in the Company’s products and addresses any client questions and concerns. Collects and studies information about new and existing products and monitors competitor sales, prices and products. May attend trade shows where new products and technologies are showcased and conferences to meet other sales representatives and clients and discuss new product developments. Remains current on developments in field(s) of expertise. Required  Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree. 3 years of successful sales leadership experience preferably within medical device industry. Well organized, capable of juggling multiple projects and accustomed to tight deadlines. Excellent personal computer skills including MS Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint. Ability to work in a highly matrixed and geographically diverse business environment. Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment. Ability to leverage and/or engage others to accomplish projects. Strong verbal and written communications with ability to effectively communicate at multiple levels in the organization. Experience with direct quota attainment and performance metrics. Schedule flexibility for case coverage and client meetings after hours and on weekends. Ability to travel a minimum of 50% of the time. Able to lift up to 25 pounds but may exceed that on occasion. Requires clear vision and good depth perception. Preferred MBA and/or multi-product/therapy sales management experience. 6 plus years medical device sales experience. Priority will be given to candidates who can think strategically and execute tactically. Experience in the Heart Failure field therapy areas. Demonstrated market development skills. Demonstrated ability to influence and work successfully with cross-functional partners and customers. Ability to motivate and sustain high performance in a clinical sales, therapy development organization. Proven exceptional sales results over an extended period of time.

description: GroundTruth is the leading location-based marketing and advertising technology company. Sitting at the convergence of offline and online data, GroundTruth delivers a unique data set called “visitation data,” which allows brands, agencies, SMBs, and non-profits to drive high-performing business outcomes (ROI). GroundTruth activates this data through a suite of performance products and services via their self-serve advertising platform, through managed services, or tailored partnerships. GroundTruth has built proprietary filtering processes that combines our BlueprintTM contextual mapping technology, owned & operated properties, along with 3rd party mobile location data, together yielding over 30B visits annually.  We believe that innovative technology starts with the best talent and were recently ranked of Ad Age’s 2021 Best Places to Work. Learn more about the perks of joining our team here.  You Will  A bit about you Main objective: new business sales through agencies and client directs while maintaining and growing a handful of running accounts that are part of your custom territory/book of business Constantly build a pipeline of leads throughout the entire sales cycle (new business focus) Communicate GroundTruth capabilities, differentiators and the entire product suite effectively to clients through various means (email, phone, in-person, conferences, networking event, etc.) Hold at least 5 meetings a week with a focus on the “Pitch a day” mentality Meet or achieve sales quotas on a monthly/quarterly basis according to sales plan set by VP Meet all deadlines set by leadership to ensure proper information is effectively shared Be a team player – contribute during team meetings, share market/product knowledge with larger team and step up to help team members when in need Respond to clients within 24hrs of email/phone call, the sooner the better Accurately maintain a forecast for team spreadsheets and opportunity pipeline Additional Things To Note Culture is key at GroundTruth – prepare to contribute and help further develop the culture of the sales team and broader company The expectation is to be meeting and entertaining clients wherever and whenever schedules align. “Whatever it takes to close a deal (within reason)” is the mentality of our top sellers here at GroundTruth Any experience within the Travel vertical is a plus You Have Bachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing, Business or similar relevant field 2+ years’ experience at an agency, media sales company or general account selling Strong communication skills (in-person/on-the-phone presentations, email and general day-today in the office and with clients) Effective time management skills and the ability to multi-task are imperative in this extremely fast-moving role Strong attention to detail in all aspects of the business Go-getter mentality – ability to find new business (hot/cold leads), maintain and grow current business and constantly curate of pipeline of potential business Understanding of the mobile eco-system and the various players in the space (location-based, attribution partners, programmatic, rich media providers, etc.) Ability to effectively and strategically complete RFP’s for clients in various verticals, proactively pitch strategic ideas to best serve your client’s needs. Strong ability to “close” or ask for the business after each pitch Technical skills: Salesforce, MSFT product suite, MediaOcean/Prisma, Expensify, Clearslide, ZOOM, Slack, The LIST/Winmo, SellerCrowd, Media Radar Key competencies Managing performance - setting clear, measurable personal goals that can be used by manager to gauge success and provide a path for future growth Collaborator – ability to effectively work with various people and departments within the company “Always Be Closing” - asking for the business or next meeting at the end of every point of contact with the client Results Driven – revenue/account growth, client satisfaction Willingness and desire to quickly learn the landscape and continuously develop and hone skills as you progress Strong networking ability We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, inclusion and equity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodations under applicable federal, state and/or local laws. If you need reasonable accommodations in the application process, please reach out to us at hr@groundtruth.com.

description: Description  Consult with America's businesses, leveraging Paychex key referral channels and partnerships to educate stakeholders on our services, and provide consultative solutions to increase market share and drive revenue. Achieve unit and revenue expectations. Create, manage, and advance accounts, leads, and opportunities in company’s CRM system (Salesforce) and provide accurate sales activity and forecasts. Collaborate with key referral sources, including Accountants, Banks, and existing Paychex clients, with the goal of education, consultation and to secure referrals to end user sales. Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel accounts through telephone calls, targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales Management. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers to increase revenue and market share. Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the Paychex product offering to optimize sales results; remain up-to-date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends and other relevant information of interest to customers. Collect, complete and submit all necessary paperwork for new sales within defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines. When required, address and escalate client concerns to our Service Partners, and follow-up as necessary to ensure satisfactory resolution. May be required to travel for purposes of visiting channel partners, and attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Requirements H.S. Diploma - Required Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in relevant sales/marketing capacity. Our Commitment  Paychex is dedicated to fostering a culture of intentional Inclusion and Diversity (I&D). Our valued employees and commitment to I&D is the essence of our internal and external success. Inclusivity is a key value of our corporate culture and is exemplified through our reputation as a top employer for employee development, diversity, and ethics, as well as a focus on fairness in recruitment, selection, and decision making.  Click here for more information on our corporate social responsibility.

description: About HealthyWage HealthyWage was founded in 2009 and administers best-in-class, outcomes-based wellness challenges for large public and private sector employers as well as consumers. We specialize in Fortune 500 companies as well as a variety of industries internationally including hospital systems, school districts, and municipalities. Our challenges provide significant clinical outcomes with verified and measurable weight loss. About the Position HealthyWage is currently seeking an Inside Sales Representative. This role is responsible for generating qualified sales leads for the Account Executive team through outbound business development techniques. Individuals in this role will generate new business opportunities by following sales processes to prospect and qualify business accounts, focus on researching lists of companies to target, and develop email and telephone campaigns to qualified accounts. If you’re a self-starter who loves talking to new people and working in a dynamic team environment, then HealthyWage is the place for you. Perks Competitive compensation plan. A typical representative will have an average total annual compensation range of $60,000-$80,000. This range includes an annual base salary of $36,000, plus performance-based commissions and bonus. Virtual Office Program, which allows you to work from anywhere, as long as you have access to outstanding Internet service and can get the job done. The Virtual Office Program is one of the best parts about working at HealthyWage. We’ve adopted tools that foster a strong, fun, fulfilling and productive work culture, even though most of us are distributed around the country. We supply your remote office with the best supplies and equipment. The Virtual Office Program is amazing for professionals who also happen to be expecting mothers, parents of young and school-age children, people with pets, people who get restless living in one place for too long, and people who just want to be able to work from the mountains or the beach or the farm...or New York City minus the crowded subway ride. Required Qualifications: 1+ years experience in inside sales or business development, sales or client development This is a quota driven role – are you hungry and eager to make an impact? Ability to thrive in a team-selling environment Experience making cold-calls to senior and executive level decision makers Familiar and comfortable with technology including Microsoft Office suite, web meeting and CRM platforms Strong track record of performance in a previous role Detail oriented, organized mindset and strong time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Individuals will have a can-do attitude, who will take initiative to figure things out as they go, learn and be open to constructive feedback Experience working in remote environment is a plus Employee Wellness industry knowledge or sales experience is a major plus This position will begin as a contractor relationship.

description: VELOX Media is one of the leading ROI-focused digital marketing agencies worldwide, ranked in the top 3% by Google and climbing Inc. 5000’s list of Fastest Growing Companies. VELOX Media is a full-service digital agency specializing in strategy, search marketing, SEO / SEM, organic optimization, paid management, and web development.  This is an in-office position located in beautiful downtown Boise, Idaho.  What you'll do  Achieve monthly quota of Qualified Opportunities (meetings set) by initiating outreach to prospective clients via phone, e-mail, and LinkedIn Research and qualify targeted prospect accounts using set criteria Effectively introduce and represent agency services through written and oral communication Perform preliminary keyword research for new opportunities prior to sales handoff Accurately manage the full lead generation process Schedule, confirm, and make follow up calls as directed Keep all data and notes up-to-date in (CRM) software Adopt VELOX Media sales methodology and adhere to our sales process  What we look for  1+ year sales experience – software sales or B2B products and services a plus Excellent verbal and written executive communications skills You are a people person that can smile through the phone Good foundation to understand and desire to learn digital marketing strategies Ability to quickly understand and carry out oral and written directions Confident and comfortable in your own skin Ownership and pride in performance Someone with something to prove each month  The right Sales Development Representative to join our team will be energetic and enthusiastic to help grow the VELOX Media pipeline. With a positive can-do attitude, successful SDR’s are likely to move up quickly and have the opportunity to build a book of business as a Digital Growth Manager.  Benefits include  Comprehensive and competitive benefits package Paid downtown parking Generous vacation and paid holidays Casual dress and frequent team building events Gym Membership Kombucha on tap!

description: Peek is a 5-star reviewed leading software platform for the tours, activities and rentals industry (think hot air balloon rides, ziplining and cooking classes), empowering thousands of operators to automate their businesses and grow revenue by an average of 30%. We have won numerous awards for innovation, including being named one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Travel and a World Economic Forum Tech Pioneer (alongside past winners such as Google and Spotify).  Peek follows a “remote-first” philosophy, with our team of over 120 Peeksters distributed across exciting locales such as San Francisco, Salt Lake City, New York, Seattle, Chile, Colombia and beyond.   PS: Peek just made the 2021 Forbes America's Best Startups Employer list!  The Peek Recruiting Team is focused on helping build Peek’s culture, one top talent hire at a time. We partner with hiring managers to design and execute recruiting strategies that enable Peek to hire remarkable talent, in the most efficient ways. We own the candidate lifecycle experience, and the recruiting team is part of the People Operations org.  The Role: We are looking for an established Recruiter with demonstrated success recruiting for operational & sales professionals. This is a unique and highly impactful opportunity to help accelerate growth. This role will report to the Talent Acquisition Manager and partner closely with the Sales Leadership team and entire People Operations team.   Responsibilities Focus on hiring for operations and sales organization, owning the top of the funnel, in both North and South America Collaborate with the Sr. Technical Recruiter and dedicated Recruiting Coordinator to ensure a high touch candidate experience for the full lifecycle Source and identify passive candidates through multiple tools you recommend as the best to build out Peek’s teams Circulate regular weekly reporting to key recruiting partners Ensure candidate feedback & tracking is up to date with a high level of integrity in our ATS (Lever) Maintain professional and courteous communication with candidates to foster long-term relationships, continually building up your network Work closely with teams and all levels of leadership to present hiring recommendations and raise flags  Requirements 2+ years of Sales Recruiting experience, preferably in SaaS / Tech Excellent written and verbal communication skills You have mastered successful pipeline management using an ATS, LinkedIn, and a variety of other demonstrated channels  Can speak to metrics and utilize them to unblock challenges, make recommendations and report overall efficiency of Peek’s talent hiring process A mix of agency and in-house experience a plus Experience working remotely a plus  Personal Attributes Naturally curious - someone who enjoys research and likes to hunt for top talent Insight driven - you utilize data to help drive your decisions, but understand the complexity of the situation and can provide context & color Growth-minded - eager to expand your skill set and excited to carve out your career path in a hyper-growth setting, take risks and create solutions Desire for impact and biased to action - ready to take on responsibility and work collaboratively with teams and get the job done  Perks and Benefits Stock options with a standard 4 year vesting schedule Medical, dental, vision and other voluntary insurance  401k with 50% matching up to 6% vested over 3-years 10 days of accrued PTO +16 holiday paid days, which includes the holiday shut-down during the weeks of Christmas and New Year  8 weeks parental paid leave for birthing parent and 2 weeks for secondary caregiver  $50 per month WFH allowance to enhance your office, internet and/or connectivity Annual "Peekiversary" gifts  Peek Travel Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. description: The ideal candidate is a motivated, organized, and creative individual who welcomes the challenges of acquiring and developing new business through sales efforts. You will build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and close business deals while maintaining an extensive knowledge of current market conditions.   Responsibilities Cultivate strong business relationships with key decision makers Proactively identify new opportunities and deliver innovative solutions to customers Develop market strategies by researching lists of high potential prospects  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business 3+ years' of sales or account management experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Are you motivated by leading conversations, driving your own schedule, getting things over the finish line and have a competitive desire to win?  Valpak provides integrated print and digital advertising solutions led by our iconic “Blue Envelope” as well as mobile and online platforms. Join a culture known for encouragement, collaboration, having fun - and winning! Valpak is at the heart of communities across North America, helping people save, businesses grow, and neighborhoods thrive.  We Offer: •    Base salary, plus uncapped commission •    Sales bonuses, contests and incentives •    Tools and customer data at your fingertips, including Salesforce.com, leads and prospecting database, tablets, best practice playbooks, a guided sales application and more… •    Comprehensive benefits package  Responsibilities •    Generate new business in assigned area through effective networking, referral generation, and local prospecting, with a demonstrated passion and curiosity about local businesses, for what they do and what they need in order to grow and thrive •    Identify key decision makers by face-to-face and phone call prospecting, as well as use of email, LinkedIn and other contemporary methods within a defined territory to grow and nurture •    Provide exceptional ongoing account management to your existing clients to ensure their programs are successful, to develop trusted relationships and to renew and upgrade their programs •    Work with clients and Valpak designers on high-impact ad design, including effective offers •    Be a product expert and develop compelling and effective marketing solutions from Valpak’s robust and market-leading suite of products, including direct mail, Valpak.com, Web sites, SEM and more •    Meet and exceed established sales goals - and exceed your own personal earnings goals •    Use Salesforce.com to effectively manage your business and participate in Valpak’s customer management ecosystem •    Execute required sales administrative functions to initiate orders and accurately publish ad campaigns •    Love what you do, have fun and be a positive contributor to your local Valpak team  Qualifications •    2+ years of proven success in business development and outside sales •    Experience in print and digital advertising sales preferred •    College degree is preferred, but not required  Knowledge, Skills and Abilities •    Must be a results-oriented self-starter and have a record of success working in a goal-oriented, highly accountable environment •    Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with emphasis on engagement and persuasion •    Curiosity and a true passion for talking face-to-face with local businesses, stimulating interest on their end and helping develop effective client solutions. •    Well-developed contemporary productivity and technological skills (Internet, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, CRM, Mobile and Social) •    Ability to manage deadlines and to operate with a sense of urgency
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: Description  Reporting into the regional sales manager the successful candidate will be tasked with optimising business intelligence subscription sales through proactively identifying, targeting and closing relevant prospects. This includes understanding the market, competition, developing leads, booking appointments with and presenting to decision makers and closing deals over the phone.  Requirements  Requirements Proactively call and engage with all incoming leads. This involves following up on pay wall hits on our websites, first month registrants and email clicks from marketing campaigns. Seek out new opportunities and build a strong pipeline of potential customers and business via existing client base, networking and other means. Research and understand the market whilst working closely with the Sales Team Leader to identify and target key sectors, through intelligent use of the information and data PEI produces. Book multiple virtual meetings daily with decision makers in relevant organisations. Ensure colleagues within the company fully informed of your activities and of all developments within the marketplace, both informally and through formal reporting Assess sales literature used by the team and take a view as to whether it can be improved. If so, co-ordinate this work and ensure each team member uses this in an effective way Contribute to ad hoc projects, reporting & data analysis and attend PEI events to network with prospects and subsequently contact to pitch relevant services as required. Ensure all sales support tasks are completed accurately and to specified deadlines Deliver confident, well-researched and tailored sales presentations to prospective customers. This includes (a) researching the prospective customer (b) identifying relevant profiles/articles in advance of meetings to best demonstrate how the service will suit them. Proactively engage with PEI Client Executive and trialists to ensure that the prospective customer is convinced of the product(s) value to their work. Define decision making process and persuade them to purchase PEI’s services over the phone. Create and maintain accurate up-to-date records in our Microsoft CRM, ensuring best practise on internal processes. Ensure all exchanges with prospective customers including issues, opportunities and competitive information are fully recorded and evaluated. Have a thorough understanding of the market and products. Liaise with colleagues within the business in order to keep up to date with the latest product developments and through your own research. Essential Experience Proven experience as a sales executive or relevant role Good interpersonal and communication skills Desired Experience Minimum 1 year business development experience Essential Knowledge/Skills Negotiating skills Desired Knowledge/Skills Financial Media Sales An interest in Private Equity Personal Characteristics Fast learner and a passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach. Ability to work independently Self-motivated and willing to take responsibility Dynamic and charismatic leader of people: able to lead by example from the front and be the face of a new business area for the company Comfortable operating in a grown-up working environment where regular feedback is provided and the eyes of several (senior) interested parties will always be focused Resilient under pressure – able to remain focused in the face of multiple competing priorities and ensure key deadlines Diplomacy: able to display multi-faceted communication skills in a persuasive, but diplomatic way to ensure that outstanding results are achieved, and the right deadlines and initiatives get prioritized High degree of personal pride in own and company work, constantly striving to improve Motivation Highly goal-focused and motivated by achieving high personal standards in all aspects of work – ambitious to meet own personal and organisational goals Desire to be part of a dynamic business with high growth expectations Keen to stretch self and develop career at PEI We strive to ensure that opportunities to work and develop at PEI Media are fair, inclusive, and open to all. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of age, disability, gender identity, or gender expression, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, or any other equality characteristic  PEI Media supports flexible working arrangements, and we welcome career returners.  Benefits Competitive base salary + uncapped commission Healthcare options 401K 24 days PTO annually with options to sell or purchase additional days Up to 10 sick days annually Flexible and hybrid working options Career progression / further learning support Family friendly policies Employee Assistance Program offering free/low-cost resources

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Digital Sales Account Executive for Poultry North America is responsible for developing and executing Cargill Digital Solutions’ commercial vision and achieve short- and medium-term goals for the customer accounts that will drive growth for Cargill Animal Nutrition, while providing customers with software and technology solutions to improve customer production and profitability.This role will focus on explaining the value of the Digital portfolio of software and technology in close collaboration with local Cargill nutrition poultry sales teams. As such, we seek a seasoned professional that can work independently, knows the poultry industry well, has excellent customer relationship skills, and is able to become a subject matter expert in applying different technology in poultry production.  Location: This is a remote position within Eastern US only.  Key Accountabilities Develop and execute the sales planning process for complex accounts for multiple value propositions and solutions as part of the account plan. Develop and structure complex sales proposals that represent maximum value optimization to customer and business. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price, and service strategies. Work with Cargill Animal Nutrition sales teams to align on goals and build actions plans to achieve results. Analyse competitor capabilities to determine gaps and to position offerings against competitive options. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned. External applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within Eastern US only. Minimum travel may be required Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in any relevant business discipline. Minimum of four years of related work experience preferably in poultry nutrition industry. Working experience with presentations and communication using Microsoft tools. Open to create reports and be able to share technical knowledge to non-technical audience. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in animal nutrition or science. Master`s degree will be a plus. Minimun five years of business experience in value added sales solution in poultry nutrition and / or health industry. Proven performance that demonstrates high accountability, strong initiative, with a sense-of-urgency and an entrepreneurial approach. Solid interpersonal skills; being an effective listener, verbal, and written communication. Experience with go-to-market, including sales Strong entrepreneurial spirit; skilled in market assessment, strategy development and annual business planning. Ability to travel up to 35% within North America (post Covid-19). Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: Tock is looking for an experienced and motivated Territory Account Executive (Sales) to join our growing team. As a member of Tock's growing sales organization, you'll be part of a dynamic group, working alongside some of the world’s best Chefs, accomplished entrepreneurs, and world famous restaurant owners. The ideal candidate is interested in working in a startup environment and is excited about the restaurant and hospitality industry.  You will continuously build a high-quality, strategic pipeline to drive the adoption of Tock to customers. As a TAE, you will be responsible for managing the end-to-end sales process; lead generation, solution demoing, negotiation, and hand-off to our implementation team to ensure customer success.  What We're Looking For 2+ years selling software (SaaS experience preferred) Proven track record of meeting and/or exceeding sales quotas Proven negotiation skills Knowledge of restaurant operations Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong work ethic and high level of professionalism Experience using Salesforce to manage pipeline Bachelor’s Degree What You’ll Do Pitch Tock to replace and improve current reservation systems Meet and exceed sales revenue goals and overall business objectives Manage the entire sales process from lead generation to contract negotiation Become a Tock product expert to lead online and onsite product demonstrations Build your territory pipeline of prospects through cold-calling, internet search, and professional networking Manage complex sales and develop strategic plans Organize and manage daily activity within Salesforce Collaborate with Tock’s Account Management team to ensure expectations set during the sales process are achieved during implementation
