description: SALES ACCOUNT MANAGER - JOB DESCRIPTION Position Summary: Title:              Sales Account Manager Reports to:    CEO Location:       San Jose, CA Education:    Bachelor’s degree in Business/Science/Engineering (preferred) Experience:    5+ years Business Management/Engineering/Sales Logistics or Service Operations and/or Semiconductor experience  Pure Wafer is looking for a bubbly, communicative and experienced Semiconductor professional to join the Sales team as a Sales Account Manager. The role will focus on driving customer success with our top equipment manufacturer clients in the Semiconductor markets. The ideal candidate will play an integral role in managing customer relations, delivering new business pitches and the achievement of defined sales objectives. As a member of the Pure Wafer Sales team, they will be responsible for developing existing business in near term and building the foundation for continued profitable revenue growth over the long term.  Primary Responsibilities: Outbound and inbound account management and sales Develop deep customer knowledge and influence through forging executive relationships, increasing Pure Wafer’s reputation as a proven partner, increasing customer satisfaction and our footprint within the Key Accounts and/or regions. Coordinates sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes used within the sales organization. Proactively monitors and strives to maintain high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in the sales organization’s planning efforts Managing company accounts and track key metrics Processing customer orders for domestic and international shipments, including generating appropriate paperwork Collaborate with Customer service, Quality, Planning, and Purchasing to resolve logistics issues or queries they may have Provide support in the planning and tracking of the shipment of finished orders Project management of new revenue streams for customer accounts. Coordinate all team efforts towards the projects’ success  About the Ideal Candidate: Strategic and target-driven Enjoys working with a team in an energetic and open working environment Results orientated and customer/account focused Engaging, empathetic with ability to challenge at senior level Self-motivated, self-sufficient, and accountable Adapts well to change Highly organized and detail oriented Excellent communication skills both verbal and written Excellent project, planning, change and time management capabilities Driven to be successful Experience in Logistics, sales, or service operations and/or project management

Job Summary  Brewer’s Supply Group (BSG), a subsidiary of Rahr Corporation, supports the craft beer, wine and distilling industries as a one-stop shop for industry related supplies and ingredients. Rahr Corporation (Rahr) is a family-owned global leader in the production and distribution of barley malt and related brewing supplies in operation since 1847. In support of long-term growth and sustainability, the Business Development Manager will develop strong relationships with new and existing customers; working closely with internal stakeholders towards packaging sales grow; identify sales leads; communication value offer to prospective customers; maintaining customer satisfaction and retention; answering client queries; and identify new business opportunities among existing customers. The Business Development Manager must have sales experience, possess strong business communication, organizational and interpersonal skills, be detail-oriented and able to work effectively in intense, dynamic situations. Technical packaging line experience would be an asset.  This role will cover the Eastern US.  Roles And Responsibilities Engage and support customers and internal stakeholders relating to packaging queries and business activities pre and post-sale. Manage all packaging sales activities including customer inquiries, presenting packaging value offering, follow up on sales leads, web site inquires, and reporting activity on new and existing business. Provide technical support to customers and internal teams relating to packaging products and services. Work closely with the commercial team towards on-boarding new customers and business. Attend customer site visits and trade shows. Prepare and present customer business reviews and presentations. Prepare sales budgets and forecasts. Establish and manage customer forecasts, service/supply agreements and/or inventory programs. Communicate and present company packaging value offering to customers. Report and update sales activity, opportunities, customer records and tasks in CRM Salesforce.com. Build and maintain appropriate sales and customer information records. Assist with developing and maintaining sales and training tools for all packaging products and services. Social media engagement relating to packaging products and events. Provide back up support for the commercial team as required. Performs other related tasks as required. Minimum Education & Work Requirements Bachelor’s degree required. Must have 2 - 5 years’ experience working in within the packaging industry, preferably in an account management or inside sales role. Strong working knowledge of MS Office applications (PowerPoint/Excel/Word). Experience working in CRM (Salesforce.com) and ERP environments would be an asset. A valid driver’s license and passport are required. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Demonstrates strong leadership, and a strategic approach with a customer- first focus. Understands goals, key drivers, and needs of customers and internal stakeholders. Displays a strong knowledge of industry, market, and beverage can products. Possesses impactful business presentation and communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills. Initiates contact and builds strong, lasting working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Results-oriented and consistent in approach to tasks. Displays a proactive work ethic and is committed to seeing tasks through to completion. Recognizes quickly when progress is stalling and takes immediate action to get back on track. Demonstrates responsiveness and reacts with appropriate urgency to situations that require quick action or turnaround. Adapts well to changing circumstances, direction, and strategy. Demonstrates ability to respond to fluid situations. Technical packaging line experience would be an asset. Experience working in CRM (Salesforce.com) and ERP environments would be an asset.

Welcome to Vaco – an uncommon company with an empowered culture. At Vaco, we welcome talented malcontents seeking a collaborative environment where creative freedom rings.    If you are feeling trapped in your current J-O-B, we invite you to explore the career of a lifetime with us. Since 2002, we have grown to over $750 MM in annual revenue and more than 40 locations. And with no plans of slowing down anytime soon, we are seeking big thinkers to lead us into the future.    If you are looking for a conservative, bureaucratic corporation, Vaco may not be the place for you. If, however, you are a lifetime learner who thrives in a high growth, entrepreneurial environment, read on!   Ranked the #1 Best Staffing Firm to Work for in North America by Staffing Industry Analysts (Category: 500+ Employees)  An Inc. 5000 fastest growing private company in America every year since 2007!   A Day in the Life  The Business Development Associate is a professional networker and relationship builder who enjoys working with professionals from a wide range of industries. This position is responsible for generating sales, increasing revenue and profitability while achieving performance metrics.     Skill sets served include but are not limited to transactional accounting, finance, administration, and operations (A/P, A/R, Payroll, Billing, Collections, Administrative Support, Marketing, Sales and Human Resources).    Duties and Responsibilities  Establish and develop client relationships on an ongoing basis.   Conduct prospecting activities including phone/email outreach, client visits, and other methods.   Actively develop and maintain a target account list.  Manage open job orders from intake to fulfillment.   Generate leads via professional relationships, candidate interviews, and other interactions that support business development/sales efforts.   Achieve performance objectives relating to activity and individual Gross Margin according to job level and line of business.    Consistently utilize Applicant Tracking System to log all activity.  Collaborate with teammates to cross-sell and/or fulfill open positions across other lines of business and/or national practices as appropriate.   The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.   ‘Best Place to Work’ Perks  True base salary and uncapped commission plans that surpass industry standards.  Annual, FIVE STAR vacations (we call it “Vatopia”) for meeting top tier performance goals.  Annual world class training where all Vacotians, as we like to call them, get together to meet, learn, and exchange ideas.   Generous PTO that increases with tenure.  Technology packages that include smart phone coverage, up-to-date equipment, and top tier online resources.  Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401k, pet insurance, life insurance, disability and more!    Vaco Values  Duties and responsibilities are to be performed while observing the following Core Tenets:  A Team First Approach, aligning with the core tenets: Proud to Wear Jersey, Stay Team Focused, and Assume Positive Intent  Self-Awareness, aligning with the core tenets Outlaws Welcome, Stay Coachable and Be Comfortable with Healthy Conflict  Solutions Oriented, aligning with the core tenets Be Entrepreneurial, Be Electable, Fix the Problem Not the Blame   Grit, aligning with the core tenets Work Hard, Stay Free and Play ‘til the Whistle.   Desired Competencies and Skills:  Communication: Speaks in a clear, concise and confident manner; listens attentively  Judgement: Forms reasonable interpretations about relationships and situations that affect actions. Develops objective opinions.   Marketing: Interprets, delivers, and communicates value to appropriate target audience.    Emotional Intelligence: Maintains a high level of self-awareness and the ability to appropriately identify, manage, and respond to the emotions of self and others; able to read others.  Written Communication: Develops written communication that is clear, concise, grammatical, and engaging.  Adaptability: Responds to changes, delays, or unexpected events in a positive manner; adapts working style to best fit a given situation.   Leadership: Self-directed with an innate drive to succeed; Accepts feedback with a desire for continuous improvement. Ethical.   Relationship Building: Builds, develops, and maintains strong relationships with others while building trust and connection.   Social Confidence: Exhibits self-confidence in social settings and when dealing with others.    Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.    Education/Experience:   Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 2 to 3 years’ B2B sales and or recruitment.   Advanced, relevant experience considered in lieu of Bachelor’s Degree.   Proven success achieving and/or exceeding performance goals.  Detailed, organized, and adaptable.  Economically motivated with high desire toB grow professionally and financially.   Technical Skills:   Must have working knowledge of MS Office Suite  Experience with Bullhorn preferred.   Basic Skills:   Able to work with a sense of urgency and meet tight deadlines; Organized, detailed, and results driven.   Travel:  <10% -Occasional travel to annual conference or client sites

description: Summary:  Does this describe you? You...  ...have a voracious appetite for learning new things. ...are someone who can explain just about anything to anyone. ...like helping people while staying patient, level-headed, and super cool under pressure. ...identify and solve problems before being asked to look into them. ...get excited about helping people and businesses to grow.  If so, we want to speak to you about a great Account Management Associate position based in north Austin, TX!  Who are we? Meet 360Connect:  At 360Connect we help our customers solving one of the most challenging problems in business – acquiring new customers. We do this by providing “marketing in a box” where we find, qualify, and deliver sales-ready prospects to our clients. On average, our customers see a $7-to-$15 return on every $1 they spend on our service and currently rate us at 4.6 stars on Google Reviews.  As one customer put it “360Connect leads help put us on the 20-yard line...and every little bit helps these days!”  To learn more about us, check out our website at www.360Connect.com. We have a diverse team of hard-working, fun-loving individuals. We believe in six core values which include:  Do what it takes to deliver excellent results. Bring a proactive, solution-oriented attitude. Act with integrity and respect. Communicate directly and honestly. Do what you say you are going to do. Always learn and try new things.  We “walk the talk” on our core values at 360Connect. The Austin-American Statesman has named us as a “Best Places to Work” for the last six years in a row. We are the only digital company in Austin to have received the award more than once! Does this sound like a place you would like to work? We would love to talk to you!  What you will do - Job Responsibilities: Work with a group of clients to ensure their goals are being met. In order to meet performance expectations and handle the appropriate workload to provide excellent service to customers, we require you to at least type over 45WPM. Regularly communicate with customers primarily via phone and email. Monitor client budgets, spending, and revenue. Be able to explain account performance to clients. If needed, work with clients to help save them from canceling. Maintain strong relationships with existing clients and seek avenues to expand budgets.  What we are looking for - Qualifications: Has 1-2 years of sales or client services experience. Exhibits sound reasoning to effectively support client success Is a self-starter, can take initiative to grow client accounts Has a confident phone presence Can multitask a number of different activities Is organized and detail-oriented with good computer skills. Live in the Austin, TX area  Job Type: Full-time  Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Retirement plan  Schedule: Monday to Friday  COVID-19 considerations: The 360Connect team is currently working in the office Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays. Monday and Fridays are optional work-from-home days. We will always put the safety of our team first. We wear masks when we leave our desks.  Location: Austin, TX (Preferred)  Work authorization: United States (Required)  Application Question: How proficient are you at typing? a. I use the standard home rows can type without looking b. I use the standard home rows, need to look down sometimes c. Hunt and peck, multiple fingers d. Hunt and peck, index fingers only  Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

About Remote  Remote is solving global remote organizations' biggest challenge: employing anyone anywhere compliantly. We make it possible for businesses big and small to employ a global team by handling global payroll, benefits, taxes, and compliance (learn more about how it works). We're backed by A+ investors and our team is world-class, literally and figuratively, as we're all scattered around the world.  Please check out our public handbook to learn more about our culture. We encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age and abilities to apply. You can also check out independent reviews by other candidates on Glassdoor. If this job description resonates with you, we want to hear from you!  All of our positions are fully remote. You do not have to relocate to join us!  How we work  This is an exciting time to join Remote and make a personal difference in the global employment space as a Senior Inside Sales Representative, joining our Sales team.  We love working async and this means you get to do your own schedule.  We empower ownership and proactiveness and when in doubt default to action instead of waiting.  Requirements Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Active-listener High level of integrity and work ethic Self-motivated and self-directed; able to work independently and as an active member of the team Efficient in multitasking, prioritization, and time management In-depth understanding of company services and its position in the industry Detailed knowledge of sales process from initiation to close Proven ability to initiate and convert prospects, close deals and achieve/exceed sales quotas Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning, call control, account development, and time management. Success in qualifying opportunities involving multiple key decision makers Previous inside sales/account management experience, or related sales experience Strong problem identification and objections resolution skills Writes and speaks fluent English Experience working remotely is considered a plus Two to three years of direct work experience in a sales or telesales capacity. Experience with customer relationship management software.  Key Responsibilities Qualify leads from digital campaigns, conferences, references, trade shows, etc., and provide deeper discovery and management of qualifying leads passed over from SDR team. Create and maintain a list/database of prospective clients ensuring timely follow up Efficiently present and deliver information to potential clients Proactively answer prospective client questions Internal collaboration with departments that support client process and experience Close sales deals and work with client through closing process to ensure positive experience  Who You Are You possess an excellent understanding of the full sales cycle and sales processes Continuous learner Self-starting and driven Coachable Kind communicator with positive mindset Good team player and collaborator  Remote Compensation Philosophy  Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair unbiased compensation and fair pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labour practices and therefore pay a minimum annual salary of USD 40,000 per year, in all locations throughout the world. Actual compensation may vary based upon geographical location, experience, and/or skill level. However, it will never be below our minimum global compensation mentioned.  Benefits  You can learn more about the benefits we're offering to all internal employees at Remote by visiting our public Benefits & Perks Handbook page.  Practicals You'll report to: Sr. Manager of SMB Team: Sales Location: Anywhere Start date: As soon as possible  Application process (async) Resume review Interview with Recruiter Interview with hiring manager (30 min) Interview with 2 sales team members - ISR/AE (30 min each) Interview with sales leader (30 min) (async) Offer  How to apply  Please fill out the form below. Don't forget to add your CV (ideally as a PDF) and a cover letter (at most a single page) explaining why do you think there's a match between this particular role and your profile. Thank you!

description: Our company is seeking a highly talented Sales Manager to be part of our team. Come and be a part of an established, yet fast growing company driven by an innovative culture and excellent products. We want our sales team to be engaged and share ideas and how we can all grow and advance as a team. We provide a flexible work schedule with a focus on results. Hard work is expected but not without having fun as well.  Join the best in the business and be part of an amazing team! APPLY TODAY.  What We Offer: Competitive pay rates Monthly incentives at no cap for specific KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) $5k-$10k-$100k+ $2000 per month car and cell phone allowance plus commissions New account bonuses Generous Paid Time-Off Company discounts Paid training Responsibilities: Build and maintain relationships with both on and off premise owners and managers within key territory Increase rate of sale for key brands within the category portfolio: wine, spirits, sparkling and more Deliver execution excellence via merchandising store resets and POS placement Utilize data analytics to identify gaps and opportunities for increasing volume and distribution Execute best in class consumer activation via sampling Achieve and/or exceed monthly KPIs Qualifications: Access to reliable transportation within your territory is critical Prior experience working in traditional retail (CPG) and/or bars or restaurants preferred Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to make oral presentations Must be comfortable selling wine, spirits and closing sales in person and on telephone Ability to develop strategic plans and make sound decisions to grow the business Track record of building and maintaining customer/client relationships and customer satisfaction Self-driven with the aptitude to work independently as well as a team Flexible and adaptable; Impeccable time management skills Strong computer skills / access to reliable computer and internet access Willingness to travel within the territory 95% of the time Applicants must be over 21 years old to be considered for this position

description: Do you enjoy establishing relationships with customers and truly care about the entire customer experience? Do you have a knack for connecting and building rapport with people, making a prospect's purchasing journey smooth and seamless? Then you might be the Account Executive that our sales team is looking for! Ricoma International is a global leader in the fashion and technology space, specializing in the R&D, design, manufacturing, and distribution of commercial embroidery machines and other apparel decoration products. We are looking to expand our sales team with smart and outspoken individuals who have B2B sales experience. The ideal candidate should have an understanding of a consultative selling process and has a passion for building relationships, providing value and insight to the prospect at every step and interaction. The Account Executive will be handling all aspects of a deal from discovery to closing. Get the chance to really make an impact in a fast-growing company at the heart and intersection of fashion and technology. Inside sales position. Leads are provided, no cold-calling required. Compensation: Base with uncapped commissions. Average $70-80k OTE with top performers earning $90k+. Duties and Responsibilities Engage with new leads, build and establish existing pipelines, and service existing accounts to obtain repeat business Keep internal CRM up-to-date and record various interactions to allow proper follow-ups with prospective clients Maintain constant communication with prospective clients for follow-ups in the sales process Adjust content of sales proposals, presentations, and other relevant materials to suit specific client needs Own your own pipeline of clients and manage the sales process from end to end: client discovery through negotiation and closing Demonstrate the usage of our products at tradeshows or virtual demos to guide customers in the research and decision-making process Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, and merchandising techniques, etc. Recommend changes in products, services, and policies by evaluating results, competitive developments, and client feedback Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Knowledge, Skills, and Education Strong written and spoken English is required Ability to travel up to 20-25% for tradeshows is required Excellent presentation, negotiation, and communication skills are necessary Ability to establish a rapport and connection with new leads to close transactions, follow up with existing leads in the pipeline, and maintain relationships with established accounts Strong attention to detail Ability to think quickly and adapt to client questions Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Business Management, or any related discipline is preferred Previous sales or customer-facing experience is preferred Experience with Salesforce CRM a plus

Job Location: Minneapolis, MN  This position can also be remote in the Mid West near a major airport  Summary  The Customer Sales Executive (CSE) is responsible for profitably growing assigned customer(s) and Hershey’s business to achieve objectives and plans, including net sales, market share, trade spend, and sales activity margin. Responsibilities include business planning & analysis, creating valued business partnerships with customers by becoming a business advisor, and achieving mutually beneficial agreements through skilled negotiation and understanding of the customers business. The CSE will also leverage insights to build a 1 to 3 year business plan and deploy supporting tactics to achieve financial objectives.  The CSE on UNFI Seasons will oversee and execute planning with both the Corporate Retail banner of SuperValu (Cub Foods), as well as the Regional offices. The role will also entail direct responsibilities on key Independent customers that are supplied by SuperValu in the region. These include Lunds & Byerlys, Festival Foods,& Niemanns. Customizing activity for each of these banners is key to the team’s success, along with sharing overall SuperValu strategies and plans with the customer group. The CSE will work with four (4) other CSEs on SuperValu (East, West, Pacific North West and Central Regions) to coordinate seasonal flow planning and activation plans.  Responsibilities Achieve net sales, market share, trade spend, and sales activity margin targets for assigned customer(s) by simulating and planning incremental volume and pre and post analysis as well as displaying core competencies and behaviors. This includes judiciously managing and allocating trade funds (maintaining compliance with all Sarbanes Oxley policies) to achieve profitable sales growth. Effectively utilize Hershey’s analytical tools (e.g. PlanEx) and processes to drive profitable and predictable sales results. Build and maintain appropriate sales plans in PlanEx. Manage trade fund budget to include clearing deductions. Monitor and control customer expenses to include WASTE and supply chain costs. Provide category analysis and consumer insights to customers as well as other category tools/consultation with CSI partnership. Develop and provide resources and tools to the retail team. Achieve appropriate levels of account penetration. Alignment with retail team through participation in retail meetings as well as field visits with appropriate Retail management. Lead presenter at ECRM for our Seasonal platform to UNFI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree strongly preferred. Experience: At least 2 years relevant sales experience. description: Why Vacasa  We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we’re the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You’ll fit right in here if you’re curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.  Why Sales at Vacasa?  If Vacasa’s incredible growth didn’t make it obvious, we’re good at what we do. We’re people people. We think on our feet and respond with tailored solutions. Our team has the street smarts, ambition, and talent to turn every potential market into a Vacasa community.  What We’re Looking For  We are looking for a Sales Executive to grow our short term rental inventory, selling Vacasa’s property management solution to homeowners in an assigned territory. Vacasa Sales Executives work in a high velocity sales environment and are expected to meet monthly and quarterly sales objectives. The role requires a variety of skills including researching our competitors and local regulations, developing referral networks with local real estate agents and other potential sources within the vacation rental industry, drafting customized letters to potential clients, cold calling prospective leads, systematically managing leads, setting appointments, meeting with prospective clients, closing sales, representing our company in a professional and collaborative manner in the community and contributing to the strategic direction for the Sales Team.  You will work closely with your manager to advance your career goals in line with the goals of Vacasa. This will require knowledge of the vacation rental industry, the ability to act as a consultant to homeowners, and to initiate what will be long term relationships with clients.  Successful candidates will be strong communicators who are comfortable contacting leads over the phone and in-person or via video conference, can learn and adapt quickly, are grounded in ethical business practices, and find reward in building a strong organization. Consistently meeting departmental goals while maintaining high customer satisfaction is a must. You will need to demonstrate a track record of excellence as a team player who is also self-motivated, reliable, and coachable.  What You’ll Do Primary duty will be to handle inbound/outbound sales operations through telesales, video conferencing, and in-person meetings Collaborate with teams to identify opportunities, plan and execute management portfolio growth Work closely with local Operations and support staff to ensure owner satisfaction Learn and communicate company services and policies to stay current with changes Consistently log and update sales activities in the company-specific CRM Handle a large volume of networking and lead generation while managing your sales pipeline through the various sales development stages Attend weekly department meetings Skills You’ll Need Ability to generate sales opportunities and build trust with prospects over the phone, work with other team members, and close sales Must be able to develop confidence with prospects and become an industry knowledgeable expert Grounded in ethical business practices Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience and education Self-motivated and self-sufficient, while having the willingness to seek guidance and direction as needed Solid computer skills including experience with G Suite and cloud computing programs Be able to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment while positively representing the company Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written Ability to set and exceed aggressive individual and organizational goals Real estate or property management experience a plus but not required Working conditions  Home office or Vacasa office setting to start with occasional virtual training sessions and occasional offsite team meetings in our various regions. Requires frequent, repetitive use of a computer, phone, and office equipment. Requires patient, professional communication with prospective clients, and the ability to build confidence with prospects.  What You’ll Get Uncapped earning potential Health/dental/vision insurance—100% coverage option Employer Sponsored & Voluntary Supplemental Benefits 401K retirement savings plan with immediate 100% company match on the first 6% you contribute Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts Flexible vacation time Paid sick days and holidays Paid parental leave after one year of tenure Employee Assistance Program Career advancement opportunities Employee discounts and All the equipment you’ll need to be successful Great colleagues and culture Please visit our careers page to review our full benefits offerings Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law.  Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.  An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

description: We’re transforming the software industry. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team.  Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester, and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace.   Flexera delivers Technology Value Optimization solutions that enable some of the largest companies in the world to inform their IT so they can transform their IT. From on-prem to the cloud, companies can get the IT asset data needed to rightsize, reallocate spend, reduce risk and maximize ROI.  The Role As a Territory Account Manager, you will meet/exceed assigned revenue goals working with a virtual team of Systems Engineers, Business Development, Channels, Marketing, and other members of your Flexera ecosystem, including Solution and Channel Partners. You will follow up on leads, perform deep discovery, use product demos for qualified customers and lead the technical validation process. You know how to work "smarter" not harder and drive standard methodologies to ensure success to win as a team. In addition, you will also successfully:  Responsibilities: Be responsible for the business by building and developing account relationships through personalized contact, understanding of account’s needs, and ability to effectively communicate the value of Flexera’s solutions Lead sales campaigns and motions that build customer value and enable multi-year, multi-solution transactions Accurately forecast opportunities based upon realistic assessments and consistently deliver against that forecast Support Channel Partners to create net new customer opportunities and upgrade/expansion opportunities in customer accounts  Requirements: 2+ years of experience in selling enterprise IT software solutions (asset management, cloud management, data analytics, security software, enterprise applications, business processing outsourcing, risk management software or networking performance) or 3-5 years in outside B2B sales or technology/business consulting Utilize a defined Sales Methodology (re: MEDDPICC, MEDDIC, Sandler, SPIN) for business needs/business pain understanding Successful experience running the entire sales cycle - direct responsibility for your own quota or have created new revenue streams with accounts Strong reputation of exceeding sales quota (top 20% in your sales organization) You have successfully owned and led the end-to-end sales process (this is not an overlay or team quota) Consultative sales experience targeting relevant companies/businesses to drive cost savings and efficiencies throughout their IT organization Successful in finding and uncovering opportunities with net new and existing accounts, via creative prospecting tactics and hunting activities Consistent track record of using a repeatable sales process for successful deal Finding, Engaging, Running & Closing Highly motivated and professional, with excellent verbal communication, presentation, and social skills A rational, logical, and analytical thinker You have shown strong technical aptitude and are passionate about technology sales CRM system (Salesforce.com); experience working with Word, Excel, Powerpoint Excellent listening skills with the attested ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks to meet deadlines Self-starter able to work independently but also a giving member of a team Willingness and desire to learn new things and ways to be more efficient and effective Excellent conflict resolution skills Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience

jobTitle: Sales Representative - Mid-Atlantic - Spine Enabling Technologies
description: Who We Want  Challengers. People who seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions.  Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward.  Charismatic networkers. Relationship-savvy people who intentionally make connections with both internal partners and external contacts.  Strategic closers. Salespeople who close profitable business and consistently exceed their performance objectives.  Customer-oriented achievers. Representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who bring value to their partnerships.  Game changers. Persistent salespeople who will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  What You Will Do  As a Stryker Spine Enabling Technologies Sales Representative, you will strategically promote and sell Stryker Spine & Cranial Navigation, Imaging and planning software products to meet our customers’ needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in the operating room and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your wins with your Regional Manager and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve product problems and inform doctors, nurses and other staff as to the proper use and maintenance of our products. You take great pride in excellent service and are prepared to assist a customer whenever the need arises. As a Spine Enabling Technologies Sales Representative, you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better.  What You Need 5+ years in an outside sales position (medical related fields or b2b sales preferred) or Bachelor’s Degree from an Accredited University with at least 2+ years of outside sales experience preferred Travel Requirement Approximately 20% travel. Must have a valid driver’s license and be able to drive an automobile. Physical Requirements Medium work: exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects Coordination of the eye, hand and foot movement with an ability to grasp by hand and meet cognitive demands to include visual and auditory discrimination / memory, reading ability and memory retention Mental Requirements Exercise discretion and independence when applying professional expertise Must be able to manage time, projects, stress and conflict Must possess strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication Must be able to bring tasks through to completion with minimal supervision Must have the ability to prioritize work and keep detailed and confidential records Must be able to communicate / present to large groups of people Must possess unwavering ethics & integrity in a competitive and demanding work environment Stryker Will Provide In-house product training program Field sales training The Company  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  Learn more about the SET Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/navigation.html  #LIInstruments

description: Egencia, an Expedia Group company, makes business travel better. Combining technology and service, we build a seamless experience, where companies have access to a user-friendly interface, diverse travel options, and 24/7 global support. Join our mission and help us take the next steps in redefining the world of business travel.This position will be located in either our Chicago office and be responsible for creating outbound connections for our Sales Executive team. This role is a key part of our sales team, contacting potentially interested decision-makers to discuss Egencia. It’s a great opportunity to put your prospecting skills to work!  Who You Are You are an optimist. You are rejection-proof. You are not phased when people ignore your emails and calls, the challenge of cutting through the clutter motivates you. You possess a deep desire to learn enterprise SAAS sales from the ground up, and can demonstrate that you have what it takes to be a rainmaker. You are bold, optimistic, confident and you love to win. You are both adaptable and inventive; you will never say “that’s just how we’ve always done it”, instead looking for new ways to increase your impact. You absorb and implement change quickly with limited disruption to your day-to-day production and workflow. You prioritize tasks and are able to handle several disparate tasks throughout your workday. You are proficient with Salesforce.com, Marketo, LinkedIn, Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel. You have a minimum of one year's experience in outbound lead generation and a desire to build upon your sales ambitions. What You’ll Do Research and build weekly prospective customer lists in targeted territories, performing daily cold-calling outreaches to grow your own pipeline. Utilize Salesforce.com, Marketo, InsideView, LinkedIn, and other tools to lead, track, and report on all prospecting activity and results. Actively partner with Marketing, Sales Management and individual Sales Reps to pursue territories, develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business. Articulate the Egencia Value Proposition to decision-makers, conducting high-level conversations with senior executives in targeted prospective accounts. Continue to grow in your sales career, demonstrating passion and polish while identifying the customers best positioned to partner with us Egencia started out by disrupting the business travel technology industry and we haven’t stopped since. We are purpose-built to provide the industry’s best travel management experience – and we’re continually investing to make it even better, faster, and easier for people to connect with confidence. Learn more at egencia.com and follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn.  Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. This employer participates in E-Verify. The employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) with information from each new employee's I-9 to confirm work authorization.

description: About Force:  Founded in 2010, Force Therapeutics is the leading patient engagement platform and research network designed to help clinicians intelligently extend their reach. Our platform leverages video and digital connections to directly engage patients at every step of the care journey – from the point of surgery scheduling, to post-op recovery and beyond. Backed by millions of clinically-validated patient data points and insights from more than 70 leading healthcare centers across the country, Force is proven to drive more effective recovery, lower costs, and achieve better patient outcomes.  Overview:  Force Therapeutics is the leading digital musculoskeletal care provider for 70+ leading health centers across the United States. With over a decade of experience and 110+ research publications behind our solutions, Force partners with healthcare organizations on their journey to succeeding in value-based care. Force provides best-in-class patient engagement with 85% opt-in, superior patient-reported data collection and analytics, and a suite of proprietary tools for providers to deliver personalized care plans to patients and monitor their progress in real-time.  We are hiring a Clinical Account Executive to join our growing Sales & Partnerships team. Force approaches business development through a clinical lens, and the Sales & Partnerships team works closely with Marketing, Client Success & Strategy, and Product teams to thoughtfully and consistently improve our go-to-market approach.  Responsibilities: Contribute to team achieving new logo targets for assigned prospect segments Build and maintain deep relationships with prospects Leverage clinical expertise to design and sell the best Force solution for each opportunity Manage full sales process for each qualified opportunity in assigned segment, from introduction to product demonstrations to business case and mutual action plan creation to contract execution Uphold sales process best practices (updating SalesForce, completing MBOs, leveraging client-title mapping, building MAPs, etc) Facilitate smooth hand-off of closed / won opportunities to Client Success & Strategy team for fast implementation Actively prospect and source qualified new logo opportunities (in collaboration with Marketing team) Contribute to internal and market-facing thought leadership initiatives Collaborate with colleagues across Force to on commercial and company-wide initiatives  Requirements: Bachelor's / advanced degree in a clinical care specialty - i.e. nursing, PT / OT, other (required) 2-5 years of healthcare experience (required) 1-3 years B2B sales experience, ideally inside sales of SaaS or services in the healthcare industry (preferred) Motivation and demonstrated success in achieving and exceeding performance targets Excellent task management, responsiveness, and attention to detail Ability to adapt and be flexible in a fast paced work environment Experience or passion to drive business growth + strategy as part of an innovative healthtech company Excellent questioning, listening, and storytelling skills Solution-oriented and able to take constructive feedback Strong ability to influence others, primarily through emails and video calls Ability to travel nationally as needed (although most of our sales process is currently remote)  Perks and Benefits: Competitive compensation with commission on closed business Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance 12 month free Talkspace membership 401k retirement planning Unlimited sick and safe leave Summer Fridays Pre-tax commuter benefits Annual company off-site Flexibility to work remotely nationwide or a hybrid work schedule, based out of our brand new pandemic-safe NYC office A crucial role at a rapidly growing healthtech company that will allow you to actively influence the business' path forward and go-to-market strategy  You must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: ARE YOU INTERESTED IN JOINING A HYPER-GROWTH LOGISTICS TECH COMPANY? Are you hungry and motivated to exceed expectations while launching your career in sales? Do you believe in game-changing innovations and are excited about reimagining an 800 billion dollar industry? Do you want to join a rocketship that has had +200% growth of year-over-year revenue?  If so, nice to meet you! We are Loadsmart and we are searching for an Account Sales Representative to join our growing team. We are a Series C-funded logistic technology company that has increased our revenue by 200% year over year, led by a leadership team of logistics veterans and experienced engineers, product leaders and data scientists continuing to disrupt this $800 billion industry.  LOCATION: Chicago, IL OR Phoenix, AZ - we are operating with a hybrid environment where you’re asked to come into our brand new, super fun office (free lunches/happy hours/games and more) during training and then come into the office at least 3 days a week    WHAT YOU GET TO DO… Actively prospect new business opportunities with high-volume outreach via cold calls, email, LinkedIn and on-site or virtual meetings to build a pipeline of customers to sell FTL, Intermodal and other logistics services Actively manage existing clients to increase bookings, margins, and customer satisfaction Identify key decision makers and business drivers, and relentlessly present the Loadsmart pitch in a compelling way Adeptly guide customers through integration projects, contracts, RFPs and onboarding processes. Exhibit utmost dedication to constantly refining your sales skills. Practice frequent role play, objection handling exercises and pitch demos. Actively seek and apply constructive feedback and data analysis observations to constantly refine your approach. Become a subject matter expert on our business, including processes, operations, the competitive landscape, and remaining up-to-date on industry news.Insightfully evaluate Loadsmart’s current product offerings and roadmap. Actively share customer feedback and your own observations with Loadsmart Product and Engineering teams to enhance value for your customers. Participate as an active member of our collaborative sales team and contribute to our culture of sales success.  WHAT ABOUT YOU? 1+ year work experience in any type of B2B sales with outbound cold calling A consistent track record of achieving quota as well as experience with CRMs and tools such Salesforce, SalesLoft, ZoomInfo and LinkedIn Sales Navigator preferred We offer career paths with quarterly developmental reviews, promotions and raises (based on your performance; ask your recruiter about our automatic CLEAR career progression program!)  YOUR COLLEAGUES WOULD DESCRIBE YOU AS: Competitive - we like to win and hope you do too Coachable - we believe in helping you to become the best you can be Social, people person - our business is about relationships with our customers and your teammates High energy and resilient - any sales job requires the ability to push through adversity and rejections to achieve greatness Curious and creative - you should be a part of building something great and we welcome ideas from all Loadies!  WORKING AT LOADSMART Prosperity • Starting base salary $50,000 that are reviewed quarterly - we believe in rewarding top talent (an average quarterly increase is $5,000) • Sign On bonus! • Uncapped commission plan - our top earners are making six figures after 12 months! • Equity package - become a shareholder in our company! • 401k Match up to $5,000  Good Health • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans • Commuter benefits and membership with DIVVY Bike  Happiness! • 10 Paid holidays, plus 15 days of accrued PTO for a total of 25 paid days off per year • Lots of employee engagement activities both offsite and onsite; if you’re in Chicago expect to have an amazing time as we reopen our offices including happy hours, free lunches, free breakfast, lots of games (ping pong, pool, arcade, etc), company social events (i.e. bowling, baseball games, golf outings) • An opportunity to work with an inclusive, global community of Loadies united by our core value of Teamwork • Regular recognition, feedback, and transparency across all levels • Opportunities for you to join our community service initiatives  At Loadsmart, we believe our biggest asset is our people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, hiring and developing individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences to add to our collaborative culture. Loadsmart treats all candidates and employees with respect and does not discriminate in our recruiting, hiring, and promoting processes, including on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, veteran status, or disability.

description: As Sales Account Executive your role will be to deliver revenue across your assigned territory based on established targets and to consultatively sell The Fire Academy learning management system, understanding the client needs and aligning that to available product options. This is an exempt position that reports to the Vice President of the Fire & Rescue Group within Clarion Events.  Main Duties and Responsibilities:   Essential Responsibilities include but are not limited to:  Generate revenue selling by phone, face-to-face (when appropriate) and other channels by targeting departments, EMS agencies, private ambulance companies, municipalities and hospitals for SaaS-based learning management system (LMS), including a suite of fire and EMS training Attend related and appropriate conferences/events with the goal of generating leads and establishing contacts Identify business opportunities and manage them through the sales pipeline to close Weekly reporting on sales results, plans and activities Meet or exceed established monthly revenue targets Document outreach to prospects using Salesforce (our customer relationship management tool) in a timely manner – whether it be calls or sales demonstrations of the product Nurture existing client relationships in order to drive future referral business Work collaboratively with the media marketing team on an as-needed basis regarding campaign messaging and goals to ensure the ongoing growth of the product Continuously developing market and product knowledge to assist with business development Maintain professional internal and external relationships that meet company core values  Skills and Qualifications 3+ years of business development experience and customer acquisition and/or inside sales experience Bachelor’s degree preferred Experience in business-to-business relationship development for educational services, public safety, or healthcare  Proven track record in establishing network of contacts and prospects Demonstrated performance in a commission-based or incentive-based compensation program Ability to write or create effective sales presentations and proposals Willingness to work additional hours outside of the established work hours when needed (i.e. for sales demos or at events/conferences) Strong communication skills to be able to interact with team members, executive management and with clients.  Experience working in the fire industry a plus Current or past state licensure as EMT or Paramedic a plus Demonstrates effective active listening and communication skills Good organizational and time management skills Be able to build trust and credibility amongst our potential customer base Strong business acumen  Core Competencies: Communication, oral and written Interpersonal skills Leadership & Motivation Innovation Ability to build strong relationships Strategy and Planning Professionalism Business Acumen  Work Environment At Clarion Events, we strive to maintain a culture that is welcoming, supportive, diverse and inclusive. We have a motto, fail forward faster - we're not afraid to make mistakes; we learn from them quickly and use learnings to help drive solutions.    This role may be done remotely, or out of one of our established US office locations in CT, NJ, OK, or WA. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. This job will also require travel and exposure to conference hall environments in which safety and environmental concerns may demand constant attention.   Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, use hands to finger, handle or feel, and reach with hands and arms. While at events/shows, this job may require extensive standing and walking and some pulling and lifting of products, supplies and/or equipment.  Position Type/Expected Hours of Work This is a full-time position, 40 hours per week. Days and hours of work and days are typically Monday through Friday, 8:30a.m. to 5:30p.m., but will vary based on event/show schedules and business needs.  Travel Travel is expected for this position for assigned shows and as required by management.  EEO Statement  Clarion Events provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Clarion Events complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has offices. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobTitle: Sales Account Executive, Entry Level - San Diego, CA
description: Job Title: Sales Account Executive, Entry Level  Location: San Diego, CA  Job Type: Full-time salaried  Reports To: Regional Manager  Bonus: Robust monthly bonus opportunities  MicroGenDX Overview  MicroGenDX is a CAP accredited and CLIA certified laboratory highly-specialized in providing Next Generation DNA Sequencing for infectious disease across multiple specialties, including COVID-19.  MicroGenDX is committed and excited to continue to move this technology to its well-deserved place in diagnostics as the gold standard of care in the diagnosis of infectious disease! MicroGenDX is seeking highly motivated, entry-level sales individuals to join our team who are just as passionate as we are about revolutionizing patient outcomes with microbial diagnostics. Are you self-motivated? Ready to disrupt an industry? Interested in a technological sell resulting in better patient outcomes? If so, MicroGenDX wants to hear from you!  Job Description  As a MicroGenDX Jr. Sales Account Executive you will develop and execute a territory business plan, sell and promote MicroGenDX service lines to meet territory sales targets for an assigned region and accounts while continually identifying and developing new client opportunities. In this role, you will also be responsible for prioritizing project planning, meetings, completing customer requests/deadlines and organized territory management, meeting assigned sales targets and strict adherence to Compliance with Federal law.  Specific Job Functions Manage the entire sales cycle beginning with prospecting through closing retention and further engagement Educates customers on the value of MicroGenDX services, superior diagnostics and better patient outcomes. Continually improve and develop selling skills, technical knowledge, sales forecasting. Monitor competitive services, pricing and other developments impacting our market. Work with marketing and other sales teams to develop, implement and execute sales and marketing plans. Provide prompt resolutions and service to customers. Qualifications Team oriented with a winning attitude and highly adaptable Demonstrate ability and desire to learn Strong passion for customer service and ability to understand client needs and increase customer engagement Interest and ability to actively engage and present scientific data to Physicians and staff Understanding and application of sales performance metrics Ability to close sales in a highly-competitive market selling new and disruptive technology Demonstrated knowledge and success in Infectious Diseases and multiple specialties, is a plus Knowledge related to PCR, Next Generation DNA Sequencing, Infectious Diseases, antimicrobials and anti-fungal, microbiology is a plus. Experience selling molecular diagnostics in the outpatient physician market, is a plus. What MicroGen DX Offers Competitive salary and bonus plan Opportunity for growth Monthly car allowance Medical coverage (all or in part paid by the company based on plan selection) Dental and Vision Insurance 401k with a 100% company match up to 4% Voluntary Short-Term Disability Company Paid Life Insurance & AD&D Voluntary Life Insurance & AD&D Expense budget Paid vacation and holiday Figo Pet Insurance MicroGen DX Values Innovation – We understand the healthcare industry advances quickly and so should we. We remain on the forefront of molecular diagnostics in order to continually ensure we are providing physicians and their patients with the very best and most reliable data with 99.9% precision. Passion – We seek to inspire the medical community and patients to believe again in accurate diagnostics and better treatment outcomes; with a laser focus on changing diagnostic medicine when it comes to infectious disease. Partnership – We are a reliable partner in the medical field for physicians, patients and within the research community. Through attention to quality and knowledge we are a proud diagnostic partner throughout the field and strive to be a sought-out partner in molecular diagnostics and infectious disease well into the future. Trust – We strive to exceed expectations while delivering highly-specialized diagnostic services. Through quality ethics and a focus on compliance we are dedicated to be a trusted guide within the field of molecular diagnostics. The above statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities necessary to describe the principal functions of the job, as identified, and shall not be considered an exhaustive list of job responsibilities which may be inherent in the job. Responsibilities are subject to change.

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Water Quality Senior Account Manager (Sales) will focus on our large or very complex customers within the Northeastern US market. We seek a seasoned professional who will handle our critical or complex products that require excellent client relationship skills to maintain competitive positioning.  Key Accountabilities Develop a plan to establish and maintain account relationships and meet personal sales targets. Build a business plan for each account. Coordinate use of resources (e. g., technical, advertising) to provide value-added services to accounts. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price and service strategies. Uncover new customer opportunities in the designated market. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision and results driven. External Applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Vermont, New Hampshire, and Maine only Relocation assistance is provided for this role Travel is required to cover the area of responsibility Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Minimum of four years of related work experience Able and willing to travel 50% of the time within the area of responsibility Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience in Retail / Grocery Salt Industry experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Salesforce or Customer Relationship Management software Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

description: Graylog is a leading enterprise log management system that enables fast and efficient log analysis in the areas of security, compliance, operations and DevOps. Our enterprise product enables large organizations to capture, store and analyze terabytes of machine data in near-real time, while our open project empowers individuals and small teams to perform basic log consolidation, analysis, and search functions at no cost.  The Sales Development Rep at Graylog will be a critical member of our team focusing on the bridge between marketing-created leads and sales opportunities globally. Your job is to engage with potential prospects, talk through their challenges in collecting and analyzing log data from their IT infrastructure, and determine if there is an opportunity for our sales team to engage. We respond to inbound contact requests as well as proactively pursue outbound opportunities. Thoughtful, personalized communications is one of the best ways to ensure Graylog maintains our strong positive brand image while maximizing sales opportunities. The goal of your work is to build early stage relationships with software evaluators that ultimately turns into new business.  You will be the first point of contact with our customers in the sales process. This position requires intense proactivity, a strong desire to learn how to become a great sales development person, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to get others excited about using our tools to improve their business results. You will learn the ins-and-outs of both enterprise software Marketing and Sales processes, with a chance to grow your career along either line.  *** Only candidates located in Houston will be considered  Responsibilities Meet weekly and monthly business goals for call / email / text / chat outreach in time-to-contact and lead-to-opportunity conversion rates Respond to prospect’s questions arising from website chat box and “contact us” form fills Proactively pursue opportunistic leads with outbound activity when a strategic position is presented. Work with Marketing to create leads from event attendees, Pardot leads, and activity on social media and third-party software review sites Qualify leads based on timing, budget, and size then effectively transfer interested prospects to Sales in a way that maximizes opportunity creation and wins Constantly search for methods of improvement through technology and process innovation and effectively communicate those ideas internally Work with our Marketing Automation and CRM systems to track activities Assist with establishing, automating, and optimizing the marketing lead-to-sales opportunity process such as email campaigns and A/B testing of messaging and methods.  Qualifications Previous sales experience with ideally 1-2 years experience in direct B2B sales Can convey an effective message in e-mail, text, chat, and phone conversations Understand how to social sell and interact with prospects over social networks Fluent in Microsoft Office applications and CRM systems (preferably Hubspot) Ability to demonstrate an aptitude for technology Team player who possesses a desire and ability to work in a fast paced, goal oriented high growth sales environment Self-motivated and able to contact 5-10 new prospects per day, while managing the 12+ touches necessary to convert existing prospects into qualified leads

description: Curious about AI, social media and innovative technology? Interested in diving deeper into corporate strategy, consumer insights and digital marketing? We’re looking for a scrappy Sales Development Rep looking to grow into a sales role.  Our platform combines more than a decade of development and dozens of patents for a unique offering used by hundreds of the world’s leading brands and agencies. We give customers the ability to discover broad context of a conversation with unsupervised learning while diving deeper with industry-leading NLP and sentiment analysis.  We are looking for the ability to think strategically about our business, product and any technical challenges, as well as the tactical execution to drive sales and business development goals. We want entrepreneurial and ambitious folks that can learn and apply our cutting-edge technology where no official playbook exists.  Responsibilities: Work with Marketing, Sales Directors and Account Managers to maintain a steady rate of conversion on marketing activity while also prospecting an outbound pipeline Ability and willingness to get on the phone and turn qualification discussions into leads Join an established team that knows the industry, has considerable sales experience, and works closely with technical resources to maximize opportunity Support the sales process for enterprise, consulting and agency accounts including sales strategy, lead generation, software validation Use your market knowledge to help develop new ways for companies to leverage NetBase Quid to solve their unique needs  About you: Passionate about sales – competitive nature to reach and exceed quota Previous sales development experience – particularly with outbound prospecting and lead gen Technically curious – wanting to learn new technologies and keep up with a product and market that’s constantly evolving Attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and an absolute focus on quality of work  Strong work ethic and self-starter, able to effectively manage multiple priorities and adapt to change within a fast-paced business environment  Experience with sales enablement or prospecting platforms like Outreach, Salesloft, Apollo, DiscoverOrg, ZoomInfo or LinkedIn Sales Navigator Experience in social media, digital marketing and/or AI tools is a plus  Location This position can be remote, anywhere in the U.S.  ABOUT NETBASE QUID NetBase Quid is the award-winning consumer and market intelligence platform that resulted from a merger between NetBase, the industry leader in social media analytics, and Quid, a leader in AI driven text analytics, on January 28th, 2020.  In today’s age of information overload, NetBase Quid delivers businesses an unprecedented solution that is faster, more accurate and actionable and with access to billions of indexed resources — from social media posts, consumer reviews, product reviews, news articles to business filings, to patent applications, and forums – which can be aggregated, analyzed, and visualized in order to discover consumer and market insights.  The enhanced platform delivers clear, real-time and actionable results so that customers can distinguish between critical and non-essential business issues, ultimately empowering them to make smarter, data driven decisions quickly and efficiently. Learn more at https://netbasequid.com/

description: Description  Georgia Pacific (GP) is seeking a Sales Consultant in southern Virginia or Washington, DC!  You will manage the growth of a portfolio of innovative brand-name products including Dixie®, enMotion®, Compact®, and Angel Soft Ultra® to both end-user and distributor accounts.  You will work remotely and travel overnight 10% of the time. A company car is provided!  What You Will Do In Your Role Build profitable new relationships with strategic end users and distributors Develop and execute an effective territory plan Manage annual growth plans to create demand for GP proprietary products Support local sales efforts of GP National Accounts, Strategic Accounts and Distributor Sales Representatives (DSRs) through end-user activity within your primary segments of focus, which include: Healthcare, Foodservice, High Traffic, Office Buildings, and Industrial The Experience You Will Bring  Requirements Bachelor's degree OR 2 years of outside sales experience 2 years of experience in sales, leadership, and/or customer service Valid Driver's License Willing to travel 10% overnight What Will Put You Ahead Experience selling to Office Buildings, Healthcare, Industrial, Foodservice, and High Traffic segments Strategic distribution management experience Salesforce.com experience to manage prospects and accounts Experience using the Microsoft Office Suite of Outlook, PowerPoint, Word and Excel Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.  At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.  Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status.  Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf
