description: ADP is hiring an Accountant Channel Sales Representative. Do you thrive on networking to gain business and the opportunity to sell industry-leading solutions? Are you ready for your next best job where you can elevate your financial future? Do you want to join a fast-paced, inclusive environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging? If so, this may be the opportunity for you. Read on and decide for yourself.  In this role, you will close sales and win new business exclusively through our CPA accountant channel and client referrals as part of our Human Resources Outsourcing (HRO) business. You'll attend our award-winning training program and join a sales team selling human resources solutions, making employees' lives better with high-quality benefits offerings across the hire-to-retire spectrum. As a Sales Representative in our CPA channel, you will be assigned to a list of accounting firms and aligned to sales reps in our Small Business Services channel, possibly sales reps from our majors mid-market division, and CPA Sales Reps in other business units. You will collaborate with these internal partners to gain access into accounts and to pull leads from their assigned accounting firms.  Your day-to-day will focus on cultivating and nurturing relationships with your CPAs, their clients, and your internal partners to set appointments, gather leads, and assess buyer needs to present the best ADP solutions. To be successful, you will need to manage multiple sales processes simultaneously through various stages in the sales process and document them. As you sell new business, you will also need to stick with the implementation process for already-sold business until those clients are up and running on the solutions you sell. As you see more and more deals cross the finish line, you'll reap the rewards with industry-leading compensation, benefits, luxurious incentive trips, and awards. As you strive to grow your career, leaders will back your desire to pursue advancement and provide continual sales training.  A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos.  Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply today!  To learn more about Sales at ADP, watch here: http://adp.careers/Sales_Videos  WHAT YOU'LL DO: Responsibilities Grow Our Business While Growing Yours: You will develop relationships with accounting firms through business partnerships with your internal ADP partners. You will educate them on Human Resources Outsourcing solutions for their clients, and implement a top-down sales strategy including: industry updates, Continuing Professional Education (CPE) offerings, benchmarking. You will run CPA experience meetings to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals. Turn Prospects into Loyal and Referring Clients: To close sales, you will help our clients understand their needs and recommend the right solutions to solve them. You'll earn referral business through networking with existing and soon-to-be clients and forging partnerships in-person and over the phone with decision-makers. Deepen Relationships Across the ADP Family: In addition to cloud-based human resources solutions, you will strategically cross-sell with other ADP associates to cultivate additional business within existing accounts; you will make life-long friendships here. Collaborate Daily. You will serve as a trusted advisor, partner, and ADP ambassador to accountants, internal partners, and overall network while demonstrating grace under pressure and the highest ethical standards. TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE : Required Qualifications Positive Self-Starter.You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to follow-up on leads without fear of rejection. You can manage your time well, prioritize deliverables, and multi-task with the best of them. In addition, you can present your ideas in a clear, professional manner on paper, in-person, and over the phone. Strategic Closer.You have an established network and experience carrying a quota in outside business-to-business sales. You have an impressive track record of closing sales, winning clients, and managing a territory and relationships. Proven Winner. You have an ambitious spirit and thrive under pressure, motivating you to not only hit sales quotas but exceed them. If You Don't Have a College Degree, Other Acceptable Experience Could Include  A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. Payroll experience, relationship sales experience, or HRO experience. Military experience -- skills including teamwork, resilience, negotiation, trust-building, and a "never lose" mentality will help you build team and client relationships, identify solutions, and achieve success. BONUS POINTS FOR THESE: Preferred Qualifications Ability to successfully build a network and effectively use social media for sales You'll Love Working Here Because You Can Be yourselfin a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights. Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences. Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress. Continuously learn.Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner. Be your healthiest.Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones. Balance work and life.Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. Focus on your mental health and well-being.We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another. Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live. Get paid to pay it forward.Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about. What are you waiting for? Apply now!  Explore our COVID-19 page https://jobs.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Human Resources

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Wilmington – Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Leveling Guidelines:  The position will be filled at level commensurate with experience.  PCP Sales Specialist: Internal: Novartis sales associate with previous sales experience. External: Minimum 2 years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience).   PCP Senior Sales Specialist: Internal: Novartis sales associate with previous sales experience. External: 5-10 years of experience in pharmaceutical/biotech sales, within the past 15 years. description: Location Territory Parameters: Northern Il, Wisconsin possibly Indiana. Additional travel may be required as needed Acceptable Candidate Location: The candidate can reside anywhere in the territory   Job Description This is an entry-level sales position that supports a network of direct and/or indirect specialty sales representatives and our customers to successfully penetrate markets, sell specific products, educate, and cover cases to ensure enthusiastic customer experiences, achieve area business objectives, and company financial goals. Initially, this role will be focused on successful promotion and sales support of our foot and ankle and upper extremities portfolio and will require this person to learn our technology, products, procedures, market, and industry. Responsible for working closely with the Area Sales Director and our distributor partners to support building high-performance selling and distributor teams to effectively drive technology adoption, brand awareness, positive customer and patient satisfaction, and increase shareholder value. Meets and exceeds financial objectives via distributor and market development, customer and distributor relationship management and support, sales and customer training, and heavy procedure support. This is a field-based position and requires frequent travel.  Minimum Requirements Education: A four-year bachelor’s degree in related discipline Experience: Minimum 2 years of previous consultative sales with a documented track record of success or relevant experience as a clinical specialist Technical: Ability to become fluent with medical device concepts and terminology and develop strong working knowledge of the technical aspects of device(s) and surgical procedures in the orthopedic field. Experience in OR protocol is desired. Ability to master anatomy, pathology, procedures, products. Selling and Communication Skills: Excellent communication skills (oral and written) and interpersonal skills. Must be able to communicate effectively with demanding surgeons and salespeople. Other: Enjoys and works well with other people in a team environment. Willingness to travel weekly within your defined area Must possess a competitive spirit and a strong drive to win High sense of urgency and responsiveness in addressing customer needs and seizing opportunities. Places a high value on ethical standards with regard to surgical procedures and patient outcomes Must be a self-starter with strong time management and planning skills Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage time efficiently Must be customer-focused Excellent communication and selling skills Must be self-motivated and results-oriented Computer proficiency A valid driver's license  Ideal Attributes Ortho or med device background Familiarity with human anatomy Experience working with distributors Experience in the Operating Room  Job Requirements Conducts regular surgeon sales calls with and without distributor sales reps present to develop customer interest and relationships and follow up on leads in order to promote, market, and sell products Coordinates with independent reps to prospect for new accounts and seek opportunities to increase sales with existing customers Support a network of specialty geographic distributors and independent sales reps to grow the business and drive positive brand awareness. Covers surgical procedures to ensure proper use of our products, educate on best practice techniques and support positive clinical outcomes Participates in and occasionally leads distributor training courses and other advanced field-based training opportunities Listens to customer needs and suggests appropriate products/solutions. Ensures that customers are serviced in accordance with company standards and policies Ensures customer satisfaction and obtains regular customer and distributor feedback and continually works to improve processes and services Resolves customer and distributor requests and complaints efficiently Helps Area Sales Director meet and exceed established quotas and sales goals Completes required sales reports, expense, and regulatory records accurately and promptly Develops mastery of relevant procedures and technology differentiation Establishes effective relationships and collaborates with other departments (Marketing, Customer Service, Clinical, Operations, etc.) to address key business issues and opportunities. Ensures all commercial programs and compliance guidelines are communicated, implemented, and coordinated when working with sales partners. Attends important tradeshows and company sales meetings as requested.

description: Bryan Equipment Sales, Inc., a STIHL outdoor power equipment distributor located in Loveland, Ohio, is seeking a Territory Manager to maintain and grow sales with an existing retailer base, while prospecting new business, in Southeast Michigan.  Responsibilities include analyzing and evaluating opportunities and then developing, maintaining, and executing a business plan for the specific territory above with quarterly update as to the progress. Organize call plan using ABC/123 process and maintain monthly calendar reflecting schedule of call plan. Establish, develop, and maintain qualified STIHL retailers in the marketplace through sales, technical, and business trainings. This requires the ability to use and demonstrate all products. The individual will need to monitor and report market and retail sales conditions regularly as assigned and develop and maintain long-term business relationships with retailers. Required attendance of sales meetings, trainings, trade shows, product demonstrations and other events will make moderate overnight travel mandatory. Position requires a very high degree of interpersonal skills, enthusiasm, and leadership to motivate, persuade, and inspire retailers. The successful candidate must be self-motivated, confident, decisive, and action oriented. Good problem-solving and communication skills are required.  The qualified candidate should have a bachelor’s degree from a four year college or university; or 5 to 10 years industry experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Individuals must possess a valid driving license, a good driving record and reside in the greater metropolitan Detroit, Michigan area.  Bryan Equipment Sales Inc. offers a competitive salary with bonus potential, company vehicle, and a comprehensive benefits package.  For over 70 years, Bryan Equipment Sales, Inc. has been distributing outdoor power equipment tools to the full servicing retailer. We are one of the leading distributors in the OPE industry, as well as the number one distributor of STIHL power tools in the USA. We have aggressively marketed this product since 1967 to our six state region, consisting of: Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, middle and western Tennessee, and West Virginia.

description: Job: Account Manager Salary: $40k-$50k basic + $1350 quarterly bonus based on hitting key metrics Location: Miami or Atlanta | The role will be fully remote until we open our office. Then the role will then become hybrid. Hours: 40 hours per week. We can be flexible with start times.   Due to rapid growth Giraffe360 are looking for an Account Manager to join us in Miami or Atlanta.  As an Account Manager, you will work collaboratively with our support team to manage our customer’s game-changing subscription product for real estate companies to streamline professional quality photography and high accuracy floor plan creation.  This is a fantastic opportunity to develop a career with a forward-thinking, innovative and rapidly growing business that can offer you unparalleled potential for both personal and professional growth. You will receive substantial training and guidance that will enable you to take control of your career and be a part of something special.    Responsibilities   As an Account Manager with Giraffe360 you will:  Manage the onboarding process for new customers/accounts. Respond in a timely manner to customer queries via telephone and email. Give our customers guidance and training on how to best use our product. Communicate with our customers in regard to delivery updates, tech support and renewals. Focus on customer/client retention. Handle any cancellation requests from customers.  Keep in regular contact with customers/clients to gain an understanding of their general happiness with our service. When required, take on new projects from our leadership team. To undertake other ad hoc tasks as required.    Person Specification  For us, culture is everything. We want you to fundamentally be a nice person with a work ethic that matches ours. You will not be micromanaged. If we hire you, it’s because we trust you.   Below are some of the key skills/experiences we are looking for:  Previous experience gained from a sales, account management or customer service focussed role. The ability to manage customers’ expectations effectively. Be comfortable picking up the phone and talking with customers. Be able to build lasting relationships with clients/customers. Be reliable. When you say you are going to do something, do it! The ability to be agile in your working. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Strong attention to detail and the ability to establish priorities, schedule and meet deadlines. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to juggle multiple competing tasks and demands. Good problem and conflict resolution skills.   About the Company  Giraffe360 is a unique breakthrough camera technology designed to create beautiful real estate listing content. Our device is a mix of high accuracy Lidar laser and SLR photo camera to provide various contents for showcasing properties packaged in an extremely simple, push of the button design. In 2019 and 2020 Giraffe360 has been selected as one of the top 100 Property Technology solutions in Europe and is servicing real estate agencies in 30 countries across the world as well as has raised more than £5M of venture funding. The company employs more than 120 people  Everything else you need to know can be found here - http://www.giraffe360.com  If you are interested in joining us and being a part of the journey, then feel free to reach out to Geoffrey.banks-smith@giraffe360.com

description: Job Description  The Director of Strategic Sales will have a demonstrated track record and results oriented mentality in building new client relationships in the seed and agricultural industry while also retaining strong rapport and retention of existing clientele. This individual will be able to plan for and achieve individual and team revenue and sales objectives through proactive communication and sales of Eurofins BioDiagnostics, Inc. services to new and assigned clients.  Tasks And Skillset Required Development and implementation of a strategic business development plan for both the US and global markers to meet/advance the company’s objectives and support the growth of the organization. Set up discussions with prospective new clients to initiate a new business relationship Create business opportunities through client needs identification and relationship building Utilize strategies and implement tactics to persuade prospective clients to engage with Eurofins BioDiagnostics Develop and implement individual, territory and key account approaches that are specifically geared to either growth of or retention of the client base. Coordinate and execute organizational response to Requests for Proposals/Information Represent Eurofins BioDiagnostics at trade shows and industry-related conferences Provide business intelligence on competitors; their services, positioning pricing and M&A activities. Update company CRM system with relevant information Provide twice monthly sales reports outlining opportunities, discussions and accomplishments and objectives/goals achieved or missed. Willing to travel throughout assigned geographical territory, including US, LATAM and Asia As needed, provide mentorship and support Business Development team members in the US.  Other Skills Ability to work independently and under pressure without supervision Excellent communication skills with a high degree of professionalism Strong organizational skills; ability to prioritize, delegate, and evaluate work Strong, and effective presentation skills; ability to convincingly present features and benefits of Eurofins BioDiagnostics service to clients and also within the Eurofins Group Effective intrapersonal skills, creating and maintaining a positive dialogue with both clients and colleagues Demonstrated excellence in negotiating  Qualifications BA/BS or MS in business or life sciences Five plus (5) years of sales experience in the agriculture and preferably seed testing industry Fluent in English language – written and oral Familiarity with Microsoft Office and CRM software such as Hubspot or Salesforce  Additional Information  Position is full-time, Monday - Friday 8:00am - 5:00pm. Excellent full time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, dental, and vision options Life and disability insurance 401(k) with company match Paid vacation and holidays  Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. description: SnugZ USA is an innovative and thriving Top 40 promotional products supplier based out of Salt Lake City, Utah. Founded in 1989, SnugZ is the leading provider of branded lanyards, personal care, mints, leather goods and aromatherapy in the promotional products industry.  SnugZ core values are: Work Like Crazy, Care Passionately, Think Big and Do What's Right.  We have a talented executive team that leads with integrity and vision to take us where we need to be. We aim to create the best possible work environment with benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance, 401(k) Matching, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Company Events, Free Swag, as well as Paid Maternity & Paternity Leave. We are also offering a $250.00 sign-on bonus after 90 days.. Our vision is to build opportunities for our co-workers, customers, and communities; and it all starts with you!  Purpose and Scope of Position  SnugZ USA is seeking a dynamic sales person to work in a fast paced, growing and fun environment. We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, hardworking, persistent and dependable to join our growing team in the promotional products industry.  The Sales Executive will be responsible for managing their existing territory by building and managing relationships, growing our customer base both organically within existing accounts and identifying potential customers. The ideal candidate for this position will have established sales and/or marketing experience and a commitment to delivering the highest level of professional dedication and performance. This position requires an individual who is a highly motivated self-starter.  Key Responsibilities Develop action plans to set and help achieve territory goals. Manage and analyze reports and data. This position requires travel to our National Show in Las Vegas and possible sale calls throughout the year to top accounts. Work with the Inside Sales manager to create sales strategy, implement and measure strategy. Required to exhibit and represent SnugZ at relevant promotional products trade shows within the territory. Partner with Inside Sales Support in assigned region to maximize territory coverage and revenue potential on all assigned accounts. Give formal presentations to inform accounts of SnugZ USA products, decoration capabilities, marketing programs and business solutions with a focus on sales. Navigate, qualify & research B2B partnerships; engage via email/phone/social media/virtual office visits and physical office visits. Achieve monthly sales quota; work with sales team to achieve organizational sales goals. Achieve expected volume of proactive customer calls while managing inbound requests. Practice knowledge of consultative selling approach. Develop creative presentations, programs, specials and flyers for new opportunities. Effectively manage multiple projects and assignments through to completion. Participate in continuous improvement activities to include idea generation. Manage quoting projects and proactive ideation. Additional duties as assigned. Required Experience/ Education And Training Requirements Associates/ Bachelor's Degree Sales, Marketing, Communications or Business preferred. 2+ years of experience in sales and/or marketing. Communicate clearly and professionally with exceptional written and verbal skills. High interest in consumer products for marketing events and advertising. Strong ability to sell products with an "on trend" component understanding trends and how to bring the trend to market. High level of competitiveness, positive attitude, enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn. Ability to generate original solutions to business opportunities and challenges. Ability to utilize continuous improvement concepts and philosophies on a regular basis. Ability to navigate through systems such as CRM, Syteline, Outlook, Excel. Ability to reach decision-makers and quickly determine potential opportunity. Must be customer focused, confident and goal driven. High adaptability to change. High level of integrity. Ability to lead by example, motivate a team, delegate, communicate clearly, negotiate, manage change well, improve processes, organize and build relationships. Must be detail oriented and have strong decision making skills. Language Requirements Must be able to read and write fluently in English. Physical Demands Ability to alternate between sitting, standing, and walking. Ability to perform fine manipulation such as typing for 8 hours. Ability of near visual acuity, clear vision of small printed items, and use of computer. Work Environment Open concept office setting with moderate noise levels. Snugzusa LLC is an equal opportunity employer and is a supporter of diversity and inclusion. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

description: Position: Sales Representative, Territory Manager- Colorado, Denver, Centennial, Parker Department: Sales Location: REMOTE- TRAVEL- Territory:  Denver, CO mostly but may also cover UT, AZ, Vegas - must live in/near the Denver Compensation structure: Base + Commission + Bonus   Experience: This is an OUTSIDE, HUNTER, SALES role with heavy cold calling, prospecting, lead generation, onsite meetings. Please only apply if you are truly ready for serious hard work and understand you will be in the field majority of the time weekly.  We are looking for someone with ideally 2+ years of FIELD sales B2B experience who is driven, willing to travel and put in some seriously hard (and rewarding) work, learn a ton and is excited for an opportunity with a fantastic and quickly growing company in an innovative space--- Do you want a seat on our Rocketship? Next STOP, THE MOON and BEYOND!  Company summary: InMode is a leading global provider of innovative medical technologies which develops, manufactures, and markets devices harnessing novel radiofrequency (RF) technology. The company strives to enable new emerging surgical procedures and improve existing treatments. By leveraging its medically-accepted, minimally-invasive RF technology for simultaneous subdermal adipose remodeling and skin tightening, InMode offers a comprehensive portfolio of products for plastic surgery, gynecology, dermatology, otolaryngology, and ophthalmology.  Position Summary: The Territory Manager is responsible for generating revenue and executing our sales methods in their designated geographical area. TM’s responsibilities include presenting our products to potential clients, identifying specific consumer characteristics, and recommending ways to promote and sell our products. To be successful in this role, you should have excellent communication abilities and be highly motivated to meet sales goals. Ultimately, you will help us grow our customer base and establish our reputation in your assigned region.  The successful candidate enjoys and thrives in an EXTREMELY fast-paced, on the go, work environment, can juggle multiple time sensitive processes at once and possess a can-do, what-more-can-I-learn, how-can-I-help attitude.  Duties and Responsibilities: 1. Generate sales leads principally by cold calling on dermatologists or plastic surgeons (including ASPS, Facial Plastic, Ophthalmic, Plastic and AACS cosmetic surgeons) as well as other physicians in the Territory. 2. Maintain and manage a substantial lead pipeline while meeting or exceeding quarterly sales targets. 3. Present our products and services to prospective customers; Act as a point of contact for all potential customers and identify needs and recommend product solutions. 4. Identify local business opportunities and challenges 5. Develop and utilize all assets, reference sites, Company' clinical specialists and partner personnel within the Territory to achieve short-term and long-term objectives. 6. Answer customer questions about features, pricing, and additional services 7. Cross-sell products, when appropriate 8. Collaborate with sales representatives in and out of assigned territory to share best practices, support a cohesive sales approach to meet individual and group sales quotas. 9. Achieve minimum sales quota requirements as established by the Company 10. Satisfy all the Company’s Customer Care and Finance requirements as established; responsible for learning (training provided) set processes and updating the CRM system (SFDC) in a timely and accurate manner. 11. Provide timely reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually to the Regional Sales Director regarding status of each lead and sales opportunity in pipeline through the CRM database. 12. Attend and promote workshops and support programs for the Territory in conjunction with the other sales managers, marketing, and clinical departments of the Company; Provide needed sales support at all sales events. 13. Maintain a high level of understanding of the applications and performance of the Company's products.  Frequent travel within your territory, and occasionally outside of, is a requirement of this role.   Minimum Qualifications: ·      Bachelor’s degree or greater- required ·      Minimum of 2+ year’s work experience in a field sales role; Resilient with a proven track record ·      Exceptional organization skills ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills including phone and e-mail etiquette ·      Ability to adapt quickly ·      Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and meet deadlines and work well under pressure ·      Excellent inter-personal relationship skills and the ability to work with individuals of all levels ·      Intermediate knowledge of MS Office Suite; Word, Excel, PowerPoint ·      Strong team player a must ·      Ability to work extended hours, evenings and weekends occasionally as needed. ·      Experience with CRM tools; SalesForce- highly preferred ·      Medical device or laser experience- a plus

description:
Healthcare is about decision-making - and the best decisions are those made with complete and comprehensive data. At Pieces, we collect and deliver data from every part of the patient care journey to help healthcare providers and social service organizations keep communities flourishing. Pieces uses the most cutting-edge technology to help vulnerable populations get the care they need. We use artificial intelligence, natural language processing (NLP), and machine learning to address clinical and social determinants of health. Our tools provide the insights needed to improve patient care beyond the hospital walls. In plain terms, we’re building technology platforms to make better patient care easy. And we need a smart Clinical Sales Executive to help us achieve our mission. Responsibilities The Clinical Sales Executive is an integral member of Pieces Sales Team. We’re looking for people-persons & new business rockstars who enjoy working on a cross-functional and highly ambitious team to deliver. The Clinical Sales Executive will play a vital role in driving revenue for our software & services solutions. . This role reports to the VP of Business Development of the organization. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice. Specific responsibilities include but not limited to:
  • Acquire, develop and retain new healthcare accounts
  • Own the entire sales process for the assigned opportunities - discovery scoping, pricing, and closing.
  • Actively problem solve with the Sr Leadership Team (ie. Sales, Client Success, Clinical Services) to strategize on ways to drive the deals forward and close them
  • Assist with lead generation, then follow up to qualify the leads
  • Evaluate prospective customer capabilities and needs, and builds productive long lasting relationships
  • Provide consultation to prospective clients on utilization of the Pieces platform, offering thought partnership on clinical workflows and protocols
  • Develop compelling value propositions for prospective clients and communicate them effectively using multiple communication channels (e.g. calls, emails, in-person and virtual meetings, presentations, etc.)
  • Meet personal and team sales targets
  • Work closely with the marketing team to develop and execute on digital lead generation & contents for sales collaterals
  • Work closely with the Client Success team to leverage existing customers’ relationships
  • Attend meetings, sales events and trainings to keep abreast of the latest developments
  • Utilize personal network to identify and generate sales opportunities for target customers Pieces retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job, absent undue hardship. Requirements We’re looking for a Clinical Sales Executive who’s passionate about using technology to help the most vulnerable. You’re someone who believes the right data can help build better one-to-one relationships with communities in need of extra support. You have expertise in the following areas:
  • Must have a Bachelor’s degree. Masters preferred. MBA or other advanced degree graduates (MPH/MHA, etc.) preferred
  • Must have one of the following professional experience:
    • 2-5 years of experience in clinical sales, consistently meeting or exceeding sales targets at previous positions, or
    • 2-5 years of experience in healthcare consulting/professional services, or
    • 2-5 years of experience in healthcare system operations (e.g. project management), or
    • 2-5 years of software implementation and/or account management experience; software in a SaaS / Cloud computing environment
    • At least three years of experience in the healthcare or healthcare-related environment highly preferred
    • Strong analytical and quantitative competencies
    • Hubspot CRM experience preferred
    • Tech Savviness and ability to quickly acquire product knowledge
    • Integrity and commitment
    • Strong interpersonal skills, including communication skills
    • Problem solving skills

      Benefits The team at Pieces is a driven bunch of individuals working toward a common goal. When you join our team, you’ll find a mission-driven culture built on:

    • Positivity: we work hard, and we are enthusiastic about problem-solving and empathetic to our partners’ causes.
    • Teamwork: we believe in harnessing the strength of the collective, mentorship, and amplifying each other's strengths.
    • Great communication: clear, concise, empathetic communication is paramount to our success. We offer competitive salaries as well as the following benefits:
    • Shared premiums: medical, dental and vision, plus access to FSA and HSA
    • 401K and life insurance
    • Flexible vacation and holiday policies
    • Flexible work hours, with work-from-home options
    • Paid maternity/paternity leave
    • Two days of paid volunteer time per year
    • A comprehensive tech setup
    • Healthy snacks
    • Free arcade games (de-stress while trying to knock off the reigning Pac-Man office champion!)
industries: Hospital & Health Care

jobTitle: Territory Development Rep- Surgical Instrumentation (New Jersey)
description: Careers That Change Lives  Bring your talents to an innovative medical technology and healthcare solutions leader. We deliver with the training, mentorship, and guidance to build your future success.  A Day in the Life  The Territory Development Representative (TDR) will partner with the field sales and clinical teams and act as a resource in markets where expansion is expected due to business growth. The TDR will be assigned to specific territories in which there is significant potential for converting and growing business, and will support business initiatives in tandem with assigned Account Representatives. Additionally, the TDR may be required to work outside primary territory assignments as required by business conditions.  ADVANCED SURGICAL INSTRUMENTS sets the standard for Minimally Invasive Surgery (AIS) by creating innovative surgical products and services that focus on obesity and diseases and conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, lung, abdominal wall, pelvic region, and the head and neck. Click here to learn more about our products and solutions.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: Works under direction of the Regional Director and Account Representatives Provides case coverage in the OR and Hospital setting, and is responsible for in-servicing and other account maintenance duties as assigned. Covers cases for Sales Representatives and provides sales support within key customer based within the Market. Ensure new technology is introduced, when appropriate and help drive satisfaction and loyalty to our technology. Assist / Lead all in-service activities relative to disposable and/or hardware within key customer based. Install any necessary equipment/hardware and perform functional/safety tests and/or introduction or collaboration necessary with the Bio-Med team. Drive expansion of new purchases of Advance Surgical Instrumentation products with the territory, coordinate and collaborate across the Market as needed. Focus on customer satisfaction as a high priority. Provide technical information to surgeons and staff consistent with product user manuals and instructions for use Support conversions as needed. When and where appropriate, support out of town conversions by travel to site to perform activities deemed critical by conversion site lead up to by not limited to: Case coverage Product introduction/demo to staff and Clinicians Inventory balancing exercises at both the site and/or warehouse level Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including hospitals, physicians, and Radiology and Surgical personnel. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's Medical/Scientific Equipment products and/or services. Conducts and/or evaluates market research including customers and competitors activities. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's Medical/Scientific Equipment products and/or services. description: Jules and Associates is consistently ranked as one of the top independent Leasing/Financing firms in the nation. We are seeking college seniors or recent graduates who are actively seeking a career in sales.  JOB DESCRIPTION: We are currently looking for highly motivated, outgoing and well-spoken individuals who can successfully engage with key decision makers at some of the top mid-sized privately held firms nationally for an Account Executive (AE) position. As an Account Executive you will have the opportunity to learn about the corporate world and have the opportunity to achieve financial success while receiving extensive training. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent college graduate with less than five years of work experience or a graduating senior who has the qualities we seek. Your initial goal will be to identify financing opportunities through an existing database by utilizing outbound calling and email initiatives to companies throughout the nation. Successful AEs have the ability to gain trust and provide a high level of service to their customers. As an AE you will be driven by daily, weekly and monthly goals while maintaining a weekly pipeline. The position provides you with an opportunity to learn financial analysis as well as work alongside management to analyze financial statements, pricing and structuring proposals for potential clients.  ROLE EXPECTATIONS: Energetic and professional Highly Competitive Self-motivated and results-oriented Seeks financial reward for their hard work Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to be organized and multi-task Build and maintain client relationships  QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate degree or higher Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office Ability to harness financial data to inform decisions Previous sales experience is preferred, but not required  We provide one of the top training programs that will provide you the tools in order to be successful. You will work in a team environment, with the support of mentors that will help you learn how to build relationships with key decision makers in order to identify financing opportunities that will turn into commissions for you. You will have access to one of the leading CRM programs designed to increase your success in selling. The position provides you with an opportunity to learn financial analysis, pricing and structuring proposals for potential clients.  This is an excellent opportunity for a graduating College Senior who is interested in learning about Sales and the Financial Services industry.

Meet Benevity  Benevity's award-winning corporate purpose software empowers companies and their people to take social action on the issues and causes they care about. Through giving, volunteering, grantmaking and positive actions, we help 650+ clients (and counting!) build better cultures and engage their employees and customers to create greater social and business impact. We're also one of the first B-Corps in Canada, meaning we're as committed to purpose as we are to profits.  Sell software "for good"  It's easier and more fulfilling to sell when you believe in what you're selling! And at Benevity, you have an opportunity to connect the world's coolest brands (and their people!) with best-in-class software that helps them do more good.  We rally together to help you bring new clients over the line because we know it takes a team. That team approach, coupled with the best technology and service, are why we continue to win more deals than our competitors to be a market leader with a 99% client retention rate.  You'll get that competitive salary, flexible health benefits, mental health support, a generous bonus program, stock options, a hybrid office/home work environment and so much more. Plus, Benevity's very own MyGoodness program inspires our people to donate, volunteer and take action for the causes and issues they care about.  If you want to sell software that makes a difference in the world, you belong at Benevity.  Join a company where DEIB isn't a buzzword  The diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and passions of our people make it possible for us to keep innovating as the market leader in our space.  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging are part of Benevity's DNA. You'll see the impact of our massive investment in DEIB daily—from our Black Employee Network making space for us to have difficult conversations to our Pride events and the exceptional diversity on our leadership and tech teams.  We strive to build a strong culture of Belonging so that every Benevity-ite feels included and can thrive as their authentic selves — in a place where everyone has an equitable opportunity to shine!  If you want to feel seen, heard and celebrated, you belong at Benevity.  What You Will Do Sell Benevity: acquire additional Mid Market clients (2-5K employees) for Benevity's SaaS solution (meet or exceed sales goals) Own the sales cycle - from lead generation to closure: foster prospects; build relationships; cultivate a consultative sales approach; manage the sales process through responsive, proactive and client-focused communication and client management; understand the nuances of the buying process and effectively leverage internal and external resources to close your opportunities Provide consultative selling: through expertise and recommendations, your ability to solution for the needs of the client will increase the quality of product and service provided to clients. You will also be able to offer well-rounded Benevity solutions; do your research to act and think like a market expert (not a product pusher) Goal-focus: you will have an excitement and determination to meet or exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas Problem solve you will find ways to improve our business, products, approach and client programs – you listen critically to enhance, improve and augment Goodness programs at each step of the way Collaborate: you will partner with our Client Services team to foster the transition from Sales Cycle to Client Implementation  What You Bring Five to seven years of local experience in a sales function with increasing responsibilities. Pre-existing local relationships with large corporations are essential and we will consider all relevant industries and roles including but not limited to – technology sales, non-profit fundraising, business development, and account management. If sales only experience, then non-profit volunteer or board work a plus (but not mandatory) Strong experience in active solicitation and sales process management of corporations and foundations. Corresponding success of negotiating and closing contractual deals to exceed quota (consistent Presidents' Club Achievement a bonus). Consciously create and tailor a win strategy to each conversation – no two deals are the same. Effective and inspiring storyteller and presenter, with the ability to connect technology with longer term vision and goals. This includes excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills with the ability to create, edit and present collateral material. Ability to manage a pipeline of 20+ opportunities at any given time that represent the highest priority opportunities for each market assigned. Excitement to seek out and build new organizational relationships to nurture and develop on an ongoing basis. Desire to make a larger impact in the world by giving organizations and non-profits alike the ability to effect change through engagement with technology. This includes expertise in technology demonstrations and the ability to leverage technology as a storytelling tool Embraces personal and joint accountability to achieve organizational goals, including sales collaboration, internal experts, or additional resources where relevant. Fosters cross functional strategies, collaborations and executions to be successful and fully aligned with overall goals and objectives. Ability to work in a fast paced and growth environment with limited structure and guidance Ability to look at each situation with adaptability, flexibility and innovation – a true desire to win and change the world Self-starter/high level of internal motivation to win and succeed Confidence with a healthy dose of humility, humour and passion Ability to travel 40-50% of time  What You Can Expect A once-in-a-career opportunity to join a mission-driven company on a growth trajectory in a unique, ultra-engaged culture. Join a team of innovative thinkers, keen to be part of a growing and well-funded company that is all about helping businesses create innovative corporate and workplace giving and other Goodness programs. Work in a fast-paced yet flexible environment

description: Core Sales Executive Wealth Management SaaS Company - CONFIDENTIAL New York, NY  Who We Are Our mission is to bring data, technology and people together to help investors make more informed and timely investment decisions. Our wealth management platform is transforming the fintech industry by providing data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Here, your voice matters. We believe that portfolio, market and client insights can make a significant and sustainable impact, one person and one community at a time. Working at the intersection of groundbreaking technology and limitless financial services industry growth, we are optimizing how capital is put to work.  The Role We are currently seeking a Sales Executive to join our Sales Team! We are looking for a superstar to add to our ever expanding team. We are seeking an experienced, quota carrying sales performer who is looking to help grow our company to be the financial platform for the Finance Industry. The Sales Executive will be responsible for growing new ARR for large RIAs’, Multi-Family Offices and Private Banks.  What You’ll Do Development of a strategic sales plan to effectively and efficiently cover the named accounts within the assigned territory Manage lead qualification and conversion from large financial firms Aggressively prospect and generate new relationships within named accounts Some travel, as required, to prospects, customers or marketing events within territory (40-50% travel) (Covid era exempt)  Who You Are 4+ years experience in software sales Experience selling SaaS products into the wealth management or the finance industry Proven record of achieving quotas Hands on experience with Salesforce Detailed knowledge of and passion for SaaS applications with the ability to conduct product demos and understand the complexities of a SaaS business Strong interpersonal and presentation skills Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Experience with web based conferencing tools such as Zoom etc. Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Bachelor's Degree highly preferred  We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility. To ensure the health and safety of all employees and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

description: What makes Gartner Conferences a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you'll be a part of a team that serves thousands of business and technology leaders at global conferences each year. You’ll work with curious, motivated people, have unlimited career development opportunities, and learn about the latest in technology and business. If you enjoy challenging yourself, connecting with people and pushing the limits of your career, Gartner is the place for you.  Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here !  What You’ll Do As An Account Executive Quota Achievement in retaining and growing Total Sales Bookings (TSB) to ensure Net revenue growth for given portfolio of conferences and/or clients. Proficient in Account Planning and understanding of territory management Strong prospecting skills and work collaboratively with lead gen Maintain or exceed pipeline goal of 3x value of sales forecast Inter-departmental resource utilization and coordinator across Gartner Lines of Business Renewal activities focused on client needs and development of high-level client relationships Development of integrated solutions based on contract offerings Solid business acumen and industry expertise Timely and accurate revenue forecasting, ability to accurately forecast 30/60/90 days out (+/- 5% accuracy) Compliance in utilizing internal sales enablement tools such as salesforce.com and management process, such as correct use of contracts and following the booking process. Delivering high quality presentations in the Gartner format. We provide objective and invaluable insights to our C-level executive clients, where we guide them to achieve the mission-critical priorities of their organization. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and now employ over 17,000 associates globally and support 12,000 clients in more than 100 countries. With revenues in excess of $30 billion and over 4,000 employees worldwide, World Fuel Services offers its customers a value-added outsource service for supply, quality control, logistical support and price risk management.  At World Fuel Services, our employees are the key to our global success. Our high-performance culture is what allows us to drive sustained growth. Stronger together, we promote an environment where individuals can thrive. Build and maintain relationships with current customers.   Work with contractors and vendors to manage on-site repairs and improvements. Collaborate with internal stake holders to resolve customer issues related to pricing, billing, and service Fleet Fueling account set up to include bar coding and creating route cards Support KAMs in setting up new Ship To locations in back office system(s) Emergency small package lubricant/DEF deliveries Work with equipment department & vendors to assure tanks are set up and labeled properly (Lubes) Assist KAMs with temporary tank placements (Fuel) Day after delivery experience follow up via phone call or text (new customers) Details of note (i.e. confirm delivery schedule, delivery hours / correct POC info) Customer goodwill visits Support KAMs with fuel quality issues & product sampling when needed  Requirements: Bachelor’s degree preferred 1 to 3 years of experience in a customer facing role; energy/fuel industry experience not required. Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-paced team environment. Attention to detail and ability to meet strict deadlines. Strong user capability with Microsoft Office products and CRM databases such as Salesforce. Highly motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Ability to multitask Strong organizational skills

description: Are you good at building strong relationships and are excited about working for a growing leader in the Oncology space? Then it is time to consider a career at Biotheranostics, a Hologic company.  Due to our success and continued growth, we are looking to add to our Commercial Team and bring in exceptional talent with big ideas, strong personalities, and a lot of potential to be part of this amazing journey.  Think this role is for you?  As a Key Account Manager at Biotheranostics, you will thrive at managing and enhancing relationships with strategic key accounts, these include Academic Centers, Integrated Delivery Networks, Medical Groups, Integrated Delivery Systems, etc.  From the day-to-day smooth management of the account relationship to the strategic partnership development, you will be in the driving seat. You will be responsible for the development and implementation of Customer Development Plans for your designated accounts.  Playing to your interpersonal and influencing skills and commercial acumen you will help to develop our key academic and thought leader relationships, as well as working with our state, regional and district business leaders to ensure appropriate levels of support are given to these accounts.  Key Outcomes:  Your reputation within the Oncology space, and deep relationships with Key Opinion Leaders will support us in reaching more patients by equipping us with the ability to get our products in front of the right teams, maximizing our patient outcomes and commercial returns.  Always thinking strategically, you will understand and execute upon the opportunities to maximize revenue streams within your accounts as well as helping us to be proactive and mitigate account risk from our competitors.  And with strong knowledge of healthcare reform, you will be a local expert, the eyes and ears of the ever-evolving landscape of oncology diagnostics. Whether you prefer working in an office, or from the comfort of your home, we offer flexible working to all of our employees.  Do you have what it takes?  Outside of your account relationships and ability to deliver you will love the opportunity to be part of a successful and team-driven culture.  You will work across the breadth of our business but can expect to be chatting with teams such as sales management, local reps, Field Science and Medical Science Liaisons, regularly, so having a conversational attitude is important.  You will also be able to soak up information quickly, and share it in a concise and informative manner, and given your background in pharmaceutical or biotech sales/marketing, we know this will come easily to you.  Join us as a Key Account Manager and grab the opportunity to improve lives across the whole world as part of the Hologic Family. It all starts here. What are you waiting for?  Additional Qualifications And Other Information BA/BS Degree Required 5+ years of Oncology Diagnostics, Pharmaceutical or Biotech Sales/Marketing experience 3+ years as an Oncology Key Account Manager in a similar capacity 75% travel within the region  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.  Agency And Third Party Recruiter Notice  Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition, Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.

description: We’re transforming the software industry. With more than 50,000 customers across the world, we’re achieving that goal. But we know we can’t do any of that without our team.  Ready to help us re-imagine the industry during a time of substantial growth and ambitious plans? Come and see why we’re consistently recognized by Gartner, Forrester, and IDC as a category leader in the marketplace.   Flexera delivers Technology Value Optimization solutions that enable some of the largest companies in the world to inform their IT so they can transform their IT. From on-prem to the cloud, companies can get the IT asset data needed to rightsize, reallocate spend, reduce risk and maximize ROI.  The Role As a Territory Account Manager, you will meet/exceed assigned revenue goals working with a virtual team of Systems Engineers, Business Development, Channels, Marketing, and other members of your Flexera ecosystem, including Solution and Channel Partners. You will follow up on leads, perform deep discovery, use product demos for qualified customers and lead the technical validation process. You know how to work "smarter" not harder and drive standard methodologies to ensure success to win as a team. In addition, you will also successfully:  Responsibilities: Be responsible for the business by building and developing account relationships through personalized contact, understanding of account’s needs, and ability to effectively communicate the value of Flexera’s solutions Lead sales campaigns and motions that build customer value and enable multi-year, multi-solution transactions Accurately forecast opportunities based upon realistic assessments and consistently deliver against that forecast Support Channel Partners to create net new customer opportunities and upgrade/expansion opportunities in customer accounts  Requirements: 2+ years of experience in selling enterprise IT software solutions (asset management, cloud management, data analytics, security software, enterprise applications, business processing outsourcing, risk management software or networking performance) or 3-5 years in outside B2B sales or technology/business consulting Utilize a defined Sales Methodology (re: MEDDPICC, MEDDIC, Sandler, SPIN) for business needs/business pain understanding Successful experience running the entire sales cycle - direct responsibility for your own quota or have created new revenue streams with accounts Strong reputation of exceeding sales quota (top 20% in your sales organization) You have successfully owned and led the end-to-end sales process (this is not an overlay or team quota) Consultative sales experience targeting relevant companies/businesses to drive cost savings and efficiencies throughout their IT organization Successful in finding and uncovering opportunities with net new and existing accounts, via creative prospecting tactics and hunting activities Consistent track record of using a repeatable sales process for successful deal Finding, Engaging, Running & Closing Highly motivated and professional, with excellent verbal communication, presentation, and social skills A rational, logical, and analytical thinker You have shown strong technical aptitude and are passionate about technology sales CRM system (Salesforce.com); experience working with Word, Excel, Powerpoint Excellent listening skills with the attested ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks to meet deadlines Self-starter able to work independently but also a giving member of a team Willingness and desire to learn new things and ways to be more efficient and effective Excellent conflict resolution skills Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience

description: Drive Profitable Business Results Analyze the needs of the territory and formulate a strategy to create a Dealer and Rental network to maximize representation of the Pettibone brand and products. Prioritize sales prospects in regard to volume, profitability and time to convert or establish business. Develop sales plans that detail strategy, tactics, required support and timetable for attainment of sales objectives to include revenue targets. Advise on Pettibone Traverse Lift products’ performance advantages and/or competitive technical innovations or shortcomings. Provide competitor information as it becomes known and make practical recommendations for increasing market share in the assigned territory. Communicate territory issues to include competitive activity, pricing, and follow up on lost sales. Develop effective customer programs and negotiate key commercial terms with the customers and Dealers. Develop plans by customer with Dealers to gain enterprise alignment to drive profitable sales. Support the service department by responding to all field service requests in region. Relationship Management Develop deep working relationships with Pettibone Traverse Lift customers. Market all Pettibone Traverse Lift products to all Dealers (within scope) and customers. Set and manage expectations that Dealers will represent all available Pettibone Traverse Lift products. Parts Revenue Work with Dealers to determine the appropriate stocking levels of recommended spare parts list (RSPL); set expectations for appropriate spare parts inventory to service machine inventory and territory population. During each Dealer visit and during periodic conversations, review and verify parts inventory and stocking levels. Product Knowledge Develop and demonstrate proficient knowledge regarding machine features, benefits, operations, warranty and general machine operation of each Pettibone Traverse Lift model to answer customer inquiries in an accurate and timely manner. Product knowledge will be gained through company product training, machine walk around training, study of specification sheets and working through issues with customers on a day-to-day basis. Training  Provide product training to customers and assist Dealer training of customers on new products or changes, basic machine operations, cab/system operations and walk around training.  Inventory Take physical inventory of all machines (sale and rental fleet) in Dealer inventory on a quarterly basis. Provide inventory reports to the Director of Sales and Marketing within five days of quarter end. Promotional Items Check Dealer stock of specification sheets to ensure all specification sheets are current editions. Assist Dealer in maintaining and ordering stock of specification sheets. Discuss with Dealer the need for trade show items such as banners and flags. Review Pettibone Traverse Lift Co-op funds program and usage with Dealers. Job Requirements  Experience and Education: Experience: Minimum of 3+ years of experience in Dealer management and account management (Rental companies and direct customers), with demonstrated sales acumen and sales results. Education: B.A. or B.S. Degree; MBA preferred. Communication: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal communication. Technology: Strong working knowledge of MS Office, Adobe Acrobat, and CRM/ERP software. Other Requirements Strong attention to detail and ability to work both collaboratively and independently. Exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and project management skills. Knowledge of material handling equipment and applications, and construction industry. Strong mechanical skills and hydraulic system skills. Position requires that incumbent reside in or very near assigned territory of Central/Western U.S. Relocation not required. Supervisory Responsibility - This position has no supervisory responsibilities.  Position Type and Expected Hours of Work - This is a full-time position. Work hours are Monday thru Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM or as the job requires.  Travel – This position requires frequent overnight and/or extended travel within North America.  Work Environment - The position operates in a professional office environment using standard office equipment such as computers, iPads, phones, copiers and filing cabinets. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles and moving mechanical parts.  Primary Location- This position will be responsible for the Western United States and must reside within that territory.  Physical Requirements - The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary.

description: As a vital member of the SolarteHealth team, the Sales Consultant (SC) will drive critical activities to obtain new accounts. This person will prioritize targeting tactics, establish a prospect/pipeline and client database, support insights related to potential new offerings, coordinate sales readiness initiatives (e.g., sales presentations and materials), sell and then execute in partnership with business and clinical colleagues. This role is an individual contributor with no supervisory duties. This position is a key role for the organization, partnering with senior leadership to grow the client base and revenues for the business.  Learn and expertly articulate the value proposition of SolarteHealth Prospect and qualify new sales leads Schedule meetings and presentations with prospects Create, plan, and deliver presentations on company solutions Persuade prospects to consider and choose SolarteHealth as a part of their overall health plan Track all sales activities and keep current by updating account information regularly Communicate customer and prospect product pain points to appropriate departments Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospects Develop strong, ongoing relationships with prospects and customers Meet and/or exceed quotas Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort  Minimum Education/Work Experience  Bachelors-degree completion At least ten years of successful sales achievement in health insurance Demonstrated expertise in understanding both fully insured and self-funded group health plan models 10 years+ of experience in group sales and working with employer benefits departments Demonstrated expertise in planning marketplace prospecting and lead generation activities Demonstrated expertise in building and managing relationships with brokers and benefits consultants Demonstrated expertise in being a self-starter, self-motivated independent achiever  Knowledge/Skills and Abilities  A comprehensive understanding of the healthcare industry, overall healthcare economics and competitors’ practices, with ability to grasp both clinical and business concepts Expert understanding of the healthcare business models for insurance solutions and the roles brokers and consultants play Sales plan development Sales plan execution Sales metrics capture Expressing complex ideas clearly and effectively to a varied audience Strong detail orientation and project management skills. Flawless oral and written communication skills sufficient to communicate clearly and grammatically both complex and simple messages to a wide audience either within or outside of the organization Strong sales, persuasion, negotiation, and customer service skills Strong knowledge of Microsoft Outlook (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, email, etc.) Role Model: Supports, manages, and acts as role model for the sales team Clearly articulates and embraces the vision, mission, and values of SolarteHealth in all communications Maintains open communication lines with desire to share information and collaborate on business growth initiatives  Preferred Qualifications  Successful sales execution and quota achievement in health insurance Proven ability to engage, nurture and build strong relationships with brokers and consultants  License Certifications  Insurance licenses and any other state-required certifications

Your mission: Engage prospective clients and help assess their goals and needs promptly Unlimited generated leads from our sales lead system (no cold calling required)! Our mission is to provide excellent customer service in an ever-changing environment to a wide range of clients. We are re-engineering insurance distribution across the country. Join us!

description: Overview  This goal of this position is to maximize conversion across Pacific Retierement Services (PRS) communities by overseeing our sales process, sales training, sales coaching, goal setting, and monitoring progress. Your performance will have a direct effect on the organization's ability to meet or exceed budgeted occupancy targets. This is a remote position that requires extensive travel and reports directly to the VP of Sales and Marketing. You must reside in one of the following states: Arizona, California, Oregon, Texas, Utah, Washington, or Wisconsin.  About Pacific Retirement Services  At our core, we develop, build, and operate retirement communities that range from the ultra high-end life plan communities to low income housing for seniors. We also share our experience and knowledge with other retirement communities who seek our management services, helping them achieve excellence and financial stability. You can learn more by visiting our website .
