jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Tampa– Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  US PHARMA  Country  USA  Work Location  Tampa, FL  Company/Legal Entity  Novartis Pharmaceuticals  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  No
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: If you are an energetic and driven person seeking a challenging career in sales, Insuritas is the place for you! We are an innovative company that is changing the way consumers connect with the insurance products they need, and we are looking for a competitive licensed producer to join our team! As a licensed Sales Agent, you will help customers that are calling YOU navigate the insurance buying process - all within a fun, exciting and collaborative environment.  Your mission: Engage prospective clients and help assess their goals and needs promptly Unlimited generated leads from our sales lead system (no cold calling required)! Develop a rapport rooted in trust and integrity Act as an agent on behalf of top insurance companies Hit daily sales goals and close rates  You will earn a base salary of $40,000/year plus an excellent uncapped monthly incentive tied to your customer experience and sales results.  We offer a full suite of benefits including medical and dental insurance, life insurance, 401(k) retirement plan, vacation and sick time, paid holidays and flex-time availability.  Job Requirements A current Property & Casualty insurance license - REQUIRED 1 - 2 years of sales experience - with a demonstrated track record of sales success A competitive mindset and focus on continuous improvement Passion for providing a 'WOW' customer experience Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and comfortable working in a call center environment  Company Overview Insuritas is a provider of insurance agency solutions using state-of-the-art technology, and is one of the fastest-growing companies in the region. Our mission is to provide excellent customer service in an ever-changing environment to a wide range of clients. We are re-engineering insurance distribution across the country. Join us!
industries: Insurance, Banking, and Financial Services

description: Overview  This goal of this position is to maximize conversion across Pacific Retierement Services (PRS) communities by overseeing our sales process, sales training, sales coaching, goal setting, and monitoring progress. Your performance will have a direct effect on the organization's ability to meet or exceed budgeted occupancy targets. This is a remote position that requires extensive travel and reports directly to the VP of Sales and Marketing. You must reside in one of the following states: Arizona, California, Oregon, Texas, Utah, Washington, or Wisconsin.  About Pacific Retirement Services  At our core, we develop, build, and operate retirement communities that range from the ultra high-end life plan communities to low income housing for seniors. We also share our experience and knowledge with other retirement communities who seek our management services, helping them achieve excellence and financial stability. You can learn more by visiting our website .  Benefits Medical/Dental/Vision insurance (we cover 100% of the employee’s monthly premium) Vacation, Sick and Holiday time 401k with 4% match Profit Sharing Plan Life and AD&D Insurance Short Term and Long Term Disability coverage Responsibilities  How you’ll do it: Coordinate with VP of Sales to set goals for sales teams and individual sales reps Monitor performance to goal and Key Performance Indicators (KPI) Provide ongoing individual sales and coaching skills training Maintain and update our sales playbook and other sales best practices and procedures Owning and updating the central repository sales knowledge and documentation Collaborating with VP of Sales to implement touch-point coaching program (calls, emails, texts) throughout the organization Oversee new sales counselor onboarding, including content development, and provide onboarding scorecards at key milestones Coordinating the training of existing reps Partner closely with our marketing and media departments to create tools and technology that enables sales Measuring and reporting on program effectiveness to Senior and Executive Leadership Teams Partner with key stakeholders to define measurements, analytics and reporting tools / resources Assist in the recruiting, selection and onboarding all of new sales staff. Measure and report on existing sales process successes and gaps and create plans to close those gaps with enablement and process improvements as well as assess the overall business impact of enablement programs Identify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency, and productivity Produce objective sales skill assessments of sales staff on an annual basis Support on and off-site community presentations Contribute to sales staff annual performance evaluations Make recommendations on sales enablement material and re-inquiry campaigns Automation Travel (up to 50%) as needed Qualifications Minimum five (5) years experience in sales or sales management Comprehensive knowledge of common sales methods and processes Process orientation Experience with CRM software Outstanding relationship building ability and customer focus Strong public speaking skills

description: Learning & Development Specialist/Sales Trainer Up to 75k base plus bonus (20%)  Our client is a high-growth sales organization that is seeking an L&D Specialist to support their U.S. Learning operations as part of a national and global team. The role will report to the Head of Learning for the U.S. and will lead training efforts for staff, both remotely and in-person, from onboarding through ongoing coaching and development. The L&D Specialist will understand both local, regional needs as well as the firm's global learning strategies and will partner with leadership to implement effective solutions.   The ideal candidate for this role will bring several years of experience in corporate L&D/Training OR will have a strong background Staffing & Recruitment industry with a passion for moving into Learning. You will bring outstanding energy, ambition, and confidence that allows you to build effective relationships and have an immediate impact.   This is an exciting opportunity for a business with a strong investment in Learning and that continues to experience impressive growth.
industries: Management Consulting

description: Wholesale Sales Support Representative Temp to perm Pay $22-25/hour Perm $50-55k  ASAP start  Mostly remote  Once/month or so must come into office for a week  Covid Vaccine required  This role of Wholesale Support Representative responsibilities is focused mainly on the servicing of client accounts. They will work closely with Director of Sales in coordinating projects, communicating with accounts, analyzing client needs and supporting day to day customer needs.  Sales Support Executive Job Responsibilities: Assist Director of Sales in day to day management of account base Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and hospitality Prepares reports by collecting sales data weekly from key accounts for weekly wholesale meeting Maintains quality customer service by establishing and enforcing Billy Reid standards Market: showroom & collection set up, assist sales team with acct outreach, order entry, maintenance and set up of New orders etc. In season: compiling sales data weekly from key accounts, review shipping status w/ Sales Director and communicate extension requests, follow up after shipments have arrive for check in (drive reorders), keep the order book current, communicate updates to accounts, process RA upon approval, fill in new item set up sheets & pull high-res images for accounts etc. Order management: bulk and sample management, upc request, order updates Travel to: local and regional tradeshows, trunk shows and store merchandising visits Ownership of imagery folders, sample coordination & wholesale tracker Reports: assist Director of Sales in maintenance of ship reports, projection file etc.  Wholesale Support Rep Expectation: A wholesale support rep should be a detail-oriented team player with the ability to provide excellent customer service to account base. They are expected to have the ability to work independently as needed. Strong decision-making, problem-solving, organizational and communication skills are essential for the success in this role. Meeting deadlines, follow up and adhering to schedules are also important attributes expected. *Complete proficiency in excel and PowerPoint is a must.*; This professional must have experience and comfortability with creating pivot tables, v-lookups, using formulas etc. An understanding of retail in this role is a plus.e prompt, reliable, responsive & professional both with customers as well as internally.  For clarification on communication expectation: Prompt & responsive communication (on workdays) is expected within 24 hrs external & internal. After 24 hrs, if an answer is pending for an account, it is expected an acknowledgement email advising on status. Should a deadline need to be extended, it’s expected to communicate with Director of Sales in a timely manner (in advance of the deadline) for support.  Measured Success Sales Support Executive: Overall review of consistency of attend to detail, reaching deadlines and meeting standards with customer service and within the organization.  The Solomon Page Distinction Solomon Page offers a comprehensive benefit program for hourly employees. We pride ourselves on offering medical, dental, 401(k), direct deposit and commuter benefits to our employees, including freelancers – which sets us apart in the industries we serve.   About Solomon Page Founded in 1990, Solomon Page is a specialty niche provider of staffing and executive search solutions across a wide array of functions and industries. The success of Solomon Page reflects an organic growth strategy supported by a highly entrepreneurial culture. Acting as a strategic partner to our clients and candidates, we focus on providing customized solutions and building long-term relationships based on trust, respect, and the consistent delivery of excellent results. For more information and additional opportunities, visit: solomonpage.com and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.  Opportunity Awaits.
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Medical Device Sales Consultant - Richmond, VA
description: **About US** At Vyaire, we help the world breathe easier.  As a global leader in respiratory care, we know what we do enables, improves and extends lives.  We are a young company with a long history of revolutionary products.  We devise extraordinary solutions that allow patients to lead ordinary lives. We believe the best way to create value for our customers, is to become invaluable. We know a dynamic culture with diversity of thought makes this possible.  Our colleagues are people who specialize in exceeding expectations, building lasting relationships and making it a priority to listen.  Www.vyaire.com Watch Our Video  We are dedicated to anticipating what's next and get it done. We thrive on contributing and making a difference. To learn more, visit our website:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZDrQoMbMRrI&feature=youtu.be **About this role** Vyaire teams are dedicated to connecting clinicians and patients with the highest quality respiratory healthcare solutions in the market.  At Vyaire, you will find a company that puts the customer at the center of all we do.  Our culture is one that rewards performance and each interaction we have with a customer furthers our mission to be the global leader in respiratory care. The Respiratory Consumables Sales Consultant primary responsibility of selling and implementing respiratory new product innovation and technology.  Main responsibility is to maximize sales revenue and implement product innovation to Vyaire customers. **Essential Functions:** + Sell total respiratory consumables products portfolio to existing and new customers. + Drive sales growth revenue by interfacing with clinician customers and identifying clinical needs and selling clinically product differentiated solutions for Vyaire Respiratory products. + Schedule product demonstrations, educational in-services, support clinical procedures, and value-add services with Doctors, nurses, and operating room staff in order to drive implementations. + Demonstrate effective use of all approved clinical data/studies and key placement guides. + Work with all hospital call points to provide support needed to utilize Vyaire Consumables products. + Conduct follow up on product used in cases as directed and authorized by the prescribing physician while following all hospital and Vyaire Consumables policies and procedures and respecting patient confidentiality. + Complete all sales training assignments by assigned due dates. + Provide vital and timely feedback to Vyaire Consumables internal stakeholders on customer, product, and quality information and works within the Quality and Regulatory critical timelines for response + Track allowed expenses, submit via Concur weekly, remain Sunshine Act compliant + Corporate compliance and expense management compliance. Exercise control and good judgment of operational expenses (gas, office supplies, telephone, shipping, lodging, meals, and entertainment) + Acquire and maintain current knowledge of competitor's position in marketplace + Maintain current, expert knowledge of regulatory environment and its governance of use of Avanos Medical Acute Pain products **Qualifications:** + College degree and 3 years or more business sales experience + Experience or strong familiarity of Respiratory Consumables product space + Proven track record selling clinical medical device products in the acute care market space + Ability to obtain all necessary hospital credentialing that may be required for access + Knowledge and/or experience selling within a medical device consumables market model **Desired Skills:** + Variable Incentive Compensation driven + Medical Device sales acumen, knowledge, and expertise - Respiratory Consumables knowledge preferred + Strong understanding how to sell within a medical device disposable market - ability to successfully maneuver within value analysis decision making processes + Strong collaborator with excellent communication and customer service skills. + Prominent level of integrity and professionalism + Strong collaboration and partnership competency and skills + Team player, strong interaction and partnership skills. Can demonstrate effective collaboration with co-workers + Coachable - ability to understand and participate within communicated policies and procedures. Is open to and participates in constructive criticism conversations. + Strong work ethic and able to adapt quickly to a change in routine Richmond, VA Full time **We aspire to a "higher calling"** , aligning ourselves with healthcare providers to improve the lives of those who are treated with our devices.** Across the Ventilation, Respiratory Diagnostics and Anesthesia Delivery & Patient Monitoring market segments, we represent the largest pure-play company of our kind, with an ambitious and innovative vision for growth. We hold each other mutually accountable for the quality and reliability of our products and work together toward setting a new market standard in these categories. **We are transforming the future of respiratory care; explore how you can be a part of it.** We are a unified "breathing company", with a global team that is unrivaled in the respiratory care continuum. Each of our 5,000 people worldwide is critical to achieving our shared purpose of improving the lives of those who are treated with our devices. Our people are empowered to "do the right thing" every day and always put patients first. Our market presence, breadth of product and technical expertise enable us to impact the lives of patients around the world every day. One of our unique strengths is the diversity of our community. We want to treat each teammate fairly and provide equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic. To learn about our terms of use, please review Terms & Conditions (http://www.vyaire.com/terms-of-use) . Also, provided here is a link to our Privacy Policy (http://www.vyaire.com/privacy-policy) One of our unique strengths is the diversity of our community. We want to treat each teammate fairly and provide equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic.

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - Detroit, MI - Craniomaxillofacial
description: Who We Want To Work With  You’re a sales professional at heart. You love engaging with customers and colleagues – wherever that might take you. Being responsible for other’s perception of a company’s brand and reputation excites you, as does the challenge of initiating and creatively prospecting new customer relationships – especially in healthcare environments. You enjoy building relationships and understand that collaboration is key to growing any business, especially in a complex and competitive industry. You’re an influencer that is driven to succeed and accountability is important to you. You seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions. You’re resilient and persistent and will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  At Stryker’s Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) Division You’ll work closely with experienced Sales Representatives and Managers to build your knowledge, skill and comfort with clinical and product knowledge as well as selling styles and techniques. They will serve as your coaches and mentors to share lessons learned for how to build and grow a successful business. You’ll receive training and be expected study and prepare independently to perform at the highest levels in the operating room, working amongst surgeons and healthcare professionals. The expectations are challenging, yet rewarding. You’ll represent Stryker as a leader in our industry and the marketplace. You’ll have the opportunity to identify and promote solutions and sell products that change our patient’s lives. You’ll collaborate with our team to build your own business one customer and account at a time. You’ll identify and prospect new customers as well as continually take care of existing customers. You’ll assist Sales Representatives in determining the necessary resources needed for our customers to achieve sales objectives and then execute the plan. These resources may include educational programs, product development initiatives, and sales strategies. You’ll foster a culture and environment that makes CMF destination for top performers and a place where people’s careers thrive. What You Need Highly organized and demonstrate ability to organize a busy schedule. Capacity to deal with competing priorities and potential to be adaptable as days change quickly. Demonstrated ability in building and maintaining relationships in the sales capacity. Must be comfortable in emergency and operating room environments. Prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals (including some weekends, and some overnight travel). Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services This would include marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques and sales control systems Comfortability with adapting to new technology and business advancements. Bachelor’s degree required Would need personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers. Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. “Smart, hardworking, and gets along well with others.” John Brown Our Values  Integrity  We do what’s right  Accountability  We do what we say  People  We grow talent  Performance  We deliver  Core Themes And Phrases About Our Workplace Our Culture - Win together as a team We are a team. We constantly challenge ourselves. We challenge each other. We want to achieve more. We win the right way. We care about each other. Growth - Own your career Our company is growing. You can grow with us. We help you discover your strengths. You can discover and follow your passion here. We are a career destination. The Work - Customers and patients are at the heart of everything we do We strive for the best. We improve lives. We go above and beyond. We are proud of our quality products. We are accountable for our work. e Our People - Passionately driven, remarkable results We are passionate. We are driven. We are focused. We deliver remarkable results. We expect to win. We act with purpose. We act with integrity. We do what we say.  Who we are  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  CMF Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/orthopaedics/craniomaxillofacial.html  #LIInstruments

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - Detroit, MI - Craniomaxillofacial
description: Who We Want To Work With  You’re a sales professional at heart. You love engaging with customers and colleagues – wherever that might take you. Being responsible for other’s perception of a company’s brand and reputation excites you, as does the challenge of initiating and creatively prospecting new customer relationships – especially in healthcare environments. You enjoy building relationships and understand that collaboration is key to growing any business, especially in a complex and competitive industry. You’re an influencer that is driven to succeed and accountability is important to you. You seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions. You’re resilient and persistent and will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  At Stryker’s Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) Division You’ll work closely with experienced Sales Representatives and Managers to build your knowledge, skill and comfort with clinical and product knowledge as well as selling styles and techniques. They will serve as your coaches and mentors to share lessons learned for how to build and grow a successful business. You’ll receive training and be expected study and prepare independently to perform at the highest levels in the operating room, working amongst surgeons and healthcare professionals. The expectations are challenging, yet rewarding. You’ll represent Stryker as a leader in our industry and the marketplace. You’ll have the opportunity to identify and promote solutions and sell products that change our patient’s lives. You’ll collaborate with our team to build your own business one customer and account at a time. You’ll identify and prospect new customers as well as continually take care of existing customers. You’ll assist Sales Representatives in determining the necessary resources needed for our customers to achieve sales objectives and then execute the plan. These resources may include educational programs, product development initiatives, and sales strategies. You’ll foster a culture and environment that makes CMF destination for top performers and a place where people’s careers thrive. What You Need Highly organized and demonstrate ability to organize a busy schedule. Capacity to deal with competing priorities and potential to be adaptable as days change quickly. Demonstrated ability in building and maintaining relationships in the sales capacity. Must be comfortable in emergency and operating room environments. Prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals (including some weekends, and some overnight travel). Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services This would include marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques and sales control systems Comfortability with adapting to new technology and business advancements. Bachelor’s degree required Would need personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers. Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. “Smart, hardworking, and gets along well with others.” John Brown Our Values  Integrity  We do what’s right  Accountability  We do what we say  People  We grow talent  Performance  We deliver  Core Themes And Phrases About Our Workplace Our Culture - Win together as a team We are a team. We constantly challenge ourselves. We challenge each other. We want to achieve more. We win the right way. We care about each other. Growth - Own your career Our company is growing. You can grow with us. We help you discover your strengths. You can discover and follow your passion here. We are a career destination. The Work - Customers and patients are at the heart of everything we do We strive for the best. We improve lives. We go above and beyond. We are proud of our quality products. We are accountable for our work. e Our People - Passionately driven, remarkable results We are passionate. We are driven. We are focused. We deliver remarkable results. We expect to win. We act with purpose. We act with integrity. We do what we say.  Who we are  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  CMF Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/orthopaedics/craniomaxillofacial.html  #LIInstruments

jobTitle: Territory Manager New York City/Long Island
description: Description  Territory Manager-New York  SCITON is an industry leader and manufacturer of medical aesthetic lasers and light source technologies. With a vision to improve people's lives, our top-tier devices are built to order with integrity by pioneering, customer-focused, and results-driven individuals.  At the heart of it, innovation is a fundamental cornerstone of our culture. We strongly believe that new ideas can come from anyone, anywhere, at any time and embrace an open-door culture that welcomes and fosters individuals who are creative, driven, passionate, and willing to take the lead with us. Join us for an opportunity to grow and make an impact.  Life At Sciton  At Sciton, people matter. We are more than a company; we are a family, which is why we give all our employees: The support, recognition, and room to grow their careers within Sciton. Empowerment to develop their creative genius and encouragement to be lifelong learners. Incentives for creativity and innovation across the organization. About The Team  This is a fully remote position with extensive traveling covering New York. Familiarity selling to physicians in private, group and hospital settings is a plus. This position reports to the Senior Area Sales Manager.  In This Role, You Will Support the Senior Area Sales Manager by uncovering sales opportunities establish within the territory. Maintain relationships with clients, through education, training, and support. Conduct product demonstrations and develop business strategies with customers to ensure their success. Be responsible for planning and implementing strategies for elevating sales. Perform marketing research and manage territory. Support in-service training and subsequent training. Track and report sales in an organized and timely manner. Assist with post-sale customer issues. Work with Field Service and company staff. Position Requirements  Essential Requirements Bachelor’s degree. 5 years of sales experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software. B2B sales experience plus capital equipment sales experience preferred. Commitment to high performance with outstanding results. The ability to set and exceed quotas consistently. The ability to generate quality leads consistently. Has a positive attitude, is self-motivated and committed to developing quality customer experiences. Has excellent prospecting and territory management abilities and superior prospecting, selling, and closing expertise. Commitment to personal and professional development. Effective communicator and an active listener. Self-disciplined and organized. Honest, coachable, and a team player. Strong work ethic and communication skills. What Sciton Offers You Competitive health benefits Retirement Income Protection Time off Professional Development Stock Options Discounted Programs Reward Programs

jobTitle: Sales Development Representative, ACH and Online Banking
description: The world of payment processing has changed. Technology alone can no longer meet the needs of businesses who are looking for strategic partners to help them grow globally. We are Nuvei. The payment technology partner that merchants can count on to make their business a local marketplace. We deliver unified commerce solutions and expertise to help our partners capture every opportunity that comes their way. As the most valuable tech IPO ever on the Canadian TSX, we are continuing to expand and are seeking individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.  As a Sales Development Rep, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei's products with specific focus on the Northern America market by uncovering new opportunities and working with a business development manager to mature those opportunities.  Key Responsibilities Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Develop sales leads by using sales tools with outbound sales prospecting efforts.  Preferred Qualifications Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends.  Minimum Qualifications Minimum two years' of sales high growth experience. Pipeline management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits Nuvei offers a wide variety of benefits which include Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Paid Vacation, Paid Sick Time, 401(k) and many other great benefits.  Nuvei perks also include: Training, development and career advancement opportunities. Free Virtual yoga, meditation and fitness classes, community involvement, and many social activities. Employee recognition. Flexibility for Hybrid work A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Nuvei does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

description: Who We Are:  Backed by Macquarie Group, Battery Ventures, Canaan Partners & ITOCHU, JOOR is a Series D start-up that provides the world's most recognized brands and retailers with a digital wholesale management platform that transforms the way these businesses work.  With a CEO recently named a Glossy 50 "Changemaker in the Fashion Industry" and a CTO from Google, JOOR is attracting top talent to drive market dominance. We have 180 employees in 11 global offices, including NYC, Philadelphia, LA, Milan, London, Paris, Madrid, Berlin, Melbourne, Tokyo and Shanghai. And, we are continuing to grow in a smart, sound way.  Founded in 2010, JOOR now services more than 12,500 brands and over 325,000 retailers in 144 countries, processing an incredible $1.5B in wholesale transaction volume each and every month. JOOR's exclusive partners range from established luxury conglomerates such as LVMH, Kering, Richemont and Capri, to leading brands such as Stella McCartney, Valentino, Kate Spade, Tory Burch and Dr. Martens. Premier department stores including Neiman Marcus, Printemps and Harrods, as well as global digital retailers such Shopbop and Revolve, conduct their buying exclusively through JOOR.  We are one of the few tech companies with a female CEO and 1/3 of our engineering team is made up of women — well above the industry norm. Walking our floors, you'll find people of every shape, color, ethnicity and creed. If you are looking to join a team of innovators and trail blazers who value diversity of thought and experience, then JOOR is a great choice for you.  Why JOOR: We are revolutionizing the virtual showroom experience We partner with exciting brands and retailers from around the world We are a global company that is rapidly growing We are one of the most diverse and inclusive tech companies We have been recognized as a break-out technology start-up driving innovation in the fashion & retail industry.  What You'll Do: Own the sales cycle from finding contacts at prospects to close for medium to enterprise level brands/designers -- prospects will be assigned and you have the ability to find your own Conduct product demos and present the business value of JOOR to executive-level contacts via platforms like Zoom, Salesforce, and SalesLoft Establish lasting relationships with senior executives and decision-makers at prospective clients Foster new relationships for JOOR through outbound efforts including sales cadences, heavy phone use, and Social Media (LinkedIn) Consistently meet or exceed, outreach goals, proposal goals, and sales goals to ensure company revenue objectives are met Refine sales strategies to grow the business and attend industry events to generate sales leads Learn and maintain in-depth knowledge of JOOR's industry, trends, and competitors  What We're Looking For: 3+ years of Sales experience Experience in a SaaS, B2B, Retail, Wholesale, AdTech, Media or FinTech organization a plus Expertise in Salesforce and SalesLoft (or other cadence platforms) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively Active listening, negotiation and presentation skills Self-starter, entrepreneurial, and problem-solving mindset English Fluency required Spanish Fluency a strong plus Bonus: Existing contacts/relationships in the wholesale fashion industry  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: What you´ll do at BTS   As a Sales & Marketing Practice consultant, you’ll work directly with sales and marketing leaders from some of the world’s leading corporations including Global 100 largest companies. You’ll identify business results and then find key behaviors that drive sales and marketing. You’ll then craft learning experiences and simulations that build critical capabilities in those companies. The experiences we create and facilitate allow our clients to practice and learn in a risk-free environment, and to walk away with tangible action plans.   And you’ll do a lot more than this.   You’ll be shaping the leadership capabilities of our clients’ sales and marketing leaders as well as cultivating the skills of thousands of developing leaders across the globe. You’ll help customize a gamified sales execution platform that helps sales managers more effectively manage.   We work in small teams and on multiple projects at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams. Approximately 50% of your time is spent facilitating the learning experiences you and your teammates create. Right now, and for the foreseeable future, these programs are being facilitated virtually, of course. Eventually we’ll return to doing much of our facilitation work onsite with our clients, in a workshop/event setting.      When you’re not facilitating, your time is spent creating these amazing experiences we provide for our clients. Interviewing key stakeholders (including executives and top leaders), conducting research and analysis, writing – lots of writing! – testing the programs, and laughing. You’ll laugh a lot and have a lot of fun. And this is all done in a team-based setting where our entrepreneurial culture of freedom and responsibility empowers you to contribute from your first day. As your skills and career grow, you’ll have the ability to manage client relationships, find new clients and opportunities, and grow the careers of others BTSers.    What we are looking for   Experience in selling or sales enablement. Curiosity. Resourcefulness. A humble and inclusive spirit. These are core attributes of BTS all-stars.    We are also looking for entrepreneurial drive and diligence. Intellectual horsepower with strong business acumen. The courage and desire to present to a (Zoom) room that might have 50+ smart, eager people in it. We have consultants from all kinds of backgrounds, work experience, and education. We love diversity and variety.   We do have a few requirements in addition to sales experience. A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. Strong written and verbal communication skills. And eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship.
industries: Management Consulting

description: AMAX is seeking individuals with a passion for technology and is fueled by solving commercial challenges.   If you enjoy building relationships and advanced technology, please read on!   Primary job responsibilities include: ·       Prospecting, managing opportunities and growing new accounts ·       Understanding industry trends and translating to AMAX solutions that meet customer needs ·       Manage sales cycle from lead qualification to opportunity conversion ·       Prepare and respond to formal proposals, bids, quotations ·       Create and maintain pipeline and account reports ·       Maintaining positive business relationships to establish long term partnerships    Essential Job Requirements:  Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation) Upbeat, energetic and self-motivated Prospecting, cold calls, conducting face to face and web meetings Good people skills to establish, maintain and grow the client relationship Strong passion and self-discipline for continuously reaching and surpassing goals IT/Tech savvy a plus A basic understanding of computer/IT products and concepts A fast learner. We will train.   Compensation: Base salary, commission and bonus programs! Competitive benefits with a 401(k) match!   This position is located on-site in Fremont, CA

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – PHILADELPHIA – Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Leveling Guidelines:  The position will be filled at level commensurate with experience.  PCP Sales Specialist: Internal: Novartis sales associate with previous sales experience. External: Minimum 2 years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience).   PCP Senior Sales Specialist: Internal: Novartis sales associate with previous sales experience. External: 5-10 years of experience in pharmaceutical/biotech sales, within the past 15 years.   Why Consider Novartis?  769 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2020. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?  We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous, and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.  Imagine what you could do at Novartis!  Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Join our Novartis Network:  If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  US PHARMA  Country  USA  Work Location  Queens, NY  Company/Legal Entity  Novartis Pharmaceuticals  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  Yes
industries: Pharmaceuticals

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative, Surgical - Chicago, IL
description: Date: Aug 27, 2021  Location: Chicago, IL, US  Company: Teleflex  Expected Travel: More than 50%  Requisition ID: 4569  About Teleflex Incorporated  Teleflex is a global provider of clinically effective medical technologies designed to improve the health and quality of people's lives. We apply purpose driven innovation - a relentless pursuit of identifying unmet clinical needs - to benefit patients and healthcare providers. Our portfolio is diverse, with solutions in the fields of vascular and interventional access, interventional cardiology, surgical, anesthesia, cardiac care, interventional urology, urology, emergency medicine and respiratory care. Teleflex employees worldwide are united in the understanding that what we do every day makes a difference. For more information, please visit teleflex.com.  Surgical - Whatever the latest surgical breakthrough looks like, Teleflex is working to make it happen. From our MiniLapÂ® Percutaneous Surgical System to WeckÂ® Hem-o-lokÂ® Polymer Locking Ligation System, and Weck EFxÂ® Shieldâ„¢ Fascial Closure System, our portfolio of products adds up to a powerful offering of solutions that helps improve patient outcomes. These innovative, minimally invasive surgery products are offered alongside time-tested and trusted PillingÂ® Surgical Instrument and Lightsource solutions to provide a comprehensive set of solutions to meet the challenges of an evolving healthcare environment. Join a dynamic, growing team that offers healthcare providers an array of medical technology solutions that make a difference in patients' lives.  Position Summary  The primary function of the Associate Sales Representative is to provide clinical and sales support to their respective area. Critical roles and responsibilities include effectively educating physicians and support staff on the appropriate setup and use of all Teleflex Surgical products. Associate Sales Representatives are expected to work in concert with Associate Sales Representative Manager, Regional Sales Managers, Market Development Managers, Key Account Managers, and Sales Representatives to support and convert competitive users to Teleflex Surgical products. Additionally, the Associate Sales Representative on occasion will be required to attend trade shows, attend animal and cadaver labs, conduct in-services for staff and participate in sales presentations to prospective customers. Extensive travel will be required throughout the region, area, or nation based on clinical and personnel needs. Associate Sales Representatives will potentially be reassigned to cover vacant territories for an extended period of time due to but not limited to short-term disability, FMLA, or illness.  Principal Responsibilities Exhibit competencies with the Teleflex Surgical product line and competitors. Manage expenses according to Teleflex policy Assist Marketing Department on surveys and gathering customer information Assist with trade shows when requested Actively participate in and contribute to quarterly and national sales meetings Continually prospect for new customers; consistently update customer database (salesforce.com) and communicate those updates to Sales and Marketing counterparts. Fill out customer complaint forms on a timely basis and send to Quality Assurance Share competitive information with home office staff, their RSM counter-part and Area Director Taking proper care of Teleflex Surgical products in their possession Participate in designated conference calls and meetings Follow up on requests made by Sales Leadership Assist in, create and initiate strategies and tactics to increase utilization in the territories supported. Education / Experience Requirements Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a four-year college or university. Proven track record of success Able to spend a significant amount of time (50 - 80%) traveling in the U.S. Advanced level proficiency with computer skills (MS Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Outgoing with a positive attitude Specialized Skills / Other Requirements Possess a valid driver's license and operate a motor vehicle with satisfactory driving records Carry detail bag weighing up to 20 lbs. Lift equipment weighing up to 30 lbs. Be standing or walking in numerous hospitals or at meetings for 6 - 10 hours per day, up to five (5) days per week. Interact with others through effective, verbal communication. TRAVEL REQUIRED: 50-80%  Teleflex, Inc. is an affirmative action & equal opportunity employer. D/V/M/F. Applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. If you require accommodation to apply for a position, please contact us at: 262-439-1894.  Teleflex is the home of ArrowÂ®, DeknatelÂ®, Hudson RCIÂ®, LMAÂ®, PillingÂ®, RÃ¼schÂ®, UroLiftÂ® and WeckÂ® - trusted brands united by a common sense of purpose. description: Job description Growth Engineering is a rapidly growing, globally recognized SaaS company, striving to make a difference in the world of corporate learning. We believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to learn, in an environment that empowers and engages them. That’s why we set out to challenge the way that digital learning is delivered — and why we need people just like you. Did we mention that Growth Engineering is an awesome place to work? You’ll have the opportunity to work in an energetic environment with a smart team that are passionate about what they do. Position Overview This position will report to the VP of US Sales, you will own prospective client relationships, facilitate meetings to understand client needs, and act as a key proctoring consultant. We are looking for a self-starter who has demonstrated success in winning sales, operating in a competitive environment and working through complicated user requirement. Whilst currently a small team, we are on an upward trajectory and are building our results-oriented, top-performing team. Responsibilities Ideally you will have experience of SaaS, and come from an Training/HR/Education background. End to end management of own Sales Pipeline Prospect daily for new logo business and within the assigned install base accounts - using variety of tools. Develop MQL's into SQL's through discovery calls, demo's and follow-up calls Influence senior decision makers, demonstrating GE's value proposition and solving the pain that you/they identify. Assist in establishing effective sales strategies and tactics that result in new business generation and expanding current business within the assigned territory Document daily activity in our CRM to track performance with a one to one Business Development Representative relationship Update sales business plans on a monthly/quarterly basis to optimize sales results Work closely with other departments and support staff to assist with coordination of RFPs, demos, legal contracts, implementation of software, and ensure client satisfaction Achieve annual sales targets and average monthly revenue quotas on a consistent basis Qualifications Minimum 3 years previous direct sales experience selling SaaS and enterprise software - ideally in EdTech Minimum Bachelor’s Degree preferred Working knowledge of learning technology, HRS or gamification software with a history of qualifying client solution areas and orchestrating multi-departmental solution sales Working knowledge of solution selling methodology and practice Excellent written/verbal communication and presentation skills Strong relationship building skills Ability to be a knowledgeable adviser to clients/prospects with a well-developed consultative selling style Proven history of meeting quota consistently along with a strong background in selling into HR and L&D, including C-Suite experience Keen business sense, with the ability to find creative business-oriented solutions to customer problems Proven experience drafting, negotiating and finalizing a variety of client material & documents Proven success working in a fast-paced environment Strong results orientation with a dedicated client focus Demonstrated ability to work efficiently, meet demanding deadlines, prioritize workflow and adjust to frequent workload fluctuations Ability to work alone while also being a strong collaborator Flexibility to travel when needed. At Growth Engineering, we strive to create an inclusive workplace that upholds the dignity of all people and lives to our values – To be Bold, Kind and Responsible. We believe that embracing the diversity of thought and perspective encourages collaboration that leads to product (and people!) innovation, diverse products, and a successful business. Behavioral Competencies Independent and takes responsibility/ownership. Energetic and hungry for success. High integrity – makes and keeps commitments. Acts inclusively. Job: Key responsibilities To develop and drive the right sales initiatives for an ongoing solid pipeline. To identify true opportunities and match our solutions to the needs of the prospect. To present our solutions, directly or through team expertise, to all of the stakeholders within an opportunity To achieve or exceed revenue targets on an ongoing basis. To build the Growth Engineering brand in major enterprise accounts on an executive level. To support and review detailed and structured account & opportunity plans for major deals To understand the strengths and weaknesses of the company’s competitors and to use these to maximum advantage to sell the Growth Engineering solutions and deliver real value to customers. To build a network of L&D professionals, analysts and influencers To own and maintain your own USA-centric pipeline To represent Growth Engineering in a professional manner at all times and to ensure that the company’s interests are uppermost in all dealings and transactions. Role Measurables Annual revenue and new client-win targets. SQL's generated CAC, LTV and Churn Forecasting accuracy Lead generation Job Type: Full-time Salary: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Taos, an IBM Company, is immediately hiring a Sales Enablement Trainer to join our Sales organization! This role is 100% remote and offers a competitive salary and excellent benefit package!  As part of the Sales team, the Sales Enablement Trainer will help drive our high-performance culture through training, coaching and cross-functional communication. You will be responsible for creating and collaborating on sales training content, as well as preparing for and conducting both in-person and virtual training sessions. You will train both new and existing sales teams on value-based selling, product knowledge, prospecting, effective discovery, negotiation skills, sales process, call planning, CRM other tools/resources relative to successful job performance. The Sales Enablement Trainer will listen to recordings of sales calls, conduct ride-along and solicit feedback from the sales teams, then document and present findings to relevant departments on a consistent basis (primarily Product, Marketing and Customer Success). In addition, you will look for and execute on opportunities to enhance Taos’s Sales Enablement programs.  What You'll Be Doing Build and manage repository of on-demand learning assets (videos, presentations, etc.) and ensure content is up-to-date and relevant Coordination, scheduling, and facilitation of sales trainings. Ongoing support of sales new hire onboarding program, including creation of a self-driven training curriculum. Develop assessments to measure the effectiveness of the curriculum and learner performance, integrating results into new and existing course curriculum. Develop and optimize the Learning Management System for self-directed e-training courses and comprehension checks. Development and execution of a product knowledge certification processes for sellers. Formalize a continuous feedback program with relevant departments, including reporting and ongoing communication of new hire certification progress to sales leaders. Work closely with all cross-functional departments in the development and deployment of client facing training programs. Coordinate and program manage the sales kickoff events. What You'll Bring With You 5+ years of B2B sales experience or enterprise sales management experience, preferably in Professional Service or Managed Service 2+ years of training and facilitation skills (both in-person and virtual) 2+ years of Sales Enablement curriculum development expertise; a deep knowledge of adult learning principles and end to end process to develop and deliver enablement via multiple deployment methods 2+ years of Salesforce experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent related experience Working knowledge of the following: Office 365, Salesforce Proficient in L&D principles including adult learning theory, instructional design, and technology-based learning, and skill development Who is Taos?  Taos helps today’s enterprises and rapidly growing businesses harness the power of the cloud and DevOps with digital transformation and optimization solutions. From Executive Leadership to our delivery teams, Taos listens, understands, and delivers best-in-class work. Our deep technical expertise and solutions-driven approach help address our client’s biggest business challenges and opportunities. As a Global Leader of Cloud and DevOps, Taos continues to solve What’s Next.  Referrals  We love referrals so much that we pay for them! If you know someone that you would recommend, send an email to referrals@taos.com or Contact Us and we will do the rest! We'll make sure that you receive the $1000 referral bonus after they are employed with us.  Compensation  Our compensation package includes a competitive salary, medical and dental insurance, 401k, paid vacation, sick time and holiday pay, plus loads of free training (Puppet, Chef, Nagios, LAMP Stack, PMP, ITIL, Python, etc.)!  Equal Opportunity  Taos Mountain, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color national origin, sex, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.  Veterans are encouraged to apply!  E-Verify Participant  This employer will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. Please go to http://www.taos.com/join-our-team/ and review the E-Verify Participant and Right to Work links for more information.

description: Green Street provides preeminent and actionable commercial real estate research, news, data, analytics, and advisory services in the U.S. and Europe. For more than 35 years, Green Street has delivered unparalleled intelligence and trusted data on the public and private real estate markets, helping investors, banks, lenders, and other industry participants optimize investment and strategic decisions. The firm delivers exclusive market information, conclusion-driven insights, and predictive analytics through a SaaS platform. The company is headquartered in Newport Beach with offices in Hoboken, Dallas, and London. To learn more, please visit www.greenstreet.com.  The success of Green Street is directly attributable to the strength of our people. We attract high-quality applicants due to our reputation for excellence and our commitment to train and retain talent. Our collaborative work environment provides team members with opportunities to develop professionally and play a central role from day one. At Green Street, we are all about providing unique insights. A diverse and inclusive work environment where top talent can thrive, think freely and offer different perspectives makes our insights even stronger. We're building a company culture where differences in gender, race, age, religion, ethnicity, identity, physical ability and perspectives are celebrated and valued.  The Inside Sales Associate position is a team-oriented, quota carrying role that will focus on revenue generation for the Green Street Platform, specifically selling Green Street News to market participants. The Inside Sales Associate will work with an entrepreneurial mindset that demonstrates drive, initiative, energy and a sense of urgency in turning qualified prospects into new clients, and will play a vital role in the continued growth trajectory of Green Street.  Responsibilities:  Focus on creating and converting leads to clients through proactive prospect engagement via phone calls and tailored email campaigns; Exercise discretion and independent judgment to manage and build upon an existing sales pipeline; Proactively track updates to pipeline activity and revenue forecast through Salesforce; Prospect and assess new sales potential while moving a large number of prospects through sales pipeline Develop and execute a sales plan for high volume prospect engagement to drive revenue and brand awareness; Achieve key activity (e.g. calls, email engagement, etc.) and performance metrics; Amass and synthesize real estate, transaction, and securities data to enable relevant prospect engagement; Understand and document prospect feedback throughout sales cycle to assist in formulating new sales approaches.  Requirements: A minimum of 1-3 years of successful proactive business development, sales, marketing, or lead generation/enablement experience; Bachelor's degree required; Track record of achieving and exceeding key sales activities and metrics; Experience selling business to business with a track record of overachieving sales goals; Authorization to work in the United States for any employer, without sponsorship requirements; An understanding of financial concepts and principles as they relate to clients' needs is a strong plus.  Travel Percentage: <5%  Working Conditions: The Inside Sales Associate will work indoors in an air-conditioned office building, and must be able to remain stationary at a desk and computer for a majority of the day. Benefits: Comprehensive benefits package including highly competitive medical and dental insurance Company sponsored employee assistance program, life insurance and long term disability coverage Health savings accounts and flexible spending accounts 401(k) matching Vacation, sick, and personal time Company paid holidays and summer half day Fridays Cell phone reimbursements & gym stipends 16 weeks fully paid maternity leave & 2 week fully paid paternity leave Green Street is an Equal Opportunity Employer
industries: Financial Services, Information Services, and Commercial Real Estate

jobTitle: Sales and Marketing Support Executive - Denver, CO
description: Description  Are you passionate about contributing to the well-being of the Medicare population? Are you looking for a role that will let your creative ideas and marketing ability shine? If so, the Sales and Marketing Support Executive works closely with the Market Director, Management team, and Sales Representatives to find sales, marketing, and educational opportunities to help grow the market and increase sales while adhering to CMS guidelines. This position is also responsible for maintaining the local marketing budget and overseeing seminars, special events, educational and orientation programs, and accurately reporting this information. Humana has an inclusive and diverse culture welcoming candidates with multilingual skill sets to service our consumers.  Responsibilities  The Sales and Marketing Support Executive is responsible for coordinating Community Outreach and networking opportunities; partnering with agents and managers to develop and implement marketing plans; managing projects and rolling out corporate programs at the market level; leading seminars and special events; managing expenses and submitting invoices. This position is also responsible for identifying grass roots marketing, educational and sales opportunities.  Humana Perks  Full time associates enjoy Base salary?with commission Medical, Dental, Vision and a variety of?other?supplemental insurances Paid time off?(PTO)?& Paid Holidays 401(k) retirement savings plan?with a competitive match Tuition?reimbursement and/or scholarships for qualifying dependent children And much more! Required Qualifications Bachelor's or Associates degree or 2-3 years of equivalent work experience in a related position Active Health and Life Insurance licenses in CO or ability to obtain within the first 90 days of employment Excellent verbal & written communication skills. Must be self-motivated with a positive attitude. Strong organizational, interpersonal, and presentation skills Great with laptop computers, cell phones and the ability to navigate mobile apps. This also includes knowledge of Microsoft Word, Outlook, Power Point and Excel. Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences This role is part of Humana's Driver safety program and requires an individual to have a valid state driver's license and proof of personal vehicle liability insurance with at least 100/300/100 limits Ability to travel throughout the territory with some overnight stays Must reside within a daily commutable distance of the assigned market office Preferred Qualifications Prior experience in the health solutions or financial industries Knowledge of Microsoft Publisher Engaged with?the?community?through?service, organizations, activities and volunteerism Bilingual with the ability to speak, read and write in?both?English and an additional language without?limitations?or assistance Prior experience in Sales or Marketing Additional Information After offer acceptance you must be able to complete and pass the AHIP certification (paid for by Humana) prior to your start date Any Humana associate who speaks with a member in a language other than English must take a language proficiency assessment, provided by an outside vendor, to ensure competency. Applicants will be required to take the Interagency Language Rating (ILR) test as provided by the Federal Government. Scheduled Weekly Hours  40  Colorado Pay Range  The compensation range represents a good-faith estimate of annualized starting pay at the time of posting based on a full-time 40-hour workweek and may vary based on geographic location and/or employment type. Individual pay decisions will vary based on demonstrated job-related skills such as education, experience, certifications, etc.  50,100-69,075  Pay Type  Salary  Incentive  This job is eligible for a commission incentive plan. This incentive opportunity is based upon company and/or individual performance.  Description Of Benefits  Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, "Humana") offers competitive benefits that support whole-person well-being. Associate benefits are designed to encourage personal wellness and smart healthcare decisions for you and your family while also knowing your life extends outside of work. Among our benefits, Humana provides medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, time off (including paid time off, company and personal holidays, volunteer time off, paid parental and caregiver leave), short-term and long-term disability, life insurance and many other opportunities.
