description: Join Ecolab as a Territory Service and Sales Representative in the Peachtree Corners, GA market. This opportunity offers you the ability to partner with our current customers in the hospitality and foodservice industries and provide recommendations with comprehensive chemical products and programs designed to meet their needs. You will serve as the face of Ecolab, servicing laundries and dish machines, dispensing equipment, and systems for our customers. You will also provide recommendations on advanced cleaning and sanitation programs and solutions that drive a positive guest experience and create cleaner, safer, and healthier environments.  What’s In It For You The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, and healthy environments The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best Access to best-in-class resources, tools, and technology Paid training program leveraging a blended approach including digital learning, live demonstrations, and field practice to certify that associates are safe, confident, and proficient in their roles Thrive in a company that values a culture of safety to include top-notch safety training and personal protection equipment Receive a company vehicle for business use Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, matching 401k, company paid pension, opportunities for stock purchase, tuition reimbursement, and more What You Will Do Use your problem-solving skills to conduct preventative and corrective maintenance on laundries and dish machines, dispensing equipment, and systems. Assist in the installation of equipment and solutions Communicate our total value to the customer to meet their needs and grow sales within existing customer accounts Leverage tools and technology (including tablet and mobile phone apps) to conduct service visits and recommend unique programs and solutions to customers Demonstrate safe equipment use, ensuring your customers’ operations are fully functional, and teams are properly trained Provide emergency service to existing customers via phone or in person, as needed Manage equipment, parts, and inventory to control costs Position Details  This is a field-based position and may require travel to the following locations and surrounding areas: Alpharetta, Roswell, Dultuth After completing an initial training program, you will be servicing established customers including restaurants, hotels, schools, long-term care facilities, and more within an assigned territory. In some cases, where a territory is not immediately available, associates will be assigned a supporting role until a territory assignment becomes available.  Weekend Rotation Generally, 1 in every 8 weekends are required (based on business demand) Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma or GED 1 year of mechanical service or sales experience Availability to provide emergency assistance to customers which may occur at night, on weekends and over holidays Must have a valid driver's license and acceptable Motor Vehicle Record No Immigration Sponsorship available Physical Demands Ability to complete pre-employment assessments including a physical, lift and/or carry 50 pounds, color vision perception, and drug screen Ability to perform essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation Preferred Qualifications Associate degree Previous mechanical problem-solving experience (e.g. plumbing, electrical, HVAC and/or mechanical experience) in a military environment and/or industries related to food service, laundry, housekeeping, hospitality and/or pool and spa About Ecolab Institutional  Discover how our partnership with customers helps serve 45 billion restaurant meals and clean more than one billion hotel rooms annually. From restaurants, hotels, and long-term care facilities, to schools, commercial buildings, and military facilities, Ecolab’s Institutional division provides a comprehensive program of customized cleaning and sanitizing solutions to help meet the specific needs of our customers. Join us and help the biggest and best brands ensure guest safety and satisfaction and protect their reputation.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.  We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: POSITION LOCATED IN CHICAGO Purpose and Scope The Market Development Manager (MDM) works closely with customers and the field sales organization to increase the adoption of NeuroBlate® for epilepsy and oncology within existing accounts. In this role, the successful MDM will develop and execute awareness and adoption strategies to physicians, hospital staff and patients within Monteris’ installed accounts, in partnership with Monteris field representatives, physician referrers, and marketing team. Initiatives include brokering peer to peer engagement meetings, development and execution of educational-oriented programs to physicians and patients and providing tools to drive patient awareness and acceptance of NeuroBlate.   Primary Organization Responsibilities Develops, executes, and measures replicable field-based programs to accelerate adoption of NeuroBlate for epilepsy and oncology in existing Monteris accounts. Programs will include: o  Peer-to-peer meetings between Epileptologists, Neuro Oncologists, Radiation Oncologists at installed NeuroBlate accounts, which may include grand rounds, tumor board, epilepsy conference sessions or one-on-one educational meetings o  mid-level provider and medical assistant education and profiling o  New outreach collateral as needed to support accounts to drive product adoption o  Patient referral pattern and/or incidence analysis o  Quarterly business plans with accounts and field representatives to document outreach activities with deadlines  ·  Works with the field organization to identify and qualify pilot program sites.  · Tracks account metrics to determine effectiveness of outreach programs.  · Codifies program steps and trains field organization to scale programs proven successful.  · Partners with marketing and other functional departments to align resources toward epilepsy and oncology market development.  · Supports the broader Monteris team in efforts to increase epilepsy and oncology adoption.  · Ensures all programs are aligned with Monteris’ mission, values, and regulatory and compliance standards.  ·Travel 70%  Education/Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Marketing, Business, or related field · 5-7+ years product field sales/market development experience in the medical device industry. · Experience working with matrixed hospital environments and/or hospital account management preferred. ·  Experience in neurology/neuro oncology/radiation oncology or neurosurgery field is desired. ·  Comfortable presenting clinical data in a group setting to physicians.  You will be required to meet additional third-party vendor credentialing requirements for hospital access, including but not limited to providing acceptable proof of vaccination status for certain diseases such as influenza, COVID-19, hepatitis B and others, passing a drug screen, and other requirements. You will be expected to work directly with such vendors to demonstrate that you meet those requirements during your employment.

About Grafana Labs  There are more than 700,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a SpaceX launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include two other open-source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs) and Grafana Tempo (for traces)  Grafana Labs looking for Enterprise Account Executives who will be responsible for prospecting and closing new business. You will identify, nurture and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, manage forecasts and track customer data. We're strong proponents of a consultative sales approach - learn about the customer's needs first before talking products. Your expertise will be critical in helping articulate the value of our products, work with the customer during the trial phase and hand off a strong relationship to our Customer Success team. Ideally, you come from a technical background and have sold technical products before.  Responsibilities Meet and exceed individual quarterly and annual sales goals Manage all aspects of the sales process (prospecting, sales meetings, product demos, proofs of concept, proposals, negotiations and account management) Cultivate sales through outbound prospecting and inbound leads Be able to understand and convey the value of both GrafanaCloud and Grafana Enterprise. Become an expert in managing your sales pipeline in Salesforce Manage quote creation, order processing, and day-to-day customer requests  Requirements 5+ Years of Experience in Infrastructure Technology Sales Demonstrated history of consistent goal achievement in a highly competitive environment (top 10% performer) Energetic, upbeat, entrepreneurial, tenacious team player Adaptable and with demonstrable experience in high velocity technology companies Experience using Salesforce Familiarity with open source technology is a significant advantage You will need to be an excellent communicator in all channels (in person, online, in writing) and able to form strong working relationships both in person and virtually Experience using Command of the Message and MEDD(P)ICC is ideal Be located in Texas  Benefits Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Retirement Plan (401k, IRA) with a 4% employer contribution match 30 days vacation in addition to Public Holidays Stipend for work-station build Remote first working culture  Equal Opportunity Employer - At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees.  We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Digital Sales Account Executive for Poultry North America is responsible for developing and executing Cargill Digital Solutions’ commercial vision and achieve short- and medium-term goals for the customer accounts that will drive growth for Cargill Animal Nutrition, while providing customers with software and technology solutions to improve customer production and profitability.This role will focus on explaining the value of the Digital portfolio of software and technology in close collaboration with local Cargill nutrition poultry sales teams. As such, we seek a seasoned professional that can work independently, knows the poultry industry well, has excellent customer relationship skills, and is able to become a subject matter expert in applying different technology in poultry production.  Location: This is a remote position within Eastern US only.  Key Accountabilities Develop and execute the sales planning process for complex accounts for multiple value propositions and solutions as part of the account plan. Develop and structure complex sales proposals that represent maximum value optimization to customer and business. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price, and service strategies. Work with Cargill Animal Nutrition sales teams to align on goals and build actions plans to achieve results. Analyse competitor capabilities to determine gaps and to position offerings against competitive options. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned. External applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within Eastern US only. Minimum travel may be required Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in any relevant business discipline. Minimum of four years of related work experience preferably in poultry nutrition industry. Working experience with presentations and communication using Microsoft tools. Open to create reports and be able to share technical knowledge to non-technical audience. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in animal nutrition or science. Master`s degree will be a plus. Minimun five years of business experience in value added sales solution in poultry nutrition and / or health industry. Proven performance that demonstrates high accountability, strong initiative, with a sense-of-urgency and an entrepreneurial approach. Solid interpersonal skills; being an effective listener, verbal, and written communication. Experience with go-to-market, including sales Strong entrepreneurial spirit; skilled in market assessment, strategy development and annual business planning. Ability to travel up to 35% within North America (post Covid-19). Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

description: Description  Consult with America's businesses, leveraging Paychex key referral channels and partnerships to educate stakeholders on our services, and provide consultative solutions to increase market share and drive revenue. Achieve unit and revenue expectations. Create, manage, and advance accounts, leads, and opportunities in company’s CRM system (Salesforce) and provide accurate sales activity and forecasts. Collaborate with key referral sources, including Accountants, Banks, and existing Paychex clients, with the goal of education, consultation and to secure referrals to end user sales. Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel accounts through telephone calls, targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales Management. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers to increase revenue and market share. Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the Paychex product offering to optimize sales results; remain up-to-date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends and other relevant information of interest to customers. Collect, complete and submit all necessary paperwork for new sales within defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines. When required, address and escalate client concerns to our Service Partners, and follow-up as necessary to ensure satisfactory resolution. May be required to travel for purposes of visiting channel partners, and attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Requirements H.S. Diploma - Required Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in relevant sales/marketing capacity. Our Commitment  Paychex is dedicated to fostering a culture of intentional Inclusion and Diversity (I&D). Our valued employees and commitment to I&D is the essence of our internal and external success. Inclusivity is a key value of our corporate culture and is exemplified through our reputation as a top employer for employee development, diversity, and ethics, as well as a focus on fairness in recruitment, selection, and decision making.  Click here for more information on our corporate social responsibility.

description: ** PLEASE ATTACH RESUME ** Syneos Health® is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization. The Contract Research Organization (CRO) and Contract Commercial Organization (CCO) disciplines are fully integrated and able to constantly share the knowledge, insights and data that can lead to better, smarter, faster practices and processes for bringing your therapies to those who need them most. We’re one company, purpose-built to achieve a goal the industry has long been seeking: Biopharmaceutical Acceleration.  Are you passionate about discovering, developing and bringing more innovative medicines to help patients? Idorsia’s purpose is to discover, develop and bring more innovative medicines to help patients. Idorsia is an independent biopharmaceutical company specializing in the development of small molecules to meet significant unmet medical needs. With a diverse clinical development pipeline, Idorsia is working to treat Insomnia, Fabry, Cerebral Vasospasm, Resistant Hypertension and Lupus.  Job Description: Reporting to the Syneos Health District Manager (DM), the Specialty Sales Representative (SSR) role is responsible for building relationships with recognized experts, HCPs, and prioritized stakeholders in the therapeutic area and integrated health care systems.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required • Minimum 2+ years life science sales experience • Experience in psych / PCP / Sleep Disorders preferred • Experience in retail, market access sales/education discussions preferred • Strong recent experience selling launch product preferred • Strong track record of sales success and experience developing, implementing, executing and measuring success with account plans • Ability to work in a virtual and field based environment • Communicate clearly and effectively – written and verbal • Strong analytical skills and knowledge of reimbursement issues in designated market • Local and national travel required for this position • Full COVID-19 vaccination is required for this position • Valid Driver’s license • Understanding of compliance & privacy laws • Must be able to perform all responsibilities of the position  Essential Functions: • Develop and manage a designated territory with the goal of maximizing sales • Identify and develop business relationships with targeted Health Care providers • Achieve quarterly and annual sales goals • Identify key influencers and achieve designated customer interaction expectations with a focus on top target customers • Deliver disease state and product presentations to customers in territory outlining products, features, benefits and services • Understand and address both business and scientific-oriented needs of healthcare professionals by engaging in meaningful dialog to determine underlying patient needs and determine how products could address such needs • Develop and implement plans for territory to meet sales goals established at the territory level • Execution of the customer interaction plan as established by Sales Leadership. • Implement and execute in a compliant manner marketing and sales direction to achieve territory promotional objectives • Communicate effectively with peers and management • Effective in front of the customer in a hybrid environment (both in person and virtual) • Complete all administrative tasks in a timely manner • Present a professional sales image in all business matters • Manage and maintain expense and promotional budgets for the territory within guidelines • Must operate within Compliance Guidelines at all times • Adherence to Policies, Process and Procedures  At Syneos Health, we believe in providing an environment and culture in which our people can thrive, develop and advance. We reward and recognize our people by providing valuable benefits and a quality of life balance.  Why Syneos Health? Our employees voted Syneos Health as the overall winner in MedReps’ Best Places To Work In Medical Sales Awards. Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Here, you’re empowered to exceed your sales goals with the autonomy you need to over deliver. We’re dedicated to creating better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Syneos Health has launched more sales teams in the last 5 years across all major Therapeutic Areas than the top 25 pharma companies combined. By joining Syneos Health, you’ll be connected to our multitude of career paths and pipeline of employment opportunities.  ﻿WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE | How will you accelerate pharmaceutical sales?  ·      Syneos Health is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer (Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled)
industries: Pharmaceuticals

description: Make Work Better Every Day   Quantum Workplace is a fast-growing software company on a mission to make work better every day. Our tools help elevate the employee experience by transforming employee voices into conversation, understanding and positive change. We’re in the business of creating awesome work environments—and are committed to being one also. We are smart people who care deeply about what we do. We work hard but laugh harder. We wear casual clothes, work flexible hours (hybrid), and get stuff done. You’ll love it here. Even if you don’t match everything we’re looking for, we’d still love to hear from you.    Why Quantum Workplace  Health Insurance: We offer 3 options (1 option is 100% premium paid by Quantum Workplace for employees) + Telehealth  Dental & Vision: We cover 100% of premiums for employees  401k: We match 100% of contributions up to 4% and you're fully vested on Day 1  Adoption assistance and paid parental leave  Zoo memberships  Summer hours and flexible work schedule  No dress code - wear what makes you feel confident - BE YOU!  Monthly manager-employee lunches for goal planning and development  Paid time off including holidays & your birthday  We work hard but we have fun too - ping pong breaks increase productivity  Diversity Council, Culture Coach (buddy), and team focused on engagement  Don’t just take our word for it, read our Glassdoor reviews  What’s the opportunity?   The primary responsibility of the Account Executive is to acquire new customers, and hit monthly, quarterly, and annual revenue targets. To do this, the role requires someone with a high level of business acumen, grit, and influence to pursue prospective customers, effectively negotiate software subscription-based contracts, and manage the overall sales journey for each opportunity in your sales pipeline. This role also requires a hyper focus on tracking key results and activities that lead to a sale. The position is well compensated with base plus commission, 401k match, great benefits, flexible work schedules, remote (in some states) and hybrid work options, and a chance to be part of a team focused on growth – personally and as a company.   What you will get to do in this role:   Direct Sales Activity  Build targeted call lists of customers inside HubSpot for cold calling and emailing  Prospect and add a complete list of key prospective customer contacts  Manage a robust sales pipeline and follow up with prospective customers to drive to the close  Provide brand awareness, insights, and success stories with prospective customers  Document calls, emails, and other relevant sales activity inside HubSpot  Navigate through the sales process and know when to bring in other team members from Sales, Product, or Client Success for help, call support, etc. to help you close   Product Demos  Schedule and give product demos to prospective customers showcasing key features and functionality  Understand prospective customers, their business, their pain points, and showcase how our software makes an impact and adds value  Work closely with our Product and Customer Success teams to uniquely position our product to HR executives  Identify key stakeholders and schedule follow-up demos to shorten the sales cycle   Contract Negotiation  Negotiate new customer contracts  Communicate with different customer stakeholders – executive sponsor, HR, procurement, etc. – to drive to group consensus and a “win-win”  Defend standard net payment terms and invoicing schedule   Be a Teacher and a Learner  Formulate creative ideas for adding value with prospect interactions and stalled deals.  Identify areas for improvement and mastery during self and group film review sessions  Be a sounding board ad active participant in self and group pipeline review and sprint sessions   Act as a Utility Player  Freedom to take on and explore additional projects in and outside of your sales role  Identify ways to expand responsibilities based on your skills and personal interests   About you:   You understand the value of employee engagement. You know that employee engagement is critical to an organization improving workplace culture. Most likely, you have been exposed to (or have experienced) organizational topics like employee engagement, performance management, feedback, employee appreciation, and turnover – the good, the bad, the ugly. We’re here to make work better.   You’re a relationship builder and teacher. You are good with people, even the most difficult. You know that relationships are built on credibility and trust, and both of those take time. Relationships for you are not about saying yes or just being nice, but about finding common ground.  You’re tactical, yet strategic. You’ve been told before you’re a doer. You enjoy creating and completing to-do lists and understanding next steps. But, you also know the importance of big picture thinking.   You’re analytical. You dig spreadsheets – at least some of the time. You like to look for trends and uncover the hidden insights that may help shape the story to tell in the marketplace.  You thrive on making a difference. Presenting ideas, insights or ideas in-the-moment to executives isn’t intimidating because you know the difference it will make if we can continue the conversation.  You can influence those around you. You are effective at sharing insights and coaching executives on why they should set up a product demo with us. Delivering effective messages are easy for you because you’ve prepared.  You’re comfortable with challenges. Being accountable for aggressive sales revenue and related activity goals excites you. You are not frustrated by the ups and downs of sales. You know that sometimes the best laid plans go astray. You take that as a challenge to get back on track.  You’re a team player. You realize that building success in sales requires the strengths, expertise, and collaboration of the greater team. You go out of your way to ensure ideas, decisions, and plans are well communicated and understood by those you work with closely.   Most likely, you’ve had success with some or all the following experiences:  Prospecting  Cold calling and emailing  Outbound sales, ideally SaaS and/or within the HR field  Working for a software startup  Working with HubSpot (or some other CRM)   Compensation info: $65,000 base salary + uncapped commissions
industries: Computer Software

description: Charlotte Monday- Charlotte Wednesday- fort mill Thursday- lake Norman  $500/day plus a bonus on sales non-surgical regenerative medicine practice with clinics across the US. Our goal is to help patients with arthritis, sports related injuries and chronic joint pain, without the use of surgery, steroids, or pain meds. excited to open the market and we are announcing a job opportunity within our organization. We are currently looking for a Patient Sales Consultant to act as our Financial Coordinator. As mentioned, we specialize in the use of regenerative medicine to treat arthritis, sports related injuries, and chronic pain.  will spend tens of thousands of dollars on a weekly basis by adverting on local radio, TV, search engines (ie: Google), and social media. All inbound leads will be prequalified by our call center which will schedule appointments at our clinics. In other words, your time wont be wasted with random sales leads and therefore well be expecting a high closing rate. The Sales Coordinator must be a highly motivated individual that preferably has healthcare elective procedure experience in dealing with cash pay (no insurance) medical practice. We are looking for skilled "deal closers" who can overcome objections and challenges from patients and articulate to the patient why our practice and procedures are an amazing fit for them. They are expected to perform sales functions, meet with patients and guide them in the treatment processes. Following up with patients on a regular basis to develop relationships is a critical function of this medical center role as well as ensuring excellent patient satisfaction. Achieving year over year sales growth by increasing gross revenue for the clinics are a must! Responsibilities Include:  Understands the physiology for each treatment offered and able to explain each treatment in great detail as prescribed by the medical provider  Reviews notes from the medical provider in order to speak with patient concerning treatments  Obtains treatment plans from medical providers to present to the new patient  Learns and delivers verbiage for each treatment option prescribed by the medical provide  Explains to the patient any imaging questions after medical provider establishes their diagnosis and explains pathology  Answers any questions the new patient may have regarding finances  Explains recommended procedures, financial breakdown, financing options .  Closes 50%+ of patients they see. An average of 12 patients a day will be seen.  Perform outreach and marketing to help bring in a consistent flow of patients.  Works closely with marketing department to optimize campaigns.  Achieve year over year sales growth  Increasing Practice Gross Revenue Required Experience  2 year minimum experience in a related healthcare industry based environment.  2 year minimum experience in sales of elective medical procedures.  Experience with regenerative medicine/PRP injections, Pain management is a PLUS  Experience with cash payment options, non-insurance elective procedures.  Experience using 3rd party financing options such as CareCredit  Strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to work effectively with the right range of contingencies in a diverse community.  Ability to interact with staff in a team environment.  Knowledge of clinical operations and procedures  Experience  Knowledge of legal and ethical standards for the delivery of medical care and ability to work both independently and in a team environment. Our very competitive compensation structure will include base salary plus bonuses/commissions typically exceed $100,000/year working part-time-to fulltime.  Medical sales: 2 years (Preferred)  regenerative medicine: 1 year (Preferred)  please send resume to Brian Torchin.  HCRC staffing

The Sales Coordinator must be a highly motivated individual that preferably has healthcare elective procedure experience in dealing with cash pay (no insurance) medical practice. We are looking for skilled "deal closers" who can overcome objections and challenges from patients and articulate to the patient why our practice and procedures are an amazing fit for them. They are expected to perform sales functions, meet with patients and guide them in the treatment processes. Following up with patients on a regular basis to develop relationships is a critical function of this medical center role as well as ensuring excellent patient satisfaction. Achieving year over year sales growth by increasing gross revenue for the clinics are a must! Responsibilities Include:  Understands the physiology for each treatment offered and able to explain each treatment in great detail as prescribed by the medical provider  Reviews notes from the medical provider in order to speak with patient concerning treatments  Obtains treatment plans from medical providers to present to the new patient  Learns and delivers verbiage for each treatment option prescribed by the medical provide  Explains to the patient any imaging questions after medical provider establishes their diagnosis and explains pathology  Answers any questions the new patient may have regarding finances  Explains recommended procedures, financial breakdown, financing options .  Closes 50%+ of patients they see. An average of 12 patients a day will be seen.  Perform outreach and marketing to help bring in a consistent flow of patients.  Works closely with marketing department to optimize campaigns.  Achieve year over year sales growth  Increasing Practice Gross Revenue Required Experience  2 year minimum experience in a related healthcare industry based environment.  2 year minimum experience in sales of elective medical procedures.  Experience with regenerative medicine/PRP injections, Pain management is a PLUS  Experience with cash payment options, non-insurance elective procedures.  Experience using 3rd party financing options such as CareCredit  Strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to work effectively with the right range of contingencies in a diverse community.  Ability to interact with staff in a team environment.  Knowledge of clinical operations and procedures  Experience  Knowledge of legal and ethical standards for the delivery of medical care and ability to work both independently and in a team environment. Our very competitive compensation structure will include base salary plus bonuses/commissions typically exceed $100,000/year working part-time-to fulltime.  Medical sales: 2 years (Preferred)  regenerative medicine: 1 year (Preferred)  please send resume to Brian Torchin.  HCRC staffing
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Medical Practice, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Are you interested in an exciting opportunity with a fast growing company in the lucrative field of IT sales?  Infranet is hiring information technology sales representatives to help grow our revenue and market presence through prospecting, lead response and relationship building. Our partnerships with leading-edge technology manufacturers keep us on the cutting edge of delivering transformative IT solutions and services. We feel strongly about being a champion of technology for our clients. By listening to each client’s business objectives and applying technical knowledge and career experience we strive to understand, recommend and implement leading technologies that fit their needs. We take a proactive approach to client support utilizing preventative and monitoring services while always maintaining a posture and readiness to deliver fast, friendly, responsive and accurate assistance.

We are seeking an experienced high performing Sales Executive for the iVIK family of companies and the Relevium Brand of quality, all natural CBD concentrates and related products. We operate best-in-class cultivation, product development, manufacturing and distribution of pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, cosmeceutical cannabis products to meet the global needs of consumers and patients in fully-legal cannabis markets.  Responsible for ensuring maximum sales volume for products you will; develop the strategic sales plan, recommend and manage appropriate sales channels, manage key B2B/B2C accounts, cultivate and maintain high level relationships with wholesale, retail and distribution partners and customers. You are self-motivated and ambitious with a driving desire to succeed, personally and by best serving the organization.  Candidate will implement and manage programs and tools that attract new prospects and customers, stay informed of changes in industry sales and marketing environment, effectively communicate our products to the market, close large volume sales transactions, and further grow the organization in keeping with the Company’s long-term vision.  SKILLS: Successful candidates will have proven experience and success demonstrating particular attention to detail, organizational skills, and excellent communication skills to all parts of the organization. More specific qualifications include: · Bachelor’s Degree and minimum of 3 years of sales experience · Sales & strategic account management · Design professional written & oral presentations · Product portfolio management & market analysis · Business development & product launch · Sales experience in the legal Cannabis or CBD space is required · Start-Up experience in a dynamic environment a plus · Maintains deep cannabis industry product and regulation knowledge · Ability to successfully navigate complex and changing business environments · Ability to travel and work across multiple time zones · Able to communicate effectively and sensitively across multiple stakeholders and cultures · Familiarity with basic web functions, Google Analytics, other SEO tools, MS 365  DUTIES: Develop strategic sales plan to expand the company's customer base and maximize sales · Monitor and analyze current trends and competitive activity to shape sales strategy · Building relationships with other industry players and strong networking · Identify sales forecasts, highlighting gaps and sales opportunities · Consultative sales and ongoing relationship management · Identifying strategic partnerships · Negotiations and closing of sales transactions · Write and submit customer PO agreements · Actively creating and maintaining a robust CRM · Identify and manage outreach and lead generation programs · Maximize sales growth and implement effective promotion strategies · Propose and manage sales budgets · Prepare reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information against targets · Present sales projections of volume quarterly, or more often if needed · Manage sales collateral, marketing materials, advertising campaigns · Market research to identifying buyer profiles, product design, pricing recommendations · Work collaboratively with E-Commerce, Product Development, Regulatory and Operations  We afford equal opportunity in all phases of employment without regard to an individual's age, race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic tests and information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected status.  Work out of Chicago Office, your home office, on the road, or will consider remote role for right candidate.  Our safe workplace policy mandates all employees be fully vaccinated for COVID-19.  Email resume and cover letter to rlatte@ivik.ca

jobTitle: Outside Sales Representative / Account Manager - Tools and Accessories
description: Altec specializes in the manufacture, sale and service of aerial devices, digger derricks, cranes and specialty equipment for the electric utility, telecommunications, tree care, construction, and light and sign maintenance industries in more than 120 countries throughout the world.  Altec Supply is currently looking for an Outside Sales Representative / Account Manager located in Houston, TX; Austin, TX; San Antonio, TX; and surrounding areas. Altec Supply provides aftermarket parts, accessories and service needs for our customer's equipment. Primary responsibilities include the following:  Produce sales of products in a designated area or designated account(s) to meet pre-established quotas. Manage and support the designated area of responsibility consistent with Altec values. Utilize skills in territory management, account management, and time management. Perform sales calls, presentations, and product demonstrations. Assist in establishing quotas, pricing, forecasting, and receivables collections. Attend product/sales meetings. Develop external and internal personal customer relationships. Complete all sales related paperwork such as sales call logs and expense reports. Maintain a high level of customer service. Produce product sales to meet or exceed established quota. Build and maintain customer profiles and market data. Ensure that sales strategic plan and critical issues are met.  Please apply directly on our website https://jobs.altec.com/  U.S. Military Veterans and Spouses are Encouraged to Apply See https://altecveteranrecruiting.com   Education, Experience, and Skills Required Four-year Bachelor's Degree required. Current valid driver’s license required. At least two years of applicable experience preferred.  Product and/or industry knowledge preferred. Must be available for moderate overnight travel. Total communication and information processing skills are required. PC skills using spreadsheets, word processing, and other office management applications required.  The job level is able to be adjusted at time of hire, if the candidate meets the qualifications for jobs of a more experienced level in the career path.   Customer First - Enjoyment of Work - Family - Financial Stability - Integrity - People are our Greatest Strength - Quality - Spiritual Development – Teamwork  Competitive pay which rewards performance  Comprehensive benefits including Medical, Dental and Prescription Drug Program - Retirement 401(k) Program - Vacation and Holidays - Flexible Spending Accounts - Tuition Assistance Program - Employee Assistance and Mental Health/Substance Abuse Program - Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Altec Industries, Inc. and its affiliates are equal opportunity employers and maintain affirmative action plans to recruit, retain, develop, and promote qualified individuals without unlawful consideration of race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Altec strives to maintain a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and harassment, where associates are treated with respect and dignity.

jobTitle: Travel Sales Consultant - Cosmetic Surgery - Florida Market
description: Job Description  SonoBello is now seeking a full time Travel Sales Consultant for our Florida Market (Orlando, Ft. Lauderdale and Tampa). The Patient Care Consultant is responsible for conducting face to face consultations and assisting our patients with understanding the Son Bello process in electing Laser Assisted Body Contouring and Non-Invasive procedures as a solution to their needs.  To qualify for consideration, candidates will have a proven track record of success in sales in a fast-paced environment; will possess confidence; emotional intelligence; credibility and high integrity; and an excellent work ethic.  Who We Are  In just over a decade, SonoBello has grown into an industry leader in cosmetic surgery, specializing in laser assisted liposuction. We have performed over 250,000 procedures and today have 60 locations and more than 120 board certified surgeons across the country. Our cutting edge technology, specialization and experience allow us to deliver life changing results as well as an amazing patient experience. As a leader in our industry we are seeking high caliber talent to join our team and help build Sono Bello into the household name for body transformation and help push our success to the next level.  We offer competitive pay, a full suite of benefits including 401k plan, and a challenging and rewarding work environment.  Sono Bello Is a Fast-paced Small Surgery Center And We Provide Our Team Members Advantages That Most Other Medical Facilities Dont No work on Holidays or late night shifts to encourage a work/life balance Work in 'happy medicine'; treating patients who are excited about improving their lives An opportunity to work in the growing fast paced world of aesthetics Competitive pay and benefits including a 401K + Monthly commission and bonuses Required Experience  Responsibilities and Duties  Key (Sales) Patient Care Consultant Responsibilities Include but are not limited to: This role will require a highly motivated individual with strong negotiation and closing skills with the ability to overcome objections in a face-to-face consultative environment. Meet with new and existing patients to determine realistic goals, matching the appropriate treatment plans with our surgical and non-surgical body contouring solutions. Provide value and educate our patients regarding our approach, the procedure, and our processes; including all documentation and financing/payment options available. Manage the appropriate follow up with both the in-center clinical team and the patient to ensure a great experience leading up to and through the procedure. Maintain and develop a patient pipeline and regularly follow up with prospective patients who did not move forward in their initial consultation. Demonstrate leadership within your center location to keep the entire team informed, positive, and energized to support the best possible patient experience. Qualifications And Skills Proven, outstanding track record (minimum of 3 years) in sales in a high-energy, high-paced environment. Experience with one-on-one consultative selling in industries such as finance, education, plastic or cosmetic surgery, hair replacement, or other professional settings is considered a plus. Is a quick study: can immediately build rapport, assess the patients needs, and create a sense of urgency to drive action. Must have excellent interpersonal skills that builds effective working relationships with patients, physicians, and other team members. Must be a self-starter, accountable, and highly motivated to hit and exceed targets to reap financial reward (manage KPIs). Maintains professionalism and poise constantly, even when working under pressure. Must be highly organized and detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize competing tasks. Ideal candidates will have sales experience performing one-on-one consultations in professional industries such as finance, education, plastic or cosmetic surgery, hair replacement, or other professional settings. A minimum of 3 years of documented successful sales experience preferably in consultative and/or surgical sales. Keyword: sales
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Medical Practice, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Reporting Directly to the TRAM Sales Director, this position will lead independently the Sales, Investments and In-store performance of Travel Retail America accounts. Responsibilities will include achieve sales and plan investments, manage accounts, manage and implement marketing and trade marketing guidelines.  MAIN RESPONSABILITIES  1.    Deliver on market share retail objectives. 2.    Manage regional spend for the area/ group of customers. P&L management. 3.    Define and follow budget targets to reach top line sales and profit levels. 4.    Continuously look for and assess, new business opportunities within area. 5.    Develop strong working relationship with Regional Accounts. 6.    Drive commercial negotiations at corporate (HQ) and field levels (stores). 7.    Work with clients to maximize all aspects of business (in-shop space & locations, prices, investments, promotions…) 8.    Day-to-day management of accounts jointly working with TR Americas Team (Sales, Marketing, Trade Marketing, Finance and Logistics departments). 9.    Forecasting responsibilities on saleable and non-saleable goods (POS material, GWP etc.) to optimize costs and avoid obsolescence. 10. Together with Sales Director and TR Americas Marketing team, define, negotiate and implement marketing, launch and promotional plans, 11. Ensure that merchandising, builds and visual implementation is in line with corporate and brand guidelines 12. Negotiate promotional activities to develop the business. 13. Market Intelligence: gather market information related to the industry (market size, distribution, pricing, launch results, ranking etc.) 14. Continuously seek new opportunities in space and location to enhance brand image and visibility 15. Negotiate and implement Coty Brand Image in all doors according to VIP guidelines (ie personalized Brand fixtures – where possible) QUALIFICATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS REQUIRED: University Graduate, Economy or business related. 1+ years’ experience in sales. International exposure. Industry knowledge & Travel Retail experience a plus, but not essential. Language: Fluent English and Spanish. Excellent written and spoken communication. Good negotiation skills. Excellent PC knowledge for office applications. Strong retail acumen. A sharp eye for in-store excellence in execution. Strong collaboration and leadership skills required to coordinate/manage the field force. Work with Multi-brand dynamic – a variety of brand strategies. Availability to travel 30-50% of the time. PERSONAL & INTERPERSONAL SKILLS: Ability to work with a variety of people from various business and cultural background. Build account relationships at corporate and store level. Manage tight deadlines. Be able to work independently & follow through with practical, actionable application.

jobTitle: Medical Device Sales Consultant - Albuquerque, NM
description: **About US** At Vyaire, we help the world breathe easier. As a global leader in respiratory care, we know what we do enables, improves and extends lives. We are a young company with a long history of revolutionary products. We devise extraordinary solutions that allow patients to lead ordinary lives. We believe the best way to create value for our customers, is to become invaluable. We know a dynamic culture with diversity of thought makes this possible. Our colleagues are people who specialize in exceeding expectations, building lasting relationships and making it a priority to listen. We are dedicated to anticipating what's next and get it done. We thrive on contributing and making a difference. To learn more, visit our website: www.vyaire.com Watch our video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZDrQoMbMRrI&feature=youtu.be **About this role** Vyaire teams are dedicated to connecting clinicians and patients with the highest quality respiratory healthcare solutions in the market. At Vyaire, you will find a company that puts the customer at the center of all we do. Our culture is one that rewards performance and each interaction we have with a customer furthers our mission to be the global leader in respiratory care. As a Sales Consultant, you will be responsible for growing your business through world class solutions along with an investment in your professional development. You will bring new insights to healthcare professionals, shape the customer experience, and manage stakeholders across the buying process. In this role, you will deliver Vyaire' s unique value proposition to the market through your passion, expertise, and dedication. **Essential Functions:** â€¢ Maintain results driven focus in individual goals while supporting and championing organizational goals across the team and the company â€¢ Build a comprehensive territory and account plan with guidance from your manager that prioritizes sales opportunities, creates activities /methods for realizing sales objectives, and executes the plan with consistent monitoring and adjusting as needed â€¢ Maintain and grow current business by identifying customer challenges and developing holistic solutions, including cross-selling across the Vyaire solution set for deeper product and account penetration â€¢ Drive product demand by leveraging centrally generated insights with account level research that persuasively compels customers to discover or reconsider new opportunities and new ways of thinking â€¢ Responsible for meeting quota on assigned accounts within the territory on a quarterly, semi-annual and annual basis Sales Consultant â€¢ Develop strong relationships and physician advocates within accounts through clinical knowledge of procedures and products â€¢ Strategically take prompt action in navigating customer stakeholder consensus across clinical, financial, and administrative roles to coach through the buying process and identify individuals most likely to act and exert internal influence â€¢ Proactively communicate on a daily basis with team members in a fast-paced environment; provide regular updates on competitive, clinical and customer situations â€¢ Develop and deliver on monthly and quarterly forecasts while maintaining CRM compliance and accuracy â€¢ Focus on driving depth and increasing Vyaire product utilization in existing accounts through the cultivation of new physician users and re-engaging lost customers â€¢ Assist in formulating sales revenue projections, by account, for the territory utilizing salesforce.com â€¢ Based on assigned accounts and territory goals, be able to develop call plan for the week/quarter ahead â€¢ Conduct in-services and presentations to all support staff â€¢ Demonstrate outstanding product knowledge â€¢ Proactively communicate on a daily basis with team members; provide regular updates on competitive, clinical and customer situations â€¢ Maintain company standards involving ethical and moral character while professionally representing Vyaire Medical â€¢ Complete administrative requirements (including expenses) timely and accurately â€¢ Comply with Vyaire's Code of Conduct, all company policies, rules, procedures and administrative standards **Essential Function Requirements:** Credentialing: Employee shall secure and maintain the credentials required by Vyaire Medical and its customers. Securing those credentials may require mandatory vaccinations and other tests. (If employee is unwilling or unable to comply with any credentialing requirement because of religious or health/medical/disability related restrictions, employee must immediately notify Vyaire Medical's Human Resources Department to discuss possible reasonable accommodations regarding those restrictions.) Travel: Up to 80% of the time Driving: Valid driver's license and clean driving history Location: Refer to active requisition Physical Demand: Must be able to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. without limitations or constraints **Qualifications** : â€¢ Three (3) plus years in sales within the medical device and/or healthcare field â€¢ Associates degree or respiratory therapy certification required; Bachelor's degree preferred Sales Consultant â€¢ Adaptability as needs and focuses evolve â€¢ Excellent interpersonal and negotiating skills; ability to adapt to changing work prioritize â€¢ Proven product knowledge â€¢ Ability to work independently â€¢ Ability to present to senior leaders â€¢ Verbal and written communication skills; proficiency in business English and grammar; good arithmetic skills and attention to detail to maintain records and process reports â€¢ Proficiency with PC-based office computers, including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook is required Albuquerque, NM, Denver, CO Full time **We aspire to a "higher calling"** , aligning ourselves with healthcare providers to improve the lives of those who are treated with our devices.** Across the Ventilation, Respiratory Diagnostics and Anesthesia Delivery & Patient Monitoring market segments, we represent the largest pure-play company of our kind, with an ambitious and innovative vision for growth. We hold each other mutually accountable for the quality and reliability of our products and work together toward setting a new market standard in these categories. **We are transforming the future of respiratory care; explore how you can be a part of it.** We are a unified "breathing company", with a global team that is unrivaled in the respiratory care continuum. Each of our 5,000 people worldwide is critical to achieving our shared purpose of improving the lives of those who are treated with our devices. Our people are empowered to "do the right thing" every day and always put patients first. Our market presence, breadth of product and technical expertise enable us to impact the lives of patients around the world every day. One of our unique strengths is the diversity of our community. We want to treat each teammate fairly and provide equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic. To learn about our terms of use, please review Terms & Conditions (http://www.vyaire.com/terms-of-use) . Also, provided here is a link to our Privacy Policy (http://www.vyaire.com/privacy-policy) One of our unique strengths is the diversity of our community. We want to treat each teammate fairly and provide equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic.

description: Description Swift Media Entertainment is a premier esports and gaming organization with teams all over the world. Swift has three business pillars; TSM, Icon Talent Agency, and the coaching app Blitz.gg.   TSM is a world-recognized leader in esports with multiple top-ranked competitive teams, including the most notable League of Legends team who has won 7 LCS Championships, more than any other organization. Originally founded in 2009 by Andy Dinh and Dan Dinh, we now have 10+ competitive teams in addition to League of Legends, including Fortnite, Valorant, Apex, Rainbow 6 and more. We also have one of the largest networks of streamers on Twitch.tv (Subsid. Amazon) including Myth, ImperialHal, Wardell, Hikaru and Doublelift.   In 2020, TSM opened our first performance center in Playa Vista, CA - a $50 Million state of the art facility focused on cutting edge performance technology that operates as our central hub and headquarters. Most recently, TSM landed the largest partnership deal in esports history with FTX.   All of this contributes to our mission to become the most competitive, popular and successful esports and video game organization in the world. We're seeking skilled, driven, and passionate team members to continue the momentum forward.  Overview Reporting to the Sr. Director, Global Sales Strategy and Insights, the Global Sales Planner will be a key addition to the TSM sales and partnership solutions teams responsible for providing ideation, design, and content in presentations. This position will help gather, create, and manage various sales documents and presentations for internal teams in our partner and brand presentation process.  You have a love for sports/esports and media, and have a desire to be a part of a fast growing environment in the world of esports.  You have an ability to work with brands, and a strong passion for building sales presentation material.  What You’ll Be Doing  Design and create presentations for sales and partnerships solutions teams across TSM, Blitz, and 3rd party sales organizations Participate in partner and brand conversations in efforts to build best in class sales presentations  Assist in ideation and presentation process in critical partner and brand meetings Ability to multi-task and work across multiple projects  Ability to bring plans and strategies to life in presentation form in efforts to develop new business and revenue across sales and sponsorship solutions departments Understanding of sponsorship and digital sales process and landscape  Collaborate with organizational departments- sales, partnerships solutions, product (esports), content, digital, and research teams to deliver presentations for current and potential partners Will be a key player in the revenue growth of TSM and Blitz organizations  Requirements 3+ years of experience in presentation building across brand, agency, and digital landscape. Strong expertise building presentations and material (Powerpoint, Google Suites-sheets/slides, etc.) Strategic thinker, self starter with strong analytical and problem solving skills Deep understanding of the sports and media landscape Understanding of competitive esports, gaming, influencer landscape is preferred, with an ability to navigate an industry that is constantly evolving  Resourceful and independent professional who can handle managing multiple projects at one time Strong familiarity with social platforms and their performance metrics (YouTube, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, etc.) Motivated to work hard in a fast-paced, start up environment to help our growing business  Strong verbal, written communication skills Graphic design experience a plus Los Angeles based preferred  Swift Media Entertainment is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and the use of affirmative action programs to ensure that persons are recruited, hired, trained, transferred and promoted in all job groups regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, national origin, citizenship status, military or veteran status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, and any other category protected by federal, state or local law.

description: “There is a Sign-On and Retention Bonus offered for this position! *To be eligible for the hiring bonus, candidates must not have worked as a regular employee, contractor, or intern in the previous 12 months.”  Join Ecolab as a Territory Service and Sales Representative in the Boulder, CO market. This opportunity offers you the ability to partner with our current customers in the hospitality and foodservice industries and provide recommendations with comprehensive chemical products and programs designed to meet their needs. You will serve as the face of Ecolab, servicing laundries and dish machines, dispensing equipment, and systems for our customers. You will also provide recommendations on advanced cleaning and sanitation programs and solutions that drive a positive guest experience and create cleaner, safer, and healthier environments.  What’s In It For You The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, and healthy environments The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives, and ideas to achieve our best Access to best-in-class resources, tools, and technology Paid training program leveraging a blended approach including digital learning, live demonstrations, and field practice to certify that associates are safe, confident, and proficient in their roles Thrive in a company that values a culture of safety to include top-notch safety training and personal protection equipment Receive a company vehicle for business use Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, matching 401k, company paid pension, opportunities for stock purchase, tuition reimbursement, and more What You Will Do Use your problem-solving skills to conduct preventative and corrective maintenance on laundries and dish machines, dispensing equipment, and systems. Assist in the installation of equipment and solutions Communicate our total value to the customer to meet their needs and grow sales within existing customer accounts Leverage tools and technology (including tablet and mobile phone apps) to conduct service visits and recommend unique programs and solutions to customers Demonstrate safe equipment use, ensuring your customers’ operations are fully functional, and teams are properly trained Provide emergency service to existing customers via phone or in person, as needed Manage equipment, parts, and inventory to control costs Position Details  After completing an initial training program, you will be servicing established customers including restaurants, hotels, schools, long-term care facilities, and more within an assigned territory. In some cases, where a territory is not immediately available, associates will be assigned a supporting role until a territory assignment becomes available.  Weekend Rotation Generally, 1 in every 4 weekends are required (based on business demand) Minimum Qualifications High School Diploma or GED 1 year of mechanical service or sales experience Availability to provide emergency assistance to customers which may occur at night, on weekends and over holidays Must have a valid driver's license and acceptable Motor Vehicle Record No Immigration Sponsorship available Physical Demands Ability to complete pre-employment assessments including a physical, lift and/or carry 50 pounds, color vision perception, and drug screen Ability to perform essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation Preferred Qualifications Associate degree Previous mechanical problem-solving experience (e.g. plumbing, electrical, HVAC and/or mechanical experience) in a military environment and/or industries related to food service, laundry, housekeeping, hospitality and/or pool and spa About Ecolab Institutional  Discover how our partnership with customers helps serve 45 billion restaurant meals and clean more than one billion hotel rooms annually. From restaurants, hotels, and long-term care facilities, to schools, commercial buildings, and military facilities, Ecolab’s Institutional division provides a comprehensive program of customized cleaning and sanitizing solutions to help meet the specific needs of our customers. Join us and help the biggest and best brands ensure guest safety and satisfaction and protect their reputation.  For Colorado locations only.  Annual Or Hourly Compensation Range  Total compensation range is $49000 – $63400 which includes incentive compensation and projected overtime. This position pays an hourly rate and is eligible for overtime and incentive compensation based on performance, per plan terms.  Annual or Hourly Compensation Range is based on full-time 40 hours per week. Ecolab in good faith anticipates it will pay within the posted range. Many factors are taken into consideration when determining the compensation for a potential new employee such as education, training, experience, work location, travel (if required), etc.  Ecolab strives to provide comprehensive and market-competitive benefits to meet the needs of our associates and their families. Click Here to see our benefits. If you are viewing this posting on a site other than our Ecolab Career website, view our benefits at jobs.ecolab.com/working-here.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.  We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: Unlock Your Career Potential: Sales at ADP. It takes a relentless team to lead an industry. ADP's world-class sales team is driving our global growth as a worldwide leader of workforce solutions. If you believe in the power of relationships, we'll give you the tools, training and support you need to connect with new and current customers, ranging from Fortune 100 corporations to small start-ups. And as you achieve success, you'll enjoy the rewards, support and recognition you deserve.  ADP is hiring a National Accounts Sales Representative. In this position, you'll identify and cultivate new prospects with 1,000 or more employees in your territory, cross-sell solutions to existing clients, and effectively close sales, with the support of exceptional sales training and the rewards of advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits and awards.  We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, and Social Responsibility.  Responsibilities Reach or exceed assigned sales goals Implement sales strategies Develop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospects Mine existing and prospective clients for referral business Establish and maintain good customer relations, with both internal and external customers Connect customers' business needs with ADP products and services Cross-sell other ADP solutions to existing clients Build network in person and via phone with key decision makers in a designated territory Qualifications Required Five or more years of work experience Preference will be given to candidates who have the following: Associate or bachelor's degree is Preferred Experience working on a sales quota Demonstrated ability to exceed sales quotas Business-to-business experience in (HCM) human capital management, payroll, HR solutions, HRBPO or talent management Goal oriented and ambitious, with capacity and drive to reach and exceed quotas Demonstrated cold calling sales ability, with assertive, positive and persistent style Proven customer service and relationship building skills Ability to effectively communicate through all mediums (verbal, listening, written) Aptitude for acquiring sales skills and product knowledge Organized, with effective time management skills Ability to work independently and with a team General business acumen Mature and self-confident Capacity to work under pressure Strong work ethic Committed to building a career path Explore our COVID-19 page https://jobs.adp.com/covid19/ to understand how ADP is approaching safety, travel, the hiring interview process, and more.  Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP: ADP affirms that inequality is detrimental to our associates, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal is to impact lasting change through our actions. Together, we unite for equality and equity. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic, including race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, or protected veteran status and will not discriminate against anyone on the basis of a disability. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  Ethics at ADP: ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values. description: Assist Sales Team with:  Lifecycle process for new printing designs and orders. Track films throughout the printing process to alert salesman of completion for shipping purposes. Create sales orders in the system for our customers. Monitor outstanding sales and purchase orders and close out if necessary. Handle phone calls from customers.  Master Data management:  Update or add new items into ERP. Ensure the information is correct for Order Management and Production. This involves intercompany operations. Maintain Customer data information in the system. Validates the information for new or existing Items is correct. Update orders with changes when asked.  Assist Production Department with:  Confirm Artwork is correct. Understand and be knowledgeable about printing designs in order to provide the correct information from Customer to Production. Hold and facilitate the communication with all Parties involved to get all information needed to start Production. Creation of Production orders, with accurate dates and follow up on changes from start to end. Print Production Orders report and hand-in to Factory supervisor. Coordinates with Production Manager for Planning Production orders.

Porvair Filtration Group is looking for a Sales professional to join its team. The individual will serve customers by identifying needs, finding solutions and meeting customer expectations. Prospecting for new customers and opportunities. The position covers the Western region of the United States, serving the Industrial, Chemical Process, Aerospace, and Nuclear markets.  Duties/Responsibilities Services existing accounts, obtains orders, and establishes new accounts by planning and organizing daily work schedule to call on existing or potential sales accounts. Become fluent in SYSPRO in order to review open orders, provide sales forecasts, understand product costs and profitability, report delivery promises, etc. Adjusts content of sales presentations by studying the type of customer and technical need. Serve as technical filtration consultant to the customer. Keeps management informed by submitting activity and results reports, as required. Monitors competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, merchandising techniques, etc. Recommends changes in products, service, and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments. Resolves customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports; making recommendations to management. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Provides historical records by maintaining records on area and customer sales. Identify, design, develop and implement market-driven strategies to achieve revenue goals and the company’s mission. Increase customer base and add to existing customer profitability. Leverage our expanding product lines to capture market share from vulnerable strategic competitors Promote a customer-oriented focus and advocate consultative customer relationships. Qualifications/Training Required BS Engineering is preferred- equivalent education and demonstrated success required. Strong technical acumen >5 years’ experience in sales development in a complex manufacturing environment Proven leadership skills as an account or territory sales manager in industrial markets Application sales and filtration product experience required. Markets of particular interest include Industrial, Chemical Process, Nuclear, Porous Materials and Life Sciences Documented record of delivering profitable sales, reporting sales results, and implementing strategies for growth Candidate will possess strong social & communication skills both verbal and written with solid computer literacy Candidate will possess a high level of emotional intelligence, problem-solving and decision making skills Candidate should display a high level of enthusiasm, motivation, ambition and have a real passion for their work In addition to travel, candidate should be comfortable in a home office environment while operating as part of a team Proven and verifiable history of increasing revenues to meet benchmarks and company goals. Strong communication and negotiation skills. We offer a comprehensive benefits package along with a 401k match. We would love to have you as part of our team.
