description: Job Description  A brilliant opportunity exists for an outstanding individual capable of fitting into this very rewarding Key Account Manager role. Our client, a leading medical device company, is looking to hire someone who can bring added value to the team. If you’re dedicated, energetic and detail-oriented, this could be the perfect role for you. Responsibilities include: Execute initiatives to protect and grow most valuable accounts in the US and to gain new business from the most attractive targets Identify partnership program target accounts Create and monitor sales funnel for target accounts Engage with key lyric providers to drive revenue growth and daily wear adoption Comply with internal policies and procedures, including documenting customer visits in the software Maintain timely and accurate expense reporting Comply with all local, state and federal laws and requirements Implement critical business initiatives Perform other duties as assigned Critical Requirements A university degree is required. Although all candidates are welcome and encouraged to apply, preference will be given to those with degrees in a relevant field Appropriate full-time work experience is mandatory (no students or fresh graduates please) Recent experience in the medical device industry is strongly preferred Preference will be given to candidates with recent experience in sales management If you are qualified and this seems like just the right opportunity to take your career to the next level, please apply – we want to hear from you! description: Business Unit Pratt & Whitney Job ID 01477702 Most Recent Date Posted 10/06/2021 City East Hartford State Connecticut Country United States  Date Posted:  2021-09-30-07:00  Country:  United States of America  Location:  PW100: East Hartford 400 Main Street, East Hartford, CT, 06118 USA  Pratt & Whitney is working to once again transform the future of flight—designing, building and servicing engines unlike any the world has ever seen. And because transformation begins from within, we’re seeking the people to drive it. So, calling all curious.  Come ready to explore and you’ll find a place where your talent takes flight—beyond the borders of title, a country or your comfort zone. Bring your passion and commitment and we’ll welcome you into a tight-knit team that takes our mission personally. Channel your drive to make a difference into shaping an organization and an industry that’s evolving fast to the future.  Where the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up.  Are you ready to go beyond?  This role reports to the Vice President, Aftermarket Operations and will support the Commercial Engines Aftermarket Operations profit objectives.  Key Responsibilities:  Repair Sales Develop strategies and action plans to achieve short and long term financial and operational goals, drive and execute developed strategy Identify, negotiate and assemble aftermarket opportunities, developing and implementing strategies ensuring sales targets and compete/win rates are met or exceeded Drive customer interaction, developing and maintaining successful relationships, including detailed business presentations, negotiations and contract closings. Fully understand the marketplace and competitors, communicating up-to-date information on the customer’s plans and needs, finding opportunities and threats and developing strategies to meet objectives and mobilize the resources of P&W to execute those initiatives Evaluate opportunities to ensure successful market penetration of new services.  Customer Support Aftermarket Operation’s leader of Production Analytics and Customer Experience Responsible for a team at PW Aftermarket Operations (AMO) Headquarters Coordinate annual delivery goal setting (Engine Overhauls) Owner for repair and engine center on-time delivery metrics process Develops and maintains operational performance analytic tools and dashboards Tracks and reports engine overhaul commitments Coordinates AMO network customer communications Drives standards and best practices for Customer Service across AMO units Centralized customer service communications and alignment meetings Manages MFA customer feedback survey Supports Commercial Engines program office activities Coordinates customer business reviews Provides executive reports and analytics  Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree (preferably in business, finance or marketing) and 12+ years of relevant experience OR Master's Degree and 10+ years of relevant experience  Preferred Qualifications:  oMA/MS/MBA degree Proven capability developing growth strategies, commercial partnerships, and commercial deals. Experience working with operations entities (internal factories, supply chain). Excellent analytical skills evaluating commercial deals, financial forecasts, and operational performance. Effective social skills, both verbal and written, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work with senior executives, and to influence and work effectively across all levels of the organization. Demonstrated ability for Continuous Improvement and use of ACE tools. Worldwide travel is required; travel estimated at 15-20%  Raytheon Technologies is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. description: Job Description  Oracle Advertising and Marketing Cloud is a world-leader in global data solutions that inform smarter action in every part of a business. Our core mission is to empower our customers with unique data solutions across various business functions and verticals that can be plugged into any applications or decision engine to drive high-value insights and competitive action.  About The Opportunity  Oracle Advertising and Marketing Cloud's Publisher and Platform Development Team is seeking a Account Manager with a strong background selling SaaS and measurement solutions, who will work with leading publishers and platforms.  In Addition, You Will Be Expected To  The ideal candidate has a demonstrated track of record of growing and preserving client relationships, with a value-based selling approach. The Account Manager be responsible for retaining and growing existing partnerships, as well as, identifying new revenue opportunities through adoption of Oracle Advertising and Marketing Cloud's measurement solutions. Responsibilities will include renewals and expansion of revenue, client onboarding, providing product advice and expertise, and acting as the single point of contact for clients. You will be their champion internally to ensure top-notch customer service. Demonstrate a track record of developing and managing enterprise client partnerships and driving account activity. Exhibit strong digital industry knowledge, and eagerness to share internally to benefit the business. Build long-term, strategic relationships with publisher partners and their key decision makers. Facilitate strategic account plans for all assigned partners to exceed assigned business goals. Work with partners to identify opportunities to meet business needs and grow partnership. Monitor partners’ business results, making recommendations for improvements. Establish rules of engagement and operational escalation procedures to quickly identify and resolve challenges. Serve as the point of contact for client discussions by email, phone, and in person. Completely own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Possess strong analytical and client communication skills. Collaborate with Oracle Advertising and Marketing sales, engineering, and operations teams to create a positive client experience. Own internal projects (assigned and/or self-identified) and resources Required Skills And Experience BS or BA Degree. Minimum 3 years of account management or client services experience in digital advertising or advertising technology. Background experience with ad serving platforms, ad servers, data and audience management platforms. Positive, clear, and professional written and phone communication. Strong Excel skills. Outstanding attention to detail. Positive outlook, enthusiasm, resourcefulness, and strong internal drive. About Our Team We hold ourselves to exceptionally high standards for the client experience. We are dedicated to providing fast, thoughtful, and high-touch interactions with every client, during every stage of their partnership with us. We value superior writing skills and a friendly, considerate, and value-driven communication style. We strive for incredible attention to detail, empathy, and fast turnaround times. We love what we do and have a ton of fun doing it. Provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to client business. Facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations demonstrations and benchmarks; provision of support throughout the sell.  As a Staff Sales Consultant you will be responsible for providing presales technical / functional support to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. Develop and deliver high quality standard Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Present and articulate Oracle product's strengths, features, benefits, and competitive advantages. Design, validate, and present Oracle software solutions to include advanced product concepts, future direction, and 3rd party complimentary products.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures.3 - 5 years business experience preferred; vendor experience also preferred. 3 years relevant computer applications or database/tools preferred. Demonstrated proficiency in one multi-user operating system. Knowledge of system and application design preferred. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Ability to travel as needed. BA/BS degree or equivalent preferred.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

description: General  DESCRIPTION  RapidAPI is the world’s largest API marketplace and the company that is building the next-generation API platform. We enable developers and businesses to easily discover, test, and connect to any API, making it easier to create new software and services more rapidly. RapidAPI is used by millions of developers around the world and offers more than 35,000 APIs on the marketplace. Funded by a16z and Microsoft’s M12, RapidAPI is experiencing rapid growth, fueled by an increase in the number of developers and companies using our platform.  We’re looking for high energy, self-motivated, and agile outbound sales development representatives to help us on our journey to become the next enterprise unicorn. Working with our seasoned account executives you will research strategic enterprise accounts, drive personalized activity to key stakeholders & leadership, evangelize the RapidAPI platform, and generate new business opportunities to fuel our sales pipeline.  Your proven track record of working strategically with both Marketing and Sales teams in a sales development or lead generation capacity will allow you to thrive in our fast-paced, high-activity environment. You will be a significant driver for expanding our footprint across the largest enterprises in the world.  Job Duties And Responsibilities Generate new business opportunities via outbound prospecting Research target accounts and identify key stakeholders within a defined territory Conduct high-level conversations and build relationships with Senior IT Executives within target accounts Learn, leverage, and help evolve our outbound methodology & workflows Collaborate closely with tenured Enterprise Sales Account Executives Meet and exceed quarterly quota to ensure pipeline objectives are achieved Requirements Minimum of 6-12+ months of previous sales development experience, primarily Outbound focused Ability & interest in grasping technical enterprise software / developer concepts Highly motivated, driven, self starting individual Excellent time management / organizational skills Strong entrepreneurial spirit, self motivated, and coachable Bachelor's degree from an accredited university Salesforce, Outreach, Linkedin Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo experience is a plus
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Position Title: Sr. Sales Representative - Pacific Northwest  Reports to: Regional Sales Manager  Location: Oregon  Job Summary  The Sr. Sales Representative is responsible for driving specification of our products with our end user and distributor customers. Other responsibilities include top-down relationships with major regional customer distribution accounts, local relationships with national account personnel, and end-user relationships to deliver top-line sales revenue and profitability targets. Delivers results while maintaining the highest level of integrity. Fosters an environment that generates breakthrough ideas and leads a collaborative and open organization that lives the values of Newell Brands.  Job Responsibilities  Customer Relationship Management: Manages relationship with key influencers, power structures, and hierarchy at the customer and end-user Presents new ideas, trends, and data and recommends pilot and test programs to the customer and end-suer Establishes trust and credibly by demonstrating a clear understanding of how the customer defines the value by encouraging our customers to think differently and offering them unique insights. Develops an operating rhythm of joint meetings to manage opportunities, negotiations, and issues that deliver value Addresses customer concerns/needs and elevates as appropriate to sales management Actively utilizes SFDC to create opportunities, campaigns, and reporting to improve the close ratio Comfortable cold-calling to support campaigns and ownership of the field at the end-user level and spends 80% of time in the field. Activates sales campaigns in the field with the customer and end-user Customer Planning And Execution Partners to execute yearly joint business plans, quarterly business reviews along with ongoing pipeline discussions with all accounts to grow both the customer’s and Newell Brands business; follows up/measures success regularly Aligns goals with sales enablement, finance, product, and supply chain to execute strategies and plans Manages end-user pricing and P&L to meet divisional sales and gross margin targets Market, Channel, & Category Understanding Collaborates cross-functionally to provide market insights to the customer Utilizes best in class insights to develop customer strategies as they relate to purchasing behavior and commercial opportunities Develops and shares new ideas/innovation based on sales trends and insights Builds category plan consistent with customer and Newell Brands strategies Financial Management Leverages our brands and product mix to improve profitability and meet customer and Newell targets Tracks company and competitor pricing across vertical and provides feedback Monitors the impact of price on sell-through Organization Development And Talent Management Takes responsibility for and identifies opportunities for personal development Works with customer and internal sellers to ensure understanding of our products and solutions Participates in internal communities of practice relevant to the job role and external trade organizations, where appropriate Values And Behaviors Drives commitment for the brand and consumer leadership with our company and customers Embraces a culture in which learning is widely shared across functions, businesses, regions, and teams Fosters an environment that generates break-through thinking and ideas, while at the same time remaining consumer, shopper, and customer-focused Drives organizational culture, strategy execution, and achievement of the Newell vision by living the values and demonstrating the leadership competencies daily Practices the values hold self and others accountable for living the values and recognizes the right behaviors Supports an environment where people can be empowered to make solid decisions towards winning with our unique consumers and customers Supports an environment where successes are recognized, shared, and celebrated together Acts with integrity; conduct business fairly, honestly, and ethically every day Qualifications Bachelors/University degree in Business Administration 2+ years of sales and/or trade marketing experience Strong persuasive / sales ability / negotiation skills Experience with building and managing a joint business plan Experience with the Challenger sales methodology a plus Advanced skills using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SalesForce.com; experience with SAP a plus Understanding of general business financials and how these relate to customer programs and decision making Strong problem-solving abilities and resolute attitude to complete tasks Self-motivated with a strong work ethic and exceptional drive for results Excellent written and verbal communication skills; must be able to present data in an organized manner Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and assignments simultaneously Conflict Management/Composure; Technical Knowledge 30% to 50% Travel depending on geography/span of control Support team and be available to set up/work/tear down tradeshow booths Attend and participate in regional industry networking events Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Paper Mate, Sharpie, Dymo, EXPO, Parker, Elmers, Coleman, Marmot, Oster, Sunbeam, FoodSaver, Mr. Coffee, Graco, Baby Jogger, NUK, Calphalon, Rubbermaid, Contigo, First Alert and Yankee Candle. For hundreds of millions of consumers, Newell Brands makes life better every day, where they live, learn, work and play. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

description: About Grafana Labs  There are more than 700,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a SpaceX launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include two other open-source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs) and Grafana Tempo (for traces)  Grafana Labs looking for Enterprise Account Executives who will be responsible for prospecting and closing new business. You will identify, nurture and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, manage forecasts and track customer data. We're strong proponents of a consultative sales approach - learn about the customer's needs first before talking products. Your expertise will be critical in helping articulate the value of our products, work with the customer during the trial phase and hand off a strong relationship to our Customer Success team. Ideally, you come from a technical background and have sold technical products before.  Responsibilities Meet and exceed individual quarterly and annual sales goals Manage all aspects of the sales process (prospecting, sales meetings, product demos, proofs of concept, proposals, negotiations and account management) Cultivate sales through outbound prospecting and inbound leads Be able to understand and convey the value of both GrafanaCloud and Grafana Enterprise. Become an expert in managing your sales pipeline in Salesforce Manage quote creation, order processing, and day-to-day customer requests  Requirements 5+ Years of Experience in Infrastructure Technology Sales Demonstrated history of consistent goal achievement in a highly competitive environment (top 10% performer) Energetic, upbeat, entrepreneurial, tenacious team player Adaptable and with demonstrable experience in high velocity technology companies Experience using Salesforce Familiarity with open source technology is a significant advantage You will need to be an excellent communicator in all channels (in person, online, in writing) and able to form strong working relationships both in person and virtually Experience using Command of the Message and MEDD(P)ICC is ideal Be located near any major North American U.S. city on the West Coast  Benefits Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision) Retirement Plan (401k, IRA) with a 4% employer contribution match 30 days vacation in addition to Public Holidays Stipend for work-station build Remote first working culture  Equal Opportunity Employer - At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees.  We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

description: The Position: Aesthetic Sales Representative – Inside Sales Job  Why LaserAway? Generous compensation structure including uncapped commission. Career growth and advancement. Flexible schedule and work-life balance. Cutting edge medical equipment. Employee discounts on products and services. Supportive and uplifting office culture.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Description: A LaserAway Aesthetic Sales Representative is vital to delivering customer service and driving sales results by selling and promoting LaserAway’s hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services. We are looking for top performers with a track record of success. The Ideal candidate is confident with high integrity coupled with a customer-centric attitude. This person will be responsible for consultations and generating enthusiasm for our non-invasive procedures. Our expert marketing team will provide you with warm leads through their social media initiatives. This position does not require any cold calling or telemarketing. In addition to new patient sales, this role requires following up with previous potential clients/patients who have not purchased with us in the past. Our successful Aesthetic Sales Representatives are able to renew interest by promoting laser hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Responsibilities: Initiate sales process by scheduling appointments with warm leads; conduct initial consultation; describe LaserAway’s treatments and skincare line professionally and with an expert knowledge base. Close sales by building rapport with potential patient; explain product and service capabilities; overcome objections; prepare financing contracts with lenders such as Care Credit and Loan Hero. Expand sales in existing accounts by introducing new products and services. Create client retention by upselling additional products and services. Recommend new products and services by evaluating current aesthetic treatment process. Manage front desk duties such as checking patients in/out while ensuring a positive and warm experience and maintaining a clean and professional clinic. Adhere to LaserAway policies and protocols.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Skills and Qualifications: Education/ Experience:Previous sales experience required. Communication Skills:Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with patients, peers, and management. Ability to communicate with proper etiquette. Reasoning Ability:Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to patients and remaining flexible to the needs of the business. Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision. Other Skills:Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service. ** Bilingual a plus!  About LaserAway: LaserAway is a medical company set in beautiful retail settings that offer the latest innovations in non-surgical aesthetic dermatological treatments. We are the fastest growing company in the industry with 70+ locations in CA, NY, TX, NV, AZ, FL and IL. From attentive sales representatives to meticulous clinicians, we are a team of professionals driven by customer satisfaction to offer the most advanced aesthetic dermatological treatments including laser hair removal, skin rejuvenation, CoolSculpting, and Botox.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Compensation: LaserAway offers a generous pay structure with additional earning potential through commissions and bonuses. Additional benefits include (but not limited to) Healthcare benefits Dental, Vision, and 401(k) Paid Time Off Generous employee discounts. This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, LaserAway reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. LaserAway is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
industries: Medical Practice, Retail, and Cosmetics

description: This position is responsible for maintaining and growing new and/or exiting customers tele-virtually in an assigned territory comprising of Acute Care Hospitals, Long Term Acute Care Hospitals, Critical access hospitals, and Rehabilitation facilities.  Works independently to sell Stryker Medical products to account base in a defined territory. Achieves assigned monthly, quarterly, and annual quota by taking a consultative approach to selling. Focuses on the development of relationships at all levels of the hospital organization, listening to customer needs and providing product solutions and customer service that exceeds their expectations.  About Sage Products LLC, Now a Part Of Stryker  Since 1971, Sage Products has developed disposable healthcare products trusted by leading healthcare facilities worldwide. Our company has a core belief in prevention—that simple, evidence-based interventions lead to extraordinary outcomes. Now as part of Stryker, one of the world's leading medical technology companies, we continue to develop innovative products that help prevent healthcare worker injury, patient skin breakdown, healthcare-associated infections and other adverse events. For more information, visit www.sageproducts.com.  Primary Job Responsibilities Manage, prospect, and build relationships within assigned territory accounts to meet and exceed annual forecast expectations, including consistent new business Manage a healthy sales pipeline including foresting of business Meet and exceed activity expectations and goals as provided by Regional Manager: Sales Call goals, Appointment goals, Presentation goals, Use of time/Time management, Territory Management, Salesforce.com goals and targets Travel into the field Quarterly to Support Selling Efforts/Implementation of Products Establish Best Practice related to Daily Activity Fundamentals Communicate with your Regional Manager and Stryker sales and marketing on a regular basis per Manager expectations (Immediately when competitive or threats to your business arise, Be responsive to voicemail/e-mail in a timely manner). Develop and maintain good working relationships with outside Field Reps, Regional Sales Managers, Strategic Account Managers, and other leaders Be a student of your products, clinical studies, competition and overall business Understand and utilize salesforce.com effectively and efficiently Prioritize account activity, opportunities and peripheral responsibilities. Demonstrate a good understanding of all sales tools Utilize all technology available to enhance communication with your contacts. Plan for and participate in Manager work-withs, weekly team meetings, Friday call ins, Lunch and Learns and other training events including national sales meetings. Salary and commission commensurate with sales position. Provide various monthly, quarterly and annual reports requested by management. Respond promptly to administrative requirements or requests from Sage including expense reporting Qualifications And Experience Bachelor’s degree required 1-3 years business to business sales experience preferred (field or phone) Previous experience in concept selling Experience with Microsoft and CRM Verified success, i.e. ranking, awards, etc Openness to consider future relocation for growth into outside field sales in various markets across the country Will consider recent graduates with strong GPA and strong achievement accolades Physical & Mental Requirements Excellent articulation and presentation ability Self-motivated Time management skills excellent listening skills Problem solving skills

We are seeking an immediate hire for a remote Business Development Manager position for the Tennessee territory. An ideal candidate is a team player with the ability to be on task without supervision. You own your work. A BDM will be well organized, flexible and reliable. This will be a highly rewarding job for those who are willing to work hard and be committed to a long-term relationship with Precision Concrete Cutting and its customers.  The ideal candidate will have an aptitude for business development, sales & marketing, specifically business-to-business technical sales.  Responsibilities include: Face to face and virtual meetings with customers Market research, business prospect research and lead generation Cold contact outreach to target customers Client relationship building Identify business development opportunities Research and contact new clients based on referrals and data mining Develop new relationships in an effort to grow business and help company expand Maintain existing business Think critically when planning to assure project success Develop clear and effective written proposals for current and prospective customers Must be able to travel to meet with potential and current clients, occasional overnight travel (Alabama and Tennessee) Occasionally attend conferences and trade shows representing the company  REQUIREMENTS: 3 - 4 years' prior industry related business development experience Strong communication and interpersonal skills Proven knowledge and execution of successful development strategies Focused and goal-oriented  PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES: Comfortable talking directly to customers Business Development/Sales/Marketing focus (preferred) Demonstrated passion for learning and B-to-B business development/marketing The ability to comprehend and understand engineering concepts Self-starter and quick learner with the ability to maintain and complete projects on time An interest and curiosity about public works and engineering

Mark Anthony Brands, Inc. is hiring a Field Sales Representative who will be responsible for executing all aspects of Mark Anthony Brands portfolio brand plans in the assigned market of Dallas, TX. The Field Sales Representative will implement wholesaler plans, execute distributor incentive programs, and ensure key account execution. Market areas will be defined as AA markets, comprised of one or more distributors.  As a Field Sales Representative, Your Responsibilities Will Include Executing all aspects of sales plan with wholesaler network. Executing brand plans and programming by working with District Manager level influencers at their distributors. Tracking and reporting on-going and consistent market conditions, conditions through internal tools Weekly retail/market recap of execution and performance, providing manager feedback on market using internal tools Brand execution at the market level. Brand standards to include pricing, shelf placement, cold box placement, display, draft and bottle placement Monitor and evaluate personal performance on a monthly basis to identify and develop personal areas for growth 18 days (90% of time) ensuring retail execution, surveying (with key influencer of the wholesaler), evaluating distribution, display and ad feature execution 2 full days (10% of time) managing all administrative requirements due on a monthly basis (fiscal responsibility, distribution tracking, program execution tracking and performance management) as well as all local initiatives The Field Sales Representative position is well-suited for you if you: Work with teammates on regular basis in the field. Provide best practice sharing and coordinate in market execution/activation drives against key market/account initiatives, new item launches and/or distribution drives. Consistently demonstrates the Mark Anthony Brands Way to sell (Taste the Difference, MABI meetings, DAP3, and Performance Dashboard) Exhibit a very high sense of urgency, be well organized, possess a great attitude, be a team player and have the ability to build strong working relationships with all internal and external stakeholders Are energized by the opportunity to work for the leading Flavored Malt Beverage company in the US and be committed to investing significant time and energy into their career Fully embodies the Mark Anthony Brands culture Keep abreast of competitive trends and report appropriate developments Qualified Candidates Will Have Bachelor's degree 0-3 years of sales experience preferred or recent graduate with sales internship experience Fact based selling and ability to establish rapport Strong analytical and math skills Mobility is mandatory as high performers will be rewarded with new opportunities over time that will in most cases require continued relocation Strong computer skills, Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word)- including the ability to do quality presentations Relocation Available? Yes, for the right candidate  BRING FLAVOR TO LIFE  Are you interested in selling and marketing the brands of the fastest growing beer company in the US?  Mark Anthony Brands, Inc. provides sales and marketing support in the US for The Mark Anthony Group of Companies including brands like the iconic White Claw® Hard Seltzer, Mike’s® Hard Lemonade, Mike’s® Harder® Lemonade, Cayman Jack®, an MXD.  As the company grows, so does its inclusive and expressive culture. Sad people don’t drink mike’s; nor do they sell it. With over 250 team members nationwide, and a Chicago-based headquarters, Mike’s employees are bringing zest from east to west.  Company Information  We are a private, family owned business that cares for people and are proud to offer the best tasting products in the industry. In the United States, the Mark Anthony Group pioneered the flavored malt beverage category with the launch of Mike’s® Hard Lemonade in 1999. Today, Mike's has achieved iconic brand status and is the category leader. We are a disruptive innovator and true high performer in the brewing industry.  The Company is a unique blend of entrepreneurial determination and drive with advanced information systems and disciplined focus on creating and making better tasting products that consumers love to discover. Using our proprietary technology, we brew one of the cleanest tasting alcohol bases in the industry.  We are grounded in our core values of Sense of Urgency, Authenticity, Simplicity, Humility, and Trust. These come to life everyday through our 5Cs, the 5 core behaviors necessary to be successful here: Communication, Collaboration, Commitment, Competence and Curiosity.  If you are curious, collaborative, focused and thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for a long-term role with a company that is transforming the industry - while having some fun, we want you to consider joining our family!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please reach out to careers@markanthony.com for assistance.

description: Director, National Accounts  WHO WE ARE Apex Systems is a world class technology services business that incorporates industry insights and experience to deliver solutions that fulfill our clients’ digital visions.  JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for competitive, self-motivated individuals who have the drive to succeed and contribute to our next level of growth. We are looking for an experienced Accounts Director with a proven track record in the technology sales field. The Director, National Accounts will drive revenue growth by saturating designated national accounts. Develop Business Achieve national account spread goals. Ensure customer satisfaction. Develop and execute strategy for account saturation. Support branches and account managers in the development of new business. Act as a trusted advisor to senior executives within national accounts. Clearly assign performance expectations and client processes to internal branches and account managers to support breaking national accounts Manage the Business Ensure transitions to local sales team are comprehensive and satisfactory to customer. Hold branches accountable for billing, placement, and compliance requirements Accept full responsibility for client/contract matters Consistently meet or exceed client expectations Ensure billing activities produce collections within BMQA guidelines Support the Business Actively engage in development of training for account teams. Act as an escalation point for billing and collection issues  JOB REQUIREMENTS: Ability to drive to results Ability to set and manage priorities Ability to solve complex problems Ability to effectively negotiate and manage conflict Ability to effectively utilize and allocate resources Ability to manage multiple tasks and deliverables at once Ability to communicate clearly and effectively Undergraduate degree required. Five years of professional sales experience   OUR AWESOME BENEFITS:  Health, Dental and Vision Insurance Long and Short-Term Disability Life Insurance Vacation and Holiday Pay 401k Retirement Plan Training and Advancement opportunities Tuition Reimbursement Birthdays Off Philanthropic Opportunities Referral Program Partial Gym Membership Paid Team Building Events  Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact CorporateRecruiting@apexsystems.com.

description: The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.    Responsibilities * Develop and execute strategies to drive business in new and existing markets. * Meet and exceed sales targets * Partner with Talent Acquisition to identify and recruit top sales talent * Manage complex negotiations with senior-level executives  Qualifications * 6+ years' of sales experience * 5+ years' of sales leadership experience * ability to understand client needs and fulfill RFP requests  For BYOUNIC to represent candidates for freelance opportunities, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need of employer sponsorship for a non-immigrant visa.

SARIN Energy Solutions is looking for full time experienced Sales Executive in Kansas City & Houston (preference for Spanish-speaking candidates)  At SARIN Energy Solutions we are driven by successful and rewarding work environment. SARIN combines high earning potential with strong learning potential. If success motivates you, you belong at SARIN. SARIN is a Kansas City & Houston based organization specializing in customized energy solutions. Our current focus is on innovative LED lighting and control technology. We pride ourselves on providing efficient and sustainable solutions for our clients along with excellent product quality and customer service.We offer a competitive compensation program with earnings potential of up to $90,000 - $150,000, paid company car, cell phone, expenses reimbursement, paid holidays and performance based bonus potential. This position requires travels to exciting new cities within the US.  The Sales Executive will develop strong relationships by meeting and exceeding expectations. Responsibilities will include servicing and growing existing accounts, new account initialization, campaign execution, wrap-up reporting and up-selling. This position is the primary point of contact with clients throughout the sales lifecycle. SARIN Energy Solutions Inc. maintains best practices concerning platform utilization strategy, marketing industry specific approaches while advocating our position and interests internally and sourcing mission critical feedback. This position provides the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with and advising experienced manufacturing representatives, lighting supply houses, designers and professionals in the lighting field. From coast-to-coast, we explore all opportunities to educate our clientele through consultative avenues aimed at improving the bottom-line with our wide selection of LED lights. We’re proud of our diligent team and nurturing company culture. We provide competitive compensation and have a great deal of fun whenever possible. Project and career development are key, and we truly support one another. Relocation incentives maybe available for qualified candidates.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS and RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for driving sales and revenue generation for assigned territory Responsible for revenue generation for the $1/month program Responsible for the design, development and implantation of the company brand Responsible for sales and marketing efforts in assigned territory Responsibilities include but will not be limited to: cold calling, lead generation, light counts, assessment generation, assessment review, assessment presentation, proposal creation, proposal review, proposal presentation, customer follow-up, contract construction, contract negotiation, CRM tracking, CRM reporting, tradeshow participation, networking, reporting, expense tracking, budgeting and clerical work Responsibly for servicing existing accounts and opportunities, creating new accounts and opportunities, taking orders, fulfilling needs of both installation and service contracts as well as, direct product shipment orders/PO Responsible for the submission of activity and progress reports, daily call reports, weekly forecasting and annual territory analysis Recommends changes in products, service and policy by evaluating results and competitive developments Responsible for handling customer complaints by investigating problem, providing solutions and reporting to management  PLACEMENT CRITERIA 3 to 7 years experience in related field or position Must have worked in a commissioned compensation environment If lacking the above; a combination of education and/or relevant experience preferred Knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within the energy solutions industry Demonstrated comprehensive knowledge of marketing development branding, sales and sales process, and implementation Demonstrated organization, facilitation, communication and presentation skills Ability to prioritize workflow and organize diverse material and ability to handle multiple, competing and changing priorities Ability to perform effectively without supervision and within established time limits and ongoing deadlines Ability to interact effectively and professionally, and provide exceptional service, both internally and externally at all times Ability to manage Accounts and customers when needed  Job Type: Full-time Salary: $50,000.00 to $65,000.00 /year

About the Role  When you join Kyocera Document Solutions Southwest, LLC. you are joining an organization that is deeply rooted in the Philosophy of “doing what is right as a human being”. Through this Philosophy, our employees are passionate about providing best in class customer service through efficiency, accountability, and a sense of urgency all while putting knowledge to work to drive change.  As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for selling KDA equipment, service, and supplies to their assigned accounts.  The chance to do something meaningful, to challenge yourself, to be a part of change in an industry, to influence change does not come around every day.  Major Duties and Responsibilities  Sell Kyocera products by presentations, proposals, and demonstrations. Achieve monthly sales quota. Maintain a minimum of 5 times monthly quota 30 day closeable prospects. Maintain a minimum of 10 working prospects in the 30 day prospect database. Set a minimum of five new prospect appointments per week. Input all 30/60/90 day prospects into Sherpa. Conduct a minimum of 1 Account Review per quarter Conduct a minimum of 1 Strategic Account Review per month All Sales activity has to be done through Sherpa. Provide a monthly report on all account activities and progress through Sherpa. Interact with the designated NARM and the Sales Manager on all bid & RFP requests. Assure that all machine recommendations are capable of handling customer needs. Provide competitive information on all National Account strategies and activities. Provide a monthly forecast and prospect report. Assure that all customers are satisfied with our service and that we maintain a solid relationship with our customers. Maximize machine placements in large accounts. Upgrade Kyocera machines when needed by the customer. Cooperate with Administration, Service and National Accounts to assure that all information pertaining to the customer is accurate. Communicate all problems to his / her Sales respective Manager. Attend all training functions, review all training material.  Qualifications  Required: 1-3 years industry technology solutions sales experience Excellent organizational skills Excellent communication skills Master’s Club Sales Category 1 or 2  Preferred: College degree preferred  Note This is a general description of the duties and responsibilities most frequently required of this position. The company may from time-to-time request that the incumbent perform other related tasks and assume reasonable responsibilities that have not been specifically included in this description. KYOCERA Document Solutions America, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, a VEVRRA Federal Contractor, and complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding nondiscrimination. Kyocera provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. Qualified minorities, women, protected veterans and/or individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

description: Description  Consult with America's businesses, leveraging Paychex key referral channels and partnerships to educate stakeholders on our services, and provide consultative solutions to increase market share and drive revenue. Achieve unit and revenue expectations. Create, manage, and advance accounts, leads, and opportunities in company’s CRM system (Salesforce) and provide accurate sales activity and forecasts. Collaborate with key referral sources, including Accountants, Banks, and existing Paychex clients, with the goal of education, consultation and to secure referrals to end user sales. Schedule and conduct meetings with existing and new channel accounts through telephone calls, targeted email campaigns, and corporate marketing programs, as directed by Sales Management. Leverage the Go-to-Market Sales Strategy to identify customers’ needs and present the Paychex solution to key stakeholders and decision makers to increase revenue and market share. Develop sales skills and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the Paychex product offering to optimize sales results; remain up-to-date with new product initiatives, services, industry trends and other relevant information of interest to customers. Collect, complete and submit all necessary paperwork for new sales within defined Service Level Agreement (SLA) guidelines. When required, address and escalate client concerns to our Service Partners, and follow-up as necessary to ensure satisfactory resolution. May be required to travel for purposes of visiting channel partners, and attending sales incentive trips, ongoing training, and/or area meetings. Upholds and demonstrates the Paychex Values with every interaction internally and externally. Requirements H.S. Diploma - Required Bachelor's Degree - Preferred 2 years of experience in relevant sales/marketing capacity. Our Commitment  Paychex is dedicated to fostering a culture of intentional Inclusion and Diversity (I&D). Our valued employees and commitment to I&D is the essence of our internal and external success. Inclusivity is a key value of our corporate culture and is exemplified through our reputation as a top employer for employee development, diversity, and ethics, as well as a focus on fairness in recruitment, selection, and decision making.  Click here for more information on our corporate social responsibility.

description: Purpose and Scope The Market Development Manager (MDM) works closely with customers and the field sales organization to increase the adoption of NeuroBlate® for epilepsy and oncology within existing accounts. In this role, the successful MDM will develop and execute awareness and adoption strategies to physicians, hospital staff and patients within Monteris’ installed accounts, in partnership with Monteris field representatives, physician referrers, and marketing team. Initiatives include brokering peer to peer engagement meetings, development and execution of educational-oriented programs to physicians and patients and providing tools to drive patient awareness and acceptance of NeuroBlate.  Primary Organization Responsibilities Develops, executes, and measures replicable field-based programs to accelerate adoption of NeuroBlate for epilepsy and oncology in existing Monteris accounts. Programs will include: o  Peer-to-peer meetings between Epileptologists, Neuro Oncologists, Radiation Oncologists at installed NeuroBlate accounts, which may include grand rounds, tumor board, epilepsy conference sessions or one-on-one educational meetings o  mid-level provider and medical assistant education and profiling o  New outreach collateral as needed to support accounts to drive product adoption o  Patient referral pattern and/or incidence analysis o  Quarterly business plans with accounts and field representatives to document outreach activities with deadlines  ·  Works with the field organization to identify and qualify pilot program sites.  · Tracks account metrics to determine effectiveness of outreach programs.  · Codifies program steps and trains field organization to scale programs proven successful.  · Partners with marketing and other functional departments to align resources toward epilepsy and oncology market development.  · Supports the broader Monteris team in efforts to increase epilepsy and oncology adoption.  · Ensures all programs are aligned with Monteris’ mission, values, and regulatory and compliance standards.  ·Travel 70%  Education/Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Marketing, Business, or related field · 5-7+ years product field sales/market development experience in the medical device industry. · Experience working with matrixed hospital environments and/or hospital account management preferred. ·  Experience in neurology/neuro oncology/radiation oncology or neurosurgery field is desired. ·  Comfortable presenting clinical data in a group setting to physicians.  You will be required to meet additional third-party vendor credentialing requirements for hospital access, including but not limited to providing acceptable proof of vaccination status for certain diseases such as influenza, COVID-19, hepatitis B and others, passing a drug screen, and other requirements. You will be expected to work directly with such vendors to demonstrate that you meet those requirements during your employment.

companyName: Maker&Son - The most comfortable chairs in the world
description: Job Description SENIOR SALES CONSULTANT – Luxury furniture & homewares Base Salary + Commission with annual compensation target of $90,000 - $110,000  Company Overview Maker&Son is one of the world’s fastest growing luxury furniture & homewares businesses. We design and make the world’s most comfortable chairs, sofas and beds, entirely from natural and ethically sourced materials. We’re an ambitious, young company, with a vision to become a globally recognized brand, changing the face of luxury home retail. We sell directly to our customers via our website, and our team of Sales Consultants who bring our trademark mobile showrooms to our customers’ homes. We are headquartered in the United Kingdom, with a presence in the UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand and the US where we are already established in New York, Los Angeles and Florida. We are excited to continue our U.S. expansion in 2021 into a number of additional U.S. metropolitan markets including all of California. We offer a flexible, remote-based work schedule, with amazing benefits (Including 20 paid days off per year + 8 holidays).  Role Overview Working through leads generated from our impressive social media platforms, website and local marketing efforts, the Senior Sales Consultant is responsible for attaining or exceeding revenue targets through a combination of telephone, email, and in-person home visits leveraging our unique Mobile Showrooms within their assigned territory. This is a remote-based position, with frequent travel throughout the assigned territory, reporting to the Western Sales Manager. The Senior Sales Consultant will lead a direct report Sales Consultant as a team, and work collaboratively with various company partners to deliver an exceptional experience to every customer. As we are a fast-moving business currently establishing our brand in the U.S., the role is best suited for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit who loves to roll up their sleeves and get involved in any and all aspects of the business. Excellent planning skills, with an ability to remain flexible and agile to the changing nature of the business is key. A passion for sustainably and ethically made furniture, home interiors, and delivering top-notch customer service are essential to success in the role.  Key Responsibilities Meet or exceed sales targets by maximizing leads through effective phone, email, video conference, and in-person sales consultations. Proactively manage potential leads by utilizing ZenDesk CRM system. Maintain a strategic weekly schedule that maximizes opportunities for Mobile Showroom customer visits within assigned territory. Maintain sales database including updates of customer details, payments and invoicing. Ensure exceptional service before, during, and after mobile showroom visits to customers’ homes. Provide product, design and space planning advice to customers that drives sales of Maker&Son furniture. Be an Ambassador of the Maker&Son brand through friendly, thorough, and professional written and verbal communication. Set and execute specific plans to build relationships within the Interior Design community that drive sales and brand loyalty. Work closely with Western Sales Manager and US Marketing Manager to identify opportunities to expand brand awareness through local marketing efforts, events and partnerships. Uphold Maker&Son company values. Build and maintain healthy and productive relationships with fellow Maker&Son business partners.  Skills and Experience Minimum 5 years of experience in Sales with proven track record of meeting or exceeding annual sales targets. Ability to assess customer needs, provide design guidance and overcome concerns that will lead to customer satisfaction, long-term brand loyalty, and sales growth. A passion for, and experience with interior design, furniture and home goods, preferably with an established book of contacts. An entrepreneurial spirit with a passion for growing sales and brand awareness within assigned territory. Ability to effectively organize, manage and delegate job tasks. Prior experience leading direct report(s). Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and ability to manage the needs of multiple customers simultaneously and professionally. Prompt and thorough follow up maintained consistently. Excellent listening skills. Self-motivated, and able to manage time effectively. Ability to create strategic plans for accomplishing tasks, while remaining agile and flexible. Previous experience working with Google, ZenDesk, Xero, Tawk or similar CRM tools is an asset. Clean driving record is required. Experience driving a mid-sized van is helpful, but not required.  To apply please send your CV and cover letter explaining why you believe you would excel this this role to Recruitment@makerandson.com, or apply via LinkedIn/Indeed/BOH.

Overview  National Sales Executive  Do you have a passion for sales? Are you capable of hunting down business and closing the sale? If you would like to build your career in an exciting industry and grow with a world-class organization, we would like to meet you.  Who are we?  Steritech Brand Standards is proud to be a member of the Rentokil family of companies in North America. We pride ourselves on being a trusted partner to many of the world's leading brands across industries as diverse as manufacturing, distribution, retail, food service, and hospitality. We are extremely proud of our legacy of excellence and constantly work to enhance the value and impact of our services.  Responsibilities  What do our National Sales Executives do?  The National Sales Executives (NSE) are responsible for generating market growth in a defined multi-state territory to national clients in a range of industries including quick-service and fast-casual restaurants, full-service and contract dining, and grocery and convenience stores. They have extensive sales experience, including hunting and prospecting of national accounts, boardroom presence, strong business acumen and deal making, and are driven to succeed. This position is 100% new business contracted sales. Deliver targeted sales results within designated territory Work with marketing centralized services for lead generation Canvass the market for additional prospective clients Contact prospects, via social media including Linked In, utilize telephone, text, and email to schedule appointments Conduct C-level meetings to promote Steritech and our services Utilize CRM/Salesforce for pipeline management, forecasting, and account prospect details Design, price, and generate proposals for new service programs Maintain involvement in targeted associations: Attend trade shows/summits including (Achieve assigned sales quota by self-generating leads, pursuing assigned leads, and attending industry trade shows/conferences to accumulate leads to initiate new business opportunities) What do you need? Bachelor's degree Five or more years of proven sales track record with larger, complex accounts with multiple locations; ideally experience selling services vs. products (5 plus years of consistent success with hunting, closing and managing complex lines of business and implementing growth strategies at a multi-location/national level) National level sales experience preferred. Thorough understanding of sales process and demonstrated application to close new business by using Strategic/Consultative Selling training, e.g. Miller Heiman a plus but not required Salesforce CRM experience or other customer relationship management system (CRM) (Comfortable with the use of CRM platforms to track and report progress on sales opportunities.) Strong negotiation skills; high level of leadership influence Board-room level presence and communication/presentation skills Excellent prospecting and networking skills Experience in the services industry is preferred, experience in the food and hospitality industry is a plus Desire and ability to travel 50% Must pass pre-employment background screen and drug test Valid Driver's License/Clean Driving Record Why Choose Steritech?  A career with Steritech is exactly that - a professional trajectory filled with opportunity. We pride ourselves on being a world class team that rewards high performance. This position offers competitive base pay in addition to a sales incentive structure under which experienced sales professionals can thrive.  Below you'll find information about some of what Steritech has to offer. Competitive and Rewarding Compensation Structure Wellness: Excellent Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance Access to Flexible Spending Accounts for Healthcare or Dependent Care Expenses Outstanding Company-Paid Short Term Disability Access to Long-Term Disability Insurance Wellness Reimbursement Program Employee Assistance Program that offers services such as free counseling services, will preparation, discounts to health clubs, and other benefits Company-paid sick time Savings & Retirement: 401(k) retirement plan with highly-competitive company-matching contributions Holiday Savings Club option with company-matching funds Employee Discounts (includes many offerings, including cellular/mobile service, health clubs, and more) Work-Life Balance: Vacation Days & sick days Company-Paid Holidays & Floating Holidays We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work. Is that you?  Additional Information  Rentokil North America is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to equality in every aspect of employment. As we expand, we are focused on building a foundation of diverse talent and equality in all areas of our workforce. All qualified applicants receive equal consideration, regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, veteran status, or disability.  Link To Federal Employment Poster English Version - Revised November 2009 Spanish Version - Revised November 2009 Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision English (Formatted) English (Unformatted) Spanish

description: The ideal candidate is a motivated, organized, and creative individual who welcomes the challenges of acquiring and developing new business through sales efforts. You will build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and close business deals while maintaining an extensive knowledge of current market conditions.   Responsibilities Cultivate strong business relationships with key decision makers Proactively identify new opportunities and deliver innovative solutions to customers Develop market strategies by researching lists of high potential prospects  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business 2+ years' of sales or account management experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Job Description  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify / develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Duties and tasks are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have a project lead role. Highly developed selling, customer relations, and negotiation skills. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Presentation skills. Travels to customer as needed. 4+ years relevant sales experience. BS/BA degree or equivalent preferred. If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. description: This position provides you with the opportunity to connect with C-level restaurant industry contacts and introduce them to a truly unique program to increase their share of business travel and entertainment dining. In this role, you will own the acquisition of new customers by utilizing your deep knowledge of effective prospecting, networking & appointment setting tactics and strategies to develop and operationalize a pipeline of high-quality prospects from first appointment all the way to a closed sale.  What You’ll Be Doing Developing target lists of new enterprise national account prospects and creating a robust sales management strategy to effectively and efficiently communicate with prospects to gain their participation in the Dinova program Prospecting for new customers primarily via email, phone, social media, and networking activities to build a robust pipeline Liaising with C-level contacts via face-to-face and virtual meetings, phone, email, social media, etc. to introduce them to the Dinova program and persuade them to participate Creating and delivering dynamic presentations virtually or in person to engage C-level audiences to clearly articulate the benefit and value of Dinova’s services What You’ll Need 5+ years’ enterprise sales experience with a consistent track record of achieving/exceeding sales quota Strong negotiation and persuasion skills and the ability to successfully uncover problems, present solutions, identify and overcome objections, and close deals Demonstrated knowledge of prospecting skills including in person, email, phone, social media, and networking Proven track record selling an intangible product where the sales professional must persuade a buyer to participate without the ability to do direct product demos, etc. Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, negotiation, collaboration, organizational, and sales acumen skills Experience using CRM systems for tracking and managing sales opportunities (Salesforce preferred); proven ability to measure and manage the pipeline and provide accurate ongoing forecasts A positive attitude with a passion for building relationships Ability to work independently to achieve goals and with a team to collaborate on opportunities, resolve customer issues, share best practices, develop team members, and work with cross functional teams How To Stand Out Restaurant industry experience and contacts are a plus; this position provides an opportunity to transition from working in the restaurant industry to the support side of the restaurant/hospitality industry Experience selling intangible products/services Entrepreneurial mind set, highly motivated, tenacious, and committed to success Ability to adapt quickly to changing market conditions and hungry to tackle new challenges Location/Travel Requirements: Position will be remote based in the continental U.S. near a major U.S. airport allowing for air travel time of approximately two hours to most major continental U.S. cities. Ability to travel as needed in North America Compensation Competitive base pay commensurate with experience Generous incentive pay plan (uncapped providing an opportunity for unlimited earning potential) What We Offer  We work hard, and we have a great time and our culture is second to none — our annual employee surveys highly rate our culture, flexibility and work/life balance, and our leadership. We offer a casual, fun office environment and an excellent benefits package that includes: a subsidized choice of medical, dental and vision plans; Medical and Dependent Care FSAs; company-paid life insurance; HSA plan; and company-matching 401(k) plan. As much as we enjoy what we do, we all need time off to relax and recharge, so we provide paid vacation starting at fifteen days per year, paid time off for company recognized holidays - plus two holidays of your choice - and paid sick leave.  What We Don’t Have  Bullies, tyrants, selfish, territorial, and jerks - so those who don’t work and play well with others need not apply.  Dinova influences more than $7 billion annually in meals and entertainment expenses - of which the restaurants in our marketplace gain a disproportionate share through our readymade base of business diners. Our company accounts range in size from SMBs to Fortune 1000, including 40 percent of the highest travel-spending companies in the United States. Dinova’s 20,000+ restaurant locations include local independents as well as national brands, encompassing all price levels and cuisines. Using our app or web search, business travelers, meeting and event planners, executive admins and other decision-makers have an easy, real-time way to discover and locate the right restaurants for all their business dining needs. And through individual registration with myDinova, diners can also receive personal rewards every time they use their corporate card at a preferred Dinova restaurant.

Familiarity with common CRM and sales software. Excellent negotiation, presentation, and relationship-building skills.
