description: You know when you see your cousin for the first time in a long time, and they’re now this grown up college kid who you can actually hold a conversation with, and no longer that premature pre-teen who hid behind his mom’s leg? That’s us before and after the pandemic.  No, you’re not in the wrong spot. This is still a job description. Let us explain. Pre COVID, as with any start-up, we were finding our way, working out the kinks, putting the wheels on the moving bus. 2020 happened and our bus stalled for a few months. We brought it to the shop, swapped some new parts for the old, buffed and waxed it, and came out on the other side stronger, smarter, and yet, still working out the kinks. As the stakes rise, we’re not the puny pre-teen we once were. All that being said, our 90 year old grandpa tells us we never have it all figured out, so we’re not over here trying to. Here we are in the middle of our journey, thankful for the past that built us, and excited for the future that awaits us. Practice makes progress and that’s all we can say about where we are today.  We are psyched about where Booksy is headed. Chances are high that we need you on board to help execute our big plans 🤩  For this particular job, we’re looking for determined sales people eager to call, connect, and create rapport with business owners. You’re looking for a community feel (because that’s what you’ll get from your co-workers and our service providers), while also equipped to work autonomously. The challenge of introducing Booksy to a brand new city invigorates you.  Requirements  Why are you here? Because you saw the job title and want to know more!  As part of our outside sales team, you will be responsible for building relationships with select clients, scheduling and conducting safe, masked face to face demos at barbershops and salons and becoming part of the fabric of the beauty and wellness community that Booksy is growing so rapidly in.  What you’ll do Hunt for new business in Milwaukee! You get excited about showing others our product. You take “no” as a “not yet, challenge accepted.” Manage your own pipeline of potential clients and take advantage of every opportunity to grow your book of business Attend and create some amazing events to further engage potential and current Booksy users Cold calls, walk-ins, sliding into DMs - you’re personable and persistent Meetings, meetings and more meetings! You understand that face to face interaction is key in closing that sale and identifying your clients needs Own the entire sales cycle from prospecting to close. You are determined to spread the Booksy gospel Set your clients up for success by conducting demos and educating them on all our app features and how they can best utilize our product for their business needs  Who you are You’re scrappy, you take risks, and put yourself WAY out there You’re comfortable making cold calls and walk-ins and conducting safe, masked in-person meetings. You basically live outside your comfort zone You’re a straight shooter who can talk to other straight shooters You’re human (click here to prove you aren’t a bot) We’re dropping the ‘p’ word again. Passion is what our industry runs on. Put that first before any sales tactic you’ve ever learned You’re an effective, metric-driven sales person with a proven track record of success You’re humble and hungry - you don’t take rejection personally You have experience closing deals and taking clients through the entire sales cycle You’re a self-starter, we’re a start-up. Innovation is a requirement and ideas are expected You’ll let us know if you suck at something. We suck at things too At the end of the day, you fully see the reward in this job (hint: it’s not green) You have 3-5 years of solid sales experience under your belt. You’ve worked closing deals with small businesses and/or in the health and beauty space  Benefits Health/Dental/Vision/Commuter Benefits & 401k Awesome (paid) Parental Leave Policy Monthly Commission Unlimited Paid Time Off Ample opportunities for professional growth Amazing co-workers Work/Life balance Creative and collaborative culture to flourish in
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Overview  Job Description  Are you looking for innovation in institutional investment sales? As an Institutional Salesperson (Defined Contribution) at Fisher Investments, you will market a new, innovative investment capability designed to disrupt the current marketplace. Join our privately held multi-billion global investment firm to continue our search of being better.  The Opportunity  You will work remotely from your home office in Miami, FL. You will directly affect defined contribution plan client acquisition in that territory and the firm's institutional Assets Under Management. You will be evaluated by your sales efforts, activity levels, sales opportunities uncovered and new relationships developed. You will report directly to the Institutional Group Vice President, who will make sure you have all the resources for the sales process. You will receive corporate office sales support, client service, marketing and more.  The Day-to-Day Market Fisher's Personalized Retirement Outcomes investment service and stand-alone institutional investment strategies to retirement plan advisors and plan sponsors Call, schedule and meet with prospects (travel required) Maintain relationships with defined contribution record keepers and advisor-facing wholesalers Produce external retirement plan advisor and defined plan sponsor client leads Your Qualifications 5+ years' experience in asset management and/or defined contribution external sales Strong investments knowledge - able to apply mathematical and financial concepts Experience in high-volume phone activity, in-person meetings and written client communications U.S. candidates must be fully vaccinated as defined by the medical community against COVID-19 and provide proof of such vaccination by date of hire Why Fisher Investments  At Fisher Investments, we work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. From unmatched service to unique perspectives on investing, it's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible. And we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like: 100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum 20 days of PTO*, plus 9 paid holidays 8 weeks paid Primary Caregiver Parental Leave Back-up Child Care Program available, offering up to 10 days annually A cumulative learning and development framework customized for every employee An award-winning work environment - we're Great Place to Work Certified, and Top Workplace winners from The Oregonian We take great pride in our inclusive culture. We value the different perspectives and unique skills you bring to the team – it makes us all better. Success at Fisher Investments is motivated by results, a collaborative mindset and a commitment to accomplishing great things – so if you are ready to do that, we are ready for you! Apply today to be a part of a team environment where you make a difference in the lives of people by bettering the investment universe. California employees accrue up to 17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time per year. FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: STRATEGIC ACCOUNT MANAGER - NEW YORK - AUGUST 2021 Butler seeks an experienced Strategic Accounts Manager to support the needs of Butler’s existing hotel customers (including owners, management companies, and brands) and drive the long-term success of Butler’s business. The ideal candidate has at least three years of experience in project management, customer success, or sales at a technology company serving the hospitality industry.   What You Will Do Leverage your experience in hotel technology, restaurant operations, and project management to better meet the needs of Butler's customers: hotel owners, management companies, and hotel brands Project manage initiatives crucial to the long term success of the business by collaborating with stakeholders from the Tech, Product, Marketing, and Operations teams Support the Director of Strategic Accounts by performing industry research, collecting and organizing internal data, preparing presentation materials, and coordinating resources across departments Work from Butler HQ at 1250 Broadway in  Manhattan -- this is NOT a remote position  The Ideal Candidate B.A. or B.S. degree in hospitality management, business, technology, or a related field At least three years of experience in project management, customer success, or sales role at a tech enabled company, preferably in the hospitality industry Strong familiarity with hotel and restaurant technology, particularly PMS and POS systems Impeccable written and oral communication skills with particular confidence in presenting information to senior leadership and customers Familiarity with the latest communication and productivity tools, including Slack, Google Workspace, Salesforce, and Asana  Compensation & Perks Competitive Salary, Performance Bonus, & Stock Options Medical, Dental, & Vision Company funded HSA, 401(k), commuter benefits Laptop, dedicated work phone, & personal tech budget  About Butler Hospitality Butler is a technology company that helps hotels do everything better. By focusing operations inside of centrally located hotel kitchens, Butler serves hotel guests everywhere with incredible food, amazing experiences, and impeccable service, all powered by Butler’s proprietary tech. Butler is based in NYC and serves over 50,000 hotel rooms throughout the United States, including Chicago, Miami, Washington DC, Denver, and San Francisco.  Read More About Butler https://hospitalitytech.com/ghost-kitchen-hotels-expands-dc

description: Want to get traction in your new career search?  Perhaps it's time to move to the front of the line and meet hiring managers from multiple companies in the Phoenix area. They are recruiting for numerous professional opportunities including Territory Sales Manager! Apply Now  Offered: Base Salary + Commissions. On Target Earnings: $60,000 - $100,000 Benefits Training  This is an in-person event and free to attend! Apply to this post to RSVP.  Event Details:  Phoenix Sales and Management Career Fair  Starts promptly at 6pm! Monday, October 25, 2021 – 6PM - 8PM Hilton Phoenix Airport 2435 South 47th Street Phoenix, AZ 85034  *Free To Attend *Access to Hiring Managers *Interview with multiple companies *All Experience Levels Welcome  Apply Now and Mark Your Calendar.  About the Event:  The focus of this recruiting event is specifically on Sales, Business Development, Marketing, Customer Service, and Retail & Sales Management jobs, and offers you individual, face-to-face time with hiring managers from a variety of different companies. All of our events are held in the evening, making it easier to work around any existing job schedules.  Here’s how it works: we will welcome you with a formal executive presentation in which each company will introduce itself and the opportunities they offer. You will then be free to meet with hiring managers from each company that has attracted your interest. In addition, you will be able to network not only with various employers, but also with other sales professionals.  Whether you are a seasoned executive-level professional, just beginning your career, or anywhere in between, our events can connect you with as many valuable employer contacts in two hours as you would make in weeks of job searching on your own. Hiring managers will be onsite and ready to offer second interviews to qualified candidates.  Apply Now

description: Sales & Business Development | San Francisco, CA or Seattle, WA  This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia and Wyoming.  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers, and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  As an Analyst, Sales Strategy you will work on topics that range from transformational sales strategy to the nuts and bolts of sales operations. You will do this through a combination of analytical insight, strong business acumen, and robust cross-functional partnerships with leaders in Sales, Marketing, Finance, HR, etc  In this role you will drive strategic decisions, GTM design, business planning, sales optimization, and operational excellence across the Enterprise North America business.  Why should you be excited about this role? You enjoy driving change in a business and seeing fast results. You are a hard but efficient worker, and you find time to have fun with colleagues. You have high aspirations, and you are excited to scale a business from $1B to $5B revenue in five years! You have a life outside of work and you want to maintain a healthy balance.  This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, Sales Strategy & Operations and is designated as Flex.  Responsibilities Develop a strong understanding of all the main components of the Enterprise North America sales engine Identify key opportunities for business improvement through analytics, quantitative insights, and good business sense Execute projects to improve our go-to-market engine Assist with ad hoc requests and projects from the sales organization Basic Qualifications 2+ years of top-notch analytical experience in management consulting, investment banking, or corporate analytical roles BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience Preferred Qualifications Experience working closely with senior sales leaders, prior exposure to high-growth work environments, and a strong understanding of SaaS business models and go-to-market principles are all highly desirable Effective, clear, and concise verbal and written communication skills Comfortable and flexible working in a fast-paced environment Results-driven, self-motivated, and able to work independently High degree of intellectual curiosity and self confidence About Us  DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, over a million customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. And we help save the world’s forests and embrace environmental sustainability.  It's important to us that we build a talented team that is as diverse as our customers and where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging and thrive. We encourage great talent who bring a range of perspectives to apply for our open positions. DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes hiring decisions based on experience, skill, aptitude and a can-do approach. We will not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category.  Accommodations  DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.
